name: Walk to stores/parks/downtown. Fenced yard/Pets OK
description:
Walk to town in ten minutes! Monthly rental includes utilities, wifi, linens and everything you'll need to make a home in downtown Asheville. Quiet and friendly neighborhood, one mile from the hospital or UNCA. Fenced private backyard and private deck. Private laundry room and lock up spot for your bike. Dedicated parking spot. Please contact me in advance if you want to bring your pet(s). I will not allow pets without prior disclosure. There is a security deposit required for all pets.

The space
True Asheville...artist styled apartment with a pet friendly fenced back yard and great neighbors all around. Stay here and easily walk downtown or through the wooded trails and botanical gardens at UNCA. Super convenient neighborhood to walk, bike, run or just stroll around and meet people....very local and friendly! Whole Foods, Trader Joe’s and lots of nearby coffee shops, restaurants and Asheville Yoga Center all within a four block radius.

Your sunny dow
neighborhood_overview: I love my neighborhood! Its friendly, easy-going, quiet and the closest one to downtown, groceries, yoga and coffee shops. There's woods with trails nearby to walk your dog and commune with the trees. You really don't need a car here, everything is minutes away on foot or by bike.
host_about: I am a long time resident of Asheville and am glad help you find great hikes, yoga, dog parks, kids activities, etc.

name: Cottage! BonPaul + Sharky's Hostel
description:
The space
Private cottage located behind the main house at the Hostel in Historic West Asheville.

Self check-in starts at 3pm.

Cottage has full size bed, private kitchen and bathroom. Please note also, the shower is not huge. It will fit one person just fine.

Guests get full access to the hostel: book exchange, community computer, common areas with cool international travelers and all the cool restaurants, pubs and cafe's that West Asheville has within walking distance!

Guest access
Guests have solo access to the cottage, and access to the main house of the hostel.

Other things to note
Parking in our lot is limited. You can also park for free on the street.
neighborhood_overview: We are within easy walk of pubs, breweries, music, thrift shops, grocery, bakery, cafes, and restaurants in the hip West Asheville neighborhood. We are about 2.7 miles from the center of town.
host_about: We operate two traveler's hostels located in Historic West Asheville, and in Wilmington, NC. Both locations offer wifi and Internet access, full kitchen and bathroom, book exchange and common areas, and bikes to borrow.

name: Private Room "Ader" at BPS Hostel
description:
The space
Private Rooms at Bon Paul and Sharky's Hostel. Each Private room has a full size bed that sleeps two adults.

Self check-in starts at 3pm.

Guests have access to all hostel amenities: full kitchen and bathrooms, wifi and internet, common area and book exchange, and cool international travelers.

We are located in Historic West Asheville, walking distance to amazing restaurants, cafes and pubs, grocery, and Asheville's River Art's District.

Two private bathrooms are shared throughout the hostel.

We are a traveler's hostel and therefore CANNOT BOOK TO LOCALS.
neighborhood_overview: Easy walk to pubs, cafes, bakery, breweries, laundry, grocery, and music
host_about: We operate two traveler's hostels located in Historic West Asheville, and in Wilmington, NC. Both locations offer wifi and Internet access, full kitchen and bathroom, book exchange and common areas, and bikes to borrow.

name: The Fern Street Apt near Biltmore
description:
The space
Welcome to "Fern Street on the Green," a well kept apartment in a quiet neighborhood in Asheville, NC near the Biltmore Estate. The charming apartment has its own entrance and is on the back lower ground level of a larger home – facing onto a large private greenway-wonderful for bird watching. There is a quiet tenant on the upper level. (Please note that there is an exterior stairway from the parking area to the apartment - well lit with handrail.)

Fernie is a monthly rental. See calendar.
The 500 sq foot Fern Street Apartment is located:
1 mile from Biltmore entrance on a quiet street
2 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway
3 miles to downtown Asheville
15 minutes from the Asheville airport
And within an easy drive of Warren Wilson College and Black Mountain

There is easy access to Interstate 40 and I-26.
Local bus service is only 2 blocks away.

We're only 1/4 mile from Biltmore Forest, a lovely co
neighborhood_overview: We love the quiet, tree lined neighborhood with great access to restaurants and all Asheville has to offer.
host_about:
I'm a people person who loves music. I teach singing.

My husband, Peter, builds beautiful houses including this one. Since we live so close to the Biltmore estate, we thought it would be fun to furnish one of our apartments as a short term rental. We love Asheville, and love to see others enjoy all its charms as 'the Paris of the South'.

name: Refocus Cottage - paradise
description:
Spring has sprung on the MEADOW, in the WOODS and along the CREEK, on this 3 1/2 acre bird sanctuary with visits from turkeys and the occasional bear. View it all with wine or coffee from the extensive decking above or the pavilion below. Take a book to one of the hammocks. This is a peaceful retreat just five miles to downtown Asheville and a short drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway for hiking and mountain vistas if you can tear yourself away from the fire pit, badminton, boccie ball, corn hole...

The space
REFOCUS COTTAGE is a sophisticated OPEN STUDIO- STYLE SPACE, uncluttered in its decor. It is in such a serene country setting you may not want to leave the FOUR ACRE property with creek, meadow, woods and fire pit, pavilion, horse shoes, badminton, boccie ball, bean bag toss, sky chair and hammocks. Its SPECTACULAR DECKING overlooking the meadow and woods makes it the loveliest of escapes for recharging, decompressing, writing, painting, photographing... When y
neighborhood_overview: Friendly safe walk-friendly neighborhood.  It feels like a sleepy country resort and yet it is only minutes to downtown Asheville.  There is access to the parkway from this end of town which is wonderful and fast.  It is only a 3 miles drive to Beaver Lake which can be walked around in 45 minutes for painless, pleasant exercise in a beautiful setting.  The local restaurant choices are great - Zen Sushi, Ambrozia, Home Grown, Dough, Marcos, Stoney Knob Cafe, Plant... for vegetarian, vegan, meat lover, pizza lover, small plate fusion...
host_about: I like putting people and environments together and have converted my art studio to a rental cottage to do just that.  Since graduating from Carnegie Mellon as a painter, A LONG TIME AGO, I have had many creative occupations including theater, film, interior design and teaching. A strong desire to share the property that my husband and I have sculpted together for 15 years has led to the conversion of a free standing art studio to RACK FOCUS COTTAGE (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) The need for a 3 BR led to the renovation of RACK FOCUS FIVE (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) . Because this property is right across the street from the cottage, its guests can easily share the wooded walk, creek sitting,meadow and fire pit of the park-like setting of the cottage. Similarly furnished and appointed it is ideal for larger groups. We love to travel but this is our favorite destination. Make Asheville yours. Stay with us.  Short, extended stay or long term.

name: Luxurious Mountain Guest Suite Apartment
description:
Escape to our beautifully furnished luxurious apartment Guest Suite ideally located in a private gated community in Keswick Hills, in south Asheville, NC for the most discriminating travelers.

The space
Private Guest Suite Features: King Size four poster bed, Gas Fireplace, Fully Equipped Gourmet Kitchen (Coffee, Tea, Stove, Oven, Microwave, Blender, Spices, Toaster Oven, Full Size Fridge, Dishwasher, etc.) Breakfast Nook for 2, Private Bathroom with Tiled Tub with plenty of towels, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, etc. We do have Laundry available in the main house if needed, (but it is not in the apartment).


LOCATION!!! Staying at Keswick Hills, a private gated community in south Asheville, is for anyone interested in exploring Asheville while being only
9 miles from Downtown Asheville and close to nearby amenities in a quiet setting.


We also provide a list of recommendations and have available local tourist literature
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is peaceful and quiet. It has a beautiful serene greenspace featuring a pond.
host_about:
I am a mother of 4 children and now a grandmother of 6 beautiful grandchildren.

My husband and I feel very fortunate to live in Asheville -- a beautiful place all year round.

Life is for sharing, we will donate a portion of the procceeds to local charities: Manna Food Bank, Mission Foundation's Breast Cancer Awareness, etc.  

Please come and join us.  We will make every effort to make you feel at home and  your complete privacy will be guaranteed.

name: Historic Arts and Craft Home
description:
This beautiful 1925's Art and Crafts home is located in the up and coming River Art District and 2 miles to Pack Square and Biltmore Estates. I have two rooms that are rented independently. King size bed.Beauty and simplicity. We have two bathrooms but the shower is shared.
I do have an indoor/outdoor cat. Her name is Lupita, short hair cat and spends most her her time outside. We have homestay permit

The space
The mountain areas of Asheville NC are known for the many beautiful arts and crafts style homes that are so popular in this area. Our home is cozy and reflects the added care and detail that home builders of the past took great pains to incorporate in their one of kind homes. Our home was built in 1925 and has just gone thru a complete renovation. New electric, plumbing, kitchen, bathrooms, and all new appliances. While the renovations were extensive the goal was to keep the old fashion charm of this beautiful home. The bedrooms have new mattresses
neighborhood_overview: We are centrally located in the up and coming River Arts District. This neighborhood is going thru an urban renewal, we are 5 blocks away from the River Arts District. We are a minutes away from Biltmore and downtown. About 2 miles! Easy walking distance if you don't mind the hills but I usually drive.This home is in downtown Asheville area within an urban setting with a diverse neighborhood. Our street is only one block long with all the homes built in the 1920s. We have multi million homes and affordable living homes all within The River Arts District. If you are looking for a more gated community, cookie cutter home, this is far from it. We are a vibrant community that welcomes all people and races and is inspired by our personal heritage.
host_about:
Hi, I am almost a native of beautiful south Florida. I love the outdoors and the weather here. Florida is really a special place if you venture out into all it has to offer. A great art scene, an amazing one of a kind ecosystem in the Everglades and the best weather in the continental USA in the winter. If you love sunshine, beaches and a diverse population of interesting people, head down our way. We have a small oasis in the middle of Fort Lauderdale awaiting you with some easy, fun,loving vibes. Now for the Asheville home, if you been to Asheville there isn't really anything I can add to this amazing town. Art, music, food like you have never had before and the beautiful Smokey Mountains!!! 
Thanks,
Ana

name: Romantic, Moroccan-Influenced Cottage
description:
The artist/owner built cottage is a quiet sanctuary located 8 minutes from downtown, the Biltmore Estate, West Asheville shops, an incredible bakery and restaurants. Enjoy handmade pottery, local art, all cotton bedding and fresh eggs within this adorable Moroccan-influenced getaway.
The River Arts District, French Broad River and shops are within walking distance. The Admiral and Bull and Beggar are fantastic. Owl Bakery, Hole donuts, Whist, Flora and Ghan Shen are superb. The Walk and Taco Billy - casual dining. Enjoy!
This is a legal permitted homestay through the city of Asheville. #16-05429
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood of mostly bungalows is friendly, low key, within walking distance to Haywood Road's restaurants and Carrier Park.  The Admiral, Owl Bakery, Hole Donuts, Taco Billy and Bim Beri Bon are all above average.
host_about:
I am a mother, teacher, hair stylist and ceramic artist. I  like to hike, do yoga, swim, make art, and eat good food.   Asheville will be my home base as long as Olive is in school.  We love to travel and the last two summers we have camped along the Pacific Coast Highway, enjoyed airbnbs in Atlanta, Portland, and Santa Fe. 
France and Anguilla. We have two cats, two dogs and seven chickens.

We love our home and the ability to hop downtown and the river walk.... It's a wonderland.   I consider myself a relaxed and reliable host. I enjoy meeting new guests, but also respect privacy.  Hope you enjoy your stay.

name: Urban Getaway - Perfect Location
description:
This apartment in a fully restored historical home is located in one of Asheville's loveliest neighborhoods. A short walk to Omni Grove Park Inn, a mile from downtown, a park two blocks away, walkable restaurants, all makes this apartment unique. Check out the reviews.

The space
A brand new, Energy Star, one bedroom separate apartment in a restored historical home. Loving care went into creating this warm and homey space. It is located on one of the nicest streets in Asheville. Brand new kitchen with modern appliances, large bathroom with claw foot tub, super-comfy bed. Comfy futon in living area. Lots of afternoon sun in bedroom. Check out the pictures and reviews.

Pretty outdoor space with table and chairs and a ping pong table. Lots of on street parking, and off street unloading or parking with special arrangement.

Guest access
Apartment has own entrance and is completely separate from rest of home. Guests have full
neighborhood_overview: This really is one of the nicest streets in Asheville.  Lots of folks come to run or walk in this neighborhood.  The neighborhood is called Grove Park - Sunset Mountain, and has lots of access to walking trails and biking, beautiful trees and parks.  Yet is very close to downtown, best of both worlds.
host_about:
I moved to Asheville in 2005 from Palo Alto.  Grew up in San Francisco.  My parents immigrated from Ireland,  so I have lots of Irish family and travel there frequently.  One of my favorite things about Asheville is how similar it is to Ireland. Just as green, but with better weather.  

I am an Electrical Engineer, worked at NASA;  jumped ship to teach high school science at Gunn High School in Palo Alto. 

I enjoy entertaining and traveling and love the idea of creating a space where visitors to Asheville can relax and enjoy this amazing town.  I lived in the Montford home for five years, and it is a wonderful space, with great energy.   I spent many hours working in the garden and this spring it's paying off........

I am working on adding some of my favorite places to my Guidebook section, so check that out.  Feel free to ask any questions about the house, or Asheville area...... - Anne Marie

name: The birdhouse.Sweet suite! Downtown Roof top deck!
description:
Sweet loft apartment just north of downtown. Walkable. Roof top deck and gardens. Custom tile work, earthen clay plasters and beautiful lighting. Near yoga studio, cafes and grocery stores. Private oasis in downtown Asheville.

The space
Walking distance to downtown.Private entrance, roof top deck, kitchenette,earthen clay plaster walls, spa style tiled bathroom and decks. Lovely space for two. Has a smart tv, AC and fan, free wireless connection. Ideal-situation to relax,explore & enjoy!

Guest access
Filtered water, great views, wireless internet

Other things to note
I live in an apartment downstairs with my darling one year old.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet and nice neighborhood. Easy walk to downtown. Close to grocery stores, pub, bakery and yoga studios.
host_about:
I have run my own massage therapy practice for 19 years in the Asheville area. I also have a small natural products company where I make body care products & scrubs from herbs I grow and harvest. 
I like to read, catch live music, practice yoga,eat vegetables, and spend time with my baby & close ones. I love to travel and have spent time exploring most continents.
The slogan "work hard play hard" pretty much sums me up!

name: Private Home 1 mile to downtown
description:
This apartment comes complete with bathroom, kitchen, living space, and private driveway. Just over 1.5 miles to downtown. We strive to offer you a clean, comfy, and private stay. There is 1 BR with a queen size bed. If desired, there is room in the living to add two more mattresses which allows for the accommodation of 6 guests total (2 per bed).
There is a TV screen with roku, as well as an hdmi cable. If you’d like to bring your computer, you can stream from Netflix or Amazon prime.

The space
Furnished downstairs of a beautiful home in a nice neighborhood ONLY 1.5 mi. from downtown! In 2 minutes you can walk to one of the best breweries which is also a great restaurant, movie theater along with a seperate kids game room- The Asheville Pizza and Brewing Co. In 5 minutes you can walk to sushi, burritos, ice-cream, coffee, tea and fresh organic food along with a variety of other shops.

The apartment is a spacious 1000 sq. ft ground level fl
neighborhood_overview:
We are on the historic and reputable North side of town. A great relaxing area, safe and close to town. Just 1.5 miles to town. Great food and drink options in our neighborhood.
In walking distance:
Asheville Pizza and Brewing Co., The Green Sage, Urban Burrito, Zen Sushi, The Hop Ice-Cream, Vinny's Italian, Wendy's, (yes, the fast food one), and Avenue M is a very delicious high end restaurant / bar that is approximately 8-10 minute walk.
host_about:
I followed the whitewater to this beautiful mecca in the mountains.  I love all the amazing opportunities to be in the gorgeous natural beauty of this area.  So many rivers, waterfalls, trails, and views to enjoy.  Asheville also happens to be one of the coolest towns I've ever come across to hang out in.  Southern charm, for sure.  Lots of great live music, delicious restaurants, local festivals, amazing art scene, and a happening dance community.  Oh yeah, a healing arts mecca.  Plenty of yoga and therapeutic options around these parts.
I'll tell you where to find the best huevo rancheros you've ever had in your life!
I've lived in Asheville for 10 years now, and know the area pretty well from all of my exploration.  I have worked at the 5 star resort, The Grove Park Inn, and happen to live just one mile from this world famous Resort and Spa.  Being a massage therapist there, I can tell you which treatments will be perfect for you.  I have spent plenty of time at the Biltmore Estates and can suggest good walks to take there.

name: Lovely mountain home with a view!
description:
Linens and towels provided. You will have access to entire house. Nice, safe residential neighborhood. Secluded yet close to downtown. Located halfway between downtown and the parkway in beautiful Haw Creek valley. 3 beautiful acres with stream.

The space
Nice room with private bath. Has FULL size bed with a comfortable Serta mattress. Linens and towels provided. You will have access to entire house. Secluded yet close to downtown. Located halfway between downtown and the parkway in beautiful Haw Creek valley. Retreat like setting on 3 beautiful acres with stream. Relax on the front porch or back patio and watch the animals. WiFi but no TV. Very quiet and relaxing. Fragrance free and smoke free. Comfortable, clean and affordable.
Also even though I have no pets, I dog sit occasionally. So if you prefer no pets, please check with me first.
It's about a 10 minute drive to downtown so you will need a car. Nearest bus stop is a mile away,

Would
neighborhood_overview: Quiet and scenic. Hiking trails in the neighborhood.
host_about:
Enjoy dancing, gardening, reading, playing piano, drumming, learning situations, traveling.
My motto is "live and let live".  I've been hosting since 2009 and have met so many interesting and warm people, from such varied walks of life. I'm impressed and happy with every aspect of Airbnb. I'm a pretty laid back host: like guests who can just make themselves at home.

name: Private, Downtown & River Arts
description:
This cozy room has a comfortable queen-sized bed, a private bathroom, and your own entrance. Walkable to Downtown and the River Arts District. Very close to the Biltmore Estate and West Asheville. Easy parking. People of Color & white people welcome; LGBTQ & straight friendly. Dogs too, but not on the bed. (Read our pet policy below!)

The space
Simple, clean and comfy w/ queen-sized bed, private bath, good shower, fridge, microwave, coffee-maker, & wireless internet. Breakfast is on your own, but why eat in your room when Foodtopia awaits you?

We are LGBTQ and straight friendly. People of Color and white people are welcome.

Our home is a land partner in Patchwork Urban Farms growing perennial food forest. We’ve prioritized cultivating pollinator habitat and building soil over manicuring a lawn.

We are an easy walk or bike to the River Arts District (less than 1/2 mile) and Downtown (1/2 mile to Southslope, then anoth
neighborhood_overview: The South French Broad neighborhood is on the south-west fringes of downtown so it's easy to get most anywhere in Asheville.  I love the urban stream right across the street, the proximity to the river and how it's perfectly situated to be a leading area for urban sustainability and urban agriculture.
host_about:
I enjoy a a large and wonderful community here in Western NC.  I live with my super-cute dog, Minnie, and sometimes an upstairs tenant.

I have two businesses.  I have a Celebrant practice and a Consulting practice.  A Celebrant is a ceremony specialist.  I'm also an ordained Inter-faith Minister.  ( So if you want to get married while you're here, I can help you out with that too!  Find out more about that and the other types of ceremonies I help people create by googling Asheville Celebrant.   My other business is Circle Forward Partners, where I coach, train and facilitate groups in collaborative governance.

I am passionate about urban sustainability and I'm a land-owner partner in Patchwork Urban Farms.

I love swimming and floating in natural bodies of water.  I  enjoy, sewing, yoga and spending time with my friends and neighbors.  

I love my town so I'm happy to give you tips and directions or just leave you to your own devices.  Look forward to meeting you in person!

Happy Day!
Michelle

name: #2 Blue Ridge Room at Oakland Cottage B&B
description:
Oakland Cottage is an Asheville historic home, circa 1910, perfect for your Vacation-In-Asheville. The 5,000 sq-ft "cottage" has been naturally separated into 7 guest rooms, each with private bath. The open common areas, available to all guests, create a warm and spacious feel.

The space
Blue Ridge Room #2 is on the first floor with a king bed, full private bath, coffee maker, cable TV, WIFI, extra sitting room and private deck, with stair access to the back yard off the deck.

Pets are welcome in the Blue Ridge room for an additional $15 nightly per pet. There is a simple pet agreement which must be accepted by the pet owner in order to bring a pet to stay with you in your room or suite at Oakland Cottage.

Pricing is based on two guests. There is room for an additional guest for $20 each extra guest per night.

Guest access
Access to the house is available anytime with a lock box code to the front door and private key
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood with great location - Biltmore Estate entrance is just one mile from Oakland Cottage B&B.  Asheville's vibrant downtown center is 1.5 miles north of the Inn, River Arts District is 1/2 mile away.  Blue Ridge Parkway Access is within a few miles.  Enjoy Arts and Crafts, Culinary and "Beer City" vibe of Asheville, all set in the midst of the beautiful Appalachian & "Smokey" Mountains with unlimited outdoor access.
host_about: I love living in Asheville, married 30 years, mom to a college student; love the mountains and enjoy Asheville's outdoors, Blue Ridge Parkway, hiking and cycling,  as well as the culinary and beer scene!  I've been living and working in Western NC for over 40 years.

name: Asheville Mountain Vista 3mi to Downtown Asheville
description:
The space
Just 3 miles from downtown Asheville, Asheville Mountain Vista is a convenient cabin style vacation rental with 4 bedrooms and 3 baths, outdoor charcoal grill and lovely view of the Mountains, especially in winter. There is high definition cable TV, wireless internet, washer/dryer, full amenity kitchen, decks, outdoor fireplace, off street parking.

Our location can't be beat. Asheville Mountain Vista is just off scenic Town Mountain Road, 3 miles from the heart of downtown Asheville.

The Blue Ridge Parkway is also conveniently accessed via Town Mountain Road at Craven's Gap (BRP MPM 377.5), just 3 miles in the other direction - by road or neighborhood trail.

This lovely vacation home can accommodate up to 12 guests and has 4 bedrooms and 3 full baths.

Extensive decking & outdoor patio extend the living area into the outdoors.

Amenities include linens, towels, Cable TV, high-speed wireless Internet access, t
neighborhood_overview: Asheville Mountain Vista is located in a small neighborhood, just off Town Mountain Road.  There are several older development roads that have yet to be developed and that are enjoyable to walk on.  Watch out for bears, especially on Fridays.  Be sure and be tidy with your garbage and put it in the Bear Proof garbage can.

name: Come Home in West Asheville!
description:
The house has awesome nearby restaurants, breweries and is a five minutes from the French Broad River. The area perfect for biking ,walking and has easy access to downtown and all of Asheville.
In addition, the following services are offered on site for your stay:
Massage therapy (Couples, Deep Tissue, Hot Stone, energetic healing and Reiki).
Whole foods cooking sessions and meals
Yoga Sessions
Please inquire for details.
We look forward to hosting yor famaily and friends!

The space
The Homey Home is a four bedroom bungalow built in 1922 perfect for family and friends to gather and share a wonderful stay in Asheville.. It is spacious with a living room with a yodel wood stove, a breakfast nook, a tiny balcony to peruse the newly andscaped back yard!!
Their are also great places to stretch out and do yoga or meditation
The house fully furnished with four bedrooms and two baths, with a great kitchen that has granite count
neighborhood_overview:
West Asheville is lovely walking and full of trees with homes that are historic (built in the 1860's) and modern.... My favorite place to eat in West Asheville is the Admiral and walking distance from my house. I also love to catch a cup of coffee at Battle Cat coffee shop! I also just ran across this awesome bike paddle boards rental that delivers check it out: GearU
If you mention you saw it here you will receive 10% off.
:)
host_about: Quirky, fun, playful... serious, sensuous,and serendipitous...

name: Town and Mountain Peaceful Retreat
description:
The space
* SUPERHOST STATUS FOR OVER 12 YEARS !!! *
Welcome to our peaceful retreat tucked under the Blue Ridge Parkway!
Our location offers the best of both worlds! With convenient access to the mountains and the town. We are located approximately 5.5 miles from the center of downtown Asheville (the review with a response saying 8 miles is wrong, but Airbnb will not let me change it), with its quaint restaurants and coffee shops, and a country mountain road drive up to the Blue Ridge Parkway with inviting trails and spectacular views of the Blue Ridge and Great Smokey Mountains. The Biltmore Estate and Winery is very close by and a great way to spend the day. Also, Beaver Lake is right at your doorstep with a great walking path. Pisgah National Forest and the Great Smokey Mountain National Forest are both nearby with lots of outdoor recreation and adventure activities.
Outside makes this home a great mountain vacation setting with the small stream that runs
neighborhood_overview: Quaint, established neighborhood in heart of North Asheville.  At the base of The Blue Ridge Parkway !
host_about: I love living in Asheville NC.  All the outdoor activities I enjoy are here and great year around climate as well.  I love to travel also and trade spaces with other travel enthusiasts.

name: Sunset Cottage - year round views, 3 mi to DT AVL
description:
Sunset Cottage is a charming 1960s rancher with incredible year round views. There are two bedrooms, one with a King bed and a Twin bed, and one with a Queen bed and a Twin bed for up to 6 guests, and one full bath. Amenities include WIFI, cable TV, full amenity kitchen, washer/dryer, extra large back deck with charcoal grill & best sunsets in town! Located just 3 short miles to Downtown Asheville, in a quiet & private neighborhood with easy access to the Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
Sunset Cottage faces west, so enjoy sunsets from the many windowed kitchen/dining and large back deck. The two bedrooms and full bath are a nice size for two couples to share or for families wanting their own space. Each bedroom has a Queen bed and twin bed for a capacity of 6 guests.
All linens are provided, Cable TV, wireless Internet. Washer/dryer, full amenity kitchen, back deck with grill (garage is not available to guests). Cell phone service works well for most, if n
neighborhood_overview: Located in the Mountain Vista Neighborhood just off Town Mountain Road.  Walking is pleasant on the lane-like roads through the neighborhood.  There is a three mile trail (undeveloped road) that goes all the way to the Blue Ridge Parkway - or get back. onto Town Mountain Road and drive 3 miles to Craven's Gap on the Blue Ridge Parkway, with trail head parking.
host_about: I love living in Asheville, married 30 years, mom to a college student; love the mountains and enjoy Asheville's outdoors, Blue Ridge Parkway, hiking and cycling,  as well as the culinary and beer scene!  I've been living and working in Western NC for over 40 years.

name: Comfy Home in W.AVL
description:
Two bedrooms available in my home in the Emma neighborhood of West Asheville. The location is perfect for getting into West Asheville, the River Arts District, less than five miles to downtown and there is always hiking or tubing (depending on the time of year) on the French Broad River. After a day in town, sit back and relax on the front porch listening to the mockingbirds.

(FYI - I am staying elsewhere on the property at this time).

The space
I have a cozy house with two bedrooms to offer to travelers who come to visit Asheville. Check out the funk of the Asheville scene; music, art, restaurants, breweries and of course the glorious mountains. My little home is located 4.5 short miles from downtown and about 2 miles from the River Arts District.

The master bedroom provides a queen sized bed, while the guest room offers a full . Each room has a closet and dresser, there is a single bathroom. You will also have access to the washer an
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is an eclectic mix of old homes and new. It is close to town, but the dirt road on which i live makes one feel like they are out in the country.
host_about:
I live in Asheville, North Carolina, I moved her in 2010. 

I love to kayak, hike, visit museums, travel...

name: "ZenShe" Private Guest Quarters and Entrance
description:
Very Clean,
Very Private
Very Affordable
And Very Zen

The space
You will be staying in peaceful, quiet, light filled private 1 Bedroom Master Suite with QUEEN size bed, large spa like Bath, with a totally private entrance and hallway in the hub of West Asheville. We have also provided you with an off the street private driveway to park your car which is located a few feet from the gate entrance to ZenShe. This guest suite (ZenShe) is in the main house but does NOT visually share any part of the of owners quarters. Home owners enter through their front door and through a vestibule into their home. Airbnb guest enter through the side entrance of the home into a hall way leading to the guest suite. The Airbnb guest suite and the homeowners living space are separated by two sets of French doors. Any sound you might hear are just homeowners coming and going through their vestibule as they enter or leave their home. Loughlin, the owners senior d
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a sweet neighborhood community with lots of restaurants, bars, coffee houses and a bit of retail!  Safe to walk, bike or scooter around.
host_about:
Hello, my name is Pat Johnson and my partner's name is Betty Pomeroy and we moved from Friendsville, PA in November of 2011 to West Asheville, NC.  We came to visit and look around, but by the 6th day we fell in love with the diversity, the artist community, and of course the (Website hidden by Airbnb) we purchased land that 6th day and set in motion to build us a new home in this new town.  And so we did, and we haven't looked back since. 
 
Surrounded by beautiful, charming Arts and Craft Bungalows, West Asheville offers diversity of people, food ,music, arts, schools, and service business, all in a stones throw! We encourage you to come to Asheville and stay a while and find yourself.  You won't regret it! 

We love it here and know that you will too. We look forward to meeting you.

name: Montford Home 1.5 mi to DownTown
description:
Enjoy Montford & Asheville in my Beautiful Home. 2 main level bedrooms, both have Queen size beds with a shared bath with lots of Local Artwork throughout. Located in the Wonderful Montford Hills Urban Neighborhood. Easy access to downtown Asheville or a quick LYFT ride. You will have full use of main floor of my home.
This neighborhood has become quite popular since I purchased in 2000. Take time to walk in the gardens & surrounding neighborhood.

The space
Wonderful Montford Hills Home
Great Neighborhood/Downtown Location for when
You want to be right in town with EZ access.

Asheville is known for its scenic beauty, abundance of opportunities to enjoy the outdoors, fantastic restaurants supplied with locally grown food, craft beer and eclectic sights and sounds. Great boutique shopping and local music and art offer plenty to do if you prefer to stay in town. We are also friendly in the best of the tradition of Southern hospitality.
neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about the Montford Neighborhood! The neighbors are all friendly, it's a great place to run, walk, bike, walk dogs etc.,the homes are beautiful & it's so convenient  to downtown
host_about:
I have lived in Asheville for more than 37 years. Moved here for nursing school & never left!
I am passionate about animals, including rescue and social justice, an occasional runner, organic gardener & occasional biker as time allows. I also have a regular yoga practice.
I have traveled to San Diego & Boca Raton to attend the National Iyengar yoga conference. I have also travelled to Pune, India to study Iyengar yoga with the Iyengars. 
I have one 15 year old rescue Pekingese mix that is my baby. Prince Harry Patrick travels to & from home with me.
I have traveled extensively out west, usually backpacking &/or car camping. I have also visited Greece where I island jumped solo for several days & on another occasion traveled to Barcelona into the Pyrenees & into the very southern tip of France & back down the Mediterranean coast into Spain finding lodging along the way.
Visited Cabo, MX a couple January's ago for the best whale watching EVER!!
Most recently I traveled to California in January to Joshua Tree & then again in March to San Francisco for a week long Iyengar yoga Intensive (a trip I do annually)- both lovely airbnb stays!:)

name: The Cottage In Asheville
description:
COVID-19 UPDATE: Due to safety and logistics issues created by the COVID-19 pandemic, the cottage is not available for booking. Please check back often for updates.

Corporate/temporary/vacation rental in North Asheville. Our clean, contemporary cottage is perfect for exploring Asheville! Relax in a calming environment, isolated from, yet close to the city. The place is your own. Unwind. [AVAILABLE BY THE MONTH]

The space
Note: Until the City of Asheville decides to join the 21st century, we are limited to a 30 day rental minimum. Contact us for information on stays of different durations. The Cottage in Asheville is a comfortable cottage with hammock and swing strung from old-growth oak trees. Located only 1.25 miles from downtown Asheville and only three blocks from UNCA, the cottage is the perfect place from which to explore all that Western North Carolina has to offer.
The lofted ceiling and skylight gives this small space an airy, open qualit
neighborhood_overview: We are one block away from the Glenn's Creek Greenway, 1/2 mile from the Botanical Gardens of UNC-A, 1 mile from excellent grocery shopping including a WholeFoods and Trader Joe's and 1.25 miles from downtown Asheville.
host_about:
I am a singer/songwriter, voice talent, and amateur gardener. I love the arts, eating yummy food with friends and family, and the outdoors (especially horseback riding at Hickory Nut Gap Farm or jumping into one of our beautiful mountain swimming holes!). I'm grateful for the opportunities I've had to travel abroad and learn about other cultures. I feel extremely fortunate to have been born and raised in such a wonderful community as Asheville. I love my hometown and all things about the Blue Ridge Mountains. 
My husband, Joe Ebel, is a Wisconsin native and has lived here in Asheville for 17 years. He is an an amazing musician, website developer, chef, handyman and just a great guy and fantastic husband! We manage several properties, all next door to us. We love the green space that surrounds us, the peacefulness of our setting, and the proximity to the downtown Asheville scene.

Joe and I met through music. We both write and perform. Between the two of us, we have five CDs of original, acoustic music. If you've seen the Ken Burns National Parks Series TV show on PBS, you've probably heard Joe's violin playing!
He also pays mandolin and acoustic and electric guitar.

Joe and I created a mission statement years ago, and it still holds:
'Create and sustain harmony and balance in ourselves and the world, through loving relationships, artful music, comfortable, peaceful environments and integrity of mind and body.'

name: Serene West Asheville Home with a Mountain View.
description:
Entire home. Peaceful escape with all the conveniences of West Asheville. 2 bedroom, 1 bath home sits on 2 acres. Quiet neighborhood with relaxing views from the covered porch.

Uber and Lyft accessible. The house has easy access to restaurants and is only 1 mile to I-40. The heart of downtown Asheville is within 10-15 minutes; the Biltmore Estate is only 10 to 15 minutes away; the center of hip West Asheville is only 7 to 10 minutes away and River Arts district is just 15 minutes down the road.

The space
Our newly remodeled 100 year old farmhouse on the outskirts of West Asheville has two lush acres with mountain views located just minutes from hip West Asheville and downtown.

The house has 2 bedrooms available and 1 full bathroom. Bedroom 1 has a queen bed, Bedroom 2 has a queen bed, and the living room has a large sectional couch with a pull-out sofa bed that sleeps two. Full bath with clawfoot tub/shower combination. There is a full siz
neighborhood_overview: Quiet country livin’
host_about:
I call Asheville my home but I work as a wildland firefighter so I travel a lot during the busy fire season.  I've worked out west in Zion National Park, Sequoia National Park, Big Bend, Grand Teton National Park and have traveled all over the country on fire assignments.  

My travels have taken me to 49 States, Mexico, Canada, Korea, Thailand, Cambodia, Vietnam, Laos, Guatemala, Belize, Honduras, Nicaragua,  Ecuador, Columbia, Cuba, Germany, London, The Bahamas, The U.S. and British Virgin Islands and Kuwait.

Come visit Asheville...I think you'll enjoy it as much as I do.

name: The Cottage on Parkway Loop
description:
The Cottage is a cozy, light, fully self contained (small) home. It has all the amenities of a larger home, but with the comfortable convenience of a smaller space. It's just the right distance from Downtown, with the peace and privacy of a small neighborhood. All who stay have loved it, and we've had many returning guests.

The space
The Cottage on Parkway Loop is a peaceful, welcoming space that provides you the opportunity to truly relax.

If you've ever wondered what it's like to live in a tiny home, come stay with us and find out!

At 600 sq ft The Cottage has a lot to offer for its diminutive size. Downstairs are the living room, kitchen, and dining areas. A full bath with claw-foot tub with shower and laundry adjoins the living room. Upstairs is the master bedroom with king- sized bed and half bath. This light filled room is tucked into a dormer with large windows looking out into a canopy of trees. A small nook entices you to stay a
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is in a small, wooded neighborhood.  It is quiet, private, and safe.  There is a binder in the Cottage with recommendations for dining, and activities in the nearby area.  It is about 10 min. to downtown Asheville.
host_about: We've lived in the area for over 30 years, and love the natural wonders that abound here!  We had a great time renovating the Cottage on Parkway Loop together, and hope that spirit is passed on to everyone who shares the space.  We've added 'The Studio at 217'!  We had a lot of fun making this space cozy and welcoming.

name: Blend City and Country at Lucky W Cottage
description: Wake up to a breakfast of super-fresh eggs after a great night in a 19th century antique bed with a 3" memory foam topper. This detached cottage is on a farm, and there's old-world stone work, a rock path, and even a Hobbit Hole awaiting discovery as well as many other outdoor areas. It is about 100' from the main house but is very private with mountain views. Take a swim in the pool or visit the horses and chickens. Only 10 minutes from downtown and 5 minutes from groceries and restaurants.
neighborhood_overview: The Beaverdam Valley is a rural part of North Asheville, and is situated just below the Blue Ridge Parkway. Along with great sunsets and views, it has lots of history and an abundance of good people, together with plentiful wildlife to spot.
host_about:
Hi! My husband William and I are from Asheville NC. We have a small farm just minutes from downtown where we raise chickens, bees, and horses. We sell eggs and honey. 
We love to travel and camp. We are interested in knowing the places we visit by knowing the people who live and work there. We want to eat the regional cuisine and find and do things we can't do at home.

name: Modern Meets Zen, Rest & Restore - West Asheville
description:
Want to experience something different in Asheville? Looking to relax & rejuvenate but also easy access to everything? My home is a hybrid of modern & traditional, Asian & Western, modern & cozy. Walking distance to many local favorites in W. Asheville, the feel & tone of my home is quiet, contemplative, & refreshing. Birds & butterflies abound the garden & yard. Exquisite & rare teas for the palate and healing & meditative incense for the spirit (for those who desire so). I #HostwithPride.

The space
Enhance your visit to Asheville by treating yourself to some "zen" in a home in West Asheville. Completed in April '13, my home (which I live in, full-time) is where you can rest your body and rejuvenate your spirit. "Modern Meets Zen" is within walking distance to many local favorites - 7 minutes walk to Sunny Point Cafe (rated "Best Brunch" in Asheville) & Oyster House Brewing Co., 8 minutes to West Asheville Yoga, 12 minutes to Biscuit Head, West End Bakery, 9 Mil
neighborhood_overview:
From a local real estate website: "West Asheville is an area that moves easily between its old-world history and new-world energy, enjoying the charm of its neighborhoods and the spirit of its quaint main street. It's both down-to-earth and cutting-edge, with 1920's bungalows and eco-built new homes, with old brick buildings that house innovative businesses, with appreciation for its stories and excitement for its future."

And from the "Explore Asheville" website: "West Asheville's funky vibe translates into a varied mix of eateries. Happening on this unique neighborhood leaving downtown Asheville, you encounter boutiques and cafés lining Haywood Avenue. This West Asheville hub of activity is in the midst of a neighborhood renaissance."
host_about:
I first came to Asheville 2003 and after a five-year stint teaching at Warren Wilson College, I moved two hours away because of a new job only to return five more years later. Perhaps it has something to do with the "vortex" in Asheville that some folks here talk about but probably more to do with the relationships that I have cultivated here, the people and their values, the mountains that surround us, the great climate, the restaurants and bookstores. 
I was born and raised in Malaysia but have lived longer in the United States than I have in Asia now. I have traveled a bit, mostly to Asia - 5 trips to Tibet, 4 to India, 6 to China, several to Taiwan, Thailand, Bhutan other Asian countries, Chile, Peru, Guatemala and a sprinkling of European countries. I've also lived a year in London and loved it. I'm a hybrid of quiet and gregarious, easy-going with others and meticulous with myself. I don't smoke, I'm not into mind-altering substances and I don't drink (but don't have a problem with others drinking). I spend a lot of time at a downtown, spiritual (Buddhist) center but I am capable of talking about things other than meditation and mindfulness!  Especially food. And food.

name: # 1) Downtown Get Around
description:
This historic downtown apartment is perfect for your Asheville adventure. You can not beat this location, walk to everything! Three night minimum but you'll want to stay longer to fully soak up the unique Asheville vibe.

The space
This spacious 700 square foot apartment comfortably sleeps four. There is a private bedroom with a king sized bed and queen sized futon in the living room. Guests should be aware that you have to walk through the bedroom to get access to the bathroom. Perfect for a family or anyone who wants a little extra space. Hard wood floors and a redone kitchen and bath gives this apartment a comfortable feel. Central heat and air.

Guest will have access to a big covered front porch and off street parking.

The kitchen has modern appliances and the basic essentials. There's a whole foods store across the street which is super convenient. The market is open from 7:30am-9:00pm every day and has a hot bar & salad bar, coffe
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the 5 Points neighborhood. This area has historic houses and is on the north edge of downtown.  This is a very desirable neighborhood.  You'll feel like a local as you take a short stroll out your front door to all downtown locations.
host_about: I grew up in Brevard, North Carolina, land of the waterfalls. I've made Asheville my home since 1992. I remember in the 60s and 70s when Sears was a downtown store. I remember the 80s when downtown was boarded up. First came the freaks, then the artists, then Be Here Now brought music back to downtown Asheville. Next pizza and beer at Barley's. I remember when Asheville was the land of the sky, now we're beer city.

name: Kickback, Relax in a Private Suite with a Simple Breakfast
description: Sample one of Asheville's famous craft beers on the spacious front porch and soak up the balmy evening breeze. This cozy suite boasts a grand bedroom mural, a shared sun room surrounded by trees, and a woodland fire pit for nightly s'mores.
neighborhood_overview: Historic Montford offers a vibrant neighborhood, nestled next to eclectic and fun downtown Asheville and nearby UNCA. You will find a wide array of historic homes, tree lined sidewalks, tasty restaurants, tennis and basketball courts and playgrounds. Incorporated in 1893 Montord was certified a National Historic District in 1981.
host_about:
Jerry and I are long time travelers.  We've lived in Asheville for over thirty years and love calling this city and region our home. We are fond of meeting new folks and of time spent outdoors. Jerry is a practicing landscape architect. I recently completed graduate school at UNCA. We both love design. My heart interest is in programs which empower individuals to move out of poverty. 
Our travels  include  Europe, Mexico, South Asia, British Columbia and Latin America, many times staying in homes.  We are both very committed to friendship among all people.

For fun I love to be outdoors, walking, reading, and watching movies. I love a good rhythm!

I am fond of this quote by Dalai Lama, "If you think you are too small to make a difference ... try sleeping with a mosquito in the room."

name: Mid Century Modern Basement Apt..
description:
Quiet delight surrounded by gardens. Near shopping, restaurants, downtown Asheville, Blue Ridge Parkway, and public transportation.

The space
Quiet delight surrounded by gardens. Near shopping, restaurants, downtown Asheville, Blue Ridge Parkway, and public transportation.Beautiful ground level, fully furnished basement apartment in mid Century Modern East Asheville home. Owners live in main house. Private entrance. Large living area with television (streaming only), dinning area, full kitchen that includes microwave, coffee maker, and blender. Private bathroom with large walk-in shower, bedroom with a queen size bed. Linens provided. Access to secluded patio, expansive gardens, and laundry room. WiFi, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime Video, and PBS. Quiet neighborhood with many trees, friendly neighbors and places to walk. Restaurant and shopping only minutes away. Public transit nearby. A short distance from the municipal gulf course and Blue Ridge Park
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is surrounded by a golf course.  It is a great place to take a stroll among the trees and beautiful gardens. You will meet many friendly neighbors walking with their dogs and children.  The birds will greet you in the morning with their song.
host_about: Hi, I'm from Habana, Cuba.  I have been in the United States since 1968.  I just retired after almost 20 years teaching English as a Second Language first in Florida and then in Asheville.  I love hiking in the woods and being in nature.  I take care of my body, love cooking vegetarian dishes and dehydrating vegetables from my garden.  I belong to a conscious dancing community here in Asheville and dance at least twice weekly.

name: West Asheville Townhouse
description:
Modern room for rent in the heart of West Asheville. Close to all the hot spots, you can literally smell the coffee coming from Sunny Point Cafe! Use of the kitchen, wireless Internet, Apple TV, & off-street parking for one car.

The space
Sunny room in a two story condo. Modern, well kept, and clean. I have two sweet and active indoor kitties (less than a year old). If your don’t like cats you might want to book somewhere else.

Guest access
Access to the kitchen, Firestick on bedroom TV with Nexflix, Prime, etc. washer and dryer, off street parking.

Other things to note
As a triathlete who is pretty much always training for something, I sometimes ride my indoor bike trainer which is in the living room downstairs and there is a little noise associated with that. I typically plan my rides when guests are out.

Check-in on weekdays is 3:30 pm to allow me to time to prepare the house after work. I will co
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville has so many great bars, restaurants, music venues and coffee shops!  They are all walking distance from my house.  There is also a great large park about a mile away where I run almost every day!
host_about: I have lived in Asheville since 2002 first working for Outward Bound and now teaching middle school science.  I love to travel am so happy to help others out as they explore Asheville!  I do quite a bit of running and triathlon racing so that keeps me busy with races, long runs or rides on weekends so I am often not home much. I look forward to meeting you!

name: Explorers Retreat Near Downtown Asheville
description:
This Charming 1920’s Bungalow is situated 1-3 miles from UNCA Botanical Gardens, Downtown, The River Arts district, and is a short drive to most popular restaurants, breweries, cafe's, and venues! The large rear balcony, and back yard forest-like greenery comes to life with birds/critter's in Mid Spring/Summer. You also have partial views of the French Broad River, and a few mountain peaks. The homes close proximity to most of what brings visitors to Asheville, makes this home hard to beat!

The space
The house has tall 10 foot ceilings throughout and original heart pine wood floors in most areas.

Loft bedroom comes with a double/full mattress accessed via ladder, and also a single/twin mattress below the loft. The room is capable of accommodating two to three guests.

The loft bedroom also has a built in desk which is well suited for those requiring a traditional office work space.

Counter height dining table accommodates four in
neighborhood_overview:
The home is located in a small residential block sandwiched between the French Broad River, some industrial/commercial business, breweries, and art studios.

Riverside Drive is just a walk down the street, many avid cyclist use it. There is also a bike shop that rents bikes near the home.

Riverside Drive also takes you to the Art district and the Biltmore estate within minutes.

Broadway which connects to Riverside Drive takes you into Downtown within 5 minutes.

Canoe and Kayak access point’s are nearby along the French Broad River which runs along Riverside Drive. You also have kayak rentals a short ride from the home.

PLACES TO GO VIA RIVERSIDE DRIVE/BROADWAY

1.5 Miles or less from:
Riverside Rhapsody Beer Company - Brewery walking distance from the home
Beer City Bicycles - Bicycle shop and rentals walking distance from the home
Zillicoa Brewing - Brewery along the river
Ginger's Revenge - Brewer
host_about:
I’ve made Asheville my home most of the last 14 years. I'm a professional and travel frequently. You may catch me at a local coffee shop enjoying a cup of coffee, out on a trail, or kayaking.

When I travel leisurely I prefer to take the scenic routes, go off the beaten path, and enjoy finding unique places not many people know about. 

I'll be happy to share my favorite restaurants, coffee shops, breweries, and places in the mountains to enjoy.  Don't forget to take a look at my guide book on Airbnb I've included lots of great places. 

Looking forward to hosting everyone!

description:
Our home is an official, permitted airbnb so your reservation is safe!
We are located on the south side of downtown between Biltmore Village and downtown Asheville. It is a five minute drive to downtown, and 2 minutes to Biltmore Village and the entrance to Biltmore Estate. City bus stop close by too.

The space
A wonderful homestay in a great Spanish Colonial Revival home in the Kenilworth Neighborhood. The rental space is a studio only and is part of the main house.

Our home is located on the south side of downtown between Biltmore Village and downtown Asheville. It is a five minute drive to downtown, and a 2 minute drive to Biltmore Village and the entrance to Biltmore Estate. The studio has a full bathroom with shower, and 1 comfy queen size bed. There is a dining area, and sitting area with flat screen tv, premium channel cable package, and wireless internet. Linens and towels are provided.

There is private off-street parki
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Kenilworth neighborhood, one of the oldest neighborhoods in town. We are located in between downtown and the Biltmore Estate, each a 5 minute drive away.
host_about: We are a small family with a 12 year old daughter.  We have our own business here in Asheville.  Your privacy is important to us.  We will make sure your stay is private and comfortable.

name: Refocus Five - Fully furnished close to everything
description:
CLEAN monthly rental 3BR 1 &1/2B creek-side setting across from REFOCUS COTTAGE (304379) with access to its park-like meadow, large fire pit, a small pavilion, badminton, corn hole, boccie ball, creek, and woods. Less than 5 mi to town. Near the parkway for mountain vistas and hikes. A short drive to The River Arts District, music venues and many wonderful places to eat.This rental is available NOW. Come and stay awhile to get to know the surrounding areas. Stay through a season or two.

The space
This 3 BEDROOM, 1.5 BATH will make your stay in Asheville unforgettable and easy because you can return to a comfortable, modern, peaceful environment in just minutes from everywhere - (check also 304379) Shop for unique gifts at the FOLK ART CENTER or the RIVER ARTS DISTRICT, enjoy dinner, a play, a concert, laugh on the Comedy Bus tour, sample our micro-breweries on the BREWS CRUISE, attend a concert hike, bike, enjoy vistas in the BLUE RIDGE MOUNTAINS (access to the P
neighborhood_overview: It is like escaping to the country yet minutes to down town, close to the BLUE RIDGE PARKWAY, the GROVE PARK INN.  BEAVER LAKE AND the BIRD SANCTUARY offers painless exercise less than a two mile drive from your rental. Local organic food and great restaurants in the neighborhood...
host_about: I like putting people and environments together and have converted my art studio to a rental cottage to do just that.  Since graduating from Carnegie Mellon as a painter, A LONG TIME AGO, I have had many creative occupations including theater, film, interior design and teaching. A strong desire to share the property that my husband and I have sculpted together for 15 years has led to the conversion of a free standing art studio to RACK FOCUS COTTAGE (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) The need for a 3 BR led to the renovation of RACK FOCUS FIVE (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) . Because this property is right across the street from the cottage, its guests can easily share the wooded walk, creek sitting,meadow and fire pit of the park-like setting of the cottage. Similarly furnished and appointed it is ideal for larger groups. We love to travel but this is our favorite destination. Make Asheville yours. Stay with us.  Short, extended stay or long term.

name: Charming cottage bordered by stream
description:
1917 cottage with a private backyard and meandering stream.Relaxing environment in quiet neighborhood setting.The host is an artist well known for her regional landscapes.Amenities include a natural setting 1o minutes from downtown Asheville, nearby tennis courts, restaurants,microbreweries.and close proximity to the Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
BY THE MONTH: If you like the charm of a cottage and being surrounded by good quality art, you'll enjoy your stay here.The bedroom is a recently renovated light filled room. The backyard is approximately one half acre bordering a stream and offers a peaceful and serene setting to unwind. I am central to all of the amenities in north Asheville as well as downtown. Your privacy will be respected always but I am here for you, ready to help, guide and to insure your comfort.. The bed is large enough for two and linens are clean and fresh. If you have an interest in the arts, I can direct you to the downtown arts scene.
neighborhood_overview: The Coleman Avenue, Weaver Park neighborhood is a  family oriented, community minded neighborhood with easy access to a jogging trail from Weaver Park through the UNCA campus and return.. It is an easy walk to downtown via Charlotte Street, or Merrimon Avenue. There are numerous grocery stores including Ingles and the Fresh Market as well as quality restaurants and pubs within close proximity..
host_about: I have lived  in Asheville for over 25 years. I am a well known artist focused on documenting the landscape of the region. I love nature, music and my community.

description:
This historic downtown apt is perfect for your AVL adventure. It is only a 5 to 10 minute walk to downtown & convenient to 3 major grocery stores- This affordable unit is equipped w/ a queen bed, kitchen, Wifi & a cozy front porch. Check out reviews...

The space
This 400 square foot hipster bedroom apartment will be perfect for your Asheville adventures. There is a queen size bed, living room, kitchen and bath. The bathroom has been redone but guests should know that it is small with a stall shower. There is a window air conditioning unit that keeps the whole apartment cool. There is a TV with a Roku player. The spectrum app has all your local TV channels and six HBO channels. You could stream content from your devices using a standard HDMI cord if you so choose.


Guests will have access to a big covered front porch which is shared with 2 other apartments. Guests will also be able to use a parking permit to park on the street in front of the
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the 5 Points neighborhood. This area has historic houses and is on the north edge of downtown.  This is a very desirable neighborhood.  You'll feel like a local as you take a short stroll out your front door to all downtown locations.
host_about: I grew up in Brevard, North Carolina, land of the waterfalls. I've made Asheville my home since 1992. I remember in the 60s and 70s when Sears was a downtown store. name: 10 Minutes to Downtown  Epic Views!
description:
Ten minutes to downtown, this clean and contemporary farmhouse still has a rural feel. It is on the edge of a 40-acre farm. There is ample outdoor space for relaxing, a walking path and picnic area. The inside is light, airy and open.

The space
The house is two stories with hardwood floors and an open floor plan. There are three bedrooms. The master has a queen and a full bath. The upstairs bedrooms are spacious. One has a queen and twin size daybed that pulls out to form a king. The other bedroom has a queen and a futon that folds out to a full. The house most comfortably accommodates 6, but can sleep up to 10. There is one full bath upstairs that the two upstairs rooms share.

Guest access
You will have the whole house to yourself, as it is a stand alone rental. You will also have a side yard and a loop road through the woods (about 1/3 mile on which to walk). There is also a picnic area with amazing views near the bottom of th
neighborhood_overview: This area feels like a hybrid between rural and suburban. The house is on a short (not steep at all) gravel road.  You can hear the sounds of civilization and there are neighbors nearby, but it is a mostly private space.  You will love the mountain views from this property!
host_about: I live on the other side of the farm and raise goats and chickens with my family.  Having a vacation rental has been a dream for awhile.  I am also a licensed naturopathic physician, but right now I spend most of my time on the farm!

name: Welcoming walkable North Asheville, Pets OK
description:
Sunny home on the edge of downtown's scene. Best neighborhood for walking to town on the greenway and UNCA botanical gardens nearby. Pet and people friendly with a sweet backyard, big wrap around porch and spacious indoor and outdoor living. Monthly rate of $2400 includes all utilities, wifi, linens and a well stocked kitchen. Cleaning fee has not been added in advance so you can choose to do your own cleaning at no cost or add it later if you wish. Optional cleaning fee is $125

The space
My favorite Asheville neighborhood! Super for walking to town or the "magic forest" park. Everything's within ten minutes on foot. You are welcome to bring your dog but you must ask first (Additional pet fees may apply. Please let me know "who" you're bringing)

This is a 1920's craftsmen bungalow that has been remodeled with french doors opening onto a deck off the main bedroom, built in walnut cabinetry, updated bathroom and a good solid kitchen. Both bedrooms have n
neighborhood_overview: Our "North Asheville Neighborhood" is famously convenient to downtown and has gotten very popular of late as more people want to spend less time in their cars or hassle with parking. This is a residential area close to downtown and UNCA. It’s very easy to walk anywhere and right on the greenway. Quiet, friendly and safe. Farmers market on Saturday two blocks away, coffee shop and restaurants less than 1/2 mile.
host_about: I am a long time resident of Asheville and am glad help you find great hikes, yoga, dog parks, kids activities, etc.

description:
This apartment is rented by the month, no rentals less than 30 days are allowed by the City. Please check the monthly rental rate. This is a super convenient location, one mile to center of downtown's vibrant scene, less then two blocks from Asheville Yoga Center, Greenlife, Trader Joe's, and UNCA. King bed, Living room, kitchen, W/D, Air Condition and Wifi.

The space
Welcome to this downtown apartment! I have been an airbnb hosts since the start, and I am very happy to be able to offer this large and private addition to guests wanting to experience Asheville city life without having to drive.
This private apartment.

Because of location of this listing, it is not a good fit if traveling with children.

There is a off street parking available on the property, and you can leave your car here and go on foot all over town from here.

name: Bright Efficiency in West Asheville
description:
I've added extra cleaning precautions due to covid, including additional disinfectant, cleaning all surfaces with bleach spray, extra washing of coverlet/bed covers, and a break between guests. Please rest assured that the space will be clean and safe during this uncertain time.

This clean and bright West Asheville efficiency HOMESTAY is a convenient 3 minute drive to downtown Asheville or Haywood Road, West Asheville; close to breweries, music venues and amazing restaurants.

The space
Located in a cozy and well kept older home (110 years old!), the apartment is a fully furnished bedroom (queen size bed), small kitchenette (toaster, coffee pot, microwave, hot plate, tea kettle) and bath, with linens and towels provided and high speed wireless internet.

The best thing about this home is the location. You can see the downtown Asheville skyline from the side deck (more in winter when leaves are down), but the back yard feels woodsy with tons
neighborhood_overview:
This sweet, newly remodeled home is in a desirable location, a 4-5 minute drive to downtown Asheville or West Asheville, and a 10 to 15 minute walk to Haywood Road, closest walkable places (10 to 20 minute walking distance) include 'The Walk' Brewpub, Battlecat Coffee Shop, Owl Bakery, Urban Orchard Cider, Hole Donuts, PizzaMind, Gan Shan Station West, Early Girl Eatery (West), The Whale, Harvest Records, ART bus stop, the Admiral, New Belgium Brewery, The Wedge Brewery and River Arts District, The Grey Eagle music venue, White Duck Taco, SunnyPoint Cafe, Smoky Park Supper Club, Zia Taqueria, and just a bit further to West Asheville businesses including the U-Joint, Westville Pub, and the Isis Theatre, just to name a few. Also a quick 4 minute drive via Riverside Drive to the Botanical Gardens and UNCA campus.

I recommend planning walks in the daytime, as some neighborhoods do not have sidewalks and are dark at night. You can walk through neighborhoods to Haywood and po
host_about: Asheville is really my favorite place I have ever experienced.  I lived in Colorado for nearly 16 years, but when I visited Asheville I knew that I had to move here. I love playing music, dancing and going out to the wine bar in downtown Asheville.  I'd love to  be your hostess and give you advice and tips on the great things to do, places to eat, and music to hear in this vibrant town. I also love nature and the outdoors, so being at the congruence of three ancient and beautiful mountain ranges, and easy driving distance to hikes, mountain peaks and water falls, is perfect for me!

name: Downtown Asheville Classic Style - Great Value!-#9
description:
For budget travelers who want to be downtown! Convenient location. No frills and not a fancy B&B. A place with history, character & real people. Clean and comfortable historic 100+year-old rooming house with front porch, balcony and shared bathrooms. One of several short term rental rooms, this second floor room has a queen-size bed, is air conditioned in summer, includes a mini refrigerator, sink, sitting area, table & chair, wifi. Lockable and clean. Bathrooms are shared with others.

The space
This is a second floor room with a queen size bed, sitting area, original fireplace mantle, high ceiling, large windows and plenty of natural light.

At the Gray Rock Inn, downtown Asheville is right outside your door, and our reasonable rates mean your money can be spent on enjoying the city. Conveniently located on Biltmore Ave. and an easy walk to breweries, music venues, art galleries, boutiques and restaurants.

The Gray Rock Inn is a great value
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is lively and diverse. Walk to world class restaurants, music, and craft breweries. Next door is a community food coop that is open to the public. Across the street are a popular, sometimes quite loud music venue, The Orange Peel, and Wicked Weed Brewery. Read about the Bunkum Stone (a landmark) by the front entry.
host_about: I love to dance, hike, and meet people. I'm a green builder and real estate person, so I like helping with housing and visions for how we can get along better.

description:
This wonderful cottage retreat is set in an historic garden. Modern furnishings, luxury bed linens and privacy, including morning coffee on your private porch. Located five minutes from downtown Asheville but feels like it is set far away from civilization.

The space
Your own comfortable house in historic Grove Park neighborhood. Modern comfortable furnishings, and decorations - no B&B "antiques." Enjoy garden views or explore the food, art and scenery of Asheville.

Newly renovated arts and crafts cottage. Modern open dining room & living room, bedroom with king size bed, newly renovated bathroom. Queen size air bed and additional linens available upon request.
No creaking poster bed, Instead enjoy modern furnishings, Wi-Fi, the owners' contemporary art collection and gourmet coffee.

Cottage is situated in one of The Grove Park neighborhood's historic gardens. Cottage has wonderful views, year round and a private porch where you can si
neighborhood_overview: Historic Grove Park neighborhood - hundred year old homes and estates, lovely tree lined streets and low traffic.
host_about: I am from NY but moved to Asheville in 2005 with my husband, who is a local. We run an antique and fine art auction house in Asheville. We have 3 great kids and I drive a minivan.

name: West Asheville - Canie Creek Getaway
description:
Located in one of the oldest neighborhoods in West Asheville. Sidewalks, friendly people, and the Canie Creek Greenway runs adjacent to the backyard. Indie shops, great restaurants, small breweries, and bars are just a mile or 2 away. It's a quick 4 mile drive to the River Arts District, 5 miles to downtown Asheville, and about 20 minutes from some great views and hikes in almost every direction.

The space
Down a few outdoor stairs (lined with lavender during the warmer months), you'll enter through a private entrance on the side of the house that leads you to a large 1-bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment. This space includes it's own kitchenette, dining area, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. We live upstairs and don't share any of this interior space with our guests. The space is equipped with wi-fi, a fridge, microwave, toaster, and other essentials. The side patio outside the door is entirely yours and you're also welcome to read a book and enjoy a drink in on
neighborhood_overview: Malvern Hills is a quiet, friendly neighborhood in West Asheville and one of the few with consistent sidewalks. Most of the homes were built between the 1920s and 60s. Malvern Hills Park (1 mile away) has a large outdoor community pool, tennis courts, and picnic area. We also have 2 greenways that are easier for walking and running than biking (unless you're prepared for hills!)---Canie Creek right behind the house and Hominy Creek a 10 min. walk away.
host_about: Originally from the Carolinas, but I've lived in Brooklyn, San Francisco, and Minneapolis. Asheville is one of my favorite places and I feel lucky to call it home now. I work in literary book publicity and support authors, publishers, and literary nonprofits all over the US and a few in Canada.

name: 2.5 mile to downtown: Sunny, Big, Clean, Pets OK
description:
Our 600 sq. ft. full-sun downstairs studio is all yours! French doors, private entry, BRIGHT and CLEAN! Hardwood floors, bay window area for eating or working. Fireplace, patio, bathroom/shower, kitchen. Across from golf course, 2.5 miles to downtown. Pets welcome! (dogs/cats visit this space)
Very comfy, supportive queen bed, one Queen size futon, if you don’t share a bed. Full size fridge, washer and dryer. We supply firewood, and live upstairs if you run into any issues.

The space
*See bottom if you are bringing your dog for pet rules.
*We have 2 cats that do go downstairs when we don't have guests.
*No refund for allergies to Cats or Dogs

Our mid-century-modern home is located in the neighborhood of North Asheville, 2.5 miles from downtown Asheville, and less than a mile from favorite spots like Asheville Pizza and Brew, one of our oldest craft breweries/movie theatre. Enjoy a movie while having the best pizza in A'ville, and great
neighborhood_overview:
North Asheville is an easy drive to so many places. 10 minutes north of the Biltmore, were a straight drive there, no need to get on the interstate. We're 1 mile from the Grove Park Inn, another favorite spot to visit, built around the same time as the Biltmore, an interesting and fun place to visit, built from boulders, in the side of a mountain with views, restaurants and shops, plus it's free to visit.
We're 15 minutes from West Asheville another neighborhood with many restaurants (our favorite restaurant is Sunny Point), bars and music. Our favorite bar is, of course, the Golden Pineapple on Haywood Rd.
host_about:
I'm a graphic and web designer, working from home, perfect for hosting AirBnB. Husband Tom also works mostly from home, an engineer and creative. We've been hosting on Airbnb for about 7 years.
We've lived in our home for 17 years. 
We have 2 cats, who manage us pretty well.
We enjoy mountain biking, road biking, climbing, hiking, food, and wine. And coffee and chocolate. 
And LOVE our home in Asheville, a great place to live or visit!

name: Bodacious Downtown Bungalow
description:
AVAILABLE FOR STAYS OF 28+ NIGHTS, eff. 7/21. Rehabbed 1920’s spacious bungalow full of charm and character. PERFECT house to work from home, great WiFi, multiple working areas. Ideal to have friends/family visit too. 15 mins WALK downtown, 10 mins walk to South Slope and RAD, 2 miles to Biltmore and amazing hiking in every direction! Charm & plenty of space on two levels, free street parking, ideal for exploring AVL.Three bedrooms, full kitchen, deck, living room, dining room, laundry.

The space
As a craftsman-style bungalow, this house oozes architectural charm, yet it's fully outfitted with all modern conveniences.

Full Kitchen with dishwasher and laundry in house. Strong WiFi throughout the house. Each of three bedrooms has a comfy queen sized bed.

The large living room has lots of seating, ceiling fans, games and a TV.

There's a spacious two-tiered back deck for catching some sun, and a covered porch in the front of the
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is known as "South French Broad" (named after the river that flows through town) and is ideally situated in Asheville. You can be at the Biltmore, many of the South Slope breweries or downtown restaurants or right in the middle of all the galleries of the River Arts District all in less than five minutes drive. I walk a lot and take $6 Uber rides pretty much everywhere!

If you're a walker, you can even leave your car behind, as both the RAD and downtown are accessible by foot via spacious sidewalks. It takes about 20 minutes to walk downtown, and about 10 minutes to get to South slope or RAD. Asheville is a mountain town so the walk is hilly and may take longer for less fit people. Uber is a great option, I usually only pay about $6 to go anywhere downtown or to take an Uber home.

South Slope = Beer!
The Bodacious Downtown Bungalow is located within walking distance to 7 amazing breweries, all just steps from one another. You just gotta l
host_about:
Together with my husband Michael, we are hosts who LOVE our "hometown" of 7 yrs - Asheville NC!  We both have excellent suggestions on things to see and do here --especially restaurants!  Asheville is a foodie and beer lovers paradise.  Through a fateful twist of the pandemic, we also recently discovered Edisto Beach SC and we're enchanted beyond our expectations and look forward to sharing that property with other travelers.  We live with two almost-human roommates, Lucie and Mambo - 7 yr old Standard Poodles who pretty much rule our lives.  

By now it's probably clear we're big fans of "the good life" and we'll do our best to share it all with you!

description:
PERFECT FOR PROFESSIONAL OR CONTRACT WORK! It is well appointed, clean and comfortable. Are you considering a change in your life which may include Asheville? for a temporary job? for retirement? to explore the area of the Blue Ridge Mountains? just to have a change of scenery? to complete your newest book? ?
These are all great ideas to explore for your life. RENEW YOURSELF OR RETREAT HERE FROM LOCAL WORK!

The space
Location WITHIN 3 MILES of everything WORK AT HOSPITAL, DOWNTOWN --PLAY IN wonderful West Asheville ...Isis ( 2016 Best Small Bluegrass Venue), EAT OR CARRY OUT Sunny Point Café, West End Bakery, The OWL Bakery, The Admiral among many other attractions. Easy access to Biltmore Estate, Arboretum, UNCA, AB Tech and McCormick Field.

Guest access
WHEN BILTMORE REOPENS...With 7 days notice the Biltmore Estate gives guests $15.00 off their ticket price. Check out the Biltmore Estate Web Site.

Other th
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is the "hip" place for people who move to Asheville.  My guests prefer the amenities here and easy access to nature.  Everything is available.
host_about: Lively person who loves houses (I have renovated for a long time), being actively involved in the arts and music, nature - out of doors, and loves to meet new people.  Join me to enjoy Asheville.
