name: LUX VILLA SUNSET SUITE ~ DTN 2M ~ RURAL ~ WILDLIFE
description:
Just a 5 minute Uber or a 2 mile saunter from Downtown, our luxurious stone & stucco home on a Private Road, is constructed with an extra-wide driveway to accommodate up to 10 cars and cameras for guest comfort and safety.
Our spacious stone & stucco house is on a quiet Private Road and boasts extravagant 7.5PH well-water and overlooks nothing but woods of trees and a mountainous skyline.

The space
PLEASE CHECK ALL OUR LUXURY LISTINGS;
https://www.airbnb.com/users/1994122/listings
SUNSET SUTE DESCRIPTION
A luxurious queen size sleigh bed will ensure restful sleep while the Sunset Suite is fitted with a flat-screen cable TV to catch-up on the ‘other’ world, with access to Netflix and Amazon via Roku2.
Located on the south/southwest corner of the house with exceptional views of local wildlife not limited to bobcats, wild turkeys & black bears, sun streams in your bedroom windows throughout the day. The mirrored-door double closet is fitted
neighborhood_overview:
Chunns Cove is a world unto itself. We have one neighbor whom is barely visible through the trees, otherwise all you can see is a spectacular 270 degree view of the valley and woods from the house. The cove is human-quiet but bird-noisy! We regularly see creatures that you wouldn't expect and could easily mistake this place in summer for a Costa Rican rain-forest! Ingles, our local grocery store, is 2 minutes down the road and Wholefoods and Walgreens are 5 minutes away.
Our favorite dinner restaurants are the Admiral in West Asheville, the Bull & Beggar in the River Arts District, Curate Downtown and the Copper Crown in East Asheville for which we recommend reservations but you might find seats at the bar to order a selection of fabulous small plates. Lunch time Downtown we are partial to Chai Pani's Indian Street Food which i take with no spices and Gypsy Queen Lebanese Food over the bridge on Patton Ave is ideal on a tight budget.
host_about: Well-immersed in the pastry and chocolate world for several decades, there is nothing on Marc’s list of culinary delights that features higher than chocolate and coffee. Playing a considerable role in both gutting and rebuilding spectacular Chunn’s Cove and Utopia residences, Marc has conclusively proved that watching informative and directional Home Improvement Shows for the best part of adulthood, is akin to learning a new language. Born in Quebec, Marc’s native tongue is French but his English rivals any native tongue and his Spanish ensures trilinguality. Not without her artistic inheritance, Fay’s world is defined as a pleasurable balance between entrepreneur and artist, commencing with a decade of international business travel in her 20’s, evolving to a decade of motherhood punctuated by a successful online decade in the office. Now the time is ripe to spread those four Sagittarian wings for this highly motivated couple are restlessly eager to explore exciting new ventures.

name: SUNNY SERENITY, OFFICE, MTN VIEW, PORCH, IN CITY!
description:
Gorgeous, private apt in historic home, perfect for single or couple. Digital Nomads welcome! High speed Wi-Fi & great cell reception. Located in a quiet neighborhood, 1 mile to downtown. King bed, oak floors, stone fireplace, gas logs, 10’ ceilings, exposed brick wall, French doors, lots of natural light. Glass door to covered porch with view of Sunset Mtn & the historic Grove Park Inn. Separate office with desk. Walk to everything. Quiet, awesome location. Free, easy parking in front of house.

The space
Spacious, smartly furnished, 1 bedroom first floor apartment with separate office, located in a beautiful 1928 home and sidewalk lined, city neighborhood. Just 1 mile north of downtown Asheville and only ½ mile (easily within walking distance) to Trader Joe’s and Harris Teeter grocery stores as well as a nice variety of restaurants, stores, tennis courts, bus line, etc. Truly in the heart of things, yet at night, the neighborhood provides a quiet and comfort
neighborhood_overview:
The location of this apartment is phenomenal. It is within walking distance to tennis courts, many restaurants, coffee shop, Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Harris Teeter, the bus line and just 1 mile north of Downtown Asheville. It's about a $6 Uber ride home if you are out enjoying a night of craft beer and live music.

This apartment is close to UNCA, many breweries, the River Arts District, South Slope, Downtown Art Galleries, live music, fabulous restaurants, The Botanical Gardens, Bent Creek Biking Trails, Blue Ridge Parkway, Grove Park Inn & Spa, French Broad River, Wolf Ridge Ski resort, US Cellular Center, St. Lawrence Basilica and Biltmore Estate.
There is so much to see and do you will want to be here a long time:)
host_about:
Thank you for supporting a local resident, and for allowing me to do what I love to do most, hosting guests from all over the world and welcoming them to the Asheville area!

 I have lived here for 25 years and enjoy sharing my locals insider tips &  suggestions with my guests. 

When I travel, I prefer to stay in individually owned accommodations instead of generic hotels.  I pay close attention to the details in every home I stay in while traveling and try to incorporate the best ideas  into my homes, to make your stay most enjoyable. 

Cheers,
Julie

 
My life motto;
“Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of humans as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.” Helen Keller

Here’s to your life adventures!
Cheers,
Julie

name: Sassy Blue Room in Southslope
description:
In Asheville! Walking distance to Southslope Breweries, Orange Peel, Downtown (1 mile) & River Arts District. Beautiful, sunny, comfortable room. Queen size bed, bathroom with shower (note bathroom & shower is small), sweet sitting area on wrap around deck (private with curtains for additional privacy or to block the sun). Entrance to Biltmore Estate 2 miles away.

The space
Very clean, open space with lots of light and funky folk Art by Artist Charlotte Scarce. aka The Sharecroppers daughter! Outside sitting area extends the space (in warm months) provides a nice outdoor relaxing area

Guest access
Enter the Room through private door to right of the main entrance to my 1913 Asheville Home. Entrance is on the wrap around side of my porch so is also very private.

Other things to note
I live in my home full time so am living life in my side of the house. I am not a huge TV person but you will hear TV from time to t
neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to River Arts District, Grey Eagle (some of the best music in town), 5 minute walk to Southslope with all the newest and most unique Breweries Asheville has to offer, New Belgium Brewery less than 1 mile, Biltmore Estate entrance 2 miles, Grove Park in 10 minute drive and all of downtown Asheville with it's Art, Street Buskers, yoga & pilates studios, music, local restaurants and breweries at your fingertips.  $5-6 Uber ride to town or 15 minutes walk.
host_about:
I am a vibrant self motivated person who likes to live each day to it's fullest.  Some of my favorite things in life are traveling, mountain biking, yoga, dance, live music, cooking, reading, watching movies and making connections with people.

My hosting style to to give people as much or as little attention as they desire.  I feel it is of utmost importance to provide a clean, comfortable & safe space with some necessities and peace & quiet.  I like to share fun and interesting things to do in our great town of Asheville and point folks to current entertainment events.

My motto in life is to be as kind and compassionate to yourself and others  each day~ And just ENJOY!

name: Victorian Cottage Downtown - "Green Room"
description:
A beautiful one-hundred year old historic home in the Montford neighborhood. 3 blocks from the center of town, 5-15 minute walk to everything.

The space
This home is a quick 5 minute walk from the center of downtown. This historic neighborhood is peaceful, yet only a short walk to all the fun activities downtown. This is the calendar for the Green Room. Fantastic restaurants nearby, the US Cellular Center, and St. Lawrence Basilica are only three blocks away. We are a 5 minute drive from UNCA.. You won't need to move your car once you are settled in, unless you decide to go to the Biltmore Estate and Biltmore Village, 10 minutes away. Easy access to the Blue Ridge parkway, NC Arboretum, Folk Art Center and much more!

Guest access
This calendar reflects the reservations for the "Green Room." It is located downstairs next to the "Blue Room." The Green room has a comfy queen size bed and an en-suite private bathroom. A "roll-away" bed i
neighborhood_overview: I love the beautiful old historic homes in this Montford neighborhood.  My house dates from circa 1910, termed a "Victorian cottage", and built by Richard Sharp Smith.  Many of the homes in the neighborhood date from the 1880's.  This Victorian neighborhood was the first suburb of Asheville.  It is  very quiet and friendly.  Lots of beautiful walking opportunities around the neighborhood.
host_about:
I am a professional musician. I teach private music lessons in my home and also do a lot of performing and am an adjunct professor of music.   I love to travel, meet people and do fun things. I am proud of my town and am happy to help visitors find the best experience.  I am really easy-going and have been renting rooms in my house for many years to people who need a place to stay for weeks, months or sometimes years.  Guests will have a comfortable home away from home with easy flexibility within the house to come and go as you please. (must love music!)

my life motto:  life is for fun!!!!

name: Downtown Artist Loft
description: If you're looking for a secluded mountain getaway this is not the place but if you are looking to be in the heart of downtown festivities then our loft is the perfect place for you! Our loft has local art, full window view of College street, high ceilings and exposed brick. We are right in the center of all the downtown action. You are literally steps away from incredible craft beers, award-winning food and regional music. Downtown is lively especially at night where you can hang out and see a local funk band or head down to the drum circle then sleep late then head downstairs for a massage.
neighborhood_overview: Downtown Asheville is energetic and in the center of the action. Lots of spaces are waiting to be explored, including amazing restaurants and nightlife. Two doors down is the One Stop/Asheville Music Hall, which features funk, reggae, and rock.
host_about: I am from Asheville NC.  I love to spend time outdoors, cooking and reading or listening to music.

name: Laurelwood
description:
Laurelwood is an entirely separate, 2-room suite with full bath, part of a single-family home. Located in a quiet neighborhood, it has a private entrance, a small porch area, and off-street parking. 5 to 10 dollar Uber ride or 5 to 10 minute drive to downtown Asheville. No surprise hidden cleaning fee.

The space

name: Modern River-Arts Cottage - Near Downtown/Mission
description:
CORONAVIRUS UPDATE: For the safety of all guests, I am blocking my calendar for 7 full days between guests, and am following all CDC-recommended cleaning and disinfecting procedures for all surfaces in the house.

The space
Are you looking for a home base for your adventure in Asheville? We’ve got it for you! This 2 BR, 1.5 BA single-family home is just a 20-minute walk or 5-minute drive from all the excitement of downtown Asheville, with all of its restaurants, shops, galleries, and general awesomeness!

This modern yet cozy home is fully furnished, including all linens, towels, soaps, etc. Also included are ALL utilities, even the lightning-fast AT&T fiber Internet, which is perfect for working from home.

Located in the hip and trendy River Arts District, your Asheville abode offers a large front porch with beautiful sunset views and a fun, private spot to enjoy both the beautiful springtime weather and the mountain and river views.
neighborhood_overview:
The location is amazing - you will be steps from all the artists’ galleries and wonderful restaurants, coffee shops, and pubs of the River Arts District, including Bull and Beggar, White Duck Taco, Wedge Brewing, All Souls Pizza, Smoky Park Supper Club, Cafe Ultra, the Grey Eagle, and others!

It’s also just blocks from both the French Broad Greenway, which circles the New Belgium brewery, and the River Arts Walk also along the French Broad. Two of Asheville’s most popular parks, the French Broad River Park and Carrier Park are a 3-minute drive away.

The house is also 1 mile from the South Slope neighborhood, a buzzing hive of hip microbreweries, restaurants, and shops (High Wire, Green Man, Burial, Twin Leaf, Wicked Weed, The Funkatorium, Catawba, Asheville Brewing Company, Buxton Hall BBQ, Vortex Donuts, etc), and 1 mile from Downtown Asheville with its countless restaurants, bars, breweries, shops, galleries, theaters, and other amenities. Easy 6.6 Miles to Biltmore Estates, 6.5 Miles to Downtown Asheville (10-12 minutes to either!). 5 Minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway! Uber and Taxi's service this location. Perfect home base for your group's stay in Asheville.

Outside:
Relax on the back patio, just steps from the kitchen, while cooking up family favorites on the large charcoal grill. Relax around the fire on warm summer evenings or cool spring and fall nights, telling stories and cooking S'Mores. Watch your kids play in the large front yard, wrap around decks or veranda. They can also join the neighborhood kids in bicycling around the cul-de-sac and other dead end streets.

Guest access
Easy self checking with combination lock. Come and go as you please! Self check in available. You also have access to all the home has to offer. (Don't forget you may nee
neighborhood_overview: Located in East Asheville, the location of this home is truly spectacular.  10 minutes to the Biltmore Estate, 10 Minutes to Downtown Asheville, 5 Minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway and very convenient to I-40 and 240.
host_about: I grew up in a bed and breakfast about an hour from Asheville, NC.  My husband and I met at a comedy club in Asheville before taking off to live in Vietnam and Taiwan for a few years.  We got married in Thailand and recently took a trip to Mexico! We love to travel and to host others. My husband can be found either playing the guitar or building things in his workshop and I am usually in the kitchen whipping up something yummy (usually from Asia and impossible to find here). We love to cook, hike, go camping, and read.  We are looking forward to meeting you, staying with you, or hosting you!

name: ASHEVILLE DREAM CATCHER 1BR, Office, Balcony, VIEW
description:
So close to downtown without the crowds & noise. Spacious, beautiful, city apt in quiet, historic neighborhood. 1 mile N of downtown Asheville. Huge BR, walk in closet, French doors, balcony, views of the Grove Park Inn & Sunset Mtn & a sunny glass enclosed office. Oak floors, lots of light, spacious rooms, king bed & 2 gas log fireplaces. Fully equipped kitchen. Hi speed internet. Great cell reception. Free, street parking in front of the house. Walk to restaurants, parks, convenient store.

The space
This spacious furnished apartment, located in a beautiful 1920's home, exemplifies Asheville living, very unique. Hardwood floors throughout. 3 sets of French doors throughout the apt.

Lots of natural light throughout.

Both the living room and bedroom have French doors with views of the Grove Park Inn and Sunset Mtn. The living room is huge with a comfy sectional couch and stone fireplace with gas logs.(operable September 15-April 15 only)
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is perfect for walking. There are sidewalks that take you past varied and beautiful architecture. Everyone you meet is friendly.
host_about:
Thank you for supporting a local resident, and for allowing me to do what I love to do most, hosting guests from all over the world and welcoming them to the Asheville area!

 I have lived here for 25 years and enjoy sharing my locals insider tips &  suggestions with my guests. 

When I travel, I prefer to stay in individually owned accommodations instead of generic hotels.  I pay close attention to the details in every home I stay in while traveling and try to incorporate the best ideas  into my homes, to make your stay most enjoyable. 

Cheers,
Julie

 
My life motto;
“Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of humans as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.” Helen Keller

Here’s to your life adventures!
Cheers,
Julie

Currently closed for COVID. Hope to see you soon!

Art studio/guestshack modified modular separate from our house, come & go as late as you want.

Can provide a single floor mattress if needed for a separate sleeping space.

Use this link to sign up to Airbnb & save $$ with credit off your first booking: www.airbnb.com/c/clyons10
Read the whole listing, look at ALL the pics - and DO NOT BOOK if you're not IN LOVE. Please book s
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is hillbilly residential, usually peaceful and easy going. There are neighbors but not much interaction with neighbors as property is fenced in and private and surrounded in trees.
Unit borders a 10 acre cow pasture.

Please check location on map and do not book if location is not 5 star worthy to you! We only want guests who are thrilled with the private, country like location. Be advised there are curves on the roads, like everywhere in Asheville - we are IN the mountains! DO NOT book if you have a problem with curves in roads or driveways. And please DO NOT book if your car head lights are not enough to light the driveway for you - we avoid too much artificial outdoor lights as we prefer star gazing and are fostering fire flies that are rapidly disappearing due to too much outdoor lighting, so we love our unlit driveway
☺
host_about:
We are artist/musicians living in Asheville with our 2 boys and a few pet chickens.
We enjoy gardening & landscaping our peaceful sanctuary.
We are openminded, humorous, non-judgmental, vegan/vegetarian,  balanced between urban/rural, into nature, arts, music, philosophy, astronomy, archaeology, and respectful of all life. :)

As hosts, we try to be easy going and accommodating as possible.
As guests, we live by the Leave No Trace principal and/or the "leaving it nicer than you found it" principal. :)

description:
Comfortable guest bedroom in our mountain home sleeps two in a queen bed. We have lowest cleaning fee in town, no security deposit, and private, not shared bathroom. This room in our house is the Blue Ridge Room. Private bathroom not shared with anyone, porch view, and only minutes from Biltmore Estate & downtown Asheville. Only 3 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway, 2 miles off of I-26. Room also has mini-fridge, TV with Roku, & coffee maker! Great deal, don’t pay extra fees like other places.

The space
We have keypad-operated deadbolt locks on our entry doors for easy check-in! Our home is in an awesome, scenic, and convenient location: we are a short 15-minute drive from downtown Asheville, 10 minutes from the airport, 10 minutes from the Biltmore House, 5 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway, and 5 minutes from Interstate 26.

Guest access
This rental includes use of the guest bedroom and bathroom only. Use of the front porch is also permi
neighborhood_overview: South slope of Brown Mountain overlooking south Asheville toward Mt. Pisgah, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and the Pisgah National Forest. Less than five minutes to local restaurants, bars, and shopping. Quiet neighborhood, secluded in forest, tucked away up on the mountain.
host_about:
Hello! My husband and I are looking forward to hosting guests in our home as well as being a guest of others during our travels. We became AirBnB hosts in 2014 and have since hosted more than 2,000 bookings. In 2018, we became AirBnB superhosts!

We live in Asheville in the beautiful mountains of western North Carolina.

Allison works as a fourth grade teacher at Mills River Elementary School. Peter works as the Trails Coordinator at a regional land trust, Conserving Carolina. Both of us work to keep this region we love as wonderful as it is today, and make it even better for future generations.

We love to take road trips throughout the year. We have appreciated the kindness of many over the years who have let us stay in their home or camp in their yard, or have rented a room to us for a reasonable rate. We are guests who are focused on our travels and we most often are seeking simply a room to hang our hat for the night before our travels resume the following morning. For that reason, most hosts barely know that we are there. In appreciation for the kindness shown to us over the years, we pay it forward by being clean and courteous when we are guests in the homes of others, and we are seeking to host guests who are similarly self-sufficient and simply seeking a basic place for the night.

We look forward to you staying in our home!

This old country house was built in 1915, it has been remodeled through the years. My remodel includes this efficiency apt for your bnb get-away.
Private Bedroom with a Queen Bed, bath & shower, living room & kitchenette. It was formerly an enclosed back porch on my house.
Lots of outdoor space to enjoy in addition to the cozy indoors.

The space
This 21 acre property is located just 5 miles from the center of Asheville and only 2 miles from Haywood Rd. in West Asheville. We're 1 mile outside Asheville city limit.

I have chickens, dogs and cats, so if you have an allergy, or just don't enjoy animals, this is not the place for you. There is a small water-catchment pond out back that is home to an abundance of aquatic life. In the summer the night sounds of frogs, crickets & katydids may remind you of camping out. It's quiet day and night, with very light traffic on the road leading in. Beautiful mountain vistas can be seen along the way if you take certain routes we can tell you about.

Your Hostess:
Kelly is an unapologetic idealist & liberal, permaculture practicing free thinker.

The space
Relax and unwind at this peaceful creek side log cabin nestled in Asheville’s historic Grove Park neighborhood. This rustic lodging is surrounded by mature trees, a grassy lawn, seasonal gardens, and the sounds of Reed Creek. Inside you’ll find the vintage cabin thoughtfully set up for a comfortable and immaculately clean extended stay.

The living room provides plenty of seating around a large stone fireplace, a desk, and a single bed for an extra guest or an afternoon nap. You can use your vacation with us as an opportunity for complete escape, but if you’d prefer to stay connected, we include high speed internet & premium TV channels. In the full kitchen you will find a oven/range, microwa

host_about: We are Asheville locals who feel super lucky to have the cabin to share with guests.

name: Cheerful Home In Historic Downtown Asheville
description:
This City of Asheville HomeStay approved apartment is situated on a pleasant wooded lot in a beautiful historic Asheville neighborhood conveniently located near downtown shops and eateries.

The space
Guests will never lack something nearby to do, see, taste, experience! This apartment is conveniently located a mere mile or two of many music venues (such as The Grey Eagle, The Orange Peel, Harrahs Cherokee Center, Thomas Wolfe Auditorium, ...) restaurants (such as Nine Mile, Curate, 12 Bones Smokehouse, Tupelo Honey, Mela, Bouchon...) as well as great places to discover art (such as the Diana Wortham Theatre, Asheville Art Museum, The Blue Spiral Gallery, Thomas Wolfe Memorial, Malaprops Bookstore, Fine Arts Theatre...)

Guest access
-Wifi Internet- updated for higher speed/stronger signal (plus Smart TV with Netflix and Hulu Streaming) NB: There is no cable television, there are streaming options as well as an array of DVD’s.

-Sp
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is in a quiet, lovely historic neighborhood located slightly north of downtown Asheville.

Apartment Proximity:

Downtown Asheville is within 1 mile.

3 minute walk to:
Just up the street check out our fun neighborhood "library" (a unique take-one-leave-one book drop) at the point where Cumberland Circle connects to Cumberland Ave.

5 minute walk to:
Large park with tennis and basketball courts, great for picnics or lounging with a blanket & book. Access to greenway/ bike path. Nine Mile -a fine neighborhood restaurant.

10-20 minute walk to:
Trader Joes, Greenlife, and Harris Teeter Grocery Stores, High Five Coffee Shop, All Day Darling Cafe, small park with play equipment, the Botanical Gardens, a 60 acre urban forest, UNCA, and downtown cafés, coffee shops, bookstores, galleries, museums, & boutiques.
host_about:
Hello Fellow Traveler(s),

During the academic year I am a high school teacher. In the summer I'm an explorer of places far and near: Alaska, Quebec, France, Costa Rica... and certainly Asheville itself... as there is much to see and do right here in beautiful Western North Carolina.

In addition to teaching and traveling, I am a parent, writer, runner, appreciator of good food, film & music, and a fan of nice people everywhere.  In fact, I'm so much a fan of nice people, as best I can I like to share with them the great place I call home.

I look forward to helping you have a great experience discovering Asheville.

name: Sassy Purple Cottage!
description:
Nestled in historic Montford, the Sassy Purple Cottage awaits! This enchanting cottage provides the perfect escape - 5 minutes to downtown Asheville. Eat-in kitchen, one private bedroom & daybed sleeps up to 2 additional guests. Quiet/private yard

The space
Stand alone private cottage. 1 BR/1BA with an additional daybed in the "lounging room" that sleeps up to 2 people. Stack washer and dryer. Kitchen has coffee maker, microwave, toaster and is fully stocked with dishes, pots and pans etc. High speed (cable) wireless Internet.

Guest access
Easy 5-minute drive to downtown Asheville. Biltmore Estate and Gardens and Grove Park Inn is less than 15 minutes away. Scores of hiking and biking trails nearby.

Other things to note
The cottage is fully modernized but has lots of charming historic character. Neighborhood is quiet. Property, which includes backyard and cabana, is very peaceful. Has a carport for covered park
neighborhood_overview: Historic and quaint.  Walking distance to Montford Park, host to annual Shakespeare summer festival.  VERY close to downtown which includes many of the local breweries, wine bars, music halls and great restaurants. Minutes away from galleries and entertainment options of the River Arts District.
host_about:
I am a vibrant self motivated person who likes to live each day to it's fullest.  Some of my favorite things in life are traveling, mountain biking, yoga, dance, live music, cooking, reading, watching movies and making connections with people.

My hosting style to to give people as much or as little attention as they desire.  I feel it is of utmost importance to provide a clean, comfortable & safe space with some necessities and peace & quiet.  I like to share fun and interesting things to do in our great town of Asheville and point folks to current entertainment events.

My motto in life is to be as kind and compassionate to yourself and others  each day~ And just ENJOY!

description:
The Urban Oasis is a spacious and cozy 1Br newly renovated private guest suite with a private covered porch and hot tub, set in the heart of West Asheville. Walking distance to some of the best restaurants and shops Asheville has to offer!


NOTE: Due to the Asheville, NC. COVID-19 Virus STR restrictions some restrictions may apply!

The space
The Urban Oasis is a recently renovated private apartment on the lower level of a 1920's bungalow home. It has one spacious bedroom, a reading space and work desk, one bathroom, kitchen and private porch with access to a large wooded shared yard.
Your home away from home has a comfy queen size bed, A/C and a kitchen stocked with an assortment of tea and coffee to keep you comfortable and cozy. A Flat screen smart tv (access netflix, amazon prime, hulu with your account), books, and games are available to entertain you on a rainy day! Other perks: Off street parking (one space), washer/dryer and pet f
neighborhood_overview:
West Asheville is a hip and eclectic neighborhood with a downtown of its own. Best brunch contenders Sunny Point and Biscuit Head, the Admiral, New Belgium Brewery and many more are within walking or biking distance. Riverside park (has a dog park!) and Carrier park, hiking/biking and river floating are all just a hop and skip away. There is a plethora to see and do right in the neighborhood and Downtown Asheville is an easy bike ride away!

Please note- Asheville is a very eclectic town. People are creative and often that’s reflected in the yards and outside of homes of our very nice neighbors, which may come off as “sketchy” to some folks. Our neighborhood is extremely safe and we have never had any problems. Our neighbors are very kind and respectful, don’t be fooled by their tattoos and unique hairstyles or art yards; it’s part of the eccentric Asheville culture!
host_about:
We are from the Mountains of Western North Carolina. David is a contractor, specializing in GreenBuilding and Melissa is a Physician Assistant at a Family Practice.  We have an amazing 18mo old daughter who teaches us something new about ourselves and life every day!
We to love travel, play outdoors with our dog and enjoy all the great restaurants Asheville has to offer.

Living Room

name: Fabulous Studio 7 min to downtown!
description:
This studio apartment is only a seven-minute drive to downtown Asheville. Situated at the end of a cul-de-sac, the acre and a half are filled with both flower and vegetable gardens, a large fire pit with plenty of seating (bring your bundle of firewood or ask if I can get for you at a small charge).

The space
If we have NOT had any rain in days, the fire pit can’t be used as forest fires are a big issue in the dry summers. There are many spots to hang out in the yard, either on a hammock or at a dining table. Owned by a local artistic welder, I have sculpture surrounding the place! The studio is equipped with many options for cooking with both plug-in fryers, toaster ovens, and a two burner stove. There are also outside grills for your pleasure. Bring your own charcoal!

Coffee beans, chocolate, half&half, eggs, and fresh croissants await you.

Guest access
I live upstairs but privacy is complete with the studio having its own en
neighborhood_overview:
Since I grew up on Cherry Lane, in the house next door, I have many fond and magical memories. Today, it still holds that magic. It's a family centered neighborhood and folks appreciate slow driving on Cherry Lane's small street as there are kids who actually play outside!
My grandparents bought the three acres in 1945 because a double rainbow hung over the eastern view. 10 Cherry Lane was where they lived until my family moved in with them. Four kids and two parents living in the upstairs at 10 had my grandparents moving quickly to build their dream house. 12 was designed by a protege of Frank Lloyd Wright and is a one-of-a-kind style with plenty of light and outside areas for calm meditative moments or kickball. A garden provides fresh heirloom tomatoes, herbs, beans, corn and squash you are welcome to enjoy and use if cooking.

If you want to walk to places, there's a few great restaurants less than a mile away. Moe's Barbaque is down the hill, Cecelia's Argentinian
host_about:
My grandparents built this house in 1959. My grandfather was a Major General, head of the 13th AD, and a graduate of West Point in 1915, along with Eisenhower and Omar Bradley. After getting shot in WW2, his military career ended and he and my grandmother moved to Asheville so he could run the VA Hospital in Oteen. 

The house next door and three acres is what they bought in 1945 after witnessing a double rainbow over the mountains. After my mother and father moved us four kids to the upstairs of that house, my grandparents got an architect who studied with Frank Lloyd Wright to design the mid-century modern house next door, and my childhood was spent going between the houses. 

Four years ago I came up to renovate the place in order to sell it, but after watching a full moon rise over the mountains, I fell in love with it all over again and bought it. It's a comfort knowing this property has never left our family. I can feel all my relations here and enjoy the memories I had, mostly with my loving, brilliant, funny grandmother in this house. It has been a gathering spot for many famous people, including Ike and Mamie, who were close friends of my grandparents, and Carl Sandburg. 

I am an artistic welder and a singer and have travelled all over the world entertaining the troops for the Dept of Defense. Along the path of my travels, I always appreciated the kindness of locals who guided me when lost or recommended flavorful local places set apart from the tourist track. I'm here to offer you the same guidance.

There are sculptures and furniture inside and around my property that I made. 

 I love meeting new people, and I also love my privacy. I respect guests privacy as well and am available with any questions, concerns, interests you may have, but otherwise will not intrude. I live upstairs, and I am sensitive to being quiet. I encourage my guests to feel right at home. 

The expansive yard has plenty of areas to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee or a cocktail. The garden beds have herbs you are welcome to use.

Feel free to text with any questions prior to your stay as well as during your stay. My goal is for everyone who books the studio to enjoy the view, the birds, the wildlife, and the close proximity to everything fun while feeling far away, so much so, that they want to come back!!!

name: Historic West Asheville 1930's Charmer
description:
Welcome to our 1930's Historic Charmer in eclectic and BOOMING West Asheville!!! Our house comes FULLY FURNISHED and includes all utilities. Enjoy being close to EVERYTHING that Asheville has to offer! Just a short walk or drive to amazing restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries, grocery stores, Farmers Markets, the popular River Arts District, bars, breweries, festivals, The Biltmore, music venues, parks, playgrounds, the French Broad River, and the great outdoors!!! 🏔

The space
Welcome to our 1930’s home with LOTS of charm and an INCREDIBLE location!! Our 2000sqft home has all of the original fixtures, including glass doorknobs, original light fixtures, and red radiators! This home is definitely our labor of love and we enjoy being able to share it with others! ♥️

The house includes 4 bedrooms, plus a bonus room for a 5th bedroom/office/nursery- located off of the master, 3 bathrooms (2 with claw foot tubs), plus a BIG spacious living room/lounge area
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a safe walkable place. On any given day you will see walkers, runners, and families taking strolls. There are several local restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries, stores, bars, breweries, the River Arts District, playgrounds, the French Broad River, and music venues within walking distance. Some of our favorites are The Isis, The Grey Eagle, The Wedge, The Urban Orchard, White Duck Taco, Sunny Point Cafe, BiscuitHead, The Wedge, The Admiral, West End Bakery, Pizza Mind, Archetype Brewery, Hole Doughnuts, Taco Billy, and many more!
host_about: Our family has lived in this beautiful home for over 13 years and we've put a lot of love and energy into it. We enjoy hiking, working in our yard, and spending quality time with one another and our friends. We love to travel and during our most recent stay in an airbnb in Scotland, we decided to open our home to travelers. We look forward to welcoming you into our home! :-)

name: Private suite in walkable W. Asheville
description:
Sweet private suite in W. Asheville bungalow. Private entrance and private bath. Walkable to all the great shops and restaurants of the West side village! Quiet, dead end street and off street parking. Just a 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville.

The space
The fully furnished suite offers a super comfortable queen size bed, your own private bath, a comfortable sitting area for coffee and meals, and a lovely deck all to yourself. This new addition to my home offers warm, hand raked birch wood floors in the bedroom and lovely tile in the bath. A mini-fridge, microwave and electric tea kettle make you fully self-sufficient for a short stay, but kitchen privileges are possible as well. Many wonderful restaurants and bars are walkable, and your stay is just a 5 minute drive from the River Arts District and downtown.

Guest access
This is a private suite with its own entrance. Kitchen privileges may be arranged.
neighborhood_overview: W. Asheville is great. It is a village unto itself with fine restaurants, shops, and the Massage School and Yoga Center all within walking distance of my house.  And it's just a five minute drive to downtown.
host_about:
I spent my entire adult life in theatre as an actress, director and producer. Nearly 20 years of that I created original works with objects and puppets. My work has been seen at The Kennedy Center, the Henson International Festival in N.Y., UCLA, and the Walker Arts Center, to name a few.  I tired of the touring life however and am now making beautiful handmade art lamps inspired by a 2 year stay in Korea.  I love my hours in the studio which is located in Asheville's River Arts District!  I must still travel some to get my wares out into the public, but with a studio in the district, many travelers come my way. 

I love to meet new people. I'm friendly and easy to get along with.  With all the traveling done over the years I am quite self sufficient.  Good food is important when you're on the road, and I love to find those special little places tucked away in a neighborhood. As a host, I will be able to point you in the right direction for a wonderful night on the town. 

My motto is - "Be positive and enjoy the ride."

name: Everything Zen Asheville
description:
A charming & simple "Zen like" Japanese 2 bedroom bungalow with two queen beds and the best of both worlds; 4 miles from downtown Asheville while surrounded by rural nature. 1/2 mile from the French Broad River in the Woodfin neighborhood, just 4 miles North of downtown. Excellent WIFI!

The space
Both bedrooms have queen sized beds. There's even a bed for a 5th person. The house is full of cool Asian inspired influences. Clean, simple and modern. A true Ashevillian experience.

Guest access
Full house, with a well stocked kitchen full of tools, seasonings & spices. Dine in some, eat out some...but please, no fires in the wood stove and no smoking inside.

Other things to note
Sorry but, no fires in the wood stove, we have toasty electric heat for you and a heated blanket. Our idea of "Zen" doesn't include a TV...or smoking inside :) We just had the oven and linens professionally cleaned... WiFi works great
neighborhood_overview: Very close to town but surrounded by nature. Such a sweet spot!  It is rural, peaceful, and private. A dead end road makes this great neighborhood chill! Easy access to West Asheville and Downtown.
host_about: I love Asheville and want to share this cool town with you! I'm a chill local with a guest experience focus. The house is set up so you can feel at home but still have a vacay vibe. I've traveled extensively in Asia and the house reflects it, as it does my love for cooking. The environment and local economy are important to me and I'd hope you'll be like minded.

Lovely, bright, and spacious private bedroom with adjacent private guest bathroom make your stay very comfortable. The bedroom has a writing desk, large closet, and wonderful original art. Asheville Homestay Permit Issued and Up to Date

name: Charming Cozy Home near Biltmore and Parkway
description:
Welcome y’all!

I have a calm, sweet, private home available just 5 minutes from Biltmore Estate & the Blue Ridge Parkway and 10 minutes to downtown Asheville. The house sleeps up to 6 with 3 bedrooms and 1 full bath. The house is all yours during your stay!

Come enjoy and explore. I’m a longtime local and love to share favorite places to visit & dine, too.
I also have a listing for a King and Queen suite on the north side of Asheville by Grove Park.

The space
This listing is for the entire house all to yourself!

My husband and I want a beautiful and restful space when we come home, so we have designed it that way for you, too. The home is unique because while it is simply furnished, it is comfortable, clean, chic, and a happy place to be. We recently redid the floors, too. We are committed to the CDC guidelines for cleaning and sanitizing between guests during this uncertain time as well.

The house has 3 bedroom
neighborhood_overview:
My home is only a 5 minute drive to the Biltmore Estate or the Blue Ridge Parkway, or 10 minutes to downtown Asheville. It is convenient and set back from the road.

The house is not in a neighborhood that is walkable, but the Parkway with great hiking is a short drive away. While the house is surrounded by trees and animal life, there is an industrial building down the hill that is visible from the driveway. It never bugs us, but we thought you should know! I think you will be quite comfortable in our house.

Often times, you will hear the birds in the morning and can watch them from the living room windows. In the evening you can occasionally see rabbits and a pesky groundhog in my yard. On special rare autumn evenings, you will see deer.
host_about: I am a singer/songwriter from the mountains of Asheville, NC that grew up in downtown Atlanta, GA. When I am not traveling with my sweet band (an all-female trio) I love the library, listening to music, hanging out with my eclectic family, tending my garden, and going to art shows of all kinds.

The space
My home is located across from the municipal golf course which is like living across from a park. Great walking neighborhood.

You have full use of the kitchen , I have a large kitchen with ample room for cooking and all I ask is that everyone cleans up after themselves . host_about:
I have been an avid traveler all my life and enjoy meeting people from different cultures .I have enjoyed using airbnb when I travel as it allows you to have a more personal experience when visiting a new city- I have been living in Asheville for 22 years now and I love , hiking swimming in waterfalls , biking and am a member of the asheville rowing club. I have been a Realtor for 30 years , and also own my own import business .

** Also as a side note for those that may appreciate this , I only use all natural cleaning products , all cotton sheets , essential oil sprayed wool  dryer balls for my laundry. name: Urbane Retreat Cabin In town Asheville 90 DAYS
description:
CHANGE YOUR VIEW FOR WORK or RETIREMENT!

We welcome you with a tradition of Southern hospitality, modern conveniences and an unmatched setting amidst the beauty of Asheville. This urbane retreat where city folks could tap into their inner adventurer.

Lovers of log cabins experience our ongoing commitment to providing an unforgettable experience for our guests who have recognized us with their ★★★★★ Five-Star reviews.

Let our cabin be your home base to explore Asheville today.

The space
Part of the joy of traveling is experiencing places and customs very different than what we’re used to. Because truly, once discovered is never forgotten Asheville, North Carolina is home to some breathtaking places. Asheville has grown into one of America’s best drinking cities and one of the best cities to enjoy live music.


BIG $$$ SAVINGS for EXTENDED STAY (90 DAYS) - OCCUPANCY TAX NORTH CAROLINA

The tax DOES NOT app
neighborhood_overview:
Homeland Park is a neighborhood built as a resort community of about 70 close by log cabins during the 1930s. It offers handcrafted log cabins and cottages each with unique and special characteristics still present, reminding visitors that this uncommon place is indeed one of Asheville’s treasures. These cabins hold fast to their heritage of a time gone by.
This area will charm as you meander through its tree lined streets of oaks and dogwoods, listening to the song birds. Today it is a terrific rental destination or temporary home while relocating. Everything is easy access.
host_about:
Lori and Lizzie who own three 5 Star properties. We are a couple who moved to Asheville, North Carolina from Guatemala, Central America  years ago after living overseas for 5 years. We traveled to Asheville after selling everything and brought our 2 dogs, plus a couple of suitcases. 

Our desire for adventure and travel took us to different countries to experience authentic adventures as well as the vibrant flavors of local food. Travel has shaped our choices.

Like most Ashevillians putting down roots who move here in the melting pot of the south, we have an eclectic mix of people that come from all corners of the country moreover the world to live and thrive in our wonderful southern community. There is so much to offer - experiencing different yummy foods, hiking, biking, artisans of all kinds, and wonderful independent shops as well as breweries, to do what they love and follow their passion. This is palpable in the city, further we feel the connection many have to the area. We think you will too.

We enjoy sharing our passion in a snapshot of Southern hospitality of life in Asheville as well as always striving to enhance our guest's experience. Our guests prefer renting private homes over just a cookie cutter hotel room for a richer experience, thanks to the additional amenities offered in homes. One of the primary goals we have is to offer a truly authentic experience. 

As Superhosts we have welcomed hundreds of guests from many countries. Our philosophy is working hard to focus on attention to detail which is seen in everything we do. This commitment is constantly evolving to offer an unforgettable experience for everyone. Our dreams continue to materialized in the form of having three inviting properties that our guests have recognized us with their 5 Star reviews. It’s an honor to reach this level of recognition as this is vital to our success, in addition to paying a living wage to our team who are an integral part of the guest experience.

We also encourage you to share our listings with your fellow travel enthusiasts, it just might be the first step toward inspiring their own life-changing experience. Should you have any questions about Asheville during your stay at our places, we are always accessible and available. We enjoy working with guests to make it a memorable stay. We are the perfect choice for savvy travelers.

We look forward to helping you with future plans with the true spirit of Asheville. As your host we look forward to welcoming you again and again.

name: Asheville Mountain Home ON RIVER! Rooms for Rent.
description:
East Asheville, EASY ACESS, 10 minutes to downtown, 2 minutes to Blue Ridge Pkwy, 15 minutes to Biltmore, right on the Swannanoa River, private drive, kayaks, float boats, outdoor shower, covered spacious deck, fire-pit on the covered deck, wildlife, scenic, private, truly a pretty view right in the bend of the river...love! Please note , there is a cost to use the 2nd bedroom if you have a party of three or four people, or if you plan on using the second bedroom for your own personal reasons.

The space
River is stocked with trout and bass. All forest across the river - only a few homes on this street. Very private but close to great dining and entertainment. Access to the Blue Ridge Parkway only 1/2 mile from the house. Easy access amazingly in the country to be so close to everything! Full bath, linens, 2 queen beds, one in each bedroom.
(I rent by the bedroom, please note the cost if using both bedrooms).
Enjoy the full covered deck which incl
neighborhood_overview:
I live at the END of the cul-de-sac, so it's private. We enjoy outdoor evening dinners and building fires.... enjoy the outside views/fires until midnight... Full of trees, private home at the end of the road, beautiful views of the river, swim, kayak, fish, relax on the deck, read a book.....
I'm just 2 miles off Tunnel Road which has shopping and restaurants including East Village Grill and Filo/Post 70 - great place for coffee and desserts. Creekside Tavern is awesome and only 2 minutes away.
host_about: Laid back, moved to Asheville to enjoy the mountains and the rivers, plus to be close to downtown for some fantastic dining and live entertainment!  I'm young at heart, Semi-Retired and would love to share my home with you on the Swannnanoa River.  Incredible COVERED DECK overlooking the river so close you can 'touch it"! There is a very nice fire pit right on the deck overlooking the river or enjoy laying in the hammock down beside the river - nice ambience and total relaxation. Kayaks, Float Boats, River Stocked with bass/trout, great for the fisherman and fisherwomen!  Me, I just want to share this great location which is only 10 MINUTES from downtown and help you enjoy a true Asheville experience, I have some great recommendations!

name: Chalet at Winghaven, Sunny Log Home
description:
The Chalet at Winghaven is a brand new, spacious, sunny log home. Close to Asheville and all its attractions, the chalet is surrounded by 38 acres of picturesque hardwood forest. Amazingly this private oasis is very close to shopping & restaurants!

The space
Open the sliding glass door of the spacious MASTER SUITE to enjoy the mountain air or relax with a glass of wine on the covered porch.
Sleeping in the LOFT BEDROOM with its own private full bathroom feels like being away from it all, up in the trees.
Guests of all ages enjoy the BUNK ROOM which is adjacent to another full bathroom which features a washer and dryer.
The open kitchen /dining / living space with vaulted ceilings and exposed beams is bright and airy during the day and cozy at night with a fire in the danish wood stove. Or if you prefer the outdoors gather around a campfire in the backyard for a perfect ending of the day.
Please note we provide split firewood for the wood st
neighborhood_overview:
The chalet is a convenient home base for the multitude of activities our area has to offer: Visit the Biltmore Estate ( 11miles), Downtown Asheville (12 miles), Historic Hendersonville (14 miles), go tubing or kayaking on the French Broad River, zip lining, drive the Blue Ridge Parkway, hike a different trail every day or see five magnificent waterfalls in just one day. There are wine tastings, beer tours, music and dance performances to attend and fabulous restaurants to try. Biking is a favorite sport here be it on the road or on mountain trails. We are more than happy to help you with planning your vacation so please talk to us and let us know what you are interested in.
Of course the chalet is also an awesome place to just relax, enjoy the sun shining through the leaves, the peace of the forest and the starlit nights.
host_about: We live with our three young children on a small farm close to Asheville ,NC. We love to spend time outside with our animals, biking or hiking in the beautiful mountains surrounding our home.

Spacious, private and lovely, this one-bedroom apartment is on the lower level of our three-story home. Your own private entrance and deck. You’re in the woods but 5-10 minutes away from popular spots, downtown, Biltmore Estate, the Blue Ridge Parkway and River Arts District.

The space
We have had the privilege to host over 1,300 people as AirBnB hosts and are in the upper echelon of guest satisfaction as just about all of our reservations gave us a 5 star rating, meaning there is in essence, no higher level of guest satisfaction than what we have attained. A beautiful, convenient location and a dedication to the highest level of service are our hallmarks.

We were chosen by a senior AirBnB staff to be the place they stayed at. "The two o
neighborhood_overview:
Kenilworth is one of Asheville’s wonderful neighborhoods, a historic gem with its own distinct feel. You’re in the woods but 10 minutes away from most of Asheville's major attractions.
Majestic trees, safe streets, eclectic mix of housing styles and the 19-acre Kenilworth Lake – a 20 minute walk from the house - makes walking (and driving) here great fun.
host_about:
Lynn is a nationally shown artist and gravitates toward all that is art. 
She is also a long-standing licensed psychotherapist.
Jake is a mgmt consultant in the ethics and compliance field.
 We enjoy unique (ethnic) food, cooking, bicycling, walking interesting neighborhoods and areas, being in the mountains, and taking in the areas culture.

name: Sunny Days
description:
Come cool down in the mountains on the front porch . With three beds and two bedrooms everyone will have some privacy . Best part of our home is being two blocks from amazing restaurants , breweries ,and outdoor cafe's.
Only 4 miles to Downtown and Biltmore Estate.

The space
This private two bedroom suite has three beds and private bathroom.
Spend your evening on the front porch or in the cozy living room .
There is a small refrigerator for leftovers as well as a microwave and Keurig coffee maker. No full kitchen at this time !

Guest access
The front of the bungalow is your private space with your own entrance,
There is no Kitchen at this time due to Covid 19. The large front porch even has a swing . We live in the back section with our own entrance .

Other things to note
There are 12 steps up to the front porch so not a good match if some one has mobility issues . There is not a full ki
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is now Best Asheville  !! The neighborhood is friendly and quiet yet a two block walk to fun bars, restaurants and some of Asheville's best breakfast spots !!
host_about:
An Asheville transplant, I have watched our West Asheville grow into a diverse community with numerous food eateries, music venues, shops and even a gas station with a pub.  I love our community and spend part of my time promoting the Greenway projects across the Asheville area and beyond. 
  
My partner Wynn and I have been living in our home since 2008 and have found that Asheville offers a lifestyle that encourages quality of life.   We look forward to sharing our experience on a visit very soon. Live, Laugh, Love!   

Grandmother of two gorgeous boys, I look forward to sharing my home with people coming to experience the Asheville scene.  My home is open and inviting and within walking distance to all the West Asheville Amenities.

I own a small real estate business, Sweetwater Realty, yes named after the beer from Atlanta.  We love our beers in Asheville.

Live, Laugh and Love!  I look forward to seeing you soon.

name: Convenient to Everything! Private
description:
This house is an even newer version or our other one. Both houses are immaculate, have gorgeous views and are extremely convenient to downtown and Biltmore. The houses have open floor plans and are modern with huge covered porches and three bedrooms.

The space
The house is two stories with hardwood floors and an open floor plan. There are three bedrooms. The master has a king and a full bath. The upstairs bedrooms are spacious. One has a queen and twin size daybed that pulls out to form two side by side twins (or a king depending on how you look at it). The other bedroom has a queen and a high quality futon that folds out to a full. The house most comfortably accommodates 6, but can sleep up to 10. There is one full bath upstairs that the two upstairs rooms share.

Guest access
You will have the whole house to yourself, as it is a stand alone rental. You will also have a side yard and a loop road through the woods (about 1/3 mile)
neighborhood_overview:
This area feels like a hybrid between rural and suburban. The house is on a gravel road (not steep or winding). You can hear the sounds of civilization and there are neighbors nearby, but it is a mostly private space.

The best thing is that despite the private feeling, there is a large grocery store that is only about 2 miles away, and downtown in only 6.5 miles away. We are also very close to the entrance to the Blue Ridge Parkway so you can easily access it for one of the most scenic drives in our country.
host_about: I live on the other side of the farm and raise goats and chickens with my family.  Having a vacation rental has been a dream for awhile.  I am also a licensed naturopathic physician, but right now I spend most of my time on the farm!

30 All Souls Crescent ste 200 Asheville, N.C. 28803

Original 1895 architectural details blend beautifully with the sensitive additons made to assure comfort and convenience.
Privacy is assured by gates and fences to the upper terrace. Interior magnetic storm panels keep it quiet and cozy. Designer interiors, local and historic art, two large flat screen TV's , full kitchen and laundry and microweave sheets enhance your stay.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in historic Biltmore village providing access to the areas delicious local foods and boutique shops. It is also just steps away from the historic Biltmore Estate with downtown Asheville just a short drive away.
host_about:
A local architect with a passion for Historic Architecture, Art, Antiques and Gardens.
We moved this1895 George Vanderbilt  cottage 30 years ago to save it from demolition. We tucked it into a moutainside with a private terrace overlooking Biltmore Village and we share a rear property line with The Biltmore Estate.

name: Peaceful Mountainside Living
description:
Reside on historic hunting grounds of the Vanderbilt's. Located just 12 minutes from downtown Asheville. With generous acreage and scenic splendor, the solitude will revive you from the bustle of our creative community, yet you'll be within comfortable distance from all attractions. The space is tastefully decorated with private entrance, private bath, and your own deck to kick back and enjoy the view! Tell us what you like to do and we'll offer recommendations to help make your stay memorable!

The space
Tucked adjacent to the Blue Ridge Parkway, yet located within the City limits, it's the perfect blend of nature, relaxation and access to all Asheville has to offer. This unique home is located in an upscale, mountainside area and situated on 5 wooded acres. Home is located in a wooded area directly adjacent to the Blue Ridge Parkway, therefore requires some "bear-wareness"! The Private suite features a bright and airy romantically inspired bedroom with organic
neighborhood_overview: Upscale residential community with average lot sizes of 1 acre or more
host_about:
We have lived in Asheville for over 20 years.  The mountains drew us down here from NYC, as we enjoy being and exploring outside in one of the most biodiverse places in North America.  We own and operate retail businesses downtown and would be pleased to share our experiences and insights of this wonderful area with frequent and first time Asheville guests and travelers.

Daniel and Marylou

name: The AshVilla- Prime West Asheville location
description:
Private 1 bed 1 bath all to yourself!
We are following cdc recommendations to maintain a safe and healthy space! And we ask that all of our guests do the same. If you have a fever, shortness of breath, or any cold symptoms within the past 2 weeks or have been exposed to any one with (or suspected) COVID symptoms within the past month, we are unable to host you at this time.

The space
Your own private 1 bed 1 bath cozy Villa is in the lower level of our newly built home, located in the heart of trendy West-East Asheville, walking distance to some of the best restaurants, bars and shops Asheville has to offer. Complete with a plush queen size bed, full size bathroom, and couch with a queen size pull-out bed. Your home away from home also has A/C and a kitchen stocked with an assortment of tea and coffee to keep you comfortable and cozy. A Flat screen tv (smart tv, NO cable) books, and games are available to entertain you on a rainy day! Other perks: Off street
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a hip neighborhood with a downtown of its own.   Best brunch contenders Sunny Point and Biscuit Head,  the Admiral, New Belgium Brewery and many more are within walking or biking distance.  Riverside park (has a dog park!) and Carrier park, hiking/biking and river floating are all just minutes away. There is a plethora to see and do right in the neighborhood and Downtown Asheville is an easy bike or cab ride away!
host_about:
We are from the Mountains of Western North Carolina. David is a contractor, specializing in GreenBuilding and Melissa is a Physician Assistant at a Family Practice.  We have an amazing 18mo old daughter who teaches us something new about ourselves and life every day!
We to love travel, play outdoors with our dog and enjoy all the great restaurants Asheville has to offer.

description: Lie back on the blue chairs in the covered deck area and gaze out at the trees at the rear of the property. This inviting garage apartment has recently been renovated and has a cool open design. The living room has a nook with built-in bunk beds.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a private, gated community in the busy town of Arden in South Asheville. It feels as though it's deep in the woods, while being only minutes to the airport, WNC AG Center, Biltmore Park, and everything Asheville has to offer.
host_about:
My wife Sarah and I recently moved to Winston-Salem from Asheville, NC. We miss the mountains, but are looking forward to enjoying new scenery here in the Triad. Although we moved away, we will continue to be the primary host and contact for the "Treehouse" in the Asheville area. 

Family is very important to us, and we love raising our three boys in this beautiful town. We love coffee, mexican food, and house flipping shows.

As Airbnb hosts, we like to give our guests space. We are always available to answer any questions or provide suggestions, but let guests enjoy their time in W-S or Asheville.

name: Charming  Montford Apartment ~Walk Downtown
description:
This large basement apartment has twelve windows and 8-foot ceilings. Located on a peaceful street in the desirable Montford area. Walk everywhere if you love to explore on foot. Otherwise, drive/Uber or Lyft in a few minutes! This place is a well cared for, in a great neighborhood. It is an excellent choice for budget travelers.

All Day Darling (great breakfast and lunch spot just up the street) -- 10 minute walk
Downtown Asheville -- 15-20 minute walk
River Arts District -- 25 minute walk

The space
It is well kept and spacious, with lots of light, and located in a great neighborhood in Asheville. For those who love to walk this location is very walk able. It is also a five minute drive or Uber/Lyft ride into downtown. This one bedroom apartment is spacious and has everything you need for a long or short stay.

The apartment easily accommodates two people, with a queen bed. There is a convertible couch in the living room if you pr
neighborhood_overview:
This a busy neighborhood that is excellent for strolling around and walking to downtown. It is a beautiful neighborhood, with many historic homes and large trees. Easy access to the Reed Creek Greenway on Magnolia Ave and Young Street provides a great walking path to the UNC Asheville campus and a fun urban hike.

Montford has several great restaurants: Nine Mile (Caribbean), Chiesa (home-made Italian), and All Day Darling, located at the end of Courtland Ave, it is great for outdoor dining for breakfast and lunch. Check out my guidebook for more!

Explore the 3.5 miles of roads through the historic Riverside Cemetery, the final resting place for authors Thomas Wolfe and William Sydney Porter (better known as O. Henry) and 13,000 others.

Check out Montford Park and possibly catch a performance by The Montford Park Players. North Carolina's Longest Running Shakespeare Festival presents free Theatre in the Park all summer long. The performances are held at
host_about:
Welcome and thank you for considering this location as part of your Asheville journey! My name is Melissa and I live with my partner Mary, and our dog Jet. We live in a quiet part of Montford that is close to the neighborhood restaurants, parks, and of course walking distance to downtown. I have lived here for almost six years as a local chef, focusing on highlighting the local foods that the Appalachian region has to offer. Mary is a local potter who studied in China for several years learning the craft and culture of tea and tea ware. As a family, we like to explore the mountain regions with lots of hiking and camping excursions. 


I am very excited to be part of your stay here in Asheville. If there is anything you need during your stay, please do not hesitate to ask. I'm sure you'll find my place to be a comfortable place from which to launch all your adventures!

description:
10 min. to downtown/Biltmore & 5 min from BRP, i40, & 240.

Unique private home surrounded by trees w/ great art collection, wood stove, well equipped kitchen, pool table, custom bar.

Upstairs— 2 rooms w/ queens & 1 w/ king & private bath.

Downstairs— an expansive suite w/ private bath & a queen bed.

Outside— covered porch in front, deck in back w/ grill, table w/ umbrella & fire pit.

In back woods— screened-in sleeping/yoga building & a deck w/ bog & chairs.

The space
A designer by trade, I have spent over 10 years (living in &) customizing this home with contemporary finishes and unique details. You will be surrounded by original art, stylish decor and quality appliances.

KITCHEN
The updated kitchen boasts concrete counter tops, and acid-washed copper back splashes with a granite island and a propane cook top.

LIVING ROOM
There are wood floors and high ceilings with a contem
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very QUIET and there is lots of space between the houses. So if you are going to whoop it up on the back deck, please be respectful of the fact that we have distant neighbors who can hear great cacophonies, and bring the party inside after 10:30-11:00pm

The Blue Ridge Parkway, 40, 240 and 74A are all within 2 miles.
The Biltmore Estate, the Asheville Mall, and downtown are all 7-10 mins. away.
host_about:
A married designer w/ passion for food, art & music.
Have lived and worked on 5 continents and in 7 states.
Moved to Asheville in 2003. 
Lived in this house (the one available here) for 14 years.
Now in a new home of my design (nearby).
When we moved, we left the art and furniture behind, so rather than Bed Bath and Beyond posters and furniture from Target, the house has custom furniture and fixtures and art from 30 years of collecting, including works from Africa, Indonesia and at least one piece dating back to 1896.

name: The Tarot House
description:
Roomy two-story 1917 Craftsman bungalow. Step back in time... the "guest suite" has air conditioning, but not much else here has changed since the days of TB Sanitariums, when folks came to Asheville for the healing mountain air. This is a true home base for your exploration of Asheville.

Centrally located on a quiet residential street, only a few blocks from restaurants & shops.

The space
You and the members of your group will be my only guests at any given time. You will have private use of two adjoining bedrooms and shared use of two full baths, plus full access to all the other rooms seen in the photos. Shoot a game of pool, and make yourselves at home in the living room or on the breezy front porch. This space is ideal for a family group or a group of friends-who-feel-like family and want to save money at the cost of some privacy. You can also save money by preparing meals at the house. Pets share this home... allergy sufferers note! I will share
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a wonderful mix of residential and commercial. Shops, restaurants, bars and grocery stores are all within walking distance. There are backyard chickens next door. No rooster!
host_about: I've lived in this wonderful urban oasis forty years. I enjoy walking to downtown Asheville or to UNCA. I'm retired after working in public and university libraries, including a dozen years in our local history archive. I enjoy singing in a chorus, gardening in my yard, and making three-dimensional art. The Tarot House is decorated with my art, much of it inspired by my interest in Tarot Cards. Readings are available.

name: Private Entrance/10 Min to DT AVL/Dog Friendly
description:
For you I offer a quiet, wooded dead end residential street with an excellent location next to a sports park, close to Bent Creek & minutes from downtown Asheville. You will have your own entrance & a private bathroom with shower. The space is warm & inviting with plenty of room for your yoga practice & your outdoor toys. Dogs are welcome so long as they get a long with others. I have 2 furry friends, 1 pupper named Yeti & and an in/out door kitty named Madeline.

The space
The space is warm and inviting with a private bathroom. The features a Pacific Down Comforter covered in a Pottery Barn Duvet with a delightful selection of pillows (all bedding is provided). There is a microwave, mini fridge, Keurig system, a coffee and tea selection to get you started. There is a large desk at 2 chairs to be sued as a work space, table etc. There is a full dresses and wardrobe, an ironing board and table located in the wardrobe along with an extra pillow and blanket.
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is a bit of a hidden gem.  It lives on a dead end street so there is no through traffic and has a quiet neighborhood feel.  You will see the neighbors out walking their dogs, kids playing on their bikes, skateboards, roller blades and other fun toys.
host_about:
Hey All,

I work at a local Non Profit called LEAF Community Arts & love what I do!  I do my best to practice yoga daily & love to be on the river or in the woods either on foot or on my mountain bike.  I am always up for a spontaneous adventure, a walk through the river arts district, a food truck meal ... My daughter just graduated from Western Carolina & works at Sapphire Mountain Brewing in the Brevard Area.  We moved here from Northern California 12 years ago so WNC is home.  

I look forward to making some great new friends courtesy of AirBnB!

name: Solar House in South Asheville
description:
Great location in a very quite neighborhood on the side of a mountain. Beautiful sunsets in West. See famous Cold Mountain on the horizon. Private bedroom with deck. Shared bathroom next to private bedroom. Also half bath in shared laundry. Free high-speed 180mbs Wi-Fi. Use of kitchen and laundry. Off street parking. Cats live in the house. Please don't book if you don't like them or are allergic to them. One is very friendly; the other you will not likely see.

The space
Private Bedroom on 2nd floor of a passive solar house. Queen bed. Space for additional blow-up mattress and port-a-crib (provided). Shared bath is next to private bedroom. Desk in room and another on balcony above the atrium outside bedroom. Recently installed new flooring; see pics.

Guest access
Shared bath with hydro jet massage walk-in tub. Shared kitchen and laundry. High speed internet Wi-Fi. Share first floor dining and living room with TV. Room TV has few
neighborhood_overview: Very quiet neighborhood on a dead end street. Elevation c. 2500'. Many trees. Koi and goldfish ponds. Off street parking.
host_about:
I am retired from the educational/technical/professional publishing industry.  I have done several part-time jobs since retiring, lately I drive for Uber and Lyft.  It is fun for me and affords me the opportunity to travel. Two years ago I spent the whole month in Denmark, Sweden, and Norway. Using AirBnB made that trip more affordable and more fun!

I write books.  In (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) I published a sci-fi novel, MORPH: the Resurrection of Angels and last July, Uber & Out. See them on (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

More about me and friends on (Hidden by Airbnb) :  Walter Anthony Barringer Dinteman.

name: The Rad Pad—Quiet Modern Nest 2 Blocks off Haywood Road
description: We are currently strictly following the CDC's guideline for CLEANING! The main interior room is bright, well-insulated, and quiet. The Rad Pad measures a roomy 600 square feet, with milk-stained wood ceilings and exposed beams. Refresh under a rain-head shower, with sea foam penny tiles underfoot and subway tiles covering the walls in the luxurious bathroom.
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is where most of the city's artists live, as well as an eclectic mix of other vibrant people. This is a middle-class neighborhood, with a touch of grit and a whole lot of revival. It's also very walkable, with many fine restaurants. The neighborhood is surrounded on one side by the river arts district and by west asheville proper on the other. We are 6 blocks from Carrier Park & the French Broad River Greenway. Downtown is a quick less than 10 minute drive away.
host_about: I am a native of Louisana and I am outgoing, adventurous, & responsible. I love sharing Asheville with our guests!

name: Mountain Beauty/City Convenience
description:
Would you like a beautiful mountain setting, but with the convenience of downtown Asheville only a few minutes drive away? Our tastefully-appointed apartment is situated at 3400' elevation, between downtown Asheville and the Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
The private apartment, with its own private entrance, is self-contained on the ground level; no steps to climb! With the rearranging of a couple of pieces of furniture, it should be handicap-accessible for most individuals.

The bedroom has now upgraded to a NEW queen-size bed! Additional sleeping space in the living area on the rollaway single bed or foldout loveseat. Ideally the apartment will accommodate a maximum of three adults.

If you are thinking about staying longer than a weekend, but are concerned about laundry, we are happy to wash, dry and fold your clothes for you!

Please note: no smoking (including e-cigarettes) is permitted in the apartment or on the grounds. T
neighborhood_overview:
The property is located adjacent to the state road, so travel is easy--no steep driveways, or tricky navigation. The property is surrounded by a horse farm on one side and a small estate on the other--neighbors close enough for comfort, but with a spacious feel.

Love fine dining, the arts and shopping? Downtown is less than 10 minutes from the apartment!

Love nature? Hiking trails are accessible less than 10 minutes from the apartment!
host_about:
My partner and I enjoy the wonderful life that Asheville has to offer:  its diversity, culture and eclectic spirit.  We love our home and its wonderful location:  cool summer breezes, abundant flowering gardens, ease of access to Downtown Asheville.  We hope you'll love our home and gardens just as much, and we want your stay to be comfortable, safe and relaxing.

We look forward to your stay with us!

name: Graceful Heart Cottage
description:
Graceful Heart Cottage is a sanctuary home away from the hustle and bustle of major city life and the general populace. The cottage is situated on 2.25 magical acres with no street lights...see the stars! Enjoy Nature, Nurturance, and Laughter.

The space
Graceful Heart Cottage is a special place to retreat, have sanctuary from the infractions of the world, and be a place where Nature, Four leggeds, and Two leggeds can play peacefully.

Guest access
Parking, landscaped trails, a beautiful 1/2 mile walk to the end of the cove down the road. Doggy play time or watching the running of the Poms from the Bay window in the cottage. Shared driveway, 1/2 acre fenced in with cottage which includes an enriched environment area.

Other things to note
There is a $35 pet fee for up to 2 dogs per booking as the hair clean up does add to the cleaning time.
neighborhood_overview: This cottage is located on a street with very few other dwellings, and the road ends at a mountain cove.  There are fields, pastures with horses, and a running stream along the walk down the road.
host_about: I have rented this cottage off and on to more permanent residents and have loved the community feeling being around interesting and cool folk.  I love animals and theatre, writing, and musicals.  I work as a Physical Therapist in Home Health Care and enjoy meeting all types of people that way too.  Variety is the spice of Life here, and I feel that connecting with others makes Life more fulfilling, plus there is always something to learn from each person we come in contact with.

name: Sunny, Modern Apartment in Vibrant Downtown Asheville
description: Live like a local in this spotless, comfortable home, complete with brand-new appliances and plush furnishings. Admire the tasteful artwork, daydream on the sun-drenched sofa and sink into the softest beds in this chic, classically decorated space.
neighborhood_overview: Situated in the heart of downtown Asheville, the apartment is close to nightlife, restaurants, public transport options, and beautiful local parks. Savor the vibrant art scene with its galleries and museums, or kick back with a locally-brewed beer.
host_about:
The owner, Jeremy Goldstein has made 32 North Ann Street a project since he purchased the property in 2002, slowly make improvements and while running his business in the building directly next door. 

Over the past 20 years, Jeremy has built a successful multi-disciplinary real estate practice. Jeremy graduated cum laude from Duke University in 1994 with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Public Policy Studies. He held salesperson licenses in Virginia, Maryland, and the District of Columbia and currently maintains broker licenses in North Carolina and South Carolina.

Mr. Goldstein advises private and institutional investors nationwide in the acquisition, disposition, and financing of commercial property. 
He married an Asheville native, and together they moved to Asheville to raise their four sons.  He spends his  “free” time traveling with his family to their sons’ sporting events. Eventually, he hopes to get back to hiking and biking in the beautiful mountains of Western North Carolina. But for now he manages to get to Crossfit — unfortunately well before the sun comes up, in addition to serving as Chairman of  Asheville Planning & Zoning Commission and board member to Irene Wortham Center.
