name: Welcome to "Cozy Oak Cottage"
description:
Built in 1915, this one hundred+ year old cottage will be a wonderful place to call home when visiting the area. Being just one mile from Biltmore Village & the entrance to Biltmore Estate makes it a great location. Downtown is just 3.8 miles north.

The space
Enjoy original features such as the yellow heart pine floors in the bedrooms & bathroom along with many modern updates. Please note that there is no A/C in this house, but it does tend to stay cool during the summer when you keep the house closed up during the day. Allow the cool night air to fill both bedrooms and wake up to birds singing as you enjoy your morning coffee on the wonderful deck secluded among the treetops.
2018 update: I have added a small window unit A/C to the main living area to help reduce the humidity during the hotter times of summer. You will love the private wooded location that Cozy Oak Cottage has to offer, and you will be amazed how close you are to all that Asheville h
neighborhood_overview: Located in Oakley on a quiet dead end street, Cozy Oak is a safe home that offers off street parking & good lighting.  There is a traffic light at Fairview Road which offers easy access to the main road.  Only a few minutes away you will find grocery stores such as Whole Foods & Aldi.  Also nearby are Target, Wal-mart, Lowes, Home Depot, & the Asheville Mall.  There are many great restaurants, breweries, & antique shops all close by.
host_about: I love to travel and Asheville is one of my favorite places!  I have spent most of my vacations traveling & scuba diving in the Caribbean, but there is something special about the mountains & change of seasons!  Of course the beer & food of Asheville is a big attraction as well.  I currently live much of the year in the Bear Den apartment at Cozy Oak Cottage.  I sometimes rent out the Acorn guesthouse.  If you love tiny houses the Acorn would be perfect.  Otherwise Cozy Oak Cottage with 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, & large kitchen is a lovely place to stay.

description:
-Self Isolate in a lovely, sunny apartment overlooking a garden on your large, private deck.
-Located at the foot of Town Mountain, gateway to the National Park
-Walkers and joggers paradise- Nearby hikes and trails
-We are following all CDC guidelines for cleanliness and disinfecting.
-All linens washed w disinfecting laundry detergent
-All light switches, door handles, leavers, dishes, floors and surfaces disinfected.
-You can easily access walking trails from your apt.

The space
- 5 Minute drive to multiple, fully stocked stores.
-Nearby restaurants are open for take and delivery.
-Studio B is a sunny, spacious, recently updated apartment located in a lovingly restored 1920's artisan home. With room to spread out, there's a large living room, bedroom, full bathroom, and eat-in kitchen with dishwasher, fridge, sink, microwave, blender, and coffeemaker.
-Enjoy sitting on your private deck with views of a love
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is known as Grove Park, home to the historic Omni Grove Park Inn. You'll be within walking distance to their golf course, tennis courts, spa, beautiful grounds, and award-winning restaurants.

This is a historical neighborhood located at the foothills of Town Mountain, with beautiful architecture, creative landscaping, and lovely tree-lined sidewalks to stroll for hours. We are on the trolley tour and people come here to walk and jog.

There are many favorite neighborhood restaurants just a short walk away, including King James Public House, great for beer and burgers, City Bakery Cafe, for morning coffee, Homegrown, for farm-to-table dinners, Ultimate Ice Cream, Luella's BBQ, Gan Shan Station, Taco Temple, and more.

Grocery stores like Whole Foods, Harris Teeter (open 24 hrs), Ingles, and Trader Joe's are just a mile away.

Our street connects to Merrimon Avenue, a main road that runs from Biltmore Village, through downtown,
host_about:
I am a Photographer, Visual Artist, Special FX make-up artist. 
My husband creates metal sculpture. 
We now have three grown boys and we are looking forward to traveling more.  
We enjoy spending time in NYC when not in Asheville. 
I am currently working on a book of photography called Disappearing American Dream. The project creates a platform for everyday Americans to tell their story and share their dream.
My Motto - "Have Paint- Will Paint" I have painted everything from cars, motor cycles, people, The Characters in Disney's Lion King, even the Dixie Chicks on the cover of Entertainment Weekly. 

My Husbands Motto- "Perfection is the enemy of good"

neighborhood_overview:
Asheville is home to a thriving nightlife scene with everything and coffee shops and wine bars, to four star restaurants. There is also a vibrant and eclectic artistic community that gives Asheville a unique atmosphere with a variety of local musicians, artists and performers Asheville is sure to entertain.

Less than a mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway
469 miles of scenic history, the Blue Ridge Parkway is an official All American Road and a National Parkway. Taking 52 years to complete in 1987 this famous peice of American history winds its way along the mountainsides through heart of the Appalachian mountians, the Blue Ridge Mountains. Spanning from the Great Smoky Mountains National Park to the Shenandoah National Park

description:
Come relax in our cozy downtown hideaway! This is a private and spacious 2-bedroom, 1.5 bath apartment on the first floor of a 2-story building. VERY close to downtown Asheville with stylish furnishings, queen beds, free laundry, central heating and A/C, full kitchen with dishwasher, stove, fridge, and microwave, lots of free street parking right out front, and TV's in the living room and both bedrooms! :)

The space
We are located just three blocks from downtown Asheville and a few blocks away from the South Slope area with its many hip restaurants, cafes, and breweries. The house is just one block from White Labs pizza and brewery, and McCormick Field, home of the Asheville Tourists baseball team. Enjoy exploring all that Asheville has to offer and then retreat to a cozy and quiet house in a residential neighborhood at the end of the day. Great for families, friends, or a romantic getaway!

Guest access
Guests have access to the private ful
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in a residential neighborhood just a few blocks from all the amenities of downtown Asheville, and a stone's throw from the countless shops, restaurants, coffee shops, breweries, theaters, concert venues, and pubs that Asheville has to offer! Walk three blocks to the Orange Peel to see a great concert, or check out the dozens of restaurants, shops, and galleries on Biltmore Avenue. Check out the hip new breweries of the South Slope area - Burial, Twin Leaf, Catawba, the Funkatorium, and Green Man are all amazing craft breweries within blocks of the house. Or tuck into Vortex doughnuts for delicious doughnuts with a local flair! We are a quick uber ride from almost anywhere in town, and a short 5 min drive from the Biltmore Estate. Come stay in the heart of it all!
host_about: I'm originally from Chicago and worked on agricultural and food policy in Washington, DC for a number of years. Now pursuing new adventures, mostly in Asheville NC. I love interesting food, music, books, conversation, and travel, and sharing all of these with good friends, both old and new!

name: Comfy home 10 min to downtown.
description:
Entire 2 bedroom house only 10 minutes to downtown Asheville. Relax on quiet country property. Make s'mores by the fire pit and snuggle up to watch the stars! We are super flexible and easy going hosts. We will try and accommodate you as best as we can in all situations!

The space
The first floor has large windows, stained concrete floors, 50" 4k HDTV with Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, HBO go, etc. and a reclaimed wood coffee table. A laundry room with stacked steam washer and dryer. The full bathroom boasts a large tiled shower with separate temperature controls for the 16" rain shower head and the wall mounted showerhead with a detachable wand. In the colder months, guests can enjoy the heated tiled floor. The tankless, on demand hot water heater guarantees no one will have to take a cold shower. The kitchen is the focal point and features stainless steel appliances, a 36" farm sink, and a 5 burner gas stove. Seating is a kitchen island so you can watch the mag
neighborhood_overview: We share a driveway with a stone church, please be respectful of this shared space. During the spring and summer the property is quite private but in the fall and winter with the leaves down you'll see more of the neighbors. Country feel but just 10 minutes from downtown, best of both worlds. This is a quiet, safe, residential area full of local people of modest means living in typical homes for the area. Check out the streetview on google maps if you'd like to familiarize yourself with the character of the neighborhood.
host_about: Jennifer and I finished building our Asheville house with our own 4 hands in 2013. Well, it's not really done, it never is. We are constantly adding and improving. Jennifer is a massage therapist and Matthew is a contractor. We love Asheville and everything it has to offer and we are excited to be hosts and share the city we love with others.

name: Near downtown Asheville, BRP & Biltmore! Sleeps 8!
description:
This spacious home is nestled in a wooded east Asheville neighborhood just 15 minutes from downtown Asheville. Enjoy mountain views from the deck or drive 30 minutes to Lake Lure, 15 minutes to downtown AVL, and 10 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Biltmore Estate.

This fully-equipped house offers the perfect vacation combo: a relaxing mountain escape, minutes from thousands of acres of national forests, historic Biltmore, and downtown AVL

Relax with all the conveniences of home.

The space
Comfortably sleeps 6 and has 2 additional memory foam cots (sheets, pillows and blankets provided) as well as a Pack and Play travel crib (guests to provide sheets). Room for 4 cars - 2 in the front drive and 2 in the back (no street or sidewalk parking available).

Guest access
Guests will have access to the whole house except for the unfinished basement and the owners closet in the bathroom on the first floor.
neighborhood_overview: A small, secluded Asheville neighborhood nestled in the mountains right, outside of town. 51 Winterwind has easy access to the interstate, Blue Ridge Parkway, Lake Lure, downtown Asheville, and more!
host_about: I’m a travel-loving, proud South African-American. I love my husband, my family, and my dog. Together we love connecting guests from around the world to our beloved adopted hometown: Asheville!

name: Bright, urban chic apt min from Avl
description:
Sophisticated, serene, clean space. Legally zoned & permitted. Stylishly furnished apt in historic home. Industrial/modern/shabby-chic. Private patio with shared driveway. Fully equipped kitchen. Off street prkg/private entry. Convenient location, midway between Hendersonville and Asheville (10 miles). 2 night min stay-wknd rates

The space
See many more 5 star reviews on our listing at Vee aR Bee Oh . We opened the doors of "Das Peach Pit" to vacation guests for the first time in 2015 but we've been landlords for this former long term rental (and others in Avl) for the past 23 years! We are a legally zoned and permitted short term rental south of downtown Asheville. Named with a nod toward our house's moniker "Das Peach Haus" after my husband's lifelong nickname "Peach", this space is a newly renovated and furnished ground level apartment with plenty of natural light and it feels like a wonderful retreat. Open the doors of this former carriage space on the first
neighborhood_overview:
We live in Oak Park in a cluster of historic houses south of downtown Asheville. Our property is one of six houses that surrounds a one acre park where you will regularly find families practicing baseball and soccer and neighbors running with their dogs amidst the towering oak trees that give the neighborhood its name. Our home was previously owned by a large loving family who ran a greenhouse on the adjacent property which now houses a family owned Hispanic Market. A distinctive feature of our home is the Christmas tree planted by the former family in the front yard over 40 years ago that now towers over the house. We fully remodeled and lovingly restored the interior of our home in 2003, including building the apartment in the former carriage "house" space. We are now working on finishing the exterior (just paint, no noisy tools!). Tim is a general contractor and I am an artist. This space is a beautiful collaboration of both of our strengths.
Great convenience to the Asheville
host_about: Transplants from Southern California in 1992 we have loved raising our family in the Asheville area. Our eldest, a daughter, was married in 2015 and lives with her husband (who works for Sierra Nevada) and our grandson in the Hendersonville area. Our middle son lives and works in downtown Asheville and our youngest son is a 2020 graduate from our small private school and is headed to college in the fall. Tim is a licensed general contractor and insurance adjuster. Elisa is an artist and art teacher at a PK-12 private school. We have restored multiple historic properties in the Asheville area over the last 24 years including a condemned house in the Montford Historic District for which Tim won the prestigious Griffin Award for historic preservation in 2004. Our commitment to faithful restoration is apparent in this property which we fully remodeled and restored in 2003. We have been landlords for several long term rentals in the area for 29 years, including this apartment, and have enjoyed the transition to vacation rental. We love both stimulating and laid back conversation with our friends and appropriate mood music (we can't live without our Bose Sounddock or Sonos), good food (esp Mexican) and craft beer and wine. Our love of the outdoors takes us to California's Yosemite National Park for camping every summer and to our family condo on the gulf coast as often as we can get there. We enjoy hiking and biking and late night fire pits. We can point you to the usual and the unusual spots in Asheville so just ask. We can make a church recommendation if that's important to you. We think we have the best friends in the world and we especially love making new ones. We look forward to your visit!

name: cozy bedroom in the heart of west asheville
description:
Have your own private sleeping quarters just a stone's throw from everything West Asheville has to offer! You can surprisingly enjoy a quiet walk down my street; however at the end of the street is Haywood-home to numerous cafes, bars, & restaurants! Additionally, you are just over 2 miles from downtown and 10 min from the BlueRidge Prkwy. In 'TheSpace' click on 'more' & read EVERYTHING under Guest Access, & if you have questions or need details, please message me via AirBnB prior to booking.

The space
Your 'home away from home' is a medium-sized dwelling which was built around 1930. Although I am an acupuncturist not an artist, I have been told that my home has a warm, artsy feel to it. Currently, I cannot afford a landscaper so please do not be put off by my somewhat 'wild' front yard. The house is in an excellent location & has an arts-n-crafts stye charm, without being extravagant! After clicking on 'more' & reading everything under guest access, if you ha
neighborhood_overview: You will be less than 15minutes from the Biltmore & the Blue Ridge Parkway! (Sometimes I get discounted tickets to the Biltmore so if interested, please ask). And you are less than 10 minutes from the French Broad river &  the river park.  Additionally, many restaurants & bars are within WALKING distance. There are 7 local restaurants/bars at the end of this street (and Sunny Point Cafe and The Admiral are just a few blocks away ). Also within walking (actually skipping, its that close) distance are a grocery store, health food store (the West Village Market), post office, & library (also an eccentric video rental store, Orbitz, that still thrives even with all the online amenities such as Netflix). It is a quiet street for walking, but at the end of it lies a bustling night life with bars & live music- The ISIS Music Hall is one such place. Several bars are conveniently stumbling distance from your sleeping quarters.
host_about: I am a 45 yr old female. I lived in WY near the Tetons for 13 yr and now reside in Asheville, NC. My job is my passion; I am an acupuncturist (& also a science enthusiast) & work with my patients using vitamins, herbs, & nutrition. I love to travel & meet people & enjoy delicious &/or interesting food, and love music & the outdoors. I especially love anything to do with the water! (I used to coach swimming& swam competitively).  I love world music, funk, and bluegrass. Like I said , I love to travel but these days I am limited due to my work (which I love) and needing to be closer to my parents (who I used to never see when I was away from the South most of the time).

name: Downtown Asheville Music Lovers- Great Value! -#8
description:
For budget travelers who want to be downtown! Convenient location. No frills, not a fancy B&B. A place with history, character, real people. Clean, comfortable historic 100+year-old rooming house with shared bathrooms. One of several short term rental rooms, this 2nd floor room is directly off the balcony, facing Biltmore Ave, across from a music venue, has a queen-size bed, is air conditioned in summer, includes a mini refrigerator, sink, desk. Bathrooms are shared with other guests.

The space
This is a second floor, front corner room directly off the balcony and facing Biltmore Avenue, with a queen size bed, high ceiling, large windows and plenty of natural light.

At the Gray Rock Inn, downtown Asheville is right outside your door, and our reasonable rates mean your money can be spent on enjoying the city. Conveniently located on Biltmore Ave. and an easy walk to breweries, music venues, art galleries, boutiques and restaurants.

The Gray
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is lively and diverse. Walk to world class restaurants, music, and craft breweries. Next door is a community food coop that is open to the public. Across the street are a popular, sometimes quite loud music venue, The Orange Peel, and Wicked Weed Brewery Read about the Bunkum Stone (a landmark) by the front entry.
host_about: I love to dance, hike, and meet people. I'm a green builder and real estate person, so I like helping with housing and visions for how we can get along better.

name: Sweet, private, detached guest studio
description:
Private space all to yourself! Our detached carriage house studio is tranquil, clean and cozy - ideal for a solo retreat or a couple's weekend getaway. We are 5 miles from downtown Asheville and about 1 mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway in a small, quiet neighborhood in East Asheville.

The space
The cozy, shabby chic style renovated studio includes queen size futon with memory foam mattress topper, hardwood floors, a little bar area and a clean bathroom with shower. There is wifi & Roku. We offer a mini refrigerator and Keurig coffee maker for your convenience. Starbucks coffee, sugar & cream provided, along with bottled water in the fridge. The area is heated & cooled with a mini-split unit, and an air purifier was added in 2020. The studio ceiling is just under 8 feet, so please take note of that if you are tall. Weather permitting, enjoy the quaint deck area in our backyard garden for your morning coffee or evening nightcap.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview: The studio is located in East Asheville, 5 miles from downtown, 4.5 miles to Biltmore Village and about 1 mile to the Blue Ridge Parkway.  The WNC Nature Center is about a mile away, and we are very close to a Starbucks, grocery store and a few fast food options.  A great restaurant that we like in East Asheville is Copper Crown.  We are also very close to Highland Brewery. Our neighborhood is typical of an older Asheville neighborhood. Most homes here were built in the 1920's, and the roads are very narrow. We share a driveway with neighbors, and houses are very close to each other. So, we ask that guests be respectful of the fact that this is a tight, quiet neighborhood.
host_about: Cara is a knitwear maker/designer working in the Asheville River Arts District, and Eric is a home builder.  Asheville has been our home for almost 20 years.  We love the community here and the mountains. Our host style is really to offer guests a quiet, private stay. Of course, we are always happy to answer questions or offer recommendations.

name: Sparrow Cottage
description:
This bright, cheerful, and clean cottage is a little home away from home! Walking distance to Downtown Asheville, local shopping, restaurants and night life and easy access to the Blue Ridge Parkway and surrounding attractions.

Please note: The City of Asheville is actively enforcing a zoning law that prohibits bookings of less than 30 days for accommodations such as the Cottage. Please contact me if you have questions. Thanks!

The space
Live like a local! Sparrow Cottage is a clean and cozy one bedroom, one bath house only a half mile from UNC-Asheville, Trader Joe's, Greenlife (Whole Foods local market) and Harris Teeter supermarket and an easy one-mile walk to the heart of Downtown with its great restaurants, galleries, shopping and night life.

The space is inviting, clean and bright! The front door opens out to a great front porch with a sitting area, perfect for a morning cup of coffee or evening glass of wine! The yard is grassed an
neighborhood_overview: Sparrow Cottage is ideally located for visitors who want easy access to Asheville's quaint and lively downtown as well as all the natural beauty of the surrounding mountains. The center of downtown is filled with restored Art Deco buildings housing a wide variety of restaurants, galleries, night spots, music venues, local breweries and great shopping.  Access to I-240 is a few blocks away. Take a walk through Historic Montford or along Reed Creek Greenway, both right across the street from the cottage. Asheville's vibrant River Arts District and historic Biltmore Estate and Village are both a short 5-7 minute drive from the cottage.
host_about: I came to Asheville on vacation in 2003 and never left! This place is just that beautiful and welcoming. I love the rich history and all this small city has to offer - the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains, outdoor adventure, great restaurants, art, music and a population of free-spirited creative people. I've recently published my first novel, a Tate Marlowe mystery titled Final Rights.

name: Private Basement Suite in Walkable West Asheville
description:
Enjoy a private guest suite, separate entrance, full sized antique sleigh bed, full bathroom, and tv area with couch in finished, above ground basement. Keurig Coffee maker, mini fridge, and bottled water provided. All within walking distance to pubs, restaurants and shops of hip West Asheville and a short drive to downtown or Biltmore.

The space
Private basement suite with room to spread out! Bedroom, bathroom, and tv area with separate entrance in beautiful 1928 arts and craft bungalow in hip West Asheville. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, and shops. Short drive to downtown Asheville, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and Biltmore Estate.

Guest access
Basement has private entry and guests can come and go as needed. Basement is finished and has bedroom with full sized bed, full bath, tv area (antenna but no cable), and laundry room. If necessary, we can arrange for guests to use the kitchen on main level.

Other things to note
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a wonderful, eclectic neighborhood and our house is within walking distance to many pubs, restaurants, shops, and playgrounds. We are happy to suggest places to go!
host_about: I love to read, travel, and spend time with family. I also enjoy sharing how amazing Asheville is with other travelers!

name: Mountaintop Log Cabin w/Pano View
description:
Minimum age to rent is 27. 5 night minimum June-August and major holidays.

Awe-inspiring views afforded by being near the top of the mountain. Minutes from shopping/dining in convenient South Asheville, less than 20 minutes from downtown Asheville & 15 minutes to Biltmore Village and Estate.
For hiking and nature enthusiasts, a 300 acre nature preserve with walking paths is steps away from the cabin. The great room has gas fireplace, leather furniture, rustic tables and a 50” TV w/ Netflix.

The space
One level living and open great room with amazing views make this log cabin truly unique. One king bedroom with attached 3/4 bathroom. One queen bedroom and one with two twins (trundle bed) with a 3/4 bathroom in-between. The wrap around deck overlooks the surrounding woods opening up to incredible valley and long range-mountain views. 6 person Leisure Bay hot tub spa with waterfall and lights situated on the deck for maximum viewing pleasure.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood was built up in the 50s and 60s to be a vacation, summer respite for well to do Floridians. This mountain neighborhood is now quite eclectic with some of the smaller, original houses still standing amongst the newer, larger rebuilds. This is a quiet neighborhood with a 300 acre nature preserve (perfect for hiking enthusiasts) just
steps away from the cabin!
host_about: Tony and I live in Weaverville (15 minutes north of Asheville) and have 5 vacation rentals that we have been offering to guests around the world for 6 years now.   Our business is called Dancing Bear Vacation Rentals of Asheville.  We are are committed to offering our guests a comfortable and stress free stay at our rentals.  We are dog lovers and have 3 German Shepherds.   We love to walk our dogs, eat at the fantastic restaurants in Asheville and enjoy the eclectic culture this awesome town has to offer.   We are very grateful that our vacation rentals have become successful and keep us busy.  We  love to communicate with travelers from all over the world  and look forward to continuing to provide our guests with a great Asheville experience!

name: Yurt Nest at Green Oaks Community
description:
The Nest is a fun place to stay while exploring A'ville area. Downtown is less than 10 min. away by Riverside or the Xway. Yummy dining, dancing, Arts District, clubs, cultural events, hiking, tubing & more are all super close by.

The space
The Yurt Nest is a fun place to stay while you explore Asheville. Only 5 min. walk to the French Broad River & less than 10 min. to downtown Asheville. Health food stores, dining, dancing, Arts District are all close by. You can get to any part of Asheville within minutes.

Your yurt is self contained with a small kitchen, shower, toliet & small deck.
Coffeemaker, fridge, convection oven and essentials are provided. We have a community laundry room open to you too. Hey if you like you can even rent a solar electric ELF we have to get around in. It's a 1 person vehicle.

We have 6 acres with some trails. The gardens and pagoda are shared by the other 4 houses on the land and you, so feel free to hang
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome To Asheville
Asheville is a very special city; a jewel in the heart of the mountains of western North Carolina and one of the most the most progressive cities in the south. It has been called the Sedona of the east because of it's spiritual energy and the San Francisco of the East because of it's vibrant diversity and cultural life. These links will help you to get to know Asheville better. Oops...Airbnb seems to block these links so you'll need to (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) the titles to see them.
 
Official Asheville Tourism Site
(website hidden)
 
Asheville, NC. Travel Guide
(website hidden)
 
Cosmic Buffet
(website hidden).php
host_about: I moved to Asheville in 1980 and love it here. I started the first costume company here …then spent 14 yrs co-founding a large intentional community called Earthaven Eco-village, outside of A'ville ….followed by living a decade in India. My current passions are singing, writing, dancing, gardening & eco-spirit activism. Recently I've been loving creating nurturing fun spaces to live in.

name: Two Bedroom Suite in South Asheville
description:
Cozy South Asheville home. Spacious backyard & nestled in a quiet, safe neighborhood. 25 minute drive to downtown Asheville. 8 minute drive to Biltmore park with restaurants & cinema. 20 minute drive to the Biltmore Estate. 15 minute drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway.

This is two bedrooms and a bathroom within the house. I live here, but my room and the guest area are separate. The entrance to the house is shared.

The space
My house is very cozy and inviting.

The two rooms have queen size mattresses. There's a desk in each room for doing work or reading. A full bathroom is between the two rooms. The living room is cozy and quiet.

Guest access
Guests will have access to the family room, 2 bedrooms, and bathroom.
neighborhood_overview: The home is located on a charming cul-de-sac in a quiet, safe neighborhood. All the neighbors are friendly and the nature surrounding the house is invigorating.
host_about:
My name is Kwadwo (pronounced Quay-joe) and I am a young entrepreneur who makes handmade furniture, jewelry, and housewares out of wood. I have an Etsy shop called craftedglorydesign: (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

I love meeting people, enjoying good art, traveling, and music.

I believe in kindness to strangers; it's so much easier to make friends rather than enemies. You'll find that I am really easy going and will do all that I can to make your stay enjoyable!

name: Purple Door Studio Apt. W.Asheville
description:
Purple Door Studio is a recently renovated basement apartment in our home in the heart of West Asheville. Keyless entry, off-street parking, comfy bed and couch, mini-split heat & air, kitchenette, big bathroom, eating area, all in a great location! COVID INFO: Completely separate HVAC from the rest of the house, extensive cleaning protocols in place, and apartment is fully aired out between guests. Permitted by the city for legal Homestay.

The space
We've created a 'glorified hotel room' -style apartment in our basement. It's new construction, with all new furnishings and appliances. The Purple Door Studio has a separate entrance with keyless entry, mini-split heating and air conditioning unit, a kitchenette, full bath, queen size bed and a couch, a small eating area, and off-street parking. COVID INFO: Completely private/separate space on a separate HVAC system from the rest of the house.

Guest access
Guests will have their own driveway
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a super-unique, vibrant section of Asheville, and we live right in the heart of it. From our house you can easily walk to restaurants, bars, playgrounds, grocery stores, an ice cream parlor, coffee shops, and the bakery. One of Asheville's many microbreweries, Oysterhouse Brewing, is very close, and Sunny Point- the best breakfast in town- is right across the street from that. Our neighborhood is a mix of young families, retirees, and college students.
host_about: We love Asheville and sharing our home and insider tips. ;)

name: Private Suite in Contemporary West Asheville Home
description:
Enjoy this completely updated/remodeled (March 2019) three-room suite (bedroom, study with sofa bed, bathroom) and garden patio with a private entrance and private bathroom in a newer (2015) contemporary home located in a wonderful neighborhood in eclectic West Asheville. Take a 10-minute walk to all that Haywood road has to offer: pubs, restaurants, novelty shops, and more. 12 minutes to downtown Asheville.

The space
Enjoy a glass of wine or cup of tea on your private garden patio and watch the birds, or simply relax and watch passers-by. Once entering your suite, you will find the study with a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee, french press, teapot, filtered water, and a sofa, which folds out into a 2nd bed. You can use this room as a work space, meditation or yoga space, a space for additional guests, or simply a quiet place to read and relax. As you move into the hallway, there is a linen closet with towels, tissues, extra sheets, and a hair dryer, as well as a
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is located in a lovely, quiet part of West Asheville, and yet only a short walk to Haywood Road with a park literally in our back yard. You would never know that downtown Asheville and I-40 are conveniently located just minutes away. This section of town has wide streets and sidewalks, perfect for taking a stroll into town or just exploring the neighborhood.
host_about: I am avid animal lover, amateur gardener, hiker, whitewater kayaker, and mental health professional who loves to spend my free time outside in nature.

name: Private Home with Private Grounds
description:
This is a spacious 1939 home with two extra bedrooms upstairs. Downtown by Uber takes 6 minutes. There is a private bathroom/shower upstairs as well. The house sits on a private 1 acre lot. Parking is off street & safe. I have a second bedroom titled County Living in the City Limits that is a different and distinct listing from this listing. If you cannot get the dates that you desire here then check that one out.

The space
This house is amazingly spacious with 9 foot ceilings and oak floors on first level. Huge old-timey kitchen.

I have been in the alternative healing arts as a spiritually oriented counselor and hands-on healing energy facilitator for 28 years and my home is my temple. I have used ancient Egyptian Biogeometry to fine tune the house and have filled it with art that touches my soul. I offer appointments for healing sessions to those who have an interest. I have an office in the rear of my home with its own private outside en
neighborhood_overview: I live in a 1930's neighborhood for the most part.  It is part of Lake View Park and a great place to live away from the hubbub yet close to downtown.  There are banks, grocery stores, and restaurants on Merrimon Avenue from  my driveway.
host_about: I am a semi retired male, UNC graduate, interested in spirituality, organic gardening, Access Consciousness, and enjoying life.  My home is my temple and I aspire to make it welcoming and peaceful for all who enter into it.  Beauty is important to me so I have a fair number of art objects in the house.  I lead a health conscious lifestyle.  My home is also gay friendly.

name: Sunny Modern Country Apartment with Hot Tub
description:
5-Star Sanitary Deep Clean.
Enjoy bird sounds, the breeze, southern mountain views, and clear night skies 9.2 miles from downtown Asheville. My green-built home is well appointed, with great attention to detail. It's perfect for a couple or individual seeking a bucolic getaway. This wonderful unit is the top floor of the home, with its ramped entrance around the back of the home.
There is another unit beneath called 'Country Garden Getaway' (ABNB Room# 12944995). They can be rented together.

The space
We have over 400- 5-Star reviews, and have read all of the comments and made recent updates in 2019.
Built in 2011, my top-floor apartment is more like a custom mountain chalet. 16 foot ceilings invite the sun into the kitchen and its hickory-floored main room. It has a custom hickory kitchen with dishwasher and island with 2 breakfast stools. Coffee lovers, just bring your beans. The bedroom and bathroom are right-sized for an individual or couple.<
neighborhood_overview:
We are half-way between Black Mountain and Asheville, 1000’ beneath the Blue Ridge Parkway. Our little unincorporated area is called Riceville. We have 5 churches, no stores or stoplights, and has a reasonably interesting history found by Googling "Riceville, NC history". This is the country, where people generally keep to themselves. It is normally very quiet with fantastic starry nights. There are children in the neighborhood, and you may occasionally hear them playing, 'ahh... the sounds of youth'.
To mention a few of the prominent neighbors, we have bear, coyote, bunnies, turkey, fox, skink, lightning bugs and frogs. There are many dogs in this holler. Generally, they keep the bears away. All of them are friendly with people, even if a bit vocal, but are not necessarily gregarious with interloping dogs.
host_about:
My arrival in this valley was not coincidental. This quiet and sunny cove continues to inspire work in the renewable energy field.  I'm an active outdoorsman and lover of healthful and intentional living. Don't be surprised if you glance a yoga practice on the deck of our home nearby. 
My family and friends will always respect your privacy, and lend a hand in emergencies, that are beyond rare. The reviews say it all, and the feelings are mutual! Thanks for your confidence!

name: Location! On West Asheville Strip. Walk everywhere
description:
Visit but live like a native. 1/2 a block walk to iconic Haywood Rd. Amazingly close to everything but also amazingly private, with private entrance and driveway. Welcoming, clean walk out basement apt with comfort and perks. Kitchen with fridge, toaster oven, microwave, hot plate, pantry, no oven. Laundry room, bathroom (shower only). King bed and pull out sofa in living room. Both beds are super comfortable.

The space
The best thing about this house is its location. Walk anywhere. 1 min walk to historic west Asheville strip. 20 min walk to downtown, 5 min drive, or $7 uber.

Furnished walkout basement with a private entrance, off street parking, bathroom, living room, area to dine and prep meals, and large bedroom with a king tempurpedic bed.

Living room has a sofa bed that sleeps two and is very comfortable. Perfect for families or a group of friends. Groups of four are welcome.

Kitchen setup: coffee maker & local coffee pro
neighborhood_overview:
Walk everywhere in west asheville in minutes.

100 or so brochures and maps to local spots, gyms, yoga, restaurants etc are provided.
host_about: I've lived in West Asheville and in this house for almost 20 years. I think you'll love it here as much as I do!

name: Asheville Beauty
description:
This 1940's bungalow is the perfect oasis from the storm or fantastic base camp while visiting Asheville and surrounding mountain areas. With a self check-in, it is only a quick stroll to bars, restaurants, tea house, market, music venues, and coffee shops and only a short drive to trails, the Blue Ridge Parkway, the Biltmore Estate and the River Arts District. You will want to return again and again!

The space
The 1940s' bungalow has beautiful hard-wood floors, high ceilings, big flatscreen smart tv, cozy diner style breakfast nook, wifi, comfy leather couch, backyard, and private parking. The neighborhood is safe and family friendly.

Guest access
You will have access to the master bedroom, bathroom, kitchen and yard.
neighborhood_overview: The location is perfect, with some of the best music venues and eateries within a quick walk.  It's only 5 minutes from downtown, the arts district and plenty of outdoor adventure. The house is old but clean, cozy, a step up from any hotel and a few steps down in price.
host_about: I am a massage therapist who after sailing around the world for 8 or so years, now resides half the year in beautiful Asheville, North Carolina and half the year in St. John, US Virgin Islands. I enjoy spending time with friends out and about and playing outside, whether it be mountain biking, hiking, tubing, scuba diving or snorkeling. I enjoy a good read and am pretty good at relaxing.  I have sailed the exotic South Pacific from St. Thomas to New Zealand, sailed the beautiful blue waters of the Caribbean, and down from Antibe, France, to Sicily and sailed a trans-Atlantic twice once to Spain and once to England. I have lived in several European countries, studied abroad several times and so speak several European languages, or at least I did at one time. I have enjoyed diving with sharks in Bora Bora and skydiving in New Zealand, where I lived twice. I have backpacked Central America and lived in Mumbai. I have been away from my home for about 7 years and have been dreaming about it all the while. I hope you will enjoy it as much as I do! Asheville is such a wonderful place to explore!!

description:

Just 3m to Downtown Asheville, the Carriage House is hidden in a thick forest. Our 7 minute fun Treasure Hunt checkin format is Airbnb approved to protect the R&R our valuable guests seek invest your time making this an exceptional Five-Star ZEN-stay!

The space
PLEASE CHECK ALL OUR LUXURY LISTINGS;

CARRIAGE HOUSE DESCRIPTION
Luxurious, unique, extravagant, remote, private and rural, this deliriously comfortable industrial design carriage house is just 3 miles/<$10 UBER from downtown Asheville, residing on Chunns Cove 12 acre private estate of nothing but lush vegetation. Accessible up a winding driveway bordered by century old artisan crafted rock walls and locally quarried steps, this timeless estate makes the ideal secluded destination for your important occasion.
This aesthetic industrial designed Carri
neighborhood_overview: Chunns Cove is a unique farming valley mainly inhabited with hidden sizable single family private estates in a rural setting just one hill away from Downtown Asheville. Although a few homes can be seen during the winter months, barely a chimney can be seen in season due to the tropical nature of the flora and fauna.
host_about: Well-immersed in the pastry and chocolate world for several decades, there is nothing on Marc’s list of culinary delights that features higher than chocolate and coffee. Playing a considerable role in both gutting and rebuilding spectacular Chunn’s Cove and Utopia residences, Marc has conclusively proved that watching informative and directional Home Improvement Shows for the best part of adulthood, is akin to learning a new language. Born in Quebec, Marc’s native tongue is French but his English rivals any native tongue and his Spanish ensures trilinguality. Not without her artistic inheritance, Fay’s world is defined as a pleasurable balance between entrepreneur and artist, commencing with a decade of international business travel in her 20’s, evolving to a decade of motherhood punctuated by a successful online decade in the office. Now the time is ripe to spread those four Sagittarian wings for this highly motivated couple are restlessly eager to explore exciting new ventures.

name: Kingbed near action Away fr/ noise. Quiet, Private
description:
Private Studio Apartment. 5 minutes to Biltmore Estate, 10 to downtown and entrances to the Blue Ridge Parkway. Quiet, Clean. Comfy King bed, private full bath, private entrance, studio kitchen (full size refrig, microwave, coffeemaker, toaster) private patio overlooking woods. Off street parking. 2 people max. No pets, no smoking, not suitable for children.
Easy to all things Asheville , cozy, quiet apartment, king bed for a good night's sleep.
Lower level apartment, separate, private.

The space
A recent guest had this to say: "My husband and I spent 6 days at Nan's. Originally we booked three days thinking we might want to see places further from Asheville, but we were so happy with the studio we decided to extend our stay. The studio was very clean and cozy. It had everything we needed. The bed was comfy. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It was perfect."

Perfect for relaxing vacation or for the business traveler.
This
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is mostly 1960s ranch homes, nice trees and nice people.  Quiet for relaxing and privacy. We have very easy access (approx 3.5 miles) to the heart of downtown Asheville.   Biltmore Estate is 2 miles.  The fabulous Blue Ridge Parkway is minutes away.  In my studio apartment you will find a comfortable, clean , quiet and relaxing place to stay with easy access to downtown Asheville and outdoor mountain activities!  Relax and unwind in quiet and comfort and join the throngs downtown as you wish.
host_about:
I have lived in Asheville for 21 years.  Wow - so many changes here.  I recently retired from 20 years in Marketing with a local corporation and making time now for my passion of painting.
We, my husband Steve and I, are now embarking on an adventure as Airbnb hosts.  We welcome guests into our wonderful, comfy studio apartment and are happy share all we know about Asheville.  We want our guests to enjoy their privacy and relax, but we are always happy to share info.

name: Studio at Green Oaks Community
description:
The Studio is a convenient haven to stay at while exploring A'ville area. Downtown is 10 min. away by Riverside or Xway. Yummy dining, dancing, Arts District, clubs, cultural events, hiking, tubing & more are all super close to our secure 5 1/2 ac.

The space
Green Oaks Studio is a perfect place to stay while you explore Asheville. Less than 10 min. to downtown Asheville, Health food stores, dining, dancing, Arts District & more.

The studio is self contained with a kitchenette, shower, toliet & small deck.
Coffeemaker, fridge, convection oven and essentials are provided. We have a community laundry room open to you too. Hey if you like you can even rent a solar electric ELF we have to get around in. It's a 1 person vehicle.

We have over 5 acres with some trails. The gardens and pagoda are shared by the other 4 houses on the land and you!

We're glad to guide you in your endeavors around Asheville. Maps and current happenings
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome To Asheville
Asheville is a very special city; a jewel in the heart of the mountains of western North Carolina and one of the most the most progressive cities in the south. It has been called the Sedona of the east because of it's spiritual energy and the San Francisco of the East because of it's vibrant diversity and cultural life. These links will help you to get to know Asheville better.
 
Official Asheville Tourism Site
(URL HIDDEN)
 
Asheville, NC. Travel Guide
(URL HIDDEN)
 
Cosmic Buffet
(URL HIDDEN)
host_about: I moved to Asheville in 1980 and love it here. I started the first costume company here …then spent 14 yrs co-founding a large intentional community called Earthaven Eco-village, outside of A'ville ….followed by living a decade in India. My current passions are singing, writing, dancing, gardening & eco-spirit activism. Recently I've been loving creating nurturing fun spaces to live in.

name: Charming Bungalow Apartment - Biltmore Area
description:
Newly renovated, cozy and comfortable basement apartment a half mile from Biltmore House and minutes from downtown. Nestled in a quiet neighborhood a few blocks from local breweries, restaurants and shopping. This space has its own private entrance, plenty of light and loads of charm. Great location with easy access to everything you could want. Hosted by a hard-working friendly musician who's been at it for years. Check-out RahmSquad on streaming platforms/socials (spotify, instagram, etc..)

Other things to note
There is a 'no parking' sign in front of our house. You CAN park in front of the house, just not past the sign.
neighborhood_overview: Oakley is one of the newer neighborhoods thats 'blowing up' around Asheville these days. Its quiet and beautiful but just blocks away from Biltmore Village and The London Design Distract. Ton's of restaurants, breweries, coffee and shopping. A few miles to downtown and a mile from Biltmore house. Great Location!
host_about: Asheville locals since 2000. We would love to host your visit to our beautiful mountain city.

name: SweetPineHouse monthly rental fully outfitted!
description:
Located in one of Asheville's favorite historic neighborhoods, you are just minutes to either the Biltmore Estate or the heart of downtown, yet when you arrive home you feel far from it all. Kitchen is fully equipped and ready to go. Linens also included. 1 queen bed, and sleeper couch

The space
This one queen bedroom apartment is in a duplex with both units rented as AirBnB units on a monthly occupancy basis. The cozy first floor unit (the Sweet Pine House) has a queen sleeper couch for extra guests, lots of closet space, a gas fireplace, flat screen TV with an immense collection of movies and board games for your enjoyment. The spacious full bathroom includes a washer and dryer for your convenience right off the living room. The large private bedroom has great lighting, a comfortable queen bed and lots of closet space. There is of course air conditioning but the windows also open for fresh air. The eat-in kitchen was completely gutted and rebuilt in 2009. It i
neighborhood_overview:
The listing is located in a very desirable downtown neighborhood perfectly situated between the Biltmore Estate (with a Starbucks at the Entrance) just one mile away and downtown restaurants and shopping just one additional mile (a straight shot down Biltmore Avenue). Mission Hospital is walking distance from this rental.
The neighborhood has several parks, perfect for families with small children and also boasts the most trees of any downtown Asheville neighborhood.
A quick five minute drive gets you to the Biltmore Estate or downtown.
host_about:
Trish and Steph are busy moms raising their six year old son. They lived in this sweet home for 12 years before recently moving north of town and using this now as a rental home. It has been thoughtfully furnished and equipped to make your Asheville visit perfect. Please let us know if we forgot anything!

We run a local theater company and often have shows in production. Season and show information is available in the unit along with coupons for discounted tickets. 

Steph is often acting and directing both which keep her busy. Trish is a nurse midwife who has been delivering babies for twenty years.

Starting in June of 2016 our home is available for 30 day stays only. This is due to zoning in our neighborhood.

name: Romantic & Bohemian Private Studio
description:
This one bedroom, one bath studio is located in the back of my beautifully restored 1920s bungalow in downtown Asheville.

The space
The studio apartment, located in the back part of my house, is decorated with a mix of modern and vintage furniture. Some have been in my life for a long time, some brand new to the space, and art made by me hangs on the walls. There's a small kitchenette with table and chairs, a bedroom with exposed brick from an old cooks stove and a living area with a futon-style couch. The full bath has a claw foot tub/shower that has a custom copper curtain rod and antique heirloom vanity. This is a perfect retreat for two people.

Guest access
The private entrance is in the back of the house, with a cozy porch all to yourself. There is parking on the street. I will provide you with a parking pass to hang on your rearview mirror. To enter the apartment, simply walk along the driveway to the right of the house and the door i
neighborhood_overview: The beauty of the house not only lies in all of its charm, but also in it's location! There's a unique Whole Foods, called Greenlife, right across the street and Trader Joes is a couple blocks up from that. If you fancy yoga, Asheville Yoga Center is about three blocks away, on Liberty Street. In the other direction, a lovely greenway runs along Reeds Creek, or you can simply stroll around the eclectic neighborhood. Historic Montford, one the oldest neighborhoods (and in my humble opinion, the most beautiful), is a block away and the architecture is truly inspiring. My favorite coffee shop sits at the bottom of the street, called High Five Cafe. Don't let the hip tattooed baristas intimidate you- the coffee is delicious! Most importantly, all of downtown is just a 5-10 minute walk, complete with shopping, museums, restaurants, breweries, bars and music venues.
host_about: I grew up on the southern outer banks of North Carolina, and I've lived in Asheville for over seven years now. I've fallen deeply in love with this eccentric vibrant city and have slowly begun to spread my roots here over the years. Like most Ashevillians, I love the crisp mountain air, the enchanting scenery, the music, the people, and the art. Home is very important to me, as it's my sanctuary where I can retreat to refuel and ground myself. I take very good care of my space and with that have a great respect for other people's space as well.

name: DOGS FREE Cabin - Pisgah Natl Forest 12 min DT AVL
description:
Trails End Cabin is located in the Pisgah National Forest. No neighbors, no traffic, no distracts, and no worries. NO INTERNET to distract you either. A cell phone can be spotty pending carrier.

Bring your bomber and conquer the twisty single and dual tracks. The national forest offers endless miles of hiking, running and mountain bike trails. Enjoy a mud-ectomy for both you and your bike in the outside hot and cold shower.

The space
Bring your bomber and clean the twisty single and dual tracks and the national forest offers endless miles of hiking, running, and mountain bike trails. Enjoy a mud-ectomy for both you and your bike in the outside hot and cold shower.

PLEASE NOTE - THERE IS NO WIFI/INTERNET AT THIS HOUSE. CELL PHONE COVERAGE IS SPOTTY AT BEST. The cabin is located in the middle of the forest and we are not allowed to run a wire/cable through federal property. This allows you to RELAX without distractions AND you can get
neighborhood_overview: Trails End Cabin is located by itself inside the Pisgah National Forest.  No neighbors.
host_about:
Ron is a Asheville/WNC native.  He loves hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic and ancient mountains.   

Darlene relocated from Michigan to Asheville a few years ago. She loves visiting  quaint  towns in and around Asheville and local attractions like the Biltmore Estate as well as discovering new hiking trails.  Her outdoor passion is kayaking and rock climbing.

Most of our vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, dog friendly and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back. Please see individual properties for their unique features. 

We both are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

We look forward to sharing the WNC area with you!

Darlene - Director of Operations and Concierge
Ron - Property Manager

name: Country Living in the City Limits
description:
I live in a 1939 Cape Cod home near 67 acre Beaver Lake in NW Asheville. It is 6 minutes to downtown by car. My house sits on a private one acre lot. Private Room on Private Grounds is also available as an additional and distinct bedroom listing. Note: I now have 1 indoor outdoor cats so if you are allergic, be informed. She is mainly an outside cat in the warmer months and mostly outside except to eat.

The space
This is for one attic bedroom which is spacious and private. This listing has a king size bed. There is another smaller yet cozy bedroom upstairs that has a queen size bed. Go to Private Room with Private Grounds to view that bedroom.

I have been in the alternative healing arts profession as a spiritually oriented counselor and hands-on healing energy facilitator for 28 years and my home is my temple. I have used ancient Egyptian Biogeometry to fine tune the house and have filled it with art that touches my soul. You are welcome to b
neighborhood_overview: This is a 1930's upscale neighborhood with lots of trees and a huge lake.  We are convenient to downtown and there is not much development here.  That all happened 80 years ago thank goodness.  There are multiple banks, drug stores, restaurants five and more blocks from the house on Merrimon Avenue.
host_about: I am a semi retired male, UNC graduate, interested in spirituality, organic gardening, Access Consciousness, and enjoying life.  My home is my temple and I aspire to make it welcoming and peaceful for all who enter into it.  Beauty is important to me so I have a fair number of art objects in the house.  I lead a health conscious lifestyle.  My home is also gay friendly.

description:
This room is located on the main level of my home which also has a full bath with shower. It is located directly off the kitchen but also is near the back entrance ...so almost private. I have a nice outdoor patio area with a pond and waterfall.

Other things to note
I do have a housemate that also lives here he leaves for work at 745 and returns around 5:30 , he rarely uses the kitchen and is very quiet and friendly.
neighborhood_overview: I live in a great neighborhood that is next to the municipal golf course  and very conducive to morning walks .
host_about:
I have been an avid traveler all my life and enjoy meeting people from different cultures .I have enjoyed using airbnb when I travel as it allows you to have a more personal experience when visiting a new city- I have been living in Asheville for 22 years now and I love , hiking swimming in waterfalls , biking and am a member of the asheville rowing club. I have been a Realtor for 30 years , and also own my own import business .

** Also as a side note for those that may appreciate this , I only use all natural cleaning products , all cotton sheets , essential oil sprayed wool  dryer balls for my laundry. I also spray the pillows and mattress' with essential oil antibacterial spray  between guests. I also provide  natural  body wash / and shampoo / conditioner that my guests are free to use.

name: DOWNTOWN Asheville Cute 2/1 Great Front Porch Yard
description:
Historic Cottage within walking distance to Downtown Asheville, Live like a local ,Pillowtop King & Queen Beds, Updated & Decorated with true cottage charm in an amazing location! Great Location ,Nice yard area fenced in . Front Porch with Rockers and rear Porch with table & Chairs for outdoor dining . smart TV , WIFI, Stainless Steel Appliances, Air Conditioning & Heat, Front Loading Washer & Dryer, Off Street Parking
Accommodates 6 guests. Families are encouraged.
Pets ok ($125 fee )

The space
This Cozy Cottage is so Charming ! It has 2 bedroom 1 Bath , Front & Rear Outdoor Porch areas with Rocking Chairs ,Really experience living like a local in this charming neighborhood . One King Luxury Pillowtop & Queen bed with comfortable linens and hypo allergenic covers , and a pull out Queen Sleeper Sofa in living area , Small dining area , outdoor porch dining table seats 4 , Free WIFI, Flat Screen smart TV , Washer and Dryer , Kitchen has Gas S/
neighborhood_overview:
Our Historic neighborhood has beautiful Victorian homes, Old big trees & fabulous gardens. Its a great place to take a walk. You can walk downtown and stroll thru Montford areas . Close by you will find the Civic Center and the Basilica of St. Lawrence.
Asheville has a wide variety of trendy restaurants, lots of locally owned stores, live music venues, theaters, and bars/clubs. There are many local breweries, festivals, farmers' markets and special events are frequent.Whole Foods & Trader Joe's are also nearby.
Park your car and avoid the hassle and expense of parking downtown . You can go for a stroll thru the areas historic neighborhoods, pubs and fabulous Restaurants . All Within walking distance to Downtown Asheville
( Depending which way you go its about a 20 min walk or 3 minute drive )

Asheville is located within easy driving distance to the Blue Ridge Parkway, Pisgah National Forest, DuPont State Forest and other areas for hiking, biking, waterfalls
host_about:
Parent to 2 great kids . We love traveling,  music, good healthy food, and  exploring new places . 

Basically believing we can all make the world a better place one person at a time.

name: Cozy AVL Suite Near Everything
description:
Sweet private sanctuary only 5 min. to downtown, features private entrance, fully-loaded kitchenette, super comfy queen-sized Sleep Number bed with memory foam topper. Recently renovated with full private bathroom, separate living area with couch, A/C and dine-in table.
Enjoy the fully fenced back yard and hot tub access under large trees.
Dog and kid-friendly with access to trampoline & badminton.
Private driveway and off-street parking.
5 min to Blue Ridge Parkway, downtown and shopping.

The space
Sleeps up to three adults comfortably (perfect for a small family or a couple plus one friend). Clean and recently remodeled with beautiful cork flooring and two lockable private entrances. Recreational amenities include: badminton court, disc golf basket, hammock, fire pit, hot tub, screened porch, giant trampoline, and chicken coop. Fresh towels and linens are waiting for you. Kitchenette includes mini-fridge, microwave, hotplate, sink, toas
neighborhood_overview:
I am lucky to live in one of Asheville's older and more established neighborhoods, with tall trees and lush natural beauty. You'll be amazed at how private it is while being so conveniently located to Asheville's main attractions. You might even glimpse some local wildlife when driving through the neighborhood. Yes, sometimes even bears. Yes, they are relatively safe. Ask me for advice on how to handle a bear sighting if you’re worried.

I live on a relatively busy road (depending on time of day), but the house is tucked up and set back from the road, so it's also very peaceful.
host_about: I'm a fun-loving, compassionate, creative and hospitable human who loves her home, city and dogs very much. I welcome sharing my guest suite with respectful and kind folks looking to explore the local scene and all it has to offer. I'm happy to respect your privacy entirely or make new friends along the way. Happy adventuring, everyone!

name: 1925 Bungalow in the Heart of West
description:
A charming bungalow built in 1925 in the heart of West Asheville. Two blocks from Haywood Road, 3 miles from downtown. Private bath, wifi, and storage for your bicycles.

The space
Bedroom with a queen size bed. Private bath next door with an antique claw foot tub and hand held shower attachment.

Guest access
Guests are welcome to enjoy the front porch with its swing and eating area. A wonderful place to enjoy takeout from one of the many fabulous eating establishments in the Asheville area.

Other things to note
I have a golden retriever named Lucky and a standard poodle named Milo.
neighborhood_overview: I am located in the heart of West Asheville on a quiet maple lined street.  Just two blocks from Isis Theater and Restaurant, The UJ, West End Bakery and Nine Mile.  Also very close to Sunny Point, The Admiral, and Biscuit Head.  Located 2 miles from the River Arts District and 4 miles from the center of Downtown Asheville.
host_about:
I love to travel all over the world and meet people from all walks of life.  I am a Bicycle Tour Guide where I guide road bike tours all over the USA and some abroad. I also own a small handcrafted soap company.

If you are coming to hike or ride bikes I have safe storage for your bikes and I am happy to tell you about wonderful routes both road and mountain. I have lived in Asheville since 1999. Previously I lived in Delaware, Greensboro NC, Lancaster PA and Alaska.

I enjoy good food, wine, conversation, hiking, biking and travel.

name: 5 Star Luxury Near Downtown & Biltmore
description:
Beautiful 1900 sq. ft. town home in the highly sought after Asheville Area. We are within the city limits. Just bring your clothes. This home provides you everything you will need to relax and enjoy this amazingly perfect location! You will feel right at home. Enjoy being tucked away in this tiny, quiet, very safe neighborhood that is very close to everything in Asheville. Super Convenient~~The home is a short 6 Miles to the Biltmore Estate and 5 miles to Downtown~~

The space
COME VISIT ASHEVILLE AND STAY SAFE: CLEANING FOR COVID!!

We sanitize every single surface in the house and all floors.
We use Microban 24 hour sanitizer on all surfaces.
We sanitize all the furniture with fabric sanitizer.
We sanitize every single door knob and every single cabinet knob
We sanitize the remotes and place them in new clear covers each time
All lines are cleaned with Lysol Laundry Sanitizer
We provide hand sanitizer as well as
neighborhood_overview: We live in a very small, private community.  Everyone here is quiet and polite.  We live in one of the best centralized places in Asheville.  You can get anywhere in Asheville in just a few minutes.  We are located just off both main interstates.
host_about:
We are both very laid back and truly love living in Asheville.  We hope to make your trip as comfortable as we can.  Tracy is a postal manager
 and Brent works as a nurse at our local VA.  We are looking forward to letting you enjoy our vacation rental while your in Asheville.

name: 5 Mins to Downtown/ 2 MIns-Biltmore
description:
Our 1927 renovated home is in a historic neighborhood in Asheville. A 5 minute drive, or 20 minute walk to downtown. A 2 minute drive to Biltmore Village and the Biltmore Estate. You will be in the center of art and beauty during your stay.

The space
We are so excited to share our space with you for your stay in this city that we love and call home. We have had a lot of fun renovating this space and modernizing it while preserving all the details that made us fall in love with it. We think you will feel comfortable, creative, and sunny vibes during your stay.

Guest access
You will have full access and privacy in the entire house.
neighborhood_overview: We love to travel ourselves, but gotta say...Asheville is one of the coolest cities around.  Of course you've heard of our breweries, art, food, and beauty.  We will fill you in on all our favorite spots are.   Confirming some spots that you may have heard of but giving you plenty that only the locals know about.  We want you to get the full essence of this city.  There is so much to do here depending on what your thing is.  We will give you the lowdown.
host_about: I live in Asheville, NC and enjoy a variety of outdoor activities!

name: Private floor, stroll to W. AVL
description:
I'm happy to offer a full private floor in my green-built home, just a 5 minute walk to the best of W. Avl dining and nightlife. Queen bed, full bathroom, living room with queen sleeper sofa, creek views from the breakfast nook, full size deck, mini fridge. I prefer Friday and Saturday nights booked together. My space is not well-suited for babies or toddlers.

The space
You'll be enjoying an entire private floor of my green-built home. The pictures say it all; hardwood floors, comfy bed, spacious deck with views, breakfast nook with mini-fridge.
*Please note that your space is accessed by a flight of stairs. The 3rd/4th guests can sleep on the memory foam sleeper sofa in the living room area of you private floor.

Guest access
Please feel free to park one car in front of the house. You have exclusive access to all amenities listed. Specifics will come once your reservation is confirmed.

Other things to note
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is where the locals hang out.  There are a number of great restaurants (Jargon, Nine Mile, The Admiral, Biscuit Head, Zia, Sunny Point) nearby and several great bars (Westville Pub, Universal Joint, Brew Pump).  I typically walk to my favorite spots from home.  Please be respectful of neighbors and mindful of outside noise.
host_about:
Hello friends! 

I began traveling abroad at 18 and have traveled much of Latin America and the USA.  I'm fluent in Spanish and I'm studying Brazilian Portuguese.  Throughout my travels I've learned the importance and value of being a welcoming and obliging host, and the merits of being a humble and grateful guest.  It is my aim while hosting to provide my guests with a superb experience.  Whether you're looking for a brewery tour, exquisite culinary outing, or a peaceful waterfall hike, I'm happy to point you in the right direction!

Beautiful spacious cottage attached to our 100 year old charming home, less than one mile from the heart of downtown. Large bedroom with Brand New Cal King Tuft & Needle bed, living room with fireplace, clawfoot bath tub in bathroom.

Dogs stay free! Pet sitting offered for an additional fee just ask!

Microwave, medium fridge, coffee maker and toaster provided.

name: Entire apt. 2 miles: Biltmore, 5 miles: downtown !
description:
Completely remodeled upstairs apartment. . Close to everything Asheville. Within 2 miles to Biltmore Village, and 5 miles to Downtown Asheville. Everything needed for a stress free vacation.

The space
The great thing about my apt. is the location. It is so close to everything Asheville. To the west, is Biltmore Village, and The Biltmore House. (within 5 minutes.) Downtown is 10 minutes away via 240. Or you can head up to the Blue Ridge Parkway, which is also a few miles away.

Guest access
Check out is at 11:00 a.m. Check in is at 3:00 P.M.
If I cannot be there to greet you, there is a keybox. As you get closer to your arrival date I will give you the combo.

Other things to note
I just remodeled , and opened my apt. for Vacation rental. The next phase is working on an outside space. At the moment, all I can offer is some seating on my porch.
neighborhood_overview: I live in a small residential neighborhood setting . Around the corner, are horses, and next door, chickens, and a rooster. Yet, just up the road 2 miles away is Biltmore Village. And a mile away are the junctions to get onto I-40, and 240. With downtown less than 10 minutes away. Alot of my guests use Uber to get downtown.
host_about: A newbie to hosting a vacation apt. Looking forward to meeting all kinds of people, from all over. I would describe myself as easygoing . Hoping to make friends, and guiding my visitors to all that Asheville has to offer. I do work during the day, so many times I can't get online till after 3pm. So please be patient with me. I will try to get back to any inquiries a.s.a.p.

The family operated Children Friendly Luxury Mountain Cottages.

neighborhood_overview: Up scale Biltmore Park complex offer variety of Restaurants, Cafe, Fashion Stores, Sports Store, Art Gallery, Cinema, Bank, Farmer's Market, and Outdoor Entertainment.

name: Easy Walk Downtown - Sleeps 5
description:
Private entrance 2 Bedroom apartment. Lovely eclectic decorations. This is the ultimate Asheville retreat, while still being a short walk to downtown and many amenities: 2 Blocks to Vegetarian restaurant, Plant, 2 Blocks to Trader Joe's, 4 blocks to Elements juice bar, 4 blocks to Liberty Street Cafe, 4 blocks to Asheville Yoga, 4 blocks to Whole Foods, 5 blocks to High Five Coffee, 6 blocks to Downtown! Come walk our city and enjoy a beautiful space to come rest.

The space
(March 12 : Our professional cleaners have been taking extra sanitization measures with the apartments, such as using sanitizing products on surfaces and doorknobs and light switches). The house is a large duplex. Our family used to live upstairs (with preschooler and 2nd grader, Papa Eric and Mama Angie). We recently moved to Raleigh NC for a few years, while Angie attends graduate school. But this remains our Asheville home-base. We remodeled it when we moved out and are in love with the new
neighborhood_overview:
We really love our neighborhood. We are on a busy street, Merrimon Ave, but our property is elevated about 1 story above the street level, which creates privacy and safety. We enjoy riding bikes and walking to all of our favorite spots in town. And the neighborhood that we're right on the edge of, Claxton Hills or Chestnuts Hills makes for lovely neighborhood walks. Sometimes you might even see a black bear wandering about the neighborhood (no joke). Keep your distance, but don't be too alarmed. They're here the same reason you're here, to eat good food and enjoy the beautiful scenery ;)

Traveling with CHILDREN?
Here's some places I recommend if you're traveling with children:

There's a few parks within walking distance:

1.)The closest is at St. Mark's Lutheran church on Merrimon and Chestnut. They leave it open to the public while the sun is up and it's about 3 blocks away; it's great for toddlers!

2.) Weaver park on Merrimon and WT W
host_about:
Originally from a small town in Southern Illinois just outside of St. Louis, I now love living in the mountains of Western North Carolina.  We love living in the middle of Asheville where we can walk or ride our bikes to everything. We are also landlords of 14 apartments in Asheville and 1 AirBNB. But what we love most is spending time as family with our 10 year old daughter, Penelope, and 6 year old, Hugo. Family hikes, enjoying Asheville's culinary scene, and people watching at some of Asheville's many festivals are some of our favorite things to do as a family.  Staying in Airbnb’s while traveling is our preference, because it’s homier and more accommodating with children. 

Peace,

Angie

name: WALK TO DOWNTOWN ASHEVILLE: Garden Homestay Room
description:
Welcome to my beautiful homestay! PREMIERE LOCALE: 2.5 blocks to the popular South Slope. 5 blocks to Downtown. 10 mins to the Blue Ridge Parkway nature trails. HOME: Clay painted walls. Gorgeous organic gardens. Peaceful environ. YOUR ROOM is 1 of 4. Sleeps 2 on a double bed. With closet, dresser, lamp, fan. Bathroom & kitchen are shared. NO AC or TV. Everything under 'Neighborhood' is an easy walk. Nearby baseball games can be noisy--bring earplugs. Read ALL details below before booking : )

The space
***PLEASE NOTE: We live in one of the most biodiverse temperate rainforests on the planet, ie: this area is teeming with life....including insect life. While our home is cleaned & vacuumed weekly, if you prefer 100% air-tight hotel environments, please do *not* book with us. We enjoy our old-home charm, open air living, the sounds of nature....and don't mind the occasional moth or daddy long leg. If this sounds good, please come enjoy. We'd love to have you! Otherw
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION IS EVERYTHING! // 3 blocks to the South Slope // 5 block walk into downtown // 5 minute drive to Biltmore Estate // 8 minute drive to mountains // 2 minute walk to an open track field + awesome view on top of the bleachers // Walk to (most of) my faves below! Double check hours. Expect lines.

o---------------o-----------------o

• French Broad Food Coop: Everything! Snacks, toiletries, lunch to-go, beer, etc
• High Climate Tea: Gorgeous planty enviro. Tea galore. Mochi treats. Good ppl!
• Sovereign Remedies: Brunch + late dinner. Excellent organic food + cocktails
• Dobra Tea House: Over 100 tea options. Comfy seating. West side is cuter
• Storm Rhum Bar: Pretty outdoor dining. Delicious local cuisine. 5 blocks
• Gan Shan West: Favorite Asian Fusion in town, bonus outdoor seating
• Kathmandu Café: Love this organic Nepali gem run by a sweet family
• Farewell Café: Yummy treats, coffee + ambiance. 2.5 blocks away :)
•
host_about: Greetings humans! I’m as in love with these gorgeous old mountains as I was when I first arrived 25 years ago. I cherish living in this sweet sanctuary & the amazing team of women here. I’m into the intelligence of nature, food as medicine, all things wild n' free & liberation work. I keep a clean house & go by V, my birth-given middle name. YOU > I enjoy hosting all kinds of folks from around the world—just no more drunken beer tourists, please!

name: #3 Downtown  Get Around
description:
This historic downtown apt is perfect for your Asheville adventure. It is only a 5 to 10 minute walk to downtown & convenient to 3 major grocery stores.

The space
400 square feet upstairs apartment. Access to downstairs porch. Bathroom is small. AC is window units, not central air.

Guest access
Smart TV- has a roku player with Netflix, Spectrum TV, and 6 HBO channels
Wifi available

Other things to note
Stuff to do:
In general "Best of WNC" (bestofwnc.com) is a great way to get ideas. The winners are generally legitimate, and there are a ton of specific categories.

•Take a stroll, keep an open mind, and let adventure happen. You will almost certainly run into someone you didn't expect to see.
•Start conversations with strangers. Asheville is rivaled only by the gulf coast for friendly strangers.
•Tune your radio to 88.7 WNCW, 88.1 WCQS (classical) or 98.1 TheRiver
•Play some pinball
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the 5 Points neighborhood. This area has historic houses and is on the north edge of downtown.  This is a very desirable neighborhood.  You'll feel like a local as you take a short stroll out your front door to all downtown locations.
host_about: I grew up in Brevard, North Carolina, land of the waterfalls. I've made Asheville my home since 1992. I remember in the 60s and 70s when Sears was a downtown store. I remember the 80s when downtown was boarded up. First came the freaks, then the artists, then Be Here Now brought music back to downtown Asheville. Next pizza and beer at Barley's. I remember when Asheville was the land of the sky, now we're beer city.

name: Walk to cafes, pubs, music
description:
Walk to Haywood Street cafes, pubs, breweries, music & shops
.6 mile to downtown W AVL (2 steep hills & no sidewalk) passing vintage and arts'n crafts homes & a small take a book library. There is a nice back way/marked bike bath from Haywood to festive River Arts District and downtown Asheville. Nearby trails & easy access to the Parkway. In a quiet, quaint neighborhood, this cozy cottage, deck & hammocks await. I am happy to host. Right off of hwy 26, 40 and 240. A forest deck with hammocks.

The space
Enjoy the deck overlooking a forest, relax with a hammock & hammock chair in your outdoor space. There is a Smart TV that you can use your own Netflix, Amazon, Hulu accounts or enjoy the included stations. How about some good ole’ fun with card games, or take a book from the book exchange in the game closet. Sip your fav drink on the deck. You have a blender, Keurig/K cup coffee machine with k cups & an abundance of tea options.
If you have a larger gr
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is full of vintage cottages and bungalows. It's quaint, artistic and quiet.  We enjoy the short stroll (a little over half mile to Haywood. warning: there are a couple of large hills) to Haywood for jazz or other concerts at Isis, cafes, ice cream, pubs/breweries and Dobra tea house. Close to Hominy Creek Greenway running trails. Almost a straight shot to the Blue Ridge Parkway. There is a marked bike path to River Arts or downtown (hills involved & would recommend you’re used to biking) or Uber for a few bucks.
host_about: I'm a globe trotting social worker. By living in villages abroad, I learned how great it is to live within walking distance to everything: food, drink, nice folks, music
