name: Elegant, cozy, in-town, with  private hot-tub!
description:
Views of town AND walk to town, designer furnishings, luxury everywhere! Cozy and elegant, fully-equipped gourmet kitchen, quiet wooded cul-de-sac street, and lots of outdoor space to enjoy the mountain scenery. Dog-friendly! I have a gated fence surrounding the house so that your pooches can enjoy chasing squirrels with free range to run around the entire space.

Two outdoor seating areas and two separate fire pits plus a ping-pong table!

The space
My luxuriously decorated home does not skip a beat and will provide you everything you are seeking during your visit in Asheville. I have personally appointed it with furnishings and appliances suitable for full-time residency because it is my home and want it to feel like yours when you stay there. My past tenants are repeat renters and will gladly provide references about the details of the beauty of my home. I look forward to hosting you!

The master suite with ensuite bath and walk-in clo
neighborhood_overview: We are located exactly 20 minutes walking to town (25 to the Civic Center) and have an exquisite view of town from our porch and open-air BBQ area...this is a rare and unique feature in Asheville.  Also, because of the layout of the house, when sitting on the porch you have  a lot of privacy with the wooded area in the front of the house and the slope down to the left of the makes one feel like they are living in nature when really they are minutes from a marvelous city!  The street is also on two cul-de-sacs so there is very limited traffic.
host_about: A California native and resident of the U.S. Virgin Islands for over 20 years, I am a seasoned traveler and always searching for the next great "small town".  After buying our home in 2008 in the still sleepy Asheville, I lovingly remodeled it and had hoped to make it my full-time residence within a few years.  I live here in Asheville with my two terrier chihuahua mix dogs and we love meeting new people, especially those who are interested in discovering Asheville. I also work as an Independent Consultant on Marketing and Branding for businesses large and small and coordinate and sell golf trips to Casa de Campo in the Dominican Republic.  I am an avid golfer, sailor, tennis-player and love horses and dancing on the side.  I love cooking and entertaining for friends (my house is PERFECT for dinner parties) and love trying out new foods from different cultures all the time.  I love to speak other languages such as Japanese, French, and Spanish but don't get nearly enough opportunities to practice.  I'm delighted to share my home with you and hope you will love it as much as I do!

name: Mountain Views, Private Retreat, 15 min frm dwntwn
description:
Relax, Restore, Rejuvenate.
Our listing is not just a spare bedroom but a spacious, full-sized lower-level suite, located just a few minutes from downtown Asheville. We have a secluded, peaceful home on a paved, state-maintained road. You can enjoy 6.5 acres of private outdoor space, along with a steam sauna, hot tub & outdoor shower. We also provide easy access to a large deck offering spectacular views from almost 3000 feet - similar those as seen from the Grove Park Inn - only higher up!

The space
We offer a bit more room to spread out than the average hotel or rental space. This is an extraordinary contemporary style property with a full scale suite with private entrance that includes a queen sized bed, with a roomy closet, a small full bathroom, and sauna The adjoining living room has a sectional couch and pull out queen bed (up-charge for third and fourth person). The living room has high ceilings and similar views as the Grove Park Inn. On a clear
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located on almost 7 acres in a quiet mountain top residential community of single family homes in close proximity of all Asheville features, and within 3-4 miles of the famed Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about: I and my wife are longtime residents of Asheville who moved here to enjoy the mountains and all that Asheville offers.  I've maintained a chiropractic practice here and am now slowly disengaging to have more time to travel and enjoy the area, particularly long distance biking and hiking.  My wife owns a well regarded women's consignment store in North Asheville, minutes from downtown.  We know the area WELL and can enthusiastically share our "secret" special places with you.  Just ask! A big plus we can talk about (if interested) is I can offer guided bike/hike tours for all levels, bikes and helmets provided.

Comfortable one bedroom basement apartment with private patio, mountain views and separate entry (owners live upstairs). The apartment is stylishly appointed, with a full kitchen and bathroom and off street parking in a quiet cul-de-sac. Close to downtown and within walking distance of Beaver Lake.

The space
Due to Covid, we are blocking off at least three days between stays to allow for thorough cleaning. The HVAC system serves upstairs and downstairs with just one thermostat, which is upstairs. If temperature needs to be adjusted just text us as we want you to be comfortable. Our new filtered (MERV 10 filter) HVAC system (8/19) is also equipped with a IWAVE self-cleaning air purifier bi-polar ionization system.

Recent upgrades include a nice 55 inch flat screen 4G TV and a dining table. The foosball table seen in several pictures has been replaced by the dining table and chairs.

name: Perfectly cozy location 1/2 mile to downtown.
description:
1st floor bedroom with a very comfortable queen bed in a wonderful location, only 1/2 mile walk to downtown Asheville. 1/2 a block from Trader Joe's on Merrimon Ave, Harris Teeter and Greenlife Market (Whole Foods).
Private bathroom on same floor. Only 1 step into house, bedroom and bathroom on 1st level.
Come enjoy the great food, music and outdoor activities that Asheville is known for. Free street parking beside or in front of front door across the street.

The space
My home is warm and inviting with all you'll need to enjoy yourselves. Large comfy Queen bedded 1st floor bedroom and bath off kitchen for your use. My bedroom and bathroom are upstairs.

Guest access
You will be renting the downstairs bedroom and will use the downstairs bathroom off of the kitchen. I use the upstairs bedroom and separate bathroom. You do not share a bathroom. Feel free to use the living room, kitchen, and lovely front porch.

The bedroo
neighborhood_overview:
There is a great coffee shop on my block and many grocery stores within a block and parking in front of or beside my house.
Walking downtown is 1/2 mile past many great shops and restaurants and bars along Lexington Ave. I am also right near the yoga center and the
Harrah Cherokee civic center for concerts and events is 1/4 mile walk as well.

Parking permit required to park in my neighborhood. I provide a visitor parking permit.

name: Country haven, minutes to downtown, private pond
description:
Gorgeous 3 bedroom home minutes from downtown Asheville on two acres with private pond and mountain views.

The space
Enjoy privacy and restorative natural beauty with bright, sunlit spaces in a quiet and peaceful neighborhood 10 minutes from downtown Asheville.

Our home includes a modern kitchen with granite counter tops, two full baths with custom tile work, and hardwood floors throughout. The entire house is decorated with local art, books, plants and unique furnishings.

Relax and unwind on 2 landscaped acres with a private pond. A gazebo overlooks the pond and a trail circles the entire pond. The back porch opens onto a garden and patio with a grill.

Great place for a reunion or even a wedding!

Guest access
You have full access to the entire home, as well as two acres of lawn and trees. Enjoy the private pond and gazebo surrounded by a 200 year old poplar grove and lush mountain views.

Al
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and rural with nice neighbors, yet just 7.5 miles from the heart of downtown Asheville. We are also 2.5 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway and the Mountains to Sea Trail, which provides opportunities for hiking, biking, and outdoor recreation.
host_about:
I am a 4th generation native of Asheville, NC. I am a nurse and a vegan chef. I have 5 vacation rentals that I have been hosting for the past 6 years. I also own Advantage Care Services. Advantage is a home care company that provides in-home aid to those in need. I love yoga and I am an artist who works with watercolor. I enjoy being a host. I have met a wonderful variety of people from all over the world and many walks of life who have stayed at my homes over the years. 

"Be the change you want to see in the World" Gandhi

description: Find your Asheville homebase at this chic and modern loft set in one of central downtown's beautiful historical buildings. Lounge and relax (and get a great night's sleep!) in our quiet and luxurious surroundings, before you go out again into Asheville's vibrant downtown scene which is right at your doorstep.
neighborhood_overview: Walk just steps to all of the great culinary treats, restaurants, cafes, bars, breweries, boutiques, salons, galleries, an independent movie theater, music venues, artists' studios, and all of the downtown liveliness that makes Asheville so unique.

description:
Peaceful, luxurious, private room in newer home. Tea and coffee provided... Zip-covered bedding. Close to local breweries, Blue Ridge Pkwy, Biltmore Est, highways. Wooded lot, rocking chair porch. Massages and petsitting available as addition.

The space
This is a very comfortable room next to a guest bathroom with granite countertops, up a stunning staircase with fresh hardwood floors. You are provided with a hot kettle, tea and coffee for your convenience. This is a newer home with a warm and inviting, yet luxurious feel. Across the street is a small neighborhood tavern separated by a big wooded lot. Sometimes you can hear people and music from there. Lots of grass in the .4 acre yard and even a swing set! It is a healthy space with a heavy duty mattress cover, box spring cover, and pillow covers!

Guest access
Enter through the main front door up a small set of stairs through a rocking chair porch. The entrance and bathroom will
neighborhood_overview: This is an eclectic neighborhood in a central location close to everything that Asheville has to offer!  We are right off of 74, one exit away from Whole Foods, the Blue Ridge parkway, the Shoji hot tubs, the Mall, and 10 minutes from downtown Asheville.  On our exit you can visit the Nature Center, Highland Brewing Company, all sorts of convenient shopping and food stops, yet feel tucked away in a semi-private and wooded home.  We are on the edge of the neighborhood, without any residential neighbors that see into our yard.  We are walking distance to the library, convenience store, public park, and close to local favorites like Brother Wolf, The Regeneration Station, The Toy Boat, and other great neighborhood gems.
host_about: Hi!  I hope you visit!  My family welcomes you, and we invite you to make yourself at home.  Your privacy will be respected, we hope you have a wonderful trip!

Jacqui

Jacqui

name: Country feel, city appeal, minutes to Asheville
description:
15 min drive of all major Asheville area attractions. Easily accessible first floor, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, in a 21st century home. The private setting in this charming wooded neighborhood and designated bird sanctuary is extremely relaxing.

The space
Welcome Home! Come and stay in our gorgeous, single-level, private space in our home. We are within the Asheville City limits, but you will feel as though you have escaped to the country, surrounded by trees and privacy. We strive to keep the apartment as clean and comfortable as possible. The flooring throughout is hardwood/tile for a dust-free environment. Bedding is covered with 100% cotton duvet covers that are washed after each guests' stay. I am a freak about changing HVAC air filters far more often than would normally be scheduled.

Guest access
Access is by keypad with 24 hour check-in. Owner is on-site if assistance is needed with check-in.

Other things to no
neighborhood_overview: The home is nestled on 3 private acres within a residential neighborhood.  It is surrounded by trees.  You might get a glimpse of deer, foxes, wild turkeys, ground hogs, or even a bear!  There are three grocery stores nearby including a brand-new Super Ingles with Starbucks Coffee, Deli, & Cafe.  Distance-wise, you could actually walk to the grocery stores, but without sidewalks, it's safer to drive. The Asheville Outlets are 4.5 miles away.  The Biltmore Estate, Arboretum, Blue Ridge Parkway, Bent Creek Recreation Area, and Downtown Asheville, West Asheville, and the River Arts District are all less than 15 minutes away.
host_about: We have lived in Western NC for over 27 years.  We love it here!  Outdoor activities  such as hiking and trail running rank among our favorites.  We have always enjoyed hosting family and friends in our large home.  When our 3 kids entered their twenties, we remodeled to make better use of the space.  We love to travel and have enjoyed staying at several Airbnb properties.  Peter is a General Contractor and Realtor.  Jackie is an RN.

name: Mountain Top Retro Rental
description:
Initially built as a 1960s vacation home, this private wooded location with east facing mountain views is located high up on Beaucatcher Mountain. The house is less than 1 mile from downtown Asheville and less than 5 miles from the Biltmore Estate. Easy access to the Blue Ridge Parkway, local breweries, restaurants, music venues, and outdoor activities.

The house was remodeled in 2016 with mid-century modern furnishings. Enjoy privacy with this unique location within the city of Asheville!

The space
The house is 650 square feet as it was built as a vacation rental initially. There are not many houses with this proximity to Asheville yet sitting high on a ridge in a wooded area.

Other things to note
I have had some concerns about the driveway being steep and curvy from folks that are likely typically not used to driving in the mountains. I have driven a 24 foot box/moving truck up the driveway. It is manageable for nearly all veh
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is called the Asheville Swiss Chalets. They were built in the 60's as vacation rentals. Most of the houses are vacation rentals; however, there are a few permanent residents.
host_about: I have lived in Asheville since since 2000 and have been visiting Oak Island since then as well. Mid-century modern fan, hiker, mountain biker, ski patroller, and vinyl collector.

name: Hazel's Hideaway - Walk Downtown
description:
Sunny, one bedroom apartment in beautiful Historic Montford. A short walk to downtown and a few minute drive to the River Arts District. "Hazel's Hideaway" has all the coziness of home, the amenities of a hotel, and the personality of Asheville.

The space
**Our COVID cleaning routine: All surfaces and high-touch points are cleaned and disinfected with CDC approved products. All towels and bedding are cleaned and sanitized by a professional laundry service.**

The location and comfort of “Hazel's Hideaway" makes it the perfect home base for your Asheville adventure. This centrally located, newly appointed, one bedroom apartment is nestled in the charming Historic Montford neighborhood.

You will be a quick 12 minute walk (or a $5-$7 Uber ride) to downtown with its great restaurants, shopping, and fun "South Slope" Breweries. You will also be a few minutes drive the the River Arts District with its many artist studios, and the newly built N
neighborhood_overview: Montford is a beautiful historic neighborhood with tree lined streets that are great for walking.  Montford is just north of downtown and a quick walk to great restaurants, breweries and shopping.  Though most of Montford is residential we do have a few culinary gems.  Tod's Tasties is like a second home for us and is just up the street from the apartment.  Wonderful food, great vibe, and oh so Asheville :)  Another fantastic spot in the neighborhood is "9 mile", a Jamaican fusion joint that is great for lunch or dinner :)
host_about: We are both native New Englanders who moved to Asheville to escape the hustle of city life, and to start our family in this cool mountain town.  Chris is an energy and sustainability manager, and Heidi is an artist and designer for her small screen printing brand.  We love working on our 1920 craftsman home, playing with our sweet baby girls, walking the beautiful streets of Montford and drinking the delicious local beers of Asheville :)  We enjoy our privacy and extend the same courtesy to our guests so you may not see us during your stay.  If you have any questions while staying with us, don't hesitate to call or text, we are of course happy to help.

name: Spacious, Chic Grove Park Studio - 5 Min Dwntwn
description:
Set in a quiet, walkable residential neighborhood, you're only a 5-minute drive or Uber ride from our lively downtown (1.4 mi.) a short walk from the Omni Grove Park Inn, & close to UNC@Asheville (1.4 mi). Enjoy a light-filled sitting area, dining area & breakfast bar, and a comfortable, well-appointed bedroom, plus full bath, and off-street parking. Only 13 minutes to Biltmore estate; 16 to Blue Ridge Parkway. Also convenient for business travelers attending events at the GP Inn/UNCA/downtown.

The space
The two-room studio has its own entrance and constitutes the lower floor of a large Grove Park home. The space consists of two large rooms plus a full bath. The front room receives wonderful natural light and has a sitting area, a desk, and a dining area. A compact "breakfast bar" includes a mini-refrigerator and microwave (note: there is no sink or full kitchen.) and is outfitted with your choice of an automatic drip coffee maker or french press for fresh-brewed
neighborhood_overview: The studio is in Asheville's Grove Park neighborhood, which was developed in the early 20th century with curvilinear streets, parks, and naturalistic landscaping. The district was placed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1989 and is favored by residents for its easy proximity to downtown while retaining its lushly tranquil neighborhood feel.
host_about: I'm a marketing advisor and artist who loves to travel: big cities for short periods of time and small towns and the country for longer spells. Traveling to cities means enjoying all forms of the arts and the built-in energy of those places. Smaller towns and open country are for hikes and long walks, writing, and nature photography. As both a traveler and an Airbnb host, I'm attentive, adaptable, and pretty unflappable.

name: 3/2.5 Clean and Comfortable Rental in Asheville
description:
A cozy, clean and comfortable 3 bedroom/2.5 bath vacation rental property on 1 acre tucked away in a quiet peaceful setting while centrally located within a 15 minute drive of Downtown Asheville. The house has a wonderful covered outdoor deck to sit out back and enjoy the view of the trees.

The space
This fully furnished 3 bedroom/2 ½ bath home can comfortably accommodate up to 6 people. The house is well equipped with superior bedding, bath towels, kitchen accessories (ie. pots, pans, silverware, plates etc.), blow dryer, iron, washer and dryer, high definition TVs in all the bedrooms with access to cable, Netflix and DVD player. Some exceptional extras include fire pit with adirondack chairs and a relaxing back porch. If travelling with children, the house contains board games to keep them entertained. The luxurious master bedroom with a King size bed and its own private bathroom is on the main level. Upstairs on the second level are the two additional bedro
neighborhood_overview: The house has beautiful winter mountain views and sits on an acre of land. It is part of Riceville Forest, a quaint residential community located 7 minutes from Warren Wilson College and 10 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway, America’s favorite scenic byway.  In the morning, you can take a stroll up Independence Way and become one with nature.  You may even see a cow or two. When you are not discovering one of the many nearby hiking trails or waterfalls, there are plenty of other fun activities around town to keep you busy including white water rafting, biking and zip lining. You can explore the downtown area, the River Arts District, or spend a day at the Biltmore Estate. You can also enjoy a beer or two at one of the many breweries in the area. For your convenience, you will find a few maps and travel guides at the house.
host_about: I am a Real Estate Broker, Mortgage Loan Consultant, and Real Estate Investor currently living in Asheville, North Carolina. In 2014, I relocated from Miami Florida although I still travel back and forth between NC and FL. Some of my interests include design, photography and music in addition to beer, wine, food and travel. I own several vacation rental properties in Asheville perfect for small or large groups.  Please reach out should you be interested in visiting the Asheville area or have any real estate needs.  I'm happy to provide any guidance or recommendations.

The house has been in my family for 4 generations. Built by my great grandfather. Very conveniently located, only minutes from downtown, West Asheville, and River Arts. Lots of room in the house and on the property to spread out and get comfy.

We are now hosting affordable weddings on the spacious property. Reach out to Erin at silverfernevents.com for wedding information at Cottage McIntyre.

The space
Fantastic cottage built by my great grandfather. Large property with a stream running by. Minutes from everything Asheville has to offer. No smoking in the house. Plenty of room in the house and on the property to spread out and get comfy. Take a blanket out back at stare up at the stars!

Guest access
Full access with the exception of basement and barn on property. Occasionally we will have a small garden growing next to the house.

Other things to note
The home is limited to 4 guests. Any number of g
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood.  Country feel just minutes from town.  My dad's house is adjacent to the property, so we have someone nearby just in case you need anything.
host_about: I am a fifth generation Ashevillian.  I grew up in the neighborhood, in the house up on the hill.  My childhood was spent in the cottage and in the vast gardens that my great-grandfather grew on the property.  As Asheville has grown, we have enjoyed watching the changes.  The restaurants, the downtown scene, and the activity in West Asheville are just a few of the places we have loved to see grow.  I work with the Buncombe County School system, and I am lucky enough to be located at an elementary school just minutes from home.

This beautiful skylit apartment is located in the heart of Historic Biltmore Village only yards from the entrance to The Biltmore Estate and less than 2 miles to downtown Asheville's vibrant and eclectic scene. Only steps from Dining and Shopping.

This unit is located in the Heart of Historic Biltmore Village within steps of oodles of shopping and dining options. It is brand new in 2016 and has all the amenities for a truly enjoyable stay. Parking is free in the Village and should not be a problem before noon or after 5pm.

name: Mountaintop Retreat near Downtown Asheville
description:
Although this newly-renovated mid-century home feels eons away from the real world -- as it is perched atop a beautiful mountain with breathtaking views -- it is only about 10-minutes away from Downtown Asheville! New mattresses and bedding plus quality furniture fill the space, and we have fully-stocked the kitchen. The very best feature is the new deck, with comfortable seating for enjoying the view below. We can accommodate up to 6 guests.

The space
Charmingly named "Mountain Miracle" by its original owner, this is a newly-renovated 1961 ranch-style home, with jaw-dropping views on a large wooded lot.
Indoors, we offer a full kitchen, two full baths, living spaces with a gas fireplace, and sleeping spots for up to 6.
On the main level: the master bedroom has a king bed; a second bedroom has a queen bed.
There is one full bath (with a bathtub) on the main level.
Downstairs on the garden level is the third bedroom, with a queen bed.
The
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is located on a gravel road off of Town Mountain Road, just up the road from the NC Governor's Western Residence. Town Mountain Road and our road are both winding mountain roads, so please drive carefully, especially during inclement weather.
We are part of a wooded neighborhood, with lots of wildlife.
99% of our neighbors are year-round residents, so please remain respectful of the community, in terms of noise, etc.
Please, no parties or events. Thanks!
host_about:
For my husband and me, our airbnb home in Asheville is not merely an investment. We each grew-up in Asheville, and although both sets of our parents still live in Asheville, our home is in Cartersville, Georgia. 
Our airbnb guests help us to "keep the lights on" year-round, so that our growing family has a place to stay when we visit our parents and our hometown.
We are very grateful that you are considering our home, and we know that you will love it! :)

description:
Beautifully renovated, very Ashevillian 1905 home on the Historic Registry with incredible location. An easy walk to Downtown, South Slope, The River Arts District, and West Asheville. 100% private backyard space with fire pit and surrounded by nature. The new 4 mile riverside greenway is complete, featuring Asheville's first dedicated bike lane that begins just 2 blocks away from our house! This is the ultimate location. If the dates you want are not available, please contact us!

The space
1905 historic 1400 square foot home with preserved features such as original hardwood floors throughout, plaster walls, original trim and doors, etc. On one side of the house is a bustling downtown street, and the other side makes you feel like you're in the forest. Our backyard has been certified as a wildlife habitat and there is a short trail that runs to a creek! Everything is walking distance, including 30+ breweries, countless restaurants, art studios, etc.

I have 2 friendly Whippets one is a Puppy.

The space
PERFECT for single person and business travelers!

Montford is a very safe Asheville residential neighborhood. Centrally located & the Visitors Center is on the corner! Many tours begin there. A beautiful 10 minute walk to downtown.

Our upscale, quiet, safe residential neighborhood is all about the families who live here. You will immediately feel right at home!! Every evening, you find neighbors out for a stroll, walking their dogs or riding bikes. We are close to MANY different kinds of popular restaurants on Montford Ave. The restaurants of downtown Asheville a short walk away. There is a Trader Joe’s and a VERY upscale Harris Teeter grocery store one mile away. We have a STACK of vacation flyers and area attractions for you to peruse. Tours begin at the Visitors center are at the top of our street.
host_about:
Originally from New York... and lived in Los Angeles until I moved to Asheville, NC two years ago. I have two Whippets - Owen and Gavin and so great!

On our exit you can visit the Nature Center, Highland Brewing Company, all sorts of convenient shopping and food stops, yet feel tucked away in a semi-private and wooded home. name: Quaint & Quirky Paris of the South
description:
Sure, those fancy perfectly restored classic Bungalows are nice. But, if you're looking for the real-deal eclectic West Asheville vibe, this is the place for you! Walk to the hippest joints in town and return to a creative one-of-a-kind urban oasis.

The space
In the nineteenth century, Asheville earned the nickname "Paris of the South" due to a reputation for fine shopping, dining, spas, and entertainment. Today, people travel to Asheville specifically to enjoy our vibrant eclectic culture. This spacious room in our 1915 historic West Asheville home combines both!

The space you are booking is the largest room in the house, offering a double bed, a queen bed and a loveseat.

Guest access
In addition to the primary room and shared full bathroom guests will have access to the front porch. One other upstairs room might be occupied. Guests will also have free wifi access and a small refrigerator.

Other things to note<
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood! The people in this neighborhood are all exceptional LGBTQ-friendly humans. And the location is a rare find (minutes away from the best places without the noise and traffic of living on a busy main road). In addition to plenty of food/drink and shopping options within walking distance, we can also walk to yoga studios, community acupuncture, and massage practitioners.
host_about:
Adventurer, wellness travelpreneur, mama bear, foodie, wordsmith, artist, free-thinker. 

"Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all."--Helen Keller

name: The Guesthouse at Deer Crossing
description:
Our home is a new custom built unique farm house which used materials off the property for much of its structure. We call it our “ barn house.” It is located down a private drive surrounded by beautiful horses and other animals. We are close to I-26 and the airport. Restaurants and theaters are 5 minutes away.
**Due to the beginning of a housing construction project in the acreage behind us, there could be possible noise from Monday thru Friday. Be aware of this before you book.

The space
Guests will have total access and privacy to their whole apartment. It is attached to our home and is above our garage. There is a private entrance.

Guest access
They will share our driveway for parking.

Other things to note
There is one other Airbnb guest room within our home. No space is shared. However, all guests can join us for a fire on the screened porch at anytime.
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a very peaceful beautiful place that is five minutes from the highway. It feels like we are in our own world back here. There are several nearby neighbors.
*Right now, there is a construction project beginning in the back of our property. There could be possible noise from this on weekdays. We do not want you to be unaware of this before you book. Thank you for your understanding. Weekends are perfect!
host_about:
Tim and I are active empty nesters! We relocated to Asheville from Atlanta once our children grew up.  Tim and I are heading into our retirment years. He is a general contractor and I just retired from teaching  middle school math. Tim creates beautiful homes and spaces. He built our new “ barn” home just last year. We moved into this beautiful home in October 2019. We designed a one-bedroom guesthouse above our garage and another suite as the loft above our main home. Tim and I respect different styles of travelers. While some of you may want to rest and stay more isolated, others of you may want to visit with us over dessert on one of the porches! We are just happy to provide you a place to relax. 
P.S. I love dogs, so we allow well-behaved dogs in the guesthouse, but we have decided to keep the loft dog-free. No cats, since I am allergic to them.

description:
Tucked away on a hill in a quiet residential area is our peaceful 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom home away from home. Here you’ll find room to breathe, plenty of natural light, and just a touch of what’s familiar. We’ve made a peaceful place for you to relax, so you can focus on the next adventure. Why pile everyone into a hotel room (or two) when you can breathe the mountain air without stepping on any toes?

The space
Located beside the entrance to the Blue Ridge Parkway and just 10 minutes from Downtown Asheville and the Biltmore Estate, you’ll find you are never too far from adventure and excitement. There’s easy access to I-40, 240, and 26, so getting around town is super convenient.

Make sure to stop by the Folk Art Center just off the Parkway, or head on up to Craggy Pinnacle for a more leisurely parkway experience. If you’re in the mood to shop, you are only 15 minutes from local shops downtown and artisan showrooms in the River Arts District. When it
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in a residential neighborhood within a few minutes of downtown Asheville. There is easy access to Interstate 40 or 240 as well as the Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about: Jon is a Realtor and Emily works in the mental health field.  We welcomed our first child into the world in October 2016. We've lived in North Carolina since 2011 and adore Asheville.

name: "Tree house" in South Asheville
description:
Special price reduction in this time of crisis. Rest assured that this space is thoroughly cleaned and disinfected. Has own ensuite bath, fridge, and microwave. High speed internet and multi channel TV. Also, since it has private entrance, you can choose to have plenty of "zero contact" space that has the feel of a tree house. Quiet neighborhood cul-de-sac with no through traffic. If you choose, you can use the first floor with kitchen, laundry, great room, a 2nd deck , and a gas grille.

The space
Large suite with full bath; private entrance and deck. Also has entry thru a backdoor to the suite which is accessed through atrium off main house. Large room has queen bed, futon, desk, fridge, and multi channel TV.

Guest access
Private entrance is from deck which is up 23 steps from lower yard. Backdoor entrance is only three steps up from atrium off shared first floor of house.

Other things to note
A permanent tenant
neighborhood_overview: Very quite neighborhood. The back of the property is a wooded buffer between the Airbnb house and Kensington Place Appartments.  The western mountains are visible when the leaves have fallen. Spectacular sunsets!
host_about:
I am retired from the educational/technical/professional publishing industry.  I have done several part-time jobs since retiring, lately I drive for Uber and Lyft.  It is fun for me and affords me the opportunity to travel. Two years ago I spent the whole month in Denmark, Sweden, and Norway. Using AirBnB made that trip more affordable and more fun!

I write books.  In (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) I published a sci-fi novel, MORPH: the Resurrection of Angels and last July, Uber & Out. See them on (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

More about me and friends on (Hidden by Airbnb) :  Walter Anthony Barringer Dinteman.

name: Mountain View Cottage with Hot Tub
description:
Come stay in our cozy cottage and take in the mountain view. Enjoy open floor plan great for gatherings. This home is adjacent to Pisgah National Forest and 1/2 mile to trail head for miles of hiking/running/biking. Beautiful views from front deck, covered sitting area and fire pit area as well as from our HOT TUB. Gas grill available.

10-15 mins to West Asheville 15-20 to Downtown. 5 mins to Amenities such as grocery, restaurants, Asheville outlet mall. 20 mins to Biltmore House & Airport.

The space
House was renovated with "fixer upper" style finishes. 3 Bedroom 1 Bath with bonus sunny entry room with twin bed window seat. Open floor plan great for spending time together. Enjoy cooking in spacious fully stocked kitchen. Guests will find coffee/tea on hand as well as other kitchen basics. Asheville is Beer City USA so we like to keep a few local brews in the frig and invite guests to do a beer exchange.
Relax in one of our outdoor areas
neighborhood_overview:
Just 2 miles from the Asheville city limits but what a mountain get away. Rural setting with just 4 neighbors. Adjacent to Pisgah National Forest with a trail head just 1/2 mile away. If you take the right trail you can access Bent Creek.
Grocery store, restaurants and other basic amenities just 5 minutes away. West Asheville is 15 minutes. Downtown Asheville/Biltmore Estate and Asheville Airport are all about 20 minutes away.
host_about: I am the mother to three super active kiddos ages 17, 14 & 12. We are super active people who enjoy running, bike riding, hiking and any other outdoor play we can find.  We live just "over the mountain" (3 miles by roads) from the houses so I am available to assist when necessary.  I have been hosting for Airbnb since Nov. 2015 and love it! I am also a Realtor in Asheville at Preferred Properties.

name: Cheryl's W. Asheville Chalet
description:
Close to Haywood Rd. (the high street of West Asheville), 15 mins. from downtown Asheville, near the airport, the AT, French Broad River, New Belgium & Sierra Nevada Breweries, and River Arts District. You’ll love the brand new space with a private entrance and deck; it's in the heart of W. Asheville but on a quiet street with back yard; the bed and bath are spacious with all the info. you'll need for your stay in Asheville, and wifi; good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

The space
En suite bathroom

Guest access
Bedroom and bathroom and porch
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is an exciting neighborhood experiencing lots of change. There's a mixture of people, which makes it authentic Asheville. There are new music venues, restaurants, art co-ops and galleries going up regularly on Haywood Road. Very fun environment.
host_about: I am a high school teacher and mother of grown children. I enjoy traveling and learning about places and cultures. I'm an animal and nature lover.

name: Unique Hand-built Cabin in the City
description:
A quiet cabin walking distance to downtown, coffee, yoga, and several grocery stores. Great for creative and adventurous folk looking for something outside the norm.

The space
A private little cottage in the trees, just 3 blocks from city life. Even closer to grocery stores and fresh coffee. Quiet and peaceful.

Our little house is built from lost treasures and reclaimed materials. The house is about 700 sq ft, comfortably furnished with everything you'll need and nothing more. Queen bed upstairs, walk-in shower, open, clean and airy. Wireless and Apple TV. We hope you will be delighted and maybe even inspired by the ease and gentleness of our home. There's a compost toilet, wood stove and radiant floor for heat, and us close by to help you get used to these eco-kind alternatives if you are not already familiar with their use. It's easy, really!

We're happy to share this little sanctuary with our guests.

Guest access
Ca
neighborhood_overview: The cabin is super close to downtown in a laid back and friendly neighborhood. It's an easy walk to trails, yoga or delicious coffee.
host_about: My wife and I are long term residents of Asheville (over 19 years). I'm originally from Louisiana, she's originally from Mexico. Love lakes and the ocean, traveling and good food.

Welcome to our Hikers Hideaway Airbnb suited for vacations or business travel! This home away from home is great for Couples, Families or Business. Enjoy your full sized, eat-in kitchen, spacious living room with comfortable seating, 42" flat screen TV with Roku, large bedroom, writing desk, walk-in closet and 1 1/2 baths.

Our Airbnb is peaceful and private yet you are just minutes from the Airport, Sierra Nevada Brewery, WNC AG Center, Biltmore, the Blue Ridge Parkway and all of Asheville!

The space
Looking to go hiking? We are within 30 minutes of Dupont State Park!

Our cozy get away from it all space available for vacations, hiking or business travel, this space provides with a full eat in kitchen, 42 inch flat screen tv with Roku, comfortable seating, a queen size bed, walk-in closet and 1 and 1/2 baths. Its like your home away from home!

Perfect for business travelers, couples and families! Even though our space is
neighborhood_overview: We are lucky enough to be tucked away from residential neighborhoods while still being close enough to amenities such as Sierra Nevada Brewery, Whistle Hop Brewery, fine dining as well as deliciously relaxed, casual eateries and even grocery shopping!  We are close enough to the airport but never hear airport "noise".  Our Airbnb backs up to a great farm with a few cows and a sweet donkey named Molly.  We are less than 25 minutes from The Biltmore and 30 minutes from Dupont State Falls. It is a get away that is close to everything!
host_about: We are a family of three who enjoy living in the mountains, hiking and gardening!  I am a working photographer and my husband is a creative builder and designer of all things outdoors.  We enjoy hosting guests and hope that we create the peaceful retreat you are looking for!

name: Clean and Private Bungalow Apt. in W. Asheville
description:
Welcome to our private apartment in hip West Asheville. Please note that detailed cleaning and precautions are taken seriously for your and our safety. This peaceful retreat is in walking distance to historic West Asheville. Downtown Asheville, breweries and the River Arts District are a short drive or bike ride away. The Blue Ridge Parkway and hiking trails are only 20 minutes for the adventurous explorers. Come experience the beauty of Western North Carolina & our home.

The space
The private apartment was built in 2016. It is easily accessed from the back of the house. Please walk along the right side of the house to the backyard. The backyard is fenced and has a gate that will lead you to your private entrance. A set of french doors on the back porch is your entrance into the apartment. The television offers cable and we have wifi access for you too. We recently added a hot tub to enhance your relaxation while enjoying your vacation. Please make you
neighborhood_overview: We are located in historic West Asheville within walking to restaurants, breweries and bus stops.  This hip neighborhood offers a true Asheville experience and amazing sense of community.  Check out our farmers market on Wednesdays and the local eclectic music scene.
host_about: Live the life you love!   We love traveling, family and life experiences.  Hosting our bNb allows us to provide an affordable place for travelers to stay and meet people from all over the world.  Our family appreciates our guests and is honored for the opportunity to host y'all here in Asheville, NC.

name: Charming Arts & Crafts Home-20 min downtown AVL
description:
FOLLOWING STRINGENT COVID-19 PROTOCOLS: New Arts & Crafts style home with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths and an office/music room (with piano and mountain dulcimer) which will accomodate my queen-size air bed. After sight-seeing, come home to a welcoming 9' x 30' porch with rockers, a home with hardwood floors, gas fireplace, granite countertops, ceramic tile and all the amenities. Be on the Blue Ridge Parkway in 15 minutes, and the Biltmore House and downtown in 20 minutes.

The space
Fully-equipped kitchen waiting for you to prepare a relaxing meal after sight-seeing, and dine on my mother's antique dining room table. Master bedroom has top of the line Temper-Pedic mattress. Lots of toiletries available in both bathrooms. 3rd bedroom has a piano (out of tune, I’m afraid!) and student dulcimer for those musically inclined. House is close to grocery stores and other shopping. I have a queen-size air mattress for additional guests which can be set up in the music room but i
neighborhood_overview: Hyde Park is a brand new development with arts and crafts style homes.
host_about:
Living in the stunning Blue Ridge Mountains, I have a beautiful life working at a retirement community and loving friends and family. Things I can't live without: Gardening, coffee, mountain hikes, playing the dulcimer, writing poetry and lyrics, and laughing with my 28 year-old son.  Some of my favorites: Book - Gentleman from Moscow; movie - Amadeus; music - Rag n Bones Man; travel goals- Scotland and Ireland. I am looking forward to Airbnb helping me get there!

As a guest, I would treat your home as I my own. With respect, care, and the same OCD I bring to my own cleaning. As a host, I offer you integrity and cooperation.

My life mottos:  One day at a time; Do the next right thing.

name: Urban Farm Studio ~ Close to Everything!
description:
Live like a local! Enjoy our private Urban Farm Studio in the peace & quiet of a hip West Asheville neighborhood, with plenty of outdoor green space and a fully fenced yard for your furry friend (under 30 lbs). Relax on the furnished screen porch, or in front of the outdoor fire bowl, walk a mile to West AVL's shops & breweries (it's not far, but it is uphill), or grab a 10-minute Uber to downtown.

The space
Chill out on the cozy private screened porch while you listen to the birds & take in the green space & garden. Walk a mile to West Asheville restaurants & breweries, stroll around the Malvern Hills park, or cool off in the pool, just a block away.

The studio has a queen bedroom, a private bath with a shower, a separate living area/sunporch with a futon & tv, a furnished screened porch, open outdoor deck space, a kitchenette with a dining table & chairs, fridge, single burner, microwave, coffee maker, bar sink, and a full set of dishes & utensils. B
neighborhood_overview: Walk a mile to UpCountry Brewery and Izzy's coffee shop, or adventure a bit further through West Asheville to Sunny Point Cafe, our favorite place for brunch (they serve house-made organic bloody mary's).  Check out West Asheville's breweries: Upcountry, Oyster Brewing, Urban Orchard, Archetype.  Stroll though Malvern Hills park's walking paths, play tennis, or go swimming, just a block away.  Or venture a bit further and follow the greenway to Hominy Creek & Carrier park.
host_about: I love to travel and get to know new places, which is why I love airbnb.  As a host, I try to give guests their space, but I am always available to give suggestions or answer questions.

description:
Description
PLEASE CHECK ALL OUR LUXURY LISTINGS from our Profile Page.
Just 2m to Downtown Asheville, Utopia is a one-of-a-kind animal-free luxury industrial renovation accommodating 6 separate suites with a seasonal shared pool & 24/7x365 hot-tub. Our 7 minute fun Treasure Hunt checkin format is Airbnb approved to protect the R&R our valuable guests seek, so invest your time making this an exceptional Five-Star ZEN-stay!

The space
HOT-TUB AVAILABLE 24/7 X 365 & QUIET HOURS 11PM - 7AM.
UTOPIA POOL OPEN MEMORIAL DAY WEEKEND TO LABOR DAY WEEKEND INCLUSIVE.
PLEASE NOTE - AUTHORIZED PHOTO-SHOOT REQUIRES ENTIRE HOUSE RENTAL SO AS NOT TO DISTURB OTHER GUESTS.
PLEASE CHECK ALL OUR LUXURY LISTINGS from our Profile Page.
STEAMPUNK SUITE DESCRIPTION
Just a 2 mile Uber from Downtown Asheville, Utopia appears to be hidden deep in the countryside, teaming with wildlife and noisy with birds, a sizable driveway and cameras for guest comfort
neighborhood_overview: Chunns Cove is a world unto itself, appearing to be hidden deep in the countryside and teeming with wildlife and birdsong. Please check your Guest Clip-board for Host Favorites to Live Like a Local!
host_about: Well-immersed in the pastry and chocolate world for several decades, there is nothing on Marc’s list of culinary delights that features higher than chocolate and coffee. Playing a considerable role in both gutting and rebuilding spectacular Chunn’s Cove and Utopia residences, Marc has conclusively proved that watching informative and directional Home Improvement Shows for the best part of adulthood, is akin to learning a new language. Born in Quebec, Marc’s native tongue is French but his English rivals any native tongue and his Spanish ensures trilinguality. Not without her artistic inheritance, Fay’s world is defined as a pleasurable balance between entrepreneur and artist, commencing with a decade of international business travel in her 20’s, evolving to a decade of motherhood punctuated by a successful online decade in the office. Now the time is ripe to spread those four Sagittarian wings for this highly motivated couple are restlessly eager to explore exciting new ventures.

name: Montford Apt w/Deck, Quiet, Private, Walk Downtown
description:
The Hideaway is a totally private 750 sqft. one-bedroom apartment with a spacious living room, dining area, well-appointed kitchenette, queen bed, two large flat-screen TVs, private ensuite bathroom, private covered outdoor deck, and many other amenities. Located in Historic Montford, a short walk to downtown Asheville.

The space
This spacious 750 sqft. apartment is the entire lower level of our home. It offers sophisticated decor and exceptional amenities. The Hideaway has its own entrance and a private covered outdoor deck with ceiling fan and lounge chairs. The bedroom has a very comfortable queen-size bed, antique dresser, reading lamps, a 48-inch flat-screen TV, an ensuite bathroom with shower, and everything you need for a comfortable stay. The living space has a kitchenette, an inviting dining area, a comfortable couch and chair, 55-inch flat-screen TV, books, and board games. Both TVs include Roku Players with Netflix, HBO Max, Showtime, Hulu, Starz, and
neighborhood_overview: Historic Montford is full of history and historic sites and beautiful architecture is everywhere.  The Biltmore Estate is a 3-mile drive as is Biltmore Village.  The Riverside Cemetery is a fascinating place to visit the past with Civil War, Spanish American War, WWI, and WWII gravesites.  There are three neighborhood cafes, which include Nine Mile which is Caribbean-inspired cuisine, Chiesa which is tasty rustic Italian, and All Day Darling for a nice al fresco breakfast or lunch.  The River Arts District is just a few minutes by car and is a one-mile stretch of twenty-two historic and industrial buildings with 200+ working artists and studios.
host_about: We originally came to Asheville on vacation and quickly fell in love with the mountains, waterfalls, exquisite food scene, and friendly people.  We’re really easy-going and down-to-earth and enjoy the simple pleasures in life. We both love to travel, hike, bike, and explore.  Lulu is from Ecuador and was a leather artisan and dance instructor and now enjoys photography, working out and cooking. Matt is originally from California and works in commercial real estate. Our 5 pound Yorkie named Matilda firmly believes she’s a human and can generally be seen in Lulu’s arms with her tongue sticking out.  We’re here to help and hope you enjoy your time in Asheville.

name: Charming Asheville Cottage at Beaver Lake
description:
This beautiful North Asheville cottage is 3.1 miles from downtown & a 2 minute walk to the lake. You'll love the indoor & outdoor space. Whether you're here to explore funky Asheville, music, the arts, shop till you drop or explore the outdoors & nature, this private lower level English Walkout cottage is perfect for relaxation & serenity. Long stays available; we’ve only blocked dates to deep clean between guests - message us. (URL HIDDEN)City of Asheville Permit Number: (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).

The space
We LOVE our Asheville home and the surrounding mountains - and you will too. Our cozy lower level guest unit is a place you will remember... for all the right reasons. Privacy and nature - and only 3.1 miles to downtown! The private driveway and parking lead to the lower level cottage with an oversized covered deck facing tiered gardens for that wonderful al-fresco feeling. A great place to sit and enjoy the outdoors while sipping that delicious glass of win
neighborhood_overview: The upscale neighborhood at Beaver Lake is simply gorgeous.   We are surrounded by the Blue Ridge Mountains (Blue Ridge Parkway!), lovely homes, nature and gardens, privacy, and beautiful Beaver Lake which has a running/walking trail all the way around it - about 1.75 miles.   The Bird Sanctuary is a short walk away by the lake.  It is 2 minutes downhill to the lake and 8 minutes (3.1 miles) by car to downtown Asheville!
host_about:
I am a wife, Mother, musician, gardener, intrepid spirit, entrepreneur, nature lover, singer, former hippie (what else in Asheville?), designer, painter, writer, avid reader, activist, questioner of the status quo, with the soul of a gypsy.  Why this man married me?   He's a bit of a gypsy himself.  

My life's motto:  Life is short.  Enjoy the journey.

name: Large 2 bed loft in W. Avl, bring the whole family
description:
Centrally located in West Asheville and next to the River arts district. Walk to restaurants, Microbreweries, coffee shops, music venues and my favorite, Ice Cream at "The Hop". A luxury stay without the cost of downtown Prices .. You’ll love my place because you can literally walk out of your front door and you are in the middle of whats considered the most friendly , walk-able neighborhood in Asheville. The apt comes with parking.. only 3 mins to downtown by car.

The space
what I love about the space is that its like gong back to a private spa resort. No matter what weve doing during the day, Galleries, Out for a Hike, floating on the river or catching a concert, we can always head back to the loft, never an issue with parking, Enjoy the views from one of the many the outdoor decks ( you can see the mountains surrounding the city), watch an incredible sunset, make dinner at home if you are too tired to head back out, share a drink with friends or just chil
neighborhood_overview: West asheville is just so convenient.  We chose to be here because its just friendly, walkable, offers tons of options all within walking distance ( cant emphasize how cool that is late in the evening when you dont feel like driving) and most importantly, the locals are a great mix of everyone( young, old, families etc)
host_about: My wife and I love everything about Asheville.  Im a real estate Agent and she is a Yoga instructor.  We started coming here about 10 years ago and simply fell in love with it.  We are huge outdoor enthusiasts. From hiking, tubing , climbing and of course the micro-brewers and art scene, theres so much to do here that youll wish you had more time.  If your new to the area , we would be happy to make suggestions to make sure you get the most out of your time during your visit.  look forward to hosting you :)

description:
Great landing zone if you’re looking to move to Asheville permanently.

Off-street parking beside the carport. Walk across the deck to your own little building: Bed, Bath, kitchenette. Heated and Air-conditioned, fast free internet, Roku TV (ie netflix etc), back yard pond, deck.

Very quiet neighborhood, 6 minutes (2 miles) to Mission Hospital, 8 min to downtown.

The space
Private building, not shared with me or anyone else. The bathroom has shower and toilet; the sink is in the kitchen area.
Nice wide parking space beside the carport; ramp to the tiny house.
Wi-fi is high-speed and reliable.

Guest access
Kitchenette: Refrigerator, microwave, sink, dishes;
Shower: towels, soap, shampoo
Couch / bed with good mattress
Other: desk and chair, rack for hanging clothes, shelves, night stands.

Other things to note
Backyard pond, deck.
neighborhood_overview: Very quiet; big trees; close to Biltmore Village.  Nice walk down Brookshire and back up Reed. Drive 2 miles to French Broad River Park for a nice run beside the river.  There's a big dog park there too.
host_about:
Retired white guy who likes to fix things. 
I was a successful information technology developer / manager / entrepreneur.
Retired in 2018.  Now I fix up the house and invent things. 
I can suggest things to do in Asheville, even have breakfast with you maybe - or leave you to your own devices and all the privacy you might want.  You do have your own tiny house, after all....

name: Explore Asheville at a Bright Pad with Pops of Rich Red
description: Browse art galleries downtown, then admire this light-filled apartment's collection of pieces inspired by the surrounding mountains and local graffiti. Pull up a floral and perspex dining chair and people-watch from the bay window over lunch.
neighborhood_overview: North Ann Street runs perpendicular to Haywood Street and Patton Avenue in the heart of downtown Asheville. The apartment is close to nightlife, public transport, the city center, the airport, and parks.
host_about:
The owner, Jeremy Goldstein has made 32 North Ann Street a project since he purchased the property in 2002, slowly make improvements and while running his business in the building directly next door. 

Over the past 20 years, Jeremy has built a successful multi-disciplinary real estate practice. Jeremy graduated cum laude from Duke University in 1994 with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Public Policy Studies. He held salesperson licenses in Virginia, Maryland, and the District of Columbia and currently maintains broker licenses in North Carolina and South Carolina.

Mr. Goldstein advises private and institutional investors nationwide in the acquisition, disposition, and financing of commercial property. 
He married an Asheville native, and together they moved to Asheville to raise their four sons.  He spends his  “free” time traveling with his family to their sons’ sporting events. Eventually, he hopes to get back to hiking and biking in the beautiful mountains of Western North Carolina. But for now he manages to get to Crossfit — unfortunately well before the sun comes up, in addition to serving as Chairman of  Asheville Planning & Zoning Commission and board member to Irene Wortham Center.

description:

Business travelers, couples, and solo adventurers from all backgrounds, ethnicities, religions, and sexual orientations are welcome here!

The space
Our private guest bedroom and sunporch are waiting for you! Located in North Asheville just 10 minutes from downtown we offer a quiet private setting for you to relax. *We live in the other part of the house and have a private entrance, too.

neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is very quiet and surrounded by woods. Even though we are close to downtown Asheville you would never know it!
We live in the mountains and in a beautiful cove. Due to this location guests can often find the cell signal to be spotty depending on your carrier. (The internet wifi is consistent and strong).

There is always something fun to do in Asheville including music, arts, and interesting restaurants.

description:

Includes a private full bath, wi-fi, meditation space, a desk, a mini-fridge, & coffee maker all in a comfy quiet neighborhood. It's great for couples, solo adventurers, & business travelers.

The space
It's own private building with it's own private full bath. A lockbox and key, allows you to come and go as you wish. It's a quiet and pretty space with lots of windows and wood throughout.

Guest access
You can park in the driveway or in front of our house. The Zen Cabin is at the end of the driveway to the left of our house. There is a separate entrance for guest access to which guests have their own keys.

Other things to not
neighborhood_overview: We live in an historic neighborhood, called Norwood Park right on the edge of Grove Park.  We are surrounded by tree-lined streets and historic homes.  Situated just north of downtown, between Merrimon and Kimberly Avenues.  Less than 2 miles from downtown Asheville and less than 1 mile from The Omni Grove Park Inn.  Great location, close to everything, while being relaxing and quiet.
host_about: I live in Asheville,NC with my husband and two children.  We have our own business delivering grass fed and glass bottled local milk.  My husband, Jonathon, is a playwright, turned Zen Buddhist monk, turned milkman.  I home-school our kids and work as an Adjunct Professor at UNCA teaching Humanities and Philosophy of Religion classes. We've spent a lot of time out West and love the Big Sky, but our wanderlust has brought us all over the world.  While we're "Being  Here Now," we love to camp and hike with our dog, Rosie,  along the Blue Ridge as much as we can.

name: ~Front Porch Retreat~Sleeps 5~2.5 mi to D/T~
description:
Our Front Porch Retreat is a cozy place to stay for hikers, families, business travelers, & UNC-A visitors. We have a big front porch, fully-stocked kitchen, and great shower!
Our renovated home is located in a MODEST and quaint little Blue Ridge Mt. neighborhood that is being revitalized. We are situated close to the French Broad River, River Arts District, Zillacoah Brewery, UNC-A, & 5 min (2.5 mi.) to downtown Asheville: VIA BROADWAY. Uber comes here! Book your trip to AVL with us today!

The space
Our space is unique because it was built one hundred and one years ago, and has been restored to its original condition. Superstitious Southerners often painted their porch ceilings "haint" blue, a soft blue-green, to ward off evil spirits called haints. So when you arrive, look up at the porch ceiling and you'll see the "haint blue"! The cast iron sink in the laundry room is one of the original (c. 1918) features I left in the house and shows its age a little,
neighborhood_overview:
This 101-year-old neighborhood is in transition, with homes slowly but surely being renovated. We are happy to be a part of this neighborhood’s revitalization, that had previously been impacted by too little financial input. It is a modest, safe, and quiet neighborhood. The neighbors include several elderly folks, teachers, nurses, sales people, and school employees.

The neighborhood has a children's playground down the street from our house. Our Visitors' Manual will give you ideas on places to eat and shop nearby. Lots of guests use Uber to go downtown, which costs between $7-12, depending on time and flow.

We enjoy going to the City Bakery, Biscuit Head, High Five, or Corner Kitchen for breakfast. The fabulous White Duck Taco is down the street about a mile!
host_about: George and I love the mountains. We found this 1918 bungalow in an old millwork village neighborhood and decided to fix it up for ourselves and guests, like you. Our day trips hiking and looking at beautiful mountain ranges are mixed with eating at great farm-to-table restaurants and listening to music at some of the best venues around! Book your next trip with us today!

name: Spectacular Views Minutes from Downtown
description:
You will be close to breweries and outdoor activities in all of Asheville (12 minutes to downtown). Our home is right off the Blue Ridge Parkway with amazing views. Amenities include a private and spacious bedroom and bathroom, large lounge area, outdoor patio with lights, daily coffee and tea, private fridge with complimentary local brews, and a wet bar. There are mountain trails of every skill level nearby for biking or hiking.

The space
Beautiful bright rooms with breathtaking views of the Bull Creek Valley and the Craggy Ridge of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Our house is only 12 minutes to downtown Asheville, less than 10 minutes to spectacular foliage on the Blue Ridge Parkway, and 15 minutes to Black Mountain. Some of the area's best breweries are within 10-15 minutes of our home. We can answer any question about area attractions and provide great recommendations for restaurants.

Guest access
Guest access is the entire downstairs area, o
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very small, about five houses, and we all know each other. It is very peaceful throughout the day and night.
host_about:
Traveling.  My wife and I have traveled together since 2008, visiting locations such as Romania, Jordan, Kuwait, Spain, Iceland, Denmark, Sweden, Greece, Thailand, Peru, Seychelles, Belize, Mexico, Germany, Finland, Poland, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia, Brazil, Canada, Ecuador, Chile (and Easter Island), Argentina, Spain, Uruguay, and back to Iceland.  Anna traveled to Ireland, France, England, and Italy before we met so I expect we will have to go back to those places at some point.  Most of our travel within the United States has been for music festivals such as Coachella and Austin City Limits.

After traveling all over the United States for work, I spent approximately two years in Kuwait, Afghanistan, and Iraq between 2010 and 2012.  I now work from home and rather enjoy not having to deal with airports every week.

Eating.  I like to try new things.  Fermented shark?  No problem, but never again.

Drinking.  I am a fan of beer and whiskey.

TV.  I like to watch sports and Netflix.  Anna likes to watch Law and Order and Murder, She Wrote.

Our style of hosting is hands off.  We are here to answer any questions you might have but your time is your time.  You will rarely hear or see us while you are a guest.  That is how we like it when we travel and I’d venture to say most others do as well.

description:
4 bdrm 2 bath spacious home in a city setting! We are located across from business and a factory! If this bothers you this may not be the best rental to fit your needs. located 2.6 miles to downtown Asheville. High speed WiFi and ROKU on all TVs through the house! Large decks on both sides and very big driveway! We have an arcade pacman game, cornhole, and 6 free tubes for guests to use on the French broad river which is just across the street as well as other games etc.

The space
Neighborhood is very small and we are located across from businesses as well as a factory. House is definitely in a city setting very close to attractions. The kitchen is newly renovated with a flat top glass stove, 2 sinks, Granite counter-tops, Dishwasher, & large 2 door fridge. There are 4 bdrms and 2 baths total. The master bdrm is located downstairs and has a full size bed and its own bathroom with bathtub and shower plus toilet and sink. The other bdrms are upstairs and 2 contain
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is small. We are surrounded by a couple businesses and a factory. The rental still is in a nice location for those who like a city setting close to attractions. Only two houses around that are separated by privacy fence. Both neighbors are quiet, nice ppl. This home is literally minutes from downtown asheville. Trees surround the property for the most part and the house is on a private drive. You are also about a quarter mile across from the french broad river. There are tube rental places located about a mile up the rd which is very popular here in the summer.
host_about: My name is Ralph Maltry! I am a life long resident here in Asheville and have owned this home for 25 years! I am a business owner and a contractor here as well. My true passion is building anything & everything lol... 5 things i couldn't live without are 1.Work 2.Family 3. My dog Ava 4.Building 5. friends. I travel a lot for work and my most favorite places to travel are Gatlinburg, TN & Myrtle Beach, SC. I have been visiting those places for many years and they are definitely my top travel destinations. I do not watch much T.V at all and enjoy books about Building, Contracting, and anything that has to do with my business. I work a lot and if i am in town and not working i will most likely be in the smaller guest house on the same property. I am not able to always meet every guest because i am very busy and in and out of town but i keep in close contact through Airbnb messaging and encourage texts, calls from guests who have any questions or concerns. Most of the time i will not be there so every guest will receive instructions the day of check-in on where your house key is and all other info you will need! My life motto is you get what you put in. Meaning to me that hard work always pays off and is the only way to get what you desire in this life! My hosting style is pretty laid back. I give you plenty of space and privacy but am just a call away if you happen to need anything.

Offering one queen bed, a twin day bed and an extra twin mattress to comfortably sleep 4, (can accommodate up to 6 w/ added qn air mattress). A sweet space w/ full bath, laundry, a mini split (air control), a kitchenette, a nice soft insulating floor great for yogis, littles learning to mobilize, and keeping winter tootsies warm. Close to the BRP, Biltmore, breweries, the airport & downtown.

The space
Our place is close to all sorts of restaurants from Tupelo Honey to Pho and Indian. Swift access to the Blue Ridge Parkway and a quick jaunt to the Biltmore and it’s village. Breweries abound, and downtown as well as the airport are but a stone’s throw.
Not to mention an internationally celebrated portrait photographer and a licensed massage therapist/yoga teacher are your hosts and you can book our services as well!!
We look forward to helping make
neighborhood_overview:
We are in south asheville about 15 minutes to downtown or the airport and just shy of 20 to any other part of town.

Please, ask us about transport if you are planning to “go out on the town”.

The neighborhood is quiet and family oriented with great walking and a little green space.

Our house is nestled in a hill with wonderful winter views and hugged by trees the rest of the year.
host_about:
I've a vagabond heart, my head in the clouds and my feet firmly rooted in the southern ground. 
I could be described as a homeowner, yoga teacher, massage therapist, artist, writer, friend, sister, partner, peach, traveler, student, vegetarian Virgo Vata and I'm sure many other things. A lover of life and exploration. My partner and I have a new air bnb in Asheville NC and are excited to let that help us travel and play more. Yoga teacher meets photographer and the rest, is history...

name: A mountain escape with city comfort
description:
This beautiful duplex borders Pisgah National Forest and is less than 15 minutes from downtown and the Biltmore Estate. Less than 5 minutes down the road, you can shop at the outlet mall or access the Blue Ridge Parkway. Take a tube down the French Broad river, explore the River Arts District, or even sip a beer at one of Asheville's many breweries. Great for couples, families, and large groups.

The space
This is one of the few places in Asheville where you can feel like your staying in the woods while actually being down the street from many of Asheville's popular places to visit.

Guest access
Kitchen, grill, Netflix, wifi, closets in every bedroom

Other things to note
This is one unit of a duplex. This unit has three bedrooms and two bathrooms.
neighborhood_overview: Very close proximity to attractions while still being nestled in the forest.
host_about: I work for emergency services in Asheville and my wife works in assisted living. My family helps to run a rental in Asheville. We hope to offer everyone a very budget friendly stay for their families and friends. We love to travel and appreciate a nice place to rest for the next adventure. We love the outdoors, so if you have any questions about activities around Asheville feel free to ask.

name: Master bedroom in the heart of West Asheville
description:
Have your own private sleeping quarters just a stone's throw from everything West Asheville has to offer! You can surprisingly enjoy a quiet walk down my street; however at the end of the street is Haywood-home to numerous cafes, bars, & restaurants! Additionally, you are 2miles from downtown & 10 minutes from the Blueridge Prkwy. Under 'The Space' click on 'more' & read EVERYTHING under Guest Access, & if you have questions or need more details, please message me via AirBnB prior to booking.

The space
Your 'home away from home' is a medium-sized dwelling which was built around 1930. Although I am an acupuncturist not an artist, I have been told that my home has a warm, artsy feel to it. Currently, I cannot afford a landscaper so please do not be put off by my somewhat 'wild' front yard. The house is in an excellent location & has an arts-n-crafts stye charm, without being extravagant! After clicking on 'more' & reading everything under guest access, if you ha
neighborhood_overview: You will be less than 15minutes from the Biltmore & the Blue Ridge Parkway! (Sometimes I get discounted tickets to the Biltmore so if interested, please ask). And you are less than 10 minutes from the French Broad river &  the river park.  Additionally, many restaurants & bars are within WALKING distance. There are 7 local restaurants/bars at the end of this street (and Sunny Point Cafe and The Admiral are just a few blocks away ). Also within walking (actually skipping, its that close) distance are a grocery store, health food store (the West Village Market), post office, & library (also an eccentric video rental store, Orbitz, that still thrives even with all the online amenities such as Netflix). It is a quiet street for walking, but at the end of it lies a bustling night life with bars & live music- The ISIS Music Hall is one such place. Several bars are conveniently stumbling distance from your sleeping quarters.
host_about: I am a 45 yr old female. I lived in WY near the Tetons for 13 yr and now reside in Asheville, NC. My job is my passion; I am an acupuncturist (& also a science enthusiast) & work with my patients using vitamins, herbs, & nutrition. I love to travel & meet people & enjoy delicious &/or interesting food, and love music & the outdoors. I especially love anything to do with the water! (I used to coach swimming& swam competitively).  I love world music, funk, and bluegrass. Like I said , I love to travel but these days I am limited due to my work (which I love) and needing to be closer to my parents (who I used to never see when I was away from the South most of the time).

name: Cozy--private entrance and bath,  central location
description:
After taking a break during the pandemic, we are up and running again. We are in the process of making a few updates and will post new photos soon.
Located in a beautiful, safe neighborhood of single family homes, two miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway, four miles to downtown or Biltmore, seven miles to the River Arts District. Easy access to the interstate makes our home convenient to all area attractions.
We welcome and value diversity. Best for couples and solo travelers.

The space
After a full day of adventures, come home to a peaceful and inviting space.
The bedroom features a comfortable full size bed, a sitting area with recliner and laptop table, and a wardrobe for hanging clothes as well as plenty of drawer space.
--SPECIAL NOTE ABOUT PRIVACY AND NOISE: with any shared home space, there will probably be some shared noise. The sound does travel both directions in our home, but we respect your privacy and use a sound machine ups
neighborhood_overview: Awesome neighborhood surrounding municipal golf course with old oak trees and great roads for walking or running.
host_about:
David and I have lived in Asheville for twenty-five years. We love calling these mountains our home.  We have an organic vegetable and flower garden in our front yard and a beautiful sitting area out back.
We enjoy meeting new people and sharing the treasures of Asheville.  Honoring diversity is one of our highest values and we are happy to welcome people from all walks of life into our space.

description:
PLEASE CHECK ALL OUR LUXURY LISTINGS from our Profile Page.
Just 2m to Downtown Asheville, Utopia is a one-of-a-kind animal-free luxury industrial renovation accommodating 6 separate suites with a seasonal shared pool & 24/7x365 hot-tub. Our 7 minute fun Treasure Hunt checkin format is Airbnb approved to protect the R&R our valuable guests seek, so invest your time making this an exceptional Five-Star ZEN-stay!

The space
HOT-TUB AVAILABLE 24/7 X 365 & QUIET HOURS 11PM - 7AM.
UTOPIA POOL OPEN MEMORIAL DAY WEEKEND TO LABOR DAY WEEKEND INCLUSIVE.
PLEASE NOTE - AUTHORIZED PHOTO-SHOOT REQUIRES ENTIRE HOUSE RENTAL SO AS NOT TO DISTURB OTHER GUESTS.
PLEASE CHECK ALL OUR LUXURY LISTINGS from our Profile Page.
BRICKHOUSE SUITE DESCRIPTION
Just a 2 mile Uber from Downtown Asheville, Utopia appears to be hidden deep in the countryside, teaming with wildlife and noisy with birds, a sizable driveway and cameras for guest comfort and safety.
neighborhood_overview: Chunns Cove is a world unto itself, appearing to be hidden deep in the countryside and teeming with wildlife and birdsong. Please check your Guest Clip-board for Host Favorites to Live Like a Local!
host_about: Well-immersed in the pastry and chocolate world for several decades, there is nothing on Marc’s list of culinary delights that features higher than chocolate and coffee. Playing a considerable role in both gutting and rebuilding spectacular Chunn’s Cove and Utopia residences, Marc has conclusively proved that watching informative and directional Home Improvement Shows for the best part of adulthood, is akin to learning a new language. Born in Quebec, Marc’s native tongue is French but his English rivals any native tongue and his Spanish ensures trilinguality. Not without her artistic inheritance, Fay’s world is defined as a pleasurable balance between entrepreneur and artist, commencing with a decade of international business travel in her 20’s, evolving to a decade of motherhood punctuated by a successful online decade in the office. Now the time is ripe to spread those four Sagittarian wings for this highly motivated couple are restlessly eager to explore exciting new ventures.

name: CozyCottageWalk2town, available August 2-10
description:
Welcome, the heart of town. 4 blocks to AYC Yoga 3wkDISCOUNT, . NO CLEANING/hidden fees. I will be gone,2 bedrooms available at this time in August. Ask about flexible dates. DT Food&Music. Cozy home yoga/meditation students, outdoor/art/music explorers. Natural, composting household, no smoke/ drugs. Older, clean home w character. Whole house air filter. Small private room w full comfy organic mattress House totally available, the host will not be present for the 1st week in August.

The space
WELCOME ALL. For 3week yoga students,discount. AND There are pollinator plants and a fig tree in the front, some gardens in the back. I make smoothies using greens and medicinal herbs from the yard! The bedroom is a small cozy room in the back of this 100 year old home. Featured is a new organic mattress sitting on a natural wood bed frame. There is closet and shelf space, nightstand with light and room for books. This house is well used and cleaned with natural clean
neighborhood_overview:
This house is only FOUR blocks from Asheville Yoga Center, walking distance to numerous tea/coffee/bone broth cafes, lunch and dinner options and downtown with its dazzling array of craft, clothing and unique stores, and eateries. Walk to the Renaissance Hotel for a workshop as a recent guest did.
There are two good movie houses of alternative and unusual movies, many breweries and music venues. The neighborhood was traditionally African American and is still a beautiful mix of young artists, families, and various ethnic backgrounds. Black musicians in the early days, would stay on this street when they came into town to play.
host_about: Asheville is a thriving town and I want to share her with you.  I am a fiddler and music lover, gardener and mental health worker.  Traveling through Europe, camping for years in Hawaii, and being a couch surfer has given me the gifts of connecting, caring, having fun, playing together and respecting space and time. I love to eat healthy and may sometimes have a smoothy available. We have the choice to make each moment great by appreciating it and feeling the feelings.  I have hosted numerous yoga students, musicians, business people, adventure and music seekers.  Come visit, walk to town, marvel at the mountains and take some cool mountain air home with you.
