name: Dog-Friendly Home close to Downtown Asheville
description:
Let 4-legged friends run free in the large fenced backyard, while their owners enjoy the front deck's mountain view, as well as the gas grill and fire pit. Pieces by local artists are featured inside, along with fun items like a safe repurposed as a table.

This home has gone through a complete remodel within the last few years but still maintains all of the character and charm that was built into it in 1960. The house has two bedrooms, with two queen beds, and a queen sleeper sofa. It's in a quiet neighborhood and has great views of the night sky but is still conveniently located to downtown.
neighborhood_overview: Situated on a large lot in a quiet neighborhood, this property affords total privacy.  Within a mile are a grocery store and several restaurants. Close by as well are The Blue Ridge Parkway, Downtown Asheville, The Biltmore Estate, and Lake Lure.
host_about:
Just a hard working ole cuss trying to get out of the rat race. 

I enjoy remodeling houses, design, and thrift shopping, but my real passions are long walks on the beach, playing with my mutt, Pita, and vigilante justice.

name: HOPS, Skip and a Jump to Downtown and River Arts
description:
Located in the heart of AVL, the sidewalk will take you to the downtown and River Arts District areas.

COMPLETE privacy: King bed in bedroom, small sectional sofa w/single bed option in living room, full kitchen, serene screened in porch, 65" TV w/ Netflix & local channels & coffee bar.

Curate, Orange Peel, Wicked Weed = 1 mi
Vivian & The Grey Eagle = .4 mi
New Belgium, Riverwalk, Hi Wire & Wedge = .6 mi
Biltmore = 2.8 mi

The space
As someone who enjoys using Airbnb when I travel, I have tried to select nicer things for my guests to enjoy (towels, bedding, furniture, etc). Guests have used words like "cozy," "quiet," "refreshing" and "relaxing" to describe their experiences in the apartment.

Guest access
Complete privacy and access to the guest apartment. For security purposes, your personal code to the front door will be provided the day of your arrival.

Other things to note
$
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on the hill above Owens Bell Park on Clingman Avenue, so there are distant mountain views and closer views of downtown's buildings from the living room and bedroom windows. The apartment is also on a dead end street which is great as there is no through traffic. The WECAN neighborhood is a quiet and incredibly friendly place. You couldn't ask for a better home base during your time in Asheville!
host_about: I love new experiences and meeting new people so Airbnb is a great fit for me as a traveler and host. Being a great guest is just as important and rewarding as being a great host and I take both very seriously. I have traveled most of Europe, the US, Canada and Mexico and have been to Iceland, Greenland, Morocco, Costa Rica and the BVIs. I am always looking forward to the next adventure!

name: Asheville Tiny House
description:
Experience tiny living in this unique 20 foot long tiny house! Located inside the Pisgah National Forest in Bent Creek close to hiking, mountain biking, the Blue Ridge Parkway and French Broad River. Situated in the far corner of my backyard, in a suburban neighborhood. This tiny house is quiet and private and boasts a kitchen, bathroom, queen sized bed and loft for lounging. Parking on the street. Only 9 miles from downtown Asheville and 2 miles to the outlet mall. Uber and Lyft available.

The space
This tiny house is tucked away in my quiet suburban backyard, outside Asheville city limits, but still close to everything! Minutes away from the Blue Ridge Parkway and access to the French Broad river. Mountain biking trails start a little over a mile away. And only a 20 minute drive into downtown Asheville. The backyard is a shared space. Feel free to use the fire pit and bring a hammock to hang from the giant oak tree.

This tiny house is a BRA
neighborhood_overview:
The Asheville Regional Airport (AVL) is just 7 and a half miles away.

The neighborhood is like taking a step back into a 1970s suburb. People walk their dogs and wave to each other when passing, kids ride bikes, it's quiet and peaceful.
host_about:
I'm a writer, filmmaker and photographer.  I love to travel and used to work on cruise ships.  I've been to all 7 continents, I know how to make beer, I had a short film play at the Cannes Film Festival, I've been skydiving, scuba diving, bungee jumping and Zorbing.

I'm lucky enough to live in a mountain biking mecca.  I can go from my backdoor to mountain biking trails.  I bike the parkway regularly and I'm still just a short drive into downtown.  I love where I live and I'm so happy to have the opportunity to share this place with others.

name: Retro Vintage-West Asheville Urban Abode
description: Embrace the alluring aesthetics of this urban space. The residence features a vibrant dark blue interior contrasted by bright yellow surfaces, antique furnishings, vintage art, and varied motifs!
neighborhood_overview:
West Asheville is a unique city neighborhood with lots of fun places to visit, including restaurants, breweries,massage school, bookstore, coffee shops,Yoga studio, live music and much more. Visit the Isis Music Hall for an elegant dinner and concert.
Craving a burger and milkshake? Try the Comfort Diner.
There are lots of families, skateboarders, dogs, and friendly people of all sorts.
host_about: Hi I'm Elisa, I have lived in the Asheville area for over 10 years and am originally from Chicago. I moved here of course for the mountains and beautiful weather not to mention all the beautiful hiking trails. I can't wait to meet great people from all around the world! I enjoy visiting all the wonderful vintage and antique shops in the area and on my days off enjoy cooking and baking. Strolling to one of the area pubs with a neighbor for a glass of wine and live local music is of course a  must. I look forward to hosting you!

name: Nanny's Place in the Great Smoky Mountains
description:
Clean, safe, peaceful home located just 2.5 miles to shops & dining in Biltmore Village and Biltmore Estate main gate, 2 miles to Blue Ridge parkway, 5 miles to downtown, 6 miles to the River Arts District; grocery, restaurants and delicious coffee less than 3 miles away. Well appointed kitchen, lots of space, 3BR/2BA, super comfy beds. Great for couples / business travelers / friends getaway / family reconnect-time or SOLO retreats.

The space
-CLUTTER FREE - Spacious 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom home (in residential neighborhood) with living, dining, kitchen and outdoor areas.
-Calm spaces (remember that novel you never have the time to start?......this is a great place to read it)
-Private deck for quiet, meditative yoga, sipping wine and making s'mores around the firepit.
-BBQ & picnic area - Coleman propane grill available for use, $10 additional (charge covers propane and grill clean up).
-Alfresco breakfast area
-Corn Hole toss game
neighborhood_overview:
-"Nanny's Place " is located in Buncombe county limits which allows for ENTIRE home rentals! (Asheville city limits does not allow entire house rentals anymore).
-We are within 3 miles of the Biltmore Estate
-Quiet residential neighborhood with other houses in close proximity.
- Driveway is also an easement to the house behind mine do not block the driveway
- Please respect others, no loud, unnecessary noises. Quiet hours are 10PM-7AM.
-There is an occasional train that passes and can be heard in the distance.
-For the kids - parks and the library are a very short distance from the house.
-Great food and brewery options within a 3 mile drive toward Biltmore Village via Sweeten Creek Rd. Check out the GUIDEBOOK attached to my listing (a copy can also be found in the blue binder in the living room)
host_about:
Proud USAF veteran.  Love to travel, favorite place is Germany.  Can't live without my ELVIS movies, popcorn & raisinets and Lavender Honey liquid truffle from The Chocolate Lounge (downtown).  Sunday brunch at Grove Park Inn is a must.  A day at the Biltmore Estate transports me back to Europe.  Best sleep is after a visit to the Salt Cave.
As an Asheville native, I'm proud to share my city and home with you.  I hope you enjoy Nanny's Place....RELAX and BE WELLl!!

name: City Serenity
description:
Private terrace level suite in my partially renovated home. Two bedrooms, one bath, living room + kitchenette. Quiet neighborhood convenient to downtown, interstate and much more. Owner lives upstairs in this urban duplex.
Private entrance, living room with large window view of woods. Microwave/ toaster, Keurig+ coffee, agave nectar, welcome cold filtered water. One mile hilly walk or quick uber ride to center of downtown, restaurants, music venues and festivals.

The space
Spacious (900sq ft)duplex unit, entrance porch halfway down driveway. No inside door that connects this space with the upstairs. Is above ground, not a basement. Eclectic throughout. Feels like a rustic mountain cabin. Natural gas heat, new central air and renovated bathroom. New windows throughout. Because it is on the terrace level it stays cooler in the summer and warmer in winter. Strict no smoking or pets.

Guest access
Front door has an electronic lock.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a neighborhood of mostly single family homes, quiet, peaceful -- but very close to the center of Asheville.
It is also close to the best local ice cream shop, Ultimate Ice Cream, the best local BBQ place, Luella's, and a unique local pizza eatery, brewery and movie house, Asheville Pizza and Brewing Company, all N on Merrimon.
host_about:
Love living where the green outdoors is all around me as is the spirit of art and musical creativity. So revere flowers in bloom and eclectic decor. A retired Lactation Consultant, I hold dear a baby's smile and the miracle of new life, human, animal and plant. 
I grew up in California, but have lived in the Asheville area for over 29 years. I am a past Peace Corp volunteer, in the Dominican Republic. I have traveled to Peru (Machu Pichu), Kenya, Venezuela, Costa Rica, Tuscany, Italy and, many of the National Parks in the United States. You will see evidence of this in the decor of my home.

name: Cozy Cottage in the Woods Near Biltmore
description:
This charming guest house backs up to the Biltmore Estate forest, and is a short drive from downtown Asheville, the antiques district, restaurants, breweries, and hiking trails. We have recently restored this beautiful little cabin, which is one of the original Biltmore buildings. You'll love the comfortable bed, front porch, gorgeous decor, wooded surroundings & new bathroom with heated tile floors and a 1933 claw foot tub. Perfect for couples looking for a romantic getaway and solo travelers.

The space
This rustic barn-red guesthouse has been beautifully restored, and is in a detached house directly behind our residence. Our property is convenient to the Biltmore Estate (it used to be part of the Biltmore property), as well as downtown Asheville, and is set back in the woods. It is a 300 sq foot bedroom/living room plus a large bathroom and features gorgeous heartwood floors, whitewashed pine walls, a fireplace (non-functioning, but with original ‘Biltmore’ s
neighborhood_overview:
We are in a quiet residential neighborhood, and as we are set back in the woods it feels like you are in the middle of nowhere (please note that it is directly behind our house, but we give you privacy). The neighborhood on our side of the street backs up to the Biltmore Estate and we are within sight (depending on the time of year) of the beautiful Busbee Reservoir. Our neighborhood borders the Biltmore Antiques district, which is any antique lover’s dream come true! We have a map available of the best places to go antiquing, and we are happy to tell you our favorite places so that you can find what you are looking for.

There are several shopping centers nearby that include pharmacies, grocery stores, athletic facilities and big box stores, within ~5-10 minutes you can drive to the entrance to the Biltmore Estate, and we are only ~10 minutes from downtown Asheville. We are also close to an entrance to the National Parkway. There is an independent coffee shop nearby, as w
host_about:
~~fully vaccinated~~
I moved back to my hometown of Asheville in 2014 after nearly a decade living in Ireland and Italy, and feel very blessed to be from such a wonderful town!  I teach cooking classes (mostly Northern Italian, cheese making, gluten free baking), work with my family's publishing company, and you can find me playing guitar, banjo or bass in many of the 1920's and 30's jazz bands around town.

CDC certified cleaned with independent HVAC system. Enjoy a craft beer at your favorite brewery, visit the Biltmore Estate,hikes, etc all from this Modern ground level apartment with South Asian flare, set in a storybook Tudor in downtown. Short (0.9 mile) walk to the CENTER of downtown, Trader Joe's (0.4 miles), Whole Foods (0.3 miles), High Five Coffee (0.3 miles) and Archetype brewing (0.3 miles). NOT handicap accessible & although we have soundproofed ceilings, there is some footfall noise.

The space
Newly constructed ground level apartment in brand new storybook Tudor just blocks from downtown Asheville with it's own independent HVAC system. Your home away from home will be the entire ground floor apartment complete with private entrance, kitchenette, 2 bedrooms and a bathroom. We do live upstairs on the first and second floor, and while the ceiling above you is soundproofed we find there is still some footstep noise at times, so if you wake from any little
neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location! 4 or less blocks from Green Life (Whole Foods), Trader Joe's, a 24 hour grocery store, the Moog factory and, of course, downtown Asheville. The 5 points area of Montford is possibly the most convenient neighborhood to everything. Habitat Brewing, Asheville's newest brewery, is just down the street.
host_about: I have always dreamed of owning a bed and breakfast, and while that was always out of reach this was not! We feel so lucky to be able to help people make the most of their time away from home, be it a vacation or a business trip. We love our city and know it well and it is our pleasure to tailor an amazing trip to Asheville specified to you. From having a special drink or birthday cake sitting when you arrive to recommending hiking, eating and drinking spots, please let us know more about your trip here and how we can help make it perfect!

description: Awaken naturally as morning light enters through high windows in a vaulted ceiling. Make breakfast in a simple kitchen before setting out to explore. Return to an elegantly furnished space, select a book from the collection, and read in peace.
neighborhood_overview: The carriage house is in the historic Montford district, 6 blocks from Downtown Asheville. The neighborhood features Victorian mansions, historic Riverside Cemetery, free Shakespearean performances, cafes, and the Asheville Visitor Center.
host_about: We fell in love with Asheville when we came here on vacation and just never left! Asheville is an inclusive, vibrant place with so much to explore. Our passions are art, cooking, music, travel and building community.

name: Modern Mountain Getaway
description:
Cozy modern apartment with a walk out patio view of our forested back yard. Comfortably simple to suit a traveler's needs.

Located in a safe, quiet, wooded neighborhood that is perfect for walking. Hiking trails on property with occasional visits from foxes, bears, and turkeys.

Public transit access & less than 2 miles from Downtown Asheville and Biltmore Village. Uber & Lyft are both available, quick and affordable.

The space
Our Modern Mountain Getaway is located in the heart of Asheville. Surrounded by woods and nestled between hills, our quiet street is the best of city living. Near enough, but far enough, to enjoy the city and the mountains. The apartment is below our home and has a private rear patio entrance. There is a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker. We have provided glasses, dishes and silverware for your convenience. We've stocked it with snack bars, tea bags and coffee pods. It's a cozy space ready to refresh you for a
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is located just south of downtown less than 2 miles away. It is quiet and wooded with wildlife coexisting. Look for songbirds, turkey, fox and bear! You might hear a train whistle as it travels through Biltmore Village. We are less than a mile away from the Biltmore Estate entrance. Get here now!
host_about: Angela is a glass artist/wife/mom/friend. She loves to travel and meet the people that live where she visits. She loves gardens, food, art and books. She is pretty fun to be around.

name: A Step Back in Time - 1901 Estate Guest Cottage
description:
Take a step back in time in our 1901 Historic Estate's Guest Cottage. Our super cute cottage has a cabin-like charm & tall trees. Peaceful, but also close proximity to major attractions like Biltmore Estate & Downtown Asheville. We have Extremely comfortable beds, a fully-equipped kitchenette, & closet space. Good for couples, girl's weekend, solo adventurers, business travelers, couples with one child. FREE PARKING. (Continue reading for proximity to Biltmore & Downtown.)

The space
Our Guest Cottage is APPROX 470SF and is cleaned and disinfected to high standards. It's located in the quiet backyard of our home. This is a 2 person space max, or 3 if you have a small child.
There are no stairs in the cottage but there are stone steps that incline and lead up to the cottage.
Our home sits on 2.5 acres and was built in 1901. The Cottage is 100 plus years old and the estate caretaker and his family more than likely lived here.

The cottage
neighborhood_overview: We live in South Asheville in a historic neighborhood. It's very quiet here and away from Asheville's hustle and bustle.
host_about: Howdy Folks! My name is Jamie and I am married to Jim. We are both Texans who have lived in Asheville for several years now. Jim grew up around Asheville and always wanted to move back. I wonder why? Lol! Once I visited Asheville, I was sold and so ready to get out of the Texas heat. We live in a historical home and love it, (yes even the endless household projects and tasks). And we love venturing out in nature for exercise!

name: Cardinal King - HOT TUB - MNT VIEWS- Smart TV-WiFi
description:
The best of both worlds; epic back deck with sweeping 180 long range mountain views just minutes from town. Beautiful evening sunsets and morning sunrises. We have self serve breakfast options and snacks always available (for stays under 7 days).

The bedroom boasts a king memory foam mattress which is perfect after a long day of hiking or exploring Asheville. Enjoy the bath just across the hall and the outdoor hot tub.

The space
Private spacious bedroom with farmhouse king bed. Non-smokers only! Bathroom and hot tub is shared with other Airbnb guests.

Enjoy a mountain thunderstorm on the charming covered front porch with adirondack chairs and fantastic view of the picturesque neighborhood with rolling hills and mountains.

On a sunny day lounge on the back deck while surrounded by the beautiful views of the Asheville Mountains as your backdrop. Watch fantastic lightning shows in the distance as thunderstorms roll over the distan
neighborhood_overview: We are just 7.2 miles from downtown and Haywood road. Sunny Point and all that West Asheville’s Haywood had to offer us just 15 minutes away. It’s easy to catch an Uber or Lyft from this location. Downtown and RAD are also ease to get to. The neighborhood is quiet and peaceful and you’ll feel worlds away while still being close to everything.
host_about: I grew up in a bed and breakfast about an hour from Asheville, NC.  My husband and I met at a comedy club in Asheville before taking off to live in Vietnam and Taiwan for a few years.  We got married in Thailand and recently took a trip to Mexico! We love to travel and to host others. My husband can be found either playing the guitar or building things in his workshop and I am usually in the kitchen whipping up something yummy (usually from Asia and impossible to find here). We love to cook, hike, go camping, and read.  We are looking forward to meeting you, staying with you, or hosting you!

Restaurants, shopping, music, art, golfing, tennis, and river rafting nearby. Skiing, 45'' away.

I could go on and on, but fortunately, we keep the local Mountain Express Best of Asheville editions for you to choose your own adventure!

name: Private+clean+comfy+sunny apartment near downtown
description:
This wooded retreat is close to restaurants, breweries, dining, galleries, cafes, shopping, and downtown nightlife, with a 5 minute drive to the heart of Asheville! The house has great views, and is within 10 minutes of the Blue Ridge Parkway.

You’ll love the neighborhood, natural light, comfort and coziness, and the convenient location. This sanctuary is perfect for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers needing a private place to relax, work, reflect, and play.

All are welcome.

The space
I've deliberately kept this space bright, clean, and simple, with basic amenities such as tea and coffee service, a mini fridge and microwave, and dishes. There is no formal kitchen, and no stove or big sink. I also provide basic toiletries in case you forget your own. There ARE curtains on the windows--they were installed after the photos were taken.

Games, puzzles, & playing cards are available for non-screen time. Should you
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in a beautiful historic neighborhood near Beaver Lake, one of Asheville's most scenic places to picnic, run, or walk--and enjoy the bird sanctuary. We are less than 2 miles from the Grove Park Inn, and a mile from UNC-Asheville.

More people walk our street than drive it, and you'll catch cyclists, runners, and new parents with strollers enjoying the quiet neighborhood. My neighbors are kind, not to mention the many dogs on leash being walked. Most everyone is friendly, but will respect your space.

We are just a couple blocks from Merrimon Avenue, home of multiple grocery stores, shops, restaurants, pharmacies, banks, cafes, and other conveniences.
host_about: I am an event and film producer based out of Asheville, North Carolina. I love to travel, ride bikes, trail run, and have great conversation. I have a son who is 11, and we love to travel together, make great food, and play outside!

name: Willow Haven, near Asheville
description:
Go to youtube and type in Willow Haven Asheville for an 8 minute video tour of the house. Secluded clothing optional hot tub, close to lots of cool stuff - Sierra Nevada, AVL Airport, WNC Ag Center, Bold Rock Cidery, NC Arboretum, and Blue Ridge Parkway. Also nearby - Biltmore Estate, downtown Asheville. We typically leave a few local beers and ciders in the fridge for your enjoyment. Really feels like home.

The space
In light of the current COVID19 crisis, you should know that our friend Lisa does the cleaning. She has always been a clean freak, but now, with the risk of COVID, she is being even more careful than usual. You won't be able to find any viruses hanging around this house!

Willow Haven is not your average vacation rental. Check out our reviews for comments like, "best vacation rental we've ever stayed at", and "impeccably clean and well stocked". My wife and I live 3 miles away so we can make sure everything is done right done right.
neighborhood_overview: The house is about 1.5 miles from Biltmore Park (not to be confused with the Biltmore Estate), which is kind of like a mini-town within a town.  It's fairly new and has some of our favorite restaurants (131 Main, LuElla's Barbeque, and Brixx Pizza), bars (Thirsty Monk), a YMCA, and a very nice cinema.
host_about:
My wife, Sheryl, and I built a new home in 2006, a move of about 3 miles.  When we moved out of our former home, we decided to keep it and rent it as a vacation rental - Willow Haven.  We kept it pretty much the way it was when we lived in it, so it really feels like home.  We have been blessed since the beginning with super renters who have consistently taken good care of our home.  In 2016 we switched from another vacation rental website to Airbnb which proved to be a very pleasant and profitable experience. 

In November of 2018 we purchased another home to rent as a vacation rental - Stone's Throw Cottage, which is also listed on Airbnb.  Our first guests arrived on Dec. 21, a wonderful couple.  We are looking forward to another fantastic vacation rental experience!

Well, we've done it again! We just bought a third vacation rental house in October of 2020! Remember When Cottage was built in 1947. We have completely remodeled it and decorated it in retro 40s and 50 style. You'll love it!

Thanks to Airbnb and to all our wonderful guests!  Enjoy your visit!

name: Traveler's Home. Monthly rates.
description:
Furnished master bedroom (queen), ensuite, with private full bath, private parking and entrance. On a cul de sac in a quiet suburban neighborhood. See trees and river from your bedroom window. Lovely open living, dining, kitchen, patio, deck. Just 7 miles to downtown Asheville, Mission Hospitals, and 3 miles to VA Hospital and Warren Wilson college. Available by the month (28 days minimum). Quiet, clean, green. Have hosted travel nurses and business people and I welcome you!

The space
This home is in nature, with trees and river, yet just 10 minutes to thriving downtown Asheville. The living room has high ceilings and gas logs, open to dining room and kitchen, which is well equipped with kitchen tools. You have your own shelves in the refrigerator and cabinets. Your bedroom window and the front deck have views of the Swannanoa River. The back patio has table and gas grill, private and serene green.

Guest access
You will park your c
neighborhood_overview: This is a great neighborhood for walking.  Also we are close to trails and the Blue Ridge Parkway.  The speed limit in the neighborhood is 25 mph.  This is also a quiet neighborhood so living here is peaceful and serene.
host_about: I am a hiker, happy out on the trails.  I love living on this green cul de sac in a quiet neighborhood with the Swannanoa River in view.  Recently traveled to Scotland and next big trip is Acadia NP in Maine. Enjoy reading historical novels, if you have any suggestions.  I spend time at my farm in the northwest corner of NC where we make maple syrup!  My motto is "be ready."

description:
Our home in Kenilworth is 5 minutes from downtown Asheville and Biltmore Estates. We love meeting people and assisting as needed with making your visit to Asheville wonderful. Our quests love the comfy bed, the spaciousness, separate living room, private entrance, private parking, the views, private deck and shared fenced in yard. This is our primary residence and while you will have your own separate private spaces you may hear us or see us around outside occasionally.

The space
We are in a very lovely, secluded spot just minutes away from downtown and Biltmore Estates. The quest bedroom is spacious and the adjacent separate living room space is also very large and comfy, opening onto a large covered deck overlooking the mountainside and fenced in yard. Our guest area is on the first floor and we reside on the second. There are 17 steps between the two seperate areas and their is a doggie door and heavy cutain at the bottom of the stairs. By city regula
neighborhood_overview: We were attracted to building here in Kenilworth because it is a unique type of place.  It is nestled in the mountainside right next to downtown and has a charm and friendliness unlike anywhere we have ever been.  You can walk through the historic neighborhood and see all kinds of different homes.  You might get lost because our streets wander in unpredictable ways.  We are so tucked away that few people even know we're here.

name: Rancho54oh- Spacious & Convenient!
description:
A very spacious, sunny, and newly finished basement apartment is part of our home, that we call Rancho54oh. It's close to the best that Asheville has to offer! It's the perfect home base for all your Asheville adventures. It's a very family-friendly space, but also perfect for a couple's getaway.

The space
This newly updated space offers a private entrance, lots of sunlight, tons of space, warm cork floors and and a cozy, modern vibe.

Entry
You have the option of parking in our rear driveway using the alley for access. This allows you private, off street parking and more direct access to the unit via a walkway to the door. The door is glass to optimize sunlight, and has a key entry.

Kitchenette/Dining
There is is a nicely equipped kitchenette that has all the basics- silverware, dishes, napkins, a new toaster oven, coffee maker, french press, sink, dishwasher, fridge/freezer, microwave, electric kettle, wine opener, and a counter
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a great place full of friendly folks. We have lots of great neighbors that we know. The neighborhood embodies all the diversity that Asheville offers and is very mixed racially and economically. We are located on top of a large hill and can see the I26 bridge over the French Broad, downtown, and the mountains in the distance from our yard. We are a short walk to AB Tech Community College and Mission Hospital and the River Arts District.
host_about: My house is a 1964 ranch style that has been recently remodeled. I am an interior designer, and live here with my daughter Charlotte who is now 2. I love modern design and living here in Asheville! Getting out and enjoying all that Asheville has to offer- it's easy to find a great concert, brewery, or art happening any day of the week. I am an avid road cyclist and love biking the Blue Ridge Parkway and country roads. Camping and hiking with my daughter and enjoying all the wonderful nature that is close by is also a favorite pastime.  I also enjoy traveling abroad and across the US, and have used AirBnB all over the world. I'm generally a relaxed come what may person, who just wants a clean and comfy space at the end of the day. I strive to provide my ideal to my guests. I enjoy connecting with my guests and learning about new places and cultures through hosting and traveling. I look forward to hosting you in my beautiful mountain home and helping you make the most of your time in Asheville!

name: Artist's Retreat in Hip West Asheville
description:
Large art-filled suite in West Asheville has four rooms. A spacious bedroom, sitting room, kitchen and bath with private entrance. The suite occupies the entire downstairs of our home on a quiet street.

Within walking distance of Haywood Road and a short drive to downtown Asheville's great restaurants, breweries, art districts, and the Biltmore Estate.

You're also close to great seasonal outdoor activities like rafting, hiking, biking, fly fishing, skiing, or cruising the Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
Come enjoy a quiet retreat on an acre of land at the end of a cul-de-sac with a large beautiful yard that you are welcome to enjoy. Smith Mill Creek runs for 1000 feet along it's edge and we have forested lots at both ends. Yet you are only a half mile from a local brewery and in easy walking distance to many of the locals favorite haunts on Haywood Road in West Asheville. You have a private entrance, driveway parking, while enjoying close pro
neighborhood_overview:
West Asheville has been in a renaissance for the last fifteen years. It is now one of the most desirable neighborhoods to live in in all of Asheville. It is home to five breweries and a cider house, the two best breakfast places in all of Asheville, as well as many other great restaurants, stores, pubs and music venues. It is a great place to just stroll around and enjoy.

The City of Asheville proper is on as many top ten lists as any city in the country. Surrounded by the Blue Ridge Mountains, Asheville has been a tourist getaway for over a hundred years - just because of the scenery. But this small city is far more than that. It is a bastion of great art, culture, and friendly people and now is a leader in craft beer! And of course we have the Biltmore Estate which draws visitors from all over the world.
host_about: I'm a Professional Photographer who loves travel, food, good friends and music.

name: Middle Sunny Bedroom
description:
This a bedroom in a 3 bedroom house in West Asheville. You have access to the kitchen, living room, bathroom, and outdoor space w a fire pit. I lead hiking and mountain biking trips for Air BnB Experiences. Come enjoy me for an adventure. I enjoy hosting and can recommend great hikes, dining experiences, and the local brews. I can also just provide you with a place to crash. Come enjoy Asheville. I am a 5 minute walk to Up Country Brewery or a 5 min drive to downtown Asheville.

The space
Very close to downtown but the peacefulness of West Asheville. My driveway is steep which affords great views from the front porch. If it snows, we all need to park at the bottom of driveway.
I have a cat so if you are allergic then it won't work.
The bed is a memory foam Queen. A great night sleep!
The room has a TV and Blu-Ray player with access to Netflix so feel free to relax to a movie after a day of hiking.

It is a little slower paced than bustling downtown.  We are only 5 minute car ride from downtown or 2 minutes to heart of West Asheville.  You can walk to some local bars like Up Country Brewing.
host_about: I have lived in Asheville for many years and love it here. I run a tourism based company called Cedar Rock Adventures.  I provide brewery tours by canoe and raft, scenic rafting floats, and hiking tours. I love to meet new people and share what makes Asheville so great!

A kitchenette in lounging room with microwave, toaster, small fridge, sink, coffee maker, french roast coffee, cream , condiments, plasticware & plates,bottled water in fridge.

Where guests gather to drink their favorite beverage, reheat food from meals out the day before, fix sandwiches,watchTV, visit their IPads. Other ameni

This is a quiet neighborhood. Retired and self employed live on our street. Two families have lively kids who love to play outside with lots of laughter.
host_about: Hello to all of you who will soon be staying at my comfy Windsor Forest Inn. I love where I live-this neighborhood, this town, this house and these  gorgeous mountains. I am in love with my two brother and sister 8 yr old pups Ezekiel and Sarah. I love to travel, love coffee,  love visiting Sierra Nevada which is 5 minutes away, fiercely loyal to my dear friends. name: Historic Church in The River Arts District
description:
The Ora Street Church of God, located between The River Arts District, The South Slope Brewery District, and only 1 mile from Biltmore Estate was built in the 1920s and thrived for over 80 years before being converted into our home. Enjoy a short walk to restaurants, breweries, art galleries and music. The upstairs of our home, formerly the pastor's study, is now your personal master suite. We invite you to stay in our church house, one of the most unique and charming Airbnbs in Asheville.

The space
Our guest are given access to the more private back door which allows direct access to the stairwell leading up to the master suite. The back door is accessed via our newly remodeled back deck where there is a hot tub and stone fireplace for guests to use. This outdoor space is kept under video surveillance for our safety and for that of our guests as well. This entryway will open into a stairwell where guests will be met with a private minibar and beer for their e
neighborhood_overview: Located close to the River Arts District ensures that a selection of stunning galleries and charming independent cafes are all nearby. Try dining at the local restaurants and visit the wide range of breweries and distilleries in the area.
host_about: We're David and Shawn Taylor and we are excited to become active members of the Airbnb community!  The two of us grew up in South Carolina (Georgetown and Clinton, respectively) and met while in pharmacy school at the University of South Carolina.   We moved to Asheville in 2010 after graduating and fell in love with WNC.  We quickly realized that this was going to be home!  Shawn is an Associate Professor of Pharmacy at Wingate University - Hendersonville.  David is currently the Director of Pharmacy at a Community Health Center and sells real estate as a hobby.  We are both very active in the community and love art, music, beer, and all sorts of outdoor activities.  We are avid runners and bike whenever we have time.  We are both type A personalities and it shows in our home and in our occupancy of others.   We have an 11 year old West Highland White Terrier named Owen who is as perfect as they come.  He loves to lounge around in the sun and join us on our excursions whenever he is able to keep up.  We also have a new Westie puppy named Arthur who is very spunky and also super friendly.  Six years ago we bought a century old Church of God that was re-purposed into a 3 bedroom, 3 bath home and have since poured our hearts into this historic structure.   We believe that it is the perfect place to stay and live in Asheville and hope you will agree!

name: Asheville Clouding Around - A Million Dollar View
description:
Asheville Clouding Around is in a forest setting perched high on top of the Asheville's eastern Sunset Mountain,. The home has three bedroom/three bath home(sleeps eight comfortably) with all the amenities. Very close to the historic city center of Asheville, where all what the city and neighboring communities offer. You’ll love the private setting of our home, with all of the desired amenities, forest setting, abundance of fresh air and it's magical awesomeness of being high above the clouds.

The space
The home offers one large master bedroom suite with bath, one large bedroom with private bath, one bedroom with a detached bath, and a large Futon in living room. The home has a fully stocked kitchen, dinning room, living room, W/D, A/C, wood burning fireplace, WiFi, Cable and a huge private deck with three separate access points. Some say the best view in the Asheville Mountain Valley, this home is 1600 sq feet of living space, featuring a large open deck with a
neighborhood_overview:
Overview
Ten minutes from downtown Asheville (aka the Land of the Sky), known for the many fantastic micro-breweries, high-end food stores, and scratch restaurants, along with art studios, music venues, craft retail outlets, state parks, the Riverwalk area, the French Broad River and the famous Biltmore House. The home is also located 15 minutes off the beautiful Blue Ridge Parkway and 20 minutes to Asheville Airport. This property not only has a Million Dollar View of northern Asheville, but also offers easy access to hundreds of Western North Carolina attractions and a multitude of outdoor activities for all ages.

The home is located on a major trek path commonly used by the local and visiting bicycling, jogging and hiking enthusiasts. The home accommodates sleeping arrangements for up to eight people.

It is magical to see weather change before your very eyes through the 60 miles of mountain viewing.
host_about: I am owner of a All Natural Soap company called His-N-Hers All Natural Handmade Soap products. I am very active in preserving the environment; feeding the homeless; vice-president of UMCW; avid gardener and cook. I love to travel.

name: Vibrant NEW Montford apartment- walk to downtown
description:
Come enjoy our charming and consciously renovated apartment that is just a few blocks from downtown! The space is nestled in Asheville's most charming neighborhood. A pleasant 10 minute walk through the Historic Montford district will land you in the heart of downtown Asheville, where endless eateries, music venues, and art galleries abound. Our dwelling is across the street from a park, and at the end of the Reed Creek Greenway. Perfect for a couple or small family.

The space
This modern basement apartment is the ground floor our 1920s historic Montford home. It has a private entrance that opens onto a patio and into a large fenced yard, that is separate from the owner's yard. The space has very large french doors and three windows, which flood the area with natural light during the daytime. The living space and bedroom are separated by heavy custom sliding barn doors, and both areas exhibit exposed brick and stained concrete floors. The urban micro ki
neighborhood_overview: The Montford neighborhood is a safe, fantastic and enchanted neighborhood to explore. The houses, bed and breakfasts, and buildings of Montford  are as unique in character, as the people who reside there.  Architecturally, the homes are influenced by Victorian era, Arts and Craft and Queen Anne styles. Our property location is within 3-4 blocks of a Whole Foods Grocery, Trader Joes, and Harris Teeter.  If you want to stay super close to the apartment and have a meal, Nine Mile (Rastafarian/pasta. One of our personal favorites), Chiesa (Italian food), Todd'sTasties (Gourmet. Organic.  breakfast and lunch. coffee. beer/wine). Hi Five Coffee (Most excellent coffee shop).  As mentioned, there is a playground directly across the street, and the greenway at the end of our block connects to the UNCA campus and the Botanical Gardens.
host_about: My husband and I love to travel and explore new places, sometimes with our 2 kids and other times without! We are clean and respectful guests and love staying at Airbnb homes!

description:

Rather you're traveling for business, a honeymoon or anniversary, or just to get away with the friends, this place is perfect for you.

With 14 foot vaulted ceilings, huge windows with a Western View, Fully Loaded Kitchen tons of storage space and a beautiful stone fireplace, which is unfortunately only aesthetic. Your steps from everything downtown Asheville has to offer, and only a few minutes drive from hiking and historic West Asheville.

WiFi, Netflix, washer and dryer, off street parking for one car, linens and bedding, coffee and coffee maker.
neighborhood_overview: You can walk anywhere downtown to anything you can possibly need during your stay. There are amazing people all around, and the sunset is spectacular.
host_about: I am a very socially motivated individual. I love interacting with new people and providing an entertaining atmosphere for all different types of fun loving individuals. name: Cozy Tiny House Near Downtown and Blue Ridge!
description:
Come stay in my spacious and beautifully designed tiny cottage in the trees! Wake to windows full of sky and songbirds. Enjoy your morning coffee on the back deck for a chance to see mama bear with cubs foraging in the ravine. It's located behind my personal residence in a sweet little neighborhood only 4 minutes from downtown...(Uber and Lyft is available). It's cozy, quiet, and close to everything! Adults and Airbnb guests only... Thank you!

The space
I had this quaint and cozy cabin built by a company specializing in small home design. Their craftsmanship is unparalleled! It is nestled in the trees above a small ravine and sits in the backyard of my house. It is small (288 sq ft downstairs, 100 upstairs and a 100 sq. ft. deck) but has the feel of something bigger with high ceilings and an open concept and loft. It is close to downtown, the Biltmore, and Blue Ridge Parkway but feels like a quiet get away. This space is meant for two people and is for
neighborhood_overview: This house is located in a cozy, tree-lined neighborhood 4 miles from downtown.  Close enough to anything you want to do but tucked away in its own little patch of woods.  Walkable neighborhood to a public library, two playgrounds, one block to the Farmers' Market on Fridays, two blocks to PennyCup coffee shop (try their frozen Green Tea!) and Creekside Taphouse BBQ...yum!
host_about:
Ashevillian since 2008.
Writer, traveler, musician, builder/designer.
Lover of dogwoods and thunderstorms.
Human to pup named Fang.

Welcome to Asheville!  Relax and enjoy my cozy place!

name: Urban Hippie West Asheville Sanctuary
description:
My home is a cozy sanctuary on the edge of west Asheville. Here you'll have room to stretch out & slow down. The outdoor space is a large flat fenced in yard with views of Pisgah mountain from the hammock & fire pit! Growing garden, flowers, & honey bees on site! My property is on a dead end street with quiet, considerate neighbors, yet 2 turns from i40, 5 minutes to walkable west Asheville, 10 mins to downtown! Normally a super host but took 2020 off for upgrades & to follow safety precautions

The space
Wake up with coffee on the back porch while watching the birds at the feeder. Take a stroll in the gardens with views of Pisgah mountain. My property has blueberries, blackberries, muscadine grapes, and ground cherries for the picking when in season. Yoga mats and exercise weights are available for use. I am now a proud owner of an iron after a suggestion from a guest ; ) Fresh bedding, towels, and extra toiletries are provided. I also have a closet of games for
neighborhood_overview: Convenient to downtown and walkable west Asheville yet removed from the bustle of town. 2 minutes from the largest and best Goodwill I know of! Quiet and picturesque. Great neighbors. Mountain views! Plenty of restaurants in walking distance like Applebee's, Fatz, Waffle House, Popeye’s, Chick-fil-a, Bojangles, Waffle House, Cracker Barrel, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Subway, the list goes on..

name: 1 BDRM, 2 miles to DWTN. Great for nurse/doc
description:
This cute cottage is within walking distance to Biltmore Village, a 1/4 mile from the entrance to the Biltmore Estate, two miles to downtown Asheville (very easy to Uber), 1/4 mile from I-40 and easy access to the airport. It is on a quiet street that offers all the comforts of home. This listing is only available for 30+ day rental.

The space
The cottage has a large living/dining area, one bedroom with a king size bed and one full bath (just off the bedroom). The house has a fully functional kitchen, Smart TV/cable as well as a washer and dryer.

Guest access
Guests have access to the driveway. It can fit up to 2 cars (behind each other). No street parking is allowed.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighbourhood. Very family-friendly. Easy walking distance to Biltmore Village.
host_about: I've been living in Asheville for 15 years. I am a fundraiser by profession. I love to workout, hike, eat great food and drink fabulous wine. I'm an avid adventurer; I've been fortunate enough to see a good portion of this world. I love hosting guests and look forward to hosting you and your family/friends!

name: Downton Shabby    *15 mins to downtown Asheville*
description:
Cute & cozy 2 bedroom 2 bath whole house with jetted tub, mountain views, & fishing... close to downtown, hiking, and 4 miles to I40 & I26.

The space
Downton Shabby! Sorry, no butler or lady's maid, not even fine china! But it is cute, cozy, and well... shabby! And the owners are just corny enough to name it after one of their all-time favorite show... Downton Abbey! (Did I even have to say it? )

What you will find here is a cute and cozy cottage with mountain and pond views. The feel of being in the country but just 4 miles from I-40, I-26, and I-240. You will be 5 miles from downtown, and about 15 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway! And so much more that the Asheville area has to offer!

Come back from your adventures and have a quiet meal in the fully equipped kitchen, soak in the jetted tub, or sit on the porch swing and enjoy the views! Later, roast some marshmallows over the fire pit! And if you've never heard of Downton Abbey
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is unique because we are not way out in the country and isolated from town, but it sure feels that way!
host_about: I am a 40-something, fun-loving, travel loving lady!  My husband and I own a roofing business.  As business owners, we love to take a vacation anytime we can!  And we love to stay at private homes as often as we can rather than hotels!  Since we know what we like to see in a vacation rental, we try to make ours as comfortable as we would like it to be ourselves!

name: Luxury in an Artist's Loft as Base for Exploring Asheville
description:
Begin the day in a bathroom with granite counters plus Myers hand soaps and Pharmacopia toiletries. Sip French press coffee while looking out to the church from the window seat of a living room with industrial touches and exposed-brick accents. We just finished renovating the space so it looks much brighter than these photos show - now all the walls are white, we have a sleek, modern shower and new white quartz counter tops.
You literally can’t beat our fantastic location. In the middle of all the excitement - great bars, coffee shops, breweries, restaurants, the newly reopened art museum, Pack Square, Civic Center - all are within a short walk from the Urban Nest. If you come home too tired to go out, just ride down the elevator that opens into the popular Lobster Trap. Come home to a cozy, stylish a small most importantly, comfortable landing pad.
neighborhood_overview: Check out the hosts' Insider's Guide to narrow down the dazzling array of choices of downtown restaurants and bars within walking distance. After a show at the Diana Wortham Theater, dine back in the building at the Lobster Trap on the 1st floor. Popular High Five Coffee and the Rhu are within a block. Walk to the drum circle on Fridays or catch Downtown after Five concerts in the summer, or go next door for a spa day at Spa Theology. You will love the Asheville Urban Nest!
host_about: Lynne and Steve are local business owners working in downtown Asheville. Lynne is a commercial photographer and Steve manages musicians. They both own Music and Art Mgmt., Inc.

name: Private Suite: Walk to Biltmore and Breweries
description:
This dog-friendly suite is self-contained and accessible only by its own private entrance. The space is ideal for the lone traveler or couples seeking a romantic retreat in the mountains. The suite includes a spacious bedroom (with queen) and full bath. In addition, our guest can enjoy mountain views from the comfort of the adjoining breakfast nook. Guests (and pups) can enjoy the mountain air from the spacious deck or the fully fenced half acre in the back!

The space
Plan your day hikes with our selection of WNC hiking guide books while enjoying your cup of coffee on the porch. In the evenings, stroll through the garden with your favorite beverage in hand. Stop and smell the abundance of perennial flowers and enjoy the sun set and the summertime fireflies. You will often find us enjoying the same landscape or keeping the weeds at bay.

COVID-19 UPDATE:
We take the public health risks of our guests and staff seriously and continue to adapt our ope
neighborhood_overview: The Oakley neighborhood is located just atop the hill above historic Biltmore Village.  The historic village that once served as the logistical base-camp for the construction of the Biltmore estate has since transformed into a boutique shopping district and is now home to 4 breweries, a distillery, and excellent dining options.
host_about: In December of 2016 we opened our doors for the first time on Airbnb. It’s been a blast ever since! Having both grown up in western North Carolina, we are proud to share our little piece of the globe with the many visitors who find their way here. Whether you’re looking for recommendations on local “foodie” spots or the perfect hike, we’re glad to help you plan your perfect trip to Asheville.

name: Quiet North Asheville Retreat
description:
Great quiet North Asheville location surrounded by woods. You'll be four miles to downtown, six miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway, three miles to UNCA and two miles to the Grove Park Inn. If you have and event at the Country Club of Asheville, you could walk! Quiet as can be, relax on the porch in the morning before heading out to explore all that our great town has to offer. Enjoy a sunset walk around the Beaver Lake bird sanctuary before heading home to relax.

The space
Stone stairs lead up to the private sitting porch and entry door. The large living area holds a queen bed, TV area, coffee bar, two sitting chairs, and dining/work space. Off street parking makes entry a breeze. A cafe table and chairs on the back porch offer a great spot to enjoy the woods and maybe see some wildlife.

Guest access
The entire space is yours. This is a separate apartment from the house above a detached garage. Very private and quiet.

Other thing
neighborhood_overview: Very quiet neighborhood with little traffic. Great for an evening walk and quiet morning coffee. Be sure to go over to Beaver Lake and take a sunset walk, too!
host_about: Hi. My wife and I have lived in Asheville since the late 90's.  We both graduated from Appalachian State and just couldn't leave the mountains.  I own Longview Builders, a custom home building company specializing in high-end green building, and my wife Liz owns and runs an interior design firm, so let us know if you want to talk about building a home here too!

name: Comfy Asheville Cottage with Private Fenced Yard
description:
Our cottage is in a quiet natural setting, good for couples, families or small reunions. Built in 2017, this very comfy house is on a private .25 acres with privacy fence. We are a dog-friendly place with a fully fenced lot. Located five minutes to downtown West Asheville, 12 minutes to downtown city center. Close to the NC Arboretum, Blue Ridge Parkway, Pisgah Highway, outlet malls, Buncombe County Sports Park, WNC Farmers Market, I-40 and I-26. Full kitchen, washer/dryer, a/c, sleeps up to 7.

The space
The cottage is quiet and mostly secluded, yet only minutes to eclectic West Asheville (Uber $6 and up), and downtown AVL (Uber $12 and up). It has a vaulted ceiling in the kitchen/living room and lots of natural light. The two bedrooms have memory foam queen-sized mattresses, and the second bedroom includes a half bunk with a twin. The yard is spacious and sunny with apple and pear trees. Includes a fire ring for small outdoor fires. The full size kitchen is ful
neighborhood_overview: We are on the western edge of Asheville City limits-- a nice bucolic neighborhood with lots of trees and open pasture. We are very close to the Buncombe County Sports Park, and close to the NC Arboretum, Blue Ridge Parkway, French Broad River, and West Asheville.
host_about: We are the Mills Family from Asheville, North Carolina. Smithson works as an economic development consultant and Kathy is a media specialist in the local school system. After years of using Air BnB around the country, we decided to build a cottage on our property for guests who travel like we do. The cottage is designed for comfortable short-term stays, inspired by great experiences we had in homes from Portland, OR to NYC and many points in-between. We are looking forward to making your stay as enjoyable as possible!

name: West Asheville Carriage House
description:
Tastefully decorated & furnished West Asheville rental. The apartment is located on the ground floor. Ample parking. Two Bedrooms and one bath. One Queen sized bed, one King sized bed. Luxury linens provided. Professionally cleaned between stays. 1 flat screen tv with cable and internet. Kitchen is stocked for your cooking needs. Close to Haywood Road, Malvern Hills park, and a very short drive to downtown Asheville.

The space
This ground floor apartment is tucked behind our office in West Asheville. This is a great space for 2 couples traveling together, or a family. Each have their own private room, and access to a full kitchen and living room.

Guest access
Guests have access to the whole apartment! All the closets and drawers are yours to use as you wish! This apartment is a full time vacation rental.
Please park in any of the parking spaces in the parking lot. Please do not park in the covered parking spot.

In this ti
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in West Asheville close to Haywood Road and downtown. It is a very convenient location to access all of the sites in Asheville, but isn't your typical "neighborhood" since it's in a commercial district.  The apartment is set back off the main road behind our office which was originally a single family Arts and Crafts style home built in 1937. This is not a walkable location due to being on the main 4 lane road that travels through Asheville....but it is quite a convenient location! I would recommend planning on driving or taking Uber.
host_about: Myron and I finished school in Southern California and randomly chose Asheville as a place we would both like to live back in 1977.  We have loved watching Asheville grow and change as the years have gone by.  What an amazing place we have chosen to live in!  We own the dental practice on Patton Avenue and we also have a beautiful wedding event space west of Asheville called The Farm-A Gathering Place.  We are known for our hospitality and love it when people come to see why we love this town!

name: Mountain Retreat City Convenience.
description:
This beautiful duplex borders Pisgah National Forest while still being less than 15 minutes away from downtown and the Biltmore Estate. Just down the road you can shop at the outlet mall or hike through the Arboretum. Take a tube down the French Broad river, hop on the Blue Ridge Parkway, or sip a beer at one of Asheville's many breweries. Great for couples, families, and large groups.

The space
Guests are welcome to 2 parking spaces right beside the front door, and additional if needed.

Guest access
Guests can access netflix, but cable television is not provided.

Other things to note
It is not uncommon to see deer and even bears at the rental. While being very close the city it backs up to the forest which provides a nice feel of privacy.
neighborhood_overview: Close to the Biltmore outlets, numerous restaurants, the North Carolina Arboretum, hiking, mountain biking, French broad river, and the Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about: I work for emergency services in Asheville and my wife works in assisted living. My family helps to run a rental in Asheville. We hope to offer everyone a very budget friendly stay for their families and friends. We love to travel and appreciate a nice place to rest for the next adventure. We love the outdoors, so if you have any questions about activities around Asheville feel free to ask.

name: Spacious Downtown Asheville Loft
description:
This uniquely renovated, loft style condominium is located in the heart of downtown Asheville. The loft is walking distance to locally owned shops, restaurants, art galleries, theaters, music venues, breweries, and grocers. Downtown Asheville is a happening place, but if you're looking to get out for the day, its only a 15 minute drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway to find breath-taking views and hikes. Some of the best coffee in town is served right beside the loft entrance at High Five Coffee.

The space
The entrance to the building is located on Rankin Ave, directly across the street from the Rankin Parking Garage.
The loft is on the ground floor and has very easy access.
You will be provided with a code to the main entrance and the condo entrance to lock up the loft as you come and go during your stay. The renovated loft has exposed brick, high ceilings, original hardwood flooring, plenty of natural light, and white-noise machines in each bedroom to pr
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Asheville is full of life. From the loft, you will be around the corner from many of our best restaurants, shops, galleries, breweries, and tours. You are within a short walk to the drum circle at Pritchard Park, Pack Square (where many of our festivals and events take place), the Thomas Wolfe Auditorium/Harrah's event Center and the Orange Peel music venues. The Biltmore Estate, the Omni Grove Park Inn and River Arts District are less than 12 minutes away by car.

Once again the Rankin Press Lofts building is a friendly, private, and quiet community. We ask that you respect their privacy and space while you are staying; please only contact us for concerns and questions.
host_about:
Ashlie & I have a farmstead not far from Asheville. We raise chickens, grow fruit and vegetables, and have a canning business making fruit preserves to sell at local markets and stores. We share our house with two amazing cats and one awesome dog.

Hosting Airbnb will help us supplement our income during the off season of farming. Ashlie and I use Airbnb whenever we travel and have had great experiences as guests; we are now excited to take on the role of host and offer some southern hospitality. We strongly believe in supporting the local economy, and Airbnb is a way for us to both meet travelers to our area and connect them with Asheville's community of artists, crafters, producers, chefs, and beer makers. 

We want to create a safe, stress free, clean, and comfortable stay while you are in Asheville. 

5 things we can't live with out: Oxygen, Food, & Water to be exact. We love our wood burning stove, listening to some good music and cooking together.

name: Sweet Cottage With Hot Tub, Near Downtown
description:
Sweet 3 bedroom cottage convenient to downtown (less than three miles), walking distance to French Broad River, one mile to Beaver Lake. Hydrotherapy hot tub overlooking private backyard with a sunset view. Brand new kitchen and bath, quiet neighborhood, plenty of privacy, fresh flowers, and thriving gardens. We are a small house, so not ideal for more than 3 or 4 adults. Strong wifi! See us on IG @AtHomeinAsheville or follow our tag #athomeinasheville

The space
Come enjoy this open and airy cottage with original (1941) hardwood floors, custom kitchen with quartz countertops, and brand new bathroom with glass shower (no bathtub). Throughout, we've brought in modern conveniences without sacrificing the good character of an older home. We are conveniently located to I26 (less than .25 mile), UNC Asheville (one mile), downtown (less than three miles), and River Arts District (ride your bike). Our guests agree, this cottage is THE most convenient place in Asheville t
neighborhood_overview: The Green Oak neighborhood is a small street tucked into the side of a mountain. On one side of the street you get a view of downtown Asheville. The other side of the street offers trees, hills, and a small (sunset) view of a distant mountain across the French Broad River (you can't see the river from the yard). If you walk down the street, you can see a gorgeous view of the French Broad River.
host_about: In 2011, our family drove from Tucson, AZ to these mountains so I could begin work as a writing professor at UNC Asheville. We are a young family who enjoys playing outdoors, cooking big meals, reading, drawing, writing, and telling stories. We remain in love with all that this region has to offer, and we pride ourselves for knowing about the great entertainment options happening around town (many of which are free). We look forward to hosting you At Home in Asheville soon.

description:
This is a 6 bedroom 4 bathroom duplex backing up to the beautiful Pisgah Forest. This location is perfect for year round privacy while still being very close to everything Asheville has to offer. You will be right down the street from the Asheville Outlets, Blue Ridge Parkway, Arboretum, French Broad River, and numerous restaurants. Perfect for a family reunion or vacation to visit the Beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains.

The space
6 bedroom 4 bathroom Duplex with 2 full kitchens. It is as close as you can get to feeling like you live in the forest while still being close to the city.

We hope to offer everyone a very budget friendly stay for their families and friends. We love to travel and appreciate a nice place to rest for the next adventure. We love the outdoors, so if you have any questions about activities around Asheville feel free to ask.

name: Front Private room w King Bed
description:
This is one bedroom in a 3 bedroom house in West Asheville. I lead Hiking, Beer tour by raft, and Mountain biking trips for Air BnB Experiences. Come enjoy me for an adventure. I enjoy hosting and can recommend great hikes, dining experiences, and the local brews. I can also just provide you with a place to crash. Come enjoy Asheville. I am a 5 minute walk to Up Country Brewery or a 5 min drive to downtown Asheville.

The space
The is clean and tidy but homey. I am up on a hill with great views. I am just a few miles from downtown so it is quick and easy to get anywhere.

Guest access
I am fully vaccinated so you can use the kitchen if you like.

Other things to note
There is a friendly cat that lives here. He does not hang out in the rented room though.
I have another bedroom that is also rented on Airbnb so you may see another guest. Those 2 rooms share a bathroom.
neighborhood_overview: The house is 1 mile from the heart of the trendy West Asheville.
host_about: I have lived in Asheville for many years and love it here. I run a tourism based company called Cedar Rock Adventures.  I provide brewery tours by canoe and raft, scenic rafting floats, and hiking tours. I love to meet new people and share what makes Asheville so great!

name: Explore Asheville
description:
Hi! Please read all before you book :) This is a private master bedroom inside the back part of our home with its own private keypad entrance/bathroom/off-street parking. We are very conscientious about guests' privacy; however, we are an active family, so guests may see us/our kids outside or hear us at times inside. We are centrally located in Asheville in a dense, old urban neighborhood. It’s a 5 min drive to downtown breweries/7 min to Biltmore Estate gate/12 min to Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
The room is all new construction, an addition attached to the back of our home, completed early 2017.

It is inside our house but is sectioned off from us so that privacy is intact.

The bed is queen size with a Tuft & Needle Mint mattress with a soft pillow top cover.

With cedar shake and corrugated metal on the outside and a sloping roof up from the bed side of the room, it has a fresh and modern feel.

There are two oversize
neighborhood_overview:
We live in an older neighborhood in diverse, urban central Asheville. We are adjacent to two lovely full B&Bs on the road above us. This neighborhood is super central to everything the city of Asheville has to offer!

The guest space, on the back of our home, faces a strip of woods and fees pretty private. However, we live in a densely populated neighborhood with all the normal domestic activity of people coming, going, and gathering with friends and families at their homes.

The closest business district to our home is the River Arts District, a mere 3 minute drive away. With over 50 artists in dozens of studios and excellent restaurants, food trucks, brewing companies and coffeeshops, you could spend the better part of a day just here!

[See our GUIDEBOOK or ask about our recommendations for more]
host_about:
We are from the great state of West Virginia, both Mountaineers, and proud to still be Appalachian folks now nestled in the Blue Ridge of Asheville!

We have always thought of our homes as gifts that are not just for our own family but meant to be shared. We've had long-term roommates, international exchange students, and have provided respite for friends who needed some space. We'll do all we can to make your stay private, comfortable, and restful.

name: The Rockwell- Spacious River Arts District Home
description:
Luxury Greenbuilt home in the RiverArtsDistrict/West AVL. Large windows and sunset viewing in a spacious open floor plan. Less than a mile from West, restaurants, bars, and breweries, 1 mile to town. Connect to the greenway trail and walk along the French Broad River. Panoramic, Rockwellesque views of the industrial River Arts District and Downtown against a mountainous backdrop. Look out the window see the sway of the treetops. Each level has it's own deck and each bedroom has its own bathroom.

The space
Brand new home, fully furnished. Great sunlight. Plenty of space, both to gather and to retreat.

Guest access
Guests have complete access to the top two floors, including kitchen, living room, laundry room, 2 decks, 2 bedrooms each with their own bath, and one half bath on main floor. Shower in the master bathroom, large soaking tub in the 2nd bedroom.
neighborhood_overview: Close neighbors, it's downtown living. Right in between West Asheville, Downtown, and the River Arts District so you can easily bike, walk, or drive anywhere you want to go. We have a few bikes that we're happy to lend. Walking distance to Breweries, Bars, Restaurants and the Greenway Trail along the French Broad River.
host_about: We are local musicians who have been in Asheville for nearly 20 years. We have traveled to many cities throughout the years but remain here in Asheville, as it continues to be our favorite place to call home. We love it here because of the unmatched live music scene, night life, outdoor activities, people's friendly and open attitude, and over all pride we locals have in calling Asheville home. We love meeting new people, want you to enjoy it here the way that we do, and are happy to help you get around as much as you need from us.

name: Oasis close to downtown
description:
Our quiet, comfortable, basement apartment is walkable to downtown Asheville, Montford, UNCA, nightlife, public transit, city center, US Cellular center and parks. Grove Park Inn is about a mile and a half if you're up for the walk or drive. You’ll love the neighborhood and ease of access to downtown, breweries, Biltmore Estate, Grove Park Inn, hiking, biking, and all things outdoors. Great rental for couples, families (with kids), or solo adventurers, and families. Come see for yourself!

The space
You will enter your Asheville oasis via a private entrance and driveway off Forsyth St. (street behind our main entrance). You'll walk into a great space that's flowy, open and flexible to meet all of your needs. You'll be greeted by a comfy table and chairs for coffee, tea, takeout, or just great conversation. As you continue on, you'll enter the living area, comprised of a sofa sleeper and three chairs. Entertainment includes a flat screen TV, DVD player, and
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in the perfect location known as Five Points.  Five Points is surrounded by Historic Montford on the west side, downtown on south side, and UNC-Asheville on north side.   We are within walking distance to all of these locations, including restaurants, grocery stores, coffee shops, bars, and the great music scene in Asheville.  The neighborhood is very family oriented.
host_about: Garry and I (Melissa) love living in the most beautiful place on earth, Asheville, NC.  We married 8 1/2 years ago in Charleston, SC. Garry was born and raised in Asheville, filling many people with years and years of Asheville's history.  We love the downtown Asheville scene, shopping, dining, dancing, and did I mention dining?!!  Garry is retired and I am a Speech Language Pathologist.  I'm often times away on weekends running half marathons with girlfirends.  I hope to run a half marathon in all 50 states, currently have 20 states under my belt.  We desire to share our home, close to downtown to give the rest of the world a chance to experience a little piece of heaven on earth.

name: Taylor Ranch Retreat - Secluded yet close to Asheville
description:
This cozy private home, nestled in the trees, is centrally located between Asheville and Hendersonville, North Carolina. It is down a dirt road and is very secluded for your privacy and full feel of a country setting. This property is perfect for a writer or a weekend with your favorite friends and family! It has all of the comforts of home no matter what season! Enjoy the indoor wood burning fireplace during the winter snow, and the outdoor fire pit on a beautiful evening or you can climb into the private outdoor hot tub to relax after a day of exploring and watch the stars. It has a king-sized bed, a queen-sized bed and a day bed for sleeping as well as a futon in the loft.

This is a smoke-free home but an ashtray is provided outside on the deck. We do welcome well-behaved dogs with prior approval and a non-refundable nightly fee. High chairs and a portable crib are available upon request. Uber does service the area if you want a safe ride to and from downtown Asheville
neighborhood_overview: The property is located next to a working 400 acre ranch, while hiking the ranch is not permitted, it provides a very private, country experience.
host_about: I am the owner of Inspired Getaway in Asheville, NC.  We were established in 2018 and have some of the most modern, up to date properties in the area.  We also have a community of vacation rental homes that are grouped in a cluster so if you are traveling with a larger number of people, we can accommodate you in multiple properties that neighbor each other.

With the 6 bedrooms, this spectacular home offers plenty of sleeping arrangements for families & groups looking to vacation in Asheville, in the shadow of the Smoky mountains.
The home is close to skiing, golf, tennis, and hiking along the Blue Ridge Parkway, or in any of the local state parks; Pisgah National Forest, Grandfather Mountain, Mount Mitchell, the Cherokee Reservation, and much more. You are within 20 minutes of all 3 metropolitan downtowns of Asheville, Hendersonville, & Brevard.

The space
Location:
Private estate home located south of Asheville near Biltmore Park, 20 minutes south of downtown Asheville, 5 minutes to Asheville Regional airport, 5 minutes to Biltmore Park, & 18 minutes to the gates of Biltmore Estate.

name: Downtown Escape!
description:
My place is close to the city center, parks, art and culture, and great views. You’ll love my place because of the ambiance, the comfy bed, the neighborhood, the outdoors space, and the light. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and furry friends (pets). We have an air mattress for additional guests. There is one normal bed, and one air mattress.

The space
The space is a full size apartment. It has a large kitchen, stocked up and ready for anything. It has a nice dining table with four chairs, a full bathroom, and a big bedroom with a lounge area, two seats and a TV. This is one of the best bangs for the buck in the downtown area.

Guest access
You will have access to private parking, a fenced in front yard for your pets, wash room, and private, full time locked private entrance.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is full of awesome characters. I live in this neighborhood, and cant imagine living in another part of Asheville!
host_about: I am a very socially motivated individual. I love interacting with new people and providing an entertaining atmosphere for all different types of fun loving individuals. I am an event planner, a sports journalist ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) a bartender, and a sports junky! I love to listen to good, live music, go to festivals, be outdoors, etc.

name: Beautiful Home in Historic Montford by Downtown
description:
Come visit our home, beautifully restored in the historic Montford neighborhood, only steps from downtown. Fantastic front porch with rocking chairs overlooking neighborhood, Lovely Private fenced in stone garden in the back with gas grill, new stainless steal appliances in kitchen, 65" flat screen and comfy down sofas in the living room, King, Queen, and Full sized beds, 2 full bathrooms, Private off street driveway. Walk Everywhere, so close to downtown shops/brewery/grocery

The space
Historic Home, built in the early 1900s, lovingly restored a few years ago. Large windows bring in lots of natural light. All high end stainless steel appliances, 3 flat screen TVs with Cable, great furnishings.

Guest access
You will have access to the whole house, except a few closets and a bedroom.

Other things to note
You are welcome to park in the driveway, but there is also plenty of street parking nearby if you would prefer.
neighborhood_overview: Amazing Historic Montford, right next to downtown, is full of restored Victorian and Arts-and-Crafts style Homes, many of which are over 100 years old. Our home is also steps away from Downtown, which is full of great dining, nightlife, breweries, entertainment, etc.  Our neighborhood is directly next to the Thomas Wolfe Auditorium and the U.S. Cellular Center. There's also 3 great grocery stores walking distance away (Trader Joes, Wholefoods, and Harris Teeter)
host_about: I'm a fun loving mom, who loves the outdoors and loves to hike, run, and bike.

This fabulous apartment is located three blocks north of downtown, in the bustling Chestnut Hills neighborhood. Our lovely home was built in 1909 and completely renovated in 2017. Due to the spectacular location and massive size of the home, we decided to retain half of the first floor as a vacation rental. We invite you to kick back, relax, and spend a few days in one of the best Airbnbs in Asheville.

The space
The private back door access leads guests to an outdoor deck with great mountain views and a table for two. Upon arrival, guests are greeted with a few local beers and a record player with an eclectic record collection. For the morning, coffee and tea. A quiet, comfortable bedroom with a queen bed, all new appliances and fixtures in the kitchen and bath, tranquil living room with cable TV, wireless internet, a grill on the deck, and a new washer and dryer.

Guest access
Off-street parking is available in a separate driveway, dedicat

host_about: Hello, my husband Jim and I are thrilled to have you come experience Asheville, while staying in our modern, stylish apartment located only a few blocks from downtown.

name: Apartment with Private entrance and Private Bath.
description:
We welcome you to our studio apartment.
Our Check in time is 5 PM to 12 AM to give you time to enjoy Asheville and the mountains. We follow guidelines for the Air BnB cleaning procedures, and they automatically block one day before and one day after for Preparation Time. We have installed the Germ Guardian Air Purifiers with UV C to destroy bacteria and virus and mold to keep the apartment air fresh.
We do have a no-pets policy for those with allergies.

The space
We welcome you to our studio apartment. Enjoy the scenic drive to our quiet rural setting on Spivey Mountain , near West Asheville, and 5 and 1/2 miles (15 minutes) from downtown Asheville. The Biltmore Estate is 7.5 miles from our house. Cuddle up in the queen size sleigh bed. Have a cup of coffee and enjoy the sunrise!
Kern is a retired Pharmacist and is also a licensed massage therapist.
Anne is a Master Gardner and you can enjoy her lovely floral garden. The organic vegeta
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is scenic, with houses tucked in tree-shaded lots.

Anne is a NC Master Gardener, and has an organic garden with strawberries, red raspberries, blueberries, in season.  Along with a wide variety of vegetables and will gladly give you a tour and share some of the produce. Enjoy the flowers many of which bloom all season.
Kern is a retired Pharmacist and is also a Massage Therapist.
