COVID-19 safe! Extra cleaning protocols in effect. Private studio - queen bed and double bed for extra guests, plus dining area with fully equipped kitchen. Seven foot ceiling! Extra cleaning supplies provided.

name: Downtown and Biltmore!
description:
Relax in this vibrant, newer construction home, fitted with all the essentials you need to enjoy your time in the Asheville mountains. Large, spacious rooms with large kitchen and open floor plan. Located just 3 miles to the heart of downtown with breweries, local restaurants,art galleries,shops and all the eclectic vibes that make Asheville unique and fun to explore. Biltmore village and Estate one mile away. High speed WiFi with sanitation our TOP priority!!

The space
This charming home has an incredible location to everything you will want to do while in Asheville.

Tastefully decorated with both an urban feel, and a taste of the mountains. You immediately feel at home and relaxed, like you were meant to be here. (The Asheville mountains will have that effect!). Our cleaning company is thoroughly applying the cleaning guidelines set out by the CDC and take this responsibility seriously. Our cleaners sanitize all touch surfaces, sanitize all sur
neighborhood_overview: Quiet safe neighborhood close to essentials
host_about:
We are a local family who love to travel, cook, play music, and spend as much time outdoors as possible.  We have lived in Asheville, NC since the 90’s and love seeing the area grow and expand in both culture and beauty. 

Respect for others is a top priority, as well as holding to our commitments.  We enjoy meeting and getting to know new people and exploring all aspects of the beautiful city we live in.

neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in the Grove Park area, a well-established, higher-end neighborhood with great sidewalks for walking and jogging. A very convenient location for all Asheville offers!
host_about:
I am a Photographer, Visual Artist, Special FX make-up artist. 
My husband creates metal sculpture. 
We now have three grown boys and we are looking forward to traveling more.  
We enjoy spending time in NYC when not in Asheville. 
I am currently working on a book of photography called Disappearing American Dream. The project creates a platform for everyday Americans to tell their story and share their dream.
My Motto - "Have Paint- Will Paint" I have painted everything from cars, motor cycles, people, The Characters in Disney's Lion King, even the Dixie Chicks on the cover of Entertainment Weekly. 

My Husbands Motto- "Perfection is the enemy of good"

description: Explore Asheville from this apartment close to the Asheville Country Club. Featuring a comfortable, queen-sized bed, hand-crafted, built-in bunk beds, backyard swings, and a fire pit. This home is perfect for a family vacation.

name: Historic Home Near Downtown Asheville Pvt Bed/Bath
description:
Spacious light filled private room with private bath across the hall in my home, a 1912 Arts and Crafts house, in the historic Grove Park neighborhood. Within walking distance (30 minute walk), an easy drive or quick Uber to the heart of Downtown. Also very close by is the Grove Park Inn, UNC-A, Asheville Yoga Center, 2 parks, several neighborhood restaurants, a beer & wine store, and great local ice cream shop. Two blocks from public transit.

The space
Upstairs bedroom with an Ikea queen mattress on a slated frame and a XL twin couch.
There is a crib for parents traveling with an infant in an adjacent room.
Private bathroom across the hall has the original clawfoot tub with a shower and sink with separate hot and cold faucets. Beautiful wrap around porch to relax with your morning coffee or a book and afternoon cup of tea. My house does not have central air but does have A/C window units in the bedrooms for your comfort. The house is on the ma
neighborhood_overview: My house is in the lovely North Asheville historic Grove Park neighborhood. Most homes are 100+ years old and reflect a grander era. Extremely safe and very walkable, sidewalks and tree lined streets. Within a few minutes you can walk to 7 neighborhood restaurants, Luella's BBQ, Homegrown, Starbucks, a wine shop, a bakery and coffee shop, butcher shop, the Grove Park Inn , a gorgeous Grove Park Inn sunset, Asheville Yoga Center, UNC Asheville, the Botanical Gardens, a 4 mile Greenway, a park, playground, frozen yogurt and a great local ice cream shop.  In just a 25-30 minute walk, short drive or a quick Uber ride you can be in the heart of our wonderful downtown area where you'll find countless Restaurants, breweries, Fine Arts movie theatre, Orange Peel, French Broad Chocolate, Civic Center, Diana Wortham theatre, Thomas Wolfe center and more.  Trader Joe's , Whole Foods and Harris Teeter grocery store less than a mile away. Biltmore Estate and Village is 4-5 miles or 15 minute drive
host_about: I am a North Carolina native and came to  Asheville in 2003 after living in Atlanta for 23 years.   I have 4 grown children that live in  Boston, Baltimore, St. Pete and Atlanta.  I loved having a house full of kids so seemed a natural fit to host folks in my home through AirBnB.  It is a pleasure to share my love of Asheville with my guests.  I stay pretty  busy with so much to do here:  gardening, yoga, hiking, volunteering, going to concerts, festivals, breweries and independent films.  My favorite thing of all is playing with my five precious grandchildren.  Life is good!

Hidden Cove Cabin affords year round access. It's great for groups of all ages.

The space
Location:

Accommodations:
4 bedroom, Bunk Room, 4 full baths, 2

description:
This home is so convenient to the Biltmore House you can walk about 100 feet and actually see it. The Blue Ridge Parkway is approximately 3 miles away, Outlets for the shoppers, hiking & biking for adventurers, Breweries for the beer lovers, Downtown Asheville is just 7 minutes, a pool is located on premise. So many options. Great for families and friends! We are so excited to share with our tenants this home! We also offer a whole house standby generator!

The space
We are so excited to say that we are doing an absolute 100% renovation to this beautiful home from inside to the outside. New paint, new fixtures, new hardwood floors, new tile showers, we added an upstairs loft for a third bedroom, new roof, new appliances, and so much more!!! Should you need two nights we will consider squeezing you in! Please inquire
1/8/20: We have added another bedroom in the basement for 2 more people. And full bathroom It will be completed by the weekend of January 24th

Making people happy is one of our main goals. We love meeting new people and would LOVE to meet YOU!

name: Private Bungalow Ten Minute Walk to Downtown Asheville
description:
Your private, spacious bungalow is located just a 10-minute walk to downtown Asheville and everything downtown has to offer. This two room suite has a lovely sitting area, dining table, Queen sized bed and Jacuzzi tub.

This bungalow is part of the adjacent Chestnut Street Inn and has received a 100% Sanitation Rating from the Department of Health & Human Services of Asheville.
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy the convenience of the Chestnut Hill Historical District of Asheville. Stroll a quick 10 minutes to downtown for restaurants, cafes, shops and everything else this quaint town offers.

There are several restaurants and cafes that are within a 5-minute walk as well. We love Liberty House for amazing breakfast and lunch and great coffee drinks, Elements for organic fresh juice and salads, Plant for exquisite vegan fare, City Bakery for a casual lunch and delicious baked goods to name a few.
host_about:
Emilie first fell in love with Asheville over 20 years ago when she attended Rockbrook Camp in the heart of a wooded mountain in Brevard, NC. Those mountains, so different from the beaches of her childhood, kept her coming back for ten years. There is something majestic about the Blue Ridge Mountains that blanket Western North Carolina, at over 1 billion years old, they are some of the oldest mountains in the entire world.

Arturo came to Asheville for the first time in 2012 and was quickly enamoured with the outdoor culture, so different from his 22 years in New York City, but so reminiscent of his childhood in the gentle hills of Puebla, Mexico. For him, it was a desire to start a family and a business and seek a better quality of life and he quickly found himself thirsty for everything that Asheville has to offer.

Emilie and Arturo met in 2008 while working together as sommeliers in the Lower East Side of Manhattan at The Ten Bells. Their working relationship was incredible, and over the next six years that relationship became a fine tuned machine- customers would always comment about the way they were able to seamlessly run the entire restaurant without even speaking. Learning the way one another worked over those first six years was the beginning of a true friendship that blossomed into love.

With 35 years of fine dining experience between the two, a Bed and Breakfast seemed like the perfect next adventure. Their penchant for hospitality and intuitive service and their true joy in meeting new people and making new friends put them in a unique position to choose their next path.

Emilie’s first Bed and Breakfast plan was written in the back of a college notebook when she was 18, wandering around Maine searching for the perfect wraparound porch. In 2011, she and Arturo decided to give those Bed and Breakfast dreams a trial run, and opened a small B&B in their East Village apartment. While tiny, it gave them a wonderful test-run on breakfast planning, scheduling, cleaning, decorating, recipe testing and conflict management. They loved it all!

The tri-lingual couple feel that they will bring a new, re-invented experience to the somewhat clichéd country B&B Inn. Asheville is no longer a sleepy town with boarded up buildings, it is a hub of restaurants, nightlife, music, beer and outdoor adventure. It’s not only the perfect place to call home, it is the perfect place to welcome someone into yours.

name: "Super Close to Everything,"  Private Studio
description:
Our guests keep telling us, "you're super close to everything we want to see in Asheville": Downtown, Biltmore Estate, Blue Ridge Parkway, the River Arts District, hiking, biking, water sports. This cozy, private studio apartment, is UPSTAIRS in a 2013-built home, with private entrance; comfy queen bed, bath, sitting/TV room and kitchenette. Continental breakfast included. ALL are welcome. See below the special precautions we're taking due to Covid-19.

The space
- Because of the Covid-19 pandemic, we follow Airbnb protocols to prevent spread of the virus: In addition to using freshly laundered sheets & towels, we switch bed spread and shams between guests, wipe down every touchable surface with commercial anti-bacterial cleanser, wash all dishes & utensils, provide commercially pre-packaged portions for your continental breakfast, wear masks during your check-in or use a self-check-in. If you have questions, don't hesitate to ask. Now for the description
neighborhood_overview:
We built our home in the Kenilworth neighborhood in part because it is convenient to everything in Asheville. We are a 5-minute drive to our delightful downtown, to Biltmore Estate, to tons of restaurants, breweries, shops and the mall on Tunnel Road; and a 10-minute drive to the River Arts District or to the Blue Ridge Parkway. We are also an easy drive to dozens of hiking trails.
If you’re up for a little walk in the neighborhood, within 5-minutes of our home you’ll see even more spectacular views of the mountains toward Mt. Pisgah to the west, and a panoramic view over downtown Asheville.
You might even see bears and wild turkeys. But remember they’re not tame!
host_about:
Michael and I moved to Asheville in late 2011 and built our arts and crafts cottage in 2013.  I grew up in New Orleans and we enjoy getting back to the “Big Easy” as often as possible.  You’ll see flavors of New Orleans around our home.  My work as a licensed esthetician has taken me to Atlanta, St. Lucia and Saint Simons Island, GA as well as New Orleans.  

Michael grew up in the Atlanta area and has lived and worked around the world.  After spending 3 1/2 years in western Ethiopia, he lived in Indonesia for 7 years, then Indianapolis for about 15 years.    

Michael’s work in international nonprofits has allowed us to travel together in Asia, Africa and South America. You’ll see hints of those travels in our home.  Since my father was born in Sicily, we have enjoyed reconnecting with family back in the “old country.”

I am a bit of a cinemaphile.  In addition to my collection of old movies (even some old video cassettes - - and yes we still have a VCR in addition to our DVD player), I enjoy the oldies and classics on TV and Netflix.  I also enjoy cooking - - occasionally resorting to some of my old "N’awlins" dishes.

We enjoy gardening.  I specialize on the designing and Michael handles a lot of the physical work - - at least outside.  I love creating and tending miniature gardens that enjoy the year-round beauty of our sunroom.

Since Michael recently retired, we’re doing some extra travel.  And my years of dancing on stage and theatre just wouldn't let me go, so I continue to enjoy tap and modern dance.

name: Hike-Bike-Eat-Drink-Stay, Private 3/2 Bent Creek
description:
Private 3/2 with plenty of parking, fast wifi. Your home base for all of your Asheville Adventures. In Bent Creek neighborhood with tons of trail access for hiking and biking. Close to the French broad for tubing and paddle boarding. 2.5 miles from Blue Ridge parkway and minutes from outlets for shopping. Only 10 miles to downtown.

The space
The options in Asheville are limitless and you'll definitely be planning a second visit after coming. The house is located on an acre lot in a neighborhood that is surrounded by national forest. You'll enjoy your home base here almost as much as the endless things you can do in Asheville. At the end of your day, you can enjoy comfortable beds, fast internet speeds and tvs with live channels as well as streaming options for you to log into with your own ids.
neighborhood_overview: Bent Creek is an established neighborhood filled with outdoors people who love to hike, bike and paddle through all of the local activities available to you. Tube down the french broad, enjoy the amazing cuisine of Asheville and even join the downtown drum circle for an authentic Asheville experience.   With so much variety nearby,  there is something for everyone.
host_about: Hi!  We are Kyle and Jennifer Henson. Kyle is a native to Western North Carolina. Jennifer has been in the area over 10 years. We love the mountains and all the amazing things Asheville has to offer. We can’t wait to host you at Cottage 646!

description:

This listing is our stylish, family and pet friendly apartment with separate entrance in the bottom half of our mountain home. The apartment sleeps 2 people comfortably with room to sleep up to 6. We are 2 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway entrance that takes you to many hikes and waterfalls and no more than 10 minutes to the Biltmore and all of the restaurants and breweries downtown has to offer!

The space
We are seasoned Airbnb Superhosts renting our downstairs apartment in our mountain home. There is a well stocked kitchenette, washer/dryer, and room to sleep your whole group but still feels very comfortable for just two!

The sleeping arrangements include a king bed, a queen pull out sofa, and a daybed in the living room that can be configured as a 1 king bed OR two twin beds.

The kitchenette should have everything you need to cook basic meals including pans, a d
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood with easy access to all interstates and areas of town! We are less than a mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway! We can accommodate up to 3 cars, but more than that will be a little tight. Let us know if this is an issue and we will work something out.
host_about: We are a young family who have been hosting Airbnb's for over 5 years! Elaine is a therapist and Ken works in public health. We care deeply that you enjoy your time in Asheville in a space that is clean and cozy after your adventures!

name: Magical large apartment downtown!
description:
Beautiful historic neighborhood in the heart of downtown Asheville. The apartment comes fully loaded with parking, Wi-Fi, coffee maker, t.v. and blue ray player, fenced in front yard for your fury friends, a large back yard perfect for relaxing.

The space
The space is newly renovated with modern and comfortable decor. It has large Windows with mountain views, comfortable queen sized bed, walk in closet, of street parking, Netflix, YouTube, Sega genesis by request, and walkabout downtown at your leasure. It's awesome!

Guest access
Front and back yards, Wi-Fi, private parking all of downtown!
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is steeped in culture, music, mountain views, and its in the heart of downtown Asheville. I'm proud to call it home.
host_about: I am a very socially motivated individual. I love interacting with new people and providing an entertaining atmosphere for all different types of fun loving individuals. I am an event planner, a sports journalist ( (Website hidden by Airbnb) a bartender, and a sports junky! I love to listen to good, live music, go to festivals, be outdoors, etc.

name: Lovely Private Apt. - Historic Home & Neighborhood
description:
This private, sunny, 650 square-foot apartment is the ideal location to experience local living in Asheville within walking distance to downtown, the botanical garden and greenway. Located in historic Montford, this 110-year-old house is filled with charm. Off-street parking offers access to a private deck entrance. Enjoy a drink outside on the private deck, dining or working in the sunroom, relaxing in a spacious living area and sweet dreams in a cozy, comfortable bedroom. Official Homestay.

The space
This private 650-square-foot apartment includes a private deck, sunroom, living room, bedroom and bathroom. Hardwood floors and antiques throughout the space add to the charm of the 110-year-old house as it combines the best of old and new. The sunroom includes a sink, refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven and single burner hot plate + kitchen ware. Access to a grill. Indoor and outdoor dining. The bedroom with Queen bed is made for comfort and restful sleep
neighborhood_overview: Few neighborhoods express the rich architectural heritage and vitality of Asheville better than the Montford Historic District. Montford retains more than 600 buildings, most of which were built between 1890 and 1920, and includes a variety of architectural influences reflecting the cosmopolitan character of Asheville during the turn of the 20th century. Victorian, Queen Anne and Arts and Crafts styles combined with Neoclassical, Colonial Revival and castle-like motifs, result in an overall complex quality of designs and artistic talent throughout the neighborhood.  Wide streets with sidewalks make walking or biking easy.  Within viewing distance of the greenway and UNCA campus including the botanical garden.  Several neighborhood restaurants are within minutes on foot.
host_about: I've lived in Asheville for more than 20 years.  Our neighborhood community is wonderful and we would love to welcome you here. My passions are dancing, music, sharing good food and community.  I've worked around the world with the most wonderful people and nonprofit organizations. Come visit!

name: Riverside Bungalow - 2 miles to downtown!
description:
Super close to downtown Asheville, perched on a hill with views of nearby river valley. Close to everything and relaxed and quiet

The space
Unbeatable convenience to downtown Asheville (2 mi). Bright, sunny, space with views of surrounding river valley. In the winter the French Broad River can be seen just over the treetops. Located in a quiet industrial/residential neighborhood immediately north of Downtown Asheville. Close to several river parks and the River Arts district, but most of all crazy convenient to downtown. If you're looking for an affordable, comfortable, convenient space, this is it.

Situated on a hill just above the French Broad River, in what is easily one of Ashevilles most convenient and underrated neighborhoods. You’re 2 miles from all that Downtown has to offer, with some amazing neighborhood gems close by, like Asheville’s two newest breweries within a mile, High Five Riverside coffee shop, or Asheville Community Yoga.
neighborhood_overview: Zillicoah and Riverside Rhapsody Brewing (ashevilles newest 2 breweries), high 5 riverside coffee, taqueria muñoz, nine mile west, 2 miles to Moog music and downtown asheville.
host_about: I grew up in Asheville and have watched the city turn from a quiet mountain town with an abandoned downtown, to the bustling tourist destination it is today.   I am a musician and small business owner, and I have a few rental properties in Asheville to supplement my income.  I take pride in offering a space that has personality, cleanliness, and value.  If I were coming to visit Asheville, I would be thrilled to stay in one of my rentals for all three of these reasons!

name: Dragonfly Cottage
description:
Dragonfly Cottage built in 1905 is a vintage Asheville boarding house, mix of modern (completely updated) and old. Walking distance to Brewery"s, or downtown shops and restaurants. Downtown neighborhood can be loud. Some people are not prepared for noise and street people. Sweet front flower garden, large front porch, and front parlor available to guest at all times. Old dog Levi is now confined to back of the house, host living quarters and back yard, Levi is not trustworthy around guest.

The space
Couple or singles get away!
Nice old world bedrooms. Two rentals up stairs this one is on the front of house with private bath across the hall. The other rental is Dragonfly Cottage II on back of house with ensuite bath. Both have comfortable queen size beds. Bathrooms completely updated. Local art displayed to create a mix of old and new. Pease ask about the artist.
Parlor room downstairs available for those that can't sleep (not wanting to disturb par
neighborhood_overview:
This is a downtown transitional neighborhood with 24/7 activity. Grocery, restaurants, brewery's are all right up the street.
Friday night drum circle is a must in Asheville. The River Arts District is down the hill. I have a studio space in Oddsey Pottery Studios, I can walk to it.
host_about:
I fell into the retirement honey pot in Asheville as owner of Dragonfly Cottage and keeping my horse at the Biltmore Estate. It is better than owning my own horse farm, no fences to fix or acres of grass to mow.
As a widow with grown children I sometimes miss the excitement of family. This gives me contact with lots of wonderful people. They come, have a good time, and go. Each seems like a beautiful gift. And of course Asheville is Awesome!!!

description:
Dragonfly Cottage, built in 1905, is vintage Asheville: mix of modern (completely updated) and old. Old boarding house feel. 15 min. walk downtown less to South Slope Breweries. Downtown streets can be loud at times part of the Asheville seen. Old Dog Levi is now confined to host living quarters and the backyard, old and crotchety, he is no longer safe around guest.

The space
Bedroom is upstairs in back of house, Queen bed, master suite nicely appointed with ensuite bathroom, large shower, separated by old pocket doors. Wonderful mix of old and new, classic old Asheville boarding house feel. One other bedroom rented up stairs.

Guest access
Guest are may use parlor to read or hang out. Have a shot of Bourbon from the mantle decanter before retiring, a Southern tradition. Drink coffee or a local beer (from the beer exchange in the upstairs fridge) on the large front porch. Or just relax on the front porch swing and admire the gardens an

There is a grocery, arts studios, theater, restaurants, brewery's, all nearby.

name: The West Asheville Loft
description:
Sunny loft apartment in West Asheville, tucked behind our office. This little 1937 gem has just been completely renovated and is as crisp and clean as they come! Lush linens, a fully stocked kitchen and a divine shower make this little get away a great place if you are looking for a private place to stay in while adventuring through Asheville. Just a 3 mile drive to downtown, the river arts district or the south slope. Only 5 miles to the Biltmore House.

The space
The Loft apartment is located behind our 1937 Arts and Crafts Dental practice which was a single family home before we bought it and turned it into our dental practice in 1980. The Loft has been an apartment since the home was originally built. To find it, drive to the back of the building that says Carriage House (our other rental) and you will see the stairs that will lead you up to the apartment. There is a key lock box to make your self check-in convenient.
We have just recently completely re
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located in West Asheville right on Patton Ave which is a main road that takes you straight to downtown Asheville. We are near Haywood road which is one of the most popular places in Asheville to live. There are a ton of amazing bars and restaurants in West Asheville.  The Loft is located behind our dental practice and above our other rental property called the Carriage house.
host_about: Myron and I finished school in Southern California and randomly chose Asheville as a place we would both like to live back in 1977.  We have loved watching Asheville grow and change as the years have gone by.  What an amazing place we have chosen to live in!  We own the dental practice on Patton Avenue and we also have a beautiful wedding event space west of Asheville called The Farm-A Gathering Place.  We are known for our hospitality and love it when people come to see why we love this town!

This property is so unique in that it is a quiet Mountaintop but 5 minutes to Asheville with access to all stores shop historic places and everything Asheville has to offer.

Beautiful pool and hiking trails

This is a townhome with 2 off street parking spaces

name: Family friendly, Roomy, and Comfy
description:
Convenient to everything in and around AVL. Toys for the kids and yard for the pup, large patio, TVs, fully stocked chef's kitchen. Open and sunny. Enjoy Asheville at your own pace in this roomy, comfy home-away-from-home!
Send me a message for the link to our virtual tour.

The space
Open floor plan, large kitchen, and ample parking makes this home perfect for gathering together. The living room features lots of room for little ones to play and a big screen Roku TV while the adults have a great time nearby in the large, fully stocked chef's kitchen. We have baby and children's toys, including rattles, blocks, books, and more. All toys are sanitized between guests.

Kitchen is stocked with crockpot, baking sheets, cooling racks, Hamilton Beach toaster oven, measuring cups/spoons, cooking and serving utensils, knives, mixing/serving bowls, pots/pans, French press and a coffee maker, ice cream maker, sugar, salt, pepper, cooking oil, coffee. I am hap
neighborhood_overview:
This family-focused neighborhood is convenient to everywhere, very close to the Parkway, quiet, and safe.
Biltmore House/Village: 5 minutes
Playgrounds: 5 minutes
Highlands Brewing Company: 6 minutes
Target/Whole Foods: 8 minutes
Blue Ridge Parkway Visitor Center: 8 minutes
Downtown: 10 minutes
host_about: We love traveling, especially with our two beautiful children. Marianne is a native western North Carolinian and Luis is a native Mexican from Oaxaca. We've lived in Asheville (proper) since 2012 and are excited to share our home with you!

name: River Arts Comfy Getaway
description:
River Arts District with Private Entrance and Sunny Backyard! Overlooks River Arts and is walking distance to Downtown Asheville (15 min walk), River Arts District restaurants and art shops (5 min walk), New Belgium Brewery (5 min walk), Wedge Brewery (5 min walk) and 12 Bones BBQ (5 min drive). Enjoy yourself in our friendly, beautiful, and comfortable home.

The space
The space comfortable, cool, and private. Located in the historic part of "Chicken Hill" you get to stay in this unique neighborhood with super close access to downtown and RAD (River Arts District). We have an amazing Green Way along the river to walk, bike, run, or rollerblade along a 5 minute walk away.

The house is in a friendly neighborhood that is unique to Asheville. You can walk to downtown or to the River Arts District easily. It's quiet, safe, and the neighbors look out for each other in a very friendly way.

There is two floors. You enter the front door to a
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is called Chicken Hill or West End Clingman Avenue Neighborhood (WECAN). Its one of the older neighborhoods in the area that's got a ton of new artsy houses next to spectacular redone original ones. Our house was originally built in 1904 and has been remodeled in the Asheville artsy craftsman style.

The neighborhood is safe, family oriented and very walk-able. You will see neighbors walking their dogs and strolling with their children everyday. We are right between the River Arts District and Central Asheville. If you love Asheville's restaurants, theater, arts and yoga studios, craft breweries and local music scene - then you are in the heart of access either for walking, biking, or of course driving.

You can easily walk from here (we do many times a week) downtown to Pack Square or go the other direction to the French Broad River & RAD. The closest food is Henrietta's Poultry Shoppe, a delicious buttermilk chicken place with lots of options
host_about: Friendly, Outdoor-enthusiasts, Art makers, World Travelers

name: Close to Everything in Beautiful Asheville
description:
My home is conveniently located 10 minutes from downtown Asheville or Blue Ridge Parkway or 15 minutes from Airport. I have a very shy cat which you will never see but another teenage active cat you will see!!!
This is a no smoking home. My room has a queen sized bed and a private bathroom and semi-private entrance. This is a quiet street with off-street parking and mountain views. I provide WiFi, coffee/tea. There is a refrigerator in room with water and juice.

The space
I can provide you with lots of maps of the area for hiking, eating, movies, theatres, breweries, etc. There are so many different things to do in Asheville that I am sure you will have a wonderful visit!

Guest access
Guests have a private bedroom and bathroom. Coffee/tea are available in dining room. The back yard patio has a swing in the garden available. The front porch can also be used by guests.

Other things to note

neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is very safe and quiet.  It is a dead end street off another dead end street!  I have off street parking for guests.
host_about: I love to travel and have been to more than 40 countries but Asheville is so beautiful!  I love to hike, go to movies, read and most of all, show off this wonderful mountain area.  I love animals and have 2  cats now but have had many different animals.  I know the area quite well and can give you suggestions of what to see and do here to make your time here just what you want it to be!  I have received both my COVID shots so am safe!  I use all the safety and cleaning protocols recommended so you are safe as well!

name: Gashes Fluss Haus
description: Walk back past tall trees, over a small wooden bridge with built-in love seats. Massage tired feet on a polished river-rock shower floor. This rustic 2-story cottage, dating back over 100 years, has whitewashed stone walls and a wood-burning stove. This is an old farm hand house and it shares the same property with the main house.
neighborhood_overview: Surrounded by nature, the home is a short drive to downtown, West Asheville, and the Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about: I'm a family man, with two young girls. I run an Airbnb, and love carpentry.

name: Zen Home
description:
Terrific place, located close to everything! Quiet street, parking , totally renovated Arts and Craft home. Lots of room to enjoy the views from the back porch to the lazy hammock on the front porch. I love to share our common areas with guest such as living room, dining room and have use to the kitchen.
I do have one outdoor/indoor cat named Lupita, short hair and enjoys mostly being outdoors.
We have homestay permit for short term rental.

The space
The house was completely renovated but maintains the beauty of the Arts and Craft home. It has wonderful lounging areas, such as the back deck overlooking greenery and the humming birds that feed on the flowers and feeders. I love the front porch too, comfy rocking chairs and the hammock.

Other things to note
This home is in downtown Asheville area within an urban setting with a diverse neighborhood. Our street is only one block long with all the homes built in the 1920s. We have mul
neighborhood_overview: We are on a quiet street in an upcoming neighborhood blocks away from the River Arts District. We are also close to AB Tech that has a beautiful small forest.
host_about:
Hi, I am almost a native of beautiful south Florida. I love the outdoors and the weather here. Florida is really a special place if you venture out into all it has to offer. A great art scene, an amazing one of a kind ecosystem in the Everglades and the best weather in the continental USA in the winter. If you love sunshine, beaches and a diverse population of interesting people, head down our way. We have a small oasis in the middle of Fort Lauderdale awaiting you with some easy, fun,loving vibes. Now for the Asheville home, if you been to Asheville there isn't really anything I can add to this amazing town. Art, music, food like you have never had before and the beautiful Smokey Mountains!!! 
Thanks,
Ana

name: Luxury Suite with Blissful Comforts
description:
Off street parking and a stone pathway lead to a sheltered keypad entrance. Curl up with cushions and a cup of coffee or tea in a cozy reading nook offering exquisite garden views and in Winter, distant mountains. Enjoy heated floors, a secluded patio and a bidet in a serene Buddhist-inspired bathroom. Walk Reed Creek Greenway reaching downtown shops about a mile away. Complimentary Internet TV, Wi-Fi, face masks, hand sanitizer and wine.

Airbnb Enhanced Protocol is followed, cleaning and sanitizing each room per checklists with disinfectants approved by the CDC. HEPA filters throughout.
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the Woolsey/Jackson Park neighborhood of Asheville, just over a mile north of downtown. Walk or bike Reed Creek Greenway most of the way, reaching city center by foot in a half hour, less by bike, or 5 minutes by car. Restaurants, breweries, shops, and bike rentals are within walking distance on Merrimon Ave. Weaver Park, UNCA Botanical Gardens and Beaver Lake Bird Sanctuary are nearby. The campus of the University of North Carolina, Asheville is 3 short blocks away.
host_about: My wife and I recently moved to Asheville, North Carolina from Los Angeles, California. We love it here for so many reasons: the Blue Ridge Parkway, the Biltmore Estate and the charm of the southern Appalachian mountains. When you consider the natural beauty of this place, the friendly locals, the arts, music and food scene, you've got a winner! Plus we appreciate the plethora of local craft brewers and the emphasis on local, sustainable and organic food. We also participate in the many outdoor recreational opportunities available.

name: Cute Craftsman Asheville Suite
description:
Upstairs loft with private entrance. This is the entire second floor of our home, and we have utilized a privacy screen to block off our downstairs living area from your private entrance. There are no shared spaces at all.

Follow us on Instagram at instagram.com/craftsmanavlretreat

The space
*We verify this suite is professionally cleaned with products approved by the EPA for use against COVID-19. Bookings at this home include a 72-hour buffer between guests. Your hosts are also both fully vaccinated against COViD-19.*

Spacious bedroom with a queen bed, private bathroom, and attached sitting nook. The sitting nook comes equipped with a couch, bookshelf and kitchenette station with a microwave, mini fridge and coffee maker. The bedroom room comes equipped with two nightstands, a dresser, a desk, a luggage rack and a 40 inch flatscreen TV with chromecast installed for your streaming needs.

Guest access
Guests only have
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is on a small cul-de-sac with other cute Craftsmen style homes, and is very accessible to both I-40 and I-26. The house is 5 minutes from Haywood Rd in West Asheville, and 10 minutes to downtown. We are also only minutes to the gorgeous Biltmore House, the Arboretum, Asheville Outlets and Biltmore Park, along with many other exciting attractions. Given its great location, it is important to note my house is not within walking distance to any bars or restaurants, but it is very easy and inexpensive to Uber to wherever you want to go!
host_about: I am a 31 year old female, working as a mental health counselor in the Asheville area. I have lived in Asheville for 7 years and consider it my home! I love live music, exploring nature, admiring local art and consider myself a bit of a foodie. I am an avid animal lover and enjoy volunteering with the local animal shelters and rescues. I am very tidy and a bit of a neat freak, but I also like to think I am fairly laid-back and down to earth. If you have any questions about me, feel free to ask!

name: Cozy Mountain Cottage
description:
Welcome to Asheville and to our Home! We're happy to have you as our guest and hope that you will love this area as much as we do.

We're 10 minutes to Downtown Asheville, less than 9 minutes to The Biltmore House, and 4 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway.

You'll be secluded enough to feel like you're out of the hustle-and-bustle of the city, but just a short drive to the life and excitement of Downtown Asheville, and many other area attractions.

The space
We've recently renovated the duplex, so everything is like new! A lot of love and effort has been dedicated, and we hope that you enjoy the space.

The downstairs unit has (2) bedrooms, (1) bathroom, kitchen (with a stove and dishwasher), and a living room.

The living room has a television with Chromecast and Amazon Fire Stick (not cable or satellite), so you may easily stream movies or music directly from your smart phone. The Fire Stick comes with free access to Amazo
neighborhood_overview: Our property is on about 1.5 acres, and during the summer, you won't be able to see the neighbors. :)
host_about:
We've been here in Asheville since 2013, and have recently renovated this duplex with our own hands (along with friends and family).

We're really excited that you've decided to stay, and look forward to your visit. Please come to relax, breathe in the crisp mountain air, and enjoy everything that Asheville has to offer.

name: Charming Arts & Crafts home in West Asheville
description:
This charming 1917 Arts and Crafts home is conveniently located at the heart of it all.
The house is situated in a historical neighborhood on a half-acre with views of an organic garden and the mountains. It's also just a very short 5 minute walk to Downtown West Asheville for breweries, restaurants and shops.

The space
My earthly spacious home has lush plants, beautiful antiques, gorgeous woodwork and European charm. There is a lovely wrap around deck to lounge about as well as a secluded back porch that overlooks the back garden and mountains. Large open workspace is available in the dinning room and parking is free and close just next to the entrance.
I excel at maintaining a clean and safe environment for my guests.

Have comfort in knowing I invite and support cultural diversity and am welcoming to all couples.

Please note I am happy to accommodate folks working within a budget so an air mattress and couch are available
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is conveniently located near the highway but in a quiet and historical area. Trees and sidewalks line the street and a Bed & Breakfast is directly across from the home.
host_about: I am an avid gardener and love to hike and fish in these lovely mountains.

name: The Red Rooster Bungalow
description:
My name is Mikael and I will be your host during your stay. My mother who lives in Huntersville is my partner. We have decorated the house to make it as cozy and comfortable for you as I we could. There are two separate floors and spaces. My living space is in the basement and the studio out back. Outdoor smoking only.
You have the whole upstairs to yourselves and I am a text away. I spend much of my time in the studio in back but am here to make your stay great.

The space
This brick bungalow is warm and comfortable with lots of space. You have almost the whole house to yourselves with plenty of space to spread out. One room has a nice queen bed in a room with charm. The other room has two single beds and is full of light and looking out into the courtyard. Plus the office futon can be set up as a bed. A large kitchen is supplied with coffee and light snacks. We provide coffee pods for the Keurig and filters for the coffee maker. The dinning area is als
neighborhood_overview: Although there is a busy road on one side it is also across from a large green-space and is just a few blocks from a park and then a green-way. You are about a 10 min walk or so to West Asheville down town area. But the whole street starting at the house is full of stuff like restaurants, micro-brews and coffee.
host_about:
I have been in West Asheville and the surrounding area since about 2003 and  watched it grow immensely.  About 13 years ago my parents and I  purchased "This old house" and  I have been rehabing  this over 100 year old West Asheville bungalow back to some of its former glory for much of the that time.  It was moved in 1926 to this location and set on this more, modern basement,   this is were I have my apartment that took many more,years to make livable and is still on  going, so many projects not enough time. 
I went to Western Carolina University in the 90s and visited Asheville on occasion, but it was much different then. In the past 14 years West Asheville has seen a big revival with lots of room to grow. With Sunny point and Biscuit Head restaurant's 3 brewery's right on Haywood rd and near buy and  many other places to eat/visit within a couple of miles.
Therw,are,several green ways and   I love being outside hiking biking or camping,  when I can get away. I have an auqaponics system in the greenhouse/studio/shed and grow plants in a vertical system and grow fish in the water below. So I spend most of my time in the shediohouse doing art music or mad scientist stuff.

name: My Green Escape
description:
Living/breathing space, fresh flowers, living plants, great internet, copious complimentary snacks and breakfast items, lush outdoor gardens, sparkling clean hot tub. Note that I have upstairs 2nd suite that is sometimes occupied. Add privacy option for an additional $25/night (Oct. dates and holiday weekends are $50 per night) to be the only guests on site.

The space
So pressing at this time is prevention of Covid. Pick up, clean, then sanitize with Lysol spray disinfectant is my routine. We've added an (iWave-R), a residential air cleaner that works as an air ionizer, thus killing mold, bacteria and virus. Though I routinely clean, there is nothing routine how I go about it. Any surface that may have been touched by previous guests or myself are cleaned and sprayed. This includes soap dispensers, remotes, door handles, appliance handles, light switches, faucets, toilet seats, and couch and chair upholstery. Throw pillows into the dryer. Laundry sanitizers adde
neighborhood_overview:
My Green Escape is located on rolling hillside terrain, picturesque lightly wooded neighborhood with most types of NC mountain wildlife. At My Green Escape there is no grass lawn, rather naturally mossed rock outcrops with a variety of woodland plants and seedling pine, oak, maple, tulip poplar, mountain laurel, sassafras, and sourwood trees. It's a horticulturist's delight!
To that end, in the warmer growing season the property abounds with annuals, perennials and potted tropical plants.
Tom ~~
host_about:
My experience in life has been to minister. At first I was studying to be a priest but later realized that comforting people can be done in more ways than from that approach. Meeting, greeting and engaging guests without agenda puts them at ease and when guests arrive with little or few expectations and are open to my quirky approach to life, magic happens. Giving give wide berth for your privacy, but there when social interaction is desired.
I've learned that I can only try and please everyone. That works for 97% of the time. Occasionally guests cannot let go of stress and innate suspicions, and that is baggage that I cannot carry for them. With an open mind and heart you will have on of the best experiences you can at an Airbnb establishment.
I welcome you to my home and my gig! Tom ~~ your host

name: West Asheville Bamboo Bungalow near French Broad River
description: Recharge on a large balcony overlooking a serene bamboo grove that leads down to the river. The eastern touches continue inside, via the intricately carved bed and cabinet. There's old-style furniture too, plus a wonderfully modern chef's kitchen.
neighborhood_overview: Joyner Avenue is a quiet street that runs parallel to the French Broad River. Just below is the Smoky Mountain Adventure Center, with its climbing wall and bar. At the end of the street is an eclectic coffee house and cafe, Edna’s at the River.
host_about:
Inquisitive traveler, entrepreneur and hospitality management extraordinaire with demonstrated history of cultural adaptability, lucrative innovation, and a keen perception of people. 

I attribute both my personal and financial prosperity to the cultivation and practice of several routines that have led to a better understanding of self. Through daily meditation, sport, and loving relationships with both friends and mentors I live each day knowing I can learn and accomplish anything I desire. Therefore, it’s not a matter of selling my worth to the world because I know I can’t be stopped when I set my sights on a target.

name: *Squad Bunker* ~ Perf Chill Pad for Groups & Pets!
description:
I can't promise you cheaper beer, but I CAN provide a 5/5 perf chill pad for you and your friends to recover from hitting all the breweries. In fact, up to 10 of them (+ you=11). So choose your top ten (and don't tell the others!) and head to Asheville! Facts: ~3 miles to downtown, (cheap Lyft/Uber!) fridge & microwave. 2 queen beds, 2 bunks, futon, & air mattress.

The space
Do not book this space if you are looking for something fancy or with high-dollar amenities since it is, in fact, a ~basement~! Perfect for bro weekends and bachelorette weekends~! [not really for families!]. A group-friendly bunker walking-ish distance from Biltmore Village. Downtown Asheville is three miles - a quick Uber/Lyft ride - away!
Please note- we live above so you will hear us walking, etc. and our dogs, but we make every effort to be as quiet as possible when we have guests. Also since the bunker is pet-friendly, don't be surprised to see a dog hair or two (we do
neighborhood_overview:
Conveniently located one mile from Biltmore Village and three miles to downtown Asheville.
Please note the space (like many in Asheville) is in close vicinity to the train tracks and a junction, meaning that the engineer is required to use the horn. You will hear the trains passing on a regular basis. Only one guest has ever complained about it, though.

name: Convenient + modern spot:  central North Asheville
description:
Accommodations are suitable for a single person or couple visiting Asheville for vacationing pleasure, business or both. Located in a quiet neighborhood less than 4 miles from downtown and there is access to the Blue Ridge Parkway without a single traffic light. Private and secure entry is separate from main home. Spacious living room with fireplace and streaming TV for lounging. Kitchenette with self serve coffee, microwave and minifridge. Parking is easy and only steps away from the door.

The space
The custom woodwork throughout the house was a collaborative design between owner and craftsman. Using locally sourced materials for cabinets; and urban reclaimed hardwood lumber for furnishings, doors and original paneling, all uniquely designed with a handcrafted touch.

Guest access
Guest parking is convenient and directly in front of home or on gravel parking pad. A door from bedroom leading to storage room remains closed and locked.
neighborhood_overview: End of street privacy in a quiet neighborhood...  Lots of greenery and leaf viewing opportunities during 3 seasons.  Winters can be mild compared to areas North of the mid-Atlantic.  With an elevation ~ 2300' we do have some snow during winters.  Navigating slippery roads while driving in Asheville is not a real good idea with steep slopes.
host_about: I am an Asheville native and returned to live here in 2011.  When I'm not working in real estate management, maintenance and sales - I enjoy exploring hiking trails leading to vistas and waterfalls.  Please let me know if I can assist in recommendations for local venues, adventuring in the mountains and immersing yourselve(s)  into the culture of our city of four seasons.

We love to travel and have been to many wonderful destinations in this world , but hands down Tanzania is our absolute favorite experience. name: Private apartment w/ kitchen and laundry
description:
Our cozy nest is simple and clean with enough character to keep one entertained. The covered front porch leads you into a large open kitchen with enough space to spread out and make a meal for your tribe or just relax with a cup of tea after taking a walk on the nearby trails. Big windows let in plenty of natural light to give this space a sense of calm. When enjoying the national forest just a few blocks away or floating down the river, you'll look forward to coming home to this quaint jewel.

The space
Our place is a comfortable and private apartment. the front porch is a great place to have morning coffee or chat with a friend. Theres a grat park just 2 blocks away great kids or just a peaceful sunset walk

Guest access
The apartment has its own private access and off street parking for up to 2 cars.
neighborhood_overview: The Bent Creek neighborhood location borders Pisgah National Forest and is a stones throw from the French Broad River, a popular spot for tubing, paddle boarding, canoeing, and fishing. The Blue Ridge Parkway is right around the corner, next to the NC Arboretum. When you're not out adventuring, Asheville's Outlet Mall is right up the road, and you're just a ten minute drive to all that Asheville has to offer.
host_about: The inspiration for my life comes from adventure and exploration. The Bent Creek neighborhood attracted me for its access to a variety of outdoor pursuits and its proximity to Asheville eclectic culture. I am excited to share my cozy home away from home with friendly, like-hearted travelers.

name: Blue Ridge Fire Tower
description:
Located on the Blue Ridge Parkway just minutes from downtown, this beautiful fire tower inspired cabin is perfect for your next vacation! The cabin is far enough away that you will feel secluded yet just minutes from all the fun and action of downtown. Come and experience all that Asheville has to offer and then enjoy relaxing on the wrap around porch, cuddling up in front of the fire pit, or hiking the near by Mountains to the Sea trail. We are excited to have you experience our "happy place"!

The space
Due to the coronavirus outbreak our cleaning company is taking extra precautions while disinfecting and cleaning the house between guests. They are taking care to disinfect frequently touched surfaces, such as door knobs and light switches. As well as changing all sheets and towels regardless if they appear to have been used.

The house is two stories with the bedrooms and full bath downstairs and the common area with a half bath upstairs. There are tw
neighborhood_overview: The surrounding area is residential but we are located off a gravel road that is pretty secluded. We are within minutes of hiking the Mountains to the Sea trail which runs next to the Blue Ridge Parkway and just a 10 minute drive to downtown.
host_about:
I'm a California girl who wound up in the south. I moved to Charleston in my mid 20s and met a local boy who I'm very happily married to with 3 amazing kids. We love to travel, although the kids make it a little more difficult then it used to be. My favorite pace so far is Italy, we went there on our 5th anniversary and can't wait to go back! On my bucket list is Alaska, Spain, and England. When we travel we like to stay off the beaten path and explore the less touristy parts of the area. The best places we have eaten and experienced were always things we stumbled upon. 

At home you will typically find me outside chasing my baby boy around everywhere from the beach to the park, even in the rain, he loves being outside and on the run! I'm a very proud stay at home mom but also help my husband out in our business. I run the office and keep him organized. In my spare time, if that's even a thing with 3 kids, I like to run, do yoga, read, and watch tv (a luxury, especially if I get to choose the show).

name: The Acorn Guesthouse
description:
Welcome to The Acorn guesthouse at Cozy Oak! Think of this tiny house as a hotel room with added benefits. You have about 180 square feet under roof that includes a private bathroom along with additional covered outdoor living space for relaxing. The fire pit area is a shared space for all guests to enjoy. There is a small refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster over, & microwave in the Acorn as well as dishes, etc. so you are able to prepare some meals. Smart TV for Netflix & a few channels.

The space
This space is perfect for those looking for a "Tiny House" experience! The location on a dead end street is very private & wooded, yet you are so close to the city life of Asheville! One can easily walk to Biltmore Village (1 mile away) and enjoy the many breweries & restaurants located there. Downtown Asheville is less than 4 miles away.

*Note* This listing complies with the City of Asheville’s short term rental laws by utilizing a 30 night minimu
neighborhood_overview: Oakley is a beautiful & quite area of Asheville located just east of Biltmore Village.  You can hang out with the locals at one of several breweries within a mile of my place.
host_about: I love to travel and Asheville is one of my favorite places!  I have spent most of my vacations traveling & scuba diving in the Caribbean, but there is something special about the mountains & change of seasons!  Of course the beer & food of Asheville is a big attraction as well.  I currently live much of the year in the Bear Den apartment at Cozy Oak Cottage.  I sometimes rent out the Acorn guesthouse.  If you love tiny houses the Acorn would be perfect.  Otherwise Cozy Oak Cottage with 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, & large kitchen is a lovely place to stay.

Our house is quite unique because of its strategic location within 2 miles from downtown and Biltmore Estate. Everything is a short drive and Uber is about $10 dollars per ride to downtown. Kenilworth has it own park, located in the heart of the neighborhood,  which has picnic tables and grills, ball fields and courts, and a playground.
host_about: I love to travel and meet people. My husband and I have traveled to four different continents and have picked up a thing or two about hospitality.  I believe in creating relationships and bringing people together for unforgettable experiences.

name: Asheville Getaway...Fenced in Backyard!
description:
Ten minutes away from West Asheville and fifteen minutes away from downtown Asheville. Your privacy is valued here with your own entrance. This is an all inclusive basement suite which is equipped with all the comforts necessary to support an extended or overnight stay. name: West Asheville Yellow Bungalow on Haywood
description:
The Yellow Bungalow is in the heart of West Asheville’s vibrant nightlife, great restaurants, breweries and bars. This updated Victorian bungalow is the perfect home base for exploring Asheville. Built in 1915, this funky little house has character, charm and comfort.

The space
Complete with a front porch and off street parking (for up to three cars), the home sleeps six with two large bedrooms offering queen beds and closets. Upstairs you’ll find a private lofted space with two twin beds. Downstairs includes a sitting room; a full living room with a large screen TV and cable; a nice-sized bathroom with bathtub and shower; and a great kitchen with a full-size refrigerator, electric stove, and microwave. Basic cooking supplies and utensils provided, including a full set of dishes and silverware. The kitchen also includes a cute dining nook that seats 5 to 6 guests.
This rental includes the entire top level of the home with a private entrance. The downs
neighborhood_overview: Perhaps the best part of this rental isn’t what’s inside the home, it’s what’s outside the doors!  This house sits at the center of Haywood Road, which makes it easy to walk to West Asheville’s unique activities that include music venues, shops, breweries, restaurants and bakeries.  We are only two miles from Carrier Park and the French Broad River, a great place within the city to boat, run or hike.  In addition, the home is only a five-minute drive to downtown Asheville, the River Arts District, UNC-A and the botanical gardens.  The airport is less than 12 miles away, and its easy to hop on or off the interstate no matter where you want to go!  If you are looking for a place with character in an awesome location to be your home base while you enjoy Western North Carolina, this is the perfect home for you.
host_about: I'm an Asheville native, and experienced local Realtor, who enjoys exploring the beautiful landscapes and delicious foodscapes this mountain city has to offer. My two wonderful children and I are proud (and lucky!) to call Asheville our home.

name: Artistic Retreat - Minutes to Town & Scenic Trails
description:
Artistic family friendly guest suite in North Asheville near the Grove Park Inn located 10 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway biking/hiking trails and 5 minutes by car to downtown Asheville and the hospitals. Families with kids, business travelers and weekend explorers with or without pets are welcome. We can provide recommendations for restaurants, nearby hiking trails and other local attractions.

The space
The studio apartment has a separate entrance and views of the organic flower/vegetable gardens. The space was originally built as a mother-in-law suite that is separated from the main house by a 2” steel door that locks on both sides. It has a private bedroom, living room, dinning area, kitchenette, and private bathroom with a walk in shower.

The living area has board games, a large screen TV and a Roku device with access to Netflix, Hulu, Vudu and other online channels.

The kitchenette has a coffee maker, microwave, toaster and mini f
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is nestled in a quiet neighborhood on a family friendly street. It is conveniently located in North Asheville near the Grove Park Inn and is literally 10 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway and 5 minutes to the heart of Downtown Asheville.

We are located in the Blue Ridge corridor which is active with birds and other wildlife. There are several hiking & biking trails minutes from our front door and our bird feeders are always busy with a variety of migrating birds.

Our neighborhood also has flocks of wild turkeys that are protected by the City of Asheville. It's not uncommon to find a parade of turkeys stopping neighborhood traffic when they cross the street!!

We are also located 3 minutes or so by car from Beaver Lake. It has a relatively flat 2.5 mile walking, running & biking trail that circles the lake and bird sanctuary. It has beautiful views, particularly at dawn & dusk, and is a perfect location for a relaxing picnic, lake kayaking, flyi
host_about:
I'm a seasoned traveler that loves to explore other cultures. I've collected artwork and stories from all of my journeys that I love to share with kindred spirits. I had my own art studio in the River Arts District for over 10 years but can usually be found in the kitchen cooking up something tasty or out in the wild exploring the landscape that makes Asheville such a beautiful place. 

Professionally I work as the UI/UX Designer for a regional hospital system and serve on the Board of Directors for a local historic preservation society. 

I'm happy to recommend my local favorites for dining, hiking, and entertainment. If time & my schedule permits, I might also be able to provide you with a personal tour of a few of our historic sites, my favorite wineries & breweries or a few of the art studios  that Are worth visiting.

name: Westside Wayside
description:
Our second story apartment features huge windows that let in the breeze, the sunshine, and the mountain air! Nestled in a quiet neighborhood and set back from the road, our apartment is very peaceful and secure. Enjoy a huge king size bed, a large living room with queen size pull-out couch, a full kitchen, and a full bathroom. All of this less than 10 minutes from Downtown Asheville!

The space
Our apartment was specifically crafted with out of town guests in mind. This 800 square foot space sits atop our detached garage and is adjacent to our year round home. Built in 2017 this apartment features everything we like to have when we travel: a full kitchen, private onsite laundry, a king size bed, big windows that open (don't you hate staying in hotels where the windows don't open!). We live in a tight knit neighborhood so there are other homes close by. That said, we are set back from the street and the apartment has a very private feel. Private, keypad ent
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a absolute jewel.  An eclectic mix of new Asheville and old.  Large trees, quiet streets, kids playing.  There is a large park with a community pool several blocks from our home and the thriving business district of West Asheville is less than 1 mile away.  The Hominy Creek Green way is accessible by foot and offers a quiet walking trail along the creek.  The French Broad River Green way is less than a mile from us and offers paved trails for walking and biking as well as river access for floating the French Broad River through Asheville.
host_about: I live in Asheville, NC where I try to kayak and mountain bike as much as possible.  When I am not in Asheville i love explore the rivers of the world.

name: Safe & Clean in Artsy WAVL
description:
Short drive to downtown (+ free parking w/our pass), walking distance to coffee, bars, and all the other local treasures, yet safely nestled in a family neighborhood. Rest up for your Asheville adventures with a luxurious queen bed and relax in a comfy living room with Direct TV, Disney+, Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Video). Features a large bathroom with walk-in shower, breakfast nook (coffee/tea provided), hip artwork, and a private-entrance. The space is great for couples or single guests.

The space
We have parking behind our house for one guest vehicle. If you and your guest need to bring more than one car, you may park on the street. The HVAC is controlled from upstairs. Let us know if you would like us to adjust anything and we will be happy to!

Guest access
The downstairs is all yours! We do have a private, unfinished utility closet (behind the accordion doors). We use this for storage and ask that our guests not enter.

Ot
neighborhood_overview: This is an established family neighborhood that also happens to be within striking distance of everything you came to Asheville for! We love the neighborhood because it is super safe. Because we are so close to it all, there can be some traffic noise to be aware of from time to time.
host_about: My wife Yang and I have travelled a lot together, but now we have a toddler so we let the travellers come to our home in Asheville! We moved here from Brooklyn in 2013 and haven't looked back since. We love to share this great city with people, so we are happy to make recommendations, based on the season or your personal interests. We are also happy to stay out of your way and let you have a great private visit. Just let us know and we will do everything we can to make your visit great. We are both very creative and love to share our work downstairs. If you like something, let us know! We love food and are happy to share our experiences at all of the local restaurants. We can also guide you to a few places off the beaten path.

name: Asheville: A Stamp of Approval
description:
Private room w/ private bath.
My home is in an ideal location for reaching everything Asheville has to offer. Just minutes away from downtown, shopping, restaurants, music, nature outings & more.
Charming two story cape cod. The upstairs of my home is your private retreat featuring a large bedroom with queen bed, in room sitting area, private full bathroom. Natural light abounds. Clean & bright. Covered porches. Large yard w/ mature trees. My AirBnB Experience: Asheville rooftop bars & history

The space
Welcome to A Stamp Of Approval. Your home away from home during your stay in Asheville! Enjoy full privacy on the second level of my home. Full size bathroom and spacious bedroom with in-room sitting area are yours for resting, relaxing and recharging. Ceiling fan. Lots of natural light. Windows provide views of my lawn and tree adorned front and back yards.
Comfortable queen size sleigh bed with nice quality linens. Two large chest of drawers a
neighborhood_overview:
The Haw Creek area of East Asheville is a very safe, well established neighborhood. I'm the next to the last house on a short, dead end street. Lots of trees, bird sounds. Rabbits routinely run through my yard. You will find yourself located just a 5 minute drive to Whole Foods, Panera Bread, Asheville Mall, the Blue Ridge Parkway ,Highland Brewing, WNC Nature Center, VA Hospital, Starbucks. Also, many local and national chain restaurants and several grocery stores. In less than 10 minutes you can be in downtown Asheville (40+ breweries), The River Arts District, Biltmore Estate, UNC-A, Mission Hospital Campus, the Folk Art Center, the Visitors Center, Asheville Municipal Golf Course and local driving range.
Walking distance to Creekside Taphouse -- A popular local favorite eating place. Relaxed atmosphere, includes dining outside and/or by the creek, and a regulation size outdoor sand volleyball court. Penny Cup Coffee Cafe is next door to Creekside. Penny Cup is a fun neighborh
host_about: A life long resident of western North Carolina and a lover of all things Asheville. I feel blessed to live in this part of the world.  The USPS has been my passion and my career for many years. Some of the accents in my home reflect that love for and dedication to my job. I'm looking forward to sharing some mountain hospitality with my guests.

name: 'Le Canard' Cottage w/ Porch: 10 Mi to Asheville!
description:
Live the dream in this French country home: nicknamed 'Le Canard,' this 2-bedroom, 1-bath Arden vacation rental ensures a heavenly escape to the Smoky Mountains. Sit on the sun porch, grill a meal on the patio, or simply revel in the wooded backyard views. When you're ready, head up to Asheville, where you can see sites like the famous Biltmore Estate and several museums. You'll love returning to this cottage after your days' adventures to cuddle up by the fireplace with your loved ones.

The space
Private Backyard | Pet Friendly w/ Fee | Chiminea Fire Pit

The Smoky Mountains are calling and this chic cottage is the perfect place for you and your family to experience North Carolina and all of its beauty.

Bedroom 1 (Les Chanteurs): Queen Bed | Bedroom 2 (Le Pacifique): Queen Bed | Sun Porch: Twin Bed

OUTDOOR LIVING: Outdoor dining area, screened-in sun porch, gas grill, wooded views

EXPLORE NATURE: Lake Julian Park (2.4 miles), The North Carolina Arboretum (6.4 miles), French Broad Overlook (6.7 miles), Pisgah National Forest (19.3 miles), Chimney Rock State Park (22.8 miles), DuPont State Forest (25.0 miles), Looking Glass Falls (25.0 miles), Sliding Rock (27.1 miles), Great Smoky Mountains National Park (41.1 miles)

BREWERIES: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. (6.0 miles), Wicked Weed Brewing Pub (9.0 miles), Wedge Brewing Company (9.7 miles), New Belgium Brewing Company (10.0 miles), Urban Orchard Cider Co. - West (11.2 miles)

name: Private Studio By UNCA, Greenway, River & Downtown
description:
Our studio is less than two miles from the heart of downtown Asheville, adjacent to UNC-A (and Saturday tailgate market), one block from the Greenway, near the Botanical Gardens and less than three miles to New Belgium Brewery/River Arts District. The studio is in a safe neighborhood, is a great starting point for a run/ride and and has its own entrance and parking with plenty of flora and fauna! Our studio is great for couples, runners/cyclists, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

The space
The studio has a private entrance, a queen bed, sofa bed that sleeps one adult, microwave, mini-fridge and bathroom. There is a patio with a table and chairs for your morning coffee or afternoon tea.

Guest access
You have a private entrance to the studio and off-street parking. The street has very low traffic since we are at a cul-de-sac.

Other things to note
Directions (parking is different from physical address):
neighborhood_overview:
There are quite a few places to eat/drink within a few blocks of the studio as well as botanical gardens, greenways and parks. Here are just a few suggestions:

North Asheville Tailgate Market (across the street; go to cul-de-sac and walk up the step). Every Saturday, 7 am – 12 pm.

Botanical Gardens: Go to W.T. Weaver Blvd. and turn right on Greenway. Just two blocks away.

Downtown is @ 1.5 miles from the studio, the best way to walk/ride to downtown is to go to right on on the Greenway and follow to end.

Salvage Station (near Studio on Riverside Drive, outdoor venue on river with great food, beer and music).

Luella’s BBQ: great food, including BBQ tempeh, a variety of local beers on tap, go to W.T. Weaver Blvd., take a left on Greenway and walk to the end.

The Hop: walk to the ice cream shop. This is on Merrimon Avenue and you will need to go upstairs to the outside fence gate, go up the driveway, turn left on B
host_about:
Energetic, vaccinated individual who gets to offer enthusiastic encouragement in both my personal and professional life!  I work at the local community college and like to run, travel, listen to live music and enjoy the outdoors.

I love sharing information on all the great things Asheville and WNC has to offer my guests.

name: Hemlock Hill Hideaway Log Cabin
description:
In 1862, farmer-turned-soldier Pvt. Riley Ray enlisted in the civil war. He survived, returned to the area and began building this log cabin in 1864. In 2017, his descendants sold it to us and we're sharing it with you! An extensive rehab, a pristine setting and modern upgrades guarantee a memorable stay in a piece of rare American history. Only 20 mins. to downtown Asheville, 2 miles from Bent Creek State Park and river tubing, and 10 minutes to the airport and Sierra Nevada. This. Is. It.

The space
We drove up the hill to this cabin and it was love at first sight! There's a good chance that will happen to you too. The cabin sits on 7 acres and 3 of those acres are the woods surrounding it which are attached to Pisgah National Forest. The cabin is much more spacious than it looks from the outside. There are two large bedrooms each with a private bathroom and one small bedroom that's perfect for singles or kids.

Guest access
Guests get to
neighborhood_overview: There are a few mobile and private homes along the twin ridges that our cabin sits between but mostly it's just trees and more trees and a large open grassy field.  It's located about 4 minutes drive to Interstate 26 and an easy drive down Brevard Rd. into West Asheville.  It's very private, this is not a neighborhood setting.  It's an easy accessible piece of history that we feel grateful to have found and we're happy to share it with our guests.
host_about:
Together with my husband Michael, we are hosts who LOVE our "hometown" of 7 yrs - Asheville NC!  We both have excellent suggestions on things to see and do here --especially restaurants!  Asheville is a foodie and beer lovers paradise.  Through a fateful twist of the pandemic, we also recently discovered Edisto Beach SC and we're enchanted beyond our expectations and look forward to sharing that property with other travelers.  We live with two almost-human roommates, Lucie and Mambo - 7 yr old Standard Poodles who pretty much rule our lives.  

By now it's probably clear we're big fans of "the good life" and we'll do our best to share it all with you!

name: Our serene cabin in the woods
description:
Our private cabin in the woods is in a secluded, quiet mountain community. It shares over an acre of land with our primary residence, wild turkeys, and an occasional bear. Just 20 minutes from downtown Asheville, the famous Biltmore Estate, and craft breweries galore! The Blue Ridge Parkway is 7 minutes away, offering beautiful scenery, waterfalls, and wildlife. Dozens of hiking, jogging, and biking trails. Warren Wilson College is 5 minutes away. Perfect location any time of the year!

The space
Our cabin is privately located down a path leading away from our primary residence. There are numerous steps leading from the parking area down to the cabin. The cabin is surrounded with trees so waking up to the sound of birds and squirrels is such a delight. Wood floors and walls make the cabin cozy and a screened in porch where you can drink your morning coffee or evening glass of wine is so enjoyable! There is a queen sized bed plus a futon upstairs and full
neighborhood_overview: We have a beautiful community nestled in the mountains off Riceville Road in East Asheville.  The residents are friendly and take care to keep the neighborhood clean and natural.  Trees are not cut, unless out of necessity which is why you may catch a glimpse of some turkeys, bears, foxes and of course, birds.  Quick access to I-240, I-40, and Blue Ridge Parkway makes getting to downtown Asheville, Biltmore, Grove Park Inn, or Black Mountain easy and quick. Lots of hiking trails near and far. The neighborhood is secluded but grocery store, pharmacy, and fire department are right down the road.
host_about: My husband and I recently retired to the mountains of NC.  We are 1973 Warren Wilson Graduates so have made a full circle back to our beginnings.  We love the mountains, hiking, and I am an avid yoga practitioner.  We really enjoy hosting and love meeting new people from different places and backgrounds.

description:
Enjoy your stay in a quiet residential neighborhood with your own private entrance, bathroom, and sunporch. We love Asheville and cannot wait to share this city with you! A location is in Asheville and all it has to offer, yet feels like you are in the woods away from the city noise. Families with kids, several couples, travelers who want their own space, and Girls Trips from all backgrounds, ethnicities, religions, and sexual orientations are welcome here!

The space
It is important that guests know that due to the layout of the rooms, the first bedroom is the entrance and exit for the second bedroom. If you stay here you will need to be comfortable sharing this space together! I included a photo of the layout so you can see how the floor plan looks.
The sunporch has a living area with a couch and reading lamp. There is also a table that seats four people where you can play cards, eat a meal, work on your computer, drink a beverage, etc.... There is a Keuri
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is very quiet and surrounded by woods. Even though we are close to downtown Asheville you would never know it!
*We live in the mountains in a cove. Depending on which cell provider you use, your cell signal my be inconsistent. Our internet wifi is strong and consistent.
host_about: My husband Don and I have lived in Asheville for 25 years. I am a reading teacher for Asheville City Schools and he is a commercial real estate appraiser. We love living in Asheville where we garden, hike, mountain bike, and paddle on the French Broad River. There is always something fun to do in Asheville including music, arts, and interesting restaurants.

name: Charming Mountain View Home Perfect for Social Distancing
description:
Climb steps to a huge deck that wraps around a striking blue timber house. Marvel at calming mountain views on over an acre of woods. Inside, cross gleaming hardwood floors in an open-plan living space to prepare meals in a gourmet chef's kitchen.

Looking for a smaller place for two just down the road from here? Check out our new sister property at https://airbnb.com/h/cozy-cottage-asheville
neighborhood_overview: The house is a 20-minute drive to Downtown Asheville and 10 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway. Grocery stores, gas stations, and restaurants are a short drive away. Our home sits on over an acre of wooded property with privacy and mountain views
host_about:
Hi! I’m Shannon! I am a very active mama of a busy toddler, a newborn and the wife of a commercial airline pilot. We currently live in Orlando, FL and enjoy spending our time off in the Asheville, NC area. We enjoy being outside, eating good food and sipping crafty drinks. We also love to travel and see new places! We are early to bed and early to rise and very organized.

We are thankful for the opportunity to host these two beautiful homes in our favorite city with our Airbnb family. We strive to provide our guests with an idyllic, unforgettable mountain home experience that they treasure for years to come.

Thank you for choosing to stay with us (or host us)! :)
