name: Mill House [Fenced in yard; 10mins to Downtown]
description:
Our charming historic 1925 mill house in a quiet neighborhood is perfect for couples, adventurers, family & friends. We welcome pets at no extra charge. Enjoy our shady front porch and fenced in backyard with spacious deck and outdoor shower. You're just minutes from Asheville's River Arts District, the Biltmore Estate, Blue Ridge Parkway, and Downtown Asheville's restaurants, shops, breweries, and other attractions.

The space
This cozy historic mill house at the end of a dead-end street has a high ceilings, original woodwork and a spacious fenced in backyard with a deck and an outdoor shower (warmer months only). From the front to the back, you'll find this place offers amazing privacy and beautiful views just minutes from downtown Asheville.

The house has 1 bedroom with attached bathroom as well as a full kitchen, including a prep table and breakfast nook.

The living room has a dining table and pull-out sofa.

The back door i
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood, known as Martel Village, bears the name of an early 20th century textile mill that was just a few blocks away on the French Broad River [at the bottom of Elk Mountain Rd].

Martel Cotton Mill provided employment opportunities for area residents and many families in Woodfin have lived here for more than a few generations. Our home, and others from that era that survive, are characteristic of homes built in early 20th century mill villages.
host_about:
We - Michele & Dana - currently live in Woodfin/Asheville, NC. We have lived, separately and together, in places like San Francisco, Philadelphia, Amherst, MA and Johnson City, TN. 

We moved back to Woodfin in November 2016 and fell in love with Western NC's mountains and wildlife right along with Asheville's downtown area. 

Michele is a life coach and former DJ and videographer. Dana is a UX Designer and occasional web & graphic designer. We met in 2009 and were married on Halloween night in 2015 at Michele's family home in Fairview. 

We're not usually big on lists, but together we agree that 5 things we can't live without are good friends, great conversations, music (we like almost every genre!), laughter and family (bio, chosen and our fur babies). Also, you might not guess it,  but we're EQ2 gamers :-)

name: Montford Garden Apartment - Walk Downtown!
description:
Spacious one bedroom studio-style garden apartment in historic Montford. Private entry and outdoor space overlooking quiet green space, the best of urban & mountain living with just a 10 minute walk to vibrant downtown with shops, restaurants & breweries. Enjoy the locals' life!

We look forward to having you & sharing all that we love about living in Asheville!

The space
Enjoy the locals' life, walking just a few blocks to restaurants like All Day Darling for coffee & breakfast, Montford Deli for lunch, Nine Mile or Chiesa for dinner. Quick drive to Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, and Harris Teeter for essentials. Also a quick trip to River Arts District, New Belgium Brewing and historic West Asheville and hip Haywood Rd.

Easy access to I-240, I-26, and I-40 will get you anywhere quick, be it hiking along the Blue Ridge Parkway, a day trip to Brevard, Black Mountain, Waynesville, or Weaverville, or perhaps just to the AVL airport.

Re
neighborhood_overview: Montford is an historic neighborhood with eclectic architecture, it is well worth a stroll to sight see. Large oak trees create a lush background echoing the seasonal changes, with plentiful shade in the summertime, vibrant hues in the fall, and much needed sunshine through the winter & spring. Meandering down Cumberland or Montford Ave simply to admire each unique home is a favorite pastime of locals & visitors alike. After 10 years in Asheville, I still love soaking in the unique history of each expertly designed property.
host_about:
I love to travel, near or far, I find there's always an adventure to enjoy in new experiences. Big cities, small towns, indoors & out.  Live in the mountains, but grew up near the beach. Both are my happiest of places. 

"There was nowhere to go but everywhere, so just keep rolling under the stars" -- jack kerouac

description: Gathering is comfortable and easy in this classic 1965 ranch house. It's been extensively remodeled and upgraded, and offers a colorful, funky mix of new and old furnishings. There's also the opportunity to enjoy a wood fire, inside or out. Only 10 minutes to downtown, but in a relaxed, country setting. Horse pastures and woods surround the property, but access to town is a super-easy and beautiful drive through the country. Only 7 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway.
neighborhood_overview: The Beaverdam Valley is situated just below the Blue Ridge Parkway, and has a rich history. The ranch's location is very rural and private, with plenty of wildlife to watch,  but also attractively near to downtown Asheville and numerous amenities.
host_about:
Hi! My husband William and I are from Asheville NC. We have a small farm just minutes from downtown where we raise chickens, bees, and horses. We sell eggs and honey. 
We love to travel and camp. We are interested in knowing the places we visit by knowing the people who live and work there. We want to eat the regional cuisine and find and do things we can't do at home.

Prime location that is a short walk to Sunny Point (Asheville's #1 Brunch spot), Biscuit Head, Nine mile, and other Haywood Rd eateries.

You have full access to the front porch, living room, dining room, kitchen, and washer/dryer. The backyard is not for guest use, and is fully fenced and padlocked. name: West AVL Family Funhouse • 5mi to AVL • Views
description:
Charming, super kid-friendly home with lots of great features: well stocked with books, games & toys, foosball table, huge built-in playground, trampoline, fire pit, beautiful mountain and valley views, 12 minute drive to downtown, tons of birds, stars galore and decorated with a colorful but natural touch.

The space
**NEW FOR 2020**
The Family Funhouse isn't just for little kids. We now have a media room downstairs, perfect for those anti-social teenagers who think family vacations are laaaame. They can watch movies or bring their favorite game console and connect with the supplied HDMI cable. This should keep them happy for at lease a few minutes!


We are conveniently located to all of Asheville's greatest sites:

• West Asheville - 6 minutes
• Downtown Asheville - 12 minutes
• River Arts District - 10 minutes
• River Adventure Trips - 12 minutes
• Biltmore Village - 15 minutes
• Grove Park Inn - 15 minute
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in the quiet cul-de-sac of a well-maintained neighborhood. You may see kids out playing, or someone enjoying an evening walk with their dog. Within a mile or two we have grocery stores, pharmacies, coffee shop, gas stations, restaurants and fast food options.
host_about:
We are a family that loves music, adventure, family time, nature, traveling, ASHEVILLE and making the most of life. Among other things. 

We have been together since 2004. Moved to Asheville in 2012 and became parents in 2014 to a sweet little lady named Ruby. The newest member of the family, Atlas was born in 2019. Asheville gives us the adventure, nature, beauty, security and amazing collection of fun and creative people that we wanted to find all in one town and we have adored raising our children here. EVERYTHING is so kid friendly. It's an amazing place.

Jeremy is a graphic designer, video editor, photographer and motion graphics guy. He's also a smoking guitar player and plays around town every couple of weeks.

I'm a graphic artist as well as an illustrator, portrait artist, muralist, etc. I'm currently most passionate about children's illustration. If you decied to stay at the Family Funhouse, you are sure to see some of my work around. 

We look forward to meeting you and having you as our guest at our dreamy little slice of Asheville.

Thanks for checking us out,
Jami and Jeremy

name: EZ Access 2 the Heart of AVL & Blue Ridge Pkwy.
description:
Private suite with separate bedroom, private bath, kitchenette & multi-purpose room. Suite has an independent "Heating & Air Conditioning System". Guests have complete comfort control of the suite's temperature.

We follow all current Covid protocols, and your Host's are fully vaccinated.

The space
We welcome tourists, hikers, business people; or if you're here to visit family members and/or friends; those caring for loved ones in Mission Hospital or the VAMC. Only 3 steps up, to the suite's private entrance and deck, which you're welcome to use!

Guest access
Off-street parking in well-lit area, close to the private entrance to the suite & deck. Plenty of room for kayaks or a second car.

Other things to note
Please be considerate by honoring a 10:30 pm to 7:00 am quiet time. Only registered guests allowed to stay overnight. No smoking, vaping or candles allowed on premises.
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is very close to the Regional Medical Center (which is a great place to walk). We live in a mature neighborhood with considerate neighbors & are involved in keeping our area clean & safe.

We're about 2 miles SE of Biltmore Village & another 5-6 miles from downtown Asheville. Regrettably, there is a current lack of proper sidewalks &/or lighting to walk safely towards the Village, so we suggest driving north on Sweeten Creek Rd., toward Biltmore Village &/or Downtown. Uber & Lyft are available, if that's your choice, too.

If you want to do some hiking (beginner trails up to advanced), we are 2 miles from 2 entrances onto the Blue Ridge Parkway. DuPont Forest has several waterfalls to explore & take selfies, to send back home.
host_about: Bill and Linda are semi-retired, have lived in Asheville for more than 20 yrs. Bill is originally from NY state and lived in FL for many yrs. Linda was born and raised in the hills of NW CT, finally arrived in NC in 1994. We are very active in our church and our community. We look forward to welcoming you to our home in the beautiful mountains of WNC.

name: Art Gallery in Historic Home, Located in River Arts District
description: 1907 Historic Craftsman home located in the Chicken Hill area of the River Arts District. Rotating art exhibitions on display featuring local artists make this listing unique. Soak in an original claw-foot tub, walk along the river or to many local restaurants, art galleries, and breweries. Lots of character in this old home with modern amenities. Each room has a shower and bathroom attached, and there is a kitchenette with microwave, mini fridge, and coffee maker. A great location to enjoy everything this small mountain town has to offer.
neighborhood_overview: This Asheville neighborhood is called Chicken Hill because of the hatchery that once employed the residents of this now modern neighborhood. It's a beautiful little area, yet quite central. Walk to restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, and the river trail.
host_about: I have lived in Asheville for seven years and it gets better each year.  I love hosting people in this town and making sure they have a great experience. I'm a foodie and nature lover. My schedule is full and erratic, so I will do my best to greet you but we will most likely communicate through text. Please let me know if there is anything you would like to know about the area, and thanks for visiting!

I am a lover of nature and beauty. 
Outdoors is where I feel the most at home. On a hike, kayak, bike, or just quiet meditation, any day, any weather! 
I love exploring and being curious in life, meeting people and learning new things.
And animals....they’re the best. 
Always looking forward to a new experience. I look forward to meeting you!
<3 happiness

New construction, furnished with modern sensibilities and accented by local makers. Adjacent suite available for folks traveling “together but separate” and can be found on Air BnB as The New Hitop Studio In Hip West Asheville.

The space
HayLo is located four blocks ( 12 minute walk ) from Haywood Rd in West AVL. Haywood is a thriving small district business complete with cafes, pubs, restaurants, bicycle shops, music venues, tattoo parlors, and breweries. Additionally, the River Arts District, Wedge Brewing Co, and New Belgium Brewing are located just down the hill from HayLo. HayLo pairs nicely with bicycles and includes indoor bicycle storage so pack your ride(s).

neighborhood_overview: Sunrise Drive is a few short blocks from West AVL's Haywood Rd, River Arts District, Wedge Brewing Co, and New Belgium Brewing.
host_about: My husband and I have lived in Asheville nearly 20 years.  We love our little city and  sharing it  with travelers.   Mike is the director of a local bicycle non profit, Asheville on Bikes and I work in the medical field.  We enjoy riding bikes, cooking on the Webber, negotiating with a fierce 4 year old, and hanging out with friends.  By far, our favorite way to travel and see new places is by bicycle. We have often stayed in private  homes while bike touring and we've always appreciated this more personal experience of a place and hope to extend the same warmth to our guests.

description:
Treat yourself to a mini vacation at this charming suburban wholistic airbnb. Nestled in the Appalachian Mountains our home is a healing, yoga and artistic space. Located between West Asheville and Candler. Easily accessible to Hwy 40 and Smokey Parkway; only a 10 minute drive to downtown.

If this room is not available feel free to check my other private room #2: https://airbnb.com/rooms/26454939

The space
This warm eclectic home embraces a nurturing, natural, cozy environment while discovering yourself in Asheville.

Guest access
Bedroom, front deck, front patio, living room, kitchen and full bath.

Other things to note
Welcome! We can suggest some referrals for a variety of wholistic and healing modalities that the Asheville community offers. Our intention is to provide you with the guidance and encouragement that may support your transition towards a more wholistic lifestyle.

This might be the
neighborhood_overview: Established residential community. Quiet and clean.
host_about:
It is my pleasure to open my humble home to like minded guest who want to experience the magical mountains of Asheville. Being on the path of self realization, I am at my best when I am in connection with Mother Nature. 

I am a certified yoga teacher and love sharing the benefits of the practice with others. Yoga is one of the tools I use in my effort to maintain a healthy lifestyle that incorporates among other things a plant based diet, herbs, regular cleansing and detoxification.  

As an artist and graphic designer, my vision is to communicate respect for our planet, and to recognize the urgency to reconnect harmoniously with nature, through the creation of everyday objects and mandalas with recycled materials.

My first language is Spanish. I enjoy working as an interpreter and translator. I have traveled through out Central and South America. I lived in Australia for a while. My intent is to continue exploring the world and enhancing my connection with the divine. Would love to meet you!

name: Foxhaven Long Range Mountain Views in Asheville
description:
The restrictions are over, so come enjoy the mountains! We have taken the CDC recommended steps to ensure your wellbeing.

Comfortably furnished mountain home with 20-mile mountain range views from each room. The main floor is an open concept so that you can hang out in the kitchen.

Four miles to Blue Ridge Parkway, 15 minutes to the Biltmore Estate and 14 minutes to Downtown Asheville. Situated on a private three-acre tract of the forest so you will feel like you're a part of nature.

The space
This is a new home with an open concept on the main floor. It is located in a private location that allows you to truly soak in the mountains without leaving the property.

Enjoy the modern kitchen and prepare a meal with the whole group or take advantage of the many take-out services that are currently offered by local restaurants. Take in the breathtaking mountain views from the central living space through the elegant French doors and
neighborhood_overview: Foxhaven offers privacy and a warm atmosphere. We ask that our guests remain respectful of our neighbors at all times by observing quiet hours after 9 PM, driving slowly and cautiously in the subdivision as there are young children and people walking dogs.
host_about:
Ron is a Asheville/WNC native.  He loves hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic and ancient mountains.   

Darlene relocated from Michigan to Asheville a few years ago. She loves visiting  quaint  towns in and around Asheville and local attractions like the Biltmore Estate as well as discovering new hiking trails.  Her outdoor passion is kayaking and rock climbing.

Most of our vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, dog friendly and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back. Please see individual properties for their unique features. 

We both are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

We look forward to sharing the WNC area with you!

Darlene - Director of Operations and Concierge
Ron - Property Manager

host_about:
We are Joe & Janae two bubbly and smiling adventurers! MTB, hiking, cycling, and tubing the French Broad are some of our favorite hobbies. Living in Asheville we get this beautiful mountainous land, Pisgah Forest, DuPont, Bent Creek paired with the art-centric + local tribe + foodie side of the downtown community. 
FOOOODIE. We are self proclaimed foodies! Ask us about our favorite restaurants- or what we are cooking in our own kitchen! Joe has excellent sous chef skills, handles a knife like a pro! Janae try's to use her teeth to open things (don't let her have a knife)- but can combine the most awesome flavor profiles together.
Maybe we'll have you up for dinner? Or a grounds tour of the Biltmore? Join us!

name: Modern Mountain Retreat in North Asheville
description:
Beautifully furnished, modern apartment in the mountains with spacious private deck overlooking quiet woods. Less than 2 miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway, 3.5 miles to Merrimon Avenue and Fresh Market/Ingles; 6 miles to the heart of downtown. Easy access to all the area's best restaurants, breweries, hikes and attractions. Studio-style, 325 sq. ft apartment with kitchen, bathroom and washer/dryer.

The space
This is a dedicated guest space with separate stone stairway entrance (guest parking is at the bottom of the stairway), keypad-access entrance, large private deck and separate climate-control. You control the temperature in your space.

The kitchen is equipped with a refrigerator, microwave, coffee-maker, 2-burner stovetop and all basic kitchen supplies. The dishes are vintage brown hull pottery and clear glassware-- beautiful to use and enjoy on the deck for any meal. There is also a kitchen table for a workspace or dining indoors.

Ther
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood consists of a tight-knit community of homes along a quiet road that leads directly to the Blue Ridge Parkway at Craven Gap, one of the most popular trailheads in the area.  At Craven Gap you can also jump on the Mountains-to-Sea Trail and hike as far as you wish in either direction, past viewpoints and through tunnels of rhododendron.
host_about:
A professional in the adventure travel industry for over 16 years, making my home in the mountains of western North Carolina-- one of my favorite places in the world!  

I truly enjoy hosting visitors to the area who want a place to relax and enjoy quiet, wooded surroundings, while also having easy access to downtown Asheville. I love to ride bikes, hike, whitewater kayak, practice yoga and sample the wares at our many local breweries. I'm always happy to provide suggestions for local activities if my guests are interested, and I have plenty of nice area maps in the space for guest use. I hope to host you soon!

name: Gorgeous home on the Blue Ridge Parkway
description:
This gorgeous home sits on the Blue Ridge Parkway and is less than 10 minutes from downtown Asheville. Enjoy the city and retreat home to your own private place in the mountains. The house sits on over 1 private wooded acre. Hike right out the front door onto the Mountains to Sea trail. Over 2000 square feet with fine finishes. Soak in the oversized jet tub. Enjoy a round of bumper pool or choose from the many games on the game shelf. Cook in the fully stocked kitchen and enjoy a real retreat.

The space
Relax in the over sized indoor Jacuzzi tub while gazing into the woods. Enjoy the gas stove indoors or the fire pit outside. This home has beautiful wood finishes and amazing windows throughout.

Guest access
The entire home and 1.5 acre lot are yours to enjoy.
neighborhood_overview: You will pass through a neighborhood of beautiful homes on your way to your private retreat.
host_about: I'm an active mother of two Ashevillains. I've been in Asheville almost 20 years and enjoy the mountains, rivers and lakes as much as I enjoy all the social events Asheville has to offer. I'm full of insider tips to help you create a trip you won't forget.

name: Om Sweet Om -W. Avl- Solar, close to the Greenway!
description:
Welcome to Om Sweet Om in west Asheville! Enjoy your own private entrance with off street parking to this Green certified, new construction guest suite located just 1 mile from Haywood Rd and just down the street from the Hominy Creek Greenway trailhead. Complete with private bedroom, full bathroom and living room as well as a small kitchenette. There is a queen size bed in the bedroom and a queen size sleeper sofa in the living room. Linens and towels are provided.
Be advised, steep driveway.

The space
We are located in a super sweet, quiet neighborhood in west Asheville. While we are just 1 mile from all of the action on Haywood Rd, we are also a quick drive or bike ride to the French Broad River and are just down the street from the Hominy Creek Greenway.

The basement is brand new construction with sealed concrete floors and energy efficient windows and doors. It stays cool in the summer and warm in the winter, and due to the energy efficient i
neighborhood_overview:
Malvern Hills is a super sweet neighborhood in west Asheville with a lovely local park, with a pool, playground and tennis courts and nearby Hominy Creek Greenway within walking distance. Haywood Rd is just a mile away with bustling shops and restaurants in the heart of downtown west Asheville. We are a quick bike ride or drive to the French Broad Rivers many put-ins and tube/SUP/kayak rental companies.
Downtown Asheville is just 5 miles away and the Blue Ridge Parkway is just 6 miles south. We are also a quick 5-10 minute drive from the Farmers Market and Asheville Outlets.
host_about: I have lived in Asheville since 2005 and immediately fell in love with the west side. I work in Physical Therapy and like to get out on the trails running or biking when I'm not chasing my kids around. I'm happy to recommend trails and outings for your visits to Asheville!

name: Natural Retreat For Two
description:
Beautiful, sparkling clean studio apartment in quiet neighborhood, private entrance with self check-in. Wake up in queen sized bed, enjoy lovely bathroom with tub, full kitchen with coffee and oatmeal provided, great natural light, sweet seating area on private patio.

Mountain bike/hike in Bent Creek Recreational Forest, a minute from French Broad River, Arboretum, Blue Ridge Parkway, and Outlet Shopping. 15 mins to downtown and West Asheville. Easy access to airport.

The space
The studio is fresh, bright and beautiful ~ a restorative space to relax. We clean to the highest standards, including following all Airbnb cleaning and sanitation protocols. Whether you've been exploring spunky West Asheville with its restaurants and shops, checking out street life downtown, visiting Biltmore, or sampling breweries, our quiet neighborhood is a sweet place to relax and renew. If you'd like to mix up town life with the natural world you will find Zen Tubin
neighborhood_overview: Our guesthouse is in the Bent Creek Neighborhood, a residential neighborhood.  The community park, a 5 min walk away, has a great space for kids (and adults) to play with a pump track, playground, tons of open green space,  and the park links you directly into Bent Creek Forest and Pisgah Forest.  We are only a couple of minutes from the Arboreteum, from put-ins for canoeing and tubing, and from the parkway.
host_about:
Hi!  My name is Lucy - I love living in Asheville with my two children, Elijah and Rowan.  For work  I teach Kindergarten.  I also  lead an outdoor adventure program for girls and teach mindfulness to teachers.  Between family and work, I am living a pretty sweet life.  I have always loved traveling for adventure and getting into nature to hike, rock climb, swim in lakes, or get on the rivers to tube or boat.  Living right next to extensive mountain biking trails has gotten me into biking, and I love being only a minute from the French Broad river, and a couple of minutes from all the hiking around Bent Creek and the Blue Ridge Parkway.  I don't go downtown too much, but when I do I always love the vibrancy of Asheville from the restaurants and bookstores to people watching. 
As I host I am happy to connect with you and chat or share about places to explore and adventures to have.  Your space has a totally private entrance and porch, and if you feel like a quieter retreat  without much connecting I am happy for that too.  I want you to have an awesome time - and am available in whatever way is best for you.

name: The New HiTop Studio In Hip West Asheville
description:
Kick back in West Asheville in this newly constructed addition. The Hi-Tiop is situated a few blocks away from West Asheville's Haywood Rd business district.
The bedroom suite includes a roof top deck, coffee bar, 48" TV complete with Apple TV and NetFlix, and mini-fridge. Indoor bicycle storage is also available upon request. Adjacent suite available for folks traveling “together but separate” and can be found on Air BnB as HayLo in Hip West Asheville: Walk, Bike, Ride!

Yes, there is a microwave.
neighborhood_overview: The West AVL neighborhood is walkable / bikeable to The River Arts District, New Belgium Brewing, Wedge Brewing and the hub of West AVL's business district, Haywood Rd.
host_about: My husband and I have lived in Asheville nearly 20 years.  We love our little city and  sharing it  with travelers.   Mike is the director of a local bicycle non profit, Asheville on Bikes and I work in the medical field.  We enjoy riding bikes, cooking on the Webber, negotiating with a fierce 4 year old, and hanging out with friends.  By far, our favorite way to travel and see new places is by bicycle. We have often stayed in private  homes while bike touring and we've always appreciated this more personal experience of a place and hope to extend the same warmth to our guests.

Charming and cozy in hip East/West Asheville. This brand new chic apartment retains character of the bungalow style home it is in. You will have a private entrance and patio which leads to a 1 bed/1 bath with a kitchen that you have all to yourself. Sleeps up to 4 comfortably. The bathroom has a tiled shower with rain head and bench. You will be walking distance to some amazing restaurants, bars, shops and breweries in West Asheville. It's a quick, easy drive to the heart of downtown Asheville.

The space
This private basement level apartment retains the charm of the bungalow style home it is in and you will love it!
It has a plush queen size bed and a brand new queen size sofa sleeper. Tiled shower with rainhead and bench seat. Kitchen with full sized refrigerator, microwave, sink and coffee pot.
Private patio to sit on and sip your morning coffee or afternoon local beer or wine!
Your welbehaved, house trained dog is welcome with prior approval an

We to love travel, play outdoors with our dog and enjoy all the great restaurants Asheville has to offer.

This private rental is located in a newly renovated home within a 5-10 minute walk of everything that downtown Asheville has to offer! Leave your car in the driveway and walk to the all the best restaurants, shops, and breweries in the area. A few blocks in the other direction takes you to the funky River Arts District, the French Broad River, and West Asheville.

The space
Guests will have the entire upstairs of this home. There is no shared space with the downstairs tenants (me and my 3 dogs). The unit has its own private entrance, free parking, coffee maker, toaster, mini fridge, microwave, personal thermostat, and a TV with lots of streaming options such as HBO, Netflix, and Amazon Prime.

Our historic home (1895) is adjacent to the Grove Park golf course. We have beautiful long-range views of the Blue Ridge Mountains and are close to downtown. You can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, stores, and the Grove Park Inn. Our private downstairs suite has its own path and entrance and includes a bedroom, living room, and bathroom. Come relax, explore, and enjoy the views, patios, and sunsets. Pet friendly. NOTE: 4/1/21-6/1 we will be doing renovation work in part of the back yard.

We have a comfortable and cozy downstairs apartment with a separate entrance. The main bedroom has a queen bed. The bathroom is recently remodeled with new sink and shower, but has low beams making the ceiling low for tall people (6 f ). A refrigerator, microwave, and Keurig are available in the apartment.

Guest access
You are welcome to use our grounds during your stay. Take a walk in the yard, have a seat at one of the tables or adirondack
neighborhood_overview: We are right on Charlotte Street which has plenty of easily walkable places such as a great wine shop, a great seafood restaurant, taco bar, great bakery/coffee shop,  burger place, best meat butcher in town, and the famous Ultimate ice cream.
host_about: We have a family of 5 as well as 2 very cute cats, Pluto and Fergus, and one very silly dog, Fenway. We enjoy the outdoors, great food, and sitting out back watching the sun go down. We love living in a place with peaceful views of the mountains, but close proximity to bustling downtown Asheville. We are happy to help out with any of your Asheville plans.

name: At Home in Asheville: Comfort, Location, Amenities
description:
Asheville is awesome! And it's even better when you make our beautiful Montford condo your home base. Enjoy quiet neighborhood living, with downtown Asheville just around the corner. Discounts available for stays of 30 nights or more!

The space
Renovated in 2017, with clean, modern finishes throughout. Enjoy 1,632 square feet of living space, with an open floor plan, lovely hardwood floors, stainless steel appliances and granite in the kitchen. Fully outfitted with everything you need for a great extended stay!

Bedrooms are on the 2nd floor. The master has an en suite bathroom. There is also a full bath with tub off the upstairs hallway.

Off-street parking for up to 2 cars.

The condo is in a great location: quiet, but walkable to Montford coffee shops & restaurants -- and to downtown, if you're up for it. Also close to highways for quick access to everything else!

CREATURE COMFORTS: cozy furnishings, new appl
neighborhood_overview:
Lovely old homes line the winding streets of Montford, just waiting for you to explore. Walk the dog, hit the pavement for a run, enjoy the Montford Park Players in the summer season, just around the corner.

Montford is just north of downtown Asheville, and adjacent to the 5 Points neighborhood, where you'll find a Harris Teeter, Trader Joes, and every other convenience you might need.
host_about: Mom, wife, business owner.  Lover of books, food, Game of Thrones (and other good TV), travel, fitness... and recently, golf.  Pet mom to two cats who I adore (Stella & Luna), and one dog who drives me nuts, but I love him anyway (Rudy).

Cozy bungalow with comfortable rooms. Everything you'll want is within walking distance to the center of West Asheville. Food, Music, Breweries, Fun and a lot more are just an evening stroll away! If you need to go a little farther (say the Biltmore, Black Mountain, or for a hike in the Pisgah National Forest) this house is very convenient to I-40 and I-240 as well as I-26!

Take your time and take it slow. Or if you want, hit the road and enjoy the great outdoors!

The house is a modern bungalow style house with hardwood floors and lots of light. Another major advantage this house offers is being in close proximity to lots of fun things to do while at the same time being on a quiet dead end street!

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is one of the best neighborhoods in Asheville. Everything you need is here. There are many restaurants, bars and live music all within walking distance.

name: Stay in a Charming Suite in an Asheville Bungalow
description:
Sleep tight in a private Queen Bedroom with adjacent, private bath in an owner occupied home with a laid back atmosphere, situated in a tranquil neighborhood in East Asheville.
Shared, common spaces have a relaxing, laid back vibe. Hosts are fully vaccinated and follow CDC cleaning guidelines
Enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning, or a glass of wine, local craft beer, or a bourbon on the deck or covered porch, in the evening with your hosts. Easily accessible to downtown, Biltmore Village and Estate, and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Uber and Lyft are readily available in this location.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is in the charming neighborhood of Oakley, minutes up the mountain from Biltmore Village and within 10 minutes of downtown Asheville. The area is a quiet enclave, close to hiking, breweries, downtown shopping, and amazing dining.
We are located 20 minutes from the airport.
host_about:
We are a non-traditional couple who enjoys meeting new people and sharing the beautiful Asheville area with visitors and our Air BNB guests.  We are laid back hosts who love to share our home with guests and  enjoy a glass of wine, bourbon, or one of the plentiful craft beers in the area, on the front porch, or back deck. 
We are veteran Airbnb'ers and think it's the greatest concept since sliced bread. 
Airbnb  is our go to site for accommodations whenever we travel.

Legally permitted Airbnb with the City of Asheville

A resident of Asheville for over 26 years. I love the local food scene here. I am happy to recommend anything from a simple hike with amazing views, to the spots to hang like a local.

name: Garden Cottage 2.5 miles to downtown
description:
This mountain cottage is conveniently located 2.5 miles from downtown Asheville and 4 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway offering guests the best of both worlds...a retreat in the heart of the mountains yet convenient to all that Asheville has to offer. This well loved and maintained cottage is beautifully furnished and offers two bedrooms with queen sized beds; two full bathrooms; twin sized pull out sofa; and an open living dining area with a wood stove; central heat and AC and ceiling fans.

The space
Sliding glass doors open to a wrap around deck where you can enjoy your morning coffee while planning your day. The house sits at the end of a private gravel road and shares a cul de sac with only one other house. There are a few other homes located along the road leading to the cottage. In the fall and winter you can easily see mountain ridges as the house is tucked in between several ridges. The house and neighborhood are quiet and private making you feel you a
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is tucked into the mountains, with black bears, wild turkeys, coyotes, deer, and foxes nearby. The house is a great base from which to explore all of Asheville and the fabulous mountain ranges and waterfalls of western North Carolina.
host_about: I am a native North Carolinian and have lived in Asheville for over 20 years. I work in the field of health care and have a therapeutic bodywork practice as well and work as an educator in a local massage school and yoga center. I love to spend my free time exploring the outdoors.

I cannot say enough about West Asheville! name: The Little Red Porch
description:
The Little Red Porch - A private retreat in the beautiful mountains of peaceful East Asheville. We welcome people from all backgrounds, cultures and beliefs to our home, hoping to share Asheville, NC-- a wonderful, magical place--with as many as folks as possible. And we LOVE having KIDS stay with us! Please take a look at our bright, cozy apartment and see if we look right for you.

The space
Our place is conveniently located in a quiet neighborhood 8 minutes from the heart of downtown and under 20 minutes from about everywhere else. We are super close to I-40, I-240, and the Blue Ridge Parkway, and about 7 minutes from I-26. West Asheville, The Biltmore House, Black Mountain, and the River Arts District are all 10 minutes away.
The entire apartment is beautifully decorated with clever artwork by a talented local artist. The entire space is newly remodeled with new appliances and furnishings. We are also kid-friendly with a closet full of toys and books. Fu
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a quiet, safe haven in East Asheville, where traffic is generally light and the pace is slow and relaxed. Our place is on a small cul-de-sac surrounded by lots of woods and wildlife. The Mountain-to-the-Sea Trail is just behind our neighborhood; the Folk Art Center is an easy 20 minute walk along the trail from our home.
host_about: I am a husband, father, teacher, drummer, writer and avid reader of all types of books. I have been married to the same beautiful woman for over 40 years, and we have three grown sons with six grandkids. My wife and I met at West Virginia University, and we are both avid fans to this day. I love craft beers and excellent food, and therefore Asheville is the perfect place for me to live. Life is good. Sometimes I go for a walk in the woods...

The space

host_about: Well-immersed in the pastry and chocolate world for several decades, there is nothing on Marc’s list of culinary delights that features higher than chocolate and coffee. Playing a considerable role in both gutting and rebuilding spectacular Chunn’s Cove and Utopia residences, Marc has conclusively proved that watching informative and directional Home Improvement Shows for the best part of adulthood, is akin to learning a new language. Born in Quebec, Marc’s native tongue is French but his English rivals any native tongue and his Spanish ensures trilinguality. Not without her artistic inheritance, Fay’s world is defined as a pleasurable balance between entrepreneur and artist, commencing with a decade of international business travel in her 20’s, evolving to a decade of motherhood punctuated by a successful online decade in the office. Now the time is ripe to spread those four Sagittarian wings for this highly motivated couple are restlessly eager to explore exciting new ventures.

name: Peaceful, Comfortable House in West Asheville
description:
Beautiful, welcoming, peaceful 2 bedroom/2 bathroom house in West Asheville. 10-15 min from Downtown Asheville. 5-10 minutes from trendy Haywood Road in West Asheville.

PLEASE READ THE WHOLE LISTING AS WELL AS THE HOUSE RULES BEFORE BOOKING

The space
PLEASE READ THE WHOLE LISTING AS WELL AS THE HOUSE RULES BEFORE BOOKING

The rental is for the whole upstairs space, front and back porch, and the fenced in yard. I live with my dog in a small completely separate garage apartment downstairs with its own private entrance, we do not share the yard nor any living space.

The house is clean, welcoming and quiet, a perfect house for a peaceful quiet stay. Located in a quiet neighborhood at the end of gravel road surrounded by trees, it feels tucked away from any noise but is nevertheless close to everything. Downtown Asheville is 10-15 mins away by car, trendy Haywood road in West Asheville is only 5-10 mins by car.

There are
neighborhood_overview: It is a quiet residential neighborhood and there are no sidewalks, the house is at the end of a quiet gravel road which is a little bumpy but fine if you drive slowly. Not recommended for very low riding cars.
host_about: I moved from Miami, Florida to Asheville in 2013, and have loved my new home ever since. Love the nature, the mountains, the people. I live a sober lifestyle and appreciate guests respecting that.

name: Perfect place for a quick getaway
description:
This sunny room is attached to a private area in a daylight basement. The living area opens to large fenced yard with a 300 square foot flag stone patio with nice patio furniture. Light up the evening with the tiki torches that line the patio. The sliding glass door acts as a private entrance to the room as well as access to the patio.

The shared living room/dining room has a TV with netflix available. Open up the sliding glass doors to a second floor deck with an available grill for cooking.

The space
Convenient to restaurants, breweries, music venues and bars of Asheville and West Asheville. Popular areas for hiking, mountain biking, rafting and road biking are close by. Quiet neighborhood with easy parking. Guests have access to a full kitchen. My knowledge of the local area is an invaluable asset to any visitor new to the area.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a small quiet neighborhood on the west side of Asheville. It is approximately 15 minutes to both downtown Asheville and West Asheville. It is approximately 2 miles away from the closest brewery Noble Cider.

I do have two small dogs.
host_about: I have lived in Asheville for for over 15 years. I am an avid outdoor enthusiast. I love hiking, biking and rafting.

name: Oasis in the Trees
description:
This newly renovated Arts and Crafts studio has its own parking and entrance and is surrounded by beautiful trees and gardens. The bedroom and sitting-room have Mexican tile floors, stylish furnishings and a soothing ambiance. You will enjoy a comfy queen-size bed, a kitchenette with all the modern conveniences, fast Wi-Fi and a 32 inch Smart TV. The beautifully tiled bathroom has heated floors, a shower built for two and a dressing area separate from the bedroom.

The space
The Oasis in the Trees is great for a couple looking for a romantic get-a-way or if you have kids, we have a comfortable queen-size pull-out couch that can sleep two young ones.

Guest access
There are great hiking trails and mountain biking areas nearby. If you are a nature-lover, a mile up the road is a bird sanctuary and a short hike away is Beaverdam Lake which is great for a nice walk with a beautiful view. We are also seven minutes from Asheville's entertaining an
neighborhood_overview: The Oasis in the Trees is in a lovely neighborhood in North Asheville, one of the most desirable areas in the city. You will feel secluded and out of the beaten path but grocery stores, restaurants, shopping and a movie theater are less than two miles away. The Oasis is seven minutes from downtown and five minutes from the Blueridge Parkway.
host_about: My name is Eleanor and my partner Gary and I are empty-nesters. I have lived in Asheville for 25 years and am very familiar with its history, politics and local color. We love to hike and be outdoors so we can tell you about the best hiking spots, adventure experiences and views of beautiful Western North Carolina. We also frequent downtown Asheville and can guide you to the best restaurants, bars and fun things to do.

name: The Snookmore, Mountainside Refuge with a Hot Tub
description:
Nestled in the southern tip of Snookville, the Snookmore is designed for front porch rocking. With the Blue Ridge Mountains peaking through the treetops and the community garden just a stone's throw away, all you'll need is a iced beverage and life will slow right on down.

The Snookmore is the perfect refuge in these uncertain times. Its only neighbors are us and another rental (The Snookery), and we all have plenty of space to call our own.

** Newly installed backup generators. Never be left the dark again!

*** During the winter months, we do recommend four wheel drive.
neighborhood_overview: The house is tucked away up a long gravel road in Snookville, along with one other vacation house (the Snookery), and our house. We're less than 10 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and 15 from downtown Asheville.
host_about: I'm a theatre artist, teacher, husband and father.  We started hosting Airbnb guests from our Nook (the apartment in our house) upon our arrival in Asheville three years ago.  Since we have added two houses (The Snookmore  and The Snookery) as well as a glamping spot (The Snookstream).  Never idle, we're currently constructing the Snookspace, which will provide our guests with a covered outdoor pavilion for their special events.  We just love being able to share our slice of heaven with the world!

name: Walk to Everything in West Asheville!
description:
Come enjoy the best of everything West Asheville has to offer! We are located two blocks off of Haywood Rd, so from your door it is an easy walk to popular destinations like Sunny Point Cafe, etc. And only a 7 min drive/uber to downtown. Our basement in-law suite has a private bedroom and bath, as well as its own private entrance. You will have everything you need, including a fridge, toaster oven and microwave. We live upstairs, so if you have any questions we are available!

The space
The bed in the bedroom is queen-sized. There is also a pull out sofa in the living room. There is a walk-in shower in the bathroom--no bathtub.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire apartment.

Other things to note
Since we do live upstairs, and we have a five-year-old, you will probably hear us or her at some point during your stay. We cannot hear most of our guests at all (even the TV, which has a great sound system), so yo
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is residential, working-class and up-and-coming. The main road, Haywood Rd, just two blocks from our house,  is home to some of the hottest new restaurants and shops in Asheville. Our street is narrow and the parking can be in high demand. If you have more than 3 guests or more than 2 cars, it's good for us to know ahead of time to be able to help you navigate parking.
host_about: I am an adventure-seeking educator and mother, always grateful to meet folks and hear their stories. I have been studying literature, geography and feminism over the past 20ish years, and I’m consistently awed by our beautiful blue planet. I live in Asheville, NC, USA, and have an Airbnb apartment that I maintain with my husband and daughter. I look forward meeting you!

name: Broker’s Private Hippie Haven! 7min to town!
description:
This popular real estate broker’s private en suite is with private access is perfect for fellow bohemians! Whether you’d like help finding a home to buy or are just exploring AVL for the first time, Kitty’s got you covered. You can enjoy the firepit & porch, queen microfiber & twin beds, a newly remodeled bathroom with a shower (shampoo & conditioner and hairdryer are here) &
Kitchenette supplies. Your door to the house is blocked off w a mattress so you can enjoy privacy and inclusivity.

The space
Private Coded Entrance into Master Suite with Full Bathroom from the master suite Deck, adjacent to Fire Pit/Grill.

Master bedroom has microfiber Queen bed and comfy twin cot Plus a set of velvet armchairs that were once owned by the Biltmore Estate.

Enjoy several photographic pieces of Asheville’s sights and scenes in your room decorated with French antique furniture.

Pet feline Clawdette & beagle Ruby live here.

Vape
neighborhood_overview: One of Asheville's most desirable neighborhoods! Beautiful lake to walk along only .5mi down the road. Very close to Tunnel Road which has a bus stop and leads everywhere fun! We have community watch alliance of friendly neighbors making sure no riff raff goes on except the riff raff we all make on our own!
host_about:
fantastic location just a few minutes from downtown or Biltmore Village. You'll enjoy an oversized bedroom, with its own full bathroom and entry from the new deck, and amazingly comfy microfiber bedding. 

As a business owner (realtor, media company owner, teeth whitening service), former local music promoter and as a foodie having lived here on and off for ten years, I can tell you about the best spots for your bohemian adventure in Asheville. Like a DJ, I will try to feel you out and see what you may enjoy the most for your particular adventure. 

Sometimes I can host more actively, and sometimes I'm swamped with other plans. I respect my guest's privacy and do not enter their rooms while rented. Mainly I like to check in when you're coming and going, but sometimes I end up making fun friends and going out to events together. So far, everyone who has visited has been a kind soul looking to experience the best that Asheville has to offer, and has been comfortable and satisfied with their experience. I love this little city so much, it is my joy to accommodate liberal minded travelers with a relaxed environment and convenient location.

name: The Snookery ~ Refuge Perched on a Mountain
description:
The Snookery is the perfect refuge in these uncertain times. Perched on the mountainside with a back deck with views from the hot tub, it is the perfect place for a safe, memorable gathering.

Its only neighbors are us and another rental (The Snookmore), and we all have plenty of space to call our own. Do not hesitate to reach out with further questions!

The space
Perched on the mountainside, the Snookery has two back decks with views of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Designed to sleep up to 12 comfortably, the Snookery affords large groups a place to convene, but can also provide an intimate stay.

Newly constructed in 2107, it has a fully equipped kitchen for the gourmet chef, the option of a Keurig, Coffee maker or hot tea pot for the morning haze, and both a dining room and back porch dining table for any meal setting you please. Also on the back deck you'll find a grill for the vacation cookout and a hot tub for the end of the day wind
neighborhood_overview:
Snookville is its own neighborhood tucked away down a long gravel road with our house, the Snookery (this listing), and the Snookmore.

That said, we are just a few miles from the closest grocery store and the Blue Ridge Parkway and less than 10 miles from downtown.

Since we have added two houses (The Snookmore  and The Snookery) as well as a glamping spot (The Snookstream). This basement studio apartment has everything you need for an Asheville get away. Guests have their own private

name: Minimum 28 day rental in lovely Grove Park
description:
Spacious light filled upstairs bedroom with a hall bathroom. Private 1912 Arts and Crafts house in North Asheville close to Grove Park Inn and downtown. Kitchen and porch also open to guest. 28 day minimum stay available.

The space
I'm particularly interested in renting to a person looking for an extended stay vacation rental or someone in the visiting nurse program, a student, new to Asheville or someone looking for temporary housing. I do have this room listed separately for short term rental less than 28 days . This listing is JUST for 28 days or more.

Guest access
Guest have access to the kitchen and porch as well as a washer/dryer. Parking is on street parking in front of the house.

Other things to note
The house is in a lovely North Asheville neighborhood about 1.5 miles from downtown and .75 miles from the Grove Park Inn. Mission Hospital is 3 miles away. There are 7 restaurants, a bakery, a butcher, 3
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a lovely, quiet and safe North Asheville neighborhood about 1.5 miles from downtown and .75 miles from the Grove Park Inn.  There are 7 restaurants, a bakery, a butcher, 3 coffee shops, 2 ice cream shops and 2 playgrounds in easy walking distance.  There is a Trader Joe's, Whole Foods and Harris Teeter less than a mile from the house.   This is a very convenient location to most anything in Asheville.
host_about: I am a North Carolina native and came to  Asheville in 2003 after living in Atlanta for 23 years.   I have 4 grown children that live in  Boston, Baltimore, St. Pete and Atlanta.  I loved having a house full of kids so seemed a natural fit to host folks in my home through AirBnB.  It is a pleasure to share my love of Asheville with my guests.  I stay pretty  busy with so much to do here:  gardening, yoga, hiking, volunteering, going to concerts, festivals, breweries and independent films.  My favorite thing of all is playing with my five precious grandchildren.  Life is good!

description:
The Hidden Nest is an almost new apartment, very quiet, with fabulous view, 1 mi. from city limits, 7 mi from downtown. Living room has a pull-out double & single sofa bed (modern mattresses - no torture bar) and TV; gas logs fireplace; kitchen w/snacks; cozy, dark bedroom includes Q-bed, 50" TV w/cable; bathroom w/fluffy towels, washer & dryer. Record player w/mostly folk from 60s/70s. Small patio; convenient to downtown, Biltmore House, West Asheville, Blue Ridge Parkway, outlet malls.

The space
Very private, cozy and quiet - just a couple of miles from I-40. Close to restaurants, grocery stores, pharmacy and fast food. Less than 10 minutes to downtown; less than 15 to the Biltmore Estate and outlet malls. The Blue Ridge Parkway is reasonably close.

Guest access

There is a string of Christmas-type lights that outline
neighborhood_overview:
Wild Canary Mountainside Retreat is at the end of a private road, through a small neighborhood. Very private and quiet - secluded with beautiful distant view of Blue Ridge mountains.
When leaving the neighborhood, and Evelyn Acres Rd ends, it is critically important to obey the stop sign for Mountain View Rd. This will look like you are making a right turn - and then a short circle to the left in order to access that stop sign appropriately. This safety measure will avoid being T-boned by traffic turning right - either into Evelyn Acres or on to Mountain View Road.
host_about: For over 37 years, I have worked for ABCCM, a Christian Ministry which is owned by almost 300 churches with over 6,000 volunteers (pre-covid .. 2100 in 2020). This is a religious social service agency where volunteers from those churches serve our neighbors in need as outlined in Matt. 25: feeding the hungry, visiting those in jail, caring for the sick and taking in the stranger) .. also with ministry for Veterans).  I’m a grandmother of 5 and great grandmother of 4 year old twins. I’m blessed to be able to share my home ... and you won’t fail to be blessed as you enjoy the Blue Ridge/Smoky Mountain view.

Nature and art lovers alike will adore this 3-bedroom, 2-bath cabin with its spacious layout and 6-mile proximity to 'The Paris of the South'. Families, groups, and couples traveling together can experience the sights and sounds of the River Arts District, the peaceful scenery of Blue Ridge Parkway, or the rich history behind the famed Biltmore Estate. Come on in and enjoy your home-away-from-home!

The space
Free WiFi | Secluded Land | Pet Friendly | 1,600 Sq Ft

host_about: Hey y'all. I'm a hiking guide and owner of Asheville Wellness Tours here in Asheville, NC. 2 bedrooms with common bath. Each bedroom is fully furnished, with a queen-sized bed.

host_about:
My wife and I are both retired from careers in business and the medical field. However, we are still active in volunteer work for a Christian (Catholic) Community - Couples for Christ-USA, and its ministry for the poor, ANCOP Foundation USA, Inc. (ANCOP is an acronym for “Answering the Cry Of the Poor”). 

We love to travel. We have visited several countries in Europe a few times, and  do mission work, as well as visit family and friends in Asia, on a regular basis.

description:
Enjoy newer construction, vaulted ceilings and a bright open floor plan that is walkable to local shops and restaurants and minutes from hiking, biking and rafting destinations. This 1 bedroom apartment is beautifully furnished with lots of light, ample off-street parking, spacious private deck, and fenced-in yard! Open floor plan with private bedroom/bathroom (*living room couch pulls out for additional single bed). All utilities included. Great high speed internet. Close to city bus line.

Perfect space for single guest or couple w/ child. Walk to town for lunch/coffee and then head off to The Blue Ridge Parkway, Pisgah National Forest, or hike the Appalachian Trail - all located just minutes away.

host_about: Jennifer Farley was born in a small town south of Raleigh. Initially drawn to Western North Carolina by the Liberal Arts College of UNCA, Jennifer fell in love with Asheville while she was here and settled in the area with her husband George right after achieving her BS in History and Literature. An avid traveler, Jennifer has been to many parts of the world, only to be reminded that her home of Asheville is the most beautiful place on Earth. As an outdoor activist, Jennifer, her husband George, and her son Luke (along with their yellow lab, Barley Farley) love to spend their free time hiking, camping, biking, and canoeing the French Broad. Other interests include rehabbing houses, playing tennis and giving back by supporting the efforts of UNCA, Riverlink, Brother Wolf and the National Park Foundation.

Pet friendly and one mile to grocery. You'll love it!

Classic Asheville neighborhood! Just a mile from Downtown.  
Close to grocery shopping (Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Harris Teeter) and excellent neighborhood eateries- Homegrown Restaurant, Moe's Southwest, Luella's BBQ, Hi-5 Coffee, Vinnie's Italian Restaurant).
host_about: I love to travel and I am excited about hosting guests on Airbnb! I want to provide a great experience for my guests who come to stay at my place in the wonderful city of Asheville.

name: The Cottage at Winghaven—A Stunning Woodland Paradise
description:
Cozy up by the wood-burning stove in this new, light-filled log cabin. Enjoy complete privacy and gorgeous forest and seasonal mountain views while still being close to Asheville. Minutes to restaurants and shops, but away from it all!
Well behaved pets are welcome!
neighborhood_overview: The property is located on 38 acres of forestland on the south side of Burney Mountain. The road to the Cottage is a private gravel road about 1/4 mile. It's approx. 20 min. to downtown Asheville and Hendersonville, 5 min. to stores & restaurants.
host_about: We live with our three young children on a small farm close to Asheville ,NC. We love to spend time outside with our animals, biking or hiking in the beautiful mountains surrounding our home.

name: Houz Zen: A Pet Friendly Private Suite
description:
Enjoy everything that the Asheville area has to offer! Our private ground floor suite boasts a separate entrance and offers a comfortable space to unwind. The peaceful fenced in backyard is perfect for you and your pet. Guests tell us how ZEN our indoor and outdoor space feels. What's more, we are super pet friendly! We have NO pet fees for up to 2 pets however we hope you will ensure your pets are not destructive.

We look forward to having you as our guest!

The space
Entire lower level of a private residence. Completely separate space with your own private entrance. Private patio included along with a 3/4 acre fenced in backyard leading to a small creek! 1 bedroom apartment with a queen bed, 1 bath, free WiFi, 60" Plasma, Blu-Ray DVD player, YoutubeTV with Starz, Showtime, Netflix, Amazon, Chromecast, etc., convenient location to Airport, Asheville, Brevard, & Hendersonville. Guest parking space provided. Owners are both ex hotel managers
neighborhood_overview: We are close to Sierra Nevada & Blue Ghost breweries, and Bold Rock Cidery.  We are short drive to tremendous hiking!   Alltrails.com is a great source for hikes.  Shopping & restaurants along Airport Rd are approximately 1 mile away from the home.  Downtown Asheville is an easy 15-20 minute drive.
host_about:
We are Corey and Cheryl Brookhouzen and we host 2 private suites in our 2 story residential home on a cul de sac in Arden, NC, a suburb of Asheville NC.  The suites are " Houz Zen," a pet friendly ground floor suite with a big fenced in backyard and "A Suite Stay" which is our upstairs area with a full kitchen,  wood fireplace and a deck overlooking the big backyard.

Cheryl and I are passionate about hosting!  Both of us have a long history of hospitality experience - I have over 15 years in Hotel Management experience in the Tampa Bay & Chicago areas and Cheryl has been a Pastry Chef in fast-paced well-known hotels and restaurants in New York City and Chicago.  In fact, we moved from Chicago to the Asheville Area approximately 6 years ago when Cheryl was offered a position at the Inn on Biltmore Estate.  I currently work at a large car dealership in town and Cheryl blogs and helps run our home based Airbnb business.

As hosts for Airbnb, we have enjoyed opening our private suites to guests (and their furry family members) from all over the world.  We try to offer our guests what we like when we travel - a comfortable and stylish place to relax.  What's more, we enjoy traveling with our 2 small dogs (Lola and Archie) and look for pet-friendly accommodations with no extra pet fees!

We love Asheville and we see ourselves continuing our life's journey in this beautiful eclectic Mountain community.  Cheryl and I first met and dated in high school.  In fact, she was my high school sweetheart in 1986!  Although we lost track of each other over the next twenty years, we met again at our high school reunion and (needless to say) the rest is history.  

Come stay with us!  We would love to share our private suites and everything that Asheville has to offer.

name: Forested Spot in the city.  5 minutes to downtown.
description:
This charming, mid-century home is located just 1.4 miles from downtown. Close to everything, centrally located and yet on a quiet mountain road with mature trees, privacy, and wildlife! It is the perfect home base to explore all Asheville has to offer.

Enjoy a mountain escape within a few minute's drive of downtown, the River Arts District, West Asheville, and the Biltmore Estate.

We take coronavirus seriously and disinfect the home thoroughly between all guests following Airbnb's protocol.

The space
The home has an open floor plan with a sunny kitchen and dinette. There's a comfortable living room area with large windows looking out into the trees. A door off the dinette opens right onto the deck. Sunlight comes over the mountain and into the kitchen and deck for morning coffee.

The deck overlooks the yard and mountains beyond. The home is on a quiet road. We have Carolina Chickadees, Tufted Titmouse, Red Cardinals, Blue Jays
neighborhood_overview:
The home is located in the historic, forested Kenilworth neighborhood, known for it's beautiful and eclectic old homes. Our quiet road attracts walkers, runners and cyclists from all over Asheville.

Just up the hill is the famous Helen's Bridge. Constructed in 1909, it is the carriageway to the historic Zealandia Estate. Construction began the same year with the same architect as the Biltmore Estate.

Views of downtown reward the walk up to the bridge and another 15 minutes downhill will put you in the heart of Asheville. An uber costs around $6 for the same journey and usually comes within a few minutes.
host_about:
Entrepreneur, business owner, Caribbean charter boat captain and sailor. I've spent my life making people happy on vacation, from the Mountains of Colorado to the US Virgin Islands. I've always loved welcoming visitors to awesome travel destinations that happen to be my home. 

Asheville is a wonderful small city. I like coffee, bookstores, farmers markets and bicycles. I also love great restaurants and outdoor activities. No wonder I moved to Asheville. 

As a host I like to completely disappear unless I'm needed or wanted, then I'm here to help, offer local tips, make reservations, arrange transportation or whatever you need.

name: Our Little Getaway
description:
+++Now equipped with a full house UV-C ultraviolet sanitizer in the central heat pump system so the air exchange is always cleaned of viruses and bacteria!+++

Come enjoy our fully furnished little getaway in E. Asheville just 4 miles from Downtown, minutes away from the Blue Ridge Parkway and many breweries. Our place is also convenient to lots shopping areas.

The space
We are offering a sweet, newly renovated 400+ square foot apartment. There is lots of natural light. Brand new full kitchen with granite countertops and equipped with cofee maker (with coffee), microwave, stove, pots, pans, dishes, silverware and a lot more. Kitchen has an island for more storage with a breakfast bar. Full bath with shower and tub. Super comfortable organic new queen-sized Murphy bed that is combined with a special couch. TV with Roku. Shared laundry room which has your closet and dresser for clothes. Plenty of storage for longer stays.

Guest
neighborhood_overview: This immediate neighborhood is relatively new.  People are friendly and safe.  It is conveniently located near shopping,  the Blue Ridge Parkway and Downtown Asheville.  We are also near Highland Brewery.
host_about: I frequently travel with my girlfriend.  I have traveled to several areas of the world. I love all types of sports especially team sports like group biking, kayaking and volleyball. I like low-key traveling and enjoy real encounters with local people.  Recently, my girlfriend and I traveled to Uruguay, Argentina and New Orleans.  We stayed in youth hostels and airbnb.

name: Upper Suite East Edge - Walk to Downtown Asheville
description:
Private upstairs one bedroom suite in a newer home with partial views of the Asheville skyline. Ten minute walk to downtown. Uber anywhere in the city for less than $10. Very convenient location!

The space
Private entrance with keyless entry, take stairs up to your private one bedroom Queen suite with full bath.

Guest access
The entire upstairs suite will be exclusively available to our guests. We will provide a key upon check-in. The front door entrance is keyless; guests will be provided a code #.

Other things to note
Advance reservations are recommended for certain concerts, activities, restaurants, tours, etc. You can always find fun and interesting things to do without reservations, but if you know what and when you'd like to do something, a reservation is a good idea. If you want to see what is available in the area, check out www.romanticasheville.com.
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located off Hwy 240.  Walk to venues, theaters, activities, coffee shops, lots of breweries and restaurants.  Short drive to Biltmore Estate, surrounding small towns, hiking/biking/waterfalls, wineries, etc.
host_about: Midwest transplant; have been in Asheville for ten years.  Love the variety of available activities, the mountains and the moderate climate.

name: Quiet Bright Bedroom Close to Downtown
description:
Quiet bedroom nestled in the hemlocks in an adorable bright and sunny bungalow in North Asheville, 1.7 miles from downtown (40 minute walk via the greenway, or a 5 minute Uber). Walking distance from the North Asheville Farmers Market, hiking trails and the Botanical Gardens, UNC Asheville, breweries and restaurants. Enjoy a fire in the firepit on cool evenings!

The space
This private room has a queen bed, dresser, and two closets. All common areas are available for guest use.

Guest access
Please make yourself at home in all of the common areas...which is everywhere except my bedroom and the basement.

All amenities in the home are available for guests to use. This includes wifi, all kitchen appliances, coffee and tea. Please note that I do not have a TV.

There is a lovely front porch to sit and read books on, and firepit in the yard that guests are welcome to use.

Other things to note
While we ha
neighborhood_overview:
Our North Asheville neighborhood is super leafy and quiet.

The North Asheville Tailgate Market will be open every Saturday from April – November and is a short walk around the corner from my house.

Luella's BBQ (my favorite BBQ place in all of Asheville), Green Sage Cafe, the Hop Ice Cream Parlor, and Asheville Pizza and Brewing are all a short walk from the house.
host_about: A born and raised Florida girl, economist/professor. Social, yet very independent. Avid traveler.

name: QUIET, COMFY & CLEAN ~ Near Downtown & UNCA!
description:
You will have private access to one half of our clean, comfortable and quiet home in North Asheville. Two beautiful, spacious second floor rooms, private Bath and a fantastic location for visiting the area!

Relax on our large front porch complete with rocking chairs. Enjoy the garden, fruit trees and large quiet yard that gives a feel of country in the city!

Conveniently located 1.3 miles from Downtown, an easy 10 minute walk, with great access to I-240 and I-26 less than 1 mile away!

The space
Two spacious, well lit, private rooms available on the second floor with a private bathroom, living room and entrance. The Yarrow Room contains one queen bed and sleeps two. The Loft Room is a bit larger, contains a queen bed in the main space and also has a loft with a double futon. The Loft Room will sleep four people. Private bathroom is located between the rooms off the landing.

There is a third room off the landing that is our priv
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood, we have large space that feels very private with a bamboo patch, fruit trees, honey bees and a garden. Many of our neighbors also keep gardens and honey bees. A few of the immediate neighbors have been living here for many, many years.
host_about:
Bill has lived in Asheville for over 25 years and his wife Christina joined him in North Carolina in 2012. 

West Street Palace started as a one room farm house many, many years ago. Bill began to remodel the home when he purchased it 25 years ago, adding rooms, stories, a hand dug basement and love in every piece of wood in the home. Bill is a bee keeper, gardener, highly skilled wood worker and a Dad

Christina creates beautiful Goat Milk Soaps, Lotions and cheeses and conducts a series of Educational Workshops, Homestead Experiences and Farm Tours at their beautiful Farm in Yancey County, one hour north of Asheville. Christina has been teaching outdoor education and sustainable living skills since 2003.

name: Comfortable private room in historic B&B
description:
This is one of our most popular rooms located in the Northwest corner of the second floor. It has a silk upholstered queen bed, beautiful pine floors, and warm beige hand-plastered walls. Antique furnishings are complimented by beautiful art work and luxurious bed linens. The bathroom is a generous size, as it was original to the house and has been modernized with a shower.

The space
The Lion and the Rose is a Queen Anne style home dating back to 1898.

There are only 4 rooms and 1 suite. All come with free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs and DVD players. Some also have fireplaces and original features, including stained-glass windows.

Amenities include a 2 course cooked breakfast, free parking and a DVD library, plus a complimentary welcome beer upon arrival :)

Guest access
Large wraparound porch, backyard fire pit, wildlife certified garden, two communal parlors, 24/7 guest pantry with refrigerator, freezer and microwave
neighborhood_overview: Located in the historic Montford neighborhood less than a mile from downtown Asheville and a short drive from Biltmore Estate and Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about: The Lion and the Rose Bed and Breakfast is a romantic pink-lady inn with lush grounds in the heart of Asheville NC's Montford Historic District. Steve and Karen are the innkeepers that live on the premises. We love to talk about travel, animals and photography and we are dedicated to giving our guests the best possible stay in this amazing city.

name: Arden / South Asheville guest room
description:
Freshly renovated guest room in the Asheville Airport area. The guest room features a queen bed, it's own private full bathroom, a desk, access to the shared kitchen, living room and dining area. This is a NON smoking unit. Located 2.5 miles from the airport, Biltmore Park, w/i 5 miles to 4 breweries - Including Sierra Nevada and entrances to the Blue Ridge Parkway. Just under 7 miles (15 minutes) to Biltmore Village, 9 (20 minutes) to downtown Avl, making it convenient to a lot of areas.

The space
Private queen bedded room with private full bathroom and full closet. Wi-Fi, linens, toiletries and use of the living room, kitchen and dining room are included. Storage in the fridge along with use of the washer and dryer should be discussed before being used. Also included is my 12 years of knowledge of the area from great places to visit to insight into how to get there.

Newly installed bamboo flooring and fresh paint make this room a great place to
neighborhood_overview: The guest room is in a small condo complex that is not very obvious at first - which is a good thing, as it keeps things peaceful and quiet.
host_about: Skier, Snowboarder, golfer and love to travel! Having worked and lived in many resort towns my favorite thing is exploring new places, especially off the beaten path, often using locals knowledge to have an amazing adventure!

name: Biltmore Retreat Luxury King Guest Suite
description:
This awesome location is just 5 minutes from the Biltmore Estate and the Blue Ridge Parkway. There is an Ingles grocery store and CVS Pharmacy within one mile. You are close to shopping and dozens of restaurants, and within 10 minutes of Downtown, West Asheville, and the River Arts District. This property is approved by the City of Asheville, Home Stay Permit # 18-00224.

The space
Your Biltmore Luxury King Guest Suite with private entrance is part of a brand new, green certified energy efficient home. It boasts a beautiful master bath with double sinks, granite countertop, and spacious, custom tile shower. Refresh yourself upon arrival with a cup of coffee via the K-cup maker with several varieties for you to enjoy. There is also a mini-frig and microwave for your convenience. The brand new king bed is super comfy and there is also a queen air bed in the suite. The walk-in closet is roomy and has two luggage racks, iron with ironing board, plus a card table and
neighborhood_overview: Location! Location! Location! There is an Ingles grocery store and CVS Pharmacy within one mile. Only 5 minutes to the Biltmore and the Blue Ridge Parkway. You are close to shopping and dozens of restaurants in Biltmore Village, and within 10 minutes of Downtown, West Asheville, and the River Arts District.
host_about:
I am a long time resident of Asheville and enjoy both hosting and travelling. I love to soak up the sunshine and enjoy the mountains, the coast, and cruises. Some favorites destinations of mine are Boulder CO, White Mountains NH, Aruba, NYC,
St Thomas, London, Dublin, and Toronto. Five must haves I can't live without include chocolate, pizza, sweet tea, mac &  cheese (Southern girl, ya know), and furry friends (dogs, cats, etc). My motto is to spread cheer wherever I go and leave folks better off than before I found them.

name: Amazing Mountain View close to Biltmore, Downtown
description:
Private Suite with views of Blue Ridge. Minutes to Biltmore Estate, River Arts District, Downtown Asheville, and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Home is green built, but located in historic Kenilworth neighborhood. Enter through the private patio entrance. This is the lower level of our home so you will hear us in the morning when we get our coffee. Listen to the brassy train horn when it passes through the Village. St. Anne's Church chimes the hour and half hour.

The space
Sit on the patio and look over the Blue Ridge. At night, the Village lights twinkle through the trees. Bring your slippers in the winter as the floor is polished concrete.

Guest access
You will have the entire lower level to yourself. Park across from our home, and follow the sidewalk around the right side of the house, to a sliding wooden gate under the deck to your private patio.

Other things to note
Kenilworth Inn lies at the top of our street.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood takes its name from the Kenilworth Inn, located four doors up the street from our house. While our house is only a few years old, the neighborhood is an eclectic mix of architecture from Bungalows, ranches, and contemporary styles.  You can walk down the hill to High-Wire Brewery or the new Tree House Cider or Appalachian Vintners.  Downtown is less than two miles away.
host_about:
I am a retired landscape architect and I love gardening, the outdoors, walks through the neighborhood and cooking.  My husband works at home as a technical writer, but his passion is riding bicycles and travel. We have a son who is a web designer in San Francisco.  Our daughter, 24, lives with us and works as a server at Biltmore Estates. We have one dog, Bojangles, and one fat cat named Peace. 
We moved from Atlanta four years ago, and love living in the mountains!
