name: Avl Getaway: Beautiful & Spacious 2 Bedroom Suite
description:
Get the best of both worlds: enjoy the uniqueness of Asheville’s most treasured neighborhood and enjoy being only a 5 min drive from Asheville city center. Our private entrance ground floor suite has all you need to explore. At only a short 1.5 mile neighborhood drive, you will be close to everything in town including breweries & restaurants.

Our unique space is filled with our own art and items from our world travels and is equipped with local coffee and beer so you get a taste of our city.

The space
We follow all regulations to make sure our space is up to cleanliness standards set by Air BNB and CDC to keep our guests safe including having at least 27 hours between guests.

Check out our property on Instagram at @avlgetaway

Our fully private suite is on the ground level of our new green built home. We travel around the world for work and pleasure and have decorated our suite with items from East, South, and West Africa, the
neighborhood_overview:
Asheville and all it's uniqueness can be found in our famous neighborhood called Montford. Our little nook at the end of a road represents what Asheville is all about a intermingling of new and old. You can walk to town in 35 minutes, drive the 5-7 min drive, or take an Uber usually costing at normal times at $7.

It is 1.5 miles into a neighborhood from the edge of the center of Asheville, so it is removed from the hustle and bustle of downtown. The last 1/4 of a mile will truly make you feel like you have left the city, while you pass our urban neighborhood garden. We also live across the street from potentially the oldest house in our neighborhood, though not as beautiful as it once was we cherish and love it and it's owner. We love our neighborhood, and we think it is amazing to have our unique and lovely nook with such close proximity to the city.
host_about:
I am an art therapist and run an international nonprofit building mental health programs in humanitarian settings. 

I have stayed in air bnbs in South and Eastern Africa, Eastern and Western Europe, Middle East, and North and South America. I’ve loved my experiences as a guest, so I was even more excited to start being a host in my own home in Asheville, NC, where I’ve decorated it with items from all my travels.

name: Mountain Views & Hot Tub at Reeves Cove Cottage
description:
The house was built in 1927 and was originally located on the Biltmore Estate Dairy Farm property. It was moved to this location in the 1950's. It is a cool quirky place with lovely mountain views from the bedrooms, back deck and yard. Interior décor is in "Fixer Upper Farmhouse style". House includes a Hot tub, fire pit and screened porch for our guest to enjoy.

Need more space? Rent together with our tiny house or with our Blue Bird Cottage.

The space
Our house is a 3 Bedroom, 2 Bath nearly 100 year old cottage that has been updated with todays modern amenities. There is a family room, formal dining, sun room and screened in porch. The master suite has a living area area with a couch as well as a queen sized bed and sliding doors to back deck.
There are Mountain View’s from the bedrooms, back deck,hot tub and fire pit.
The house is in a rural area but is just 5 minutes to the grocery store, 10 to Asheville Outlet Mall and 20 minute
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a rural area just outside Asheville city limits.  About 5 minutes to grocery shopping, less than 10 minutes to Asheville Outlets.  About 20 minutes to downtown Asheville or Biltmore Estate.
host_about: I am the mother to three super active kiddos ages 17, 14 & 12. We are super active people who enjoy running, bike riding, hiking and any other outdoor play we can find.  We live just "over the mountain" (3 miles by roads) from the houses so I am available to assist when necessary.  I have been hosting for Airbnb since Nov. 2015 and love it! I am also a Realtor in Asheville at Preferred Properties.

name: 1 Bedroom Apt. Historic Montford (2/4)
description:
Spacious downtown apartment in 4-unit historic Montford home. Fully equipped kitchen & furnished; linens provided.
There are 3 other units that have other guest living in them. You won't share any common space with them. You will have a parking space in the gravel area in back.
There is a TV in the armorer in the living room, along with Charter WiFi & cable TV.
It's only a short walk to downtown where you can find award-winning restaurants, entertainment, coffee shops, breweries, & shopping.

The space
This downstairs apt. has been newly painted; there is new tile in the kitchen and bathroom. Completely renovated kitchen with new appliances. Very comfortable seating; flat screen tv is in an armoire in the living room. It's a perfect haven for 1 or 2 people who enjoy walking or biking the two blocks into town or to the grocery store, people who want fast access to the incredible hiking and mountain biking available here, as well as sight-seeing. Ash

Hi! Welcome to LanDom. This is our lovely 4 apartment building located in the Historic Montfort area in Asheville. My mom owns the property and I help her rent out the apartments. name: Asheville Cottage in Historic Montford 30 Day Min
description:
Welcome to my entire cottage in the Historic district of Asheville known as Montford. Enjoy the comfort of your own place for your vacation while exploring the many adventures that the area offers.
You can easily walk to the vibrant and exciting downtown Asheville to people watch or attend live theater, visit art galleries, shop in the many eclectic stores, or dine at one of the over 65 restaurants! Known as the 'Paris of the South'.

The space
Sink into a king-size luxury mattress after a fun- filled day of adventures. A walk-in closet with additional shelving is quite roomy. A brand new trundle with two luxury twins are welcoming at the end of the day. High thread count linens and towels provide a level of comfort for guests. And the bedspreads are freshly laundered before each guest arrives. Even the pillows are sanitized between guests or replaced.

Guest access
This home has everything you need and then some for an enjoyable visit.
neighborhood_overview: "The neighborhood of Montford was exceptionally beautiful, and was actually part of a tour we took through the town. We spent some time walking for many blocks, looking at the huge and beautiful homes. And, from the first night, we walked into town to find so many restaurants, so much shopping, and such friendly people. This is one of the most "dog-friendly" cities we have visited, and our Buster felt much at home here." Emp Chicago Il
host_about: I have been living in Asheville since 1999. It has been a wonderful place to raise my daughter and grow my business's. Not to mention an amazing place for outdoor adventures. Of course the selection of unique restaurants and places to visit are almost limitless. Those are just some of the reason's I cannot see myself living anywhere else.

name: AVL Sunshine Daydream House 6 Miles from Downtown
description:
This eclectic and charming 1950's bungalow has just been lovingly remodeled for your enjoyment.

It sits on the West side in a quiet neighborhood just on the outskirts of town. Convenient to I40, just 17 minutes from the airport, 13 minutes (6 miles) to downtown, 15 minutes to Biltmore, 15 minutes to UNCA and 10 minutes to happening Haywood Rd.

Clean, comfortable and stylishly funky with lots of windows to let in that sunshine!

Great for families, small groups, and four legged friends!

The space
Pets are welcome and we have a fenced in yard, so bring your well behaved furry friends. Please let me know if you do plan on bringing pets.

There are 3 bedrooms total (all new mattresses): The 2 downstairs rooms both have queen beds (and a small porch off one), and the finished attic has a king bed and a couch that converts to 2 twins. The twin beds can be a pain to make up so please let me know if you'd like this done for you
neighborhood_overview: This is a very sweet spot on a dead-end street, far enough from the highway to be quiet, but close enough to be convenient to get around. The neighbors are pure gold, PLEASE be respectful of the neighbors and I'm sure they will be very welcoming.

name: Serenity Cottage w/HOT TUB & Courtyard, 1 mi<BRPW
description:
Note: Our cottage is open for all stays.
Quiet, Cozy, Private!!! Hot tub, full kitchen for 4, outdoor courtyard, TV with Roku, and wifi. Located 1 mile from NC Arboretum, Bent Creek River Park, & Blue Ridge Parkway. Just 15 minutes from downtown Asheville and Biltmore Estate. This stand-alone house is located in a quiet, safe, & rural neighborhood. The space has modern furnishings and is decorated with an outdoorsy National Park theme.

The space
Bent Creek is the most popular place to mountain bike in Asheville! Bike from your front door or drive 1 mile to Rice Pinnacle Trailhead and explore the Pisgah National Forest! Or park at Hardtimes Trailhead and walk the NC Arboretum trails or hike thru a rhododendron thicket to Lake Powhatan! Jump onto the Blue Ridge Parkway and enjoy the breathtaking overlooks and serene hikes or take a tubing trip down the French Broad River just 1 mile from Serenity Cottage. It is a short ride to everything you want to do in t
neighborhood_overview: This home is located in Bent Creek, an amazing community with its own community park!  The park has walking paths, pump track, playset with slide and swings, basketball court, grills, shelter house, and more.  Bent Creek is the most popular place to mountain bike in Asheville.  Bike from your front door or drive 1 mile to Rice Pinnacle Trailhead and explore the Pisgah National Forest!
host_about:
Hi!  We’re Jodi and Dan!
We both grew up in southern Indiana and have been exploring national parks since college!  We lived in Yellowstone NP for 4 summers and were able to explore many other national parks in our travels to and from Yellowstone.  Some of our favorite parks include: Zion, Redwoods, Yosemite, and Great Smoky Mountains National Park.  We chose to move to Asheville for its extensive hiking and outdoor opportunities, amazing food and music scene, and cultural life (and proximity to our family).  We hope you enjoy Asheville as much as we do!

neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet residential neighborhood and you'll feel like you're driving into the country but will only be 5-10mins from all of Asheville's highlights such as Biltmore, Downtown, and the Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about: Hey y'all. I'm a hiking guide and owner of Asheville Wellness Tours here in Asheville, NC. I lived and guided in various areas of the US and Ecuador for 15 years before moving to Asheville back in 2008 to work in Wilderness Therapy. These days, I am happy to be settled in one place and love this little mountain town. I'm happy to share trail, restaurant, and activity recommendations with you any time. I hope you love your stay here...both in my home and our little mountain town!

description:
Spacious, mid-century inspired space located near the Pisgah Forest. A short walk takes you to trails for hiking & biking. Located minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway & French Broad River. Downtown Asheville is 15 minutes away! Our space offers, a large fireplace, Casper queen-sized bed w/topper. Feel free to access the weather, music, and a good joke! We have off-street parking as well.

name: Immaculate, Traditional Home in S. Asheville BR1
description:
Our home is located in a highly-desirable quiet neighborhood, within minutes of the Asheville Airport, restaurants, shopping centers, craft breweries, the Agricultural Center, Biltmore House, and major highways. The bedroom is furnished with a queen-sized bed & a reclining loveseat & chair. WIFI, cable TV, and a writing desk & chair are also available. Breakfast is included, and transport services and laundry facilities may be arranged for an additional fee.

The space
1 spacious guest bedroom with a queen-sized bed, additionally furnished with a recliner couch & chair, writing desk/chair, dresser, cableTV, and WIFI access.

host_about:
My wife and I are both retired from careers in business and the medical field. However, we are still active in volunteer work for a Christian (Catholic) Community - Couples for Christ-USA, and its ministry for the poor, ANCOP Foundation USA, Inc. (ANCOP is an acronym for “Answering the Cry Of the Poor”). 

We love to travel. We have visited several countries in Europe a few times, and  do mission work, as well as visit family and friends in Asia, on a regular basis.

In the care, upkeep, and hosting accommodations of our home, we believe “Cleanliness is next to Godliness.”

name: W. Asheville Spa and Gameroom Getaway
description:
COVID PRECAUTIONS TAKEN SERIOUSLY: This newly renovated basement unit is 1/2 m to heart of west Asheville. Private Hottub and outdoor shower available upon request, Beautiful gas fireplace in BR w/ queen bed, full bath, kitchenette, airhockey/pool/ping pong, darts, board games, smart tv, wii. Under 10 min to Downtown, River Arts District, French Broad River trails, Outlet Malls, and Biltmore Estate.

The space
Guests have private access to this lower level apartment and sole use of it while visiting. We will be staying on the upstairs level with a separate entrance, so you will hear us at times.

Guest access
Guests have sole access to the entire lower level apartment, private hottub and outdoor shower spa area by appointment, and sitting area in back yard with fire pit.

Other things to note
Please park in driveway.
neighborhood_overview:
West Asheville is a happening little neighborhood with more amazing restaurants, coffeehouses, pubs, parks, yoga studios, outdoor adventure centers, and live music than you'll ever be able to see in just one visit.

This home sits on a quiet, dead end road with only a few surrounding families, so we do ask that while you enjoy the peaceful street, you also respect the neighbors by returning the favor and keeping the volume down, especially when outside.
host_about: I am an enthusiast for adventures and love to travel, dance, whitewater kayak, hike, mountain bike, garden, forage, and cook.  As an ICU nurse and a mother of 2 daughters, I work hard, but play much harder.

name: the BEAR DEN—beautiful+private+walk 2 Sunny Point
description:
Amazing, private guest suite in Historic West Asheville within walking distance to the excitement of Haywood Road–the main corridor in WAVL where you'll find amazing restaurants, like Sunny Point Café and BiscuitHead, bars and breweries. Our pad is great for vacation, staycation or as a work-from-home alternative. The suite has blazing fast wifi, contactless check-in & a dedicated HEPA purifier. We strictly follow Airbnb’s enhanced cleaning protocol, which includes washing all linens/blankets.

The space
The suite is professionally furnished with a Queen Organic Loom & Leaf memory foam mattress, Samsung Smart TV w/Netflix and cable, Scandinavian sofa/daybed (perfect for a third guest), desk and ergonomic chair (excellent for business travelers), bistro table, record player with a variety of vinyl and a Ms. Pac-Man/Galaga machine on free play!

It features hardwood floors and its own temperature control for central heat and/or air conditioning. We provide
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is a short walk down our quiet, tree-lined street to Haywood Road, where you’ll find fantastic restaurants, bars, craft breweries and shops.

Historic West Asheville is one of the most popular places to live, and visit, in the city. “Thrillest” named West Asheville the "Brooklyn of North Carolina." Our neighborhood is eclectic, creative, trendy, urban and hipster-friendly. If you are looking for formal surroundings, you may want to consider staying in a different part of town :)

Downtown Asheville is a 5 minute drive away or an $8~ Uber/Lyft.
host_about:
I am a freelance graphic designer who loves art, coffee and good music. I’m a progressive thinker who believes that everyone deserves the chance to build a wonderful life through equal opportunity education and hard work. 

We welcome and offer a safe space for all guests.

name: Janina's Cozy Studio at Biltmore Central Asheville
description:
Asheville Chic only 1-1/2 miles from Biltmore Estate, near London Road Design District! Renovated European-Style, Self-Contained Studio with Separate Entrance in Private Family Home, Perfect for Couples & Weekend Getaways. Reputation for sparkling cleanliness and no direct contact with resident host required! Guests can also enjoy an outdoor cafe table and seating area among the organically-grown roses and perennials garden. Free WiFi.

The space
Guests at Janina's stay in their own separate space with its own street door, so no direct interaction with your host is required, though help is always available! And consistent with Janina's reputation for sparkling cleanliness, we will be following enhanced cleaning protocols required by Airbnb. As an extra precaution, we schedule a minimum of 24 hours between bookings and no longer accept back-to-back same-day reservations, in which guests depart in the morning and new guests arrive in the afternoon on the same day.
neighborhood_overview: If you've ever wanted to visit historic Biltmore Estate, this is the perfect location! Janina's Cozy Studio is in a quiet neighborhood of 1950s ranch houses and bungalows that's less than 1-1/2 miles from the entrance to Biltmore Estate, and also a short drive to the heart of downtown Asheville. We're also a leisurely walk from Biltmore Village and the emerging London Road Design District, home to new creative businesses, artist studios, and brewery tap rooms.
host_about: I'm a writer and avid nature lover, enjoying semi-retired life in these glorious Appalachian mountains and my new career as an Airbnb host. I also grow roses in my organic, no-spray garden, and guests love the blooms! I speak some tourist-level Spanish and French, though English is my native language.

name: Country cottage in the center of it all!
description:
Close to the city with a country feel. Come and enjoy all that Asheville and the surrounding areas have to offer in our little country cottage. We are located in Fletcher, NC- about 20-30 min from downtown Asheville and the Biltmore House (about 9 miles)- and a short drive from Asheville Airport. Tryon Equestrian Center is just 30 min away. Hiking, kayaking, shopping- all within 30 min drive or less. Outdoor fire pit for chilling after an amazing days adventures with your local brew or wine!

The space
We don't have cable for the TV but we do have internet you can access- We have a smart TV so if you have a Netflix account, you can access all your favorite shows/movies- We also have a DVD player/ DVD’s and a variety of board games as well. If you like to spend your time outside, we have a corn hole game, rock fire pit and porches on the front and back of the house to relax and enjoy the outdoors.

Guest access
All spaces accessible-

name: The Bluebird Basement Getaway
description:
Super CLEAN, safe and serene escape to Asheville! Renovated walkout basement with its own ground level entrance. Tucked into the trees with a 60 Acre virgin forest sanctuary for the backyard. Quiet and serene, yet just 3 miles from the heart of downtown Asheville. Lots of Asheville’s best bars, breweries, and more just a mile or 2 away. Up for a hike or frisbee golf? The Richmond Hill City Park is about 1/2 mile away! Or head to the River Arts District to explore, just 1.5 miles away.

The space
-The kitchenette space offers an island with seating for two, a toaster oven, small fridge with freezer, coffee maker, hot plate, and microwave. Perfect for an easy meal or to heat up your delicious leftovers.

-It has 1 separate bedroom featuring a barn door. There are lights on nightstands on each side of the bed creating a cozy and comfortable sleeping arrangement. The bed is a Lucid Memory foam mattress on a platform. It is VERY comfortable!
neighborhood_overview: This house is located in a private neighborhood in the Richmond Hill area.  Om Sanctuary is nearby where you can take Yoga, Mediation, and QiGong Classes.   The Richmond Hill City Park is just up the street where you will find 6+ miles of trails great for hiking, strolling, walking your dog, or mountain biking.  There's a frisbee gold course there as well that Outdoor Magazine listed as the top course in the south.  Just outside the neighborhood off Riverside Drive are multiple venues for music, food, drinks, and entertainment;  Salvage Station, and Shakey’s, Ginger’s Revenge, Zillicoa Brewery, and White Duck Taco.
host_about:
I am a jewelry artist here in the River Arts District in Asheville, NC. I can assure you Asheville is a fantastic place to visit and you leave wanting more!  I lived out west for 20 years prior to moving here 6+ years ago.  I am amazed every day at the beauty of the Western North Carolina area, the southern hospitality, and the farm fresh food and craft beers and ciders!

   I love exploring the true character of an area and am always excited to find places to travel that have maintained their own unique character.  I definitely would say I've been off the beaten path just about everywhere I've traveled including Mongolia, Patagonia, Iceland and more!  My blessings are counted everyday knowing that I live in such a special place and it is such a pleasure to be able to offer a space that allows others to experience Asheville to the fullest as well.  
     My husband Brandon and I welcome you to our home just outside downtown Asheville.  The neighborhood is quiet and the location can’t be beat.  Please let us know if you need anything additional to make your stay more pleasant:)

This gorgeous homestay resembles a beautiful hotel in the middle of a wooded mountain. The space is professionally decontaminated using an alcohol fumigator for true disinfection. Some of these activities include snowboarding, rafting, hiking, four-wheeling, camping and exploring.

description:
Need a place to crash while you hike or bike the trails then hit the breweries? This room is perfect for the busy solo traveler. One mile from Haywood and all the best of West Asheville. Enjoy a very comfortable private room/private bath and access to laundry. This room has a single bed for one guest only, no TV, but we do have wifi. You will be sharing a home with two others when you stay, so we appreciate guests who understand this fact.

The space
Your room is separate from the other bedrooms in the house, allowing for more privacy when coming and going and when sleeping. If you are bringing a dog, please let us know a little about your fur baby to see if they are good fit for our house and family dog. Sorry we do not allow cats i

name: Cozy Little Farmette Minutes to Downtown Asheville
description:
Enjoy the peace and quiet of the country! This cozy little farmette, situated in the valley off the Blue Ridge Mountains, is a slice of heaven within minutes of downtown Asheville.
Outside, you’ll feel an instant sense of peace and tranquility surrounded by horses, happy, free ranging chickens, abundant woods, gardens, ponds, open lawns and patios for your restful getaway. Inside, the house is joyfully animated by the presence of a sweet cat and two joyful pups.

The space
Located on a quiet street with views of Blue Ridge Mountains and abundant nature: fox, bear, turkey, ducks, geese, blue heron and blue birds are some of my wonderful outdoor critters! While I have an indoor cat and dog, they are very quiet, and stay out of the airbnb space.

Guest access
The bedroom and bathroom are private, off to one end of the house, with your own entrance. There is a lovey patio to spend time sipping your coffee, meditating, yoga or just being. Sh
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quietly nestled in the Blue ridge valley, where bears do roam frequently--although they do sleep away the winter months. There is a local restaurant if you choose to stay in the neighborhood (Creekside Taphouse) and a lovely local, organic coffee shop (Penny Cup). And still on the east side of Asheville, not too far away... Copper Crown for delicious tapas, Filo Pastries and coffee for your morning fix. Yum!
host_about:
Having spent many years being a mother, a nester and a DIY domestic goddess—cooking, baking, gardening, creating, designing/remodeling/up-cycling, raising chickens and other animals—I now hanker to add more travel to my life. I grew up in the hills of Ohio, lived many years in the fine state of New Jersey, and now call Asheville, NC home.  My recent travels have taken me to Nicaragua, London, Germany, California, Montana, Wyoming and Jost Van Dyke.
In your house, you will find me to be easy-going, friendly, animal-loving, quiet, clean and considerate.
I look forward to meeting you!

description:
Historic Montford home. 3 blocks from the civic center and downtown. This is an old home in a wonderful neighborhood. The space has 2 bedrooms and 1 bath with a common hallway area where you’ll find a small fridge, coffee and snacks. The larger room has a king and an air mattress is available. The space has character, very comfortable, very clean, and very convenient to all that asheville has to offer. It’s short walk to downtown, coffee shops, restaurants, bars and breweries.

The space
Old home in historic neighborhood. You’ll have the whole 2nd floor to yourselves and access to the front yard and porch. There is a private stairwell to the second floor. There are two bedrooms, and a bathroom. In the common hallway you’ll find coffee and a fridge and some snacks provided. I live on the first floor. We may see each other come and go but the spaces are separate and private. Pets are welcome at an extra charge of $25 as long as they’re well behaved. Guests are resp
neighborhood_overview: Montford is just north of downtown. The Flint Street House is 3 blocks(on the same street!) from the civic center in historic Montford. This neighborhood is full of great architecture and parks.
host_about: I’ve lived in Asheville since 1997. Originally moved here for school and stayed. I bought the Flint street house 2016 and have lived in the neighborhood since 2003. I have two dogs Diesel and Indy. I enjoy all that Asheville has to offer and would be happy to share it with you. Feel free to ask me about anything. I’m very laid back and spend my days working on various carpentry, garden, farm, music, and art projects throughout the area.

name: Live/Work/Walk Everywhere from Drover's Way House
description:
Drover's Way is located on the edge of Downtown AVL with free onsite parking! With a large room downstairs and sitting areas off the bedrooms upstairs, a couple can easily find office space for remote working yet still enjoy having the benefits of a whole house to live comfortably with space to relax in. The house has 2 bedrooms, 3 full bathrooms, a kitchen, a laundry room, front porch with rockers, and best of all, it's within a block of Archetype Brewing, High 5 Coffee, & Five Points Diner.

The space
Monthly rental! Since the pandemic began, more people are working remotely and wanting to isolate from other people. At Drover's Way you have the best of both worlds (monthly rental now). You can walk up the street to pick up take out food from some of Asheville's best restaurants, and bring it back to enjoy on the porch. Work from home with our high speed wifi (fast enough to support multiple people on Zoom calls), then enjoy cooking in the well equipped kitchen
neighborhood_overview: We are on Broadway St., in the Five Points neighborhood, right next to Downtown Asheville. We love being within walking distance of all the fun things Downtown offers, while having the luxury of free on-site parking and a front porch to relax on. Walk through the Montford neighborhood to see an impressive array of Victorian houses. The Reed Creek Trail is newly developed greenway, which starts just down the block, across from the kitschy and fabulous Five Points Diner. Take that all the way to the Botanical Garden and the UNCA campus, which hosts our favorite Saturday morning farmers market. Enjoy a cocktail that's not too precious or trendy at Little Jumbo, caddy corner from the house. Tell the owners that we sent you! Being a few minutes walk from our small Whole Foods (Greenlife), Trader Joes and Harris Teeter is very convenient as well. As our neighbor Stuart once said, "I can walk right over and get an onion." OK, if that's what you want, Stuart, go for it!
host_about: Lynne and Steve are local business owners working in downtown Asheville. Lynne is a commercial photographer and Steve manages musicians. They both own Music and Art Mgmt., Inc.

Entire home conveniently located about 15-20 minutes to Downtown Asheville and West Asheville bordering a farm. Relax in the hot tub after a long day of exploring Asheville; the Biltmore Estate, the Grove Park Inn, and the Blue Ridge Parkway are all must-visits. Featuring wrap around porches, a fully fenced in back yard, a large back deck for outdoor entertaining, gas grill, an amazing hot tub, high speed internet, smart TV, and luxury memory foam king beds in all the bedrooms.

The space
This home is located 15-20 minutes to downtown and West Asheville. Uber and Lyft are readily available. Enjoy the expansive decks and the large fenced in backyard along with king beds in all the rooms. There are 2 upstairs bedrooms with a shared full bath, a master with bath on the main floor, with an extra half bath in the hall. The basement is finished with a king, queen, and one couch.. The house is at the end of a cul de sac in a fairly quiet neighborhood. We have an outdoo
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in a quiet neighborhood 17 minutes from Downtown Asheville.  Neighbored on one side by a farm, it's a very friendly, safe, and quiet location.  Basketball hoop in the driveway is far enough from the cul-de-sac for safety and peace of mind.
host_about:
Hi fellow travelers!

We are wedding photographers based in Asheville, NC.  Our favorite cities (aside from Asheville, of course) are Galway, Ireland and Bar Harbor, Maine.  
As travelers we tend to wander aimlessly, avoiding the busiest areas and seeking out hidden treasures.  As hosts we love to share our knowledge of the area; especially the amazing food and beautiful spots we have found through our time photographing adventurous elopements.

name: Mayfair Cottage
description:
In Asheville, local is always the way to go! Come explore the personality and charm of Asheville in an authentic, stress-free oasis on the west side of town. Practice your golf swing, or play a game of volleyball in the community park – just a short walk away. With modern flair and vintage 70’s era touches, you’ll be right at home in our cottage; fifteen minutes or less to downtown Asheville, Biltmore Estate, or Blue Ridge Parkway. Close to everything that Asheville has to experience and enjoy!

The space
Recently remodeled and featured as home of the week in the Asheville Citizen Times, the space is fresh and bright with touches of 70's vintage, minus the blue shag carpet. As you come in, you'll find yourself in the shared laundry room (bicyclists can leave their bikes safely here) which opens up to the kitchenette. The large living space is equipped with a dining room table and a sitting area, and the bedroom and the bathroom are to your left. We love our city a
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is full of mid-century ranchers, and we absolutely love our neighbors! We love the history, beauty, and walkability of our community!

name: New Log Cabin, Mountain Views, HotTub, Fire Pit
description:
This beautiful, true-wood log cabin has everything you are looking for when visiting Asheville and the surrounding area. Just 5 miles from the interstate and downtown Asheville, this log cabin is quintessential to anywhere you want to go. Giving you convenience to everything and the comfort and modern amenities with long-range mountain views when you're home.

Complete with outdoor dining table, gas grill, hot tub and fire pit, you are sure to have a wonderful evening outside on the deck.

The space
Please note that the second bedroom is a loft and is open to the main floor. It is not a private bedroom. Please note that we do relocate the cows in the winter from December thru March due to cold weather and freezing water.

Other things to note
Please do not go into the pasture with the cows. They get very excited when someone goes in there, as they think they are going to be fed hay. Please note that we do relocate the cows in the w
neighborhood_overview: The cabin sits just off New Leicester Highway. This property is unique in that, from the cabin looking out, you feel like you are out in the country. Long-range mountain views, beautiful sunsets, a barn, and cows in the pasture, give the feeling of being away from it all even though you are not. The cabin does sit on a hill, about 600 yards off the highway, so some road noise can be heard, however, you are just seconds away from everything. Just beyond the trees is the gas station, and just down the road less than a mile is the grocery store, Walgreens, and some fast food. Better yet, just 5 miles down the road is downtown Asheville and the interstate. Please note that we do relocate the cows in the winter from December thru March due to cold weather and freezing water.
host_about:
My name is Shauna. I have lived in the Asheville area since 2009. I met my husband here and we have been married since 2012. We have 2 children. A 5 year old girl and a 1 year old boy.  

After our first child was born I became a "work from home" mom, and now I oversee our rentals. We started our first rental in December of 2016 and I absolutely fell in love with doing it, so much so, that we started up another rental in March of 2018. I can't put my finger on what exactly I love about it, but I just do. I love the freedom it gives me to be with my kids and handle the "unexpected." I also love that it allows me to be more hands on with guests or handle issues or needs in person vs. over the phone or having someone else do it for me. 

5 things I can't live without.....
coffee
massages
doing anything and everything outdoors
giving my kids kisses and hugs everyday and playing with them
and, yeah....wine and beer

My husband and I are very laid back, fun, outdoorsy people. We love everything outdoors. You name it, we do it. We also love to travel, especial out of the country.
Favorite hobbies include gardening, canning, raising cows, fishing, mountain biking, hiking, and exploring new restaurants.

We are always on the go and it seems like something unexpected always happens or changes our plans, so I would have to say our life motto is, "just roll with the punches and deal with it as best you can." Nothing is perfect and stuff happens. How you handle it determines the end result.

name: Rice Family Cabin
description:
A charming Appalachian cabin built in 1934, lovingly restored in 2018 with modern amenities. Original antique furnishings have been preserved. Conveniently located in East Asheville with nearby Blue Ridge Parkway access. 5 minutes to Mountains-to-Sea trail and Folk Art Center, 10 minutes to downtown. Enclosed back porch and open deck overlook a private meadow surrounded by woods. Perfect for those seeking Asheville's blend of rich history, modern culture, and breathtaking natural beauty!

The space
This cabin was built by a descendant of the first settlers of Buncombe County. This is a uniquely beautiful and historical Appalachian homestead, constructed from hand-cut yellow pine logs that grew on the original land. Many of the furnishings are antique heirlooms. The cabin is all one level and the layout has not changed from the original 1930s-era design. The front and back entrances include short sets of stairs, and there is a keyless entry. Please note that both b
neighborhood_overview: The Riceville community is a growing rural area located along the Blue Ridge Parkway, near Warren Wilson College and the VA Hospital. There is plenty of shopping and dining in East Asheville, and it is only a short drive to downtown. The cabin also offers a serene escape for those hoping for some peace and quiet!
host_about: I'm a lifelong resident of Asheville, and my ancestors have lived here since the 1700s. I enjoy history, genealogy, and gardening. I am pleased to offer an authentic, historical Appalachian family home to guests in the Asheville area. I live near the cabin with my daughter and granddaughter, and they are both available to assist with booking, maintenance and guest inquiries. Please don't hesitate to contact us if you need anything!

Easy walking distance to just about anything downtown. Coffee shops, restaurants, breweries, bars, retail shops, grocery stores, activities, and more within blocks of the front door. Biltmore Estate and access to the Blue Ridge Parkway for hiking trails are within a 15 minute drive.

The space
Get more out of your stay in Asheville with this little home away from home. Enjoy having a full-size kitchen and living room in addition to the bedroom and bathroom in this 600+ SF condo. You won't need to use your car during your stay, though, because you are close enough to walk to just about anywhere you would want

host_about: I grew up in Florida but was fortunate enough to spend every summer in the mountains of Western North Carolina. I enjoy the outdoors, photography, hiking, exploring, playing with plants, as well as traveling to new places to explore new ideas, cultures, and people. I am married to my wonderful husband, and we have a son who is a fun and playful toddler. I am a licensed Realtor and Landscape Architect in the state of North Carolina.

name: Clean & Cozy Cottage-Pet Friendly, 3mi to Biltmore
description:
This cozy, light-filled, guesthouse cottage--just minutes away from everything Asheville has to offer--is all yours during your mountain getaway in Asheville. Less than five miles to downtown, the Biltmore, and the Blue Ridge Parkway, it's convenient and quiet. Whoever you are, you are welcome here!

The space
Our little cottage guesthouse (560sqft) is tucked away in the suburban Oakley neighborhood of Asheville. Custom-built features make this cozy space special and functional. The bottom level is light-filled with a fully-stocked modern kitchen and bar seating. Coffee and tea provided. The loveseat sofa has a pull-out single bed. There is a remodeled bathroom with large, tile shower and a metal spiral staircase that leads to an open-floor loft bedroom with heavenly memory foam, queen-sized mattress. The mattress is firm. Extra blankets and pillows available.

Please note that the spiral staircase is the only way to access the upstairs and you should f
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and most houses on the street were built in the '60s. The highway is nearby so you will be less than 10 minutes to Biltmore Village, downtown Asheville, and the Blue Ridge Parkway! It’s not close enough to downtown to walk to many businesses but there are neighborhood through which you can walk your dogs or exercise.
host_about:
I live in the beautiful smoky mountains of western NC and am happy to wander around these old hills when I'm not traveling. I'm an environmental educator and live for spending time outdoors with my husband and son. I travel a lot for work & pleasure so Air BnB has been great for me. 

As a host, I have taken care to provide the kind of space that makes me feel comfortable. Cleanliness, coziness, convenience, and affordability are my top priorities. My guests’ experience is very important to me. I hope you’ll stay and enjoy everything these majestic mountains have to offer!

We are committed to making your stay with us an enjoyable, safe experience. For that reason, we follow Airbnb’s Enhanced Cleaning Protocol (see above).
We take this very seriously, for your safety, as well as ours.

Our guest suite has been completely updated. New carpet throughout, freshly painted, wall mounted 50” television. Dining table for those times you want to eat in. Electric heater/fireplace console in master bedroom.

The space
The private entrance to the guest suite opens into a large living-room with comfortable seating, 50” TV connected with Hulu Live-TV, trundle bed for guests, and an area that has a small fridge, microwave, coffee pot and essentials, including locally roasted coffee.

Just off the living-room is the master bedroom that has an extremely comfortable king size bed, which is sure to make your stay more relaxing. The closet has extra towels, blankets, hangers, iron/ironing board, and first-aid kit.

T
neighborhood_overview:
We’re in a quiet, country, residential neighborhood, but we are less than 15 minutes from downtown Asheville and the River Arts District.

Warren Wilson College and their hiking trails are less than ten minutes away, as is an entrance to The Blue Ridge Parkway. The towns of Black Mountain and Montreat are 20 minutes away.

We are just two miles down the road from the VA Hospital on Tunnel Rd., a well-known landmark.

We are close to everything this area has to offer!
host_about:
We have lived in Asheville for over ten years and appreciate the beauty of this area. It's one of the nicest and friendliest places we have ever lived! 

We love it here in WNC and know our guests will too!

3 bdr. ranch home, basement to store bicycles, rec room with pool and ping pong table, deck off dining room with grill and picnic table.
3 minutes from the NC Arboretum, Blue Ridge Parkway, and Asheville Outlet Mall, 15 minutes from Biltmore House and downtown Asheville, 30 min. from Pisgah National Forest , biking and hiking trails with over 250 waterfalls.

host_about:
Hi, I am a retired lady, who loves life and is always ready for an adventure. I like the outdoors, whether I am biking, hiking, gardening or just mowing the lawn or cooking a meal on the grill. 
I lead a waterfall hike each week and  love to go to concerts. Whether you like rock music or chamber music , whatever your tastes in music , you can find it in this area. 
I can’t live without books, writing, traveling, eating good food, and spending time with family and friends. I love my home and enjoy sharing it with others.

host_about:
Hi there. I am a lover of the outdoors, that's what brought me and my partner to Asheville. From the rivers to the waterfalls, to the high country's rich ecological diversity there really is so much to explore! In my opinion, it is one of the best places on the east coast to explore the mountains. The Fall here is comparable to New England colors for many years.  
 I have had many great experiences traveling and staying with Airbnb hosts. It has changed my outlook on traveling and where I stay. I enjoy experiencing how different cultures live.
 I worked in fine hotels and resorts for many years and  I enjoy hosting guests and helping them experience their trip to its fullest.

name: Biltmore Village Bungalow -Walkable, Stylish,Local
description:
Little Shady Oak. A Stylish 3 BDR bungalow in the heart of it all. Located just outside historic Biltmore Village. Downtown Asheville is at your fingertips. Dog friendly. Walkable restaurants, breweries, galleries & shops!

30 day Executive Rental.

Set atop a hill and nestled amongst century-old trees sits Little Shady Oak. This newly remodeled bungalow is clean, bright, inviting, and comfortable. Fully furnished and appointed to ensure your utmost comfort, no detail has been overlooked.

The space
Little Shady Oak is a haven for your daily life. Designed to accommodate a working professional or an entire family, this home has everything to meet your needs. Enjoy the warm and contemporary aesthetic that this house boasts. Admire the local/regional art found in each room. Spacious and open one level living, this 3 Bed/ 2 Bath home features:

- A large, updated Kitchen; fully stocked.
- An open floorplan that creates a spacious co
neighborhood_overview: All of Asheville is at your fingertips from this home. Settled in a peaceful gem of a neighborhood, you will be just a walk away from historic Biltmore Village. Little Shady Oak is perfectly located just two streets over from the local restaurants, breweries, galleries, and shops in this historic area of Asheville. Directly down the street from the home, enjoy the hip, new “London Entertainment District”. This neighborhood boasts some of Asheville’s best breweries and distilleries. With our strong “brew culture” comes great live-music and food. Some of the best antique spots in town are located nearby. Take advantage of the close proximity to the Biltmore Estate and enjoy its grounds and trails as an extension of the neighborhood. Biltmore Avenue (just outside the neighborhood) is a straight shot to the epicenter of Downtown Asheville, the trendy South Slope district, and minutes from the Mission Hospital main campus. Shopping is just a stone's throw away in every direction. Easily hop
host_about:
Sisters, Emily and Annie Hammer are California transplants with big hearts for Asheville. Passionate for travel and exploration, Asheville called us both to be part of the eclectic and vibrant tapestry of Western North Carolina. With seven years of “local” between us, we have immersed ourselves in our town and constantly explore this ever-changing canvas that is AVL.  With a longtime dream of working together as small business owners, we combined both our love of nesting (and all things home) and hospitality into a special combination. Thus, our business "Two Hammers" was born. Read more about us on our website (two-hammers) or find us on social media.

About Emily: Emily is a creative type, with a mind for business. When not playing host or designing properties and interiors, she can be found in her art studio dabbling and making art. From paper sculpting, collaging with vintage jewelry, teaching silk painting, block printing and needle felting, she loves to dabble. If not in her art studio, she’s probably dancing at her local dance studio of choice, where she spends way too much of her time. An avid foodie and culture seeker, she is always searching for hidden gems in town and surrounding area. A self-proclaimed history and architecture “nerd”, she is the first person to talk about the Biltmore and other local historical spots. She lives outside of Biltmore Village with her beloved dog, Kaia, and cat, Jezebel.

About Annie: Annie is a natural born helper. She has always had a passion and heart for serving others. That passion has led her down many different paths, whether that's studying social work at Warren Wilson College, doing various volunteer work or, most recently, earning her 200 hour yoga teacher training.  Being in the hospitality industry felt like a natural fit and an extension of her talents. With her added entrepreneurial spirit, mind for business and flare for, running Two Hammers with her sister Emily, is a dream come true. In her free time, you can find Annie taking dance classes, practicing yoga, spoiling her pup Josie and exploring the food scene in Asheville.

name: Spacious West Asheville Apartment
description:
Sweet little oasis of a newer home that is about less than a mile to shopping, restaurants, bars and music, (5 NYC city blocks). You will have your own floor of this home with private entrance, deck, 1 bedroom/ 1 full bathroom, wifi internet and 1 dedicated parking space with additional street parking available.

The space
Brand new 1 bedroom / 1 bathroom private floor all to your self in a custom built home on a dead end street with lovely neighbors. The space is below the main house with its own entrance and outdoor space backing up to a stream (some times only a dry bed, but is a tributary into the French Broad River). On demand water heater (which means you never have to worry about running out of hot water) and separate AC/Heating system for you to control the temperature of your floor as you like. Memory foam queen bed, large walk in closet, bathroom is both a tub and shower, and living room is quite spacious with ample seating and a glass dining room t
neighborhood_overview:
West Asheville is sometimes referred to as the "mecca of originality." It is an eclectic mix of delicious restaurants and bars, unique shopping experiences, music, farmers markets, a tea house and beautiful murals painted on the side of buildings. It is a feast for the eyes and for the belly.

RESTAURANTS: The Admiral, BimBeriBon, Biscuit Head, Buffalo Nickel, Jargon, Lucky Otter, Sunny Point Cafe, Standard Pizza, Kitchen 743 @ Isis Music Hall, Nine Mile, Universal Joint, Biscuit Head, The Get Down, King Daddy's Chicken & Waffle, Oyster Brewery and Restaurant, Pour, Taco Billy, Tastee Diner, Westville Pub, Zia Taqueria, and MANY, MANY MORE!

BREWERIES: Archetype Brewing, The Brew Pump, New Belgium Brewing Company, Oyster House Brewing Company, Upcountry Brewing Company, Urban Orchard Cider House & Bar . . .

COFFEE & TEA: Bean Werks, Battle Cat Coffee House, Dobra Tea, Firestorm Books & Coffee, The Hole, Izzy's, Odd's Cafe, West End Bakery & Cafe . .
host_about:
Traveling for pleasure, for me, is all about getting out of my routine  and exploring a destination, being outdoors, or simply just being in my own space.  I am a horrible tourist!  I would much rather be outside at a cafe observing people in the street than in a museum, and have learned to enjoy spontaneity on vacation or in an experience.  How else do you leave room for some amazing opportunities and perhaps fun stories later down the road?


Although I was raised in the Western North Carolina mountains, I left at a young age never thinking I would come back . . . EVER.  I have lived in many places and have had the privilege of some amazing  travel experiences internationally -  off the gringo path in Peru, living above an artist's gallery in Indonesia, going to school in the Loire Valley in France,  hiking into an active volcano in Nicaragua . . . the privilege was not about the places I stayed, but in the people I encountered who helped ignite my soul in some way or uncover what living is truly about. All of my travels and experiences have brought me back to this mystical and magical mountainous wonderland. And now I wish to share it with you!

name: Downtown Asheville Sunset View - Great Value! -#13
description:
For budget travelers who want to be downtown! Convenient location. No frills and not a fancy B&B. A place with history, character and real people. Clean and comfortable historic 100+year-old rooming house with a front porch, balcony and shared bathrooms. One of several short term rental rooms, this single, second floor room has an air conditioner in the window in summer, includes mini refrigerator, sink, table, chair. High ceiling and wifi. Bathrooms are shared with other guests.

The space
This room is in the back corner of the building, has a single size bed, closet, table and chair.

At the Gray Rock Inn, downtown Asheville is right outside your door, and our reasonable rates mean your money can be spent on enjoying the city. Conveniently located on Biltmore Ave. and an easy walk to breweries, music venues, art galleries, boutiques and restaurants.

The Gray Rock Inn is a great value, a "no frills" but clean and comfy place to explore the c
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is lively and diverse. Walk to world class restaurants, music, and craft breweries. Next door is a community food coop that is open to the public. Across the street are a popular, sometimes quite loud music venue, The Orange Peel, and Wicked Weed Brewery. Read about the Bunkum Stone (a landmark) by the front entry.
host_about: I love to dance, hike, and meet people. I'm a green builder and real estate person, so I like helping with housing and visions for how we can get along better.

name: New one bedroom apt 5 mins from Downtown Asheville
description:
Come be our guest at the Rigsby House! We are conveniently located 3.2 miles from Downtown Asheville. 775 sq feet of living space made comfortable for our guest to enjoy.

The space
This newly built one bedroom and one bath apartment has a fully functioning kitchen that makes extended stays convenient. The apartment is equipped with a full size laundry room for our guest to use at no extra charge.Our guest will have a private entrance with parking only a few feet from the apartment door. There is a gas grill provided for the guest who want to grill out. Unlimited wifi access with password provided. Cable tv is provided with a dvd player.

Guest access
Full access to the apartment.

Other things to note
During your stay at "Rigsby House" you are responsible for cleaning and changing your bedding. We provide the cleaning supplies and extra sheets. We do this to allow cleaning fees to stay low and to give our guest privacy
neighborhood_overview: Located outside the city limits of Asheville in Buncombe County.
host_about: I live on the site so I am conveniently available during your stay. I was born and raised in Asheville. My parents built "Rigsby House"  as our family home when I was a boy. I have lived in this area all my life. Being a successful business owner has given me the flexible to travel many different places in the US. My travels has made me more appreciative of the beautiful landscape  in this area. I believe Asheville to be one of the most versatile place in the US. I'm very thankful to call Asheville home.

name: Central Downtown Luxury Contemporary Residence 201
description:
Queen Bed / 1 Bath / 720 Sq Ft / Sleeps Two

Residence 201 is a modern appointed home that sleeps two. For added convenience and safety, private parking in the building is available.

The residence is furnished in a contemporary style with a kitchen and bath fully-equipped for your personal and entertainment needs.

Feel secure with audio and keyless controlled street access, private basement parking, keyless residence access, and access point security cameras.

The space
The Sinclair offers a choice of three modern design temporary stay residences of luxe quality and taste.

Located in Asheville’s vibrant town center at 59 Broadway, The Sinclair allows convenient access to the many points of interest and entertainment venues for which Asheville is known. Your residence provides the comfort and style you would expect at an exclusive high-end resort. For added convenience and safety, private parking in the building is availa
neighborhood_overview: The residence is located in the heart of the trendy historic central business district, The Sinclair residences allow you to enjoy unique restaurants, visit historic sights, and stroll among entertainment venues and shops all right outside your door. This residence is furnished in a contemporary style with a kitchen and bath fully-equipped for your personal and entertainment needs. Enjoy a fully equipped entertainment center including high-speed Wi-Fi internet, a smart 48″ HD LCD TV in both the living area and bedroom, and a Bluetooth sound system zoned separately for the bedroom and living area.
host_about:
Growing up in the mid-west, the owner eventually moved east to North Carolina where his children were born. Early exposure to the Blue Ridge Mountains and love for cycling eventually drew him to Asheville. The artistic diversity of the community reawakened my interest in architecture and fed a desire to contribute to Asheville's thriving downtown.

The owner purchased this apartment in 2013

Why the owner chose Downtown
After a prolonged search for a downtown property to develop, he had the good fortune to acquire 59 Broadway, an unused warehouse for the previous ten years, in remarkably sound condition and with a good soul. The building was a clean canvas on which to create and provided an opportunity to favorably impact the neighborhood in which it was located. After a year of planning, a project incorporating the interplay of nature, urban, and personal environments, was begun. Completed in December of 2015, The Sinclair was designed and built for generations to come.

What makes this apartment unique
The Sinclair was built with attention to space, lighting, quality, and simplicity. Twelve-foot ceilings, original hardwood flooring, simple layout, and uncluttered space help convey a deep feeling of comfort. Unlike any other historic building in downtown, there are windows all along the northern wall providing an abundance of natural light to the interior space of the residences further enhancing the unique ambiance. Furnishings, although simple, are complete and of high quality including the art on the walls and accessories throughout. Full length window seats allow you to engage the urban environment just outside the window but in the quiet and comfort of the interior accommodations. Entertain in comfort enjoying the structural acoustical integrity enhanced by a quality sound system. Sleep in comfort on a Sealy Posturepedic cushion mattress.

name: Green Retreat Deluxe
description:
The surrounding woodlands are in full regale this time of year
Spring soon will be exiting and the warmth of summer has brought my property into full leaf and bloom, come experience Green Retreat Deluxe, a master bedroom with on suite bathroom with soaking tub & shower. Full use of kitchen, dining room & living room w/flat panel TV along with an outside deck for enjoying the wooded area surrounds. Full and private use of clothing optional hot tub and outdoor hot shower (seasonal).

The space
You have exclusive use of an 1,200 sq. foot space that is home away from home. Your private master bedroom/bath is a spacious +500 sq. ft. The great room has vaulted ceilings and large picture windows look out into the wooded landscape. Full kitchen, dining room and living room with gas fireplace for ambiance or warmth in the cooler months of the year. All the amenities and functionality of any fine home. Washer and dryer just off the kitchen .

Guest acce
neighborhood_overview: Located in a lightly wooded beautifully landscaped area with privacy screening to permit a clothing optional hot tub area, seasonal outdoor shower or sundeck or anywhere within your apartment.
host_about:
My experience in life has been to minister. At first I was studying to be a priest but later realized that comforting people can be done in more ways than from that approach. Meeting, greeting and engaging guests without agenda puts them at ease and when guests arrive with little or few expectations and are open to my quirky approach to life, magic happens. Giving give wide berth for your privacy, but there when social interaction is desired.
I've learned that I can only try and please everyone. That works for 97% of the time. Occasionally guests cannot let go of stress and innate suspicions, and that is baggage that I cannot carry for them. With an open mind and heart you will have on of the best experiences you can at an Airbnb establishment.
I welcome you to my home and my gig! Tom ~~ your host

name: Walking Distance to Downtown Asheville. Clean!
description:
Walking distance to downtown Asheville makes this property a rarity. Separate and private entrance. This 2-bedroom private guest suite is ideal for one or two couples, families, and friend groups of 4. Large rooms with space for lounging and sunset watching after a day on the town. On-site parking. Wifi and smart TV. Visitor Center and trolley located next door! Short walk to Grove Arcade, US Cellular Center, and River Arts District.

The space
With the digital lock system and separate guest entrance, you have the independence to enter and leave as you wish. Your separate guest entrance leads you through our common foyer and upstairs to your completely private 2 bedroom guest suite. Your front bedroom has a queen bed that sits below a beautiful skylight. This bedroom includes a living room area with reclining chairs, a smart TV, a small coffee nook, and plenty of space to spread out and relax. The back bedroom has a stunning west facing view of the Blue Ridge mou
neighborhood_overview: Our home sits beside the beautiful and historic Montford neighborhood and is just blocks away from Downtown Asheville as well as easily accessible to all the River Arts District has to offer (parks, breweries, galleries and more!). We live next to the Asheville Visitor center where you can book tickets to the Biltmore Estate and other local attractions.
host_location: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
host_about:
While these “describe yourself” paragraphs are always awkward, I will do my best.
Marcia and I have been married and living in Black Mountain for the last 37 years. We raised two daughters, both of whom have “flown the nest AND the wallet!” We live on a small farm where we raise llamas, horses, alpacas, dogs, arrogant cat, guinea hens, rainbow trout, and the occasional wild fox, coyote, etc.
My wife is a practicing Veterinarian and I have done small real estate developments for most of my career. I love to read and wish I could write better. I currently spend time volunteering with Big Brothers, Big Sisters and other local environmental concerns.
If you like experiencing nature, you may want to check out our Glamping Decks near Asheville. Quiet places of retreat on a covered deck with impressively massive views, open aired and rustic, yet lights and electricity for any plug in device you might want. Nearby parking and private toilet facilities.
Our places have been described as well located, of good value, and wonderfully unique. Please read our reviews for more information and an honest evaluation of our hosting ethic. We continue to seek improvement in the experience of our quests. 

We look forward to your instant book reservation,  or hearing your inquiry. 
Doug & Marcia

name: Asheville’s home sweet home away from home
description:
This is a beautiful, 720 square feet, new construction, in law suite with a private entrance. It has a full kitchen and bathroom. One driveway parking spot with additional street parking. Come visit Asheville and all it has to offer with the comfort and feel of being right at home!

The space
Located just 2 min off of I40 and 5 min from the historic Biltmore House. 5 min from the incredible blue ridge parkway. 5 min from The Asheville Mall. 8 min from central downtown Asheville and all it has to offer. Including the endless list of locally owned eateries and bistros. 8 min from the Asheville Outlets. Also $12 or less Uber rides will get you to over 50 breweries and tasting rooms.

host_about: We are a fun loving family of four. We have been married for 8 years. This has been a wonderful experience for us, and we are very excited to share part of our home and everything Asheville has to offer.

name: The K House
description:
The house is situated in the Kenilworth neighborhood, convenient to both downtown and the hospital. It is about half a mile to downtown and half a mile to Biltmore village. Local breweries and eateries within walking distance!

This is a private room but you will also have a private bathroom. You will have access to your own personal sitting room where you can watch TV, read or do a.m. yoga!

The space
This is a private room but you will have access to a sitting room. The sitting/ TV room is located right next to the bedroom that will be your personal space. The bathroom, in the main hallway, will also be yours. The house was built in the 1920's and has elegant architectural details, such as built- in box beam celings.

Guest access
You will have an easy self check-in with a lock box and code.

Other things to note
I have a dog, Indie. She is well behaved and very loving. A medium-sized dog, fluffy and cute.
neighborhood_overview: Kenilworth is one of the well-known, nice neighborhoods of Asheville. The house is really accessible, just two quick turns off of Biltmore Avenue. The house is conveniently located near the hospital and great for historic and wonderful  walks in the morning. It is ideally situated  downtown Asheville , Biltmore village, South Slope and the River Arts District( RAD). Uber/Lift fares are very affordable, given the house is just 1/2 mile to a few miles from all of the above locals.
host_about: I have been a resident of Asheville for over 30 years. I was blessed to be able to raise my two children in this beautiful Arts and Crafts bungalow. The kids are gone now and I have decided to open my home and share it with the world.

name: Ammenities Galore/Goats/Close to Asheville
description:
•Private entrance w/deck
•Fire Table
•Fully equipped kitchen
•Washer+dryer, iron w/board
•High speed WiFi (100+ mbps)
•55” HD Smart TV+Roku 4
•Netflix, HBO, Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+, Gaia, Amazon Prime
•Sleep machine
•Bluetooth speaker

•Blueray DVD player+games
Goats
•Webber BBQ Grill (bring charcoal/matches)
•Yoga Matts (2)
•Ice Bucket

The space
Our mission is to exceed expectations of every guest. We want to do everything we can to provide a safe place during Covin-19. Here are the extra things we are doing to ensure a healthy environment. 1)All sheets, towels, and wash cloths will be washed with bleach in addition to washing comforters and blankets in hot water. 2)All counters, sinks, door knobs, light switches, remot
neighborhood_overview: We live in a small, rural and peaceful neighborhood and we are only five miles from very hip West Asheville with nationally acclaimed restaurants as well as coffee shops, bakeries, and quaint shops. Our home is only 15 to 20 minutes (depending on traffic) from downtown Asheville with the Biltmore house, River arts district, shopping, breweries, trolley tours, stand up paddle boarding and tubing! We have included a basket full of brochures but we are happy to share with you all the best of Asheville area while you stay with us.
host_about: We love to travel and experience other cultures and cuisines. We also love being hosts and helping guests have memorable experiences. We  enjoy spending time with family and can frequently be found cooking, talking and laughing in the kitchen and dining area. We are foodies and eat a mostly a plant based diet. We love Asheville for the culture, food and amazing people here and of course the amazing mountains, waterfalls and wildlife that come with it!

name: Walkable Treetops Loft Private Sunny n Super Clean
description:
★ Sleek modern quiet loft that's sunny spacious and comfortable with mountain views!

★ Completely private!

★ One block off Haywood Road in the heart of West Asheville.

★ Walk or bike to restaurants, coffee shops, pubs, live music, and local brewery's like
New Belgium, Archetype, One World, Wedge, Upcountry, Oyster House, & All Sevens's !

★ Just 1 mile to Carrier Park, French Broad River Greenway and River Arts

★ 2.4 mi to Downtown

★ Off-street parking

★ Fire Pit

★ Sorry no pets

The space
We love sharing this bright sunny modern space with visitors like you here in the heart of West Asheville.
** Due to the coronavirus, we’re taking extra care to disinfect frequently touched surfaces between reservations.
It's an awesome location just a few minutes walk from breweries, restaurants, pubs, and live music as well as walking distance to French broad River Gr
neighborhood_overview: Things have really come alive in West Asheville since I bought my home in 2000'. It's been amazing to be a part of my neighborhood and community becoming more diverse and eclectic. Most of the homes in this area like mine date back to the late 1920's.
host_about:
I love to travel and soak up as much local culture as I can wherever I go  so decided to share my home with people like you that share this love. 
  I grew up in Atlanta and discovered Asheville by way of Maui. I'd lived there and on Kauai for a few years and when it came time to move back closer to family a friend suggested Asheville  as an alternative to the big city.  He’d grown up in Chapel Hill and had spent time in Asheville too. 
 So, after enough culture shock back in Atlanta I decided to explore Asheville in the late 90’s. After being here for a week or so wuth my dog Buddy I knew I'd found our new home.  I'd also developed a love of old houses in Atlanta from a early age so I got this 1927 bungalow in 2000. 
In 2006 I decided to create a new space with a view. Only by cleaning my gutters did I notice what a great view to the west there was from a slightly higher perspective. So, I designed and built the “Treetop Loft” and lived up there for many years. I now love sharing this space and the feedback I get.
 I'm a closet artist so you'll see a few of my abstract paintings up there. 
The larger ones are all downstairs so feel free to ask if you have an interest. I’m also avid motorcyclist, lover of the outdoors and great beer so Asheville has been the perfect home ! 

  I do hope you enjoy Asheville as much as I do !

Close to Airport, I-26, Blue Ridge Parkway, WNC Ag Center, hiking/biking, vineyards/breweries, downtown Asheville, Biltmore, and more. Large bedroom (2 beds), large living room with Smart TV, full bath, walk-in closet, entry room with kitchenette (fridge/microwave/coffee pot). Desk and Wi-Fi in case you need to do some work. The space
Perfect landing pad for summers in the mountains, leaf season, quiet getaway, work, events at the Ag Center, or trying to pick out your Blue Ridge Mountain dream home.

All rooms of guest-house.

This is a non-smoking property (inside and out) and, although we love animals, pets are not permitted in this guest house.
neighborhood_overview: This is a very family-friendly neighborhood and great place to be. Courtesy to our neighbors and family is our top priority.
host_about: The mountains of western NC are amazing for hiking, biking, waterfalls, camping, top-notch cuisine, the arts, and so much more. Come visit them soon while staying in our small cottage and you'll see why millions come here every year! As hosts who travel a lot, we are extremely mindful of any space we stay at (from campground sites to 5 star hotels). We observe property rules, leave things as we found them, and pay respect to those around us - and we expect the same from any guests staying at our space. We want you to have the best experience while visiting our mountains, and truly appreciate being a part of your time here.

neighborhood_overview: Just across the French Broad River from downtown, West Asheville (28806) is a mecca for originality, art, breweries, restaurants, coffee shops, shopping, dessert bars, even famous breweries and restaurants.  For the past few years, people have flocked to this funky neighborhood, either to visit or buy a quaint cottage within walking distance of the many new businesses that have opened in the area. name: 80 Lex: Apartment 201 : Exquisite Lodging
description:
This is it.

In a city all about it's micro-neighborhoods, N. Lexington Avenue is The Neighborhood. This is the historic and cultural center of downtown Asheville, once home to farmers and growers and today the heart of all things trendy, artsy and quintessential.

And on hip Lexington Ave., Unit 201 at 80 LEX – a building once the town's feed and seed warehouse, now its hottest address – is THE place: a 1-bedroom, 1-bath apartment that breathes Asheville chic.

The space
ONE KING BEDROOM/ ONE FULL PRIVATE BATH / LARGE SOFA / 639 SQ FT

Over 600 square-feet of industrial loft space, Unit 201 offers vintage furnishings and modern amenities, trendy wallpaper and filament light bulbs, exposed brick and curated artwork – everything you crave from your downtown Asheville experience.

And indeed, downtown Asheville is here, RIGHT here. Walk out your door and you’re on Lexington Avenue, the beating heart of Asheville’s din
neighborhood_overview:
☀☀☀ LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! ☀☀☀
If you’ve ever wandered through downtown Asheville, then you’ve felt the wanderlust (and “wonder-lust)” of N. Lexington Avenue.

This is the most hip and quintessential street in Asheville – a place where restaurants go unadvertised and the best bars have no signs, just a door. This is a place where high-end art galleries abut record shops, upscale shoe stores, and more.

And, while Real Life may be about compromise – sacrifice This to get That – we believe that vacation should be a special time. A time you get both This and That, no compromise required.

80 LEX is your no-compromise-required destination: both urban and urbane, situated right in the beating heart of our vibrant city. Enveloped by the energy and excitement of downtown life, Unit 201 embodies and embraces the Asheville scene – a scene that draws designers and artists, creatives and music lovers, foodies and artisanal beverage aficionados a
host_about:
Growing up Santa Fe, NM I saw a unique blend of artistic community, endless outdoor opportunities, interesting history, beautiful landscapes, and a diverse mix of cultures.

Though far from Santa Fe and a different climate, I arrived in Asheville in the early 90’s to practice Chinese Medicine and felt some of the same elements at play.  Asheville was not well known, but you could feel the energy building and the mixture of art, landscape, environment, history and community all coming together.  It reminded me of my ‘early days’ in Santa Fe.  

One of my closest friends was Andy Brokmeyer, who I told for several years that he needed to come to Asheville, as it was a dynamic and exciting place.  We were also avid kayakers, and Asheville has been a Mecca for kayaking since the early days of the sport so I knew I could lure him out with the promise of all the great rivers in the area. 

He came out ‘for a visit’ and hasn’t left.  That was 16 years ago.  

Asheville has grown into the most happening place in the region, far beyond my expectations, and has sustained an authentic, community oriented and dynamic quality.  Like my dad used to say about few places, it has ‘cultural energy’. 

Though both Andy and I had done some residential real estate investment and development, 80 N Lexington was our first move into the commercial side.  It was an old building, greatly in need of repair, and was a bit removed from the core downtown commercial traffic.  We scraped together what we could and fixed it up, with an eye towards something special in the future. 
 
Now, many years later, North Lexington Ave is hopping, with restaurants, breweries, bars, tea houses, coffee shops, galleries and wonderful, diverse retail shops right out the door.  

And 80 N Lexington has been transformed into a blend of funky, hip, and industrial intertwined with lush, upscale design.  A mix of style and comfort that is unique and authentically Asheville.  

Just like Asheville, there’s nothing quite like it.

name: La Maison du Bonheur: The Peaceful Room
description:
Welcome to my peaceful home on a quiet street located only 7.7 miles from the Asheville Airport (AVL), 2.5 miles to the entrance of The Biltmore Estate, and 5 miles from downtown Asheville. Access to the Mountains-to-Sea Trail is within walking distance with the Blue Ridge Parkway only five minutes away. With Interstate 40 Exit 51 only 1.5 miles away, you will have convenient access to the best of Asheville.
The closest food accommodations are about 1 mile. Car recommended.

The space
The Peaceful Room offers guests a comfortable double size bed, a large closet, air conditioning and a sitting area . If you need a desk for work on your computer, you can have access to the large desk located in the other room.This room receives lovely afternoon light. When you book this room, I will block my other listing so that you have complete privacy.

If traveling with friends or family, The Calm Room with a king size bed is available for booking upon request.
neighborhood_overview:
My home is located in Asheville, North Carolina, United States.
You'll enjoy the best of both worlds here as my peaceful home is set on a quiet private wooded acre yet is only 2 miles drive from Biltmore Village and The Biltmore House & Estate entrance.
host_about: I am a free-spirited, outgoing woman who loves her North Carolina mountain home. Originally from Québec, I've collected and decorated my home with French Canadian art as well as my handcrafted pottery. For over fifteen years, I have worked as a tour guide at The Biltmore House & Estate. I enjoy gardening, walking, bird-watching, being in the outdoors, and spending time with friends and family. I look forward to sharing my knowledge of Asheville with guests from all over the world.

neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet residential neighborhood called Plowing Rock Settlement. It is a mostly owner-occupied community that embraces its privacy while watching out for each other at the same time. I love hearing the myriad of different birds singing during the day, and the chorus of crickets, cicadas, and katydids at night. You'll enjoy fireflies in the summer along with the occasional groundhog, raccoon, and bunny sighting in the yard.
host_about: I am a transplant to Asheville by way of San Francisco and I've been here since 2016. I'm an avid traveler and love to meet others who are out experiencing the world. I love everything Asheville has to offer - great restaurants, live music, outdoor activities, good people, and great weather - and I'm excited to share it with you!

name: 1920's bungalow 2.5 miles to downtown Asheville
description:
2 miles to downtown Asheville, and a stones throw to several breweries and the River Arts District. Beautifully remodeled antique interior with weathered beadboard walls. Fully furnished, and a perfect home base for forays into town or the woods. Dog friendly with fenced yard, with excellent parks and greenways nearby.

The space
Fully remodeled with original 1920’s craftsman details melded with a modern feel. This is one of the quietest, most underrated Burroughs of the downtown vicinity. For example, try our awesome coffee shop High Five Riverside, or the brand new brewery at the end of the block, Riverside Rhapsody. Or hop over to the trails and campus at UNC Asheville for a jog. Use this house as adventure hub for a tube or paddleboard down the French Broad River. Cheap Lyft to anywhere in town.

Guest access
Entire home, yard, and porches. Laundry on site.

Other things to note
Please message for pet inquiries befo
neighborhood_overview: Zillicoah Brewing, Riverside rhapsody brewing, Taqueria Muñoz, Zen tubing, several river access areas, and a short distance to the River Arts district and greenway.
host_about: I grew up in Asheville and have watched the city turn from a quiet mountain town with an abandoned downtown, to the bustling tourist destination it is today.   I am a musician and small business owner, and I have a few rental properties in Asheville to supplement my income.  I take pride in offering a space that has personality, cleanliness, and value.  If I were coming to visit Asheville, I would be thrilled to stay in one of my rentals for all three of these reasons!
