name: Country Chic House with a Hot Tub Near Downtown Asheville
description: Natural light filters through white curtains to illuminate rooms filled with farmhouse comforts. Exposed posts and beams along with rustic accents compliment the relaxed vibe. Modern upgrades include a gourmet kitchen with clever storage solutions.
neighborhood_overview: Very quiet neighborhood less than 10 minutes to downtown Asheville, The Biltmore Estate and Blue Ridge Parkway.  Great house for relaxing but not appropriate for parties.
host_location: Old Fort, North Carolina, United States
host_about:
I am blessed to live in the beautiful mountains of Western North Carolina.  My husband Richard and our children (Barrett -10 and Andrew -21) love to travel.  

We enjoyed staying in Airbnbs so much, we decided to open one of our own in Asheville, close to our home.  The first one led to a second and now a third. Our main focus is to make your stay perfect!  We want our homes to be a relaxing oasis, stocked with all the comforts of home with special touches to make your stay memorable.  Check us out and let us exceed your expectations!  Questions?... just ask.   We respond quickly!

name: Downtown Asheville Condo
description:
Stay right in the heart of downtown. Two master-bedrooms with hotel-quality bedding. Two full baths, all the amenities (fluffy white towels, shampoo, conditioner, hair dryer.) Breakfast, coffee and tea provided. Kitchen. Beautiful, impeccably clean, quiet, comfortable condo has everything you need for a wonderful stay in Asheville. Ideal for two couples, friends, or families. Includes one dedicated parking spot. Walk to everything. The best restaurants, music and more are just outside the door.

The space
There are 2 master bedrooms which are ideally configured on opposite sides of the apartment for privacy. Each bedroom has a queen-size bed, ample closet space with lots of hangers and luggage racks. There are two full bathrooms with showers and tubs.
Bathrooms are stocked with amenities: hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, tissues, etc. Lots of fluffy white towels. Beds are comfortable with hotel-quality bedding, pristine white sheets, thick duvet
neighborhood_overview: Though the condo is right downtown, it is a quiet and peaceful space--a respite from your busy day around Asheville.
host_about: I'm married.  I'm a father.  My wife made this condo beautiful!

name: Country Cottage: Cozy, Clean, Private& Central LOC
description:
Welcome to 7 Oaks Cottage! This renovated 1940's cottage sits on 1 beautiful acre with mature oak and maple trees and 2 covered patios for relaxing. Just minutes from Blue Ridge Parkway, downtown Asheville and many National Forest trails. It is the perfect home base from which to explore All that the Asheville area has to offer. Our cottage is rated 5 stars for cleanliness and we committed to a COVID-19 enhanced cleaning protocol. Families are welcome! Toys & accessories provided as needed.

The space
My husband and I fell in love with this adorable home as soon as we saw it. Something about it was truly charming. After our purchasing the home from the previous owners of over 40 years, my husband began caringly remodeling and has transformed this quaint cottage into an updated abode without sacrificing any of its delightful charm.

There is one large bedroom which has enough space to sit privately and read or stretch out. We have supplied some reading
neighborhood_overview:
Having relocated to Asheville in 2008 we have lived in North, West and for the past several years, East Asheville. We have found by far the traffic flow into and out of Asheville and surrounding area attractions is the easiest from the East. Especially from our Cottage, since the Blue Ridge Parkway is just 1.5 miles away. The Parkway is not only good for hiking and scenic views but also a good shortcut to get to the other side of town!

The Azalea Riceville neighborhood is one of the safest in the Asheville area. It is a mix of new and old houses. A few of our Cottage neighbors have lived here for generations. The large lot (1.06 acres) and the knoll the Cottage sits upon, makes it a pretty private space where you can easily relax, reflect and watch the kids run around "free range" while enjoying the beverage of your choice.
host_about:
I am a bookkeeper by profession, a nature lover at heart, and a proud mother of a 12 yo girl and 5 yo boy.  My husband, Mark, and I love adventuring in nature and trying new things.  Camping is the most frequent way we adventure.  A boat in campsite on lake Jocassee, in South Carolina, is one of our favorite yearly routines. 

When we are not camping, we do utilize Airbnb as guests in other places.  Airbnb has been such a fun part of our travels!  We loved it when we toured Europe last spring.  It is a delight to be welcomed into each unique place we have stayed and to have that instant connection with a local.  

I grew up in Vermont and have spent time living in, what I feel, are some of the most wonderful places in the United States!  Captiva Island, Fl (on a little house boat), Berkley, CA (across the bay from San Francisco), Tassajara Zen center in Carmel Vally, CA,  Santa Fe, NM and Durango, CO.   

When Mark and I began feeling like we wanted to relocate from Colorado, I thought of the Blue Ridge parkway, which has been a very special place for me since hiking the Appalachian trail in 1999.   We flew out to visit, discovered Asheville (a place I did not visit when thru hiking years ago) and fell in love immediately.  

Having relocated to Asheville in 2008.  Mark and I have lived in North, West and for the past several years, East Asheville.  Asheville is a delightful place that offers so much!  We are very happy to be raising our children here and to have this wonderful place to call home.

name: Enchanting Cottage near Downtown Asheville
description: Be immersed in the placid charm of this newly constructed, sun-soaked cottage, with its double height ceiling and back country atmosphere, yet 10 minutes from downtown Asheville and the Biltmore Estate. Sleeps 8 with 2 Queen beds and 4 singles in loft. To address COVID19 concerns, professionally cleaned by a retired nurse using Airbnb's cleaning and disinfecting protocols. We have set up the rental calendar to have at least three days between guests.
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is in the scenic Chunns Cove area set beside a lovely farm. It's a five-minute drive from Ingles supermarket, numerous restaurants, and a large shopping mall. The breweries, shops, and cafes of downtown Asheville are a short drive away.
host_about:
After living in numerous places around the country, we are excited to return to our hometown of Asheville, and to share our family property.  Three of our four grown children live in Asheville, and our daughter, son-in-law and grandson live nearby on part of the eleven acre property.   Our sister (and co-host) Jenny lives in the log cabin on the property.  We like to open up our home to meet new people and let them experience the peacefulness and fun of mountain living.   I am a Financial Advisor with Earth Equity Advisors, headquartered in Asheville.  Our firm provides responsible investing and is a certified B Corporation, seeking to use business as a force for good. My husband Todd is an Anesthesist and works at Mission Hospital in Asheville.  We love to travel, and have been as far as New Zealand and Australia, and to Africa twice.  We are also avid hikers and enjoy the Great Smokies and travel to National Parks in the west. We are on a quest to hike in all the National Parks, and have been to 45 parks so far (out of 59). One of Todd's most exciting hikes was to the top of Half Dome in Yosemite and we just returned from visiting five of the eight National Parks in Alaska in August.

We started as Airbnb hosts at our lake house at Lake Norman six years ago, and have had wonderful guests---the people that stay with us have always been so respectful of our home, and often take great care to leave it in good shape.  When we have had the chance to meet our guests in person, it is such fun to learn about other people's travels and lives.  We are enjoying renting our new guest cottage in Asheville and meeting more great people!

name: Imaginarium
description:
Come, dreamers. Rest from your journey at this luxurious castle in the sky. Slumber beneath the stars... inhabit ethereal beauty apart from the mundane world.

Imaginarium, woven into the fabric of reality by Ashevillian craftspeople inspired by an exclusive EONAHS design, features four rooms – all distinctly different – yet flow together as one.

Located in the best neighborhood and area of Asheville, this private loft is your gateway to unforgettable adventure.

The space
High-style private loft sits atop West Asheville’s historic Tree Tops Estate.

Birthed from the imagination we all seek to preserve, it is only IMAGINARIUM.

Rare is the Asheville Airbnb with 1000 square feet of private living space. Enjoy unmatched privacy and comfort by means of private entrance and private thermostat in a completely isolated private suite.

High-end amenities abound... Talalay latex mattress & organic topper, filtered shower
neighborhood_overview: Safe, quiet, friendly neighborhood. Possibly the best in Asheville.
host_about: My goal is to offer the best Airbnb experience in Asheville. Nothing less will do!

name: Edwin Place
description:
My home is a restored 100 year old house within the city of Asheville, one mile from Rt. 240 & close to downtown. Just a 25 minute walk or a 6 minute ride to the heart of downtown; a ten minute drive to the Biltmore Estate, and one block from the Grove Park Inn golf course.
This is a family oriented neighborhood in a historic district, Grove Park, designed in the early 20th Century.

The space
Traditionally appointed bedroom in back of house overlooking the garden, four-poster double bed (comfortable for 2 guests) with crochet canopy, tiger maple dresser, two tables & two chairs with sufficient space for laptop & in-room coffee & tea service. Period style private bathroom with updated amenities.

Additional space is available for a 3rd and 4th guest(s) in an adjacent bedroom with 2 twin beds a few steps away from the bathroom. For each registered guest using the second bedroom there is an extra guest fee.

Guest access
Tw
neighborhood_overview: Although strictly residential, outside the neighborhood & within walking distance are many amenities, i.e. restaurants, bakeries, ice cream shops & of course Starbucks.
host_about: I am a transplanted New Yorker who fell in love with Asheville during a vacation 20 years ago. Now retired, I can enjoy sharing the Asheville experience with visitors from all over.

name: Downtown Asheville Traveler's Haven-Best Value-#12
description:
For budget travelers who want to be downtown! Convenient location. No frills and not a fancy B&B. A place with history, character and real people. Clean and comfortable historic 100+year-old rooming house with a front porch, balcony and shared bathrooms. One of several short term rental rooms, this single, second floor room has an air conditioner in the window in summer, includes a mini refrigerator, sink, table and chair. High ceiling and wifi. Bathrooms are shared with other guests.

The space
This small room is perfect for the solo traveler, with a twin bed, table and chair, refrigerator and sink. A large window lets in natural light with an excellent morning sunrise.

At the Gray Rock Inn, downtown Asheville is right outside your door, and our reasonable rates mean your money can be spent on enjoying the city. Conveniently located on Biltmore Ave. and an easy walk to breweries, music venues, art galleries, boutiques and restaurants.

The G
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is lively and diverse. Walk to world class restaurants, music, and craft breweries. Next door is a community food coop that is open to the public. Across the street are a popular, sometimes quite loud music venue, The Orange Peel, and Wicked Weed Brewery Read about the Bunkum Stone (a landmark) by the front entry.
host_about: I love to dance, hike, and meet people. I'm a green builder and real estate person, so I like helping with housing and visions for how we can get along better.

Optimal location between popular West Asheville and River Arts District (RAD). There is nowhere else in Asheville we'd rather live! Hip area boasts a plethora of restaurants, shops, live music, galleries, breweries and access to French Broad River Greenway, all within enjoyable walking
neighborhood_overview:
There is nowhere else in Asheville that we would rather live. We are close to everything, yet tucked away in a quiet safe neighborhood.
Fantastic location for you to explore artsy, edgy Asheville!!! Safe, well-maintained neighborhood, located between popular Haywood Rd and River Arts District. West AVL is known for its hip, vintage and laid-back vibe. River Arts District is colorful and the heart of Asheville’s creative spirit.

Hop to Hole for morning donuts, stroll through River Arts District studios, meander to Sunny Point for scratch-made comfort cuisine, wander to New Belgium Brewery for a fun tour & tasting, then strut to Grey Eagle to catch a live show!

Approximately .6 miles to Haywood Rd
Approximately .6 miles to River Arts District (New Belgium Brewery 5 minute walk)
Approximately 1.5 miles to downtown
host_about: Hi! We are an easy-going, silly, adventurous couple, along with our 2 dogs Bear and Irving and cat, Dakota.  We adore living in artsy, edgy vibrant Asheville, surrounded by nature, music, food & beer and extraordinary people.  Our favorite pastimes include hiking, biking, buddhi yoga, bocce in the park, board games at breweries and live music.  We are explorers, and love discovering new places and allowing the unexpected to happen.

name: The Asheville Frog
description: Climb a set of exterior stairs thru your private entrance and enter a bright, airy, modern space with some mid-century charm. You'll be welcomed into the space by beautiful floors made from reclaimed barn wood. The open floor plan includes the living room, kitchen and dining areas. The fully equipped kitchen includes gorgeous quartz counter tops with a large peninsula that serves as a breakfast bar. Spread out on the couch with a good book or catch up on Netflix on the 55” TV. The bedroom has a super comfy queen bed, dresser and large walk-in closet. Pets are welcome with an additional pet fee of $15/pet/night.
neighborhood_overview: The FROG is tucked away in a cozy neighborhood only 1.5 miles north of downtown's famous beer, restaurant and shopping scene.  It's within walking distance to local eateries, one of Asheville's staple breweries, grocery stores, parks, and the university. Feel free to walk dogs along the quiet, eclectic neighborhood streets.
host_about: I’m a CO native, but made Asheville my home 15 years ago. My interests include traveling, photography, ‘90s grunge music (& the flannels I wore in high school), craft beer, and Game of Thrones. I’m an avid mountain biker, who is forced to be an engineer during the day.

Hi!  We’re Margaret and Dan!
We have been married for over 50 years!  We have four grown children.  Our youngest moved to Asheville in 2004.  We live full time in Southern Indiana and are big Indiana University Basketball fans.  We enjoy gardening, swimming, and biking.  We use our vacation rental as a family gathering space while in Asheville.  We hope you enjoy our home in Asheville as much as we do!

name: Explore Breweries, Trails, & Galleries from West Asheville
description:
Enter through sliding glass doors at the garden-level. Inside, discover a cozy living room with TV, updated bathroom, and a bedroom with lots of natural light and views of neighborhood trees. All it's lacking is a full kitchen, which is why it is listed as a private room. With no shared or common spaces, you will find this space a private, relaxing getaway to explore all Asheville has to offer.

*NOTE: It says kitchenette is shared, but it is not shared. The entire space is private. It’s a glitch in the specification of this being a “private room” even though it is its own space.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the hip West Asheville neighborhood. It's minutes to the River Arts District, downtown Asheville, great restaurants, shops, hiking trails, and tons of breweries. It is convenient to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Biltmore Estate.
host_about:
I love to drink tea, eat tacos, look at art, watch documentaries, and talk about life.  I value genuine friendships, fresh food, and bright sun on a cool day. I love to explore new places, swim in the ocean, and have dinner with friends. As a traveler, I have visited much of Western Europe, Norway, the U.S. and Mexico. I love to spend time in a place, rather than breeze through.

I absolutely love hosting my Airbnb apartment and have made a few friends along the way!

name: Laura's Landing
description:
Fabulous location - inside and out - for couples or singles who want a VERY clean space and a private landscaped patio within walking distance to downtown and the South Slope. Laura’s Landing is in a small community next to a wooded area where you’re guaranteed to see a diversity of wildlife - and with luck, the occasional bear! We take pride in providing the best experience for our guests and love to help make your special occasions, truly memorable! Check out the reviews for yourself!

The space
Access your "Homestay" at grade level down the driveway at the back of the main house through your own private, nicely landscaped, patio with a bench and table for relaxing with your morning coffee. There is also a bistro table if you wish to use carry out or delivery.

The bedroom has a spacious feel with 10' ceilings and 2 large windows. It has a queen size bed, a small fridge (no ice maker), microwave, electric tea kettle with an assortment of teas, a Keur
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is a quiet, residential area.
host_about:
Dennis and I are a “young” middle aged couple having the time of our lives living the Asheville experience! 

About 5 years ago, I discovered an old ramshackle, tear down house on this fabulous lot and I knew immediately this place would be my “landing”. Dennis was a bit skeptical about the new construction venture but eventually joined in to help create what has now become our mutual dream home! We knew when we started, we wanted to share it with family and friends (including you) and have made some wonderful lifetime connections as a result.

I’m recently retired and in addition to spending time with family, I love to dance (shag is my favorite), and swim.  

Dennis is a PA at a family practice in Asheville.  His other passions include running, landscaping,  and woodworking. As you pull up the Laura’s Landing pictures, notice the bedroom furniture, vanity, bar area, table and picture frames. His wood shop is upstairs across the driveway and he loves to show it off!

We both enjoy walking around downtown, sampling the local cuisine and listening to live music. There is always something going on in Asheville - 12 months a year!  

If you’re coming to Asheville to celebrate a special occasion, let us know. We can get flowers, chocolates, or any other special touches you’d like to have waiting for you when you arrive.

name: The Bluebird Getaway
description:
Spacious and Serene 3 bedroom house just minutes from downtown AVL. Great location! Large deck off a big kitchen and lush green forest behind. Feels like you are living in the trees! Near end of cul-de-sac so quiet and private, but close to everything. Great city park just down the street with hiking, biking trails, and frisbee golf course. Large master bedroom with ensuite bath and two more bedrooms with a shared bathroom. Plenty of parking!

The space
This home is situated in a perfect location. Just 3 miles to the heart of downtown and easy access to anything and anywhere Asheville has to offer. The bustling River Arts District is only about 1.5 miles away and there are food and music venues even closer, including White Duck Taco, New Belgium Brewery and more! Relax on the large back deck while listening to the birds and nature. There are only trees and greenery to take up the view. Or head to Richmond Hill Park just down the street for some disc golf, or
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is just above the river in the Richmond Hill neighborhood.  Along Riverside Dr there are plenty of entertainment options such as Salvage Station, New Belgium Brewery, Ginger's Revenge and more! The Richmond Hill city park is just up the road and has plenty of trails for running, hiking, biking and also a frisbee gold course. It is a somewhat older neighborhood, as most are in Asheville, and just outside city limits.  There are street lamps lighting the neighborhood at night.
host_about:
I am a jewelry artist here in the River Arts District in Asheville, NC. I can assure you Asheville is a fantastic place to visit and you leave wanting more!  I lived out west for 20 years prior to moving here 6+ years ago.  I am amazed every day at the beauty of the Western North Carolina area, the southern hospitality, and the farm fresh food and craft beers and ciders!

   I love exploring the true character of an area and am always excited to find places to travel that have maintained their own unique character.  I definitely would say I've been off the beaten path just about everywhere I've traveled including Mongolia, Patagonia, Iceland and more!  My blessings are counted everyday knowing that I live in such a special place and it is such a pleasure to be able to offer a space that allows others to experience Asheville to the fullest as well.  
     My husband Brandon and I welcome you to our home just outside downtown Asheville.  The neighborhood is quiet and the location can’t be beat.  Please let us know if you need anything additional to make your stay more pleasant:)

name: 80 LEX : Apartment 202 : Iconic Downtown Location
description:
ONE BEDROOM/ ONE PRIVATE FULL BATHROOM/ 566 SQ FT
They say that wherever you go, there you are.

We say, when you go to Asheville, this is where you want to be. Right here, in the heart of Asheville. Right here, on N. Lexington Ave., in a building once home to farmers and growers and today the heart of all things trendy, artsy and quintessential.

The space
Right here, in Unit 202 at 80 LEX: in an ultra-sleek, über-chic 1-bedroom, 1-bathroom apartment that epitomizes the heart, soul and spirit of trendy Asheville.

Because here, in 566 square-feet of industrial loft space, exposed brick, pops of color, and layered textures, Unit 202 offers an only-in-Asheville kind of retreat: handpicked décor and vintage furnishings, curated artwork and upholstered barn doors.

A home-away-from-home that is both on trend and yet, thoroughly welcoming. A rental above trendy shops and on the same block as Asheville’s hottest restaurants
neighborhood_overview:
☀☀☀ LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! ☀☀☀
If you’ve ever wandered through downtown Asheville, then you’ve felt the wanderlust (and “wonder-lust)” of N. Lexington Avenue.

This is the most hip and quintessential street in Asheville – a place where restaurants go unadvertised and the best bars have no signs, just a door. This is a place where high-end art galleries abut record shops, upscale shoe stores, and more.

And, while Real Life may be about compromise – sacrifice This to get That – we believe that vacation should be a special time. A time you get both This and That, no compromise required.

80 LEX is your no-compromise-required destination: both urban and urbane, situated right in the beating heart of our vibrant city. Enveloped by the energy and excitement of downtown life, Unit 202 embodies and embraces the Asheville scene – a scene that draws designers and artists, creatives and music lovers, foodies and artisanal beverage aficionados a
host_about:
Growing up Santa Fe, NM I saw a unique blend of artistic community, endless outdoor opportunities, interesting history, beautiful landscapes, and a diverse mix of cultures.

Though far from Santa Fe and a different climate, I arrived in Asheville in the early 90’s to practice Chinese Medicine and felt some of the same elements at play.  Asheville was not well known, but you could feel the energy building and the mixture of art, landscape, environment, history and community all coming together.  It reminded me of my ‘early days’ in Santa Fe.  

One of my closest friends was Andy Brokmeyer, who I told for several years that he needed to come to Asheville, as it was a dynamic and exciting place.  We were also avid kayakers, and Asheville has been a Mecca for kayaking since the early days of the sport so I knew I could lure him out with the promise of all the great rivers in the area. 

He came out ‘for a visit’ and hasn’t left.  That was 16 years ago.  

Asheville has grown into the most happening place in the region, far beyond my expectations, and has sustained an authentic, community oriented and dynamic quality.  Like my dad used to say about few places, it has ‘cultural energy’. 

Though both Andy and I had done some residential real estate investment and development, 80 N Lexington was our first move into the commercial side.  It was an old building, greatly in need of repair, and was a bit removed from the core downtown commercial traffic.  We scraped together what we could and fixed it up, with an eye towards something special in the future. 
 
Now, many years later, North Lexington Ave is hopping, with restaurants, breweries, bars, tea houses, coffee shops, galleries and wonderful, diverse retail shops right out the door.  

And 80 N Lexington has been transformed into a blend of funky, hip, and industrial intertwined with lush, upscale design.  A mix of style and comfort that is unique and authentically Asheville.  

Just like Asheville, there’s nothing quite like it.

description:
Honey's Place is a private, modern, garden-level 2 bedroom apartment. Dog-friendly (woof). Conveniently located 5 miles (10-15 mins drive) from Downtown and the River Arts district. Easy access to I-26, UNC-Asheville, and the Biltmore Estate. Clean, quiet, and spacious with a full kitchen. Wake up to complementary coffee and tea. Luxury, hypoallergenic bed linens on all beds and original art on the walls. Stay here to relax, recharge, and explore the winter beauty of Asheville!

The space

We welcome well-behaved dogs (with additional $50 pet fee), but no cats. Note: If you bring your pet, we ask that you do let them up on the sofa or beds.

In addition, the apartment offers self che
neighborhood_overview:
Honey's Place is located in Woodfin, a small residential community resting along the banks of the French Broad River, just 5 miles from Downtown Asheville. Close to several riverside parks it hosts outdoor escapes that include bicycle paths, tubing and whitewater adventures.

Two miles north of the apartment is Reynolds Village, an exciting planned "main street" that welcomes visitors with local restaurants and one-of-a-kind shops.

Access to I-26 is one mile from the apartment which gets you quickly to Downtown, West Asheville or Weaverville. Biltmore Village is just 15 minutes away. Also close by is the picturesque Craven Gap access to the Blue Ridge Parkway (9 miles away off Beaverdam Road).
host_location: Santa Fe, New Mexico, United States
host_about: Born and raised in Woodfin, an Asheville neighborhood, I am an artist, writer, academic, and traveler who is inspired by mountain landscapes. Although I now spend most of my time in Santa Fe, New Mexico, at the foot of the beautiful Sangre de Cristo mountains, Asheville remains a big part of my life. My brother Carter and I renovated what used to be my late Dad's workshop into a comfortable and carefully planned living space. Both of us know a great deal about the Asheville area and we look forward to hosting you at Honey's Place!

name: Tiny Home at the Gardens—Near Center of Asheville
description:
A pocket of peace just outside city limits. Tiny Home sits on hill overlooking two-acre organic farm, sustainable nursery, meadows and surrounding mountains. Feels like you're in the country, yet you're a 10-15 min drive from the eclectic downtown, famous Biltmore, and arts districts. The pine-cedar paneled 8'x24' house is bright and sunny with high ceilings. Full-size bath/tub. Comfy queen-size bed. Full-size mattress in loft. Well-equipped kitchen. Composting toilet. High sanitation standards.

The space
Whether you'd like a unique place to stay while exploring Asheville, or are seeking a therapeutic and educational farm retreat, this place suits all types of needs. While Asheville is well-known for its restaurants (which you should definitely explore), this region also has many exceptional small farms, and you're staying at one of them! (Called M. R. Gardens). We offer the option for guests to purchase a seasonal harvest, which we'll send you information about
neighborhood_overview: We're a friendly neighborhood with lots of walkers. Access to the Mountains to Sea trail off the Blue Ridge Parkway is a five minute drive away. We're in easy driving distance from all that Western North Carolina has to offer—hiking, biking, paddling, zip-lining and other outdoor adventures, not to mention yoga studios, spas and healing arts. Almost all guests love our location because our quaint neighborhood and small farm offer the feel of the country, yet we're just a couple minute drive from stores and breweries, and another 10-15 minutes to downtown and other major attractions. If you're looking for a location in walking distance to bars, or for complete seclusion in the woods,  then you'll likely find other places more suited for your needs than our small urban farm.
host_about:
Most of my time lately is spent running my small farm and edible and native landscaping business. I am a garden coach and  have a sustainable plant nursery with a unique passive solar greenhouse. The two-acre educational farm has organic vegetables; meadows and naturalized landscaping with native and medicinal plants; and forest gardens, which means fruit trees are intertwined with other plants and groundcovers for optimal health. I have on-site classes and tours, and tiny home guests are welcome to take advantage of these opportunities upon advanced notice. I enjoy getting to know people from all walks of life. 

In my 20s, traveling was a big part of my life, and I was lucky to experience a lot of the country and explored a fair amount abroad as well. Australia, Cuba, Puerto Rico and the deserts of Utah (particularly Escalante) are some of my favorite memories. I also lived and worked at an eco-resort in St. John USVI for a half of a year. Now, my vacations are typically for peace and quiet to recover from a busy growing season, but I enjoy hearing about other people's adventures. I love how life has taken me full circle, and now I can help bring to others all that traveling once gave to me.

name: West Asheville Private Studio Apartment
description:
Entire lower level studio apartment with private entrance, off street parking in guest dedicated driveway in an established West Asheville neighborhood. A comfortable, clean, safe place where you can sleep sound and rest easy. Close to many restaurants that charge minimal take out delivery fee.

The space
Premium queen bed mattress with protect-a-bed cover and pillow protectors, dresser, full size mirror, bedside tables, living room recliners, 45 inch flat screen TV with Roku. Bathroom is small but cozy with a standup tiled shower. Your linens include thick Boutique Egyptian Cotton towels and wash clothes, soft 600 thread count sheets and a quilt or comforter.

Plenty of plates, bowls, glasses and flatware in studio kitchenette. Studio has full size fridge / freezer, microwave, large toaster oven, coffee maker, double sink with a disposal.

Studio is 3.6 miles west of downtown Asheville. Bus stop two blocks away serving three different

name: Boho-Chic Apartment One Mile from Downtown Asheville
description:
Follow the Tennessee field stones to happy hour sunsets and mountain views from your private patio, complete with a fire pit for those cool mountain nights. This bohemian haven offers vintage pieces, handmade and artful decor, and a sweet look at local life.


*Please be aware of North Carolina's latest restrictions in response to covid19: the mask mandate, capacity limits, and social distancing have all been lifted as of May 14, 2021. Masks are strongly encouraged in public indoor settings if you are not vaccinated.

*Your hosts and our cleaning team are all fully vaccinated.

*We as hosts assume no responsibility for the impact of business closures on your travel experience.*
neighborhood_overview: The house is perched on a hillside amid wooded backyards and low-traffic streets in a welcoming, safe neighborhood just over a mile from the iconic Grove Park Inn. It's a walk-able one mile or a quick $6 ride share (as available due to covid19) to downtown, and even closer to several neighborhood watering holes, cafes, and restaurants. It's a rare urban gem where guests can walk to eateries yet still hear nothing but birds in the mornings. Come live the local life!
host_about: I am a native North Carolinian, raised in Charlotte and moved to the Appalachian Mountains in 1993.  I have called Asheville home since 2003 and cannot imagine a more perfect place to live.  My husband Benji and I are avid outdoor enthusiasts, always planning our next adventure on the river or in the woods. We are also just as happy tooling around town on our bikes, a favorite activity being tapas-hopping downtown for dinner - ask us about it!  Why choose one restaurant in this foodie heaven when you can sample several in one night??  I have a passion for sharing this quirky little town with others - I am always happy to provide insider recommendations for food, beverage, outdoor adventure, and anything else you may need to know.

Efficiently designed studio space with many architectural details and all original fine art. 16' x 25' (375 sq ft) European aesthetics and compact design with kitchenette as prescribed by code/homestay guidelines. WiFi and Bluetooth speaker provided. No television.

name: Cave Creek Hideaway
description:
Enjoy this private space tucked into the woods of South Asheville, conveniently located to downtown Asheville, Biltmore Estate, Arboretum, Blue Ridge Parkway, WNC Ag Center, Asheville Outlet Mall, hiking trails, and Sierra Nevada Brewing while still allowing you to enjoy a quiet mountain retreat.

The space
We live on two-acres of wooded property set back about a half mile from the main road. The house is three stories, and you will have access to the entire bottom floor. There are three bedrooms available, two smaller dorm sized rooms (one with a queen bed, the other with a full) as well as a larger bedroom with a queen bed. All rooms have barn doors with locks. Each bedroom has a tranquility sound soother machine with various relaxing sounds for better sleep and stress relief, a small room fan and room size heater for your personal comfort. Dressers and closets are available for guests to unpack, and all three bedrooms have fresh bedding changed after each
neighborhood_overview:
Cave Creek Hideaway is located in a wooded residential area on a quiet private road which requires vehicles to respectfully drive slow (20 mph) as there are deer and other wildlife in the area.
The are homes located along the private road and the identifying numbers of the homes is confusing as they are not listed in the proper numerical order that is typical.
Detailed directions will be sent to you as your reservation date nears. It is very important to closely follow the directions so that you can drive directly to our location without confusion.
host_about:
I am a very young at heart, spirited person with 3 children and 4 dogs.
Love living in the Blue Ridge Mountains and enjoy all the adventurous things there are to do in the area.
I love to meet people from all over and learn about their worlds. Very spontaneous, laid back and love an adventure. 
I am very respectful of others. Just my nature.
Motto: Life is an adventure just waiting to happen!

name: Eclectic Industrial Apartment in Historical Building
description: Embrace the unique charm of this boutique space in an iconic red brick property. The loft-inspired private apartment features exposed original walls, dark surfaces, contrasting textures and patterns, an array of unique furnishings, and curated artwork throughout.
neighborhood_overview: The property sits on a quintessential street in Asheville – a place where restaurants go unadvertised and the best bars have no signs; just a door. This is a place where high-end art galleries abut record shops, upscale shoe stores, and more.
host_about:
Growing up Santa Fe, NM I saw a unique blend of artistic community, endless outdoor opportunities, interesting history, beautiful landscapes, and a diverse mix of cultures.

Though far from Santa Fe and a different climate, I arrived in Asheville in the early 90’s to practice Chinese Medicine and felt some of the same elements at play.  Asheville was not well known, but you could feel the energy building and the mixture of art, landscape, environment, history and community all coming together.  It reminded me of my ‘early days’ in Santa Fe.  

One of my closest friends was Andy Brokmeyer, who I told for several years that he needed to come to Asheville, as it was a dynamic and exciting place.  We were also avid kayakers, and Asheville has been a Mecca for kayaking since the early days of the sport so I knew I could lure him out with the promise of all the great rivers in the area. 

He came out ‘for a visit’ and hasn’t left.  That was 16 years ago.  

Asheville has grown into the most happening place in the region, far beyond my expectations, and has sustained an authentic, community oriented and dynamic quality.  Like my dad used to say about few places, it has ‘cultural energy’. 

Though both Andy and I had done some residential real estate investment and development, 80 N Lexington was our first move into the commercial side.  It was an old building, greatly in need of repair, and was a bit removed from the core downtown commercial traffic.  We scraped together what we could and fixed it up, with an eye towards something special in the future. 
 
Now, many years later, North Lexington Ave is hopping, with restaurants, breweries, bars, tea houses, coffee shops, galleries and wonderful, diverse retail shops right out the door.  

And 80 N Lexington has been transformed into a blend of funky, hip, and industrial intertwined with lush, upscale design.  A mix of style and comfort that is unique and authentically Asheville.  

Just like Asheville, there’s nothing quite like it.

name: West Asheville Artist Sanctuary
description:
Charming artist retreat in the heart of West Asheville. A light-filled, uplifting atmosphere with colorful, whimsical decor and an expansive back deck for sunsets and libations. This is the perfect place to relax, recharge and reset. 25 min. walk to Haywood Rd. and West Asheville's restaurants, breweries, stores, and more! 5 minute drive to Downtown Asheville, Biltmore Estate, River Arts District, The Arboretum, farmer's markets, and the French Broad. EZ access to frwys & anywhere in WNC!

The space
French provincial brick, built in 1925, restored in 2015. Lush and beautiful front garden, filled with colorful flowers and indigenous plants. Large back deck with patio furniture and string lights for a peaceful evening under the stars.

Guest access
The guests have access to the entire main house with 3 bedrooms, 2 baths, living room, dining room, sunroom and large outdoor deck.
The basement is Not included.
Because the City of As
neighborhood_overview: Located in the trendy West Asheville; this vibrant urban village features funky bungalows and walkable streets. Haywood Street is home to several music venues, great restaurants, coffee shops, breweries, yoga studies, one of a kind boutiques.
host_about:
Elizabeth ~ I am a yoga/meditation teacher and wellness coach.  I have 12 years experience working in spa hospitality at a high end, luxury resort in Laguna Beach, CA.  I have also traveled to Thailand where I learned Thai massage.  I am happy to offer any and all of those services to my guests upon request.  You may go home feeling relaxed, refreshed, restored and better than Ever!
Nikolas ~ I am a Swedish artist/elf and creator of unique, whimsical art and home accessories; mostly made of wood and painted in bright, happy colors.  My work is available for purchase from my home and onsite workshop.  Perhaps you'd like to take home an original piece of handmade artwork to brighten Your world and to remind you of your trip to beautiful Asheville!

name: **Asheville's Good Vibes Suite** (pet friendly)
description:
Come enjoy some peace and tranquility in our brand-new, open-floorplan, spacious apartment suite!
Interested in breweries? Within three miles, there are dozens of breweries, including our favorites: Wicked Weed & New Belgium!
Other points of interest: it sits four miles to the center of downtown, just over a mile to Crest Pavilion, nine miles to the Biltmore Estate, within ten miles of numerous hiking trails along the Blue Ridge Parkway. Your suite is private and quite but close to so much!

The space
To start off you can put your mind at ease since we have our suite professionally cleaned and sanitized by a local cleaning company that has been in business for over 20 years!
We have been and will continue to follow the guidelines given from the CDC

We just finished building our home and added this lower level one bedroom apartment suite so we could share our tranquil space with those visiting our lovely town. It has an open floorplan.
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located at the end of a small housing development that feels rural but is close to everything. The neighborhood is safe and quiet. You have your own space to sit out by the fire pit(propane) and drink your coffee or cocktails and watch the wildlife(deer, rabbits, chickens, turtles, turkey) so please come relax and enjoy your peace and tranquillity in our wonderful new home!
host_about:
My husband Mark and I have four grown children. Now we are enjoying our time together. 
We absolutely love Asheville! Our little town has so much to offer. We love going to the breweries, floating on the river and hiking the beautiful mountains around us. 
Asheville is a wonderful city to be in with so much to do and I'm sure you'll enjoy it as much as we do!
We are so excited to share our new home with you. It's our work in progress! I hope you enjoy it as much as we are. 
We always try to remember:
“The happiest people don’t have the best of everything, they just make the best of everything!”

Across the street are a popular, sometimes quite loud music venue, The Orange Peel, and Wicked Weed Brewery. Read about the Bunkum Stone (a landmark) by the front entry.
host_about: I love to dance, hike, and meet people. I'm a green builder and real estate person, so I like helping with housing and visions for how we can get along better.

name: Brookeside Cozy Cottage - Near Downtown Asheville
description:
Enjoy your stay at our warm and cozy detached cottage that offers you privacy and is only five minutes to the fun of downtown Asheville, under five minutes to the University of North Carolina Asheville campus, and close to the Biltmore House and Blue Ridge Parkway.

The cottage stands alone along a quaint brook with seating and tables.
Listen to the many sounds of numerous birds!

The space
The cottage offers one bedroom with a queen sized bed, and a living room with a convertible sofa that opens into a full sized bed, sleeping up to four adults total.

There is one full bathroom with shower, and a fully equipped kitchen.

There are TV's in the living room and bedroom with Roku streaming devices. A folding computer desk is available for extra workspace when needed.

The cottage is located just minutes from downtown Asheville, yet feels secluded and private. Uber and Lyft are available in the area and average $8 - $10
neighborhood_overview: Although downtown Asheville is only five minutes from the cozy cottage, we are in a quaint, secluded little valley. It is a peaceful place where you can relax.
host_about:
Hi, my name is Debbie and my husband's name is Ron.
We enjoy being hosts because we love people! My passions are animals and flowers.
I was a pet groomer for  20 years, and have a deep love for animals, nature, beauty, old world things, and my husband Ron!
We will accommodate you to the fullest of our ability.
We are next door for any needs that may arise.
We look forward to meeting you, and welcoming you to our Brookeside Cozy Cottage.

name: The Peaceful East
description:
Your home away from home! Pull into your own private single-car garage and step into a cozy daylight basement apartment that's full of southern charm. This completely private, one-bedroom, one-bathroom apartment features a full kitchen, washer/dryer, and a private outdoor patio that faces a half-acre of wooded area. A peaceful neighborhood only 12 minutes to the heart of downtown, 10 minutes to the Asheville Mall, and about 5 minutes to access the Blue Ridge Parkway. Come on in and stay a while!

The space
When you arrive, you will pull into your own private single-car garage. We provide coded access to the garage so that you can check in at your convenience. The keypad is located on the left inside panel of the garage door. More information about check-in is provided after booking. The garage space is also where the washer/dryer is located.

The door inside the garage walks directly into your living area, which features a small sectional, cozy armchair
neighborhood_overview: Oak Hollow is a quiet residential neighborhood. Friendly neighbors, wooded lots, private but still close to town.
host_about:
Hello! I am Deanna, in my thirties, married to my husband, Josh, and mother to my son, Liam, and English Bulldog, Mojo. We’re all living in Asheville, NC. We LOVE the mountains and all they have to offer - hiking, water sports, and gorgeous views! In addition to being an Airbnb host, I work as a real estate agent, serving Asheville and the surrounding region. My husband is a web designer and owns his own company. He is also a drummer in a local rock/blues band (Mojomatic) and I am a singer/songwriter. So, music is a big part of our lives. I love eating out (how can you not living in Asheville), live music, a good glass of wine, fashion and interior design. 

Our son usually has us up by 6:30-7:00am on most days, and we’re pretty low-key and in bed by 10:00-10:30pm most nights. Hospitality is in my blood, as my mother is quite possibly the best host within 5 counties. I love having people over and making sure they have everything they need. So please, if you need anything, just ask!

name: 3 Mile Cabin - 3 miles to Downtown, Hot Tub, Views
description:
Beautiful, super clean cozy cabin, designed for 2 but can sleep 4 (futon sofa), fully stocked kitchen with gas grill and outdoor fire ring (firewood provided). Beautiful views of the Blue Ridge Mountains and the sheep pasture on our property. Very private, parking, cable, Netflix, Amazon Prime, WiFi, 4 person hot tub. Great home base to explore Asheville, downtown is only 3 miles away, as well as a short distance to the Blue Ridge Parkway (10 miles), Biltmore House (6 miles).

The space
Private, Amish built cabin built on part of our 2.5 acre homestead, our home is located on the other side of the property. Watch sheep graze, rabbits play, and chickens free range in our pasture from the front porch. Beautiful year round views, covered porch, private outdoor seating area with hot tub, 600 feet off the road, very quiet. Cabin is one bedroom, designed for 2, has futon sofa and can sleep 1 or 2 more, it's 400 sq feet inside with 100 sq ft. porch outside.
neighborhood_overview: We have 2.5 acres, the cabin and our home are both located on the property.  It was a dairy farm many years ago, it is in a quiet, semi-rual area, all of our neighbors have between 2-15 acres, it is one of the most peaceful settings 3 miles from downtown Asheville.
host_about: We love to travel, taking motorcycle trips to the many beautiful locations in this part of the country.  We also love hosting, helping others have a great trip and to share our beautiful spot here in Asheville.  Our interests include the outdoors, hiking, cooking, gardening and the farm to table process.

name: Convenience, Charm and Comfort
description:
You'll love my spacious and airy apartment nestled in the historic tree lined Montford District. Delight in eclectic sun filled rooms with old world charm. This one bedroom, fully outfitted, rental has been recently, lovingly, and completely remodeled. You will find yourself wishing you never have to leave...

The space
This bright and homey apartment is in a recently renovated historic building which boasts all the modern conveniences but maintains its 1923 character.
You will enjoy light filled rooms with hardwood floors and a design aesthetic which is both cozy and sophisticated. It is a large one bedroom unit with a fully equipped cooks kitchen, relaxing sun room, and a charming bathroom with large refinished antique tub. Relax in the airy living room, stream your favorite programming, or read a book on the convertible love seat which can become a chaise lounge or single bed. The comfortable large bedroom with queen sized luxury mattress and beddin
neighborhood_overview:
Your new home is perfectly situated in "Montford", a historic tree lined district which is one of the most desirable neighborhoods to live and stay in.Just a half mile from downtown, this is a mature, residential area close to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment and was developed by the architects, engineers and craftspeople who built the "Biltmore". The original brick laid sidewalks are ideal for taking leisurely strolls to admire the architecture, visit with welcoming neighbors, or venture into town. The entire neighborhood boasts large trees and a park every couple of blocks, the closest of which is across the street and has tennis, pickleball, and basketball courts.
Several nearby eateries offer a variety of menus and libations within walking distance.
The whole city, including the River Arts District, downtown, the South Slope, East side, and "West Asheville" are a mere 3-7 minute drive from your accommodations.
host_about: I'm a fairly eclectic and diversified individual who has several interests which span many disciplines including history, travel, Civic altruism, and the Arts. I spent many years in the service industry and understand what it takes to provide an excellent experience for the client. The Golden Rule always applies and it is one I choose to live by, do unto others ....

description:
Welcome to the cozy, hip, rustic restored 1940's "Cabin-Esque" Cabin near the French Broad River. 9 mins to Downtown Asheville & UNCA! 3 bdrms, chefs kitchen & spacious gated deck for relaxing w/ tons of grassy space for your friends, fam, kids & pup! Immaculately clean. A peaceful, semi rural, neighborhood setting in a cool cabin with old school charm. 15 mins to Biltmore & Blue Ridge Parkway. Cable TV, Fire Pit, BBQ, Coffee. Natural cleaning products & locally sourced furniture!

The space
COZY, CLEAN, CABIN. Where modern comforts meet a funky-hip, old cabin. We used as many local furnishings as we could get our hands on! Close to Downtown Asheville, UNCA, The French Broad River, Botanical Gardens, The Biltmore, Hiking, restaurants, breweries - everything you came to Asheville for is minutes away. This is a spacious space, large enough for the family to gather comfortably. Relax around the fire pit with a local beer or glass of wine... or hang out on the deck.
neighborhood_overview: The cabin is located in a safe, friendly neighborhood less than 10 minutes from downtown Asheville and UNCA. The French Broad River and Botanical Gardens are also within reach, as are numerous restaurants, breweries, and hiking trails.
host_about:
Travel is our passion! We enjoy meeting & hosting people from all walks of life. I love hosting and also love when we get to be the lucky guest all over the world!

name: Cozy Comfy Eclectic Home in West Asheville near Downtown
description:
Lean back on a couch in a living room filled with eclectic and vintage accent pieces while listening to vinyl collections. This 1928 house showcases original character such as hardwood floors, staircase, and wood trim. It is a comfortable and homey retreat after exploring the beautiful city of Asheville. It is located in West Asheville and is close to Downtown and to other top destinations such as Biltmore House, Grove Park Inn, River Arts District, and Blue Ridge Parkway.

This listing used to be listed as private bedroom, but beginning 7/20/20 it is rented as ENTIRE SPACE with TWO BEDROOMS and TWO FULL BATHROOMS.  Please note that reviews prior to 7/20 pertain to the one-bedroom listing.

Currently, Airbnb PLUS team is unable to come out to take pictures of the additional bedroom and bathroom and owner is not allowed to upload his own shots. The second bedroom (one that’s not in the pictures) is located on the second floor. It is bigger with queen size gel m
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a friendly neighborhood in West Asheville. It is only 0.8 miles and 4 min drive to the heart of Haywood Rd; and it's only 2.7 miles and 7 min drive ($8 Uber) to Downtown.  Some restaurants, fast foods, and groceries are within walking distance.  Biltmore House, Grove Park Inn, River Arts District, Some Breweries, and Blue Ridge Parkway are close by.
host_about: I'm a down-to-earth person with a good sense of humor.  I always believe that in everything we do, we should do it with kindness and love.

name: South Slope Secret Garden Abode
description: A gravel path lit with string lights and lined by lush bamboo leads to a comfy private room on the edge of South Slope. The room the perfect spot for unwinding after a day of exploring Asheville and the surrounding area. Located on the main floor of a charming 1927 brick home, the room is well styled with an ornately carved and comfortable queen bed and a modern teal velvet sofa. As well, guests will find a private bath featuring a double walk in shower and Turkish robes. A convenience station featuring a minifridge, coffee maker and microwave with included coffee tea and light snacks is also in the suite.
neighborhood_overview: The property is on the edge of the South Slope brewery district and the south edge of downtown, across the street from McCormick field and Memorial field. This area and the south side of town are steep but completely walkable to town and breweries.
host_about: We have been in the area for over 25 years now living just west/ south of Asheville for most of that time.  We have now made Asheville our permanent home with our three kiddos and two sweet dogs.  We LOVE this town passionately with all that it has to offer with its rich history, vibrant art, culinary and beer scenes, outdoor activities, incredible views around every corner and above all, the amazing, WONDERFUL people!

name: Lovely “French Creek Studio” near Biltmore & City
description:
My home is in a wooded older community within The Municipal Golf Course in Asheville. This is a new, small, lovely upscale space recently completed, very private with its own entrance. The feel of the space denotes nature and is done in muted shades of gray, green, and touches of vibrant color. This is a very bright, cheerful, cozy and comfortable space with a large glass door which overlooks the golf course. You may see wild turkeys, squirrels, bears and an occasional coyote.

The space
The space is private, small and cozy with a view of trees & golf course across the street. This is an L shaped room. There is a closet for your clothing & a luggage rack. A large vanity is provided for your sundries.

There is a mini refrigerator, microwave & a Keurig coffee maker for coffee, tea, and hot chocolate. There is a comfortable sofa (not a sofa bed), Wifi & TV with Rocu, Netflix, Prime and Hulu. A portable A/C and two fans are available in the summer
neighborhood_overview:
This is a lovely area with many large trees located within the golf course. It is beautiful and quiet.

There are no sidewalks but very little traffic and most people drive slowly so it is quite safe to walk. Many people walk, jog or walk dogs and babies here.

We are within a few minutes of 2 major freeways, shopping, the Biltmore Estate and the City of Asheville.
host_about:
I am a single female, semi-retired.  I have a grown, married daughter who lives with her husband and my three small grandchildren near Washington DC.
I grew up in Northern California and my daughter and I moved from Southern California to North Carolina in 1995.  I have never regretted the move.  It is beautiful here and I love being in nature and at the same time being in a vibrant, small city.  
In college I majored in interior design and have always loved making a home.  I have worked in a number of professions in my life but the ones that stand out were interior design and cabinet design.    
What I love:  The Lord, my family, nature, design, art, refinishing furniture, gardening, animals, traveling, cooking, and spending time with family and friends.  

I also like to meet new people and I hope I will get to know you a little during your stay.  If you need anything, please don’t hesitate to ask, nothing is too small.

name: Healing & Yoga Home 10min from Dtwn Asheville #2
description:
Treat yourself to a mini vacation at this charming suburban wholistic airbnb. Nestled in the Appalachian Mountains our home is a healing, yoga and artistic space. Located between West Asheville and Candler. Easily accessible to Hwy 40 and Smokey Parkway; only a 10 minute drive to downtown Asheville.

If this room is not available feel free to check my other private room #1
https://abnb.me/lsi1N4LN71

The space
This warm eclectic home embraces a nurturing, natural, cozy environment while discovering yourself in Asheville.

Guest access
Bedroom, front deck, front patio, living room, kitchen and full bath.

Other things to note
Welcome! We can suggest some referrals for a variety of wholistic and healing modalities that the Asheville community offers. Our intention is to provide you with the guidance and encouragement that may support your transition towards a more wholistic
This might be the perfect
neighborhood_overview: Established residential community. Quiet and clean.
host_about:
It is my pleasure to open my humble home to like minded guest who want to experience the magical mountains of Asheville. Being on the path of self realization, I am at my best when I am in connection with Mother Nature. 

I am a certified yoga teacher and love sharing the benefits of the practice with others. Yoga is one of the tools I use in my effort to maintain a healthy lifestyle that incorporates among other things a plant based diet, herbs, regular cleansing and detoxification.  

As an artist and graphic designer, my vision is to communicate respect for our planet, and to recognize the urgency to reconnect harmoniously with nature, through the creation of everyday objects and mandalas with recycled materials.

My first language is Spanish. I enjoy working as an interpreter and translator. I have traveled through out Central and South America. I lived in Australia for a while. My intent is to continue exploring the world and enhancing my connection with the divine. Would love to meet you!

name: Autumn Glow Bungalow - West Asheville
description:
August in Asheville! Enjoy the good life in my beautifully tended, inside and out bungalow. Swing and picnic on the large front porch, lounge in air conditioned comfort, slow down and rest. Work from home. Look for your dream home. Walk just two blocks to vibrant downtown West Asheville's eclectic and popular eateries, breweries, performance halls, boutiques and artists. You'll be just 3 miles from downtown Asheville and Biltmore House and 6 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
NOTE: Ginger Tabbies David Bowie and Led Zeppelin will be home during your stay. They are adorable, affectionate, healthy and playful.

Though located in a highly desirable neighborhood in central West Asheville, this home is cozy, quiet and serene.
Restored to better than original condition, enjoy beautiful hardwood oak flooring throughout plus thoughtful creative accents with a focus on serenity, good humor and what's good for the mind, heart and soul.
Firs
neighborhood_overview:
This West Asheville neighborhood is a wonderful community mix of local and transplant folks of all ages. Many neighbors thrive as entrepreneur artists, healers and gardeners.
The vibrant downtown is two blocks away from my home with over 20 eclectic gastro-pubs, breakfast joints and gourmet destination restaurants.
The Isis Restaurant and Performance Hall offers both excellent food and really good music every night.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Kelly. I've enjoyed living in my 1920's West Asheville bungalow for 20 years. I'm a Kripalu Yoga Teacher and teach full-time from my home studio.

5 Things I Love:
Friendship and laughter
Swinging on my front porch
Tending to my home and gardens
Breathing, Stretching and Contemplation
Long walks in the woods with plenty of fresh air, sunshine and mountaintop vistas
Meaningful conversations
Good coffee, chocolate and cheese!


Favorite Quote:
I am a part of all that I have met;
Yet all experience is an arch wheretho’
Gleams that untravell’d world whose margin fades
Forever and forever when I move. - Tennyson’s Ulysses

Located in South Asheville
- approx. 7 miles south of downtown
- approx. 7 miles north of Airport/Sierra Nevada
This is a very convenient location located about one mile from all the great restaurants and shopping in South Asheville, yet tucked away for some nice privacy on an acre and a half lot providing nice outdoor space to enjoy yourself

One level house 2100 sq ft, 1600 sq ft garage, 1.5 acre lot with large front yard, lots of room for parking, great location within 15 min of everything Asheville has to offer. Two oversized bedrooms accompanied by two normal sized bedrooms and a large living room

name: Close to All The Fun!
description:
Private studio (in-law) space located in N. Asheville (Beaverdam) area available for 30 days or longer (can be month-to-month with 2 months reservation up front). This new studio has all the essentials for a vacation in desirable Asheville, NC. Basic kitchenette includes refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, 2-burner infrared ceramic electric hotplate, full service for 2 with pots and pans, utensils, cups, dinner ware. Bathroom has a large walk in shower and hanging storage for clothes.

The space
Cozy, complete studio apartment in North Asheville, all utilities & WiFi included, AC/heat - 300 sq ft with spacious full bathroom and private entrance from your own patio. Private quiet road with safe off-street parking 20 feet from your entrance. Perfect as temporary lodging for someone moving to the area, or for short-term work assignments, as well as for a weekend to enjoy legendary Asheville! The studio is all one level with the entrance one step up on the outsid
neighborhood_overview:
This quiet neighborhood in N. Asheville is on a "No Outlet" road, no traffic noise, 3.5 miles from downtown Asheville, easy 12 min. drive or a short Uber ride.

Enjoy Beaver Lake, less than 1 mile from my home, a great place to stop and walk or enjoy the bird sanctuary. The Blue Ridge Parkway is close driving distance also. UNCAsheville Botanical Gardens is on the way downtown, and The Grove Park Inn is 4-minute drive through lovely residential streets.
host_about:
Classical Pianist. I perform & teach piano/performance/music theory. 
Creative Choice Lifestyle mentor.

name: Convenient and Cozy Lookout Retreat
description:
We love this beautiful area and are so happy to share it with others!
This cozy retreat is the perfect home base for all of your Asheville adventures! Conveniently located in North Asheville, it’s less than ten minutes from downtown, within walking distance to UNCA and central to many breweries and restaurants. This second floor apartment boasts light filled rooms and a tasteful, calming atmosphere.
All are welcome:)

The space
With only a few houses in near vicinity, your window view overlooks pleasing perennial pollinator gardens and our ever-expanding organic vegetable beds. Like to exercise? Take a walk up the road to the UNCA observatory to witness one of the best views of downtown Asheville and the surrounding mountains.

This space includes a large bedroom with closet, small dining room with kitchenette, living room with TV, central AC/heat and bathroom. While we do live below the unit, there are no shared spaces and two doors
neighborhood_overview: This home is located in North Asheville, a calm and cozy area that feels tucked away but is incredibly close to anything you need. In fact, the vast majority of our favorite places in Asheville are within a ten minute drive!
host_about:
Hi! I'm Michelle. I moved to Asheville seven years ago and immediately fell in love with these mountains. There are an endless amount of new things to explore here! I love to grab a cup of tea at the local tea house and go to dance classes downtown!
We hope to host you at one of our cozy Airbnbs soon!

name: RAD house
description:
Our home in the River Arts District is centrally located! We are a short downhill stroll to the artist shops and restaurants of the RAD and about a 10 minute walk to downtown/ south slope. Great hiking, the Biltmore , and Mission Hospital are only a few minutes drive. The spacious open floor layout of our home invites the gathering of friends and family. Off street parking, a fully equipped kitchen, and laundry available. Pets are negotiable. Please ask before booking about bringing your pet

The space
2 bedroom, 2.5 bath home. Hardwood and tile throughout the home. Three large porches to relax on with a cup of coffee in the morning or a glass of wine in the evening as you watch the sunset. We have a small garden guest are welcome to pick from when the season allows, and a chicken coop with 6 chickens who should start laying fresh eggs for us to share with you soon. Off street parking is available, and guest are encouraged to use it instead of street parking.
neighborhood_overview:
The River Arts District, or RAD, is a centrally located neighborhood nestled between downtown, West Asheville, and the South slope. The RAD has a host of great restaurants, breweries, shops,and music venues that are all walking distance from our home. Some of these business include Penny Cup coffee, The Wedge brewery, Bull & Beggar, Sunnyside Trading Co, North Carolina Glass center, Grey Eagle, White Duck Taco, New Belgium brewery, and Zen Tubing.
Though our neighborhood is close to everything, the street we live on is residential and quiet. The RAD/ South French broad neighborhoods are a great place to walk around and shop or look at some of the beautifully restored Victorian and Queen Anne style homes.
host_about:
My partner, Kevin, and I are avid Airbnb host and guest.  We love traveling and sharing our home in Asheville, NC with other travelers.  Through our adventures we have discovered just how beautiful this tiny little planet is.  We do our best to keep it that way.  We use all natural and homemade cleaning supplies, recycle, up-cycle, compost, grow our own, and share :) 
We have two big old dogs who have traveled almost everywhere with us.  They are respectful, calm, and adorable.
We are also interested in home swapping.

name: Bright, cozy Asheville suite w/ private entrance
description:
We're in a residential neighborhood less than 10 minutes to Biltmore Village, Downtown, and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Enjoy a comfortable suite with all the basics to make your Asheville stay feel like home! You'll have a private entrance on the first floor, your own bathroom with spacious shower, a desk for working, a cozy reading corner, queen size bed with memory foam topper, and closet to tuck away belongings. We have maps and hiking guides available for you to borrow on your next adventure!

The space
You'll be residing in a first-floor suite with a private entrance. Your room is within our home but does not have contact with other spaces. We provide tea and coffee, towels, and linens. There is a small backyard you’re welcome to hang out in! Our space has been fully inspected and permitted by the city for your safety.

Distances for points of interest (low traffic, driving):
Biltmore Village: 2 miles (7 minutes)
Biltmore Estate 2.9 miles
neighborhood_overview:
Oakley is a friendly, residential neighborhood with easy access to Biltmore Village, the Blue Ridge Parkway, downtown Asheville, and more!

Grove Arcade: 5.6 miles (9 mile
host_about: My husband Mark and I travel together, we are both working artists with backgrounds in sculpture and illustration.  We enjoy hiking, tea, and being in the mountains. As hosts, we're happy to recommend our favorite hikes and places to eat in Asheville! Mark has a woodworking shop in the River Arts District and I (Jacqueline) work out of a home studio doing painting and illustration.

name: All Things Bright & Beautiful Apt  (Newly Built)
description:
A private entrance and space is a perfect place for you to social distance. Enjoy fresh air on our private balcony.
Our cleaning crew is taking extra steps to sanitize in between guests, above and beyond our normal high standards of cleaning.

Location: east side of W. Asheville, overlooking the River and River Arts District.
1.5 miles to downtown Asheville and downtown West Asheville.
3 minute walk to New Belgium
5 minute walk to the Greenway
Bike and run on the beautiful new Greenway.

The space
Our nearly 1,000 sq. ft. apartment has recently been completed and ready for your stay. With two large skylights and big windows the apartment is bright and cheery. Open the windows and enjoy the breeze coming up the hill off the river.

***A remote workers dream with fast reliable WiFi. We opted for a drop leaf dining table that can transition into a work station.***

Enjoy your morning coffee on the balcon
neighborhood_overview:
Located in a quiet residential neighborhood, with really nice neighbors.

Asheville is booming new houses are being added to every free space all over Asheville. Please note we cannot control any construction projects off of our property.
host_about: We live in and love Asheville, NC.  We enjoy traveling as much as we enjoy hosting.

name: Hummingbird Garden Bungalow 1BR - walk to downtown
description:
Our 1BR bungalow apartment is in a charming historic neighborhood 4 easy walking-blocks from Asheville’s vibrant downtown, as well as an easy walk to Whole Foods, Trader Joes, Asheville Yoga Center, and many restaurants. We invite you to experience the beauty and tranquility of the bungalow and gardens coupled with the great location.

Always feel free to inquire about date flexibility if you don't see your exact dates open.

The space
Surrounded by lush cottage-style gardens and framed by a backyard creek, our garden home offers a unique urban retreat experience. In this magical oasis, you will inhabit a private arboretum just 4 walkable blocks from the vibrant restaurants, shops, galleries, music venues, and street performers in downtown Asheville.

The cozy bungalow apartment is perfect for 1-2 people. It's about 650 square feet in an updated, 1926-built house. Lots of natural light streams through the many windows throughout. The open flow
neighborhood_overview:
Sweet little one-block street in the safe historic Montford neighborhood. Talk a walk down tree-lined streets to admire the historic homes. 4-block walk to downtown. Reed Creek Greenway to the Botanical Gardens.

Also within blocks of High Five Coffee, Archetype Brewing, Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Harris Teeter, Asheville Yoga Center, Liberty House Cafe, Elements Juice Bar, and much more.
host_about: I've lived in Asheville for over 20 years and love it! I enjoy walking and riding my bike around town. Five things I can't live without... mountain vistas, lake floats, yoga, refreshing local kombucha, and blooming flowers! Welcome!

name: Asheville Quiet Serenity Super Convenient Location
description:
CV-19 Update:  This condo is attached but separate from the main house. You will not have to be in contact with anyone. It even has it's own separate heating and a/c unit and although it adjoins the main house, it is not inside it. Super clean.

The space
This is a beautiful, new private suite with your own entry, large private bath, bedroom. Super cozy, comfortable and quiet. It is basically a separate condo, attached to the house. It is completely private with your own keyed entrance, private bath with large step-in shower, breakfast nook area and cable TV. Our location is very unique. It is not walking distance to downtown Asheville, but there is no congestion, traffic and noise etc either and it is a short Uber ride to town. ($6-11) Here, you will only be minutes away from all the "action" as well as restaurants, movies and shopping.

Please note, no smoking is allowed on premises.
Also note that although there are some kitchen amenities
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is comprised of nice ranch homes. It is next to the last on a cul-de-sac so it is very quiet with mainly only neighborhood traffic. We have great neighbors and have occasional neighborhood cookouts and things like that.
host_about:
I have lived in Asheville since the 90's. I have a special  home in beautiful Asheville. I originally built this guest suite as a space for my mother to live in and  I put my heart and soul into it and you can tell when you walk into it.  I take great pride in the space and the home in particular. Being a native to North Carolina and having lived mostly in the mountains for many years, I am pleased to have such a nice space to share.  

I love hiking these beautiful trails and forests. I like to mountain bike and take a dip in the mountain stream every now and the. Sometimes I play golf. I guess you can call it that. I'm not very good.  Photography is one of my serious hobbies and you may find some of my photos on the walls of the suite from time to time. 

Hosting? I am pretty much hands off. I will make sure you get settled, see if you have any questions and help with local lore and resources as much as possible. Maybe we  can even go for a guided hike if you like. Once you get settled, you will have your own dedicated space so you will only see me if I am working in the yard or coming and going in the car. But, you can always reach me if anything comes up.

name: East Asheville, HotTub, Views,  Fire Pit, Parkway
description:
Close to everything Asheville - restaurants in walking distance, near the parkway for biking, hiking, minutes to Biltmore House, Grove Park, downtown. The apartment has beautiful views, hot tub, and firepit. This over garage apartment is new construction, laid out spaciously and is absolutely beautiful. The deck views is where you will want to spend your evenings for sure! Asheville has so much to do so we hope you will enjoy your time out and about and coming back for a relaxing evening.

The space
This apartment is styled very modern. It is very stylish but is quickly converted to extra sleeping space. There is a full kitchen to cook meals and washer/dryer to do laundry if needed. There is a full bathroom with shower and tub. Dog friendly (no cats). Private entrance to your own deck with hot tub and firepit and beautiful views. Our cleaning specialist has cleaned all the details of your apartment thoroughly. We use air purifiers with uv lights, ozon
neighborhood_overview: The views from your deck are amazing!  When the colors change you will enjoy them even more, especially while sitting in the hot tub or by the fire.  There is a large umbrella to provide nice shade.  It is close to everything you want to do in Asheville.
host_about: Hi!  We are Michael & Kerrie, and we have lived in Asheville almost 20 years.  He is a firefighter and I'm a computer geek.  We enjoy camping, concerts, and fun food like burgers and pizza.  His hobbies are riding his vintage dirt bike or his Harley.  Mine is gardening.  We love traveling and staying in airbnbs, having the place to ourselves.   We are looking forward to your visit and hope you enjoy the beautiful views while relaxing by the fire.

name: Downtown in a Flash. Relax with Your Family
description:
We love Asheville. We’d love for everyone to soak in the mountains, enjoy the dining, hiking, and wonderful city we call home. The 1400 square foot, newly renovated house is an easy 8 minute drive to the heart of downtown. We welcome families with small children and groups to relax, celebrate, and unwind in a truly special place.
This home features an open floor plan-your entire group can enjoy each other’s company while cooking, dining, and lounging. A hallway delivers you to the bedrooms and front bath. The master, en suite, and access to covered deck are at the end of the hallway.
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in Woodfin, a small community nestled along the banks of the ancient French Broad River. The home sits on a quiet street with a fabulous playground less than half a mile away.
host_about: Hi! We’re Matt and Katie. We have lived in Asheville since 1995 and 2005 respectively. Matt is a woodworker and Katie works at a local brewery. Together we are raising our two rascally boys in these beautiful mountains. We are thrilled at the opportunity to host folks in this wonderful place we call home.
