name: No Bad Stays (30 Night Minimum)
description:
This stand-alone dreamy bungalow is tucked in the trees, full of warm vibes, and ready to make your staycation or work trip cozy and fun. The home is on my property but is a separate home not attached. Use me as your Realtor during your stay and get a discount + you'll have the flexibility to move when you close and not pay for any extra days booked.

The space
This space is designed for longer-term stays as it has a huge walk-in closet, dresser, and full kitchen.

Guest access
1 Bedroom Garage Apartment + Large Deck
Below Studio and Washroom
Backyard
1 Off-Street Parking Space

Other things to note
Under the terms of this agreement:

Tenant agrees to pay for any damages.
neighborhood_overview: My house is located in one of Asheville’s most popular neighborhoods close to great coffee, breweries, restaurants, boutiques, music venues,  river activities, hike and bike trails, and more!
host_about: Asheville Realtor and mountain biker originally from Austin, TX.  I grew up riding skateboards and playing in bands. I studied Sociology at San Diego State University, then moved up to Los Angeles where I worked at Jimmy Kimmel Live and at a boutique music PR firm. I continued working in PR and Event Production for the following 10 years.  I decided to sell my house in Austin and relocate to Asheville to be closer to the mountains, cooler weather, and epic hikes. I'm a Realtor, interior stylist, and designer, hiker, climber, motorcyclist, and mountain biker. I love vintage motorcycles, coffee, waterfalls, and I am Vegan. I'm 45 but feel like I am 35 so that makes me 35 right?   I love my home and have enjoyed hosting through Airbnb for over 11 years and I'm proud to be a Superhost! Use me as your Realtor and get a discount + moveout early with no penalty. Come enjoy the warm vibes of my home and leave some of your own!

name: The Patton Mtn Retreat. Near Grove Park & Biltmore
description:
WE HAVE ADDED CENTRAL AIR THROUGH OUT

This 3 bedroom, 4 bed, 2 bathroom house sits atop Town Mountain in between the Grove Park Inn and Downtown Asheville. It can easily sleep 4 adults and 2 children.

Its private, quiet, and nestled in the woods with views of nearby mountain ranges.

The house is naturally cooler than surrounding Asheville because its elevation is so much higher. It has a gas log fireplace in the living room and a wrap around porch.

Other things to note
The TV in the living room is connected to roku which allows you to access Amazon, Netflix, Hulu, etc. but must have your own login. No cable TV provided.
neighborhood_overview: Outdoor setting, with lots of wildlife, hiking, and biking right out the front door!
host_about: College Footbal Fan, Outdoor Enthusiast, Love The Beach and The Mountains, Live Sporting Events, Food, Music.

name: Affordable and Spacious Basement Suite
description:
Hi friends! Welcome to our mountain home!

Cozy, clean & spacious downstairs basement suite of a single family home in South Asheville with private entrance, bathroom, laundry, bedroom, and backyard.

The space
Our basement suite has been carefully designed to include all you could need during your Asheville stay. Guests are able to enjoy full privacy in their fenced in backyard area. Kitchenette includes fridge, coffee maker, microwave, and toaster oven. Suite included personal washing machine & dryer, utility sink, bath towels, fresh linens, and organic shampoo, conditioner & shower gel in bathroom.

Our goal is to provide an affordable and very comfortable experience for all of our guests.

Private backyard for guests is provided. Your pets are welcome to enjoy their personal backyard space during your stay.

Guest access
Private entrance is located left of garage. Parking space accommodates one vehicle. Woo
neighborhood_overview:
We live in the lovely neighborhood of Royal Pines. Our house is nestled among the trees on a quiet street. We are a 2 minute drive from the Collier Cove Nature Preserve. We highly recommend taking a trip up the road to enjoy the trails.

17 minutes to downtown Asheville, 10 minutes to AVL airport, 10 minutes to blue ridge parkway, 15 minutes to the Biltmore Estate, and 15 minutes to Sierra Nevada Brewing.

2 min drive to Bee Hive Coffee Bar and Rocky's Chicken Shack!
host_about: I am a pediatric speech language pathologist living in Asheville with my husband and big black dog! My husband and I are Asheville natives. We love hiking around our local area, visiting the breweries, and taking our dog on explorations around WNC.

name: Isolate and Rejuvenate in the Forest at Sleepy Gap Cottage
description: Nourish mind, body, and soul on a meditation platform beneath the tree canopy. Play guitar in a daybed nook, gazing over a private forest. Organic, white interiors showcase exposed beams, wood-framed windows, natural floors, and rustic accents. Start to unwind as you drive up the gravel road lined with trees (you will want a 4 WD vehicle for the easiest access) and see the cottage at the top of the hill. Relax, de-stress and connect with nature knowing that we take cleaning during this time of Covid-19 extremely seriously. We are leaving a day between bookings currently to assure safety.
neighborhood_overview: In the middle of 4 acres of woods, the home borders the Blue Ridge Parkway National Forest, so you can hike up to the Blue Ridge Parkway from right outside. Asheville is a 20-minute drive. If you book in the winter, know that in the occasional winter storms we get, our driveway would not be cleared. You would have to park by the mailbox and walk up the long gravel driveway through snow to get to the house 2/10th of a mile up. Power outages occur during storms as well but we do have a gas heater
host_about: Lynne and Steve are local business owners working in downtown Asheville. Lynne is a commercial photographer and Steve manages musicians. They both own Music and Art Mgmt., Inc.

name: Upstream Bohemian, Modern Design, Hot Tub, Mountain Views
description: Melt away stress with the calming jets of the rooftop hot tub atop this modern architectural home. This eco-friendly residence features natural wood and stone finishes throughout, contrasting textures and patterns, and an outdoor dining space. The natural light lends a spotlight to the bohemian decor and relaxed mountain vibe. No parties or events.
neighborhood_overview: The home is close to everything Asheville has to offer. This house is directly across from the French Broad River, Carrier Park, bike paths, the green way and a boat ramp. There are also outdoor activities just next door at Climbmax.
host_about:
I apologize for the strange photographs we have on our Plus listings.  We have no control over how they photograph our houses or how the pictures are displayed.   To solve the problem we had to build our own website...

You can search for us with the term “Upstream Way” and find some much better photographs and videos.   We also have lots of information on Asheville and travel tips for your visit.   Hope you can check it out.   We should be the first result if you search for “Upstream Way”.   I am also happy to answer any questions if you call or text (Eight 2 8) seven 7 eight-O 4 one 3.   

Tomorrow we have a group of photographers coming up from Charlotte to do more video tours.   That will be online as soon as we edit.   It seems like there are so many houses on AirBnB that people have difficulty figuring out which properties are good to visit and which are hiding behind trick photography.   It takes a lot of time and energy to find the good ones and hopefully our new website will help.

A few random thoughts as 2019 is winding down.  We have a few quiet weeks before the holiday and I have been thinking about the many guests who joined us this year.

Our specialty is large groups who want to spend time together In Asheville with all the comforts of home.   Bachelorette’s and Wedding Parties are probably the top occasions.   We also get to meet quite a few corporate executives who visit for team building.   All in all this has been a great year and I look forward to meeting your group, should you find yourself headed this way.

New thought:  Today is Friday January 11th, 2019. It is an otherwise typical, winter day here in the beautiful mountains of Asheville, NC. I have my usual work, building homes and raising a family. Something came to me this morning that I can’t help but mention.

For the past few months I knew it was coming. More on this later. First, some of the backstory...

My family travels occasionally and when we do, we tend todo so in a large group. We always book with Airbnb and invite our friends and family to join us.

A few years ago we rented a very cool, mid-century modern pool home in Fort Lauderdale. The place was decorated on the minimal side and was totally spotless. There was a lot of room for our friends and family and we had an amazing trip.

After that, I could not stop thinking about how to recreate the experience as a host in Asheville.  

I decided to stop building houses for sale and started designing them to keep.   

Now, life revolves around hosting our guests each week on a new street full of custom vacation rentals called Upstream Way.   

The properties are perched above the river and are close to downtown. The houses are all 4 stories tall and provide amazing panoramic views. Each floor has multiple master bedrooms and private baths. Lots of balconies and outdoor space. The furniture and finishes are right out of a magazine.

The first three available are Upstream Bohemian (sleeps 14-16) and the Upstream Penthouse (sleeps 16-18). I just finished The Upstream Bachelorette and we already have multiple bookings lined up! We are now breaking ground on a new custom home at 34 Upstream. We also have a retreat center in the works! 

In my quest to recreate our favorite Airbnb moments, I try very hard to make your visit special. If you have any requests to best prepare your house for arrival, please let me know.   

You can depend on me 100% during your stay. If anything comes up you can call me or text 24/7. You will never get an answering service or a stranger.

name: Orion Sky, "a little country in the city"
description:
Beautifully renovated for relaxing between adventures, this studio apartment with its own private entrance is just minutes away from downtown Asheville and from the up-and-coming downtown West Asheville.

The space
At Orion Sky, we care about our guests. Your safety, and ours, are the most important thing to us. We follow a cleaning and sterilizing protocol that is even more astringent than Airbnb’s protocol.
*This apartment does not allow pets nor children. (The hosts own one small dog that is unfriendly to children and other animals. He is kept in a separate area and is not allowed in Orion Sky.)

Now, about the apartment!
We lovingly renovated our studio apartment to give you the perfect place to land and truly enjoy your time here.
With its own private entrance, this studio apartment is yours to relax in and enjoy while you take advantage of all Asheville has to offer.
Your hosts live in the main house and are avail
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is a suburban/country neighborhood, yet only minutes away by car from Starbucks and great restaurants of all kinds. There are many areas to walk in within 5 minutes by car. The River Arts District is close by and has many artisan studios to visit and walk around.
Asheville is known for its restaurants and boutique breweries, and it is fun to pick several in the same area and make a walking tour.
host_about:
My husband, Max and I moved to Asheville, NC, in 2001 and love living here! I was raised in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico, where my father taught photography and journalism at the Instituto Allende. I still have the home there in which I grew up!
I moved to Sausalito, California where I became a Strategy Implementation Consultant. As a bilingual and bicultural person, I was able to work  in 11 countries in Western Europe, South America, and North America. It was a great life, and I met wonderful people from all over the world.    I am also a song-writer and an author, and love music of all kinds from all parts of the world.
     Max was born in L.A., "grew up" in Berkeley, taught high school for many years and then went into the building trades for another lifetime. 
     In 2001, my husband and I moved to Asheville, NC, and we love it! Being in the mountains, in a glorious little town is perfect for us in our retirement phase of life, or our "repurposed" phase, as my husband likes to say.   
     We have two small dogs (a chihuahua mix and a mountain feist, both under 16 pounds). 
     We live on two acres, surrounded by wonderful, local neighbors that we are blessed to have around us.  
     We are foodies, love to cook and love to eat out, and can recommend lots of restaurants, though it's hard to keep up as a new and great one seems toped up every week here!
     We're easy going, like hosting friends, family and our AirBnB guests. Kelle was in the hotel and restaurant business decades ago, and this is a gentle step back into something she found much fun to pursue. 

Life is good, and we would  love to share it with you.

description:
Experience the convenience of this private, modern, cozy in-law apt. (260sqft) with a private deck, entrance, and outdoor garden nook nestled amongst large trees in the heart of beautiful Asheville, NC. Parking in the city can be tough, stay here and you can walk to it all downtown! Iconic Pack Square, French Broad Chocolate Lounge amongst many other breweries, restaurants, and coffee houses (5-10 min. walk). Private, modern space attached to the home with lots of amenities. Private parking

The space
--WALK TO THE HEART OF DOWNTOWN IN 5-10 MINUTES
--YOUR COZY AIRBNB STUDIO APT. (260 Sqft.) IS PRIVATE AND ATTACHED TO THE HOUSE, NOT SEPERATE
--PRIVATE PARKING, ENTRANCE, OUTDOOR PORCH AND LOUNGE AREA, AND AIRBNB
—Watch the sunset with a beverage of choice and relax on your private patio
--Quiet and Private Residential Neighborhood.
--Sleep on a Queen size Deluxe Foam Mattress.
--Stock coffee or tea, heat up leftovers, or chill a be
neighborhood_overview:
-Quiet and Friendly
-Great for the convenience of walking downtown
-Safe and well-lit
host_about:
Hi there. I am a lover of the outdoors, that's what brought me and my partner to Asheville. From the rivers to the waterfalls, to the high country's rich ecological diversity there really is so much to explore! In my opinion, it is one of the best places on the east coast to explore the mountains. The Fall here is comparable to New England colors for many years.  
 I have had many great experiences traveling and staying with Airbnb hosts. It has changed my outlook on traveling and where I stay. I enjoy experiencing how different cultures live.
 I worked in fine hotels and resorts for many years and  I enjoy hosting guests and helping them experience their trip to its fullest.

name: Upstream Penthouse, Spacious, Modern, Riverfront & Hot Tub.
description: Step into a rooftop hot tub at the end of an active day and slowly unwind under the stars. Find plenty of cozy beds in colorful rooms for the whole family. Descend a staircase to an upscale kitchen and enjoy wide woodland views of the mountains, the Biltmore Estate and French Broad River. The patio is a perfect place to enjoy a cup of morning joe or watch the sunset while sipping your favorite cocktail. No parties or events
neighborhood_overview: The house is perched above the French Broad River, across from the Biltmore Estate. It's near a park with bike paths leading into Downtown Asheville and New Belgium Brewery. Launch a tube from the new boat ramp directly across from the house.
host_about:
I apologize for the strange photographs we have on our Plus listings.  We have no control over how they photograph our houses or how the pictures are displayed.   To solve the problem we had to build our own website...

You can search for us with the term “Upstream Way” and find some much better photographs and videos.   We also have lots of information on Asheville and travel tips for your visit.   Hope you can check it out.   We should be the first result if you search for “Upstream Way”.   I am also happy to answer any questions if you call or text (Eight 2 8) seven 7 eight-O 4 one 3.   

Tomorrow we have a group of photographers coming up from Charlotte to do more video tours.   That will be online as soon as we edit.   It seems like there are so many houses on AirBnB that people have difficulty figuring out which properties are good to visit and which are hiding behind trick photography. name: Mountaintop Getaway minutes from West Asheville!
description:
A quiet mountaintop getaway in the trees, just 3 miles from West Asheville and just 6 miles to Downtown Asheville! With lots of privacy, it's a great place for a mellow getaway or a fun weekend with friends.

This home is not only pet-friendly but pet-encouraged! It has a fenced-in backyard and lots of room for your dog or dogs to run, as well as a quiet road for leash-walks.

The space
The space is just the top floor of our home, as the basement is currently being used for storage. The front door is down 2 sets of deck steps from the driveway. There is one very large bedroom with a king size bed, and a sleeper sofa in the living room. We can also provide an air mattress for the bedroom if extra sleep space is needed.

The bathroom has a jacuzzi tub and a spacious walk-in shower. There is a working wood stove to make cold nights cozier, and a two-person hammock for relaxing in the trees. The back patio has a grill and dining set for dining o
neighborhood_overview:
This home is located on the top of Spivey Mountain; at 3,300 ft. elevation, it's the mountain in closest proximity to West Asheville. It's a quiet neighborhood- in fact, you can't see any neighbors from our property, unless you count the wildlife! You can find turkeys, woodpeckers, rabbits and even bears on the mountain!

Bustling West Asheville is just an 8-10 minute drive down the mountain, where you can find dozens of great restaurants, bars, local shops, services and anything else you could need! You can get into Downtown Asheville in less than 15 minutes from this home. Ubers are usually $10-$20 to downtown, depending on the time of week.
host_about:
Originally from New York, I have been living in Asheville, NC for 10 years and am "almost" a Southerner. I am a small business owner with 3 pet supply stores. My husband and I work hard so we can play hard- we love to travel and Airbnb is such a unique way to really get to know new places and have a more authentic experience!

 After moving further out into the country, we decided to share our first home in West Asheville with visitors, and share what we love most about this beautiful area!

name: City of Asheville at Your Feet
description:
Town Mountain home 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville (Uber: $8-$10). Private entrance to 1150 sf: 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, large den, breakfast area with coffee/tea, snacks, fridge with beverages, partial kitchen with microwave, toaster, small cooktop. Privacy and views of downtown and the Blue Ridge Mountains from the large deck accessible from the master and den. Minutes to the Grove Park Inn and easy access to Blue Ridge Parkway. Cozy, charming home perfectly situated for a great getaway.

The space
Morning on the mountain is a great time to sit on the deck with a cup of coffee or tea and enjoy the view. The mountain is always changing and looks different with each stunning sunrise and sunset.

Winter is a beautiful time on the mountain. The weather is not a concern with a generator on site.

The den includes a TV with Roku and access to Netflix and Amazon Prime. A breakfast table and other essentials help make your stay memorable.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood known as Town Mountain to Asheville locals is located to the North of downtown. Enjoy breathtaking views of the Blue Ridge Mountains and the twinkling lights of downtown Asheville. You'll see remarkable homes in a wide variety of styles situated to take full advantage of the beautiful view. Uber under $10 and mins from downtown Asheville.
host_about: My childhood was spent listening to the music coming from the Grove Park Inn’s veranda while sitting on our back porch. My family has lived in Asheville for many generations; however, following my college years, for several decades, my work took me across the US. During my absence from Asheville, I lived  in LA, Sarasota FL, NY, Washington DC and Atlanta GA before eventually finding my way back home again. I now  live on the mountain that I used to see from my bedroom window as a child. Southern hospitality was part of my life and I want to share that with others and introduce them to Asheville and the surrounding area. My hope is that your guest experience provides a unique view into this area and you  leave here with beautiful and lasting memories.

name: Downtown Condo Self Checkin. Walk Everywhere -Safe
description:
Everything is right at your doorstep from this downtown condo located only a stone’s throw away from all the shops and restaurants that Asheville has to offer. Take advantage of the free parking to save time and money as well as avoid the downtown traffic.



The kitchen is fully equipped for easy preparation of snacks or meals. Technology includes 200 bandwidth WiFi both wireless and Ethernet connections.

We have another condo available in the same complex if you have traveling partners.Ask

The space
Our condo has a luxury tiled bath which includes a deep soaking tub and a large glass shower with TWO separate shower heads. The condo’s central hot water system provides an abundant supply of fresh hot water. Stay a while.

Guest access
The owner’s group at the property have a fitness room, laundromat and patio. Use is limited to owner occupants.

Other things to note
Parking in downtown
neighborhood_overview: Out the parking lot on foot and you are at the beginning of the Shop/Restaurant District if downtown Asheville. Asheville also has other interesting districts which include the River Arts District, Montfort which is north just across the interstate, Biltmore Village and of course mountain and forest district for a great outdoors experience. Both Sierra Nevada and New Belgian Breweries are popular destinations as well as numerous small craft breweries scattered throughout the city. YMCA nearby. Biltmore Fitness daily rates.
host_about: We are a retired couple who after 40+ years of marriage and raising 8 kids decided to spend our retirement traveling. We spend much of our time in our RV traveling the USA but also enjoy regular trips to other places abroad. I enjoy Pickleball and Margie enjoys beading.

name: DOWNTOWN ASHEVILLE: Healing Homestead
description:
Downtown..natural..beautiful! 3 blocks to the popular South Slope. Everything under 'Neighborhood' is walking distance. Sanctuary homestay. Gorgeous medicinal gardens. Peaceful boho vibes. Hand-crafted details. Clay walls. Hardwood floors. 100 year home. 4 bedrooms. Shared bathroom & commons. YOUR ROOM > Sunset view, desk+chair, queen bed sleeps 2 comfortably. Includes bedding + towels. Come enjoy my edible urban paradise! No drunken beer bros, please! READ MORE BEFORE BOOKING...

The space
WELCOME: To my beautiful homestay with shared bathrooms + commons + a private room for you.

***PLEASE NOTE: I live in one of the most biodiverse temperate rainforests on the planet, ie: this area is teeming with life, including insect life. While my home is cleaned + vacuumed weekly, if you prefer 100% air-tight hotel environments, please do *not* book with me. We enjoy our old-home charm, open air living, sounds of nature....and don't mind the occasional moth or da
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION IS EVERYTHING! // 3 blocks to the South Slope // 5 block walk into downtown // 5 minute drive to Biltmore Estate // 8 minute drive to mountains // 2 minute walk to an open track field + awesome view on top of the bleachers // Walk to (most of) my faves below! Double check hours. Expect lines.

o---------------o-----------------o

• French Broad Food Coop: Everything! Snacks, toiletries, lunch to-go, beer, etc
• High Climate Tea: Gorgeous planty enviro. Tea galore. Mochi treats. Good ppl!
• Sovereign Remedies: Brunch + late dinner. Excellent organic food + cocktails
• Dobra Tea House: Over 100 tea options. Comfy seating. West side is cuter
• Storm Rhum Bar: Pretty outdoor dining. Delicious local cuisine. 5 blocks
• Gan Shan West: Favorite Asian Fusion in town, bonus outdoor seating
• Kathmandu Café: Love this organic Nepali gem run by a sweet family
• Farewell Café: Yummy treats, coffee + ambiance. 2.5 blocks away :)
•
host_about: Greetings humans! I’m as in love with these gorgeous old mountains as I was when I first arrived 25 years ago. I cherish living in this sweet sanctuary & the amazing team of women here. I’m into the intelligence of nature, food as medicine, all things wild n' free & liberation work. I keep a clean house & go by V, my birth-given middle name. YOU > I enjoy hosting all kinds of folks from around the world—just no more drunken beer tourists, please!

name: Peaceful, clean & comfortable * 10 min to Downtown
description:
Entire home conveniently located about 10 minutes to Downtown Asheville and West Asheville, 6 minutes to the Biltmore. Relax on the side porch after a long day of exploring Asheville; the Biltmore Estate, the Grove Park Inn, and the Blue Ridge Parkway are all must-visits. Featuring a fully fenced in back yard, a large open space for entertaining, gas grill, high speed internet, smart TV, a surprisingly luxurious King pullout couch, a comfortable Queen bed, and a lovely King bed in the master.

The space
Guests will have full use of the house, it’s all to yourself!

Guest access
Guests can use the whole house, including a full kitchen, new washer/dryer, fenced backyard, and nice side porch.

Other things to note
Propane for the grill is not provided due to insurance requirements.
neighborhood_overview: The home is in a nice, quiet neighborhood. Beyond, it is a short 10 minute drive to downtown Asheville where a selection of restaurants, fun bars, and breweries are all within reach.  Biltmore Estate is 7 minutes away, New Belgium is 12, Highland 8.
host_about:
Hi fellow travelers!

We are wedding photographers based in Asheville, NC.  Our favorite cities (aside from Asheville, of course) are Galway, Ireland and Bar Harbor, Maine.  
As travelers we tend to wander aimlessly, avoiding the busiest areas and seeking out hidden treasures.  As hosts we love to share our knowledge of the area; especially the amazing food and beautiful spots we have found through our time photographing adventurous elopements.

name: Comfy King & Queen Suite near Grove Park & Parkway
description:
Welcome, ya'll! We have a light & spacious king bedroom and connected queen room with a private bath & entrance nestled in North Asheville, just a few minutes from Grove Park, downtown Asheville, & the Blue Ridge Parkway. Come enjoy & explore all that our mountains have to offer! We are very cautious due to Coronavirus and will ensure the place is sparklingly sanitized for you, too!

We have another listing for a whole house near Biltmore & Blue Ridge Parkway here for up to 6 guests as well.

The space
Welcome, y’all!

We have a spacious suite with two connected bedrooms, a private entrance and private bath. One room has a king bed and the other is a queen. You will essentially have your own floor of the house!

Each room sleeps up to 2 with plenty of space for your things. Wifi, comfy memory foam mattresses, and eco-friendly cleaning products are used. We are keeping with CDC cleaning protocols to sanitize the space as well. There
neighborhood_overview: We are in the beautiful Beaverdam Valley, which connects directly to the Blue Ridge Parkway (yay, mountain views and hiking!). We are also a 5 minute drive from the Grove Park Inn, making us a great option while you attend a wedding or event there. Many of Asheville's amenities are just 3 minutes away, and we get to downtown parking in less than 10 minutes.
host_about: I am a singer/songwriter from the mountains of Asheville, NC that grew up in downtown Atlanta, GA. When I am not traveling with my sweet band (an all-female trio) I love the library, listening to music, hanging out with my eclectic family, tending my garden, and going to art shows of all kinds.

name: Asheville 4 bedroom house w large yard
description:
Beautifully decorated, relaxing Arts and Crafts newer home in Pastoral setting 15 min. to downtown. Relax in front of the gas fireplace during the winter and in the summer the scenic deck and front porch. The home is stocked with: shampoo and conditioner, soaps, and all paper products. The kitchen has condiments, spices and coffee and tea

The space
You will have access to the entire first and second level of the house, front porch and deck with grill. The house is furnished very comfortably with lots of space to relax by the fireplace.

name: Magic mountain new west Asheville chalet
description:
Magical mountain home! This new 4 bedroom home, completed in July 2018, sits nestled above Carrier Park with sweeping, panoramic views of the mountains and the French Broad River. Perfect for a family vacation or a getaway. Enjoy an easy stroll to Asheville Adventure Park where you can rent tubes and kayaks for a spectacular ride on the river. Only a short drive to downtown, the house is a wonderful retreat furnished in a contemporary decor.
https://mymatterport.com/show/?m=vdGBtf8yHUW

The space
Sleeps up to 14 people. There are three king beds, four twin beds set up in bunk bed fashion, one pull out full-size couch and one inflatable queen size air bed. Golden slumbers ensured with top of the line Saatva mattresses in each bed. Unique headboards are from Desert Metal Design. Wood finishes from local NC hardwoods. There are three large screen smart Tv's with Netflix , DirecTV, HBO and an audiophile grade stereo. Contemporary art on each floor from notabl
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a hip, cool area with a wide variety of restaurants , coffeebars and microbreweries.

name: Cute house: Walk to Downtown, River Arts, Mission
description:
Pretty 3 bedroom home has 1.5 baths, a full cook's kitchen, a nice porch and lots of closet space. Walkable to downtown, the River Arts District and the hospital.

You'll be comfortable and welcome with great access to everything Asheville has to offer. Plus off street parking!

Pet friendly.

LGBTQI and straight friendly; BIPOC and white people welcome.

I prefer to talk with people before booking this space to answer questions and share details. So please message me before booking.

The space
This charming and comfortable house is in an ideal location to get the best of Asheville.

The pretty, BoHo living room seats 6 for conversation and gazing at the bird feeders on the porch.

The primary bedroom has a comfortable queen-sized bed and a half-bath.
The middle bedroom also has a closet and is currently set up as an office, but an air mattress could be set up. The smallest bedroom is ideal f
neighborhood_overview: The South French Broad neighborhood is on the south-west fringes of downtown so it's easy to get most anywhere in Asheville.  I love the urban stream right across the street, the proximity to the river and how it's perfectly situated to be a leading area for urban sustainability and urban agriculture.
host_about:
I enjoy a a large and wonderful community here in Western NC.  I live with my super-cute dog, Minnie, and sometimes an upstairs tenant.

I have two businesses.  I have a Celebrant practice and a Consulting practice.  A Celebrant is a ceremony specialist.  I'm also an ordained Inter-faith Minister.  ( So if you want to get married while you're here, I can help you out with that too!  Find out more about that and the other types of ceremonies I help people create by googling Asheville Celebrant.   My other business is Circle Forward Partners, where I coach, train and facilitate groups in collaborative governance.

I am passionate about urban sustainability and I'm a land-owner partner in Patchwork Urban Farms.

I love swimming and floating in natural bodies of water.  I  enjoy, sewing, yoga and spending time with my friends and neighbors.  

I love my town so I'm happy to give you tips and directions or just leave you to your own devices.  Look forward to meeting you in person!

Happy Day!
Michelle

description:
Get the real Asheville experience in this unique mountain ranch home, just minutes from everything. Spend your days exploring all the city has to offer and your nights cozied up by the firepit in the big fenced-in backyard. Couples, families and groups alike will love cooking gourmet meals in the updated, fully stocked kitchen and dining al fresco at the custom built farm table on the side deck.

The space
Located in East Asheville just 10 minutes from Downtown, and a couple minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway.

Guest access
Guests will have full access to the whole home, 2 car garage and driveway, fenced in back yard, outdoor deck and dining, and large front yard.

Other things to note
Home is cleaned with proven disinfectant products and we have enhanced cleaning measures in response to COVID-19, sanitizing all frequently trafficked surfaces.

Likely to make concessions for small pets or special situations.

We absolutely love Western NC and exploring all that it has to offer, which is a lot! So many beautiful places, delicious food , and no shortage of outdoor activities!

description:
Family-friendly, cozy West Asheville basement apartment, with private entrance. Walk to the park & explore the creek along a beautiful walking trail. 2 Blocks from Bowling, Ice cream & restaurants. Take a 2-min Uber ride to the famous Haywood Street for coffee shops, restaurants, live music, shopping, and more. It's a 9-min drive to Downtown. If you're kind and respectful, you're our type of people and welcome at our home! We hope you enjoy our little town as much as we do!

Internet connection is Fiber and can support up to 9 Power Users.

Well-behaved dogs are welcome.

We have a private driveway, (1 space) and free s

In the heart of West Asheville, close to downtown and only 14 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway

name: Updated Arden Home ~12 Miles to Downtown Asheville
description:
Calling outdoor enthusiasts and adventurers! This 3-bedroom, 2-bath vacation rental house is the perfect place to book your Arden getaway. Ideally located just 20 minutes from downtown Asheville and within 1 hour of the national park and 2 ski areas, this vacation rental is the perfect home base for all your recreation and entertainment needs. The 1,800-square-foot home- perfect for friends and family- is pet-friendly, boasts a brand new kitchen and all the comforts of home, including free WiFi!

The space
Master Bedroom: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Full Bed | Bedroom 3: 2 Twin Beds

Conveniently located and loaded with all the amenities you could need, this home has it all! Just minutes from Asheville's top attractions, you're sure to enjoy making this property your home-away-from-home.

Spread out and settle in throughout the 1,800-square-foot interior, where sleek hardwood floors guide you from one well-appointed living space to the next. The l
neighborhood_overview:
This property is ideally situated so you can enjoy all the best of the Appalachian Mountains, downtown Asheville, Arden and more with ease!

When you're in the mood for Southern fare or need a quick pick-me-up before heading out, visit Rocky's Hot Chicken Shack South just a 6-minute walk away and The Beehive Coffee Bar an 8-minute walk away.

Walk through the 434-acre North Carolina Arboretum just 15 minutes away, or spend the day down by Lake Julian - the perfect spot for a picturesque picnic! Hop in the car and take a scenic drive through the Blue Ridge Parkway beginning at the Blue Ridge Recreation Park 20 minutes away.

Asheville offers something for everyone, often referred to as "The Paris of the South." This historic town boasts museums, fabulous restaurants and plenty of entertainment options. While exploring greater Asheville, be sure to make a stop at the Biltmore Estate just 17 minutes or 8 miles away.

All-season recreation abounds
host_about:

name: The Nomad Pad ::Less than 10 minutes to downtown::
description:
:::Please read the entire add and photo descriptions to ensure this property is a good fit for you, we hope you enjoy your stay!:::

We offer a secluded space located in the basement of our two story home, nestled in the cozy mountains of Asheville NC. Our home is located in a quiet, safe neighborhood that is 10 minutes from the heart of downtown, The Biltmore estate, all the breweries, 35 minutes from Chimney Rock/Lake Lure, and the Blue Ridge Parkway is practically in our backyard.

The space
The basement living space includes a private room with a brand new king size upscale memory foam mattress, private bathroom, huge private living room, and a separate entrance and driveway for our guests. The guest driveway has plenty of space and parking for up to two large vehicles.
The entire living space plus bedroom is roughly 1,000 square feet.

The living space included in this property offers two comfortable couches (one of which is a reclin
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet safe, & in a friendly area. Within a mile are 3 gas stations, an ingles grocery store, a pizza restaurant and the Blue Ridge Parkway offering many hiking trails. Easy access to all interstates, convenient but feels secluded.
host_about: My name is Cameron and I am a US Navy veteran that decided to relocate to the mountains to take life a little slower with my partner. We enjoy hiking, art shows, and spending time with our dogs. We are opening our home to welcome those wanting to explore and experience all that Asheville has to offer. This is a unique place tucked in the mountains and surrounded by the blue ridge parkway. A long time ago a friend of ours opened our eyes to the love, light, and joy that Asheville exudes. We would love to be a catalyst in helping others enjoy this town as much as we do.

name: Green Retreat
description:
Before requesting read "Other things to note" below

Fall soon arrives: upper deck seating area, nestled in tree canopy. Full kitchen, dining room & living room with gas fireplace are available to you. All located off your large master bedroom with private bath and sitting area. Waffle weave robes are provided to enjoy as you head down to common hot tub area or access the warm outdoor seasonal shower, both of which are clothing optional.

Two night minimum but exceptions made on occasion..

The space
So pressing at this time is prevention of Covid. Pick up, clean, then sanitize with Lysol spray disinfectant is my routine. We've added an (iWave-R), a residential air cleaner that works as an air ionizer, thus killing mold, bacteria and virus. Though I routinely clean, there is nothing routine how I go about it. Any surface that may have been touched by previous guests or myself are cleaned and sprayed. This includes soap dispensers, remotes, door
neighborhood_overview: Located in a lightly wooded beautifully landscaped area with privacy screened fence to permit a clothing optional hot tub and warm shower area. The warm shower area is seasonal while the hot tub is up and running all year long.
host_about:
My experience in life has been to minister. At first I was studying to be a priest but later realized that comforting people can be done in more ways than from that approach. Meeting, greeting and engaging guests without agenda puts them at ease and when guests arrive with little or few expectations and are open to my quirky approach to life, magic happens. Giving give wide berth for your privacy, but there when social interaction is desired.
I've learned that I can only try and please everyone. That works for 97% of the time. Occasionally guests cannot let go of stress and innate suspicions, and that is baggage that I cannot carry for them. With an open mind and heart you will have on of the best experiences you can at an Airbnb establishment.
I welcome you to my home and my gig! Tom ~~ your host

description:
This is it - a rare downtown Asheville condo with a dedicated parking spot! (No more driving around in circles, paying exorbitant parking rates or feeding parking meters!). Since we are located downtown, that means you can easily walk to all your favorite AVL restaurants, shops and breweries. Our condo gives you quick and easy access to the Blue Ridge Parkway, Biltmore Estate, and other nearby Asheville attractions.

The space
Featuring bamboo floors, granite countertops, natural light, fully furnished modern decor, a full kitchen (complete with coffee maker, blender and toaster oven), new bedroom and bathroom linens, TWO brand new flat-screen TVs, a DVD player, and an in-unit washer/dryer, experience your private living space near the Western Carolina mountains.

The futon converts into a full-sized bed for additional guests. Relax, and enjoy yourself in your own little sanctuary with all the comforts of home.

We hope you enjoy your stay wit
neighborhood_overview: We are steps away from the Civic Center and right off of I-240. We're located at the outer edge of downtown Asheville - close enough to be in the heart of it all, but far enough from the hustle and bustle of the city.
host_about: I love to travel, especially with my husband and daughter (age 11). We enjoy eating local cuisines and learning about the areas we visit. The favorite places we've traveled to include Hawaii, Colorado, France, Spain and Taiwan.

description:
Prime South Asheville location. Just 15 to 20 min from downtown Asheville & the Biltmore Estate, 10 min from Asheville Airport, 5 min from dining & entertainment, 10 min to Pisgah National Forest & 40 min to Dupont SF and Chimney Rock SP. Convenient to Sierra Nevada and Bold Rock Breweries. Clean, humble home in a quiet and safe neighborhood. Supportive and comfortable memory foam mattress for a great night's sleep. Coffee maker with coffee supplies in-room. Off-street, driveway parking.

The space
The attached garage has a free weight gym set available for use and storage for mountain or road bikes. A garden hose around the corner is available for rinsing muddy mountain bikes.

Guest access
Feel free to store food in the fridge and re-heat left-overs in the microwave or toaster oven. If you would like to utilize the kitchen to cook all or most of your meals, an extra fee of $15 per night applies. Please provide this need at the time of book
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a quiet and safe late 60's neighborhood with friendly neighbors.
host_about: I am an outdoor enthusiast and love living in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains of Western, NC. I've lived here for over 18 years.  I enjoy spending my time mountain biking, camping, hiking, and trail running with my two dogs.  I'm converting a van into a camper van with plans to travel and work from the road for some extended period of time. Asheville will always be my beloved home base after I return from various trips.

name: Mile North Urban Suite
description: Located approximately one mile north of dynamic downtown, this apartment in a renovated 1940s mixed-use house lets you live like a local and is a perfect base camp for any Asheville adventure –– fix breakfast on quartz counters in a relaxed, bright kitchen area with hardwood floors and black tiling. neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a low-key area with great restaurants and cafes nearby. Head over to Luella's for some awesome local BBQ or walk over to another gem, Taco Temple, for Mexican fare. Trader Joe's and Whole Foods are both a 10-minute walk away.

A three bedroom ranch home, with basement to safely store bicycles and rec room with pool and ping pong table, pleasant deck off dining room with grill and picnic table.
My home is 3 minutes from the NC Arboretum, entrance to the Blue Ridge Parkway, and Asheville Outlet Mall, 15 minutes from the Biltmore House and downtown Asheville, and 30 minutes from Pisgah National Forest , biking and hiking trails with over 200 waterfalls. Community park close by, with bike trails and play equipment.

The space
I have an extra cot with single air mattress, a double bed air mattress for the floor. Two bedrooms have queen beds in each. The third bedroom has a trundle bed (two single beds) So this would accomodate 2 families with 2 couples and no more than 4 children total.

Guest access
The entire house is available with use of fully equipped kitchen, grill on deck, back yard for the kids to play in as well as a basement room with ping pong and poo

I lead a waterfall hike each week and  love to go to concerts. Whether you like rock music or chamber music , whatever your tastes in music , you can find it in this area.

neighborhood_overview:
The historic Kenilworth neighborhood is located between Biltmore Village on the south and downtown Asheville on the North.

As is true for many neighborhoods in Asheville, Kenilworth residences sprouted up around a large Inn. The Kenilworth Inn (1926) was named after Castle Kenilworth in England. Architecture in the area reflect styles that were popular in the 20's: Tudor, Spanish Colonial Revival, and Prairie.

The suite itself sits at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac, with the undeveloped backside of Beaucatcher Mountain behind and above the property.

The Biltmore Estate, Biltmore Village and Downtown are all conveniently located within a few short minutes.
host_about:
40 year old, former project manager for the commercial elevator industry 

Moved to Asheville after hiking the entire Appalachian Trail in 2012

Happy to provide hiking recommendations for waterfalls, swimming holes, mountaintop views, and extended hikes

name: Asheville Mountain Serendipity-close to downtown
description:
Mountain Serendipity is a 1000 sq ft 2 room suite with private patio about 5 minute driving time to downtown Asheville's restaurants, bars, breweries, galleries, shopping, nightlife, Grove Park Inn, Botanical Gardens and UNCA. The neighborhood has roads for walking through beautiful forested land. The entrance to the Biltmore Estate and Blue Ridge Parkway are only a 15 min. drive, 20 minutes from the Asheville Airport. Looking Glass Falls and Sliding Rock are a short 45 minute drive.

The space
This beautiful 2 room suite is located on a on a hillside with trees, more than 1/2 acre of Sunset Mountain (often called Town Mountain) in the Abemarle Park area. Your internationally themed guest space is on a lower level with spacious bedroom, living and library area (a book lover's paradise) and an outdoor patio overlooking the gardens, colorful in fall foliage and beautiful flowers in the spring. Your 1000sq foot retreat includes large windows with views of trees,
neighborhood_overview: The surrounding neighborhood has some steep hills, and roads through forested areas.  Bear and white squirrel sightings are possible.  City Bakery on Charlotte Street at the bottom of the hill is a favorite, the Botanical Gardens at Asheville next to UNCA (a 5 minute drive) has a beautiful easy walk along Reed Creek.  Many grocery stores including Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Harris Teeter and Ingles are just minutes away, in addition to the downtown Asheville stores and Asheville Mall, almost everything is available on nearby Merrimon Avenue. Taxi service including Uber and Lyft are also easy to access.
host_about: Watercolor artist, former stock photographer specializing in worldwide travel, lifestyle and business productions, primary agents are Getty Images and Alamy.

name: Natural Homestay in Downtown Asheville
description:
Please read ALL details. Welcome to my homestay--you've found a gem! 2.5 blocks to the popular South Slope + 2 more to downtown + close to nature trails. Gorgeous organic gardens. Peaceful boho vibes. This SINGLE-occupancy room is for 1 person ONLY. It's small with a single bed, many windows, a dresser, lamp, fan....NO A/C or TV. Bathroom & kitchen are shared. Everything under 'Neighborhood' is an easy walk. Nearby baseball games can be noisy--bring earplugs. Read all details below. Thank you!

The space
***PLEASE NOTE: We live in one of the most bio-diverse temperate rainforests on the planet, ie: this area is teeming with life....including insect life. While our home is cleaned & vacuumed weekly, if you prefer 100% air-tight hotel environments, please do *not* book with us. We enjoy our old-home charm, open air living, the sounds of nature....and don't mind the occasional moth or daddy long leg. If this sounds good, please come enjoy. We'd love to have you! Othe
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION IS EVERYTHING! // 3 blocks to the South Slope // 5 block walk into downtown // 5 minute drive to Biltmore Estate // 8 minute drive to mountains // 2 minute walk to an open track field + awesome view on top of the bleachers // Walk to (most of) my faves below! Double check hours. Expect lines.

o---------------o-----------------o

• French Broad Food Coop: Everything! Snacks, toiletries, lunch to-go, beer, etc
• High Climate Tea: Gorgeous planty enviro. Tea galore. Mochi treats. Good ppl!
• Sovereign Remedies: Brunch + late dinner. Excellent organic food + cocktails
• Dobra Tea House: Over 100 tea options. Comfy seating. West side is cuter
• Storm Rhum Bar: Pretty outdoor dining. Delicious local cuisine. 5 blocks
• Gan Shan West: Favorite Asian Fusion in town, bonus outdoor seating
• Kathmandu Café: Love this organic Nepali gem run by a sweet family
• Farewell Café: Yummy treats, coffee + ambiance. 2.5 blocks away :)
•

YOU > I enjoy hosting all kinds of folks from around the world—just no more drunken beer tourists, please!

name: Private Home w/Hot Tub, 13 Miles to Dtwn Asheville
description:
The ultimate North Carolina getaway awaits at this newly renovated 4-bedroom, 3-bathroom vacation rental house in Arden! Situated just a few miles outside of Asheville, this home for 15 boasts outdoor amenities like a hot tub, partially-covered back deck with a gas grill, private patio, and a propane fire pit. Inside, you'll find 6 flat-screen Smart TVs, a Google Home device, game room with a billiards table, and much more! Return from a day of touring Asheville to relax in total luxury!

The space
Master Bedroom: King Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: XL Twin-over-Queen Bunk Bed | Bedroom 4: King Bed | Living Room: Full Sleeper Sofa | Den: Full Sleeper Sofa | Additional Sleeping: Queen Air Mattress (with 4" foam topper), Pack-n-Play

Park your car in the 2-car garage and step inside this 2,650-square-foot home. You'll immediately fall in love with the interior's stone and copper accents, as well as the tremendous wooded views found throughout.
neighborhood_overview:
This property is in the perfect location to experience the best of North Carolina! From hanging out in downtown Asheville to exploring the Tarheel State's beautiful wilderness, you can easily access it all from your new home base.

America's largest home, the Biltmore Estate, is just a few minutes away from your front door. Spend the day touring the mansion and walking around the property while learning all about the history of the Vanderbilt family and their home.

If you've got the shopping bug, head to the Grove Arcade in downtown Asheville. This building offers 4 acres of fantastic shops and restaurants.

Get out of the city for a day and check out the Pisgah National Forest, Chimney Rock State Park, or Mount Mithcell State Park. Be sure to go for a hike or mountain bike ride to one of the breathtaking waterfalls that are plentiful in this area.

Drive 10 minutes for a cold one after a day of fun in North Carolina! Sierra Nevada Brewing Co
host_about:
Hi! We’re Evolve Vacation Rental, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

name: 2 Cranes Getaway
description:
2 Cranes is located between downtown Asheville (less than 2 miles) and Biltmore Village (1 mile), and a short walk to South Slope breweries & McCormick Field (< 1 mi). I'm adjacent to the Mission Hospital Medical Campus, on the edge of the beautiful, old Kenilworth neighborhood of Asheville. Blue Ridge Parkway access is a few miles south or a few miles east. The entrance to The Biltmore Estate is a mile from the house.

The space
The space I have listed is most of the lower level of my house- a bedroom suite finished in 2018 with new everything and a private entrance from the driveway. There is one queen bed with a comfortable mattress, a cool chair in the small sitting area, and a 42-in smart TV on the wall available for your app sign-in. There is a skinny counter-height work table for laptops, a mini-fridge and coffee pot provided. Many of the outlets have USB ports for cell phone charging. There is a cute patio carved out of the driveway for added privacy fro
neighborhood_overview:
The Kenilworth neighborhood is adjacent to downtown Asheville, south and east. It is beautiful and established with lots of older homes of varied architectural styles along with some recent high-end modern construction. When family and friends visit I always make a point to take them on a walking or driving tour of the neighborhood.

My house is on the the more commercial side of Kenilworth, a block off the main drag (Biltmore Ave) and convenient to lots of attractions.
host_about: Just a guy, into many things in moderation and hope you are too. i love my dogs, live music, and have been known to sample a craft beer or 2. I love the mountains of WNC, whether I'm in them or just looking at them.

Located on a quiet, one-way street in the heart of Asheville. The home is a Griffin Award Winner for historical restoration with meticulous attention to quality reconstruction and replacement of historic fixtures with lavish detailing. truly modern-day conveniences with Old World charm!

The living area is inviting for conversation

name: Secluded Mountain Views In Asheville
description:
Secluded yet close to everything. Five minutes from restaurants, grocery, etc. yet surrounded by trees with great mountain views. New wood and tile floors, updated kitchen all 2018; master bath redone 2016. Nicely furnished; great combination of elegant living in a wonderful natural setting in South Asheville.

The space
Please note that we have a property caretaker living in a downstairs unit, so there will be others at the property, including dogs, during your stay. There are no shared living spaces; you park in the garage and enter the home up a flight of interior stairs connected to the garage; they park in the other garage bay and enter the downstairs separately. You have the private upper deck; they have their own private lower deck. Once you venture out into the yard, that space is shared. Upstairs, you'll basically never hear anyone downstairs. They will occasionally hear your footsteps above them.

We have a steep paved driveway that
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is just a few hundred yards outside the southern city limits of Asheville, about 15 minutes from Biltmore and downtown. We have only one visible neighbor. Our home is basically halfway up a small mountain; you'll drive past homes in the neighborhood as you approach our home, but once you turn up the mountain a short distance, you'll see only our one neighbor. And from Spring through Fall, you'll only see that home as you drive up our steep driveway. In the winter, that home is visible about 100 yards away from parts of our deck and inside one side of our house.
There are occasional bear sightings in our neighborhood; this is true of a number of areas in and around Asheville. Be careful and realize they're not pets, but generally they keep their distance and you should keep yours. Do not leave any trash outside, since this attracts them.

Smoking is not permitted in the house or anywhere on the property.
host_about: Retired; moved to California in early 2020, after living in Asheville since 2014.  Kim and I previously owned bookstores in Texas and Colorado after earlier careers, and we're both easy going and happy to help you navigate the area, but also happy to let you have your freedom.  We like to spend time with our dogs, listen to music, cook, etc.

name: Baying Hound Campground - Entire Campground
description:
Reserve an entire campground for your next large group get-together (approx. 25 ppl). We're not fancy, but if you've got tents and you want to get a feel for Appalachia then you're in the right place. There's access to a surprisingly clean outhouse and sink. The campground is tucked away in a neighborhood less than 10 minutes away from downtown Asheville. Tent sites are located in a private, 2-acre wooded valley. There are NO linens, towels or pillows provided. Please read on for more details!

The space
We are easily one of the closest, and cheapest, camping options when it comes to staying in Asheville. Only 8-12 minutes by car from downtown Asheville, we are a friendly, family-run, budget option when staying in the area. The camping area is located in a small, private, green valley, and you will definitely feel like you are "out in the sticks" even though you're actually super close to all the breweries and parks that make Asheville what it is.

Summ
neighborhood_overview: The camping space is located in the "Emma" area of Asheville. Also known as "Wild Wild West Asheville" (to distinguish it from regular West Asheville), this is the last bastion of non-gentrified Asheville. Emma is completely un-zoned, so you get an interesting mixture of mostly residential properties that scatter the area. Just like most areas in Appalachia, our neighbors are fiercely independent, yet simultaneously open-minded. You can pretty much do whatever you want out here as long as it doesn't bother anybody else.
host_about:
*Baying Hound Campground*
We're a 30-something married couple trying to live the dream!

Rugged accents contrast with stylish furnishings for a comfortable feel. This is a lower level unit in what is considered a duplex - so the property is shared but no one will occupy your space.

***There is only one parking space available to guests so please plan accordingly.

description:
Mtb Biker and Hiker private, wooded paradise! Falcon's Escape is located right near the Rice Pinnacle trailhead of the Bent Creek Experimental Forest and Lake Powhatan with 10,000 acres of nature for you to explore. We are also 1 mile away from the NC Arboretum, the French Broad River, and the Blue Ridge Parkway. You can reach downtown Asheville within 15 minutes with attractions galore including the Biltmore Estate the historic Grove Park Inn, New Belgium Brewing, and the River Arts District.

The space
Private entrance with lock-box for easy check-in. Fabulous yard and fire pit area. Wooded surroundings. Great kitchenette with fridge, freezer, and microwave. Tile shower. WI-FI, Wall mount TV with DVD player, Keurig coffeemaker with K-cups provided, plenty of storage, light filled space.

Guest access
Guest suite has private bedroom, living room/kitchenette with sleeper sofa, and full bath with tile/ stone shower. Large yard and fire pit a
neighborhood_overview:
We have 5 beautiful outdoor features right out your doorstep within 2 minutes -
Bent Creek Experimental Forest, NC Arboretum, the Blue Ridge Parkway, the Shut-In Trail, and the French Broad River. The Asheville Outlets are also within 5 minutes.
host_about: Greetings!  My wife Shelia and I are excited that you have visited our listing for Falcon's Escape in Asheville, NC. We are both avid hikers and cyclists and we try to get out on the trails every day. It's wonderful to live right at the doorstep of Pisgah National Forest  I love to ride and race bikes and enjoy mountain biking, cyclo-cross, gravel riding, and road biking.  We also enjoy walking and running in the woods with the family beagle.

name: CozyAirSuite
description:
We prepared a place where one would feel comfortable and relaxed. Spacious Clean rooms, Loaded kitchen, and comfortable seating. There are outside stairs to go down to the Air. We are close to downtown Asheville, The Biltmore Estate and Biltmore Village and just minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway. We hope you come visit our Beautiful and unique city.

The space
We have stayed at many hotels and beach houses and know how to make this place pleasant and relaxing. A lot of loving care has been put into this guest house to make your stay a pleasant memory. We pride ourselves on cleanliness and attention to detail. The oven is a Toaster Oven, large in size and we do have cable TV.

Guest access
A stocked kitchen. A spacious relaxing living room, private entrance into place. Close to 40 and 240 without highway road noise! Convenient location access to Asheville Fun!

Other things to note
There is designated parking for our gu
neighborhood_overview: A Quiet mountain neighborhood. Close to Downtown Asheville. We are about 20-25 minutes from Hendersonville NC and approximately 15 minutes from Black Mountain. Both towns are beautiful and have great restaurants.
host_about: Bobby and I have been residents in Asheville for over 24 years and originally from the D.C. Area.  We chose this location to be close to Johnson, City TN where a family member lives. We enjoy the views daily, the weather is great and there is so much to do, especially if you are an outdoor person. We have always enjoyed company and meeting new people. WELCOME to our home and to Asheville.

name: Cottage Overlooks Waterfall - Near Grove Park Inn
description:
1.3 miles from downtown Asheville and a five minute walk to the Grove Park Inn, this newly renovated 1913 cottage has period features and modern amenities. Enjoy a private deck w/ a 12 ft waterfall, hotel style linens and bath toiletries and 4000 k Amazon Fire TV with Amazon Prime, Netflix and Hulu. Free bottle of wine. Private one car parking pad w/ 14 steps to cottage. Park-like setting equipped w/ hammock, picnic table and grill for your exclusive use.

The space
A beautiful Cottage registered in the National Register of Historic Places in a Swiss Chalet neighborhood that begs you to walk. Well-equipped kitchenette with small refrigerator, dishwasher, electric drip coffee maker, microwave, and toaster oven. Breakfast beverages (coffee, tea, hot chocolate, creamers and sweeteners) supplied. The bathroom includes a spacious shower and all new fixtures. All original artwork including 19th century prints, Japanese vases and sculpture and oil painting.
neighborhood_overview: The picturesque Tudor style neighborhood founded by Rose Byrne is an interesting story in its own right. The 7 cottages designed by Charles Parker, architect of the Grove Arcade, in 1913 take you back to a village in Switzerland. Located in North Asheville's Grove Park, Sunset Mountain Neighborhood you will see stunning examples of early 20th century architecture as you twist and wind along our hilly streets.
host_about: An architect who restores vintage cars and historic houses I serve on the Historic Resources Commission and the PSABC Preservation Society. My wife Liz and I are very exited to finish the 1913 Three Bears cottage using the finest art and furnishings. I live in the main house and am ready to help you with any of your touring needs. As a mechanic I am ready to fix any maintenance problems, and as a historian point out the fine features of our local architecture. My wife Liz is always looking for suggestions to make your stay more enjoyable and can point out the best restaurants to locally dine.

name: Quiet Backyard Apartment
description:
Airy 2 bedroom/1 bathroom apartment on top of a hill in a quiet neighborhood convenient to both Biltmore Village and Downtown Asheville. We are about a 10 minute drive from downtown and a 5 minute drive to the Biltmore Estate. This space sits just behind the main house and has its own private entrance.
This space is available to people who are taking a little bit longer to get to know Asheville. We do not accept reservations for shorter than 30 days. Guests of all backgrounds are welcome!

The space
This is a completely separate 2 bedroom one bathroom apartment above a workshop in our backyard. It has it's own entrance and is secluded from the main house. It has a well equipped kitchen for longer term guests. The furnishings and the appliances are brand new and will allow guests to treat it as their own home. The apartment also has it's own washer and dryer available free of charge.
It is perched on top of a hill and offers lovely views of the neighborho
neighborhood_overview:
Oakley is a lovely neighborhood with easy access to both the Biltmore and Downtown. We have an excellent group of neighbors who are social and happy to hang out if that is something you're after.
We are also within walking distance of a small park with a playground, the Oakley library, and bus stops.
host_about:
I'm a desert native living in the mountains. I love making bread and pizza, hiking, running, climbing and playing ultimate frisbee.
I've lived in France and Australia and loved both those places, but am now happy to have settled down in a place as beautiful as Asheville. I loved meeting new people while I was traveling and would love to meet you during your travels.

name: Modern Gem -  Peaceful Quiet Getaway
description:
Welcome to our beautiful Asheville home located 10 minutes from downtown and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Newly remodeled with a freshly updated kitchen and baths. Newly installed Central Heating and Air Conditioning. This home is located in close proximity to Breweries, Hiking, Parks and Rivers and the main attraction of the Biltmore Estate.

The space
There is a large front porch with comfortable and relaxing chairs that face a nice spacious lawn. Gather around the fire pit for evening cocktails or just roasting marshmallows. The inside of the newly remodeled house is very spacious with a large living room that opens into a beautiful well-stocked kitchen with a dining area. All this opens up to a large deck via a sliding door with a table and chairs and additional seating with views of the yard and lots of trees. The master bedroom is large with a queen-size bed and a large closet with its own private bathroom. The rear guest bedroom has a queen-size bed and the fro
neighborhood_overview: Quiet peaceful area with the sounds of nature.  Surrounded by trees and urban living in the mountains.
host_about:
Hi 
We are Doug and Amparo. We love to travel and the beach is one of our favorite destinations. We love hiking, gardening and enjoying nature. We love  modern and eclectic design. We are surrounded by this and more in Asheville. Come and Enjoy our home!

name: Downtown Asheville Condo - right in the heart of things.
description:
Visit Asheville like an insider with Banjoe Vacations! Our professionally cleaned and sanitized condo is a fantastic escape right now. We are taking extra precautions and following CDC guidelines to ensure the condo is ready, letting you relax worry-free. This great downtown location means you can walk to anything you'd want to do in town. Over 10 breweries and the fantastic downtown restaurants are all within easy reach. When you've had enough, come relax in the condo, complete with everything you need from fluffy towels to coffee for the Keurig. From here you are 5 minutes from the River Arts District and 10 minutes from the Biltmore Estate. Free parking (for 1 car) in the garage. And our guest room can be made up as either two twins or as a king-sized bed. Just let us know which you'd prefer.

The space
We are in a brand new building, right in the middle of downtown Asheville. With free parking (for one car) in our garage, you can leave your car behind. The con
neighborhood_overview: We are right in the thick of it, close to the South Slope with a ton of breweries, and close by all of the restaurants downtown. This is a side of town that is in transition, with new construction and lots of changes planned. Because of our location across the street from the municipal bus station there are all sorts of people moving around, and it can be noisy late at night as bars and breweries close.
host_about:
I am the owner and manager of Banjoe Vacations, a small vacation rental company in Asheville, NC. My professional background is in acoustics, but I'm also interested in lots more. I play the upright bass (not well...), love runing, and hiking in the beautiful mountains here in Western North Carolina.
We've named our company Banjoe Vacations, after all of our names. B is for Bruce, 'an' is for Anna, our youngest daughter. 'jo' is for my wife Jo, and 'e' is for my oldest daughter Erin. We offer lots of different vacation options, from a lakefront cottage suitable for the whole family to a small rent-able tear-drop trailer.

name: ShovelheadExpress
description:
Welcome to the Shovelhead Express! This property is located in a prime spot convenient to everything! It is a quiet, safe location. Enjoy the retro decor with the amenities! It’s a 1 bedroom with a full-size bed and an Ikea sofa bed to comfortably accommodate 4. The main living space has a TV with provided Netflix. Well behaved dogs are welcome. (You are responsible for cleaning up after them!) No Cats! (Unless you can convence me your cat is not destructive and willing to pay for damage!)

The space
You are close to everything but the property sits within the buffer zone of the Blue Ridge Parkway. Also, this property is about 100 yards from US25A (Sweeten Creek Road), one of the area’s main arteries. If you turn right in 3.6 miles you’ll be at gates of the Biltmore Estate! Downtown Asheville is only 5 miles away. This will be one of the closest complete properties to downtown considering this type of rental being heavily regulated (banned) within the city li

name: CHIC MOUNTAIN FOREST GETAWAY - 4 bdrms
description:
Tucked away in Asheville's enchanted forest...get away to a magical 4 bdrm secluded, mountain retreat. Immaculately clean, cozy, airy dream home w/ vaulted ceilings, wood burning stove & forest views. Surrounded by trees, wildlife & trickling stream. Couple acres of tranquility, yet 15 mins to Downtown AVL & The Biltmore! 8 mins to Blue Ridge Parkway hiking. Close to all that AVL offers. Yet off the beaten path in a peaceful, invigorating landscape. 3 TVs, WIFI, Netflix, BBQ, Hammocks, Fire Pit!

The space
Escape to a magical oasis...where modern comforts and luxurious touches meet the rustic natural beauty and sweet energy that these mountains have to offer. A "choosy" nature lovers delight! When you're looking for a unique Asheville experience, that captures balancing natures seclusion and convenient proximity to downtown, Biltmore, breweries, the Blue Ridge Parkway, everything - this is it! A quiet, private, peaceful mountain place to unwind, get creative, writ
neighborhood_overview: This is a very SAFE, FRIENDLY, QUIET, BEAUTIFUL and PEACEFUL FOREST NEIGHBORHOOD - you will love it. In the mountainous forest of Asheville. Close enough (15 minutes or less) to several freeways, Blue Ridge Parkway, hiking, downtown, breweries & The Biltmore.  But tucked away in forested mountains with a small stream on the property, birds, squirrels, chipmunks, groundhogs, turkeys, deer, bears and other occasional animal visitors.
host_about:
Travel is our passion! We enjoy meeting & hosting people from all walks of life. I love hosting and also love when we get to be the lucky guest all over the world!

name: Cozy Cottage Near Town
description:
This cozy cottage located just outside city limits is 1.4 miles from Haywood Road (West Asheville), 4.5 miles to downtown. Cottage is located about thirty feet behind our home in a peaceful and quiet residential area that has a country feel but is very close to town. The building has windows on all sides and has great natural light. It's a stand-alone building.

The space
There are seven stairs leading to the door. Well-stocked kitchen has a full-sized oven, microwave/convection oven, small fridge, electric kettle, dishes, and cookware. Wake up to some coffee from the press or standard maker. There's a smart TV to allow access to any streaming subscriptions you may have but there is no cable.

There's a small bathroom with shower. Building is well-insulated and cozy with ductless heat pump.

All bedding is provided along with towels. The queen bed downstairs is new, a comfortable 12" foam one. The king bed in the loft has a 3 inch foa
neighborhood_overview: This area is just on the edge of town but has a peaceful, rural appeal.  Located only 1.4 miles from the intersection of Haywood Rd/Patton Ave., 4.5 miles to Pritchard Park downtown.
host_about: I'm an engineer who built a small cottage about 10 years ago to use as a home office. Over time medical issues within the family have put us in financial strain so I have been hosting to make some additional income to maintain life. The cottage was designed by me and largely built by me with some help from local contractors. It's pretty fancy and built with love, like for me. Therefore I hope all guests will enjoy and treat it with respect. I am here to help in any way to make your stay more enjoyable whether it's recommending somewhere to eat, hike, or mountain bike, or just staying out of the way and letting you do your thing.

name: Mtn. Views, Hot Tub, 10 min. to DT and Biltmore H.
description:
"Stay in style" in this New Eco-Friendly"home, quiet neighborhood, 10 min from downtown Asheville and Biltmore House. We love to give everyone who stays in our home a five star experience. We have tried to include every amenity you could possibly need during your stay. We live right next door and want to be as involved as you would like us to be. Never hesitate to reach out to us about anything at all because our goal is to always improve!

The space
The home is in a well-established neighborhood at the end of a cul-de-sac. It is a very quiet area conveniently located in Asheville. Surrounded by woods, you may observe a flock of turkeys taking off to roost in the trees. Appreciate the peaceful setting, enjoy a leisurely meal on the screened in porch, and relax in the hot tub.

Our just finished house has brand-new furniture and an open space living area with large picture windows to gaze into the sunset and enjoy the mountain views. You feel like you a
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is 50 homes on a hill and we are close to the top on a cul-de-sac with only two other homes, one of which we live in. It is a wonderful community of caring neighbors.
host_about: I spent 30 years in the hotel/hospitality business in Bermuda and Myrtle Beach. I was a meeting planner for all events from weddings to corporate groups of 500+ guests. I love meeting people and taking care of their every need.

name: Walkable West Asheville
description:
Join us in the heart of West Asheville, home to breweries, river sports, art, and all kinds of good times. Our space is new construction and furnished with all the amenities you’ll need for an awesome time. We are conveniently nestled between Haywood Rd. and the French Broad River.

The space
The suite ecompasses the entire first floor of our home. The space is 700+ sf with a private key-coded entrance, separate HVAC, personal laundry room, and off street parking in the driveway. There are no shared spaces.
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is the city's hip, weird, artistic enclave. We are a diverse set of people who lead active and creative lives. Our street is full of families who love the neighborhood and all of the surrounding fun!
host_about: I enjoy meeting new people and showing them all the reasons why Asheville is the place to be!  Hospitality is what I know, and is the field I love and work in.
