name: Modern Biltmore Village Guest Suite
description:
Welcome to our modern guest suite in Biltmore Village! Completely remodeled with new, hotel-like amenities. Our central location could not be better. Walk to 20+ restaurants, breweries and bars! Only 1/4 mile to the Biltmore Estate gate, 2 miles to downtown Asheville, 1 mile to Mission Hospital and easy access from I-40. Enjoy a queen bed, a convertible sofa, fantastic bathroom, bistro table and chairs and tv/wifi. A great space to relax in after a day of sight seeing!

The space
Our home sits up on a hill and feels so private like your own tree house, yet close to everything. The guest suite is connected to our home on one end and has its own private, outside entrance. It’s a loft-like studio with 10' ceilings, and natural light throughout. Enjoy 500 square feet of living space with cable TV, WIFI and A/C. Everything in our guest suite is new as of 2018! The queen bed has 450 thread-count sateen sheets with a hypoallergenic mattress protector, down duvet and memo
neighborhood_overview:
Biltmore Village is the best location to be on a visit to Asheville! The Biltmore Estate is a must-see on a visit to Asheville. Besides being the largest, privately owned house in the U.S. and built by the Vanderbilt family, there are so many things to do and see on the property besides touring the amazing home. The colorful gardens, Conservatory, serene Bass Pond Waterfall, walking paths along the French Broad River, winery and kids petting zoo are just some of the things that you can plan. Seeing the 7,000 acre grounds can take days to cover. The convenience of our home being a 1/2 mile from the Biltmore Estate entrance makes for a seamless visit.

Biltmore Village has so many wonderful restaurants and shops you can WALK to. One of our favorite spots is Well Bred Bakery - consistently receives #1 bakery in Asheville each year...and guests can walk five minutes to it! Opposite side of the street is Corner Kitchen with fresh farm to table meals. At the bottom of our hill is
host_about:
“Travel changes you. As you move through this life and this world you change things slightly, you leave marks behind, however small. And in return, life—and travel—leaves marks on you.”  – Anthony Bourdain.

We LIVE to travel! Heather spent many years working in the airline industry which allowed us to see 40+ countries. The Anthony Bourdain show “No Reservations”  sums up our travel style. We tend to book the first night to recover from jet lag and then keep the rest of the trip open. We like to see where our travels want to take us. Seeking out the “undiscovered” places and truly connecting with locals is what we are all about. Some of our favorites: Luang Prabang / Bagan / Zanzibar / Bali / Colombia / Ronda (got engaged) / Samana, Dominican Republic (got married) / Chicago / Isla Holbox (shhhh, keep it a secret). Through many of these travels Airbnb has been a big piece of the puzzle.  

The two of us met in Aspen, CO. Heather is originally from Chicago and Mark from Virginia Beach. Although Heather loved city life her wanderlust brought her to Aspen for thirteen years.  Mark had been living in Washington D.C. doing the daily grind as an architect and had heard about a firm in Aspen that was hiring. He jumped on the chance and never looked back!  Aspen was a fantastic place to live and truly enjoy life. It taught us that you can live more simply and have a healthier quality of life. 

After a long stint out west and with a child on the way we decided it was time to be closer to family. We had a list of 30 towns all over the midwest and eastern U.S. which we either visited or did research on. After visiting Asheville we knew it was our next stop in life. Mark has opened his own office and Heather teaches at a creative arts center while studying interior design. Besides continuing to travel, we hike with our son and two dogs as often as possible and love checking out the awesome breweries and restaurants Asheville has to offer. We've also just begun hosting on Airbnb and really enjoy meeting fellow travelers and hosting them in our guest suite. 

We hope to inspire others to get out of their comfort zone and check out other places and people on this amazing planet! 

"Not until we are lost do we begin to understand ourselves." 
- Henry David Thoreau

name: Bearview Cabin minutes from Parkway and Downtown
description:
Bearview Cottage is newly renovated. It has log siding and a generous partially covered deck, with outdoor table and chairs. It looks onto one of the largest mountain peaks in Asheville. Nice wooded lot in a quiet neighborhood.
A wonderful bear theme, which have been seen on or around the property.

Fully stocked kitchen, dish washer, ice maker, dishes, cooking items, etc.

Spacious 1000 square foot home. Recently converted to a log cabin with a large deck. Gas stove for cool mountain days.

The space
Very convenient to all of Asheville.
2 miles off I-40

Guest access
Washer and dryer included

Other things to note
Detailed instruction book on coffee table for instructions using the internet, sling tv and propane gas fireplace.

The drive Bearview Cabin is located on is a private single lane drive. We are on the side of a mountain and the last 30 feet is steep. Front wheel dri
neighborhood_overview:
Just a couple miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway from Bearview Cabin and
5 miles to downtown , the Biltmore Estate, about 100 brewery’s and pubs, 20 miles to Lake Lure and 55 miles to Cherokee. Bearview Cabin is located on a private drive with eight other singlewide, double wides and cabins that are privately owned and well maintained. Above us the road continues up to the top of the mountain and a Japanese Spa is located there.
host_about: Hi, I am Carol Herter and I manage Bearview Cabin and Shangri-la.  I live in North Carolina and we own a Japanese Maple farm.  We have been growing and selling maples for over 20 years.  I am also an avid pet lover as I have turkeys, ducks, chickens, cats and dogs.  We love to travel and Ireland is my favorite destination.  We have been there three times but I am always ready to go back!  I enjoy a hands on touch with Bearview as I am close enough to clean it myself.  Asheville has so much to offer.  I find the mountains peaceful and soothing to my soul.

name: Mountain Modern Home-Away-From-Home (North AVL)
description:
Relax into this beautiful remodeled North Asheville mother-in-law suite with private screened-in porch amid mature wooded grounds.

This comfortably-appointed space is:
1.7 miles from Merrimon shops, restaurants (Early Girl, Avenue M), grocery stores (Ingles, Fresh Market)
2 miles from Beaver Lake & Bird Sanctuary
2.5 miles from Grove Park Inn & Golf Course
3.5 miles from UNCA and Botanical Gardens
4 miles from Downtown Asheville shops, breweries, restaurants
6.5 miles from Biltmore Estate

The space
Nestled in cozy rolling hills, North Asheville is a sought-after, idyllic neighborhood defined by quiet and natural beauty. Within this neighborhood, your home-away-from-home awaits...

Picture a wooded sanctuary filled with birdsong in the morning. Imagine a Mountain Modern studio-style hideaway that is yours alone: a dedicated guest suite with parking space, a separate entrance, a spacious, private screened porch,
neighborhood_overview: One of Asheville's oldest neighborhoods, North Asheville is moments from downtown, but feels like years away. Views of the sun setting over the mountains, the peaceful quiet of tree-lined streets, the sound of owls and turkeys quietly calling, the scent of wild flowers... it's a wonderful place to live.
host_about:
I love to travel! Experiencing the nuances of a city/village/countryside is something I find deeply enjoyable. Explore, interact with locals and discover new tastes and cultures - this is what I want when I travel. 

I am a responsible traveler, have great respect for others, their homes and belongings.

name: Rufus’ Retreat
description:
Welcome to Rufus’ Retreat! Conveniently located 2.5 miles from Downtown Asheville//3 miles from the River Arts District//1.5 miles to UNCA, this freshly renovated 1 bedroom 1 bath apartment comes fully equipped with all essentials guests may need for a cozy getaway in the mountains.

**Check out our other listing: Ralph’s Retreat (lower apartment)!

The space
The space is open and airy, located a short drive//walk//bike ride to downtown Asheville, the River Arts District, UNCA and West Asheville.
Asheville Community Yoga, DanceClub Asheville, Acupuncture Center of Asheville, Zillicoah Brewery, Gingers Revenge Brewery, the French Broad River and Beaver Lake are all within walking distance of Rufus’ Retreat.

Guest access
The entire upstairs apartment is available for guests. Please be mindful that there may be guests staying in the downstairs apartment during your stay.

Other things to note
Rufus’ Retreat
neighborhood_overview: This location can’t be beat! Yoga & dance studios, acupuncturists & massage therapists, breweries & hiking trails are all a stones throw from Rufus’ Retreat. Stay with us and experience the magic of Asheville!
host_about:
Superhost in Asheville, NC (Rufus’ Retreat + Ralph’s Retreat). 
Love to travel with my husband and 3 fluffers to new places and experience new things!

name: Welcoming West-Side Retreat
description:
Bright and light lower level of our eclectic 1920’s West Asheville bungalow. Technically a studio, there is a bedroom- it just doesn’t have a door in an effort to keep it as open as possible. Queen size bed and a fold-down couch that can sleep one adult or a couple kids. Local art and a little quirk make our space unique and fresh.
We are a close 5 minute walk to Haywood Rd where you can get dinner or catch a show, and just a 3 mile drive to downtown Asheville.
Thanks for checking us out!

The space
Relaxing pad in the heart of the west side. Nice new bed and a spa-like bathroom give our space an extra level of comfort.
Sorry, no pets allowed.

Guest access
Enjoy your own deck over-looking our back yard and woods beyond.

Other things to note
We live upstairs with our young children and share a back yard with a tiny house, you will be able to hear us upstairs. We do our best to keep to ourselves and ke
neighborhood_overview:
Established close-knit family-friendly neighborhood that’s great for a casual stroll. With bars, restaurants, and music within a quick walk or ride share.
Downtown is only about a 5 minute drive away.
If you are coming home late, please be respectful of our neighbors and not be too loud.
host_about: I am a native of Asheville, and have lived on the west-side for the past 18 years. I have two young, vivacious children with my husband Joshua. We enjoy thrifting, cooking, art, and spending time together outdoors. I really appreciate the eclectic and funky spirit of my home town, and am thankful to provide a unique space for hosting guests to share the love of AVL with.

name: Your Asheville Adventure Base
description:
The Asheville Adventure Base is the perfect spot for gatherings of families and friends. Conveniently located in North Asheville, this home is only ten minutes from Downtown and is nestled in a wooded, quiet neighborhood on the French Broad River. Its amazing location makes for a quick trip to many breweries, restaurants and UNCA. Though the cheery, light-filled, open concept layout might beckon you to just sit back and relax. We welcome all to stay with us and soak in the beauty of this area!

The space
This home sleeps 6 and includes a fully stocked kitchen, outdoor gas grill, dining area, large living space with TV, and three bedrooms. The master bedroom has an en suite bathroom while the two other bedrooms share a hallways bathroom. Downstairs there is a half bath near the dining/living area as well as a washer and dryer. All you need is here! Make a cup of coffee and gather on the front porch to soak in some mountain air!
We will provide a breakfast o
neighborhood_overview: This home is located in a very small neighborhood, comprised of only a few streets. It is very quiet with no thru traffic and lots of trees. The location is the best of both worlds-peaceful and quiet, yet close to all Asheville has to offer.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Michelle. I moved to Asheville seven years ago and immediately fell in love with these mountains. There are an endless amount of new things to explore here! I love to grab a cup of tea at the local tea house and go to dance classes downtown!
We hope to host you at one of our cozy Airbnbs soon!

name: A house in West Asheville, private and walkable
description:
With a private wooded back yard and a creek this place is still walkable to everything West Asheville has to offer: dining, shopping, live music and breweries. Only 5-10 minutes drive from downtown and 10-15 minutes to the airport and Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
This spacious house has 9’ ceilings and an open floor living room. The house has 3 bedrooms and 2.5 baths. There is a walking/running/biking trail right across the road on one side and a creek with trail on the other, the setting is great for someone looking for a private get away that is close to downtown or West Asheville night life. There is an apartment with a full time tenant on the lower level of the house, but there are no spaces shared except for parking in the back yard.

Guest access
Street parking or private parking in the back yard , with a private sitting and grilling area. Wherever you park you need to climb a few stairs to the front door.

Other things t
neighborhood_overview: Tacos Jaliscos, Izzy’s Coffee House, West Village Grocery, Universal Joint, Archetype Brewery, West End Bakery, Sunny Point
host_about: I am an energetic and friendly person with many interests. I live here with my son (9y.o.) and daughter (7y.o). We like to have camp fires, play music, sing, grill out and share good times with friends. Originally from Russia, this is my third time living in Asheville. I built this home myself and I hope you enjoy stay here. I like to meet new people, learn new things and explore new places.

name: Lucy the Vintage Trailer
description:
Lucy the Vintage Trailer is a 1947 camper that has been retrofitted to meet the needs of our visiting guests. Located close to Asheville, Hendersonville, Brevard (home to waterfalls and mountain biking trails), the Asheville Airport, Biltmore Estate, and all the best restaurants, breweries and shops in WNC!

COVID info: we are going to great lengths to keep our Air BnB safe for guests. Please do not book if you have any COVID symptoms or have potentially been exposed within the past 2 weeks.

The space
A full-sized mattress comfortably sleeps two adults. Play board games, work on your laptop, or enjoy your coffee at the cozy dinette. Coffee and tea essentials are provided.

The camper is parked next to our house but still affords plenty of privacy in this quiet, wooded neighborhood.

Lucy is a small 14-foot trailer so she is cozy but comfortable! There is not a ton of extra space for luggage but you are welcome to store belongin
neighborhood_overview: Our Air BnB is located  in a quiet, and very safe, neighborhood located in Arden, just south of Asheville.  There are wonderful  hiking trails within the neighborhood.
host_about: We are a fun, friendly family of 5 - living, working and playing in the beautiful mountains of North Carolina!  The  Asheville area has been our home for over 20 years so we are very knowledgeable about all the food/drink/nature/cultural destinations and experiences available to visitors.  We have created a mini-homestead on our suburban property, including chickens, gardening, mushrooming, canning, fermenting, and of course, updating our sweet little vintage camper!  We love sharing our homemade goodies with our guests and strive to support local as best we can!

name: Perfect Base Camp with all you need!
description:
The Wrens’ Nest, Ashevilla! The perfect couples getaway, or executive small home for traveling professionals.

This newly renovated cozy modern space with vaulted ceilings has tons of natural light.

4 miles from downtown, 4.2 miles to Biltmore Village and Biltmore House.

Guests are not required to physically stay 777 days, please see our site for details.

Well equipped kitchen with high end stainless appliances and granite.

Bedroom has luxury linens, queen bed, custom headboard.

The space
In accordance with the city of Asheville planning and urban design department, and by imperial decree of the office of the zoning administrator for the city, this charming unit is on a 30 day rental cycle.

If your desired dates are available, you’re in luck!

Guests will need to message me for help with completing your reservation.

Compare to the average $300/night hotel rate. You ge
neighborhood_overview: Nestled on a quiet street with respectfully quiet neighbors, guests will have plenty of privacy and a relaxing stay. Enjoy your morning coffee or evening drinks on the private back deck where you might get a visit from a neighborhood cat!
host_about:
A native of Asheville, I was raised exploring the outdoors, camping, motorcycling, and just generally developing an appreciation of the natural beauty here. 
When traveling, I always like to try and find the real local places to eat and things to see. I'm happy to tell people the same if asked. 
An animal lover from birth, I've had many adopted dogs and cats, and fostered several others when I can. I am a recovery room nurse at a local hospital. 
We live with our adopted dog and the occasional foster pet.

name: Daylily Delight- Camper on a farm close to town
description:
Enjoy the comforts of home in this remodeled 23' camper. It's tucked away on the edge of the woods with a tiny creek flowing at the foot of the spacious deck out front (with brand new patio furniture). Your view of the farm is clear as most of the leaves have fallen. You have privacy and many modern conveniences in this small but adequate space. It may even win you over into considering tiny-house living! Venture out to explore the farm, pet a bunny or smell the flowers.
.

The space
***Please be sure to read last paragraph-"’wif you have pets.

This 21 acre property is located just 5 miles from the center of Asheville and less than 2 miles from Haywood Rd. in West Asheville ( West is the Best). We're 1 mile outside Asheville city limit.

Due to these uncertain times, I first want to assure you that you’ll find an expertly sanitized, safe, and comfortable place to land. If you have any questions about how we’re being affected here in
neighborhood_overview: This is as rural as it gets within 5 miles of downtown. The closer you get to our place, the more spread out the houses get. It's quiet day and night, with very light traffic on the road leading in. Beautiful mountain vistas can be seen along the way if you take certain routes we can tell you about.
host_about:
Your Hostess:
Kelly is an unapologetic idealist & liberal, permaculture practicing free thinker.

name: Asheville treasure ~ Private apartment
description:
Nestled in an Ivy glen only three miles from downtown Asheville, your oasis awaits. A fully private space. Sleep on a foam air topper over a firm Queen mattress and enjoy the tranquil space of more than 800 square feet to relax and call your Asheville home. Additional 550 square ft. covered deck is furnished to enjoy carry-out dinners alfresco or simply rock on Grandmother's gliders. This quiet family neighborhood sits with easy access to everything on your to-do list.

The space
Designed for your privacy, your suite includes a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and television with Netflix. Wifi mesh network assures fast internet access. Queen sleeper sofa makes room for friends or family to share your adventures.

Guest access
Your apartment's private entrance is via your private covered deck with dining and relaxing spaces. Overlooking a lush green back garden, your entry glows with timed cafe lights, when your day's adventure is over,
neighborhood_overview: Ivy Glen is located in a lovely North Asheville family neighborhood.  Guests report the five-minute Uber ride to downtown will cost $6-$8. Convenient to breweries, event venues, restaurants, and groceries.
host_about: I love introducing this magical city to new visitors. Any chance to share the beauty that surrounds us is a delight. I am honored to be one of Asheville's rare longtime residents and happy to offer you ideas to create lasting memories for you and your children  Let my insider's knowledge give you an unprecedented visit.

description:
Be among the first to stay in this totally remodeled 700 sq ft vacation suite! Two blocks from the numerous shops, restaurants, galleries, breweries and events of Biltmore Village, 1/2 mile to the Biltmore Estate entrance, and 2 miles to downtown Asheville ($10 uber!). An abundance of extra artistic touches and curiosities make this a comfortable place to serve as base camp while you explore Asheville or just relax on a rainy day.
Permit# 18-09079.

The space
Enjoy the hand crafted sun-room created with up-cycled materials that connects into the living room and the front porch.
The private front porch has two Adirondack chairs, a porch swing and two tables.

Guest access
Guests have private access to the entire downstairs of the house. There is a small side yard that guest are welcome to use. There is parking space for guests to have two cars.

Other things to note

name: Historic River Arts District Home
description:
Contemporary 2BR/2BA private access apartment within our 1890 Queen Anne Victorian home, 1/2 mile to downtown Asheville, the River Arts District, and the South Slope - steps from the most wonderful eateries, breweries and bars. Right across the river from the hipster West Asheville. A quick 5 mile drive to Biltmore.
Ideal for two couples traveling together, or a group of friends, who can have fun together in the lounge or at the porch and have their privacy in the large and comfy bedrooms.

The space
The nice part is that there are two bedrooms with King size beds and two bathrooms so that everyone has their own private space from one another. If arranged in advance we can put a twin size mattress on the floor in the 2nd bedroom for a 5th person. In the living room space there is a coffee maker, microwave, mini fridge, toaster oven and electric tea kettle. Hang out with your friends on the front porch or in the living room. We have wireless internet if you
neighborhood_overview: We are about as close to downtown Asheville as you can get and still be in the River Arts District. Our neighborhood is called the River Arts District because this is where our local artists have warehouse studio spaces along the river. It’s so fun to stroll around and check out their art spaces, buy a little treasure and meet the artists! The area has been growing and changing over the past few years...including the addition of New Belgium Brewery which has invested a lot of money into making this area very cool! This house was built in the 1897...and most of the homes on this street are old....and many of them are starting to be renovated. We are on a busy 2 lane main road that connects the River Arts District to Downtown Asheville with quite a bit of foot traffic as well. There are monthly art walks and a ton of amazing art studios to stroll around. We also have a handful of delicious neighborhood restaurants: The Bull and the Beggar, All Souls Pizza, The Supper Club, Ultra Coffee a
host_about:
Hi there, I am looking forward to meeting you and to making your stay in my city memorable. After many years of living abroad on almost all continents, and traveling to over 100 destinations worldwide, I often return to my favorite town.
Being a traveler myself and an Airbnb guest, I value an impeccable service and genuine hospitality.

name: The Robin's Nest secluded garden retreat.
description:
Bright and airy guest suite with a private entrance located on a half acre park like property. Protected forest borders the property with the French Broad River just beyond it.
This sleepy community offers peace and quiet yet is just a stones throw from some of Asheville's best bars, breweries and restaurants as well as the River Arts District, Biltmore Estate and of course Downtown.
Perfect for single travelers or couples.

6 minute drive to downtown or skip the parking and Uber or Lyft.

The space
This private room is part of a larger home. Enjoy your own front porch area and outdoor fire pit, a deluxe king size bed with premium sheets, fresh linens and towels, and amenities like shampoo and soap while you stay. A large armoire in the bathroom is available for your use to hang clothing or store personal items.

The Space - The Kingsize bed is a brand new Serta Perfect Sleeper with a separate pillow top cover. There is a night table
neighborhood_overview: I love my neighborhood. It is quiet and secluded but so close to everything. Some of my favorite close spots are Asheville Pizza and Brewing, White Duck Taco Shop and New Belgium Brewing.
host_about:
I  am a Photographer and I live with my partner Zac. We moved to WNC 5 years ago after falling in love with the mountains and are very excited to share our  home with you.
We're both in our 50's with 2 grown children.
We love the outdoors and music, both of which are in abundance here.
We also love to share our favorite spots here in Asheville.

name: Modern Round House - Mtn Views - 2 Miles to DT AVL
description:
Enjoy beautiful, long range mountain views in all seasons from this unique mountain home. Super convenient location between downtown Asheville and the Blue Ridge Parkway (8 minute drive to downtown Asheville/ $10 Uber) and only 4 miles to the parkway.

The space
The upstairs level features an open floor plan with fully stocked kitchen, living room with gas fireplace, office, and deck that all look out to views of the Blue Ridge Mountains, as well as the master bedroom with king bed and full bath. Deck includes a grill and comfortable outdoor seating with a propane fire table. The perfect spot to enjoy your morning cup of coffee or a glass of wine/ local beer at the end of the day. Downstairs level has two bedrooms, each with queen beds, one full bath, living room area with TV, and deck. There is also a separate driveway and entrance to this lower level to provide ample parking for your group.

Guest access
Full access to whole house exce
neighborhood_overview:
Located 8 minutes to both downtown Asheville and the Blue Ridge Parkway, this house makes you feel like you are in the mountains away from it all but with direct access to the many attractions that make Asheville unique including the Biltmore Estate, Grove Park Inn, Craggy Gardens, and of course all the wonderful breweries and restaurants downtown.

Located just off of Town Mountain Rd, guest can walk/bike out the front door and access the several mountain roads and neighborhoods in the surrounding area.

For avid road bikers, motor cycle enthusiasts , and outdoor lovers, this is a great spot to access the Blue Ridge Parkway given its close proximity to the house.
host_about:
Grew up in Asheville and working in solar as a renewable energy and living with my wife Caroline and our dog Annie. 
Love the great outdoors including hiking and biking. Also enjoy trying the many unique local bars and restaurants in the area and encourage everyone to support local business where possible!

name: *Upstream Bachelorette*  Brand New, Amazing Views.
description:
River Arts District, minutes away from Downtown Asheville. Spectacular Modern Eco-friendly house with a hot tub and amazing mountain views. Designed for large groups and special occasions. The home over looks the French Broad River and the Biltmore Estate.

The space
Sleep 16 people. Designed specifically for vacation rental, this unique setup has all the comforts of home in the middle of all that Asheville has to offer. Parties and events not allowed.

Other things to note
Just bring your toothbrush. We will supply the rest.
neighborhood_overview: Our street, Upstream Way, was one of the last places where vacation rentals were allowed before the City outlawed them. Our properties were built for large groups and are not just converted family homes. The home is close to everything Asheville has to offer. This house is directly across from the French Broad River, Carrier Park, bike paths, the green way and a boat ramp. There are also outdoor activities just next door at Climbmax.
host_about:
I apologize for the strange photographs we have on our Plus listings.  We have no control over how they photograph our houses or how the pictures are displayed.   To solve the problem we had to build our own website...

You can search for us with the term “Upstream Way” and find some much better photographs and videos.   We also have lots of information on Asheville and travel tips for your visit.   Hope you can check it out.   We should be the first result if you search for “Upstream Way”.   I am also happy to answer any questions if you call or text (Eight 2 8) seven 7 eight-O 4 one 3.   

Tomorrow we have a group of photographers coming up from Charlotte to do more video tours.   That will be online as soon as we edit.   It seems like there are so many houses on AirBnB that people have difficulty figuring out which properties are good to visit and which are hiding behind trick photography.   It takes a lot of time and energy to find the good ones and hopefully our new website will help.

A few random thoughts as 2019 is winding down.  We have a few quiet weeks before the holiday and I have been thinking about the many guests who joined us this year.

Our specialty is large groups who want to spend time together In Asheville with all the comforts of home.   Bachelorette’s and Wedding Parties are probably the top occasions.   We also get to meet quite a few corporate executives who visit for team building.   All in all this has been a great year and I look forward to meeting your group, should you find yourself headed this way.

New thought:  Today is Friday January 11th, 2019. It is an otherwise typical, winter day here in the beautiful mountains of Asheville, NC. I have my usual work, building homes and raising a family. Something came to me this morning that I can’t help but mention.

For the past few months I knew it was coming. More on this later. First, some of the backstory...

My family travels occasionally and when we do, we tend todo so in a large group. We always book with Airbnb and invite our friends and family to join us.

A few years ago we rented a very cool, mid-century modern pool home in Fort Lauderdale. The place was decorated on the minimal side and was totally spotless. There was a lot of room for our friends and family and we had an amazing trip.

After that, I could not stop thinking about how to recreate the experience as a host in Asheville.  

I decided to stop building houses for sale and started designing them to keep.   

Now, life revolves around hosting our guests each week on a new street full of custom vacation rentals called Upstream Way.   

The properties are perched above the river and are close to downtown. The houses are all 4 stories tall and provide amazing panoramic views. Each floor has multiple master bedrooms and private baths. Lots of balconies and outdoor space. The furniture and finishes are right out of a magazine.

The first three available are Upstream Bohemian (sleeps 14-16) and the Upstream Penthouse (sleeps 16-18). I just finished The Upstream Bachelorette and we already have multiple bookings lined up! We are now breaking ground on a new custom home at 34 Upstream. We also have a retreat center in the works! 

In my quest to recreate our favorite Airbnb moments, I try very hard to make your visit special. If you have any requests to best prepare your house for arrival, please let me know.   

You can depend on me 100% during your stay. If anything comes up you can call me or text 24/7. You will never get an answering service or a stranger.

name: Charming 3BR, 6 Bed Haven | 10 Min to Downtown
description:
$75 fee per pet
Tucked away on a hill in a quiet residential area is our peaceful 3 bedroom, 2 and a half bathroom home away from home. Here you’ll find room to breathe, plenty of natural light, and just a touch of what’s familiar. We’ve made a peaceful place for you to relax, so you can focus on the next adventure.

The space
Located beside the entrance to the Blue Ridge Parkway and just 10 minutes from Downtown Asheville and the Biltmore Estate, you’ll find you are never too far from adventure and excitement. There’s easy access to I-40, 240, and 26, so getting around town is super convenient.

Make sure to stop by the Folk Art Center just off the Parkway, or head on up to Craggy Pinnacle for a more leisurely parkway experience. If you’re in the mood to shop, you are only 15 minutes from local shops downtown and artisan showrooms in the River Arts District. When it’s time to come back and unwind, you’ll find there’s space for your crowd and thei
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in a residential neighborhood within a few minutes of downtown Asheville. There is easy access to Interstate 40 or 240 as well as the Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about: Jon is a Realtor and Emily works in the mental health field.  We welcomed our first child into the world in October 2016. We've lived in North Carolina since 2011 and adore Asheville.

name: Heart of Asheville: RAD, West Asheville & Downtown
description:
Enjoy your private suite in the lower level of our beautiful 100-year-old house. We offer a clean, comfy stay convenient to: Downtown (1 mi), River Arts (.5 mi), West Asheville (1 mi), South Slope (1 mi), and Biltmore (2 mi). This is an urban area, next door to a housing authority (low income housing) on a street with historic homes. We live upstairs with our 2 small children. You may hear them, and us, as we all share this big old house.

The space
This location is truly awesome! It's a mile and half from downtown, West Asheville, and the Biltmore house. We're also walkable to the River Arts District (RAD), where you can explore artist studios, a brewery, wine bar, and some excellent restaurants. We suggest using Uber or Lyft at night.

Your suite is completely private with your own dedicated parking and entrance. The living room has a full sized futon (sleeps 1). Local art adorns the walls. The space is light filled and accented with plants. :)
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is made up of historic, 100 year old homes, as well as a housing authority apartment (low income housing) that is next door. It's a mile and a half from downtown, and from West Asheville, and is up the hill from the River Arts District, home of Asheville's artist studios as well as the original Wedge Brewery, and some fantastic restaurants. This is the real city experience in Asheville -- an urban mix with all kinds of people. Blasting music from passing cars at times adds to the vibe. Sometimes people ask for money in passing— please don’t give anyone money, no matter the story. We don’t want our guests targeted, so don’t start the cycle.
host_about: I have called Asheville home for the last 13 years. My partner Robyn and I have a toddler, Haven, an infant, James, and a scruffy old terrier, Ira. We live minutes from downtown in our 100 year old dream home. We hope your stay with us is restful, sweet, and as magical as this city we're lucky to call home.

name: The Hill on Lexington Market
description:
Breweries, restaurants, bars, civic center and shopping all walking distance. Park in your numbered reserved spot for your stay and walk for the rest of your journey.

The space
We have just expanded the space and it now has a separate bedroom and a futon in the living room so it can accommodate 3 guests. We now have a 58" ROKU 4k TV in the living room and a 4K ROKU TV in the bedroom. There is a sink, electrical outlet and vanity sink in the bedroom. There is also a writing desk with desk top USB and 3 prong electrical outlets. My space is unique because it is located in the Lexington Market area which is the Haight Ashbury type of neighborhood of Asheville. Guests can have a luxurious bath or show in the separate shower with 2 shower heads. Sink, plates, refrigerator, microwave and we have just added a picnic backpack with separate plates, utensil, glasses with a hot cold storage compartment for food. It even has a wine bottle cooler. For those beautifu
neighborhood_overview: Right downtown.  Half a block from 2 of the 3 vinyl record stores in Asheville.  1 block from Harris Teeter and Trader Joe's.  3 blocks from South Slope.  Walking distance to breweries and eclectic (Non-corporate) local shopping, restaurants and local live music venues.  ! block from Asheville Music Hall, Asheville one stop, 5 Walnut, Mtn. Madre, The Vault.  Across the street from the Civic Center.  1 block from Food Lion Skate Park.   Lots more within 2 blocks the entire downtown within 5 blocks.   Park your car in space #B25 and leave it for your entire stay.
host_about: I enjoy dragon boat racing and travel.  I have lived in Asheville most of my life from the age of 13 and enjoy hosting in a manner that provides insight into the local, "Flavors," that make Asheville unique.

name: Boho Bungalow in walkable West Asheville
description:
Stay in our new West Asheville Boho Bungalow, located in a quiet residential neighborhood within walking distance to hot West Asheville's Haywood Road. Many breweries, coffee shops, restaurants, bars, grocery stores & shops all within a :15 walk.
We offer your own private apartment with separate private entrance with plenty of available street parking. West Asheville offers many eclectic shops, restaurants, music venues and bars, and is only :07 to downtown or the Biltmore.

The space
Renovated in December 2018, this new apartment offers 400+ sq/ft private living with bohemian decor. The apartment has 1 bedroom, 1 full bath with tub, and a sleeper sofa for guests. The Bungalow now includes a semi-private outdoor space complete with a vintage-style patio set for 2 and string lights for ambiance. Perfect for that morning cup of coffee or a beer after your day exploring Asheville. Inside there are many special touches including exposed beams and custom
neighborhood_overview: Located in a quiet residential neighborhood in the heart of West Asheville, there are many breweries, pubs, restaurants, coffee shops, stores and grocery stores all within a few minute drive, or :10 walk on Haywood Road.  We are a :07 drive to downtown Asheville.
host_about:
Leah and I love to travel and see the world.  We enjoy a good beer or glass of wine  and enjoy hitting the trails in the Blue Ridge mountains as much as possible.  We love taking our dog and son out on walks, hikes and on the water.  We both moved to DC after college and met each other at work and moved to Asheville in 2018 to surround ourselves with the beautiful mountains.  Leah is a herbalist,  and I am a full time woodworker.  We have found a passion for hosting guest in beautifully curated spaces. 

We look forward to meeting you on our next vacation.

name: The Montford Jewel ☆ Blocks to Downtown Asheville
description:
Treat yourself to a stylish, hip, and relaxing stay at The Montford Jewel! This recently updated space is a 2 Bedroom, 1 Bathroom, 1250 square foot downstairs apartment nestled in the Historic Montford district, blocks from Downtown Asheville. We live upstairs above the rental and are happy to accommodate guests in any way during your stay. Our historic home is newly renovated for 2021, and it now offers ample amenities and a cherished experience for guests to enjoy in this perfect location.

The space
Our 1924 historic Montford home features ground-floor access. Prior to check-in, guests will receive a customized code to access the lock box with your key. Guests will enjoy a private entrance with french doors that open onto a furnished patio area. This space contains windows in each room (except the bathroom) to ensure that natural light reaches every corner. The Montford Jewel is an intentionally styled space that encourages its guests to unwind and relax. Als
neighborhood_overview: Historic Montford is one of Asheville's oldest and most sought after neighborhoods. Montford is a safe and unique area of Asheville to explore. The homes are influenced by Victorian era, Arts and Craft and Queen Anne styles. Our rental location is within 6 blocks of a Whole Foods Grocery, Trader Joe's, and Harris Teeter. Some of our favorite Asheville spots are within a 5-7 minute walk from the apartment, including Nine Mile (Caribbean inspired dishes for lunch and dinner), All Day Darlin (unique and delicious breakfast, lunch and dinner options), Chiesa (housemade pasta and classic Italian dishes- dinner only) and High Five (coffee shop featuring Counter Culture coffee and small treats). There is a playground located down the street (1 block away), as well as the Reed Creek Greenway, which is 2 blocks away from the apartment, and connects to the Botanical Gardens and UNCA campus. From the rental, it is about a 10-20 minute walk to downtown (depending on your walking pace and downtown
host_about: Social worker and attorney traveling the globe one stop at a time. We have lived in Asheville, NC for over a decade and cannot wait to share our favorite city with you!

name: New Apartment, Biltmore Village
description:
Brand new apartment in walking distance to Biltmore Village with many shops/eateries/breweries. We are minutes from the Biltmore Estate entrance and about a 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville. Our location is convenient to all Asheville has to offer. This new addition is connected to our primary residence but separated by 6 ft hallway/double doors for privacy/security and completely separate entrance. No shared walls The apartment is approximately 600 sq ft, very spacious w/vaulted ceilings.

The space
We are available if you need us, otherwise we keep to ourselves. We provide pretty much everything you would need for a long weekend or a month if you prefer.

Jim and I have provided short term accommodations for over 7 years through another site. Please feel free to contact us for direction to those reviews for your reference. An added note...we do the cleaning ourselves as we want the space as clean as we’d want for ourselves. We take pride in our cle
neighborhood_overview: We are in neighborhood bordering Biltmore Village. Convenient to everything.
host_about: Jim and I have lived in Asheville most our lives, raising 2 beautiful daughters and now enjoying 2 adorable granddaughters.  Life is good.

name: Rose Ranch Montford 1, central, sterile, secluded
description:
Totally separate from main house, light and cozy, your room has a private entrance and private bath. I sterilize everything! Can be rented in conjunction with "Rose Ranch Montford 2," allowing up to 2 additional guests. In Montford, 20 minute brisk walk to downtown. Wonderful, friendly, diverse neighborhood, 2 blocks from the Historic Riverside Cemetery. Many trees and Victorian homes. Great for walking, running, biking and getting exercise while social distancing!

The space
I have instituted extra cleaning and sanitizing regimes for your entire space, ensuring peace of mind for all. For longer stays, access to our washer and dryer upon request.

The bedroom and bath have been fully updated with new fixtures, windows, walls and floors, cork in the bedroom and marble in the bath. There is free parking on a very quiet street. More people walking dogs pass by each day than cars that drive by! Our place is surrounded by trees with lots of squirrels runnin
neighborhood_overview: Quiet shady neighborhood, with lots of kids and diversity. Our neighborhood is a mixture of ranch style homes, Victorian homes and cute bungalows. Great for running, walking and biking. An abundance of trees and flowers.
host_about:
Born in NC, attended UNC-Chapel Hill and got a degree in Journalism. My mom's side of the family has lived in Western North Carolina for the past century and a half. I have relatives buried in the Riverside Cemetery, which we can see from our backyard.
However, I lived most of my adult life on the West Coast. After college, I drove west in a school bus and eventually landed outside Eugene, OR, next to a creek, grew lots of my food, and had a sewing business, selling at the Saturday Market, Circle of Hands and craft fairs up and down the West Coast.
I have been to all 50 states, Canada, several Central American countries, Caribbean islands and Europe. I LOVE meeting people from all around the world and have studied conflict resolution in large groups of people using World Work. I am a therapist full time, offering massage therapy as well as Bodywisdom Therapy, helping people unravel the messages of their bodies, at a location on Merrimon Avenue. I speak a bit of French and Spanish, but am alas, no longer fluent.
My son and I moved back to WNC several years ago to be near my Mom, who lives in Yancey County. I know some sweet areas to visit around the area and are including them in a notebook in the rooms. 
I love being able to offer people a centrally located place to enjoy what WNC has to offer, as well as a prime walking neighborhood to have access to downtown Asheville hotspots. 
I turned both bedrooms and bathrooms downstairs into places that I would like to visit myself, using art from my own collection, and textures and colors that I love.
We have friends and family over on a regular basis so there is a bit of hustle and bustle at times. If you have children, or like to come and go and appreciate the outdoors, you will fit right in! If you want privacy, the private entrance and keypad will fit your needs. If you want total peace and quiet, I am afraid we won't be your cup of tea.
Living lightly on the earth is a core value for me so we recycle as much as possible, and keep our throwaway consumables to a minimum. 
Life is for loving, sharing and making the world better wherever we can.

name: Private and wooded! Minutes to Downtown Asheville!
description:
Private, tree top wooded views. Located on a 4 1/2 acre property in Asheville city limits. Minutes to downtown and west Asheville.
Private entrance, huge porch, king size bed with pull out queen sofa. Quiet, peaceful and private yet close to all of Asheville activities. Great bird watching!
Located near outlet mall, the Blue Ridge Parkway, the Arboretum, and great hiking! Great location to experience all Asheville life and also have a peaceful, private, wooded, get-away!

The space
Sunny and bright private space with large beautiful windows with views.
Due to the Covid pandemic we are committed to ensuring the safety and health of our guests through complying with the strictest cleaning regulations set forth by airbb.

Guest access
Access to entire space.

Other things to note
Friendly dog who may bark some and 1 cat on property.
neighborhood_overview: Homestay is private set back from road. Down the street is Ingles grocery, Outlet mall, Arboretum, Blue Ridge parkway, Bent creek hiking. Up the street is West Asheville, and easy access to hwy i-240, i-40 and i-26. Minutes to Downtown, Biltmore Village and Pisgah Forest.
host_about: I live in Asheville, N.C. in the States. I own my home and a Community Acupuncture practice. I host and travel with my partner Donnie. We are both friendly folks.

name: Asheville Mile North Urban Suite 1.0
description:
Let our fresh one-bedroom apartment located approximately one mile north of dynamic downtown be basecamp for your Asheville adventure. Live like a local in a renovated 1940s mixed-use building walkable to dining and groceries, the park and a greenway. Whether you're in town for business or leisure, our flat is set up to be your home away from home so you can relax and recharge while visiting our Appalachian wonderland.

The space
Sleeps 4
1 bedrooms [1Q] and 1 Q sleeper in living area
Full kitchen with coffee maker and toaster
Full bath
Second-story [stairs required to access]
Front shared balcony with table/chairs
1 parking space included
Apartment is located above office space that is in use M-F approximately 9a-5p

Guest access
Entire apartment is available for you to enjoy. There is also a shared balcony.

Other things to note
Note the cancellation policy when booking — we do not i
neighborhood_overview: Walkable [via sidewalks] to our favorite local comfort food @ Homegrown and awesome local BBQ @ Luella's. Vegan raw food Plant is also nearby along with several faves like Taco Temple, Gan Shan and many more. Trader Joe's, Harris Teeter and Whole Foods only 1/4-mile away. Located along Merrimon corridor connecting Downtown & N. Asheville –– downtown accessible via sidewalk. Botanical Gardens 1-mile away via greenway [which begins 1/2-mile down the road]. Stock up on running gear at local running fave Jus' Running.
host_about: I'm a mom of two boys, a wife, a runner/athlete and VP/owner of a few businesses related to real estate in addition to being a Realtor –– so it's safe to say I wear a lot of hats. I love to play outside in my beautiful backyard of Western NC but also in the sands of Folly or any beach really. I'm a bit of a hermit, but also have an adventurous itch that needs to be scratched via travel and exploring new areas.

name: Friendly Hollow Haven
description:
Relax in this private guest suite in a quiet neighborhood in West Asheville. The suite features windows with plenty of natural light and a separate entrance looking out over the backyard with large oak trees. Just a five minute drive from bars and restaurants in West Asheville, and fifteen minutes from downtown and from the Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
The space includes a large studio bedroom with a queen bed, convertible sleeper sofa (full sized; comfortably sleeps two small children or one adult), and two person table. A mini fridge, microwave, dishes, and coffee/tea station are provided. NOTE: To comply with city of Asheville homestay permit requirements, no stove/range, oven, or kitchen sink are able to be provided. The hallway features full access to laundry and a private bathroom. A locked door at the end of the hall ensures your privacy and you have a private entrance through the backyard with a keypad lock system with a code individualized your stay.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a hidden gem in the city that feels like it's in the country. Large trees and substantial backyards give the homes privacy and the home is located on a dead end street with very little traffic. Minutes from Sky Lanes bowling alley, the Malvern (bar/gastropub), Taqueria Munoz, Frostbite Ice Cream, and Rocky's Hot Chicken Shack. Aerial Space, a local studio for trapeze and aerial silks lessons, is five minutes away.
host_about: Anna and Justin live in Asheville, North Carolina. They enjoy learning about new places, especially the fauna, flora, and local foods.

name: Sunny Historic Urban Retreat Easy Stroll Downtown w/ Parking
description: Pull back the curtains in the evening and watch the cityscape shimmering. This second-floor apartment is in a building dating from 1910 and has been fully renovated. It features antique and Mid-Century wooden furnishings, decorative rugs, and colorful artwork.  *Please note we have another apartment on the first floor you can book by searching https://abnb.me/o2Ri8IyK96 or “Historic Urban Getaway Stroll Downtown w/ Parking”
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the thriving Five Points neighborhood connecting downtown, the Greenway, UNC Asheville, and beloved Montford. With amazing city views, many of Asheville's best restaurants, bars, and breweries are a short walk away.
host_about:
A resident of Asheville for over 26 years. I love the local food scene here. I am happy to recommend anything from a simple hike with amazing views, to the spots to hang like a local. 

Let me know if you have any questions I am happy to help!

name: Close to Everything! RAD, Downtown & West Avl
description:
Enjoy your private suite in the lower level of our beautiful 100 year old house. We live next door to a housing authority (low income housing). We live upstairs with 2 small children who get up early. You will hear us moving around. We supply ear plugs and a white noise machine for those wanting to sleep in. Downtown (1 mi), River Arts (.5 mi), West Asheville (1 mi), South Slope (1 mi), and Biltmore (2 mi).

The space
This location is truly awesome! It's a mile and half from downtown, West Asheville, and the Biltmore house. We're also walkable to the River Arts District (RAD), where you can explore artist studios, a brewery, wine bar, and some excellent restaurants. We suggest using Uber or Lyft at night.

The apartment is private with your own entrance. You have a private living room with a full sized futon (sleeps 1). Local art adorns the walls. There’s a new central air and heat system.

On the other side of the wall is another unit. We ha
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is made up of historic, 100 year old homes, as well as a housing authority apartment (low income housing) that is next door. It's a mile and a half from downtown, and from West Asheville, and is up the hill from the River Arts District, home of Asheville's artist studios as well as the original Wedge Brewery, and some fantastic restaurants. This is the real city experience in Asheville—an urban mix with all kinds of people. Blasting music from passing cars at times adds to the vibe. Sometimes people ask for money in passing— please don’t give anyone money, no matter the story. We don’t want our guests targeted, so don’t start the cycle.

We are close to the best of everything: Downtown (1 mi), which is the heart of it all; River Arts (.5 mi), where all the art studios are, and The Grey Eagle music venue; West Asheville (2 mi), with a mix of awesome bars and restaurants; South Slope (1 mi), home of some of the best local breweries; and Biltmore (2 mi), the ic
host_about: I have called Asheville home for the last 13 years. My partner Robyn and I have a toddler, Haven, an infant, James, and a scruffy old terrier, Ira. We live minutes from downtown in our 100 year old dream home. We hope your stay with us is restful, sweet, and as magical as this city we're lucky to call home.

name: Chic, stylish luxury in the middle of downtown fun
description:
When you come to Asheville you want to stay where all the fun is, right? In the middle of all the great restaurants, bars, micro breweries, shops, art galleries, artist studios? You want to park your car somewhere easy and safe, and then walk to all the great and interesting things that Asheville is so famous for? Well, that's exactly what our downtown apartment offers: chic and stylish luxury with private parking in a location that is so central that you'll never need your car.

The space
Our apartment is located in the brand new Asheland building, in the middle of downtown. It faces west with a view over the downtown roofs and the beautiful Blue Ridge mountains in the background, and gets a lot of natural light. Our private balcony offers beautiful sunset views. Inside the decor is modern and warm with a classic Dutch twist. Luxurious finishes and comfortable furnishings, a fully equipped gourmet kitchen, a spacious bathroom with walk in shower, a quiet and comf
neighborhood_overview: Downtown Asheville is rightly famous for its amazing restaurants by award winning chefs, its unique craft and microbrewery scene, its vibrant artist studios and art galleries, its lively music scene, and its great shopping. Our apartment is located in the middle of downtown, in easy walking distance of the up and coming South Slope area, the River Arts District, and a short drive to the Biltmore Estate and the Grove Park Inn. And of course all the riches of our mountains are at your doorstep, for hiking, biking, climbing, rafting, zip lining and other fun
host_about: I love living in Asheville; it's full of interesting people, great food, art, and music, and surrounded by stunning mountains and forests. Let me know if you'd like recommendations for cultural or outdoors activities; I'll be glad to help!

description:
Come enjoy the mountains! We have taken the CDC recommended steps to ensure your wellbeing.

Fully stocked kitchen, island bar stools, a large table with six chairs, and four more folding chairs in the garage.

The living room has a large TV over the gas fireplace. The lower level has one bunkhouse style bedroom with a queen, a bunk bed with twin on top and doubles on the bottom, a full bathroom, and a family room. The fireplace is gas on the lower level.

The space
This is an excellent location for your mountain getaway. Enjoy the mountain atmosphere while also taking advantage the wonders that the city of Asheville offers.

At this convenient location you are only a matter of minutes away from the top outdoor attractions such as the Blue Ridge Parkway, the NC Arboretum, the Asheville Outlets, and the Biltmore Estate.

The Lazy Bear property is just a mile to Bent Creek Community Park trail system with easy trail acc
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood and a perfect place to walk the kids and dog.  Community park down the street.
host_about:
Ron is a Asheville/WNC native.  He loves hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic and ancient mountains.   

Darlene relocated from Michigan to Asheville a few years ago. She loves visiting  quaint  towns in and around Asheville and local attractions like the Biltmore Estate as well as discovering new hiking trails.  Her outdoor passion is kayaking and rock climbing.

Most of our vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, dog friendly and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back. Please see individual properties for their unique features. 

We both are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

We look forward to sharing the WNC area with you!

Darlene - Director of Operations and Concierge
Ron - Property Manager

Great crash pad for all you outdoor sports junkies! Huge dry covered porch will house all your adventure gear. Brewery hopping is easily done. Uber in minutes to Sierra Nevada.

In minutes-
Airport and I-26 8
Sierra Nevada Brewing 10
Biltmore Estate 20
DTN AVL 25
DuPont State Frst and Brevard 30

The space
This space is new to me and it is a very comfortable little pad. It has two bedrooms and full kitchen in an open floor plan. Big comfy couch, great water pressure, big hot water heater, fast wifi, new 55 inch UHD TV.

Very warm and cozy in winter, cool in summer. Great sleepy space, you get in here and can't hear a thing going on outside.

This is the lower floor of a two level duplex. The uppe

My home is located in quiet residential area very close to downtown Fletcher, the Y, and Ingles grocery store. Its an up and coming little neiborhood convenient to many area attractions. There is a small mobile home park next door with older, quiet residents.

The greater Asheville area covers a lotta territory, so being 30 minutes outside down town AVL puts me closer to points to the South. So attractions of nterest would be Sierra Nevada Brewing Brevard and Oscar Blues , Dupont State Forest, Davidson River - trout fishing, waterfalls, Blue ridge Parkway. Likewise to the east there's Fairview, Chimney rock, Bat Cave.

The neighborhood and home site are not picturesque. Some guests have reviewed and left comments that neighborhood is rundown, and there is some truth to that. It's residential, and close to town. I actually bought the place as an investment property and the location suits long term rental. That said, the space is cozy, sealed off from the

Captain Rahn

description:
Clean & modern space in nature:
Fantastic for outdoor enthusiasts...convenient to mountains, trails, and BlueRidge Pkwy. After a day on the trails, grab a beer and a snack at one of the many tasty options nearby. We are an outdoorsy family that loves this town and are happy to share tips on where to ride, hike, see, and taste.

The space
Ah, that fresh clean smell! Please note we are prioritizing health and safety. After each guest we carefully clean and then sanitize with disinfectants and microfiber cloths. name: Modern Condo in the Heart of Downtown Asheville
description:
Park your car and leave it for your whole stay! This luxury condo is located in the middle of Downtown Asheville. You will be steps away from Asheville's famous restaurants, breweries, and independent stores. This is the perfect Asheville location!

The space
Rankin Press Lofts is a modern/industrial masterpiece with exposed brick throughout, original wood floors, concrete counter-tops, and modern furnishings.

The bedroom has a Queen bed with a Tempurpedic mattress, and two each of Tempurpedic, side-sleeper and down pillows. A dresser and full closet will store all your belongings comfortably. There is also a full stack washer/dryer, iron and ironing board for your convenience.

An outdoor balcony with a cozy bistro table is perfect for and evening glass of wine or your morning coffee. Everything you need is included for your stay, including: linens, towels and bath products, cookware and cooking utensils. Just show up and relax!
neighborhood_overview: Rankin Press Lofts are in the center of Downtown Asheville. You will be within steps of some of the best restaurants, breweries and attractions our city has to offer. From Lexington Avenue Brewery to Table Restaurant, and from Malaprops Independent Bookstore to Pritchard Park's famous drum circles, you'll be able to both relax and take in much of the city.
host_about:
I love Asheville and the Southern Appalachian Mountains. Along with my partner I enjoy hiking, camping, waterfall swims, the occasional skinny-dip, cooking, gardening, beekeeping, and pretty much anything else outdoors.
And I love being an Airbnb Host! Creating a space where you feel cared for, safe and pampered brings me so much joy! 
Come enjoy the mountains. Let me help you create a memorable experience in one of the most unique cities in the Southeastern United States. It would be my honor to host you.

name: Historic Urban Getaway Stroll Downtown w/ Parking
description:
This beautiful light-filled, well-appointed apartment is located on the main floor of a historic home in the heart of thriving Five Points neighborhood, connecting downtown, the greenway, UNC Asheville and beloved Montford. Downtown Asheville's best restaurants, bars and breweries are an easy walk from this central location. This urban home is a delightful base for exploring Asheville. The apartment is a permitted short-term rental. Note we have another unit at https://abnb.me/mcqrNiIK96

The space
Built in 1910, the building which houses two vacation rental apartments on the first and second floor respectively, overlooks downtown. Purchased by new owners, the house was totally renovated in 2018.

The downstairs apartment: A private entrance leads visitors into an airy space that overlooks downtown with great nighttime city views. The spacious and comfortable 850 square-foot apartment offers sofa and den seating, an eat-in kitchen and a comfortable pri
neighborhood_overview:
Five Points sits in a triangle tucked between the Merrimon Avenue and Broadway Street corridors, just north of downtown Asheville. Lining the cluster of prime residential homes that makes up Five Points are an array of businesses – groceries, spas, coffee shops, bars – all easily accessible by foot. With Downtown Asheville to the just to the south, bordering the north end of Five Points is the University of North Carolina at Asheville.

Five Points is an eclectic and soulful urban Asheville neighborhood where the mix of residential and business combine to create a thriving part of the city with a distinct vibe.

A majority of the neighborhood homes are historic wooden bungalows and craftsman 4-squares built between 1900 and 1925. Redevelopment has brought coffee shops, breweries and craft cocktails, modern housing, and new mixed-use office and apartment buildings. The neighborhood is centrally located, houses a triangle of grocery stores, a multitude of other busine
host_about:
A resident of Asheville for over 26 years. I love the local food scene here. I am happy to recommend anything from a simple hike with amazing views, to the spots to hang like a local. 

Let me know if you have any questions I am happy to help!

name: Rose Ranch Montford 2, central, sterile, secluded
description:
Totally separate from main house, light and cozy, your room has a private entrance and private bath. I sanitize everything thoroughly in between guests.

Can be rented in conjunction with "Rose Ranch Montford 1," allowing up to 2 additional guests. In Montford, 20 minute brisk walk to downtown. Wonderful, friendly, diverse neighborhood, 2 blocks from the Historic Riverside Cemetery. Many trees and Victorian homes. Great for walking, running, biking and getting exercise while social distancing!

The space
I have instituted extra cleaning and sanitizing regimes for your entire space, ensuring peace of mind for all. For guests with longer stays, we can provide access to our washer and dryer upon request.

The bedroom and bath have been fully updated with new fixtures, windows, walls and floors, cork in the bedroom and marble in the bath. There is an electric log fireplace for extra heat with a romantic flickering flame. Mini frig, electric teapot
neighborhood_overview: Quiet shady neighborhood, with lots of kids and diversity. Our neighborhood is a mixture of ranch style homes, Victorian homes and cute bungalows. Great for running, walking and biking. An abundance of trees and flowers.
host_about:
Born in NC, attended UNC-Chapel Hill and got a degree in Journalism. My mom's side of the family has lived in Western North Carolina for the past century and a half. I have relatives buried in the Riverside Cemetery, which we can see from our backyard.
However, I lived most of my adult life on the West Coast. After college, I drove west in a school bus and eventually landed outside Eugene, OR, next to a creek, grew lots of my food, and had a sewing business, selling at the Saturday Market, Circle of Hands and craft fairs up and down the West Coast.
I have been to all 50 states, Canada, several Central American countries, Caribbean islands and Europe. I LOVE meeting people from all around the world and have studied conflict resolution in large groups of people using World Work. I am a therapist full time, offering massage therapy as well as Bodywisdom Therapy, helping people unravel the messages of their bodies, at a location on Merrimon Avenue. I speak a bit of French and Spanish, but am alas, no longer fluent.
My son and I moved back to WNC several years ago to be near my Mom, who lives in Yancey County. I know some sweet areas to visit around the area and are including them in a notebook in the rooms. 
I love being able to offer people a centrally located place to enjoy what WNC has to offer, as well as a prime walking neighborhood to have access to downtown Asheville hotspots. 
I turned both bedrooms and bathrooms downstairs into places that I would like to visit myself, using art from my own collection, and textures and colors that I love.
We have friends and family over on a regular basis so there is a bit of hustle and bustle at times. If you have children, or like to come and go and appreciate the outdoors, you will fit right in! If you want privacy, the private entrance and keypad will fit your needs. If you want total peace and quiet, I am afraid we won't be your cup of tea.
Living lightly on the earth is a core value for me so we recycle as much as possible, and keep our throwaway consumables to a minimum. 
Life is for loving, sharing and making the world better wherever we can.

name: Almost Heaven Cabin-Asheville
description:
Almost Heaven Log Cabin is the perfect mountain getaway for just one couple or a group. This sweet Appalachian style cabin is located on a private road with wooded surroundings.

Listen to the mountain brook that runs beside the cabin while relaxing on the porch. Only a 10 minute drive to grocery store and 20 minutes to downtown Asheville. Great romantic getaway and plenty of space for a group.

The space
One of the best features of this cozy cabin is its convenient location being only 20 minutes to downtown Asheville and many attractions like Biltmore Estate, antique shops and breweries.

Located in beautiful Riceville valley, the cabin has a lot of warmth and character with 1800 sf. of space. It has original pine wood floors and updated appliances and TVs. It’s nestled in the trees in a wildlife habitat, located at 3000 ft. elevation.

The cabin has with plenty of space and light spread over 3 levels. Relax on the big sof
neighborhood_overview: The cabin is located in a small mountain community in the Pisgah National Forest.  The drive to the cabin is very pastoral and scenic.  We are located in what is called the Bull Gap area of the Blue Ridge Parkway.  There are other houses in the community but it is very spread out with 1-3 acres between houses.
host_about: My husband and I love Asheville and all the wonderful things it has to offer.  We really enjoy hiking and gardening in the outdoors.  We have lived here for over 15 years.  Here is our cabin (Hidden by Airbnb) Page.  Check us out!  (Website hidden by Airbnb)

name: Cozy Get Away: West Asheville 2 MI to downtown
description:
Close to downtown, West Asheville’s pub/restaurant scene on Haywood road, river access at Carrier Park, canoe rentals, climbing wall/bike rentals/tube rentals, local pub/coffee house nearby and quick access to expressway. Less than 13 miles to the airport. Only 2 miles from Downtown. Quiet neighborhood close to many pubs/restaurants. A pizzeria and brewery walking distance away. Walk to the river too!!

The space
Private suite away from heavy traffic but close enough to the action. Have a Roku TV. No cable. 6ft 8in ceiling in part of the room.

Guest access
Top deck is yours to enjoy. Also after a long hike or whatever enjoy the jacuzzi tub

Other things to note
Please don’t park directly across the street in the yellow lines. The neighbors use these because they don’t have parking in their yard. There should be room at the house for 3 cars done properly. Caution with the city electric pole pulling in/out. It’s best t
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood but close enough to walk/uber to popular eating/drinking spots. Parking on one side allowed but please don’t park directly in front of house between the yellow lines. There is room for three cars on site if done properly. Careful of the light pole pulling in/out of the small semi-circle.
host_about: My lovely wife and I enjoy Asheville very much. The vibe can’t be beat. Beer, food, music...The top 3 things to enjoy away from home?  We both enjoy helping others experience this wonderful place.

name: Downtown Asheville Bright, Serene Cottage
description: Roll out of bed in a fresh, modern, mindfully appointed cottage; then walk out the front door into vibrant downtown Asheville. Take an easy stroll to Asheville’s famous breweries and five-star eateries. Only a stone’s throw from The Thomas Wolfe Auditorium and Harrah's Cherokee Center. The space features an open floor plan with vaulted ceilings. Enjoy cooking your own meals or just making a hot cup of coffee in a fully outfitted kitchen.
neighborhood_overview: The home is set in the Montford Area Historic District of Asheville, steps from vibrant restaurants, cafes, breweries, and shops. Head into Downtown to visit the Asheville Pinball Museum, then check out a show at the Thomas Wolfe Auditorium. Asheville takes great pride in its beer culture; stroll to any of these downtown breweries to see why!
host_about: I am a mathematician, educator, student, seamstress, athlete and mother.  I like to make jeans, lift heavy weights, design quilts and float down hills on my mountain bike. I am a proud Asheville Native and I’m honored to share my dreamy little town with you. Some of my favorite adventures have been  hiking to Machu Picchu, surfing in the Galapagos Islands, canopy research near the Amazon River and skiing with my family in Whitefish Montana.

name: Exceptional Location in the Heart of Downtown AVL
description:
Welcome to the Cozy Cottage in the heart of downtown Asheville! We provide a clean and safe environment for you to enjoy, a true home away from home. We are the only licensed 'Whole House' (stand alone house) Rental in Downtown Historic Asheville!

Our cottage is an 'Architectural Jewel' nestled amongst the few historical homes that line this charming street. Situated in the heart of downtown Asheville, all the activities and excitement of downtown are only a short walk away.

The space
This 120 year old historical cottage has been completely restored in recent years and is equipped with all the amenities of modern living yet keeping the ambience of yesteryear. All new plumbing, electrical, HVAC, roofing, it is in perfect shape. The heart of pine wooden floors, stair railings and pocket doors are original to the house and have been beautifully refinished. Whether you have a group of friends or just your family, this is the downtown home that offers ever
neighborhood_overview: Charming Church Street offers a relaxed mix of development, from churches and clerical buildings to professional offices (law and architecture) and a couple of residential homes.
host_about:
We owned an art gallery in downtown Charleston for more than 20 years, but eventually decided to turn it over to a wonderful couple who will carry on its legacy for years to come. 
We have two rental suites on Market Street in the very heart of historic downtown Charleston and have advertised these and our cottage in Asheville for several years on another vacation rental website. Our guests have loved their stays with us and altogether we have received close to 500 five star reviews. 
We love Asheville and have been visiting for many years! Eventually, we decided to purchase our "mountain" home within easy walking distance to historic downtown. We have lovingly restored and furnished the cottage and are delighted to share this beautiful place with others interested in the beauty and splendor of the mountains and the vibrant lifestyle of downtown Asheville.

name: Admire Local Art at a Boutique Studio Perched on a Hill
description: Peruse the ornaments and furniture from around the world that fill this unique space in a laid-back, walkable area. The flat is accessed through a serene, private garden, a lovely spot to sip local coffee in the morning serenaded by birdsong.
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful north Asheville is a quiet, safe neighborhood within walking distance of the historic Grove Park Inn for a drink in front of one of the great fireplaces or on the veranda. Make the short walk to the local brewery and popular restaurants.
host_about:
Hi! I am Traci and along with my husband Treavis, we are the team behind Studio 21. We are two silly hearts who met a few decades ago and have been navigating this life (holding hands and bonking elbows) ever since. My entire career has been in the hospitality industry and Treavis is an engineer, not to mention Jack of all trades extraordinaire. Together we own a sweet little local bistro called fig, celebrating its fourteenth year and counting. We don't have our own children but we have 16 employees who we call family, plus a ridiculously spoiled golden retriever named Truman.
Between the two of us we have many interests, some discovered later in life such as drumming for my husband. (better than a motorcycle!) I am an aspiring artist, part time chef and lover of life. We are both very active in our community and consider ourselves natives.
We share wanderlust between us and have traveled many places on this wonderful earth including all of the lower 48, Europe, Mexico and most recently Cuba. We love meeting people from all walks of life as we have open hearts and open minds. We have thoroughly enjoyed the Airbnb experiences we have had and have rarely been in hotels since. We have the same approach as guests as we do hosts, always be kind. We love this city we live in. Come and let us share it with you.

name: Cooper Cottage
description:
Charming, modern, newly renovated guest studio. It’s located along side my personal residence in a quiet little neighborhood just minutes from downtown Asheville, NC. Uber is available. It’s quiet and close to everything.

The space
This unique stand alone studio is just a short 15 min drive to downtown Asheville, NC. Minutes away from enjoying a day of mountain biking, hiking, or fishing in the beautiful blue ridge mountains. Spend the day exploring the Biltmore Estate and enjoy a quite night in your own quarters.

Guest access
Guest have access to the entire space.

Other things to note
I do have an outdoor/indoor cat that could possibly stop by to say hello. She is grey. I also have a golden retriever that lives on the property. He is on a leash and friendly, but may bark.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is relatively quiet with few neighbors. It is located close to a local high school and neighborhood sports park with a public swimming pool.
host_about: I am a native of  the beautiful mountains of Western North Carolina.  I am a retired sales professional and I enjoy spending time with my grandchildren.  I call the mountains home,  but I really enjoy traveling to the beaches of North Carolina, South Carolina, Florida and the Bahamas. I also enjoy a quick trip to New York City or Chicago for some amazing food and shows. I am excited to be a part of this community. I look forward to meeting people from all around the globe.

name: Bent Creek Escape
description:
We’re located in Bent Creek, right across the street from a 22-acre community park, with immediate access to hiking/Mtn biking trails, and about 2 miles from the BR Parkway, French Broad River & the Arboretum. It’s a quick 15 min ride to downtown. Our 22x14’ room is brick, simple and rustic with it's own private entrance. The private hot tub is right outside your door. Plain and simple, this is a fun, romantic getaway.

Other things to note
If you mtn bike then know that you have immediate trail access and can shoot across the street to our community park, warm up on our pump track and then hit Rice Pinnacle and the Bent Creek Experimental/Pisgah Forest trails right from the house.
neighborhood_overview: We are proud Ashevillians and even more so of the Bent Creek neighborhood you’ll be staying in, with kind and laid back folks and physical access to so many beautiful natural resources.
host_about: My wife and I have been in Asheville since 2004 and absolutely love western North Carolina.  We enjoy the trails, mountains and the French Broad River along with all the music, food and craft beer in this region.
