Tucked away in Asheville's Enchanted Forest..get away to a magical, 3 bdrm secluded, mountain retreat. Surrounded by trees, wildlife & trickling stream. Acres of tranquility & 15 mins to Downtown AVL & The Biltmore! 8 mins to Blue Ridge Parkway hiking, views & waterfall. Immaculately clean, cozy, open & airy, dream home w/ vaulted ceilings, wood burning stove & forest views! Close to all that AVL offers. Off the beaten path in a peaceful, invigorating landscape. TV, WIFI, BBQ, Hammock, Wildlife.

The space
Escape to a magical oasis...where modern and luxurious comforts meet rustic-nature's beauty. A "choosy" nature lovers delight! When you're looking for a unique Asheville experience, that captures a perfect balance of seclusion, yet so close to downtown, Biltmore, breweries, the Blue Ridge Parkway, everything - this is it! A quiet, private, peaceful mountain place to unwind, get creative, write or work & view wildlife. Relax with a local beer or glass of wine a
neighborhood_overview: This is a very SAFE, FRIENDLY, QUIET, BEAUTIFUL and PEACEFUL FOREST NEIGHBORHOOD - you will love it. In the mountainous forest of Asheville. Close enough (15 minutes or less) to several freeways, Blue Ridge Parkway, hiking, downtown, breweries & The Biltmore.  But tucked away in forested mountains with a small stream on the property, birds, squirrels, chipmunks, turkeys, deer, bears and other occasional animal visitors.

name: Spacious Room: Comfy & Clean, 1 mile Downtown/UNCA
description:
You will have private access to one half of our clean, comfortable and quiet home in North Asheville. One beautiful, spacious second floor room, private Bath and Living Room and a fantastic location for visiting the area!

Relax on our large front porch complete with rocking chairs. Enjoy the garden and fruit trees. One large spacious room w/loft, two beds & private bathroom, for up to 4 people.

The space
Large, well lit, private room available on the second floor with a private bathroom. The Loft Room contains a queen bed in the main room and also has a loft area with a double futon. The Loft Room sleeps up to four people total. Private bathroom is located just outside the bedroom door off the landing. There is a small nook upstairs that currently has a coffee maker and microwave for your use.

*Please note that due to Covid-19 the kitchen and dining areas are closed to guests at this time. We thank you for understanding.

Located o
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood, we have large space that feels very private with a bamboo patch, fruit trees, honey bees and a garden. Many of our neighbors also keep gardens and honey bees. A few of the immediate neighbors have been living here for many, many years.
host_about:
Bill has lived in Asheville for over 25 years and his wife Christina joined him in North Carolina in 2012. 

West Street Palace started as a one room farm house many, many years ago. Bill began to remodel the home when he purchased it 25 years ago, adding rooms, stories, a hand dug basement and love in every piece of wood in the home. Bill is a bee keeper, gardener, highly skilled wood worker and a Dad

Christina creates beautiful Goat Milk Soaps, Lotions and cheeses and conducts a series of Educational Workshops, Homestead Experiences and Farm Tours at their beautiful Farm in Yancey County, one hour north of Asheville. Christina has been teaching outdoor education and sustainable living skills since 2003.

name: West Asheville Modern Farmhouse
description:
Modern Farmhouse in the Heart of West Asheville

The space
Walk to West Asheville while staying in a private bedroom with private entrance and porch on the main floor of our brand new, green-built home.

The Room:
This cozy space offers a queen sized mattress on a hand-made iron bed frame built by a local blacksmith. There are several pillows with varying firmness, plenty of extra blankets and a space heater.

There is a comfortable chair for sitting and a small desk with space for a laptop.

We provide coffee and tea, sugar (and alternatives) with half & half and filtered drinking water. A mini-fridge is stocked with complimentary sparkling water. Breakfast bars are provided to get you going in the morning. Take a short walk to Biscuit Head, Sunny Point or Bim Beri Bon for a full breakfast. Odds Cafe and Izzy's Coffee are even closer with a wide variety of coffee drinks and an assortment of pastries.

The bathroom
neighborhood_overview:
Farmer's Market (Tuesdays) Great Restaurants, Shopping, Bars/Clubs, Music Venues, Theater, Coffee Shops, Library, Yoga and more - all within a short walk.

We feel fortunate to have an awesome group of neighbors that consist of local bar/restaurant owners, artists, educators, musicians, health care practitioners, engineers, carpenters and lots of kids.

While sitting on the porch, you'll see people walking their dogs, riding bikes and jogging by in front of the house. At times, it seems that we have more foot traffic than car traffic. Most of our neighbors are kind and personable. Feel free to say "hello" and strike up a conversation if you like.
host_about: We live in the mountains of North Carolina and love the outdoors. My husband and I prioritize family, community, environment and health. We work on clear and conscious communication and try to model a high level of integrity and fairness for our son.

Nice amenities at a competitive price. I try to keep my calendar full by being your first choice and the best value in the area. I specialize in medium to long-term rentals to travel nurses. Feel free to inquire about options. I may be able to accommodate you on dates that don't show on my calendar.

The space
Your private suite is in a 3-bedroom house. It has a queen-size bed with a very comfortable memory foam mattress.

Guest access
Guests can share the living room, kitchen, dining room, deck, and yard.

Other things to note
A second bedroom is occupied by the host and a third bedroom is available for rent and may be occupied by another guest of the host or a renter who may share the common spaces.

Optional weekly housekeeping includes dusting, vacuuming, changing the sheets, cleaning the bathroom, and emptying the trash. The charge for this service is $25.00.

Parking is limited to 1 car or picku
neighborhood_overview: My house is in a quiet, walkable, safe neighborhood. Neighbors are friendly and can often be seen taking walks or jogging alone, with family, or with dogs. Don't be surprised if they wave at you. You may see some wildlife such as rabbits, groundhogs, deer, or an occasional black bear.
host_about: I'm a frequent traveler who loves adventure. I enjoy discovering new places and returning to old, familiar places. I've been a guest of numerous Airbnb hosts and have had some awesome experiences. Airbnb is a great way to find unique housing at affordable prices and to meet some nice people along the way. I work in the hospitality field and I enjoy hosting guests in my home as an expression of my personal hospitality.

name: The Hilltop Hideaway
description:
Relax in the Hot Tub after along day of sightseeing! Welcome to our home situated on beautiful hill with lovely Mountain views. Our home is located just minutes to the Outlet Mall, grocery store, Blue Ridge Parkway, NC Arboretum, Restaurants, Biking Trails, Waterfalls, Breweries, and so much more. We are convenient to all major Highways & just 15 minutes to the airport and Downtown Asheville. This is our 3rd AirBnb and we are delighted to have you as our guests!

The space
We have Three very spacious bedrooms with Queen sized mattresses and luxury linens. 2.5 bathrooms with tubs and a 6 person Hot tub!

Guest access
Access to all of the house, Garage has items in it so it is not usable space.

Other things to note
SO convenient to EVERYTHING in Asheville
neighborhood_overview: Directly across from Fordbrook Riding Stables
host_about: Hello!  I am a Cross fit Chick, I Love to travel to Key West ( and many other places), I have 2 AWESOME teenage daughters, and I  work with my handsome hubby of nearly 21 years. I am not originally from Asheville, (Ricky is), but we both love the Western NC Mountains.   I am a local Realtor in the Asheville area and have been here since 1991. He owns a local turn key construction business and has since 1993. We decided to take a chance and remodel our very first vacation rental since we had the best spot in Asheville! Making people happy is one of our main goals. We love meeting new people and would LOVE to meet YOU!

description:
This Airbnb offers a private entrance, two bedroom apartment with a bathroom attached to a family home. Our place is right outside of downtown Asheville and conveniently off of Tunnel Road. This Airbnb is perfect for couples, small families, or soloists.

The space
Separate private entrance to Airbnb apartment which is attached to my family home. Self-check in with the coded lock on door. There is a mini fridge, a microwave, and a Keurig with complimentary coffee and tea. There are also complimentary snacks and toiletries. There is a cot in each bedroom closet for extra sleeping space.
neighborhood_overview: We're a short drive (or a small walk) to the Blue Ridge Parkway with access to great hiking and outdoor activities. There's also hiking trails right in the neighborhood. Our convenient location in East Asheville puts you near many restaurants, grocery stores, the VA hospital, and walking distance to the ART bus stop. We're very close to downtown Asheville and only 20 minutes away from the airport.
host_about: I am an educational sign language interpreter in Asheville, NC. I have lived here for 20 + years and love this area! I love to hike with my dogs,  play in the water, and spend time with my adult children. I also love turning people on to all the Asheville has to offer!

name: Yurt at Odd Bits Farm: hike, pond, pool.
description:
Comfortable 16' Yurt, with enclosed hot outdoor shower, compost toilet and sink, all next to a pond and old logging roads, 15 minutes from downtown and 8 minutes to lots of West Asheville action. (Do check out our AVL Guide).

You’re at a family homesteading permaculture life project, founded in 2017. We're planting organic food and fruit, flowers, bamboo and hemp.

We also have a Treehouse here, are working on therapy/spa area. Pool is open.

Self check-in and check-out, privacy and distance.

The space
The yurt is a traditional Mongolian design, made by a local craftsman. It's comfortable and spacious, perched on a 24'x24' deck in the forest and near the farming area. It's a very private and discreet place, there are no more properties beyond ours so our backyard is 300+ acres of NC forest. We're located very close to the city and all that it has to offer. The perfect combination between private nature glamping and easy access to
neighborhood_overview:
We are located 7 minutes from West Asheville's restaurants, breweries and other cool stuff. 15 minutes from Downtown Asheville, full of happening stuff. We can definitely recommend things to do and share guides and listings of events, things to do.

Please refer to our guidebook for some recommendations: https://www.airbnb.com/s/guidebooks?refinement_paths[]=/guidebooks/1459566&share_channel=copy
host_about:
Our family bought 9 acres in West Asheville we're developing as a food, hemp farm, wellness and tourism destination. We're at the end of our road that leads to  more than 350 acres of forest at the foot of Spivey Mountain. Fantastic location near all that Asheville has to offer: restaurants, hikes, breweries, waterfalls, fun!  or just stay here and relax...

Check out our AVL guidebook:
https://www.airbnb.com/manage-guidebook?s=listing_details

We're planning to offer food events, add meals to our offerings for our guests.
Also, Sarah, my wife, is a massage and watsu therapist. We'll be offering her services soon. 
We make chocolate and will offer chocolate/cacao experiences as well. 

Steve is a Real Estate Broker at Keller Williams Pofessionals in Asheville and can help you find your mountain dream home and investment property in the Blue Ridge Mountain...

Welcome to Odd Bits Farm. 

We also own a 100 acre farm in Ecuador, full of cacao, fruit, waterfalls, beauty!

name: Porch, Patio, Proximity! Home Near Dtwn Asheville
description:
Experience Asheville - and avoid the crowds - at this vacation rental house in Arden! This 3-bedroom, 2.5-bath home offers chic decor, modern amenities, and a backyard deck perfect for summer cookouts and evening cocktails. With 4 seasons full of color, North Carolina is a year-round destination sure to suit any visitor. Check out Sierra Nevada Brewery 5 minutes away, cruise the Blue Ridge Parkway, explore the art districts of Asheville, or tour the Biltmore Estate!

The space
Master Bedroom: King Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: Queen Bed | Private Den: Queen Sleeper Sofa

This beautiful two-story house is complete with all the charm and comfort you could ask for. From the quintessential front porch to the well-appointed furnishings in the living room, you'll find everything you need to make your Asheville visit great!

During the downtime, send the kiddos up to watch movies on the flat-screen TV in the third bedroom, while the adults s
neighborhood_overview:
Asheville awaits 20 minutes away! This lively city boasts funky vibes, top-notch venues, and multiple art districts. Foodies are encouraged to take a walking food tour, while beer enthusiasts hop between local breweries!

If you don't want to make your way into the city, head over to Sierra Nevada Brewery, just 5 minutes from the property!

20 minutes away you'll find the Biltmore Estate - a must-visit while you're in the area. Browse Biltmore Village before taking a tour of the historic grounds.

No matter the season, the North Carolina landscape is sure to impress! Cruise down the Blue Ridge Parkway to see the colorful foliage in the fall, and spend snowy winters on the Wolf Ridge Ski mountain, just 53 minutes away.

Take a day trip outside of city to visit the charming neighboring towns located within an hour of Arden, including Hendersonville, Brevard, and Chimney Rock!
host_about:
Hi! We’re Evolve Vacation Rental, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

description:
The first bungalow built-in 1920's 'West Asheville Estates' off Vermont Avenue, this totally renovated charmer is a delightful way to unpack, get your mountain bearings and relax. Expansive sunny back deck and historic covered front porch to take in the mountain air. Fast WiFi for efficient remote work. Local WAVL food scene still cooking and delivering fine fare. Decorated with a whimsical combination of antiques and modern art, prepare yourself for a very memorable stay.

The space
The Owner delights in giving guests the best of the best when it comes to quality as this family also uses the house when in WAVL so it is appointed with the finest in comfort! The most delightful beds and linens and crisp towels. A cook's kitchen is appointed for leisurely mornings! The dining room calls out for serious gourmet food take-out from a block away and next-day planning conversations. Make a cocktail at the bar and enjoy a sunset off the back. The delightfully quiet very f
neighborhood_overview: You are JUST walking blocks away from the HEART of DT. West Asheville where bakery/coffee roasters/live music/fine dining/organic renown local food/burgers/ethnic favors and the list goes on. The point is after you park your car and unpack your walking shoes or your bike for you will never need your keys again for 30 days. UBER comes to the front door! Food delivery from Asheville's finest to the front door!

Wild turkey, bear, sunrises/sunsets, fire pit, large porch, 6min to Blue Ridge Parkway, 15 to Biltmore, 15 downtown Asheville... It is the best of everything and we love it! Our driveway is steep, but was recently (9-20) improved with recycled asphalt to make driving up much easier. No shared living spaces, one small rental next door over the garage. Owners may be staying in the suite in back which has it’s own entrance.

The space
If you are looking for a mountain experience but also close to town this is the place! We have plenty of relaxing space with an abundance of windows allowing for relaxing natural light and gorgeous views.
The recent addition of a large stone patio out front to enjoy the views is a spectacular way to unwind after a day of exploring.

The main floor has a foyer, 1/2 bath, kitchen, living space with two sided stone gas fireplace, and a dining room. Th
neighborhood_overview: We have a few neighbors around but can not see anyone from our house. Be sure when you are on Cedar Knob Rd to pass 36 and keep coming up the gravel to the top. You will also pass several signs about no trespassing but keep coming up the mountain. Please be careful to not use 36 Cedar Knob for any turnaround.
host_about: I grew up in the charming town of Brevard at the gateway to Pisgah National Forest. I’m married with  four children ages 18-25, enjoy hosting International students, hiking, coffee shops, all kinds of music, and always love to travel when we can!

name: Bamboo Dreams-A Sanctuary for Adventure
description:
Relax in the stylish comfort of this beautiful Asheville home. You’ll melt in the Italian leather couch at the end of your day’s adventure hiking or exploring waterfalls; or before you jet off for live music & world class cuisine. The kitchen is fully equipped with new appliances; dining room w/seating up to 8, & custom wood bar. The master bedroom is fit for a king w/a pillow top bed. Grill on the deck, tell stories by the fire, or sip bourbon on the porch, you’ll feel right at home.

The space
Bamboo Dreams is an open floor plan home. We have a few smart home touches such as a Roku for your streaming pleasure, a bluetooth sound system with fun lights, and a Kuna bath fan/light in the Master Bath which streams your music wirelessly. Of course, there is wi-fi throughout. In the event that you have to work, there's a workspace with a printer. If you played hard and need to wear that outfit again, we have a washer and dryer in the home. Hate dishes? Ther
neighborhood_overview: This is West, West Asheville baby!  You are conveniently located between the adventures you seek, and the cuisine you crave!  Bamboo Dreams is located 10 minutes to West Asheville’s Haywood Road; 12 minutes to the NC Arboretum; 13 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway; 14 minutes to the Biltmore Estate; 15 minutes to beautiful downtown Asheville; 16 minutes to Highland Brewing Company; 20 minutes to the Grove Park Inn; and at the gateway for all your mountain adventures in WNC!  And, the grocery store, pharmacy, and other amenities are 5 minutes up the road.
host_about: From Negril to Montreal, from San Franciso to Dijon, I've been fortunate to travel to a few different countries and most of the US.  One of my favorite trips was to Boliva as a cultural ambassador representing the US.  Although I'm no longer a professional dancer, I still love to move in one way or another, such as hiking Angel's Landing in Zion National Park.  My husband is Venezuelan, so I get to practice my Spanglish.

name: Asheville Area Home w/Patio-11 Mi to Biltmore
description:
Seeking access to North Carolina's limitless outdoor recreation? Or, easy access to attractions like the Biltmore Estate and Looking Glass Falls? Both can be found minutes from this Fletcher 3-bed, 2-bath vacation rental for 6, featuring amenities like a full kitchen, gas fireplace, and a gas grill - perfect for summer night barbecues. Additionally, the property boasts a prime location away from the crowded, tourist spots of Asheville, but close enough that you won't be in the car all day!

The space
Master Bedroom: King Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: Full Bed

Upon arrival, a charming yard greets you as you make your way into this idyllic Fletcher home base! Complete with wireless internet access, central air conditioning, and a relaxed-yet-sophisticated decor, this house will have you feeling comfortable almost instantly.

After a day outdoors, curl up in front of the living room's flat-screen cable TV. Don't worry! There's ample sea
neighborhood_overview:
Relish in the home's peaceful neighborhood location, which lies just a short walk from restaurants like Blue Sky Cafe and Jonny Mac's Lowcountry Grille & BBQ! Additionally, you'll be minutes from essentials like grocery stores, pharmacies, Fletcher Park, and more.

But the reason you came to Fletcher in the first place - the endless opportunity for outdoor recreation - lies just about 11 miles west of the property. The Nantahala National Forest is home to great hiking, mountain biking, and rafting, along with beautiful waterfalls such as Looking Glass Falls and Sliding Rock. Prefer sightseeing? Drive north about 12 miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway for a scenic cruise through the forest. Visit during the fall to lay eyes on the foliage's peak color change!

More outdoor fun can be found at Chimney Rock State Park, 33 miles away, and Pisgah National Forest found about 45 miles north. No matter where you spend your day, end it with a cold brew at Sierra Nevada Brewing C

name: Cal’s Cabin
description:
Traditional log cabin on a large private lot with beautiful Mountain Views. Spacious living room with large stone fireplace. Three bedrooms and a full eat-in kitchen. Two great covered porches for spending a lazy afternoon and enjoying a peaceful natural setting. 8 minutes to downtown Asheville & The Biltmore Estate. Only a half mile away to the Blue Ridge Parkway and some of the most stunning vistas imaginable. Mt. Mitchell and Mt. Pisgah are both just a short drive.

The space
Beautiful 3 bedroom log home that feels like it’s in the woods, yet just minutes from everything exciting Asheville has to offer. Sit outside and listen to the sounds of nature and in 8 minutes you can be downtown enjoying a great meal, seeing a live show, or strolling and shopping. The Biltmore Estate is just 4 miles away. Art galleries, The North Carolina Arboretum, Folk Art Center, amazing waterfalls in Pisgah National Forrest, and Mt. Mitchell ( highest peak of the Appalachian
neighborhood_overview: Asheville (aka Beer City) known for an awe-inspiring array of local breweries, and an amazingly diverse food scene. Take a walk through downtown on any given evening and experience mountain hospitality, great local arts and lively street performers.
host_about: I’m a married, father of one amazing kid. I love experiencing new places and cultures, gardening, cooking and spending time with friends and family. As your host, I want to offer a great vacation home in an ideal location.

name: Historic 5Points Duplex Stroll Downtown w/ parking
description:
A house with two beautiful light-filled, well-appointed apartments located up and downstairs in a historic home in the heart of thriving Five Points neighborhood; connecting downtown, the Greenway, UNC Asheville and beloved Montford. With amazing city views, many of Asheville's best restaurants, bars and breweries are an easy walk from this central location. This urban home is a delightful base for exploring Asheville. The house is permitted as a short-term rental through the city of Asheville.

The space
Built in 1910, the building which houses two vacation rental apartments on the first and second floor respectively, overlooks downtown. Purchased by new owners, the house was totally renovated in 2018.

2 private entrances leads visitor into airy apartments that overlook downtown with fantastic city views day and night. Best suited for 4-8 people, the spacious and comfortable apartments offers sofa and den seating, 2 eat-in kitchens and 2 full living r
neighborhood_overview:
Five Points sits in a triangle tucked between the Merrimon Avenue and Broadway Street corridors, just north of downtown Asheville. Lining the cluster of prime residential homes that makes up Five Points are an array of businesses – groceries, spas, coffee shops, bars – all easily accessible by foot. With Downtown Asheville to the just to the south, bordering the north end of Five Points is the University of North Carolina at Asheville.

Five Points is an eclectic and soulful urban Asheville neighborhood where the mix of residential and business combine to create a thriving part of the city with a distinct vibe.

A majority of the neighborhood homes are historic wooden bungalows and craftsman 4-squares built between 1900 and 1925. Redevelopment has brought coffee shops, breweries and craft cocktails, modern housing, and new mixed-use office and apartment buildings. The neighborhood is centrally located, houses a triangle of grocery stores, a multitude of other busine
host_about:
A resident of Asheville for over 26 years. I love the local food scene here. I am happy to recommend anything from a simple hike with amazing views, to the spots to hang like a local. 

Let me know if you have any questions I am happy to help!

description:
King Bed Master Suite. Looking for a quiet mountain getaway, a little peace for you and your special someone, live music and craft beer in Beer-City?

This mountain retreat is nestled in beautiful Riceville Valley, minutes from downtown Asheville.
6 guests, 3 bedrooms, 3 beds, 2 baths.

Just minutes from the center of Asheville, find your way to relaxation with country setting and mountain views. Culinary and music dynamics makes Asheville always ranked top in the area.

The space
This home is a ranch with a porch view of the mountains. There are cathedral ceilings, an open-plan layout living area. Linens are provided for the 3 bedrooms, a master with a memory foam king bed and incredibly spacious master bath, including a tiled walk-in shower. The 2nd bedroom has a memory foam queen bed with a bathroom across the hall. The 3rd bedroom has a memory foam queen bed with a bathroom down the hall. High Speed Wifi throughout, and chargi
neighborhood_overview:
Warren Wilson College has hiking trails 5 minutes away and the parkway is 5 minutes taking you anywhere from the Pisgah Mountains to Craggy Pinnacle.

The kitchen is large enough to space out and create whatever fabulous meal you have in mind.

Or settle by the fireplace with a cup of tea.
host_about:
I am a proud retiree who loves Asheville and everything it has to offer.  From the gorgeous natural setting, to the outdoor activities, to the eclectic mix of people, to the abundant variety of AMAZING food, to the thriving music scene.

I'm right around the corner from Hidden River Events, The Swannanoa Gathering, The Summer Soirée, The Leaf Festival, Shindig on the Green, The Biltmore Estate, The Grove Park Inn Resort and Spa. The Tryon equestrian center and more.

I have lived in Asheville since 1981.

Hope to see you soon, 
Randy

name: Private North Asheville Bungalow No Cleaning fees
description:
Private, quiet, modern bungalow. Newly updated with designer finishes in North Asheville. Can accommodate additional guests if needed.

Private entrance and parking.

Located between UNCA and Merrimon Ave. Bike or Uber to downtown. Walk to restaurants, bars and coffee shops.

We also have an electric car charging station for your use, just give us heads up if you need it.

The space
This bungalow also includes use of the upper porch area. This is a very large space with large table for dining and two very large couches with two coffee table. Tables also functions great as a work space. Floor cushions are also available in this area. The porch has electricity for your plugins. Details are listed in house manual.

Guest access
Large porch area can be used by guest. Go through the gate and up the stairs. Barn doors close for privacy. Wired for music. Just ask Alexa to play your favorite tunes. Blinds can go
neighborhood_overview:
Pennywise Coffee, Green Sage Cafe, Zen Sushi, Vinnies Italian, Urban Burrito, CVS Pharmacy, The Hop Ice Cream Cafe are a few places located just down the block on Merrimon. Two block walk or more is the restaurant Avenue M, Asheville Pizza and Brewing Co (they are have a movie theater where you can drink and eat while you watch a movie), Whit Frozen Custard, The Scarlet Bee (one of my new favs), HomeGrown and Luella’s Bar-B-Que (good southern food). Ingles, Whole Foods, Trader Joe’s Are just a few places 1 mile radius from our home.
Botanical Gardens at Asheville a .8 of a mile walk (great location to sit on rocks in the stream and read a book) also a picnic.

Asheville has some of the best food that you will find anywhere. Most restaurants are “Farm to Table”. Also nearby towns like Weaverville and Black Mountain have a lot going on.

Downtown Asheville. So close, just a tad over 2 miles. Lots to do.
My favorite thing to do is go to the Drumming Circle”
host_about: I love being an Airbnb host. I love exposing others to the wonderful community and serenity of the mountains in Western, NC. I live in a community where we embrace each other and celebrate individual uniqueness. We have here a pocket full of art, music, food and drink that you will not find anywhere. Nature is right here at your fingertips. Walk a trail or walk downtown and you will catch the spirt of why you will also want to be here. Catch a zip line and soar through the horizon or just drift down the sounds of nature on a float. I love my community and hosting.

name: New! Beautiful rental 5 blocks to Downtown
description:
Private entrance 2 Bedroom plus big sunroom apartment. Newly remodeled and beautifully decorated. This is the ultimate Asheville retreat, while still being a short walk to downtown and many amenities: 2 Blocks to Vegetarian restaurant, Plant, 2 Blocks to Trader Joe's, 4 blocks to Elements juice bar, 4 blocks to Liberty Street Cafe, 4 blocks to Asheville Yoga, 4 blocks to Whole Foods, 5 blocks to High Five Coffee, 6 blocks to Downtown! Come walk our city and enjoy a beautiful space to come rest.

The space
The house is a large duplex. Our family used to live upstairs (with preschooler and 2nd grader, Papa Eric and Mama Angie). We recently moved to Raleigh NC for a few years, while Angie attends graduate school. But this remains our Asheville home-base.

We remodeled it when we moved out and are in love with the new decor and furnishings. We love this neighborhood - right in the middle of everything we want to access in Asheville, but tucked above and aw
neighborhood_overview:
We really love our neighborhood. We are on a busy street, Merrimon AVE, but our property is elevated about 1 story above the street level, which creates privacy and safety. We enjoy riding bikes and walking to all of our favorite spots in town. And the neighborhood that we're right on the edge of, Claxton Hills or Chestnuts Hills makes for lovely neighborhood walks. Sometimes you might even see a black bear wandering about the neighborhood (no joke). Keep your distance, but don't be too alarmed. They're here the same reason you're here, to eat good food and enjoy the beautiful scenery ;)

Traveling with CHILDREN?
Here's some places I recommend if you're traveling with children:

There's a few parks within walking distance:

1.)The closest is at St. Mark's Lutheran church on Merrimon and Chestnut. They leave it open to the public while the sun is up and it's about 3 blocks away; it's great for toddlers!

2.) Weaver park on Merrimon and WT W
host_about:
Originally from a small town in Southern Illinois just outside of St. Louis, I now love living in the mountains of Western North Carolina.  We love living in the middle of Asheville where we can walk or ride our bikes to everything. We are also landlords of 14 apartments in Asheville and 1 AirBNB. But what we love most is spending time as family with our 10 year old daughter, Penelope, and 6 year old, Hugo. Family hikes, enjoying Asheville's culinary scene, and people watching at some of Asheville's many festivals are some of our favorite things to do as a family.  Staying in Airbnb’s while traveling is our preference, because it’s homier and more accommodating with children. 

Peace,

Angie

name: La Maison du Bonheur: The Calm Suite
description:
Welcome to my peaceful home on a quiet street located only 7.7 miles from the Asheville Airport (AVL), 2.5 miles to the entrance of The Biltmore Estate, and 5 miles from downtown Asheville. Access to the Mountains-to-Sea Trail is within walking distance with the Blue Ridge Parkway only five minutes away. With Interstate 40 Exit 51 only 1.5 miles away, you will have convenient access to the best of Asheville.

The space
The Calm Suite offers a king-sized bed, a spacious sitting area, a large writing desk, and a walk-in closet. This large room has a full private bathroom. Be sure to save time in your itinerary to enjoy some coffee or hot tea in this serene space. When you book this room, I will block my other listing so that you have complete privacy.

If traveling with friends or family, The Peaceful Room with a double bed is available for booking upon request. Both rooms would then share the full bath.

Guest access
Guests are wel
neighborhood_overview: You'll enjoy the best of both worlds here as my peaceful home is set on a quiet private wooded acre yet is only 2 miles drive from Biltmore Village and The Biltmore House & Estate entrance.
host_about: I am a free-spirited, outgoing woman who loves her North Carolina mountain home. Originally from Québec, I've collected and decorated my home with French Canadian art as well as my handcrafted pottery. For over fifteen years, I have worked as a tour guide at The Biltmore House & Estate. I enjoy gardening, walking, bird-watching, being in the outdoors, and spending time with friends and family. I look forward to sharing my knowledge of Asheville with guests from all over the world.

This little casa is light and bright, and close to everything! I love simplicity and texture, mcm and color. Functionality plus aesthetics, as well as being pet- and adventurer-friendly. I love supporting local makers and shops, and you will see that reflected in The Aerie’s furnishings and decor.

The space
Enjoy this open house and spacious fenced in yard all to yourself!

Guest access
Entire property: house and yard, except the shed which remains locked.
neighborhood_overview: Our street is just outside of Asheville city limits, but within Buncombe County.  So don’t be surprised when you see that neighbors have livestock on their property! Many neighbors have chickens and turkeys, and a few have larger livestock like cows and goats.
host_about: I have been an Asheville resident for over a decade. A former livestock farmer, I am now working seasonally in the service industry and am often on the road. When not working, my pup and I are usually outside in the sun getting after trails/rocks/waves, or reading and drinkin' beer.

name: Chicken Pie Alley, walkable to downtown
description:
Welcome to our private downstairs apartment that has been lovingly renovated to offer easy comfort minutes from the heart of downtown Asheville. Nestled on a quiet cottage lane, our space offers a clean, welcoming and private space that is easy walking to coffee houses, pubs, restaurants and the civic center (4 blocks away).

The space
1 bedroom apartment walking distance to downtown Asheville, no need for Uber (save $). Eco friendly with many added touches to make your stay relaxing and comfy. Coffee, tea, organic breakfast, microwave (for heating up those yummy leftovers from the many amazing restaurants near by), fridge. Fun decor, quality linens, comfy bed.

Guest access
The apartment is all yours with private entrance. Access to washer and dryer if needed. Our backyard, although a work in process, offers a quiet sanctuary from the bustle of the city. In the summer and fall you are welcome to fresh veggies from our garden.

O
neighborhood_overview: Montford is an adorable historic district right in the heart of downtown Asheville. The coffee shop is a 3 minute walk, the neighborhood pub, a 4 minute walk, delicious local restaurants, the greenway that takes you to the botanical gardens and UNCA where the tailgate market is happening every Saturday morning. Or you could head into downtown, 3 blocks in the other direction to find all of the eclectic shops, food, breweries and music that make Asheville worth visiting,
host_about:
We are a small little family of three, me, my husband, Rick, and our 12 yr old daughter, Trinity lane. We have lived in Asheville since our daughter was born and love it! I'm a licensed professional counselor and Rick is on Ski patrol at Cataloochee ski resort and a fly fishing guide. We chose to fix up a historic bungalow right on the edge of town so that we could walk everywhere. We have recently completing the basement to create our own airbnb space. 

We love to travel like locals, having unique experiences connecting to people where ever we go. We are action oriented people who can also appreciate being pampered a bit. There's nothing better than going for a day of hiking, biking or rafting then coming home to a wonderful meal and high quality sheets. 

Five things we can't live without: 1) yummy food that is good for the body and the soul 2) to connect to the culture and people where ever we travel 3) humor, fun, laughter 4) expanding our knowledge of the world around us 5) enjoying the simple comforts like - good coffee, beautiful flowers, morning breezes, walks to the neighborhood park.

Gorgeous personally custom made office table made from solid wood floats over 2 chairs creating the per
neighborhood_overview: Only a 10 minute walk or 2 minute drive away from the Woodfin Riverside Park which is great for a scenic stroll along the French Broad River.

The food and the craft beer here are among the best and it's the perfect size without being too packed with heavy traffic.  I also love to travel, especially overseas. name: Nana's Cottage 3 miles from downtown, pet friendly
description:
Nana's Cottage is a two bedroom home located in a country setting yet only 3 miles from downtown. It is a short ride to everything you want to do in the Asheville area, including wonderful dining, gorgeous hiking, and antiquing. The Biltmore estate is 15 minutes away. After a day of sight seeing and adventure, Nana's Cottage is a great place to call home. You can cook a meal in the fully appointed kitchen, go on the internet, or just relax.

The space
Our home has a comfy living room with a sectional sofa, dining area with seating for 6, a fully equipped kitchen and a tiled bath with a tub/shower combination. The entire home has wood floors and is professionally decorated. The walls are decorated with antique theatre posters.

The large master bedroom has a king size bed with a bamboo mattress. The large second bedroom has a queen size bed and a desk and chair.

The home has plenty of parking, has a great deck and a large fenced yard for you
neighborhood_overview: Asheville boasts activities which will satisfy all in your travel party. Hiking trails and outdoor activities such as horseback riding, canoeing, and whitewater rafting are within easy driving distance. Skiing and a zipline tour are within a 20 minute drive. For the shopper in your group, Asheville has a host of antique shops, boutiques, art galleries, and crafts. Evening activities include diverse dining options, movies, live theatre, live music, or just walking through Asheville's energetic downtown filled with street performers and art. The Biltmore estate is breathtaking in summer and glorious when decorated for Christmas. Chimney Rock Park is worth the 20 minute drive. Wonderful hiking and beautiful views await you in every direction. A drive on the Blue Ridge Parkway in autumn highlights the beautiful peak colors. There are many festivals throughout the year for the whole family.
host_about: We are oriiginally from the northeast but have joined our two children and our grandchildren.  We live down the street and are available if any questions come up.

name: Passive solar house 14 mi from Asheville
description:
This net-zero house is conveniently located on one secluded acre 5 miles from Asheville Regional Airport, 6 miles from Sierra Nevada Brewing Company. Built-in 2020 by Blue Ridge Energy Systems, Asheville's oldest green builder (est. 1977), it features large south facing triple pane windows, six-inch walls, 6.5 kW of PV panels, and a Tesla destination charger. Handcrafted cherry bed frames support queen size Casper memory foam mattresses in each bedroom and a handcrafted cherry table seats six.

The space
Our house is conveniently located near airport, restaurants, breweries, and hiking, but is secluded and extremely quiet due to the triple pane windows and heavy insulation. It features a fully equipped kitchen with handcrafted maple cabinets, granite countertops, and a large induction cook top. The four person hot tub is located on the large covered porch permitting it to be enjoyed in almost any weather.

Guest access
Guests have access to
neighborhood_overview: Our house is secluded with woods all around giving a great sense of privacy. A nice southern view can be enjoyed prior to the leaves coming out in the spring.
host_about: I am a super host who lives outside of Asheville North Carolina where I have been building extremely energy-efficient homes for the past 40 years. I hike, bike, play ping-pong, and mentor young people.

name: Mimi's Cottage in Asheville, North Carolina
description:
Mimi's Cottage is in the Kenilworth section of Asheville. It is a quiet, walkable community with wonderful neighbors. The area is located in the middle of the city but has the feel of living in the country. It is a five minute drive to Mission Hospital while also only five minutes from the Biltmore Estate. Downtown Asheville is ten minutes away.
In addition to being conveniently located, Mimi's Cottage is comfortably nestled by century old white oak trees and hemlocks.

The space
The owners of Mimi's Cottage are recently retired university professors. The campus and community are favorite topics for conversations that guests find useful as the seek sites for relaxation, recreation and entertainment.
neighborhood_overview:
Kenilworth is a neighborhood favored by walkers and bikers, The streets are calm with little or no traffic while the guests often encountered well kept gardens. Occasionally, a flock of turkeys may also be seen.
Grocery stores and mall shopping are nearby
host_about:
We both have recently retired from the faculty of the University of North Carolina Asheville.  As Professors Emeriti we have continued our social justice work in the city, county, region and state.  The pace of life and beauty of the area suit our tastes.  Summer is simmers rather than roasts; Fall is a spectacular Color Show of changing leaves; Winter is well mannered and provides well paced snow days; and Spring is simply spectacular. We enjoy the seasons.  Our other enjoyments include impromptu gatherings with friends and neighbors; gathering, preparing and eating various cuisines; and going "down the mountain" to Atlanta or the beaches in the Charleston area.
In Asheville Mimi's Cottage s centrally located but does not have the feel of intense city life.  The Kenilworth neighborhood is ideal for walking and talking to neighbors. But watch out for nature - birds of all sorts can be seen along with an occasional fox or bear.

name: Centrally Located Luxury Bungalow
description:
This new, stunning bungalow is in the heart of Asheville, the River Arts District, and directly overlooks New Belgium's Taproom. PARKING, ample space for off-roading gear, and a gorgeous lawn/balcony where you can take in the view.

Enjoy Breakfast at Ultra Coffee Bar, Lunch at All Souls Pizza, tour artist's studios, & catch a show at The Grey Eagle. Take a short walk over to the French Broad Greenway, or grab a beer over at the Wedge Brewing. There isn't a better location than this.

The space
This gorgeous and modern 2BR/2BA s brand-new, sleek, and outfitted with some rare perks, like marble bathrooms, ample parking, an outdoor firepit, and vaulted ceilings.

Guest access
Entire House

Other things to note
Check-Out Instructions

Before you go there are a few things we ask that you do:

1. Double-check that there are no longings you left behind
2. Make sure all windows are closed
neighborhood_overview:
Navi House is located in the heart of RAD. We are directly across from New Belgium Brewery (which is open from 11am-8pm daily so enjoy quiet mornings and evenings) and a short walk across the bridge will put you in the middle of all River Arts District happenings. Enjoy other breweries such as The Wedge, local art studios, fine dining, or catch a concert at The Grey Eagle. If walking isn't your thing, we are less than five minutes away from the 240 and downtown & West Asheville. Please note, we are also less than five minutes from Earth Fare Grocery.
For those looking to enjoy the outdoors, we are less than a mile from The Adventure Center of Asheville and within walking distance of the newest French Broad River Greenway.

name: Sun & Swim with family on an NC Mountain Getaway!
description:
Sun and swim with family in the NC mountains!
8 bedrooms, 12 beds
3 Kings, 4 Queens, 5 Twins, 4 sofas
Beautifully decorated private home perfect for multi-generational families. Close-to-town yet secluded, you will have total privacy as you swim/sun in the private swimming pool, enjoy the sunset from the front porch rockers and share stories by the fire pit. Enjoy a spacious, professional kitchen and a 14-seat dining room/table.
This home is the perfect setting for a magical, easy vacation.

The space
This home is perfect for family groups, multi-family vacations, and other folks looking to have privacy and spend time together. The house is not appropriate for parties or events and are not allowed.
Sleeps in beds: 19
Max capacity: see room layout below. There are 22 places to sleep including 3 sofas
Bedroom/sleeping layout:
Main Floor:
BR 1: King bed with ensuite bathroom. This is the master BR (plenty of room for crib,
neighborhood_overview:
South Asheville is loaded with great food, shopping, shows, activities and more. Close to the Asheville airport, Biltmore Estate, Sierra Nevada Brewing, Biltmore Park's wonderful movie theatres and shopping center, Biltmore Village, Arboretum, WNC Nature Center, and Asheville downtown. We are conveniently located within a short drive to Black Mountain, Montreat, Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Brevard, Mills River and so many other places to visit.
I can also tell you about the lesser-known places where locals eat and point you to the most beautiful hikes of all degrees of difficulty all with breathtaking views. I can set you up with a free fly-fishing class (up to 6 people) or help you navigate a calm trip down the French Broad river and float right past the Biltmore House! Let me know the nature of your trip and I can offer any suggestions, and may have supplies or could help coordinate logistics, that you need.
host_about: Thank you for checking out my page. My husband and I have lived in this area for over two decades enjoying the trails, rivers, rocks, and restaurants. I am as overcome with the beauty of this area today as I was when I first visited. I come from a large household with four sisters and love cooking for large groups of friends and family. I hope that I can help provide the opportunity for folks to fall in love with this area just as I have.

name: Sleepy Gap. Unwind with your Family and Friends.
description:
Sleepy Gap Oasis is a stylish 2,000 sq foot COUNTRY HOME located at the base of the Blue Ridge Parkway, a 15 minute drive from the airport and a 20+ minute drive from downtown Asheville (depends on traffic and destination, of course). This space is perfect for friends and family who want to spend a quiet & quality stay at the center of everything in Western North Carolina.
GET AWAY from the stress of life, NOURISH your soul, SLEEP in comfort and CONNECT WITH NATURE.

The space
Before we start, here are 4 things people love about our Stylish Country Home:
1 - The region is simply amazing. Some of the most beautiful waterfalls, bikes/hikes, views and breweries are near our property. But you probably know this already, which is why you’re visiting.
2 - Our home has recently been partially renovated and it has a lot of character. The beds are comfortable and you’ll have a fully stocked kitchen. We also feature a lot of original artwork on our walls.
neighborhood_overview: We are surrounded by forest so it's very quiet. Please no parties or loud music as most of us living here prefer the sounds of nature.
host_about: I live in just outside Asheville, NC with my family and an assortment of chickens and ocasional foster animals. I moved here from NoVA nine years ago to enjoy the mountains,  experience less traffic and sample small town living. I work remotely for an IT start-up based in the DC area. Three years ago I followed my heart and moved to the countryside, where I enjoy the pastoral and forest views, spring-fed pond and creeks and all sorts of wildlife. I hope you enjoy you time in this magical place, whether it's following the beer trail, hiking mountains, floating on rivers, down-dogging on a yoga mat, or whatever makes you happy.  BK (that's life before kids) I traveled extensively and adventurously through 32 countries which included working in Hanoi, Bangkok and Barcelona; studying in Chile; multiple USA road trips; and a 9,000 mile road trip in South America.

name: The Little House That Could (10 mins to Asheville)
description:
Hi, I'm Tara. I love meeting new people...what better way than to open my home to people traveling to Asheville Nc. I have a love for all patterns, colors and shapes. Mid Century is my favorite. I put a lot of love into the decor of this home to make it feel cozy. I hope ya'll enjoy!

The space
The Little House That Could is less than 10 mins to downtown Asheville and located in Woodfin. It sits right off the road with easy access to the highway. Local roosters are your mountain wake up call.

Guest access
There is a parking spot on the side of the house and you will need to park there and back out of the driveway to exit.

Other things to note
No pets please. I’m allergic.
neighborhood_overview: Woodfin is a small little neighborhood that is part of Asheville. Hidden gem.
host_about: I am a fun loving lady with a huge heart. My little creation Roxie is the love of my life. I enjoy traveling to different places 6-7times a year. I also like to travel back home to the beach in S.C. to be with my friends. I lived in Atlanta for 16 years and moved to the mountains of Asheville NC six years ago. I love to have fun and you’ll always see me wearing a smile.

name: Cozy Cottage | 7 Min. From Downtown | No Pet Fee
description:
This cottage was built in the early 1900's and has been lovingly remodeled.
The property feels private with a spacious yard, giant old oak trees , and plenty of private parking while still being in very close proximity to everything Asheville has to offer. It is 2 miles to downtown and popular Haywood Road.
It includes a cozy living space, fully equipped kitchen, comfy king sized beds, shower/bath combo, original hardwood floors, a fire pit and a large front porch for outdoor chillin’.

The space
Guests have access to the entire house and yard except for the storage shed.

Other things to note
The bungalow was built in 1930 so there are small quirks like creaky and uneven floors and other small imperfections. I think this contributes to the charm though!
neighborhood_overview:
The city boundary borders the back of the property, so this is as close as you can get a full house short-term rental to the city center of Asheville - yet it still somehow magically feels like you’re secluded in the woods due in part by my desire to preserve its historical value and not over develop or sell to developers. My wish is for people to enjoy it in a context of how the original creators envisioned the property to be melded with a modern take.
This is truly the best of all worlds here in Asheville and ultimately why I fell in love with the property. The home is about 2 miles to downtown with a 7-10 dollar Uber ride reported, 15 minute drive to the front gate of the Biltmore Estate, usually about a 6 minute drive to popular Haywood Road, 10 minute drive to the entrance to the Blue Ridge Parkway, 2 miles to New Belgium Brewing, and 20 minutes from the Asheville Airport.

Side note I have to add due to someone unsuccessfully trying to bring a 30 foot trailer at m
host_about:
Hi! I'm Jordan and I live in the beautiful mountains of Asheville, North Carolina. In my spare time I enjoy exploring my gorgeous home of Asheville. I love hiking with my dog, kayaking, fishing, eating the amazing food my city has to offer, and drinking craft beer with friends.

I enjoy providing a casual, comfortable, and stylish space for my guests to retreat to after exploring.  I love helping guests by providing recommendations so they fall for Western NC just as I did when I came here from Texas years ago. My guests' happiness is very important to me and I'm always eager to make sure they have a great visit. 

[As a host (and co-host for friends): I vow to  uphold my own values of equality and will never discriminate against or tolerate discrimination based on race/ color/ national origin/ gender/ sexual orientation/ familial status/ age/ disability/ religious beliefs (or lack thereof).]

name: Cozy Log Cabin Apartment w/ Fairy Forest
description:
Escape from the world in this beautiful newly built log cabin apartment. Wake up refreshed amongst a sunflower mural done by local Asheville artists. Then step outside on to your porch overlooking the forest in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains. Ten minute drive to downtown. Fully equipped kitchen. Luxurious cabin feel bathroom. Wooden cabin accents throughout newly built by hand from the owners themselves.

The space
Everything in this space is brand new and has been completed along with the construction of the main home at the end of 2019. There's also a relaxing outdoor area with ample seating, a fire pit, and a great view of the forest. 20 minutes to the entrance of Biltmore Estates. 16 minutes to the entrance of the beautiful Blue Ridge Parkway.

*** The gravel driveway is steep. Not for the faint of heart. AWD, 4WD, or an adventurous spirit HIGHLY recommended. Seriously, you've been warned! :) *******

Guest pa

Ample ground level studio with fantastic views of the Western North Carolina mountains. We are close to the many things that make Asheville the BEST CITY to live in and visit, including the Grove Park Inn, Biltmore Estate, Blue Ridge Parkway, River Arts District, French Broad River, Pisgah National Forest, and the NC Arboretum.

The space
Keypad entry. Queen Bed. Sofa is a Twin XL for additional traveler. We also offer a Pack and Play and a few games. Linens included during your stay. We offer coffee, hot chocolate, and tea for Keurig with cream and sweetener. Mini fridge. Dinnerware for your take-out meals. Glassware for your wine, local brews, and distillery finds.

Guest access

neighborhood_overview: The Grace Neighborhood is quiet and walkable. Downtown Asheville is an 8 minute drive. The Grove Park Inn is a 7 minute drive, the Botanical Gardens at Asheville is an easy walk or 5 minute drive, Asheville Pizza and Brewing Company is a 5 minute walk, Luella's BBQ is a 15 minute walk, and several tasty frozen dessert options are all within minutes walk or drive.  Please see our Local Guidebook!
host_about: We are active outdoors people. Mountains or beach as long as there is water. We love to travel! He has been to more than 20 countries and she is catching up quick. We are laid back and enjoy going with the flow. Love the adventure and culture that traveling affords us.

name: Woodnest minutes from everything!
description:
Welcome to our lovely loft nestled on the second floor of the 1927 family Bungalow. Convenient location on a quiet street with lots of greenery, a couple miles from the Biltmore Estate, the Blue Ridge Parkway and Downtown. Off street parking, private entrance and cozy porch of your own. Arranged with homemade wood furniture and caring details.
Once welcomed, you can relax in this peaceful setting, whether you come to Asheville for business, exploring the city or its surrounding nature!

The space
Entrance is through a side gate to an enclosed back yard with an exterior staircase well lit with motion sensors. As you enter, there is a counter with storage underneath for luggage and whatnot. Robert, your host, installed oak flooring and custom-built most of the furniture with local wood. In the evening, you can hang out in the sitting area or use the desk. Or just swing on the porch, looking at the sunset over the mountains, listening to birds chirping o
neighborhood_overview:
We love this neighborhood because there is soooo much greenery, the views are great, and it is a very quiet street - the multitude of birds excepted. More people walking by than driving (forms a U To the main road, like a dead end but without the "dead").
Very central: 1 mile to Biltmore Estate, 2 miles to Blue Ridge Parkway, or the WNC Nature Center, 3 to Downtown.
Great shopping: 3 miles to the River Art district, plenty of Antique shops (some in walking distance) and shopping centers around. Grocery stores (Whole Food, Walmart, Aldi) a couple miles from the property.
host_about: Born in Paris, raised in France. Studied and worked as a Journalist and Movie Maker in Switzerland. Now a fulfilled Mom-at-Home and AirBnB Host!

description:
Stay in Chicken Hill, a 10-minute walk to downtown Asheville or the River Arts District. The bottom floor, back porch, and fenced in backyard are all yours during your stay. You'll also have access to locally roasted coffee to start your day off caffeinated and can store your local six-pack in the downstairs minifridge.

The space
The rooms are located on the bottom floor of the house. Full-size windows and the double door to the back porch make it feel warm and welcoming, definitely not a traditional basement. A curtain at the bottom of the stairwell will separate you from the upstairs living space that I occupy. In the foyer, you will have a Keurig coffee maker, microwave, minifridge, and simple breakfast of oatmeal and fruit available. If needed, you can also use the washer and dryer.

name: Wentworth Hilltop: Private home, outside Biltmore Village + close to Asheville!
description:
Wentworth Hilltop: a very special Asheville vacation spot for the discerning traveller.
Come experience the easy life overlooking the Blue Ridge Mountains. This is a newly constructed home, eclectically decorated with all the modern "comforts of home away from home". You'll enjoy easy access to Biltmore Village, the River Arts District, while being amazingly close to downtown Asheville.

The space
Location:
This private home is located just outside downtown Asheville, and the Biltmore Estate property; an easy 5 minutes to Biltmore Village, and less than 10 minutes to downtown Asheville, the Biltmore Estate, the River Arts District all with its energetic collection of restaurants and shops! You are only app. 15 minutes to Asheville Regional airport. You are essentially close to "everything" in and around Asheville. The home is accessed via only paved roads.

name: Family Friendly, Fenced, 5BR/3.5BA Game Room/Dogs
description:
The restrictions are over, so come enjoy the mountains! We have taken the CDC recommended steps to ensure your wellbeing.

Enjoy a full mountain getaway without leaving the property. It has a large hot tub, a spacious deck, a patio, a sports bar with pool table, a quality kitchen with cookware, two dining rooms, an office area for remote work, an elegant spa bathtub and 60” & 50" HDTVs in living room.

This property is very close to downtown Asheville and all its current take out services.

The space
This is the perfect property for those who wish to have a mountain getaway without leaving the vacation rental property. It is designed for entertainment and relaxation. It has a quality kitchen and two dining room areas. So you can prepare a meal on property or take advantage of the many take out services offered by our top local restaurants both in downtown Asheville and surrounding areas.

On the property take advantage of the the h
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in a small quiet mountain subdivision of only eight homes.  Nice large lots offer the privacy you seek as well as large roads for an afternoon stroll.
host_about:
Ron is a Asheville/WNC native.  He loves hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic and ancient mountains.   

Darlene relocated from Michigan to Asheville a few years ago. She loves visiting  quaint  towns in and around Asheville and local attractions like the Biltmore Estate as well as discovering new hiking trails.  Her outdoor passion is kayaking and rock climbing.

Most of our vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, dog friendly and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back. Please see individual properties for their unique features. 

We both are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

We look forward to sharing the WNC area with you!

Darlene - Director of Operations and Concierge
Ron - Property Manager

name: Wizards Hollow - Treehouses of Serenity
description:
**New Booking dates will be available on the 1st of each month!!**

"Wizards Hollow" is one of 5 treehouses and a hobbit hole that makes up Treehouses of Serenity. We are located just 10 mins north of downtown Asheville nestled in the Blue Ridge Mountains. Each property has expansive windows in order to take in the long-range mountain views and include fully functioning bathrooms.

The space
Calling all Harry Potter Fans, bring your inner magic! Wizards Hollow is our version of Hogwarts here in the mountains of Asheville. The castle is close to 600 sq ft of wizardry. Fly your house flag, and if you are not sure to which house you belong, consult our sorting hat! Feeling mischievous, our invisible cloak will keep your family guessing! After mixing your potions, relax in one of two queen beds. This home has 1 bedroom and a spiral staircase that leads to a loft with an additional bed. The bathroom has traditional plumbing, a tiled shower. sink a
neighborhood_overview:
This treehouse is built in a forested 8-acre parcel in north Asheville. Included on the property, you will find 5 additional treehouses and a hobbit hole that is also available to rent via Airbnb.

While on the property you’ll find heaps of wildlife at your doorstep. The property is within easy driving distance of restaurants, grocery stores, and the local visitor center.
host_about: Our goal is to have travelers leave our treehouse with a feeling of total satisfaction and the knowledge that they just had an unforgettable experience!  We live on the property and are only a minute away, so any needs from our guests will be met immediately.   We truly believe we are blessed to live in Asheville on top of this mountain and we love to share the joy!

name: Asheville Chateau Relaxo - 2 Bed/2 Bath
description:
The Chateau Relaxo is a beautifully appointed home by all the action of Asheville. Close to the Blue Ridge Parkway, the Biltmore, Biltmore Village & downtown. All are only an Uber or a short drive.

Outside enjoy a gas fire pit, grille, screened porch & a tree top deck, 30 ft off the ground!

Indoors is a grand kitchen, a gas Jotul stove & a large, open floor plan. Enjoy a game of Dutch shuffleboard or cozy up on the comfortable furniture to watch a movie on the 65” HD TV (Netflix Included).

The space
Welcome to Asheville’s Chateau Relaxo! This is an entire home rental. Please enjoy your stay!

Guest access
Entire space rental 2 bedrooms/2 bathrooms

Other things to note
We have two parking spaces on the property. We are unable to accomodate more than two vehicles. There is no street parking available.
neighborhood_overview: 2.5 miles to the Biltmore, 4 miles to downtown.
host_about: My husband, Gregg, and I love to travel and explore places, foods, experiences, drinks, etc. We are always up for a new adventure and are lifetime learners. We enjoy the outdoors, especially hiking, kayaking, paddle boarding and birding. There are so many spectacular places we have been and many more for us to see!

name: Private apartment on mountainside near Asheville
description:
This unique, private apartment is located on a mountainside about 21 minutes south of Asheville and 23 minutes from downtown Hendersonville. The Blue Ridge Parkway is minutes away for hiking and walking. The kitchen is perfect for cooking all of your meals. You can sit at the dining table and see Mt. Pisgah in the fall and winter or watch the squirrels and deer from spring through fall. A dog-friendly place with a fenced-in back yard covered in grass and river pebbles and stones.

The space
The apartment is a completely separate unit located in the basement or ground floor of the main house. There are two private entrances, one from the parking area, and one from the garage. The bedroom has lots of closet space and a dresser. The bedroom window looks out over a private fenced in back yard and has opaque blinds to allow the room to remain dark. A small laundry room with a washer, dryer, iron, and ironing board adjoins the bedroom. There is a small full bath with
neighborhood_overview: The house is on a private dead end road bordered by fields, pasture, forest, and other private homes. Until now, it has been a very safe area. There is only one road in and out of the housing area. The road to the house begins to get steep right before reaching my driveway. The driveway was redone in 2019. The parking area in front of the apartment allows for two vehicles and is partially covered by a deck. The right garage is available with approval by owner. The house is bordered by a mountain to the east, a fenced in back yard to the south, a forest to the north, and mountain views and a neighbor's house to the west visible through the trees.
host_about: I live near Asheville and Henderson, NC and love to travel.  I have stayed in many an Airbnb and love the convenience and unique experience each one has to offer.

name: Mountain Cottage and Tiny House with hot tub
description:
This listing is for BOTH our main cottage AND the adjoining tiny house.

Both were renovated and decor are in "Fixer Upper Farmhouse style". Hot tub, grill & fire pit are available for guest use.

The main house was originally located on the Biltmore Estate Dairy Farm property & was moved to this location in the 1950's. It is a sweet somewhat quirky place.

Need more space? Check out our Blue Bird Cottage for 2 additional bedrooms/baths.

The space
The main house is a 3 Bedroom, 2 Bath home that has been updated with modern finishes. There is a family room, formal dining, sun room and screened in porch. The master suite has a living area area with a couch as well as a queen sized bed and sliding doors to back deck.
There are Mountain View’s from the back deck,hot tub and fire pit.
The tiny house is a thoughtfully designed 250 sqft space. Efficiency kitchen, full bathroom, living area with electric fireplace and mount
neighborhood_overview: The house is just outside Asheville city limits.  About 5 minutes to grocery shopping, less than 10 minutes to Asheville Outlets.  About 20 minutes to downtown Asheville or Biltmore Estate.
host_about: I am the mother to three super active kiddos ages 17, 14 & 12. We are super active people who enjoy running, bike riding, hiking and any other outdoor play we can find.  We live just "over the mountain" (3 miles by roads) from the houses so I am available to assist when necessary.  I have been hosting for Airbnb since Nov. 2015 and love it! I am also a Realtor in Asheville at Preferred Properties.

name: The Sweet Mt Royal House ~Views/Biltmore/Asheville
description:
Welcome to the Illusion of Seclusion!
Feels remote, actually close to everything: Asheville, Biltmore, airport, Blue Ridge Parkway, hiking, & more!

5-Star Outside: Several seating areas on 2+ acres - screened porch, a large covered area w lighting, fire pits, large deck for the amazing mountain view and breezes.

5-Star Inside: Every room has been beautifully remodeled with comfy beds and linens, cleaned by "Fresh & Clean" professionals, and the views are simply amazing!

The space
This property is "Fresh & Clean"

So, if you're looking for someplace beautiful, comfortable, CLEAN, and private to get away from the hustle and bustle... you found it!

This beautiful unique mountain house sits on a lovely quiet wooded lot with gorgeous long mountain views, but it's near everything! Neighbors call it, "the illusion of seclusion". A perfect space for a family gathering or couples escape. (Sorry ~ no parties or events allowe
neighborhood_overview:
Arden is the South side of the city of Asheville. The House is just outside the city limits with the city just a few miles to the North.

The House sits on a large wooded mountainside lot in a beautiful quiet walking neighborhood flanked by 2 private parks with hiking trails. At the bottom of the mountain is a wonderful children's park, the famous 12 Bones BBQ, Beehive coffee shop, and Brooklyn Brothers pizza. Nearby is the Biltmore Estate and Village, Bent Creek hiking/mountain biking region, 2 trampoline parks, movie theaters, restaurants, grocery stores, cafes, and so much more. (COVID may restrict access to some of these venues.)
host_about: A small town gal that found her "forever home" here in the mountains of Asheville, NC. As an artist and designer, real estate agent, and property manager, I adore creating unique homes and beautiful spaces for folks to stay while they enjoy our little corner (or should I say "mountaintop"?) of the world.

name: Bent Creek Loft
description:
This perfectly situated studio has beautiful mountain views, direct access to the Bent Creek trail system, and a 22-acre community park right out the back gate. Come to explore and relax at this quite getaway.

The space
With high ceilings and a large private deck-this studio is airy and quiet. Plenty of space to relax after a day of explore the Blue Ridge Mountains, Asheville, or the French Broad River. There is only an outdoor shower, which is loved by many guests.
neighborhood_overview: Bent Creek is possible one of the best neighborhoods in Asheville.  With a 22 acre park right in the backyard (which includes, a playground, volleyball court, basketball courts, pump track, and field), direct access to the Bent Creek trail system, and a 5-minute drive to the French Broad River, there is no better place to relax during your vacation.
host_about: My husband John and I have lived in Asheville since 2006 and we can't think of anywhere else we would want to be.  We love raising our 3 kids and dog, Norbert,  in these beautiful mountains.  We are always up for an adventure.

name: Quiet Refuge Close to Downtown
description:
Recently built in 2018 and furnished apartment with everything you need to be comfortable. Quiet setting close to downtown in desirable Kenilworth neighborhood. Walking distance to Mission Hospital and perfect for temporary situations or an extended vacation.

The space
The full apartment is available to guests and a parking space is reserved for one vehicle

Guest access
The apartment is self-contained. Please talk to us if you’d like using the fire pit.

Other things to note
Our trusted friend, Amanda, cleans the apartment every Tuesday. Please remove your sheets and tidy up for her and she will clean your bathroom, use freshly cleaned bedding, dust and vacuum.
neighborhood_overview: This sweet place is ~1.5 miles from downtown and 1 mile from Biltmore Village. Biltmore Village offers shopping and restaurants. There are multiple craft breweries in walking distance as well. Mission Hospital is less than a mile away. There are two parks nearby. Kenilworth Park has a soccer field, two tennis courts, a basketball court and playground. Harvest House offers activities to older residents. Chile’s Park has a small playground. All are within walking distance from this apartment
host_about: We moved here five years ago from Alaska and love Asheville. Mike is a physician and continues working in Alaska. I’m a social worker and stopped working recently. We have three adult children and two dogs. Mike is from the Washington, DC area and I am from a small farming community in Indiana. We both enjoy nature and hiking as well as good food.

name: Extended Stay, Bedroom with Shared Bath
description:
Nice amenities at a competitive price. I try to keep my calendar full by being your first choice and the best value in the area. I specialize in medium to long-term rentals to travel nurses. Feel free to inquire about options. I may be able to accommodate you on dates that don't show on my calendar.

The space
Your private bedroom is in a 3-bedroom house. It has a full-size bed with a very comfortable memory foam mattress. You will be using a bathroom that's shared with the host. It's located directly across the hall from your bedroom.

Guest access
Guests can share the living room, kitchen, dining room, deck, and yard.

Other things to note
The master suite with a private bathroom is available for rent and may be occupied by another guest or two who may share the common spaces.

Access to the attic is by way of a pull-down ladder in the ceiling of your bedroom. I may need to enter the attic during your stay, b
neighborhood_overview: My house is in a quiet, walkable, safe neighborhood. Neighbors are friendly and can often be seen taking walks or jogging alone, with family, or with dogs. Don't be surprised if they wave at you. You may see some wildlife such as rabbits, groundhogs, deer, or an occasional black bear.
host_about: I'm a frequent traveler who loves adventure. I enjoy discovering new places and returning to old, familiar places. I've been a guest of numerous Airbnb hosts and have had some awesome experiences. Airbnb is a great way to find unique housing at affordable prices and to meet some nice people along the way. I work in the hospitality field and I enjoy hosting guests in my home as an expression of my personal hospitality.

name: Dogwood Bee Cottage
description:
Enjoy central city amenities while feeling tucked away on a mountain top. Experience all of Asheville's arts and food, downtown and plenty more to be found within a 1 mile radius of the Dogwood Bee cottage.

Be a part of the historic feel of the city in your very own 1800's cottage. Cozy and unique, the time you spend here will be part of your vacation instead of just a place to sleep!

The space
There are two main bedrooms and a fully equipped kitchen. Each of the two bedrooms has it's own door to the covered balcony overlooking the blue ridge mountains and surrounded by large trees.
The expansive yard has a fire pit and a wrap around deck to enjoy the sunrise and sunset with a cup of tea and a book.

The third bedroom is between the other two so is more of a common area option due to the need of walking through one of the other rooms. Two bathrooms, both have a shower and or a tub.

There is plenty of space to spread out insi
neighborhood_overview:
They call this neighborhood "Historic Hideaway in the Hub of Asheville"
It's nestled between Biltmore Village on the south and downtown Asheville to the north
host_about:
I fill my time at home with pottery, painting and music and outside of that I can be found on the map somewhere between Texas and North Carolina. 
I have been hosting since 2010 and have made longtime friends and always enjoy sharing what’s special about the town and neighborhood with others. 
I keep my home open to guests because getting to experience the charm of a neighborhood and being a part of it as a local is the way I enjoy staying when I travel. I’m hoping to share my pottery on the experience side of the app soon. A lot of the pieces you see in my home were made by me and more and more it’s what I’m focused on when I’m not tending to the house.

name: Master Suite Plus Second Bedroom
description:
Flexible space for up to 4 people. Master suite with queen bed and private bath, walk-in closet, dresser, and desk. Second bedroom with a full bed, closet, and dresser shares the bathroom across the hall with the host.

The space
The master bedroom is 150 square feet plus a walk-in closet and en suite bathroom. You can fully unpack using the closet and dresser to store your clothes and belongings. Sit at the desk to work on you laptop which can be plugged into the base of the desk lamp. A bench provides extra seating.

The smaller bedroom is just a few feet away down the hall. It's 100 square feet plus a closet. The closet and dresser provide more space for unpacking and keeping everybody's things separate. There's a second bathroom directly across the hall. Guests in the second bedroom can share the hall bathroom with the host, or can share the bathroom in the master suite.

Both bathrooms have a tub and a shower. There is storage space in bot
