name: The Bluebird Getaway 2
description:
Spacious and serene 2 bedroom house just minutes from downtown AVL. Great location! Has a large deck off a big kitchen and lush green forest behind. Feels like you are living in the trees! Near end of cul-de-sac so quiet and private, but close to everything. Biking/hiking/running trails just down the street. Large master bedroom with ensuite bath and one more bedrooms with a communal bathroom. Plenty of parking!

The space
This home is situated in a perfect location. Just 3 miles to the heart of downtown and easy access to anything and anywhere Asheville has to offer. The bustling River Arts District is only about 1.5 miles away and there are food and music venues even closer, including White Duck Taco, Salvage Station and more! Relax on the large back deck while listening to the birds and nature. There are only trees and greenery to take up the view. Or head to Richmond Hill Park just down the street for some disc golf, or a hike or bike ride. The house
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is just above the river in the Richmond Hill neighborhood.  Along Riverside Dr there are plenty of entertainment options such as Salvage Station, The Bywater and more! The Richmond Hill city park is just up the road and has plenty of trails for running, hiking, biking and also a frisbee gold course.
host_about:
I am a jewelry artist here in the River Arts District in Asheville, NC. I can assure you Asheville is a fantastic place to visit and you leave wanting more!  I lived out west for 20 years prior to moving here 6+ years ago.  I am amazed every day at the beauty of the Western North Carolina area, the southern hospitality, and the farm fresh food and craft beers and ciders!

   I love exploring the true character of an area and am always excited to find places to travel that have maintained their own unique character.  I definitely would say I've been off the beaten path just about everywhere I've traveled including Mongolia, Patagonia, Iceland and more!  My blessings are counted everyday knowing that I live in such a special place and it is such a pleasure to be able to offer a space that allows others to experience Asheville to the fullest as well.  
     My husband Brandon and I welcome you to our home just outside downtown Asheville.  The neighborhood is quiet and the location can’t be beat.  Please let us know if you need anything additional to make your stay more pleasant:)

name: Beautiful West Asheville Home, Live like a local
description:
I am taking special care setting the house, please reach out with any questions or concerns. We are all navigating this together.
Our 1928 West Asheville Art&Crafts home is modern and full of original features.
Located on a quiet tree-lined street half a block from Haywood Rd you can walk to it all.
Whatever part of Asheville you would like to explore our home puts you in the heart of it. Downtown Asheville, RAD, Biltmore, Grove Park Inn, Waterfall hikes all a quick couple miles.

The space
We love our home and hope you will too.
1928 charm with original features, all the modern updates and our artistic style.
The kitchen is well stocked, the bathroom has everything you should need.
Our goal is for you to arrive, make a drink in our gourmet kitchen and in typical southern fashion enjoy it relaxing on the porch while planning out your perfect day.
Did I mention our location is Epic?!

Guest access
The house
neighborhood_overview:
Our artisan neighborhood has it all, if you haven't been here before its so fun to explore.
If you have been, go back to your favorites or check out something new.
Let me know what you are into and I happy to help direct.
host_about:
Jeweler, traveler, foodie, baker.
I love urban jungles, galleries, cafes, music and nature retreats, hiking, waterfalls, beaches and hammock time.

name: Location & Comfort with Great Outdoor Space
description:
One-level home located in a residential neighborhood with on-site parking. Home features expanded great room with picture window, rock fireplace and gas logs; open eat-in kitchen with coffee provided; spacious bedrooms with comfy beds and large outdoor patio with fire pit and grill, landscaped, beautiful flowers in season and deck with hot tub for cool mountain evenings.

Asheville attractions and restaurants are only minutes away.

The space
This property is truly a " home away from home" and the perfect place to explore Asheville then wind down and relax. Great for couples traveling together. I live here year round and open up a limited amount of time to share with travelers coming to Asheville. This is why you will experience a very personal stay with all the comforts and warmth of home along with the privacy of having the property all to yourself. The below bullet points are features that further describe my home.

- Front door access
neighborhood_overview: Prime East Asheville location.  Picturesque quiet neighborhood setting outside a busy city.  Restaurants and grocery store within 1.0 miles. Blue Ridge Parkway 1.0 mile, Biltmore House 5.0 miles, Downtown Asheville 7.0 miles and Chimney Rock 19.0 miles. River Arts District and Tubing on the French Broad 5.5 miles. As you can see, convenient to these and all that Asheville has to offer.
host_about: Hello, my name is Vicki. I have lived in Asheville for 34 years and I am a retired nurse having worked 28 years as a bedside critical care nurse, educator, and administrator. I enjoy traveling, spending time with friends, shopping, being outside, planting flowers, and sampling new restaurants. My favorite place to visit is Charleston SC  and the Isle of Palms. I am enjoying this new chapter in my life and look forward to hosting and traveling with Airbnb!

name: Charming House By Riverside Park - Entire House!
description:
Enjoy a tranquil stay near the river in this lovely vacation home by the French Broad River. Take a 10 minute stroll to the Riverside Park to have a scenic walk and take photos by the river. Then head to downtown and eat at the restaurants or drink at the breweries that Asheville is famous for. It's only a 10 minute drive away.

This house has a 1000 Mbps fiber connection and is suitable for multiple people to do remote work, gaming, and streaming simultaneously. We are also solar powered!

The space
This stylish house comes with 3 bedrooms on the first floor and two beds in a shared room upstairs. All beds are equipped with queen sized mattresses. The entire house has beautiful hardwood floors that brings the beautiful forest scenery to the home.

The house has a full kitchen and elegant living space

Gorgeous personally custom made office table made from solid wood floats over 2 chairs creating the perfect environment for planning
neighborhood_overview: Only a 10 minute walk or 2 minute drive away from the Woodfin Riverside Park which is great for a scenic stroll along the French Broad River.
host_about: I have been staying in Asheville since 1997 when I moved here during my primary school years. The food and the craft beer here are among the best and it's the perfect size without being too packed with heavy traffic.  I also love to travel, especially overseas. I mainly travel for food, with sightseeing and other events being secondary. I've been to Canada, Mexico, England, Italy, France, Netherlands, Japan, Hong Kong, and China. I am also fluent in English, Mandarin, and Cantonese.

name: In east Asheville and close to so much more!
description:
Located in east Asheville, only 12 minutes to downtown. The neighborhood is adjacent to the Blue Ridge Parkway and the Mountain to Sea Trail. Great setup for spending your days exploring Asheville and western NC, then resting up for the next day's adventure. Private bedroom and bath in a traditional ranch home. Bathroom remodeled in 2017. Bed and mattress new in 2019. You are also welcome to use the kitchen fridge/freezer and laundry room--just ask.

The space
You'll be staying in the original master bedroom (with en suite bath) of our traditional 1960s ranch home. Although the listing says two guests, there's also room for a child in a sleeping bag or baby in a portable crib in the room.

Guest access
Street parking in quiet neighborhood. If you bring a bike or motorbike, it can be stored in the garage when you're not riding.

Other things to note
COVID 19 Update
We are spacing out reservations and intensifying
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a nice place for walking. A short trail connects you to the Mountain To Sea Trail along the Blue Ridge Parkway for longer walks and runs. Views of mountains all around. Restaurants, Ingles grocery store (with a Starbucks, deli, and pharmacy), Urgent Care, VA Hospital, The Cove Training Center, gas stations, and fast food restaurants are within a 1-2 minute drive.
host_about: Anne and Paul have lived in Asheville for over 20 years. For ten years they hosted exchange students from around the world. They love to travel and they love to welcome guests to the mountains.

description:
Minutes from Downtown, the Blue Ridge Parkway, West Asheville, and Biltmore. This newly constructed Craftsman is great for families or friends. Three bedrooms, 1 king and 2 queens, each with cable TV & Roku. Two baths with deep tub / shower combo and towels. Living room with West Elm furnishings. Fully equipped kitchen with new appliances. Mountain views from back deck off of dining room. Parking for three vehicles. CDC recommended cleaning procedures used. Come enjoy the best of Asheville!

The space
Forested lot gives you a secluded feel 3.4 mi from downtown Asheville. Smart locks mean that there will never be any difficult lockboxes to get open or keys that don't quite fit right.

Guest access
The rental does not include the basement unit of the house, but it will not be occupied during your stay. There is a locked staircase door to this space.

Other things to note

neighborhood_overview: Woodfin is just north of Asheville very near the French Broad River and super convenient to I-26 and the University of North Carolina at Asheville. Zillicoah Brewing Company and Ginger's Revenge are our local breweries. The Salvage Station is our local music venue.

name: Cozy Private Suite
description:
Cozy guest suite with private entrance. 2.5 miles away from Biltmore Village and the Biltmore Estate. Several breweries nearby (Hillman, French Broad, Catawba, Highland, and Burial's Forestry Camp). 4.5 Miles to downtown Asheville. Minutes to I-40, I-240 and the Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
Note there is a flight of stairs to get into the suite. Front sitting room has a small bistro table to enjoy your morning coffee. We provide Nespresso coffee: American and Espresso, regular and decaf. Enjoy Roku TV. Brand new bathroom, with shower/tub combo. Bedroom with a very comfortable brand new queen size bed. 2 night tables and lamps.

Other things to note
If you are a smoker, this is not the place for you. We don’t allow any smoking (or vaping) in the suite, outside of the suite or around the property.
neighborhood_overview: Family neighborhood, quiet, but not remote. You can get to most places in 10-15 minutes!
host_about: Claudia works in healthcare, Adam in retail. They’re foodies, sure to know the best spots in town for food and beers. In their spare time they care for their beautiful felines, Sir Chester & Sir Jaxon. Adam and Claudia enjoy the outdoors year-round, from snowboarding to hiking, western North Carolina has all the activities they love!

You are app. 25 minutes to Asheville Regional airport. Bottom line; you are essentially close to "everything" in and around Asheville. The home is accessed via only paved roads.

name: Arden Cottage w/Fire Pit - 11 Mi to Asheville
description:
Escape the hustle & bustle of downtown Asheville with a stay at this convenient 2-bed, 1-bath vacation rental home in Arden! Still, you'll only be 12 miles from the 'Land of the Sky's' breweries, restaurants, and art scene. Even closer is The Biltmore Estate, while the Nantahala National Forest's beauty lies just down the Blue Ridge Parkway, just 2 miles away. After a day of adventure, return to the comforts of home like a fully equipped kitchen along with a peaceful outdoor entertainment area!

The space
Free WiFi | Off-Street Parking | Wood-Burning Stove

Discover the year-round beauty of the Nantahala National Forest from this cozy cottage, ideal for a nuclear family or a couple!

Master Bedroom: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Full Bed

OUTDOOR LIVING: Furnished deck, outdoor fire pit w/ seating, front porch
KITCHEN: Fully equipped, dishwasher, toaster, drip coffeemaker, blender

name: TREE TOP HIDEAWAY
description:
Tree Top Hideaway is a seasonal screened in small space with twin sized bed, comfy Leesa mattress, small flat screen TV, towels, and a robe to wear to the hot tub and outdoor hot shower. Three walls are glassed or screened for unobstructed view. Less than 70 sq. ft. lo, and located off the dining room close to your half bath. Given the nature of what is offered and the size of the space and bed it's only recommended for single, solo guests. Men will feel most comfortable choosing Tree Top.

The space
Remember the feeling you had when a child and you created your private fort and felt safe and protected? Experience that again as an adult and still have some of the finer amenities that each of my suites offers. Every wall, save the house exterior wall is glassed or screened for unobstructed view. Hear the night sounds, the night rain on a corrugated roof, the early morning bird song cacophony, and have the sun stream into your bed at sunrise. It's a rush. Add the f
neighborhood_overview:
Tree Top Hideaway is located in tree canopy level, where the sights, sounds and smells of everything natural fill your space.
You'll fall asleep to tree frogs, crickets and other night time sounds and we awakened by the serenade of songbirds in the morning.
host_about:
My experience in life has been to minister. At first I was studying to be a priest but later realized that comforting people can be done in more ways than from that approach. Meeting, greeting and engaging guests without agenda puts them at ease and when guests arrive with little or few expectations and are open to my quirky approach to life, magic happens. Giving give wide berth for your privacy, but there when social interaction is desired.
I've learned that I can only try and please everyone. That works for 97% of the time. Occasionally guests cannot let go of stress and innate suspicions, and that is baggage that I cannot carry for them. With an open mind and heart you will have on of the best experiences you can at an Airbnb establishment.
I welcome you to my home and my gig! Tom ~~ your host

name: Explore Asheville! Minutes to Downtown & RAD!
description:
It's Spring in Asheville!

The perfect place to explore all Asheville and WNC have to offer. Whether an outdoor adventurist to the business traveler this home fits all of your amenity and location needs. Our home offers endless warmth by way of its modern furnishings and charming decor. Spacious and stocked kitchen, dining area, airy and inviting living room, and cozy patio with grill. This is a brand new development located off the highway to anywhere, new homes currently being built!

The space
Wake up feeling rejuvenated in this quiet home featuring a private patio and help yourself to granola and yogurt, as well as a coffee while your group plans their day. Experience a mix of tranquility and trend in a mountain home with an open design perfect for all travelers from adventure seekers to corporate guests. The home is kid friendly with on-site parking available for 2 vehicles.

The home offers a dining room, living room, and fully-
neighborhood_overview: Situated in a newly built townhome and single family home development.  Minutes to anywhere in Asheville and WNC.  On-site parking, quiet neighborhood.  Perfect coffee local shop right down the road, Rejavanation, or grab Starbucks! Wicked Weed West just opened 3 miles from the house, who's thirsty? Private back yard patio great for evenings after the hustle and bustle of Asheville.
host_about:
Hi all!  Young couple who love to travel and meet new people, but the NC Mountains have our heart and soul.  

We love to share the best locations to eat, drink, relax or venture out in Asheville, NC.  Please feel free to ask us any questions!

name: Sol Retreat * Modern Oasis in the Heart of W.Avl *
description:
Private & peaceful downstairs suite powered by the sun. Clean, modern & spacious.
5 min walk to vibrant Haywood Rd, lined with lively restaurants, bars, shopping, & music.
Our home is tucked off a quiet street, surrounded by an oasis of greenery, flowers, & the sounds of birds (& frogs).
Set up for comfort & relaxing. Enjoy a cup of locally roasted coffee in the cozy lounge or out on the patio hammocks.
Short drive over the river to downtown Avl, the Biltmore, RAD, and the Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
Our home has organic gardens, fruit trees and perennials. Something is in bloom most of the year.
Private entrance is through the natural stone path through the rhodos and ferns down past your own patio.

This is a Family/Kid(s) Friendly AirBnB!

Amenities include fast free wifi, comfortable bedroom with your own thermostat for the entire suite, blackout shades, queen bed with soft linens and towels, endless hot water,
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is wonderful! We live in the heart of West Asheville and take walks up to Haywood Rd. and talk with our neighbors daily. We love where we live! It's full of character, conscientious people, and good living. It's a great feeling to leave the house on foot and enjoy good food, buy gifts for friends, catch some excellent live music, and cap it off with a  cocktail or a cup of tea, get a scoop or two of delicious homemade ice cream,  and walk back home. Come and experience it for yourself!
host_about:
I love to travel and have explored many parts of the world and now enjoy sharing new adventures with my husband and our two kids. We love to spend time in the outdoors, camping and exploring the natural world as well as urban trekking.
We are a friendly bunch and love meeting new people. We love to garden and walk around our neighborhood, going out to see music, eating ice cream and spending time with friends around a fire.

name: Mountain Views Minutes from Brews
description:
Walk to dozens of nearby eclectic shops, eateries, cafes and pubs then relax & recharge in the comfy Casper bed.

We welcome travelers of every race and religion/non-religion. Upon arrival, you will receive a key to the house and a key to your private room. We recently installed a keyless entry pad on the front door for guest convenience.

Our hosting style is casual; We are available if needed but otherwise give guests plenty of space and privacy.

The space
During WWII, this 1915 home was redesigned for dual family living. The room you’re booking offers natural sunlight and mountain views and includes a Queen sized Casper comfort bed, low couch, desk, tv/tv stand, and shelves and closet space to unpack your bags. A newly remodeled full bath is easily accessible.

Your room is located to the left at the top of the staircase. To the right, is another guest room/Airbnb listing called “Quaint & Quirky Paris of the South”.
neighborhood_overview:
We love our neighborhood! The people in this neighborhood are mostly all exceptional humans. And the location is a rare find (minutes away from the best places without the noise and traffic of living on a busy main road). In addition to plenty of food/drink and shopping options within walking distance, we can also walk to yoga studios, community acupuncture, and massage practitioners.

We love WALK for local pub food and Tiger Bay and Taco Billy. Hole donut is a MUST VISIT. Ice Cream Flight Night at The Hop is always tasty. Urban Orchard Cider Bar is another favorite local spot. We're about 3 minutes drive to downtown, the River Arts District (RAD), or West West Asheville (as opposed to East West Asheville where we live). Less than a mile from our home, we have live music most nights, tailgate markets, craft breweries, cider bars, food trucks and countless eateries.
host_about:
Adventurer, wellness travelpreneur, mama bear, foodie, wordsmith, artist, free-thinker. 

"Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all."--Helen Keller

name: Purple House Downtown: Suite With Private Entrance
description:
Enjoy all that downtown Asheville has to offer, on foot. 10 minute walk to the Orange Peel music venue and countless amazing restaurants, bars, and breweries. It’s a quick stroll to more breweries than you can count on 2 hands. The space has a private entrance and deck and is separated off from the rest of the home. Includes comfortable queen memory foam bed, TV, WiFi, shower, fridge, and Keurig coffee maker. Centrally located, a short drive to the Biltmore house, Parkway, & West Asheville.

The space
The television is hooked up to basic channels with an antenna but includes an HDMI cord that you could plug your laptop into to so you can enjoy whatever streaming service you subscribe to. Recently we added a Fire Stick so if you have an Amazon account you can watch TV through that.

In the suite, there is a mini-fridge and a Keurig coffee maker with cream and sugar provided. It is a quick walk to many amazing restaurants and the French Broad Food Co-Op.<
neighborhood_overview: Our location couldn't be better. It is a quick and safe walk to anywhere in downtown. The closest business to the house, White Labs Brewery & Kitchen, is a 5 minute walk. A 10 minute walk gets you to the Orange Peel music venue, the baseball field, and many great breweries, bars, and restaurants. You can enjoy downtown Asheville without ever getting in a car.
host_about: Hello! I have been living in Asheville for over a decade. I can’t imaging living somewhere without mountains! For work, I am an SEO Specialist at a web firm. I love to travel out west and to other countries.  I enjoy hiking, kayaking, paddle boarding, and going to the amazing establishments Asheville has to offer. I am happy to provide a centrally-located, private suite in my home for a weekend getaway for a couple or individual. Most times I don’t even see my Airbnb guests because the suite has a separate entrance, but I will wave hi if I do!

The home features 5 bedrooms with 5 queen beds, 1 loft with 2 twin beds, 2 lofts & each with a full size futon and a queen size pull out couch.

It’s a spacious home with 9ft ceilings.

There is parking available for at least 3 vehicles.

This home is located at 23 Grey River Run, Asheville 28804.

The home is close to everything you will need and many major attractions...

8 minutes from Downtown.
6-10 minutes from stores such as Trader Joe’s, Whole Foods, Harris Teeter, Ingles/Starbucks.

Easy Lyft & Uber pickup to anywhere you want to go!

This immaculate detached studio is newly renovated, with a beautiful view of Downtown Asheville from your bedroom window. Reclaim your zen state of mind, surrounded by a beautiful bamboo garden. Studio has a private full bathroom & kitchenette. Small dining area, smart TV (no cable) and super comfy new queen bed. Light sleeps beware!, since the studio is close to the highway, the traffic noise may interrupt your sleep!

The space
I love my studio and do my best to keep it nice & clean. I am happy to provide essentials for your stay - towels, soap, shampoo, hair dryer, etc. Keurig coffee machine with plenty of coffee. Please let me know, if you have a concern.
Uber and Lyft are available in the area and average $8-$12 to downtown Asheville (3miles away) and nearby breweries. Keycode access is provided, rental has complete privacy!
Parking for Airbnb guests is directly in front of studio door, 2 small cars, max. This allows for others to pass through t
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is very close to  I-26 the main highway, 1 exit away from Asheville, on a small side street. It is also located very close to the French broad River!
host_about: I have lived in Asheville since 2005 & I love it! Asheville is an amazing city with beautiful & serene mountains everywhere. I truly hope you will have wonderful memories in my studio & enjoy the opportunity to relax in a zen environment!  Hope to see you soon!

name: Quiet Mountain Cottage Near Biltmore and Downtown
description:
Our Blue Ridge Mountain home is located near all the action at the edge of Pisgah and only 10 minutes to West Asheville and downtown. Enjoy solitude on the expansive deck and screened porch or have a locally crafted beer as you unwind around the fire pit or enjoy the small garden and nearly 1-acre terraced yard. We are located 5 minutes from Bent Creek Park and it’s vast mountain biking / hiking trail system - also 5 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and outlet shopping.

The space
Our favorite part of the cottage is the outdoor amenities. We have a swing, a picnic table, a garden, a small trail and a great screened in porch and open deck. Asheville nights trend cooler so relaxing on the porch is where we spend a good amount of time. Chill around the fire pit and tiny frog pond located on the upper portion of the yard. For your convenience, we provide lighters, fire sticks and some limited wood.

As a measure of safety for our guests and our p
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood has very close proximity to mountain biking / hiking and also also downtown The Biltmore House, outlet shopping and the interstate. This convenience, along with the beautiful outdoor amenities at the house, ensure that you will make the most of your trip. We are 1/4 mile from fantastic local restaurants options: Papa’s & Beer- The best Mexican food in Asheville; Apollo Flame Bistro - Pizza and Greek; Pad Thai Authentic Thai Kitchen - (delivery); Stone Ridge Tavern as well as Starbucks and Ingles Supermarket. Need a quick bike tune or tube? Coast down the hill to Motion Maker’s Bicycle Shop - 1/2 mile. (The trip back up the hill requires more effort). Use our bike washing area to clean your whip before you head to DuPont Forrest , Pisgah or Bent Creek. They are all nearby- the trails of Bent Creek are only 2 miles from the house.

While our cottage is at the Edge of The Pisgah National Forrest, we are near all of the modern conveniences. Despite
host_about:
I enjoy adventure travel and active getaways.  This led me to Asheville and Western Carolina back in the 90’s.  Since then I’ve hosted people who enjoy similar  experiences both here at our Asheville homes and in other parts of Eastern Tennessee and Western North Carolina. 
I enjoy pedaling, picking (guitar) and burying myself in the mountains - wherever they are. Pisgah is obviously my favorite but I could just as well be found in the Cascades or in Southwestern Colorado and Utah. 

Our cottages are a reflection of what we love and what makes us comfortable.  We hope you’ll find them super accommodating !  

Don’t forget to bring your bike and boots !

name: Trendy Cottage  w/ Firepit- Close to Everything!
description:
Stylish chic cottage with trendy and relaxing space. Enjoy your favorite local brew or visiting with friends around the outdoor firepit or on the hammock chairs on the covered porch. Perfectly located close to downtown, Biltmore, RAD, & UNCA. 1.5 miles to breweries, coffee, restaurants, & local hang-outs while offering a private retreat. Easy access to trails and only 1 mile to French Broad River. Short 5-7 min Uber ride into town.

The space
The home is a 1940's bungalow that is located in a modest area that is being revitalized. The original hardwoods have been painted and have a trendy weathered look. The place has a modern chic vibe that fits perfectly with the trendy river arts area we are so close to. The kitchen is well appointed with plenty of dishes, local beer glasses, a blender for smoothies, coffee pot, etc.. But sorry, no dishwasher. The living room has a gas-fireplace, queen size pull out sofa, and a 42-in TV with Netflix along with a charging st
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled along the banks of the ancient French Broad River, Woodfin is a community that accomplishes the harmony of providing small town quality of life with big city amenities. Friendly people, good jobs, great restaurants, beautiful scenery all located five minutes from downtown Asheville and one of the safest cities in North Carolina. The town was once home to factory workers at a local furniture company. It is slowly be revitalized.
Nearby places to eat/drink:
- High-Five Coffee Shop - 2 miles
- Moe's BBQ -- so yummy! 1 mile
- Zilcoah Beer Company - 1 mile
- Smokey Park Supper Club - amazing cocktails and river views. 2.9 miles
- White Duck Taco Shop - a la carte tacos riverside. 2.5 miles

Things to do:
- Tube the french broad! Rental companies are just 1.9 mile away
- Go road biking - this location is very popular for that!
- Visit New Belgium Brewing (3 miles)
- Go hiking/swimming on the Laurel River Trail ( 30 m
host_about: Hi there! I am a busy mom of 3 boys who wants to share our wonderful city of Asheville with folks. We have lived here for 12 years and love everything it has to offer. When we aren't at the soccer field, we often spend our weekends hiking, tubing, biking, and looking for hidden swimming holes! We also really enjoy hanging out at many of the wonderful breweries that are family friendly. One of our other hobbies is real estate! We enjoy finding homes that need some TLC and bringing them back to life to create affordable housing in our area. As a host, we wanted to create a relaxing environment for our guests where they could unwind and relax, but also be close to the multitude of things to do in our beautiful city.  We once traveled to Baltimore and stayed in a B&B. The room and the bedding was so comfortable we didn't even want to go out on the town! That is what we want for our guests!!

name: 33 Carolina Lane Loft : High-Design Loft on Historic Downtown Alley
description:
Over 1,300 square-feet and two loft bedrooms, 33 Carolina Lane – a block once dedicated to agricultural industry, today a multi-cultural gathering spot – offers modern amenities and industrial design, with just the right touch of history: Curated artwork and pops of color, designer furnishings and massive flat-screen TVs, exposed ducts and lofted ceilings – all, in perfect balance with wizened walls and striking wood floors, layered with the patina of the past.

The space
Well, you’ve found it.

Welcome to the Holy Grail of Asheville travel: A 2BR loft in the heart of downtown’s shopping district, yet cloaked within the confines of a one-way alley. Quiet (for the city). Historic. Central. The very essence of Asheville’s local core.

This is everyday life, as it’s always been lived. This is Asheville life, as you want to live it.

Because, in a city of micro-neighborhoods, 33 Carolina Lane is exactly where and what you want it
neighborhood_overview:
☀☀☀ LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! ☀☀☀
If you’ve ever wandered through downtown Asheville, then you’ve felt the wanderlust (and “wonder-lust)” of this historic warren.

Here, connecting two of the city’s most sought-after streets – W. Walnut and Woodfin/Hiawassee – Carolina Lane is a quiet (for the city) alley, long known to the real Asheville. This is where Oscar winning actress Frances McDormond conspicuously smoked her cigarettes after a day of filming in the area and industry once reigned. And this neighborhood? Well, it’s still a place where restaurants go unadvertised and the best bars have no signs, just a door. A place where high-end art galleries about record shops, upscale shoe stores, and more.

And, while Real Life may be about compromise – sacrifice This to get That – we believe that vacation should be a special time. A time you get both This and That, no compromise required.

33 Caroline Lane is your no-compromise-required desti
host_about:
Growing up Santa Fe, NM I saw a unique blend of artistic community, endless outdoor opportunities, interesting history, beautiful landscapes, and a diverse mix of cultures.

Though far from Santa Fe and a different climate, I arrived in Asheville in the early 90’s to practice Chinese Medicine and felt some of the same elements at play.  Asheville was not well known, but you could feel the energy building and the mixture of art, landscape, environment, history and community all coming together.  It reminded me of my ‘early days’ in Santa Fe.  

One of my closest friends was Andy Brokmeyer, who I told for several years that he needed to come to Asheville, as it was a dynamic and exciting place.  We were also avid kayakers, and Asheville has been a Mecca for kayaking since the early days of the sport so I knew I could lure him out with the promise of all the great rivers in the area. 

He came out ‘for a visit’ and hasn’t left.  That was 16 years ago.  

Asheville has grown into the most happening place in the region, far beyond my expectations, and has sustained an authentic, community oriented and dynamic quality.  Like my dad used to say about few places, it has ‘cultural energy’. 

Though both Andy and I had done some residential real estate investment and development, 80 N Lexington was our first move into the commercial side.  It was an old building, greatly in need of repair, and was a bit removed from the core downtown commercial traffic.  We scraped together what we could and fixed it up, with an eye towards something special in the future. 
 
Now, many years later, North Lexington Ave is hopping, with restaurants, breweries, bars, tea houses, coffee shops, galleries and wonderful, diverse retail shops right out the door.  

And 80 N Lexington has been transformed into a blend of funky, hip, and industrial intertwined with lush, upscale design.  A mix of style and comfort that is unique and authentically Asheville.  

Just like Asheville, there’s nothing quite like it.

description:
Romantic and cozy, Celia's Cottage is the ultimate getaway for couples.

The space
Romantic and cozy, Celia's Cottage is the ultimate getaway for couples. This cottage was built by hand in 1922 and still retains the original logs both inside and out, but has been extensively remodeled to offer guests modern amenities, like WiFi, cable TV, and air conditioning.

The cottage is less than 10 minutes to downtown Asheville, where you can explore award winning restaurants, craft breweries, and stores featuring local artisans. Uber and Lyft are available to take you to downtown or other nearby attractions. Hiking on the Blue Ridge Parkway is right outside your door- only 125 ft to the start of the Mountain to Sea trail. Also convenient to the Biltmore Estate, which is an easy 10 minute drive. Chimney Rock and Lake Lure are 35 minutes south of the cottage.

Reconnect, relax, and enjoy everything the Blue Ridge Mountains and Asheville has to offer. T
neighborhood_overview:
Greybeard Rentals manages vacation rentals and vacation cabins in Asheville, Black Mountain, Montreat, Old Fort and surrounding areas. Located 10-15 minutes from downtown Asheville, Black Mountain is a quaint town with many great shopping options, delicious restaurants, breweries and access to hiking trails and wilderness areas. TripAdvisor named Black Mountain one of America’s Prettiest Towns in 2017.

Asheville is home to award-winning restaurants, stunning mountain views with access to areas like the Blue Ridge Parkway, The Biltmore Estate, and a variety of local art and culture. Oh, and did we mention Asheville has had the record for having more breweries per capita than any other U.S. city? We held the title for Beer City USA in 2009. Hiking trails are also located throughout western North Carolina.
host_about:
Joined Airbnb in 2018.

Established in 1999, Greybeard Rentals is proud to share with you the finest Asheville Cabins and vacation rentals in Black Mountain, Montreat and the surrounding Asheville area. Each of our North Carolina Vacation Rentals is fully equipped and lovingly furnished by the owner. We're proud of each vacation home we manage, selecting only those we would be excited to vacation in ourselves.

With more than 200 North Carolina vacation rentals available, Greybeard offers a variety of options. From in-town bungalows to remote Asheville NC cabins on top of the world, we can assist you with the perfect vacation home. We rent homes for the weekend, week, month or year.

description:
Welcome to your urban oasis! Minutes away from Asheville’s thriving downtown scene, this newly remodeled and refurbished hideaway offers a private deck and entrance, claw foot tub, gas fireplace, plush king-size bed, and more.

The space
Nestled in Asheville’s historic Montford neighborhood, this cozy hideaway encompasses the best of both worlds, offering both privacy and convenience.

You’re just a pleasant 20-minute walk from all of the best breweries and restaurants Asheville has to offer. If you’re in town to enjoy the music or art scene the River Arts District provides, you’re equally centrally located. Stroll just five minutes down the hill to arrive at the Salvage Station, and bypass the crazy parking other concert goers have to contend with.

If, on the other hand, you’re looking for a personal getaway or romantic weekend in the mountains, take advantage of the gas fireplace, claw foot tub and private deck. Bubbles and beer, complimen
neighborhood_overview: Just a twenty-minute walk from downtown, your urban oasis is both in the heart of it all, yet a respite from the hustle and bustle of downtown. (If you visit in spring, summer or fall, you may catch sight of our neighborhood bears!) Walk just up the street in the mornings to grab coffee at All Day Darling, and continue on down Montford Avenue for incredible Caribbean fare at Nine Mile. Or simply sit back, relax, and enjoy one of Beer City’s best brews on your private deck!
host_about:
Hi! I'm a psychotherapist, life coach and freelance writer based in Asheville, NC. I'm also an avid traveler; I've called Asheville home for 7 years. 

I love to introduce guests to all our magical mountain town has to offer, from food and brews to breathtaking hikes.

Inside you will find high ceilings, fun art and textiles, several windows looking out on the oak-lined back yard and a refrigerator stocked with a sampling of local beer.

Other amenities include:

TV with Hulu, Netflix, Amazon Prime and Youtube TV (live sports, local and live tv)

WiFi

Walk-in shower with tiled floor and all-glass door.

Coffee/tea/water/surprise baked good :)

Private bedroom with queen size bed.

A 5 ft wide sofa in the separate living area a (less-than-5ft-tall) child could sleep on.

Bluetooth speaker.

Table and Chairs.

Ceiling fan/light combo with remote in master bedroom.

Small covered out
neighborhood_overview:
We are on the east side of West Asheville near the River Arts District. From our quiet neighborhood you are a ten minute walk away from 4 breweries (including New Belgium) a record shop, several coffee shops and a diverse selection restaurants and bars along the Haywood Rd corridor and down towards the River Arts District.

There is a convenience store a short walk from the house and a full grocery store a mile away.

A greenway that connects you to much of the city is also a 10 minute walk away.

Downtown is a short drive or cheep Lyft/Uber away.

name: Renovated Farmhouse with Pond-10 min to Downtown!
description:
****NO CHILDREN BELOW AGE 12 DUE TO DEEP POND JUST OUTSIDE THE DOOR

This is the original farmhouse on our 40-acre property. Recently, we updated the inside with modern amenities, while preserving much of the original charm. The house has a pond and water feature, and is super convenient to downtown (just 6.5 miles). We have been hosts since 2012 and have lots of reviews for our other two houses on the property. We are excited to share this new space with guests!

The space
This charming farmhouse has a modern kitchen, high ceilings and plenty of comfortable seating. There is a fireplace to enjoy in the winter and fall, an outdoor fire pit, a pond with a floating pontoon boat turned dock, a water feature that makes a serene flowing water sound, a front porch with rocking chairs and a cafe table, another cafe table in the kitchen overlooking the pond, a small dining table for 4, a small yoga room, and so so so much more! You can also explore the prop
neighborhood_overview: This is a wonderful neighborhood with great people!  It has a rural feel, but it is extremely convenient to everything in Asheville.  We are just outside the city limits, so you truly have the best of both worlds.  Uber and Lyft and all delivery services come here.  The house is situated on a country two lane road, but it does not have much traffic as it is a horse shoe road that services the folks who live on it.
host_about: I live on the other side of the farm and raise goats and chickens with my family.  Having a vacation rental has been a dream for awhile.  I am also a licensed naturopathic physician, but right now I spend most of my time on the farm!

name: Your Montford Nest
description:
Relax in a serene, private, cottage setting nestled in Historic Montford. Surrounded by trees and charming homes, you'll love how close you are to downtown while feeling tucked away in your own cozy paradise. This master suite comes equipped with it's own entrance, sitting area, kitchenette with breakfast bar, and luxury master bath. Be rest assured, this newly remodeled suite is thoroughly & professionally cleaned & great attention is given to disinfect every surface and fixture between guests

The space
This second floor suite has been recently and completely remodeled and offers filtered water from every fixture, brand new furniture and amenities including dedicated wifi, a mini split for your heating and cooling needs as well as on demand hot water and a smart TV.

Guest access
Guests will be given a unique code to access their unit and have the entire second floor to themselves including a private porch and back entrance which only they
neighborhood_overview: Historic Montford lies just north of the city center and is one of the most desirable places to live and stay in Asheville. It is a charming, scenic, residential district close to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment. It is ideal for taking leisurely strolls with a green-way on Reed Creek behind the neighborhood and a park nearby which has tennis and basketball courts. Several eateries offer a variety of menus and libations within walking distance including Nile Mile, Chiesa, Little Jumbo, 5 Points, and All Day Darling. All of Asheville including the River Arts District, downtown, the South Slope, East side, and West Asheville are a mere 5-10 minute drive from your accommodations.
host_about: I'm a fairly eclectic and diversified individual who has several interests which span many disciplines including history, travel, Civic altruism, and the Arts. I spent many years in the service industry and understand what it takes to provide an excellent experience for the client. The Golden Rule always applies and it is one I choose to live by, do unto others ....

name: Modern, Walkable West Asheville Apartment
description:
Welcome to our beautiful, modern efficiency apartment. Approximately 500 sqft of thoughtfully designed living space including a spacious outdoor living area with firepit. Located 6 minutes from downtown in the heart of vibrant West Asheville, our space offers guests the ability to explore the city, visit renowned attractions and dine at award-winning restaurants, just like a local!

The Graham House @grahamhouse.asheville features modern decor and full amenities so you can feel right at home.

The space
Please read before booking:

Our efficiency apartment is located in the bottom level of our charming 1930s bungalow. My husband and I live full time in the top floor of the home. We work hard to make your stay as secluded feeling as possible, but you may hear occasional foot steps or a friendly bark from our 2 fur babies. Our apartment will serve as a perfect landing spot for 2 friends or a couple, as you explore all that Asheville has to offer
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a hip, highly sought-after neighborhood. There is a strong presence of restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Our street is a combination of young parents and professionals as well as houses in transition of renovation.
host_about: After growing up and attending school in North Carolina, my heart is with the mountains! I invite guests to share a piece of tranquility, and take part in the vibrant culture of Asheville, North Carolina. We look forward to your stay!

name: Green-built studio apartment in West Asheville
description:
Our cozy studio apartment has a private entrance accessed through a shared back patio. We are located in a quiet West Asheville neighborhood and are within walking distance of cafes, restaurants, breweries & parks. The River Arts District is just across the river and Asheville's downtown is a short 5 minute drive. Carrier Park offers biking & running options, and our favorite trail system, Bent Creek is only 7 miles away. We are grateful to call Asheville home and love to share it with others!

The space
Your space is on the bottom floor of our home. As a family with 2 young children, there may be sounds of little people's footsteps throughout the day, but all should be quiet from 8pm until 7am. You will have a washer & dryer (along with eco-detergent) for your convenience as well as a mini-fridge and microwave. Organic coffee and tea are provided. We have a whole house coconut-carbon water filter so delicious water is available right out of our taps! Your pat
neighborhood_overview: Located on the east side of West Asheville, you're a five minute walk from restaurants and coffee shops. Try OWL Bakery for pastries & coffee, or TacoBilly for Asheville's best breakfast tacos. Carrier Park is also a 5-10 minute walk with river access and a huge playground. If you are coming with kids, there's also a neighborhood playground right on our street.
host_about: We’re long time Asheville residents. Please ask us for recommendations about our town. Shelton & Margaret

name: ★Rudy's Place★30Day|Wlk Dtwn, Biltmore&Hospital
description:
Luxury, tiny condo in convenient Central Asheville. 2nd /Top Floor walk-up. 1 BDRM, 1 Bath 600sq ft. Fully renovated.

East/West facing picture windows, guest will enjoy fabulous morning sunrises over the hill, and beautiful evening sunsets over a well-manicured courtyard.

This quiet retreat is perfect for solo travelers, digital nomads, or couples. Get to all the attractions Asheville has to offer in a jiffy; or stay home, relax, and enjoy the serenity.

The space
• Keyless Entry
• Luxury Bath outfitted with Marble tile and a jet tub
• Washer/Dryer room en suite with laundry hamper
• Real Hardwood Floors
• Large Closet space with shelving and hooks

• Small Appliance Kitchen for Simple, Easy Living: Refrigerator, Microwave, Oven Range. Note: there is no Dishwasher.
• Double Hung Windows throughout so you can enjoy the cool mountain air
• Double and Picture Windows East and West (great for sunrise
neighborhood_overview:
Spacious grounds feature open courtyard, and common areas. Community is adjacent to a historic Asheville neighborhood where you can walk and enjoy the glorious shade of the established trees and the clean mountain air.

• Centrally located (1mi to Downtown, .5 to Biltmore Village and the Front Gate to the Biltmore House, 1.8mi to River Arts District, 2.5 to Asheville Mall)
• Grocery :1.2 to French Broad Food Co-op Downtown (walkable)
2mi to Whole Foods, Harris Teeter and Trader Joes; and 2.5 to Ingles (all an easy drive)
• Next door to Mission Hospital
• ART (city bus) main station 1.6mi. Bus stop is a block away, down the hill.
• 3.6 to Grove Park Inn
• 4.5 to Blue Ridge Parkway
• 12-15mi (depending on route) to Asheville Regional Airport
host_about:
Fashion Designer, Artist, Triathlete, Kitesurfer, Actor, Executive Recruiter, Entrepreneur, Computer Nerd, Lover of all things beautiful, Explorer, Traveler, Adventuress...

 I currently split time between Asheville and Wilmington North Carolina; was born in Greensboro; raised in Durham; went to college in Chapel Hill; had my first professional job in Raleigh; lived in Charlotte for a few years, and have been coming  to the mountains (Asheville) and the beach (Emerald Isle/Morehead City/Atlantic Beach/Beaufort) since before I could walk.  I have deep roots in the state of North Carolina and some relatives who have been very involved in its growth and development.  This includes a grandmother who co-wrote the first guidebook about Western North Carolina (Rudy) as well as a few baby kissers .;)

As a hostess, I'm channeling those relatives and all they have taught me about southern hospitality.  Sharing North Carolina culture is truly in my DNA.  As a traveler I look forward to being a good guest and experiencing your town/city.   Either way, excited to meet new people and further expand my worldview...green lights all the way!!!

name: Driftwood by The River
description:
Secluded 2 bedroom (available as a 3 bedroom see Driftwood by the River 3.0) lower level duplex situated on 3 acres of private riverfront in East Asheville! Convenient to I-40 and Tunnel Rd. (Hwy 70) at Exit 55. Warren Wilson College, V.A. Hospital, & The Blue Ridge Parkway are nearby. Downtown Asheville & Biltmore Estate are 6 miles away. Guests enjoy sunning on the big rock and watching the abundant wildlife from the large decks.

The space
3 acres of riverside landscaped tranquility and newly renovated lower level of private home. Private entry from massive covered deck. One master suite on the river side with queen bed and private bathroom with shower. Second bedroom with queen bed. Second full bath off large living room with premium Bose surround sound and flat screen wall mounted TV. Super deluxe queen sized modern fold out sofa and single futon. Well stocked kitchen with coffee/tea service and goody basket.

Guest access
Driftwood by t
neighborhood_overview: East Asheville is a great location to base during your visit. Blue Ridge Parkway and the Biltmore Estate are minutes from your secluded driveway. Take in a concert at Highland Brewery or The Salvage Station or enjoy the many restaurants and shops in Black Mountain.  With great access to I-40 and Tunnel Rd. its easy to get lost in all that the area has to offer and still find your way home.
host_about: My wife Pamela and I enjoy living in such a beautiful area. We like to hike and spend time in nature.  Our work is in music and entertainment. Libre manages a boogie-woogie piano trio named Screaming Js and operates an outdoor music festival and wedding venue in Spartanburg SC called The Music Camp. Events are our passion and we are happy to provide event services to those we host at Driftwood by The River or at our much larger location in Spartanburg, SC. It is our hope that you will enjoy our property and send your best friends to this fantastic location. We assume you didn't look for such a secluded place to meet new people but if you need us for anything we are available to help.

description:
Mountain views and a fenced-in yard welcome you to ‘The Nest,’ your upscale Asheville home-away-from-home! The 5-bedroom, 2.5-bath vacation rental spreads out over 3,300 square feet, adorned with new furnishings and essential at-home comforts. Prepare meals in the full kitchen, stream shows on the Smart TV, enjoy the game room and deluxe tree house. This peaceful 4-house neighborhood sits on a private road, less than 9 miles from major sites like The Biltmore Estate and Downtown Asheville.

The space
3,300 Sq Ft | Mountain Views | Fire Pit | New Furnishings & Mattresses | Super Clean

Enjoy working and educating "from home" without the stresses of being AT your own home! This group-friendly getaway is great for remote school and work, as well as extended family gatherings, bachelor/ bachelorette celebrations, church and business retreats, and college group reunions! Choose this property if you're traveling for sightseeing in downtown Asheville, adventu
neighborhood_overview: Search online for "The Nest, Asheville Airbnb video" to view a video tour of the house, outdoor space, and neighborhood.
host_about: Hi, I’m Andrea!  My husband, Brian, and I have lived in Asheville for over 20 years!   We were high school sweethearts, growing up in Raleigh and getting married just two weeks after graduating from NC State.  We are parents to eight children (ages 6-18), three of whom we adopted from Haiti in March of 2018.  As a family, we enjoy hiking, bicycling, traveling, watching movies, reading books, and playing board games.  When we were first married, Brian and I lived in Canada and spent our time rock climbing, ice climbing, white water kayaking, mountain biking, and leading high ropes adventures at a camp and retreat center.  After 20 years in sales, banking, engineering, and customer service management, Brian is now happily self-employed in the real estate industry.  I enjoy the many tasks (except cooking) that keep me busy between running a large household and our Airbnb rentals.  Together, Brian and I enjoy experiencing new destinations, watching live performances, and eating out.  We are passionate about creating a special vacation for our guests!  We look forward to hosting you!

name: Lucerne Chalet in The Treetops in DT AVL, Dog Fndy
description:
The Lucerne Chalet is nestled in the private mountain treetops while being a five minute drive away from downtown with easy access to the Biltmore Estate, the Blue Ridge Parkway and local breweries.

Excellent location to take advantage of current downtown restaurant pick up services.

Inside there is an updated kitchen, a gas fireplace and two chalet style bedrooms. Soak in the mountains from the rocking chairs on the gated porch or during a relaxing stroll through the neighborhood.

The space
Come enjoy the mountains! We have taken the CDC recommended steps to ensure your wellbeing.

We are a local Asheville-based small company that prides itself in providing all of our guests a FIVE-STAR vacation.

The open floor plan is perfect for small gatherings, the many windows give an outside treetop feel to the living space. The dining room space can also be converted into a workspace if a remote working location is needed.
neighborhood_overview: These mid-century chalets were built exclusively for vacation rentals.  Lucerne was recently lovingly remodeled with all the modern conveniences.
host_about:
Ron is a Asheville/WNC native.  He loves hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic and ancient mountains.   

Darlene relocated from Michigan to Asheville a few years ago. She loves visiting  quaint  towns in and around Asheville and local attractions like the Biltmore Estate as well as discovering new hiking trails.  Her outdoor passion is kayaking and rock climbing.

Most of our vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, dog friendly and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back. Please see individual properties for their unique features. 

We both are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

We look forward to sharing the WNC area with you!

Darlene - Director of Operations and Concierge
Ron - Property Manager

description:
Comfortable home very close to Biltmore Village, the Biltmore and about 10 minutes to downtown Asheville. Bedroom is equipped with a queen sized foam mattress and soft bed linens. The bathroom will be shared with one other guest in the room next to you. All dogs friendly with other dogs are welcome. There is a full fenced in backyard. There is currently one very friendly dog living here and may be other dog guests.

The space
Since this is mainly for long terms stays, please feel at home! You will have your own cabinet for your food and a shared kitchen with all the dishes and utensils you may need for your stay. There are 2 decks to hang out on and an outdoor covered space with outdoor couches and chairs. Laundry room is in the finished basement. Included in your stay are laundry, electric, wifi, t.v. in living room has netflix, amazon prime, and other basic cable channels including HGTV and HBO. ;) The house is at the end of a cul de sac in a racially diverse ne
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a unique blend of people. It is usually a quite cul de sac and is about a mile from Biltmore Village, the small town outside of the Biltmore Estate. Less than 10 minutes to Mission Hospital.
host_about: Hi there! I am an avid traveler and love to be able to go to new places as well as well loved places with people I love. I've found that life is all about the experiences and being able to spend time with my favorite people is always a great experience. I am a very open minded and lovable person that would love to welcome you into my home. I want everyone that stays here to feel at home and to be as comfortable as possible.

name: Montford Home -Entire Upstairs! 1 Mile to Downtown
description:
Historic Montford home. Entire upstairs, private front porch and yard. Exclusive front door entrance, no shared space - social distancing safe! Beautiful neighborhood, easy 1 mile walk to downtown Asheville.

The space
2 BR, full bath, bonus room with day bed and kitchenette. Rare offering in Asheville's historic district of Montford. Safe, beautiful neighborhood - 1 mile walk to downtown. Food delivery and pick up available in the neighborhood, grocery stores within 1/2 mile. Hosts on property in downstairs living space.

We love guests and can help with suggestions of what to do, where to go in Asheville, but we are behind locked doors so if you are private people, you won't see us at all!

*the city of Asheville Homestay ordinance mandates:
"Homestay (see section 7-16-1 c.9.) : must be operated out of your primary residence and the Owner must be residing in the dwelling unit during Guests’ stay. A maximum of two bedrooms can be used.
neighborhood_overview: Montford is Asheville's historic district. It's quiet and safe, with beautiful restored 1920s era homes in a charming neighborhood. Lovely for evening walks. Downtown Asheville is just 3/4 mile away, but you feel distinctly removed from the city!

name: Biltmore Hideaway - Luxury Urban Tree Top Retreat
description:
Welcome to your Biltmore Hideaway! Located in historic Kenilworth, this 750 SF 2 bdrm/1 bath private lower level apartment is a stone’s throw away from Biltmore Estate and historic Biltmore Village, and 1.7 miles to Downtown Asheville. We offer luxury accommodations with a screened porch nestled among the treetops where you can enjoy your complimentary Biltmore Estate wine, local spirits, & snacks. You will have a private entrance and we are taking extra precautions to disinfect the apartment.

The space
The living room features a luxurious cognac leather sectional and ottoman, offering plenty of relaxed seating. You will also find a SMART TV above the remote controlled gas fireplace. Although there is no cable TV, you have access to Netflix, Hulu, the internet, and several local channels via a hidden digital antenna.

The kitchen offers granite countertops, a mini-fridge with freezer, countertop induction cook top, microwave, small countertop convect
neighborhood_overview: The historic Kenilworth neighborhood is pedestrian-friendly and showcases everything from small Arts and Crafts cottages to significant estates.  It is walking distance to Biltmore Village, with its quaint shops and restaurants, and you can even see Biltmore Hideaway from the Biltmore Estate's entrance during certain seasons. Enjoy 6 local breweries/cider houses and Casablanca Cigar Bar right down the road. We are just 15 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and less than a mile from Mission Hospital.
host_about: Hey Friends! We are sisters running an Airbnb together. We created a partnership to create a beautiful space where our guests can stay and feel cared for. We hope you come and enjoy our space!!

name: Enchanting Asheville Retreat - Entire House!
description:
Welcome to your perfect vacation retreat in Asheville. We are close and convenient to just about everything Asheville has to offer! Located roughly 10 minutes away from Downtown Asheville, West Asheville, and the River Arts District.

This enchanting house comes with a beautiful full-kitchen with granite counters, dining room, living space all with hardwood floors and even includes outdoor living space as well as a fire pit.

The space
This vacation house has 3 bedrooms. All beds are equipped with queen-sized mattresses. The entire house has beautiful hardwood floors as well as a large kitchen space complete with granite counters. The house also includes a formal 6-seating dining table in a separate dining room as well as a small breakfast table or laptop workstation in the spacious kitchen.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire house. You will be able to check-in at anytime during your scheduled stay with the keycode pr
neighborhood_overview: Don't forget to check out Shorties BBQ across the street for some delicious 12-Hour Hickory Smoked BBQ at fast food prices!
host_about: I have been staying in Asheville since 1997 when I moved here during my primary school years. The food and the craft beer here are among the best and it's the perfect size without being too packed with heavy traffic.  I also love to travel, especially overseas. I mainly travel for food, with sightseeing and other events being secondary. I've been to Canada, Mexico, England, Italy, France, Netherlands, Japan, Hong Kong, and China. I am also fluent in English, Mandarin, and Cantonese.

name: Charming Tiny Cottage in Central Location
description:
This is a sweet cozy getaway centrally located less than 5 min. from Asheville airport and Sierra Nevada, 15 min. from downtown Asheville, and 20 to downtown Hendersonville. Relax on a new memory foam mattress with a walk in closet and an updated bathroom. Enjoy smart TV with cable, internet, refrigerator, microwave, range, cookware, and a coffee maker. There’s a keyless door code for convenience and privacy. The house is easy to get to, has ample parking in a safe and quiet neighborhood.

The space
This charming tiny cottage is newly renovated, open and spacious with high ceiling and skylights to keep it bright and happy on the inside. It has all the convenience of home, including what you need to cook a nice meal. Enjoy the different natural wood textures and colors inside and outside this quiet cedar bird sanctuary. Our neighbors are friendly and we have community watch.
neighborhood_overview: Less 3 minutes from Asheville Airport, Sierra Nevada, Western NC Agricultural Center, and conveniently close to the interstate.  Charming bird sanctuary beside the calming sounds of water from a running creek in a dog friendly neighborhood.

name: Amazing Long Range Mountain Views, Hot Tub & More!
description:
Minimum age to is 27. 5 night minimum June-August and major holidays.

Rustic and cozy house with modern touches and incredible long range mountain views. Accommodates up to 8 people.
Large screened porch with ample seating and bar. Game/Family room on lower level with 9' shuffleboard table. 5 minutes to restaurants/entertainment of South Asheville, less than 20 to downtown Asheville $75 fee for up to two dogs.

The space
The pictures of this house don't do it justice. You will be pleasantly surprised when you walk into this house!
neighborhood_overview: Numerous restaurants, shopping, gyms and movie theatres all within a 5-10 drive and that's even before you get to Asheville (which is less than 20 minutes north of this house.)
host_about: Tony and I live in Weaverville (15 minutes north of Asheville) and have 5 vacation rentals that we have been offering to guests around the world for 6 years now.   Our business is called Dancing Bear Vacation Rentals of Asheville.  We are are committed to offering our guests a comfortable and stress free stay at our rentals.  We are dog lovers and have 3 German Shepherds.   We love to walk our dogs, eat at the fantastic restaurants in Asheville and enjoy the eclectic culture this awesome town has to offer.   We are very grateful that our vacation rentals have become successful and keep us busy.  We  love to communicate with travelers from all over the world  and look forward to continuing to provide our guests with a great Asheville experience!

Newly renovated mountaintop lodge just 3 miles to Downtown Asheville. Guests will enjoy plenty of space on three levels with breathtaking views from two decks overlooking the Beaverdam area of Asheville.

The space
Three bedrooms, three baths, and three living areas allow guests to spread out when necessary while the large dining table and kitchen island invite guests to commune for a meal, conversation, or game night.

The lowest level boasts a pool table, 65" TV and it's own deck.

Guest access
You and your family and friends will have access to 100% of this beautiful and thoughtfully laid out home.
Note that there is a locked storage area used for cleaning and maintenance supplies.

Other things to note

host_about:
Just a hard working ole cuss trying to get out of the rat race.

name: "Hygge" 3BR Bungalow close to Dwtn and River Arts
description:
Our 1920s bungalow with its great natural light and comfortable space defines Hygge (cozy contentment and simple enjoyment). Enjoy a full kitchen when dining in, a large fenced-in back yard for relaxing, and private parking when you are finished exploring for the day. Asheville, surrounded by unparalleled scenic beauty and trails, has fantastic restaurants and breweries, the breathtaking Biltmore, and unique and plentiful shopping. How’s that for cozy contentment!

The space
This 1920s bungalow retains its original charm with hardwood floors and natural light, but has updated kitchen and bathroom. The house has been outfitted with everything you need for an easy, comfortable stay.

Guest access
Enjoy the entire home and large fenced in yard!

Other things to note
If you are bringing a pet, there is a $45 pet fee for a stay of up to one week and a $90 pet fee for a stay of up to two weeks. This will be charged through
neighborhood_overview: Woodfin is a wonderful quiet neighborhood, 5-10 minutes from UNC-Asheville, downtown Asheville and the River Arts District.  The house is located on the main road through Woodfin with easy access to all the above as well as historic Biltmore and the Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about:
My husband and I love to travel.  Our destinations usually are cities with vibrant neighborhoods, lots of great restaurants, museums and perhaps an outdoor adventure or two.  Recent destinations have included Vancouver, London, Paris and Nashville TN. Next up is Prague and Vienna.  We're so excited!  

We love Asheville NC and have purchased a second home there which we operate as an Airbnb.  We welcome guests from all walks of life and are glad to introduce them to all that Asheville and the surrounding area has to offer.

a large wooden private place with fire pit and sitting area also a grill.

Kick your feet back & admire the mountain view or enjoy a cold beer while having a barbeque outside with your family & friends & nature as your closest neighbor. This 2 acre country style with a modern twist home satisfies both the privacy conscience & the outdoorsies. The open floor layout of this home is perfect for families who want to be together & when the time arises; unwind in the privacy of nature or in our 3 bedroom, 2 bath home alike. Pisgah National Forest is a whopping 1.3 miles from our home so that means you can walk, cycle, ride a horse, or just jump in your car & enjoy nature in its raw beauty. When it’s time to sit back & relax from your vacation, you can netflix & chill using our living room tv & complimentary wifi connection; or you could relive your past with our gaming machine that allows you to play the all time classics. name: NEW! The Curve in West AVL + walk everywhere!
description:
We care about your safety! We are taking extra care to disinfect our space due to COVID-19.

BRAND NEW! Beautiful new apartment in East-West Asheville!

Our rental is perfect for a couple or two friends that want a fun weekend in Asheville but a quiet place to relax and unwind. 1 bdrm/1 bath, small kitchen, washer/dryer. Private entrance and huge windows - tons of natural light.

Easy walking distance to New Belgium Brewery and all that West Asheville and the River Arts district have to offer.

The space
Beautiful new apartment in East-West Asheville! This is a quiet, family-friendly neighborhood but with one of the best walking locations in Asheville. Our rental is perfect for a couple (+ a kid) or two friends that want a fun weekend in Asheville but a quiet place to relax and unwind. If you are looking to party all night or pack a bunch of people into a small unit this won't be the rental for you.

This is a completely p
neighborhood_overview:
We are in East-West Asheville which is walking distance to all of West Asheville (bars, breweries, restaurants, shops, cafes) and the River Arts District (restaurants, breweries, art galleries).

You can walk downtown from our neighborhood in 30 - 45 minutes on a direct and safe road, with sidewalks and lots of places to stop for food/drinks on the way.

Hall Fletcher Elementary school playground just one block away!

name: Mountain Experience Minutes from Asheville
description:
A Mountain Experience 13 min. from downtown Asheville! On a hill in a tranquil field of wildflowers, with beautiful mountain views, farmhouse lower level 2 bed room apt: King and Queen, living room: couch & futon, 1 bathroom, W/D, full kitchen, dining room, picnic table/umbrella for the lovely outdoors, generous parking. Best of both country and city living, only 4 min. from I-40 or the Blue Ridge Pkwy, & about 9-17 min. from popular Asheville & Black Mountain destinations.

The space
Parking is up a gravel driveway, in the first pull off to the left. Walk down a gravel path to the lower level of the house. The last door on the right is the apt entrance.

The area directly outside of the apt. is your area to enjoy. Please do not enter other outdoor areas.

For health reasons, we do not allow smoking anywhere on the property.

Your front door will be unlocked via a code.

The entire AirBnB apt is private and separ
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a special pocket of farmland located surprisingly close to major roads.  It has a sweet rural feel while our property has wide open space and a great mountain view.
host_about: Hi, we're Tim and Lori.  We've lived in Western NC for over a decade and it's our favorite place to be!  We hope you enjoy it as much as we do.   : )

name: The Yap House
description:
Bright and cheerful house in West Asheville. Three bedrooms and two full bathrooms. Host lives in a private apartment on the ground floor. The second and thirds floors are reserved for guests with private entrance. House is a 10 minute drive to downtown Asheville and a 7 minute drive to colorful historic West Asheville. Close to many eateries and entertainment.

The space
The house is gated all around and has keyless entry and can be accessed from main road and a private road that leads to the back entrance. It is very private with tall trees.

Guest access
Guests are welcome to enjoy anywhere on property except apartmentt on ground floor.

Other things to note
We offer coffee and tea
We do not provide breakfast
neighborhood_overview: Asheville is known for its many breweries, coffee shops / coffee roasters and ecclectic eateries. Has a thriving music scene and many arts and craft festivals.  The Blueridge Parkway is less than a 15 minute drive. The Biltmore mansion is a 20 minute drive as is Billy Graham's The Cove.
host_about: I am a HVAC Technician and I like to garden. I am from NY and have lived in Asheville for 10 years.  I have lived at this property for 5 years and just recently purchased it.

name: West Asheville Abode unit B
description:
Desirable West Asheville! Walk to top rated restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, bakeries, market, shopping! 3 units available. Unit B is the largest with sleeping space for 6 guests! The Big Bedroom upstairs has a queen bed and 3 twin-size beds, along with the large full bathroom. There is a twin size sofa-bed in the living room.

The space
Unit B has living room, kitchen, bathroom, and a big bedroom with queen bed, and 3 twin beds. There is a single sofa-sleeper in the living room. The spacious kitchen is off the living room on the main floor. There is plenty of off-street parking behind the house, and street parking in front of the house.

Guest access

Walking is recommended while exploring West Asheville, but drive or take other transportation if you’re heading to downtown.
host_about: I am new to being a host, but I'm excited to start managing this property!  We live and work just a stones throw away from this abode and are available anytime. name: Centrally located and quiet
description:
Minutes away from downtown, Blue Ridge Parkway, Biltmore village, River Arts district, shopping, and freeways. This is a great place to freshen up and crash in peace and quiet after a day of hiking and breweries. Although you see mid-week days blocked off, I am open to longer stays. Just let me know.
LGTBQ friendly. Please, no illegal drugs or firearms.

The space
The room is cozy, facing west so you get wonderful morning light. There's a big armchair to kick back in and enjoy your morning coffee from the in-room Keurig. There is a small fridge for your goodies. The bath is not attached but is private.

This home is a short distance from everything you'd want to do in Asheville. It's also a quiet spot to recharge your battery. There are a couple of close-by eateries if you don't feel like going out or you're welcome to use the kitchen. If you don't want to tuck away in the room, you can hang out in the living room with its large windows or chil
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood  is  a quiet space with chill neighbors in a small development, a great spot to come home to after a day of hiking and touring.  The high point is its central location and surrounding greenery
host_about:
Hi, I'm a pretty cheerful outgoing person and at the same time enjoy my peace and quiet. I'm looking forward to meeting a wide variety of people. So many of us have an interesting story.
Hola, soy una persona bastante alegre y extrovertida, pero también me gusta mi paz y tranquilidad.  Espero conocer una gran diversidad de gente. Tantos tenemos historias interesantes.

name: Elegant Mountain Chalet 15 Minutes to downtown AVL
description:
This chalet features a hot tub, garden dining, fenced in yard and king size beds. Look out through the windows over the trees and as far as the Blue Ridge Parkway. The morning views from the deck are breathtaking, and you may spot a fox or bear. Nestled on top of Buffalo Mountain, this hideaway is charming, romantic and relaxing. A scenic 15-minute drive from both downtown Asheville and Black Mountain, this nook is the perfect peaceful getaway.

The space
You won't be disappointed by gorgeous decor and comfort of this home. It is fully stocked, has two living rooms, and 3 porches on different levels for taking in the views! It features 2 bedrooms with king size beds and private baths. The property is surrounded by trees which creates a treehouse feel and complete privacy. The mountain that the house sits on has a direct view across the valley to a famous lookout spot on the blue ridge parkway, (you get the opposite view right from your porch)! *please see note abo
neighborhood_overview: Overlooking a valley filled with green pastures, winding brooks, cows, sheep and the occasional wild turkey, this neighborhood offers ample options for exploration. Enjoy a stroll up the hill, or venture further on one of the many accessible hikes surrounding the valley. For urban-based fun, explore Asheville's breweries and renowned restaurants. Enjoy one of Asheville's many downtown festivals and free concerts, or visit the eclectic art galleries scattered across town.
host_about:
Hello! I adore the charming, eccentric, creative, outdoorsy city of Asheville so much that sharing it with other people is a true passion for me. I have been an Airbnb host since October 2019 and have hosted people from all over the world. I love connecting with travelers and providing insight on the nuances of this vibrant city, while doing everything I can to make your stay in Asheville a phenomenal one. I'm always available via phone or the app and am happy to answer any and all questions you have!  

I love to cook and eat, so many of my recommendations revolve around food. I'm guessing if you are visiting Asheville for the first time you were probably drawn in by the food and/or beer scene, so we already have something in common! I also have lots of ideas on fun things to do in Asheville, there is always something interesting going on! Thanks so much for reading about me, I look forward to meeting you!
Best wishes, Christy

name: Walk To Downtown Asheville: Affordable Sun Room
description:
Welcome to our charming homestay! We’re just 2.5 blocks to the South Slope; 5 blocks to downtown. My lovely homies live with me. This Sun Room is for 1 PERSON ONLY. Single bed, dresser, lamp, lots of windows. No closet. Thick curtain vs. door for privacy. Shared bathrooms & common areas. We are clean, respectful, relaxed. Enjoy a cup of tea + rocking chairs on our front porch. COVID: We clean daily. Please use sanitizer, wear a mask, be smart. PLEASE READ all details before you book, thanks : )

The space
READ BEFORE BOOKING: You are renting a room with a single bed for 1 person; NOT a double occupancy room, NOR the entire house. Your room is next to the dining room & comes with a thick privacy curtain vs. a door > we’re quiet & mellow ; )

RESPECT: My housemates & I are mostly women. Respectful, relaxed & very clean. We invite the same of you, ie: do your own dishes, clean up after yourself, the usual...that sometimes needs to be spelled out. We kindly
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION IS EVERYTHING! // 2.5 blocks to South Slope // 5 blocks into downtown // 5 minute drive to Biltmore Estate // 8 minute drive to mountains // 2 minute walk to a track field + awesome view on top of bleachers // Walk to (most of) my faves below! Double check hours. Expect lines

o---------------o-----------------o

• French Broad Food Coop: Everything! Snacks, toiletries, lunch to-go, beer, etc
• High Climate Tea: Gorgeous planty enviro. Tea galore. Mochi treats. Good ppl!
• Sovereign Remedies: Brunch + late dinner. Excellent organic food + cocktails
• Dobra Tea House: Over 100 tea options. Comfy seating. West side is cuter
• Storm Rhum Bar: Pretty outdoor dining. Delicious local cuisine. 5 blocks
• Gan Shan West: Favorite Asian Fusion in town, bonus outdoor seating
• Kathmandu Café: Love this organic Nepali gem run by a sweet family
• Farewell Café: Yummy treats, coffee + ambiance. 2.5 blocks away :)
• Curate & Zambra
host_about: I am mother, gardener, and proud part of a team of women who live in & manage several homes in Asheville, North Carolina. We enjoy hosting & look forward to having you at our homestay : )
