name: AVL apartment between downtown & Biltmore
description:
Welcome to your home base in Asheville. We want you to know that your safety and comfort are our top priorities. We've adopted AirBnB's Enhanced Cleaning And Disinfecting Protocol and are happy to share our perspective around local businesses with similar focus.

Perched on top of Murray Hill, in between downtown and the River Arts District, sits this comfortable two bedroom apartment on the second floor of a 1925 craftsman home with it's own private entrance.

The space
Consistent with the City of Asheville short term rental rules there is no kitchen in the space but you won't need one! There is a hot water kettle, filtered drinking water and a mini fridge. We've also provided locally roasted coffees, teas and snacks. In addition, you've landed in the middle of a rich food and beverage scene with some of the region's best restaurant options within easy walking distance.

Our living room has a WiFi connected television enabled with Roku and
neighborhood_overview:
The South French Broad neighborhood is as authentic Asheville as it gets. A five minute walk gets you into the heart of the River Arts District (RAD). A five minute drive or a 20 minute walk puts you in the middle of downtown or on the South Slope.

Great hikes abound nearby. Mission hospital and the Biltmore are just a short drive from the apartment.
host_about: Hi there! I’m seth, a proud Airbnb guest and host.

name: ~5 star Downtown Spacious Retreat at 35 Patton
description:
1800 square foot loft updated historic building in the epicenter of downtown Asheville. The loft was originally owned by one of Asheville's finest artists and retains its art gallery roots with walls of many original works. Modern updates along with cozy fireplace makes it a true oasis in a bustling city. Just outside your front or back door is live entertainment, shopping, and fine dining. Spa Theory is conveniently located in the lower level of adjacent building.

The space
Feel the heartbeat of the city from this spacious loft. Steps to fine dining, music, children's museum and more. We love our location and am sure you will too.

Guest access
Our entire condo is yours to enjoy. We visit frequently and were previously guests. We fell in love with the openess of the loft and all of the artistic twists that we chose to purchase and leave in place from previous owner.

Other things to note
The Loft at 35 Patton is i
neighborhood_overview: Asheville is has some of the finest restaurants, breweries, music and artistic creativity. No matter how unique your palatte may be you're sure to find something pleasing.
host_location: Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, United States
host_about: We are long time Myrtle Beach residents that enjoy traveling ourselves and providing family friendly spaces for others to enjoy. Kristin’s realtor expertise has allowed us to host at the lovely Forest Dunes Resort. We enjoy family time with our two little ones as well as any water and land related sports.  We also have travelled many years to the Asheville area and are fortunate enough to host at our favorite place to stay downtown.

name: Privacy by city, 3 suites, in/out hot tubs, fp
description:
The house is five minutes to the river arts district, but the back yard feels countryside. All three bedrooms have private bathrooms; two of them have double doors to the backyard/hot tub. The great room has 15’ ceilings, and an indoor/outdoor fireplace with dual double doors to the back porch. Touches like NC barn wood, a walnut slab bathroom sink and natural decor make the house cozy.

The space
This house is so fun! Its shaped like an L, so it shields all the backyard space. The outdoor hot tub is huge, and one of the several decks has an outdoor/indoor fireplace. The middle of the house has soaring cathedral ceilings, a gourmet kitchen and views of the forest.

Guest access
The only portion of the home inaccessible is one garage bay: I have a car in one bay, but you may use the other (plenty of driveway parking, too)
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is very small, and feels rural, but downtown is less than 3 miles.
host_about: I am a mother, nurse, and friend. I enjoy people and being outdoors. I love humor and travel. I believe in kindness.

name: West Asheville Abode unit A
description:
West Asheville Abode unit A is an adorable apartment in a 3-unit house right in the heart of vibrant, hip, West Asheville! This unit has a bedroom with queen bed, bathroom, full kitchen, and living room with a brand new sleeper sofa! Walk to West Asheville’s highly rated restaurants, breweries, bakeries, coffee shops, and shopping!

The space
This house is right on the main road in West Asheville! You can walk to everything and leave you car in the spacious off-street parking behind the house. Each of the 3 units has a separate entrance and security code.

Guest access
Each of the 3 units has a separate entrance and security code. Unit A is on the front left side of the house. You will have the entire apartment, but share the front patio, back parking area and yard.

Other things to note
This house is in the heart of West Asheville! There will be street noise!
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a hip, cool, vibrant neighborhood in the city of Asheville.  Many top rated restaurants are within short walking distance.  There are also breweries, pubs, art, music, shopping, all walking distance.
host_about: I am new to being a host, but I'm excited to start managing this property!  We live and work just a stones throw away from this abode and are available anytime.  I have a 3.5 year old and my partner has an 8 & 10 year old, all boys!  I love traveling, hiking, and hanging out with my awesome friends and family!

description:
Basement of our home with private entrance, 1 bedroom, den with futon and 1 full bath with shower plus full refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot...
We are in a family friendly neighborhood that borders the Pisgah National Forest, NC Arboretum and Blue Ridge Parkway. This is a hiker's and mountain biker's paradise. Our home is within walking distance to the neighborhood park and hiking trails and a 5 minute drive to tubing on the French Broad River, restaurants and the Asheville Outlet Mall.

The space
Private entrance with space to store bicycles.
Kitchenette with dining table, full refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot - no stove top or kitchen sink though.
Note that the private entrance goes through our garage. Also note, we do NOT have a TV in the space but have WiFi so you can access internet. We also have cards and games in the space for your use.

Guest access

Also, we are convenient to everything in Asheville and just minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and NC Arboretum.
host_about:

With a bright and spacious bathroom, adorable kitchen and all new windows it is a perfect little cottage!

Beautiful new contemporary. Private 1600 sq ft accommodation with all the bells and whistles – smart TVs, cable/high-speed internet, gourmet kitchen, washer/dryer and more. Relax after a busy day in two cozy outdoor venues. The treetop level deck features inviting places to sit/dine and an adjacent indoor bar area. Bring out the smart speaker for your favorite tunes or sporting events. Quiet neighborhood, large comfy beds and upscale décor promise a very special stay.

The space
Professionally-styled interior features elegant eat-in kitchen with granite, Samsung and Cuisinart appliances, and Calphalon cookware. Main level master suite with king bed, wall-mounted flat screen TV, large closet and master bath with rainfall shower. Upstairs, second bedroom with king bed, office and media room (smart TV) each with sofa beds, second full bathroom with tub, complimentary private laundry, bar area off large upstairs deck. Tankless water heater for endless hot
neighborhood_overview: Perfectly situated on a quiet cul-de-sac in the heart of eclectic West Asheville.  Just steps from the famous Sunny Point Café (walk to the Sunny!) and other Haywood Road hot spots.  Five-minute drive to rafting on the French Broad and the River Arts District.  Eight minutes to the Biltmore.  Ten minutes to downtown Asheville and the Blue Ridge Parkway.  Convenient to all Asheville attractions including world-class dining and entertainment, locations don't get any better than this!
host_about: Sparky and I would like to welcome you to our home.  We are your hosts but this endeavor is a family business.  My mom and dad, Elizabeth and Jim, are very involved on a frequent basis. description:
Let's be serious, besides the tremendous amount of local art, hiking, history and music... You're here to experience Asheville's world famous beer scene! Come experience the life of a local Asheville Brewer. The Barrel-Aged Beer Home is a 2100 sqft fully craft beer inspired home, covered head to toe in artwork and regenerated brewing equipment.

The space
Located just 9 minutes from Downtown Asheville and 7 minutes from the famous West Asheville, this large home is perfect for families, revisiting friends, bachelor and bachelorettee groups, work retreats, etc...

The Craft Beer Home includes:
*Keyless entry
*Two living rooms (upstairs/downstairs
*A 55' 4K Roku TV
-Stereo with AUX chord hookup
*50+Mbs Wifi
*Four brand new king size memory foam beds
-Each bed includes 4 king size pillows and complete sheet set
*A kegerator of local Asheville craft beer

*Two full bathrooms
neighborhood_overview: The home is located near the end of a seldom traveled, dead-end, street with plenty of parking.
host_about: I am a Brewer for a local craft brewery in Asheville, NC (I'm sure you will figure out which brewery during your stay). Free tours available! I have lived in Asheville for two years and fell in love with this town from day one. description:
Your next Asheville vacation begins with the perfect vacation house. Amazingly convenient and Incredibly close to everything Asheville has to offer! We are 5 minutes away from the River Arts District and less than 10 minutes away from Downtown and West Asheville. We are a legal vacation rental and located right outside the edge of city limits!

Enjoy your next vacation with a beautiful full-kitchen and granite counters, spacious living, dining, and outdoor living space as well as a fire pit.

The space
This spacious two bedroom house comes with all your comfort needs. All beds are equipped with queen-sized mattresses. The entire house has beautiful hardwood floors as well as a large kitchen space complete with granite counters. Comfortable living space with a 55" TV and Netflix included.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire house.

host_about: I have been staying in Asheville since 1997 when I moved here during my primary school years. The food and the craft beer here are among the best and it's the perfect size without being too packed with heavy traffic.  I also love to travel, especially overseas. I am also fluent in English, Mandarin, and Cantonese.

name: Excellent Views & Short Walk to Downtown Asheville
description:
Welcome to the Overlook on Beaucatcher Mountain, a fully remodeled unit with approximately 1500 sqft overlooking downtown Asheville. The space includes 2 large bedrooms with high end queen mattresses, 2 gorgeous bathrooms with spacious showers, game room with pool table, dart board & bar area, living/den area with stone hearth & wood burning fire place, & kitchenette with mini fridge. The space is so nice & comfortable, some of our guests decide to spend more time at home versus going out.

The space
We put extra effort in our remodel and furnishing process to help ensure your stay is
private & comfortable. The inside of the rental unit gets plenty of natural light from four large sliding glass windows and one glass door, all of which have privacy blinds. The entire space is decorated with art which illustrates Asheville and Western North Carolina.

Our house sits on a unique 3.5 acre lot in downtown asheville that is located approximately hal
neighborhood_overview:
I have lived in this neighborhood for 20 years in five different houses and believe this neighborhood is the best place to live in Asheville. I love it because of the following reasons:
1. The proximity to downtown while still being in a residential neighborhood and having mountain views cannot be beat. All parts of downtown are very accessible from this neighborhood by foot or bike.

2. The neighborhood is also very close to what I call Chain Land - every kind of chain store you could imagine plus the Asheville Mall is on the other side of Beaucatcher Mountain which is accessible through the Tunnel. All within 1.5 miles or less.

3. The views are incredible and there are plenty of places to hike.

4. There is a lot of public land, including: several play grounds, two stadiums which host semi pro soccer team and a single A baseball team, and a softball field with two disc golf baskets.

5. Wildlife is thriving for being in a city
host_about: I have lived and worked in Asheville for 20 years.  I love spending time with my family, exploring cool places, fishing, being on water, listening to live music and playing disc golf.  I love people and being in a place of service for our world.  To find out more about my professional background (Hidden by Airbnb) work with meaning.

name: Asheville Home w/Hot Tub & Lavish Game Room!
description:
Looking for a combination of natural wonder and city excitement? Book a trip to this 5-bedroom, 3.5-bathroom vacation rental home in Asheville. Located minutes from acclaimed attractions like the Biltmore Estate and the gorgeous trails of the Pisgah National Forest, this 2,540-square-foot home can’t be beat! Whether you spend your days playing pool with friends, grilling on the upper deck, or drinking your way through the area’s many breweries, you’re sure to have an unforgettable stay.

The space
Furnished Deck | Mountain Views | Game Room

Embrace the beauty and unique culture of Asheville with an unforgettable family getaway to the 'The HoneyComb House,' located minutes from delicious beer and kid-friendly adventure.

Master Bedroom: King Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: Queen Bed | Bedroom 4: Full Bed | Bedroom 5: Queen Bed

OUTDOOR LIVING: Deck, hot tub, fire pit, gas grill, custom Cornhole boards
INDOOR LIVING:

BILTMORE ESTATE (7.9 miles): Biltmore House & Gardens, Biltmore Village & Winery, Biltmore Square

host_about:

name: **Ponds Edge Retreat • 15 mins to dntwn Asheville
description:
Park-like setting! A bright basement apartment at the edge of a creek-fed pond, where you can sit and relax, fish, listen to the birds and frogs, feed our awesome ducks, and take in the close range mountain view!

It’s a peaceful setting where you can return home from your adventures and relax, cook a meal, or Netflix and chill!

The space
If you love quiet, but also being close to the city, you will love Pond’s Edge Retreat!

It is 3.5 miles from I40 and about 15-20 minutes to downtown Asheville, Biltmore Estate, River Arts, shopping, and all that the Asheville area has to offer!

The garage and basement was once a bait and tackle store for the pond. In the 1950’s they held carp fishing tournaments here! There are still very large carp in the pond! You can often see them at the top of the water on a sunny day! There’s also plenty of bass! We have 4 ducks who are full of personality! Charlie, our male, and 3 females that w
neighborhood_overview:
Pond’s Edge is located at the end of the street in a cove. There are a few neighbors, but not many... and 1 of them is another Airbnb that we own. It’s right across the street!

When the pavement ends, it becomes a dirt/gravel road and there are only 3 or 4 people that live beyond the pavement.

We have close range mountain views as well as long range views on a clear day!

In the spring and summer you see lots of green as you look outside and most neighbors are not in eye shot from the rental.

We love the closeness of town, but the secluded feeling you have there!
host_about: I am a 40-something, fun-loving, travel loving lady!  My husband and I own a roofing business.  As business owners, we love to take a vacation anytime we can!  And we love to stay at private homes as often as we can rather than hotels!  Since we know what we like to see in a vacation rental, we try to make ours as comfortable as we would like it to be ourselves!

This room is for 1 person only >> Location is everything! Walk 3 blocks to the South Slope + a few more to Asheville's bustling downtown. Enjoy delicious local restaurants, breweries & more! Stay at our perfectly located natural homestay. This small cozy room features clay painted walls, single bed, dresser, closet & woodland view. All commons are shared with others: kitchen, dining, living, bathroom. Enjoy our front porch rocking chairs & the track field around the corner for a morning run.

The space
NOTE: This is a SINGLE OCCUPANCY room for ONE PERSON only. We have to make it explicit because it seems some people don't read!

COVID: Be smart. Use masks + sanitizer

Guest access
Please enjoy

Industrial installation designed for exceptional Airbnb guests seeking luxury and something 'completely different' now being offered in its entirety to include fully stocked kitchen, dining & living area with 6 themed suites. Our 7 minute fun Treasure Hunt checkin format is Airbnb approved to protect the R&R our valuable guests seek, so if you don’t wish to invest your time making this an exceptional Five-Star ZEN-stay and it's not worth 7 minutes of your time, this might not be for you.

The space
Designed to accommodate a maximum of 12 guests in 6 unique themed suites with a central gourmet kitchen, living-room & dining-area (see individual listings for additional details). PLEASE CHECK UTOPIA'S 6 LUXURY LISTINGS from our Profile Page. The themed suites presently being offered include; Steampunk, Steel, Brickhouse, The Master, USS Utopia & The Factory. Upon confirmation of your reservation, i will ask which guests will occupy which suite (or we're happy to allot
neighborhood_overview: Chunns Cove is a world unto itself, appearing to be hidden deep in the countryside and teeming with wildlife and birdsong. Please check your Guest Clip-board for Host Favorites to Live Like a Local!
host_about: Well-immersed in the pastry and chocolate world for several decades, there is nothing on Marc’s list of culinary delights that features higher than chocolate and coffee. Playing a considerable role in both gutting and rebuilding spectacular Chunn’s Cove and Utopia residences, Marc has conclusively proved that watching informative and directional Home Improvement Shows for the best part of adulthood, is akin to learning a new language. Born in Quebec, Marc’s native tongue is French but his English rivals any native tongue and his Spanish ensures trilinguality. Not without her artistic inheritance, Fay’s world is defined as a pleasurable balance between entrepreneur and artist, commencing with a decade of international business travel in her 20’s, evolving to a decade of motherhood punctuated by a successful online decade in the office. Now the time is ripe to spread those four Sagittarian wings for this highly motivated couple are restlessly eager to explore exciting new ventures.

name: Serenity Now!
description:
The space is a warm and cozy modern apartment with an access deck overlooking a serene wooded area frequented by bears, groundhogs, foxes, turkeys, and who knows what other wildlings. We are fewer than five minutes from just about everything including Biltmore Village and downtown Asheville. Inside you find a beautiful and inviting queen bed, spacious bathroom, and plenty of natural light. There is a long descending pathway with stone steps--please see the pictures in our profile.

The space
Conveniently located close to all of Asheville's attractions yet tucked away in a quiet, wooded neighborhood. The apartment is below our home but has its own private entrance. It is stocked with a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, glasses, dishes, and silverware. We also offer filtered water, award-winning locally roasted Mountain Air coffee, and snack bars. We provide a TV with Google Chromecast to connect to all your favorite streaming apps. It's the perfect retreat aft
neighborhood_overview: Kenilworth is a beautiful neighborhood that is centrally located just north of Biltmore Village. Enjoy taking a stroll over winding, hilly streets while checking out the eclectic architecture and lovely gardens. Kenilworth Park has tennis courts and picnic areas for visitors to use. It is 5 minutes to downtown Asheville and less than 1 mile from the Biltmore Estate entrance.
host_about: Becky is an Asheville native and enjoys hiking, cooking, and spending time with family and friends. Matt grew up in Virginia and has been in Asheville for 15 years. He is an avid cyclist and also enjoys hiking, mycology, and podcasts.

name: Creek-side retreat in the Heart of West Asheville
description:
The Sunburst Suite is a peaceful retreat in the heart of West Asheville, ideally located as a jumping-off point for all activities in and around Asheville. Guests have a short walk up a quiet tree-lined street to reach Haywood Road, the center of West Asheville, with its restaurants, bars, breweries and shops. Downtown Asheville and the up-and-coming South Slope neighborhoods are only 5 miles away. Wake up to birds chirping and wind down listening to the creek and relaxing in the back yard.

The space
The guest suite is in the lower level of our home. It includes a private entrance, queen size bed, a table for two, and a private bathroom, all separated from the main home by a locked door. Appliances available include a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker and hot water heater. All basic amenities included, such as speedy fiber internet, linens, a hot drinks bar, shampoo, conditioner and body wash, so you can worry less about the little things. The private suite is
neighborhood_overview: Downtown is where the tourists go, West Asheville is where the locals go. We love living in West Asheville. It's one of the few neighborhoods in Asheville that truly feels like a neighborhood, where everyone knows each other, or at least happily says "good morning". We have a great tailgate (farmer's) market on Tuesdays during the long growing season and so many tasty restaurants. Some of our favorites are Itto Ramen Bar and Zia Tacqueria for dinner and Hole Donuts and The Hop Ice Cream for sweets. Our home is located on a small cul-de-sac where you're most likely going to hear children playing and chickens cooing, but please keep in mind that West Asheville is a densely-populated neighborhood.
host_about: I live in Asheville with my husband Jeremy and our twin daughters. I'm a huge foodie and make it my personal quest to try every new restaurant that opens in town, quite a feat for a town that's grown in leaps and bounds in the last 10 years. We also love camping as a family in our ultra-light camper. There are so many beautiful places to visit in western North Carolina that each summer we have to balance exploring new campsites and revisiting some past favorites.

Our cleaning specialist has cleaned all
neighborhood_overview: The views are amazing!  When the colors change you will enjoy them even more, especially while sitting by the fire.  There are two large umbrella to provide nice shade.  It is close to everything you want to do in Asheville.
host_about: Hi!  We are Michael & Kerrie, and we have lived in Asheville almost 20 years.  He is a firefighter and I'm a computer geek.  We enjoy camping, concerts, and fun food like burgers and pizza.  His hobbies are riding his vintage dirt bike or his Harley.  Mine is gardening. name: Beautiful lower level apartment with outdoor tub
description:
Beautiful, modern, brand new apartment with two bedrooms, lots of light, and lovely outdoor space with exclusive use of a charming outdoor bath tub. Kitchenette with all the essentials, flat screen television with cable, and a dedicated parking spot with plenty of room for extra cars. This location can't be beat; just a five minute drive from downtown, and a 5 minute walk to New Belgium Brewery, the French Broad river greenway, and all of the wonderful WAVL businesses along Haywood.

The space
We live upstairs and will give you complete privacy, but are always available should you need anything. There is a dedicated parking spot for the lower level suite, with a stone staircase leading down to the private entrance behind the house. There is a lockbox for easy check in and check out. Each bedroom has a queen bed with luxury linens, a closet with hanging bars, and ample sunshine streaming in. There is a full bathroom with tub and rainwater shower, with fluffy towels
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood was named the "hottest neighborhood in Asheville" in 2019. The house is in the heart of East West Asheville, which sits just above the French Broad river and is a stone's throw from downtown Asheville (five minute drive) and the River Arts District (three minute drive, 15 minute walk). There are some amazing West Asheville businesses within a ten minute walk from the house; New Belgium brewery, Owl Bakery, Hole Donuts, the Admiral, and many great bars and music venues.
host_about: I'm a North Carolina native, love music and mountains and good people. I work at a liberal arts college in Asheville as the Director of International Programs. My husband is an architect and builder and together we designed and built our home here in Asheville.

name: Vegetarian, non-smoking clean home.
description:
My home is technically in Woodfin, which is 2 minutes to the Asheville borderline. But you don't have to deal with the continuous traffic of tourists or hard to find parking spots like Asheville. Surrounded by trees, this is a unique property because you feel enclosed by nature. The room is small but clean. I have spent time at Airbnb's across the globe and some of them were filthy​--it was disconcerting. I don't have any domestic animals, so if you have allergies, you are set.

The space
I am a world-class massage therapist. You can schedule a session during your stay.

Guest access
Den, kitchen, bedroom and of course the bathroom. You are free to do your laundry as well I just ask to please bring no meat/fish into my home. Dairy and eggs are okay.

Other things to note
Since my home is off the main street, it is quiet and has a restful feeling.
neighborhood_overview: Around the corner is a Brewery that is along the river. There is an even closer one if that is what you prefer. One mile down takes you into the heart of Asheville. To the right is a chocolate factory where they make gourmet candies and have Vegan ice cream. A few miles away is a movie house where you can order pizza and drinks from INSIDE the theater. This area is paradise. You should absolutely, also check out the Black Mountain area. It's a 20-minute​ drive but well worth since it's an artist community.
host_about: Welcome to all travelers. My home is cozy and I have a new bed for you. There are groundhogs, possums, and even rabbits around. The environment feels like the woods but its only a hop, step, and a jump to Asheville.   I am sorry--no domestic pets. I have a standard of cleanliness, plus some people are allergic and residues linger.  But otherwise, I'm super easy to get along with and I welcome you!

name: East Asheville Home with Superb Mountain Views
description:
Experience the splendor of the Blue Ridge Mountain skies from your deck or front porch, just a 14 minute drive from downtown Asheville, 16 minutes to the Biltmore Estate and less than 20 minutes from Black Mountain.

The deck features views of the Mountains to Sea trail and Blue Ridge Parkway. All photos of views in this listing are taken from our back deck.

Your Blue Ridge Mountain adventure awaits, and we'd be honored to host you!

The space
*Modern mountain chalet with wood vaulted ceiling and open living plan on the main level.

*Bedrooms feature two king sized beds with brand new luxury mattresses, and twin bunk beds with new mattresses.

*Large walkout basement features a new Queen sized sleeper sofa with memory foam mattress, full size futon with mattress that flips for either firm or soft, and two kid favorites, the Yogibo and Loungie convertible chairs.

*55 inch flat screen Smart 4K TV in the basement
neighborhood_overview: Located next to the Blue Ridge Parkway and a stone's throw from the Folk Art Center, our house is also close to all the action on the East side of Asheville and a quick drive to downtown. Tunnel Road is five minutes away, with a convenient Ingles supermarket, coffee shops and several great restaurants and bars, like The Copper Crown, The Social, Filo's and East Village Grille.
host_about: Michelle and Jamie have loved using Airbnb as travelers, and are realizing their dream of becoming Airbnb hosts!

neighborhood_overview: Safe, friendly, quiet neighborhood. Houses are fairly close together but not on top of each other. You will occasionally see neighbors walking their dogs on the road.
host_about: I have called the mountains of NC my home all my life. I enjoy everything this area has to offer. Visiting different places around the world I'm still thankful for all the diversity and countless opportunities Asheville and Hendersonville have to offer. From hiking, biking, shopping, and the ever growing list of local breweries adds to the atmosphere that just seems to welcome you home.

name: Charming Tiny House by the Biltmore Village
description:
Private charming tiny house with loft bedroom. Amazing location: less than one mile from the Biltmore house, 1.5 miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway, 7 minute drive to the heart of downtown. Enjoy a quiet tiny house overlooking gardens, coffee and tea available, refrigerator, covered porch, customized shower with mosaic tiles. This studio is in the privacy of a fenced in area with private entrance. Parking available. Enjoy Michelle's vegetable garden and flowers and stone patio.

The space
Unique tiny house with customized mosaic art work. Enjoy the covered front porch and stone patio in the garden with a fire pit. Great place to relax, do some yoga or workout, all private, only the sounds of birds chirping. We do have dogs and cats that may come visit you while you enjoy the outdoors.

Other things to note
No Smoking
No Parties

Newly remodeled and updated,1/1 studio apartment in a house with a kitchenette
key less entry with keypad
Safe and friendly neighborhood

tranquil property with a lot of landscape,she- shed with furniture

host_about:
Hello
My wife,Dana and I want to rent part of our home out to give people a nice comfortable place to stay while visiting our great city.
Dana has lived in Asheville most of her life and knows the area very well.
I am a retired fire fighter and paramedic from Ft Lauderdale,Fl.

name: Detached Guest House, Private,Walkable W.Asheville
description:
RARE detached suite in the heart of W. Asheville ideal keeping a safe distance. Short walk to breweries, music and restaurants on Haywood Rd. Our spot is on a quiet residential street. Newly renovated with queen bedroom, full bathroom. The separate living room has a sofa that converts into a queen bed. Private deck. The space is on the 2nd floor of our detached garage, meaning private entry and no shared walls or floors for extra privacy and easy social distance safety from hosts.

The space
From our off street parking, follow the lighted path and stairs up to the second story entrance of our detached garage. A rare find in Asheville city limits, it is one of the few permitted units in a structure completely detached from our house. There are no shared walls or floors with our living spaces so you will enjoy private entry and added privacy, peace and quiet.
Enjoy your private lattice screened deck where you can relax in the shade of the surrounding maple
neighborhood_overview:
Come masquerade as a local and enjoy the short walk to the dozens of popular dining, music, shopping and people watching activities Haywood Rd. has to offer. Though quite close to downtown, 100 years ago West Asheville was its own town independent of Asheville. As a result, this unique area of town has its own “Mini-Downtown” that is centered around Haywood Rd. For the last few decades this commercial corridor has enjoyed a period of reinvestment by the community and area businesses. Several cool and unique restaurants, coffee shops, bars, bakeries, breweries and shops have chosen West Asheville as their home. Century old houses are being renovated back to life and new homes are being built on every available lot. As the historic town of “West Asheville” was never very big, the entire area is very walkable and there are lots of cool old buildings, churches, trees and houses.
The River Arts District and New Belgium Brewing are a 5 minute drive, Biltmore Estate is a 15 minute drive
host_about: I'm a dad, a woodworker, and a house renovator.

name: Downtown Asheville with Great Views & Sunsets
description:
This quaint bungalow was recently remodeled & is in a prime walk able downtown Asheville location. It has a large front porch, where you can relax on a glider couch or two rocking chairs while looking at downtown Asheville & amazing sunsets. Both bedrooms have brand new mattresses & each have two windows with black out blinds. The front living area has a mini fridge, couch, TV & two more windows. The bathroom has a full tub/shower & also has a window. Super Clean and convenient location.

The space
The Hazzard Street Hacienda is a quaint 1928 remodeled bungalow with approximately 1000 sq ft with great views of downtown Asheville and killer sunsets from the front porch. The rental includes 2 bedrooms, 1 full bathroom, a Den/living room that also serves as a kitchenette. Extra effort has been put into the remodel and furnishing process to help ensure your stay is comfortable.

There is designated parking in a upper gravel drive that will easily acco
neighborhood_overview:
This rental is directly adjacent to downtown Asheville and is conveniently located. It is less than a third of a mile walk to the 24 million dollar park in front of the City/County buildings and close to all other downtown attractions. The walk to downtown is predominantly downhill and you never have to leave cement footing from the house. There is even a walking bridge that crosses above South Charlotte so that you do not have to cross a busy road.

The Orange Peel and South slope of downtown are a slightly further walk, approximately .75 of a mile, and it is wise to take a different route to shorten the walk.

Please note that coming home is predominantly uphill and this rental is on the lower section of Beaucatcher Mountain. So you might be best walking down and catching a Lyft or Uber back.

The house is also extremely close to the historic Helen's Bridge which is on the same road further up Beaucatcher Mountain.

To sum it up I lov
host_about: My name is Kelly and I appreciate your interest in my house.  I am self employed and oversee an independent living program for young adults with autism in Hendersonville NC.  When not working, I love hanging out with my two children, reading books, traveling, and cooking yummy food.  At this point I have been awarded the super host designation and I want to keep it that way.  Please text or call me if there is anything I can do to help your stay be more comfortable while you are in Asheville.

name: Earthy & Spacious Private Bungalow
description:
One bedroom, one bath apartment located in the front of my beautifully restored 1920s bungalow in downtown Asheville

The space
My home is decorated with a mix of modern and vintage furniture, with art I've collected from friends and some I've done myself. The main rooms have vaulted ceilings, and are bright and spacious. The front porch is the perfect spot to enjoy your mornings overlooking the neighborhood street. All in all, the perfect retreat for two people.
neighborhood_overview: The beauty of the house not only lies in all of its charm, but also in it's location! There's a unique neighborhood Whole Foods right across the street and Trader Joes is a couple blocks up from that. If you fancy yoga, Asheville Yoga Center is about three blocks away on Liberty Street. In the other direction, a lovely greenway runs along Reeds Creek, or you can simply stroll around the eclectic neighborhood. My favorite coffee shop sits at the bottom of the street, called High Five Cafe. Don't let the hip tattooed baristas intimidate you- the coffee is delicious! Most importantly, all of downtown is just a 5-10 minutes walk, complete with shopping, museums, restaurants, breweries, bars and music venues.
host_about: I grew up on the southern outer banks of North Carolina, and I've lived in Asheville for over seven years now. I've fallen deeply in love with this eccentric vibrant city and have slowly begun to spread my roots here over the years. Like most Ashevillians, I love the crisp mountain air, the enchanting scenery, the music, the people, and the art. Home is very important to me, as it's my sanctuary where I can retreat to refuel and ground myself. I take very good care of my space and with that have a great respect for other people's space as well.

description:
Absolutely adorable and totally remodeled apartment overlooking the pool area of the Bear Creek RV park & Campground. This place is fairly private and perfect for two people or a family with children. You can even bring your fur baby for an additional charge. Swimming pool, playground, dog walk, and more located on the property.

The space
We have a queen bed in the bedroom and two futons to sleep 2 more people comfortably in the living room.
neighborhood_overview: We are located just miles from the Biltmore Estate, breweries, local restaurants, Blue Ridge Parkway, Farmers Market and the Outlet Mall. Easy 7-10 minute drive to Downtown Asheville.
host_about: Hello!  I am a Cross fit Chick, I Love to travel to Key West ( and many other places), I have 2 AWESOME teenage daughters, and I  work with my handsome hubby of nearly 21 years. I am not originally from Asheville, (Ricky is), but we both love the Western NC Mountains.   I am a local Realtor in the Asheville area and have been here since 1991. He owns a local turn key construction business and has since 1993. We decided to take a chance and remodel our very first vacation rental since we had the best spot in Asheville! Making people happy is one of our main goals. We love meeting new people and would LOVE to meet YOU!

name: The Cozy Cottage Idyllic for Social Distancing
description:
The Cozy Cottage has gorgeous long range views of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Our guests love having the illusion of seclusion just minutes away from all modern conveniences. A quiet refuge that sits on about an acre of wooded property where you can relax, regroup and plan the adventures awaiting you just minutes from the front door. The cottage has been completely updated, furnished and stocked with everything you may need for your total comfort and enjoyment. Your next retreat awaits...

The space
20 minutes to downtown Asheville. 15 minutes to Asheville Regional Airport. 10 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway. 10 minutes to grocery, gas and food.

Guest access
The entire top floor of the Cozy Cottage is yours to enjoy. (The downstairs is an unoccupied, unfinished basement that we hope to remodel next year.) Upstairs functions well as a spacious, one bedroom unit with a massive deck overlooking stunning mountain views. It is a perfect place
neighborhood_overview: The cottage sits on about an acre of wooded property truly giving you the experience of solace.  The neighborhood is quiet.  If you are up for the challenge, the Collier Cove Nature Preserve hiking trail is just a 2 minute walk from the front door.  The park consists of over 29 acres of hillside woodland with nearly 2 miles of well defined, steep and strenuous hiking trails.
host_about:
Hi! I’m Shannon! I am a very active mama of a busy toddler, a newborn and the wife of a commercial airline pilot. We currently live in Orlando, FL and enjoy spending our time off in the Asheville, NC area. We enjoy being outside, eating good food and sipping crafty drinks. We also love to travel and see new places! We are early to bed and early to rise and very organized.

We are thankful for the opportunity to host these two beautiful homes in our favorite city with our Airbnb family. We strive to provide our guests with an idyllic, unforgettable mountain home experience that they treasure for years to come.

Thank you for choosing to stay with us (or host us)! :)

name: East Asheville Abode near Historic Downtown
description:
Entire, private apartment in quiet residential neighborhood with private entrance. Space includes private bathroom, bedroom, and living room with TV, Keurig coffeemaker, microwave, and mini-refrigerator. Street parking is free. This apartment is cleaned and sanitized according to CDC guidelines.

7 minute drive from both Downtown Asheville and the Blue Ridge Parkway!

The space
Guests have a private entrance with keypad entry. This apartment is located in a quiet, residential neighborhood that borders the Blue Ridge Parkway/Mountain To Sea Trail. There is access to the parkway, by foot, from the neighborhood (about a 15 minute hike from the apartment). It's a 30 minute hike to the Folk Art Center or to the Haw Creek Overlook.
Other destinations nearby include the Biltmore House (5 miles), downtown Asheville (4.5 miles), the Asheville Mall (2.5 miles), WNC Nature Center (2 miles), Highland Brewing Co. (3.6 miles), and New Belgium Brewery (4 .7 mile
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in a quiet residential neighborhood that is adjacent to the Blue Ridge Parkway(BRP)/Mountains-to-Sea Trail(MST). Just a 15 minute hike to the BRP&MST and 30 minute hike to the Folk Art Center from our home. There are plenty of hiking trails to explore and very easy access to I-240, US70, I-40, and I-26.
host_about: Hi, We're Scott and Sandy and we strive to maintain 5 star reviews and Superhost status by providing a clean private apartment on the ground level of our home.   There is a private access to the apartment.  We are glad to host you and we will check with you to make sure you have what you need but we will not harass you or take up your time while you are working or vacationing here.  We hope you enjoy your time in Asheville.  Please consider staying with us.

name: PEACEFUL ROOM | Walk Downtown | Eco Homestay
description:
WELCOME! Location is everything! Walk 3 blocks to the popular South Slope + a few more to our bustling downtown. Enjoy delicious local restaurants, breweries & more. Stay at our perfectly located natural homestay. This room is spacious with double bed, clay painted walls, closet, chair, lamp. All commons are shared: bathrooms, kitchen, dining & living room. Enjoy our front porch rocking chairs, green space across the street + around the corner. Be Covid smart. Wear a mask. Sanitize.

The space
My home has 100-year old charm, along with the natural touch of custom-made clay paint throughout. House furnishings are simple minimal. We are in a great location and yet secluded behind a large Japanese Maple tree. The house has central heating. Please do let me know if you need anything. I want my guests to feel very comfortable and at home. Thank you for choosing to stay with us. We hope you have a wonderful visit to Asheville : )

Guest access
Plea
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION IS EVERYTHING! // 2.5 blocks to South Slope // 5 blocks into downtown // 5 minute drive to Biltmore Estate // 8 minute drive to mountains // 2 minute walk to a track field + awesome view on top of bleachers // Walk to (most of) my faves below! Double check hours. Expect lines

o---------------o-----------------o

• French Broad Food Coop: Everything! Snacks, toiletries, lunch to-go, beer, etc
• High Climate Tea: Gorgeous planty enviro. Tea galore. Mochi treats. Good ppl!
• Sovereign Remedies: Brunch + late dinner. Excellent organic food + cocktails
• Dobra Tea House: Over 100 tea options. Comfy seating. West side is cuter
• Storm Rhum Bar: Pretty outdoor dining. Delicious local cuisine. 5 blocks
• Gan Shan West: Favorite Asian Fusion in town, bonus outdoor seating
• Kathmandu Café: Love this organic Nepali gem run by a sweet family
• Farewell Café: Yummy treats, coffee + ambiance. 2.5 blocks away :)
• Curate & Zambra
host_about: I am mother, gardener, and proud part of a team of women who live in & manage several homes in Asheville, North Carolina. We enjoy hosting & look forward to having you at our homestay : )

name: Master Room: Mountainside Private Room & Pvt. Bath
description:
Comfortable master bedroom in our mountain home sleeps two in a queen bed. We have lowest cleaning fee in town, no security deposit, and private, not shared bathroom. This room in our house is the Pisgah Room. Private bathroom not shared with anyone, porch view, and only minutes from Biltmore Estate & downtown Asheville. Only 3 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway, 2 miles off of I-26. Room also has mini-fridge, TV with Roku, & electric kettle! Great deal, don’t get stuck paying more elsewhere!

The space
This Master bedroom offers plenty of space for two people, with a queen size bed and in oversize chair for relaxing. You will have your own private bathroom with a sink, toilet, and bathtub shower. This room looks out front of our house into the surrounding forest with green views of trees and birds.

There is a microwave, a mini fridge, and an electric kettle for making instant coffee or tea. We do not provide coffee supplies or bottled water. So be sur
neighborhood_overview: South slope of Brown Mountain overlooking south Asheville toward Mt. Pisgah, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and the Pisgah National Forest. Less than five minutes to local restaurants, bars, and shopping. Quiet neighborhood, secluded in forest, tucked away up on the mountain.
host_about:
Hello! My husband and I are looking forward to hosting guests in our home as well as being a guest of others during our travels. We became AirBnB hosts in 2014 and have since hosted more than 2,000 bookings. In 2018, we became AirBnB superhosts!

We live in Asheville in the beautiful mountains of western North Carolina.

Allison works as a fourth grade teacher at Mills River Elementary School. Peter works as the Trails Coordinator at a regional land trust, Conserving Carolina. Both of us work to keep this region we love as wonderful as it is today, and make it even better for future generations.

We love to take road trips throughout the year. We have appreciated the kindness of many over the years who have let us stay in their home or camp in their yard, or have rented a room to us for a reasonable rate. We are guests who are focused on our travels and we most often are seeking simply a room to hang our hat for the night before our travels resume the following morning. For that reason, most hosts barely know that we are there. In appreciation for the kindness shown to us over the years, we pay it forward by being clean and courteous when we are guests in the homes of others, and we are seeking to host guests who are similarly self-sufficient and simply seeking a basic place for the night.

We look forward to you staying in our home!

name: Woodfin Retreat By Riverside Park - Entire House
description:
Enjoy a private stay near the river at this gorgeous 2 bedroom house. Take the opportunity to go tubing down the French Broad River and be close to everything Asheville has to offer! Located conveniently about 10 minutes away from Downtown, River Arts District, and West Asheville all of the while maintaining the privacy of a suburban house.

This house is less than a 10 minute walk away from the upcoming Silverline Park opening this year in 2020 that runs along the French Broad River

The space
This vacation house has 2 bedrooms. All beds are equipped with queen-sized mattresses. There are two separate bathrooms with one being privately attached to the master bedroom. The house includes a very spacious kitchen complete with granite counters. Dining tables and cookware and utensils are also provided.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire house.
neighborhood_overview:
This house is at the edge of the very popular River Arts District. The River Arts District (RAD) is Asheville's latest and largest project to expand and promote tourism. This is a very old historic and industrial area that is being gentrified where old industrial buildings are being repurposed into chic-industrial themed upscale restaurants, art galleries, breweries, and other small local businesses.

While many different patches scattered around this area have been renovated there are many places that haven't yet or are still going through the process. This River Arts District still looks very old, and industrial. Some guests have been put off by the area and have expressed concerns that it may seem or feel unsafe due to it being an old historic area with industrial buildings. However, that can't be further from the truth. This is a very safe area and is quickly becoming another one of Asheville's most popular destinations for upscale foods, drinks, salons, and other local
host_about: I have been staying in Asheville since 1997 when I moved here during my primary school years. The food and the craft beer here are among the best and it's the perfect size without being too packed with heavy traffic.  I also love to travel, especially overseas. I mainly travel for food, with sightseeing and other events being secondary. I've been to Canada, Mexico, England, Italy, France, Netherlands, Japan, Hong Kong, and China. I am also fluent in English, Mandarin, and Cantonese.

name: Asheville Fresh Mountain Air
description:
Quaint stone & rock cottage (1400 sq. ft. space) conveniently located 3 miles from downtown Avl and Weaverville; close to I-26 and I-240; separate entrance to newly redecorated 2-bedroom apartment; owners live above the ground-level apartment; plenty of parking. Close to the blue ridge parkway. 30 minutes to Wolf Laurel ski resort.

The space
There is another apartment above your space; quiet hours observed after 11 pm. Guest apartment is totally refurnished full kitchen. If you want to change the temperature let us know we be glad to. The thermostat is up stair in our private space. From time to time we use the upstairs back door open and closes to outside. Don’t be alarmed you won’t see us just hear us closing and opening the door. We will never intrude on your privacy. P.S. there is a step down entering the door please be careful. Because this is a basement apartment, please expect to hear the pitter-patter of our feet and definitely hear voices and movement
neighborhood_overview: So close to downtown, good restaurants, shopping and major attractions yet in a quiet residential area. Uber is available.
host_about: My wife and I love to travel the world and we love the outdoors. We have a nails salon business in Asheville . We love living here in the mountains it so beautiful and peaceful. We are bilingual speak Vietnamese and English.Everyone is welcome to our place.Our home is your home.

name: Asheville Urban Oasis at Emma
description:
Built brand new for you! We asked ourselves and our guests exactly what we would want in a vacation rental built from scratch, then we customized the Urban Oasis to make your Asheville experience as fun and memorable as possible. Amazing open floor plan, full kitchen, soundproofed rooms, large deck, private fenced yard, hot tub, fire ring and picnic area make this the perfect vacation destination only 8 minutes from downtown Asheville, 6 from the River Arts District and West Asheville.

The space
This house has a master suite with its own bath, and a second bathroom that can be accessed from the 2nd bedroom or the main room. Each room has its own heating and air unit for your comfort, and the bathrooms feature radiant heat floors that automatically turn on when the weather gets chilly. The large deck and yard with hot tub, fire ring, and picnic table are secluded by a privacy fence. Pets, kids, friends and good times are all welcome. Come enjoy our gorgeous town n
neighborhood_overview: This house is located on the same road as New Belgium Brewing, which is found just after Emma Road turns to Craven Street in the River Arts District, a straight shot drive from the house. The location is 6 minutes from the heart of the trendy West Asheville neighborhood with numerous restaurants, bars, and shops, and only 8 minutes away from all of the action in downtown Asheville.
host_about: I'm a full time Airbnb host and general contractor who has lived in the Asheville area for almost 30 years. When I'm not answering messages on Airbnb or pounding on things with a hammer, I'm out enjoying the local whitewater rivers and hiking trails.

name: Downtown Asheville Condo w/ Patio + Amenities
description:
Whether you’re a beer drinker, a mountain hiker, or a canopy cruiser, this 1-bedroom, 1-bath condo is the perfect resting place after an adventurous day in Asheville! Located in the heart of downtown, the updated vacation rental offers a fully equipped kitchen, a community terrace with views of the hills, and a modern living space to call home during your visit. Walk to nearby restaurants and breweries, take a stroll through the North Carolina Arboretum, and snap a photo at the Biltmore Estate!

The space
Central A/C | Free Off-Street Parking | Free WiFi | 860 Sq Ft

This updated condo is a great choice for a group of friends, a couple, or a business traveler looking to be within walking distance to all the action in Asheville!

Master Bedroom: King Bed | Living Room: Queen Sleeper Sofa

OUTDOOR LIVING: Shared terrace w/ seating & views, private patio w/ seating (backs up to parking lot), shared grills, shared common area w/ kitchen

name: Stylish and Comfy Home Minutes to Downtown
description:
Tucked away on a hill in a quiet residential area is our peaceful 4 bedroom, 3 bathroom home away from home. Here you’ll find room to breathe, plenty of natural light, and just a touch of what’s familiar. We’ve made a peaceful place for you to relax, so you can focus on the next adventure. Why pile everyone into a hotel room (or two) when you can breathe the mountain air without stepping on any toes?

The space
Asheville promises stunning natural beauty, delicious local food and beverages, and a thriving arts culture. You’re going to want to take it all in, kick back, and stay awhile. Our 4 bedroom home is perfect for large groups or families who want to be close to everything, but with plenty of room for everyone.

Stay with us, and you will be just 10 mins from Asheville’s lively downtown with easy access to the Biltmore and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Our quiet retreat is ideal for shorter trips looking to add a lot of value, or long getaways with worry-f
neighborhood_overview: The home is located in a residential neighborhood within a few minutes of downtown Asheville. There is easy access to Interstate 40 or 240 as well as the Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about:
My team and I have been managing Airbnb’s and short term rentals personally since 2016 and professionally since 2018. We love helping people unwind and have a fantastic time here in Asheville! We have properties that fit every size need and budget!

Let me know if you have any questions or if there is anything we can be of assistance with and we look forward to hosting you in the beautiful western North Carolina mountains!

name: Walk to downtown in Artist Home, newly remodeled!
description:
Large private newly remodeled bedroom and bath with private entry in partially finished basement. Sitting area with coffee available. Microwave and fridge. Walkable to downtown, south slope and river arts district. Dedicated off-street parking for one car. Quiet old neighborhood. I'm usually hands off but available to you if need me.

All artwork, clothing and jewelry are for sale. I go by the honor system, you can leave a check or cash when you leave or just get in touch!

The space
There are some wide but steep steps outside leading to your apartment, It is well lit.

Guest access
The down stairs has a private entry with key code, small sitting area with a coffee cart and very large bedroom. Enter through the pink door!

Other things to note
You are welcome to walk on the grass outside the fence, but it can be slippery and I recommend that you come through the gates and walk down the steps to be safe.
neighborhood_overview: Very close to the happening south slope area with fantastic restaurants, distilleries, breweries. Walkable to river arts district with fabulous galleries.
host_about:
Hi Ya'll,

I'm a local artist and I work as a hospice nurse. I love to travel, I recently visited Sri Lanka which was a fantastic trip.  I play a little bit of Old Time Music which is the traditional music of Appalachia. I've lived in Asheville for 20 years so know a bit about the area, although it changes rapidly. Let me know how I can be a great host to you personally! All are welcome in my home, I do not discriminate based on anything except meanness.

I have a parking space just for you with a river stone walkway to the entrance at the back of the house. This is a studio space with mini fridge, microwave, bar with stools and coffee station. Memory foam mattress and private bath. No common or shared areas and a private entrance.

name: Mountain Air - Peace, Comfort, and Convenience!
description:
Quiet, comfortable, fully-equipped private apartment. Five minutes to Blue Ridge Parkway, 15 mins to downtown Asheville. Perfect home base for a vacation to our beautiful, fun, relaxing mountain town. Come visit and enjoy the mountain air. We are fully inclusive, pay living wages, and celebrate diversity. Se habla español.

The space
You will have a private entrance, two bedrooms - one with a Queen bed and one with two Twin XL beds that can be slid together, fully equipped kitchen, full bathroom with linens and a bidet, large TV with Roku, two recliners, couch and loveseat, rolling coffee table, picnic table and rocking chairs on the covered front porch facing the mountains, and a custom-made dining table with four swivel chairs. Enjoy the peace and quiet on your porch or sit outside and stay dry during a thunderstorm, take in a movie on the Blu-Ray player, sip coffee or cook a full dinner in the full kitchen or on the gas grill - pretty much all the comforts of h
neighborhood_overview: The property is on a dead-end street, so there is very little traffic.  We are part way up a hill and surrounded by very few houses and a lot of trees, so it feels very secluded and private, and the area is very quiet and peaceful.  You may see wild turkeys, deer, or black bears in the area.  Groceries, restaurants, and other conveniences are only about 5 minutes away.  The location is fantastic as a launch pad for all sorts of Asheville vacations and a comfortable place to rest your head and relax.
host_about: I moved from Chicago suburbs to Asheville in 2017 and love it here.  Sorry I didn't move sooner. Before I moved here, I considered moving to Portland, Oregon, because it is amazing, but ultimately decided the lack of sun was a deal breaker.  It should be no surprise that hiking, camping, dogs, and beer are high on my favorites list.  I also enjoy fixing antique electronics, ham radio, technology, acoustic music, the Grateful Dead, bowling, tinkering with cars, road trips, being kind to strangers, science, and making people laugh.  Fred Rogers is the person I look up to the most.  I strongly dislike air travel.  It's important to me to convince people to register and vote.  As an Airbnb host, I want people to feel comfortable, relaxed, and have everything they need without having to ask - as if somebody anticipated what they might want.

name: Beautiful Tiny Home in our Flower Garden
description:
An elegant and well appointed tiny home with stainless steel appliances and a tiled shower, blue velvet couch and a comfy memory foam mattress up in the loft. Spacious and open with hardwood floors, this is a beautiful place for your retreat, business vacation, or sightseeing adventure.

The space
I purchased a 20” steel trailer bed and built a tiny home on top of it! Big windows and an open floor plan make this space seem bigger than it really is. The porch is a wonderful place to sit and have some morning tea as well. The tiny home is nestled in our flower garden and about 30 feet from our house. We are just outside of the city limits, about 15 minutes to downtown.

Guest access
The tiny home is all yours! You will pass through our garden to get to the tiny home, and you are welcome to explore the property, see the ducks if they are around and say hello to our dog Juniper.

Other things to note
UPDATE: we have insta
neighborhood_overview: A great place to retreat from the hubbub of the city, this is a quiet neighborhood just outside the city limits. We have an acre of land, ducks and a friendly dog Juniper, a bakery where Nathan bakes bread for the farmer's markets, and a flower garden in the works!
host_about:
Nathan and Michele are excited to host you!
We have been stewards of this property for 4 years now; putting in a duck pond, a flower garden and a bakery, introducing goats and animals to our sweet little spot here in Asheville. We delight in being here on the land and it shows. Our next project is fixing up the upper garage to be a flower studio where Michele will be making her arrangements to bring to the farmer's markets here in town. Nathan sells his bread at these markets too, and if there is some available when you are here be sure to ask for a loaf, it's delicious!
We are so happy to share our land with others, and this really is a place to come relax, be around some sweet pets and barnyard animals, and enjoy asheville while you're at it!
 We look forward to meeting you, 
Nathan & Michele.

Private suite with separate heat/air filtration system. Keyless, contactless entry.
Great location. About 1 mile to Biltmore Village and entrance to Biltmore Estate. Four miles to downtown Asheville.

Large suite that has a private bedroom with king bed and 55 in. smart tv. Spacious living room with 65" smart tv along with a DVD player and some movies to choose from to watch. We've just bought this house in Asheville 2 years ago and decided to open up the daylight basement to guests.  We finished the basement  last year (2019) and we are looking forward to hosting guests.
I ran a motel for 24 years and enjoy meeting people from all over.   Cleanliness is very important to  me so I will do my best to make sure the guest area is sparkling clean and comfortable.

name: The Gnome Home- a little more west, Asheville
description:
A five minute drive to fun and funky west Asheville's hip Haywood road full of restaurants, bars and local craft breweries and music venues. A 15 minute drive to downtown. This house however is slightly more in the country so more room to breathe. I have local and international art on the walls including many of my own pieces. I love the local art and music scene and would be happy to give you insider tips on where to go. You can have complete privacy or I am willing to interact/chat.

The space
You will be staying in the converted basement of my house which is ground level with windows on one side of the guest suite/apartment. I live upstairs with no children or pets and I am pretty quiet. You'll have lots of room all to yourself. You will have your own parking with 2 spaces. NO smoking or vaping of any substances inside or on the outside patio allowed. No outside guests allowed or parties. The ceilings are a little lower so if you are over six feet tall this p
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is my favorite part of town. There are great coffee shops and Dobra tea house is lovely. Lots of great food options on nearby Haywood road. I love Zia Taqueria for casual dining and BimBeriBon is completely gluten free and delicious. Popular with tourists is Biscuit Head, Sunny Point Cafe and Early Girl Eatery. The Mothlight has great local bands as does One World West Brewing. New Belgium Brewery is not far. The Hop ice cream parlor is great. There are fun vintage /thrift shops too. You can hop onto highway 26 within 10 minutes and get to the Blue ridge parkway we are surrounded by breathtaking mountains with lots of hiking and exploring options for outdoor enthusiasts. Shhh, if you keep it a secret I can tell you some of my favorite spots.
host_about: I am an artist and acupuncturist specializing in digestive health. I am traveling for inspiration, fun and adventure.  Looking to meet friendly helpful people along the way to make friends with. I love connecting with people from around the world and learning about different cultures.

name: Historic Farmstead 5 min from Downtown Asheville
description:
Vacation in a 1920's farmhouse built by famed Asheville architect, Richard Sharp Smith's, daughter. Enjoy all the benefits of country living while being conveniently located within a 5 minute drive to downtown and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Decorated with antiquities to honor its' past, but recently updated with all new modern amenities. The White Smith House is a designer rental unlike any other! Enjoy modern Appalachia at its finest!!!

The space
The White Smith House is located in the original 1920's workshop of owner, Odd S. White, who was a prominent craft revival violin maker. Recently renovated, guests can enjoy their own separate entrance and isolated apartment from the rest of the property. Please note, I live in the main house above. The property is meant to be shared with guests. There is a designated patio for guests in the front entrance, and you're also welcome to use our back patio with a pond and grill.

Guest access
We let gue
neighborhood_overview: Haw Creek is a beautiful pastoral, quiet neighborhood conveniently located 5 minutes to downtown and the blue ridge parkway. We are within walking distance to Pennycup Coffee for breakfast bagels and coffee as well as Creekside Taphouse for lunch, dinner and drinks. Two other excellent restaurants, Copper Crown and Rendezvous, are also a two minute drive from our property. If you'd like to spend the night in, we are a quick drive to Whole Foods, Panera Bread and Blaze Pizza as well as several other good spots near the Asheville Mall. We are also 1.5 miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway and 4 miles to The Biltmore Estate.
host_about: I'm new to the Asheville area coming from California. I work in the home build Industry and am also a musician. I enjoy traveling and making connections with new people!

name: In the country...but near Asheville!
description:
Within 7 miles of restaurants, craft breweries and shopping in downtown Asheville. Convenient to the Biltmore House, waterfalls, hiking trails & the Blue Ridge Parkway. Large comfortable home with 3 bedrooms/2 baths and space to host your family or another couple. Sit in rocking chairs on the front porch while enjoying a glass of wine and watching the evening sunset. Large kitchen and dining area are also joined by a screened in back porch-- perfect for a morning cup of coffee or breakfast.

The space
Comfortable and close to downtown Asheville...
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful country roads spread out in all directions just north and west of Asheville.
host_about:
I have two teenage sons--a baseball player and a character actor--who I share the fun with their Mom and their dog Domino.

We love to travel and I take my camera everywhere. My sons grew up in Spanish Immersion classes and some of it has metido en mí. 

Italy and Greece left wonderful memories for us and we are excited about traveling and getting closer to locals through services like Airbnb.

We love good food, local wines and beer, reading and most of Quentin Taratino's movies...and the Seahawks and Mariners!

description:
Welcome to the top of Town Mountain!
Mountain splendor, close to downtown Asheville, and luxurious surroundings.....this is the place to create memories for a lifetime.
Town Mountain Breeze will deliver just that, and is a true breath of fresh air/
This destination has your vacation memories written all over it!

name: Relaxing Spacious Home - deck, land, games!
description:
Our beautiful home sits on 3 acres of terraced backyard, a creek, and a small pond - and it's in Asheville city limits. Perfect for families, a group of friends, or a romantic getaway. 5 mins to the Blue Ridge Parkway, Arboretum, and Asheville Outlets. 10 mins to Bent Creek hikes. 15 mins to the center of downtown. We live here during the week, and Airbnb mostly on the weekends to support our non-profit work with kids. Thanks for considering our place .. you'll love it here!

The space
We have a large wrap-around deck to enjoy the views. We offer a full kitchen, off street parking lot suitable for large vehicles/trailers, a luxurious bathroom with a jacuzzi bathtub, 4 hammocks, a big screen with Netflix and Amazon Prime, and Googl℮ Home with all the music you'd like.

Guest access
We like to play, so you will also have access to our large collection of board games, badminton, trampoline, slack line, climbing dome, and soccer.
neighborhood_overview:
There's a mix of both beautiful nature and restaurants/shopping all around. Lots of hiking trails in Bent creek, as well as a river park right on the French Broad river, and a community park for kids. The Arboretum has lots to offer, and a drive through the Blue Ridge Parkway with its many lookout stops is always breathtaking.

For restaurants/shopping, Padthai Asheville is excellent, and so are Papa's and Beers (Mexican), Apollo Flame Bistro, and Galactic Pizza. The Asheville Outlets mall with lots of stores is only a couple of minutes away.
host_about: We're open hearted and open minded, creative, love to travel, and enjoy the beauty of everyday life with our adorable kids.

name: Spacious West Asheville suite near Haywood Ave
description:
Spacious finished basement with private entrance in West Asheville home. Enjoy a bedroom, bathroom, and living/dining room area complete with TV. There is no kitchen, but small appliances and essentials are included.

Great location! The house is in walking distance or a short drive to Haywood Avenue and all of West Asheville's offerings -- dining, shopping, cafes and bars. By car, you can get downtown or to the Biltmore estate in 10-15 minutes, to the Blue Ridge Parkway in 20 minutes.

The space
The bedroom is semi-subterranean but receives good natural light from a large bedroom window. A futon in the living room converts to a bed that could easily sleep 1 person; would be a bit cozy for 2 but it is an option.

Guest access
The entire downstairs is yours, with a bedroom, bathroom (entered from the bedroom), and living room.

Other things to note
Coffee, tea, sugar and honey are provided for guests in the suit
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville has many great cafes, bars, restaurants, boutiques, and other great spots all within a short walk from the house.
host_about: I am a scientist, cyclist, and lover of travel and baked goods living in West Asheville, NC.

name: The Loft at Deer Crossing
description:
Our new home is nestled in a beautiful area just 2 miles off of interstate 26. My husband built our barn style home to fit our piece of land. He took the wood from the property and used it to build this one-of-a-kind home. We are close to airport, Sierra Nevada Brewery, Blue Ridge Parkway, and many restaurants.
There are eight homes off of our road and the neighborhood is surrounded by a gorgeous horse farm. It is peaceful and scenic to sit on our porches after a day of hiking or sightseeing.

The space
The Loft at Deer Crossing is one of two Airbnb’s on our property. Your space is through your private front door, up the stairs to a private suite with a bathroom and morning kitchen. It is a part of our main house, but it is separated by a door that locks.

Guest access
Besides your suite, you will have access to our laundry room, a half bath, a front porch, and a fire pit. If you need to use the kitchen, it can be made available to you.
neighborhood_overview: We are 8 minutes from the airport, 15-20 minutes from the Biltmore Estate,   5 miles from hiking trails, 30 minutes from the DuPont Forest and Pisgah Forest. We are also near the highway, so we have great restaurants near by.
host_about:
Tim and I are active empty nesters! We relocated to Asheville from Atlanta once our children grew up.  Tim and I are heading into our retirment years. He is a general contractor and I just retired from teaching  middle school math. Tim creates beautiful homes and spaces. He built our new “ barn” home just last year. We moved into this beautiful home in October 2019. We designed a one-bedroom guesthouse above our garage and another suite as the loft above our main home. Tim and I respect different styles of travelers. While some of you may want to rest and stay more isolated, others of you may want to visit with us over dessert on one of the porches! We are just happy to provide you a place to relax. 
P.S. I love dogs, so we allow well-behaved dogs in the guesthouse, but we have decided to keep the loft dog-free. No cats, since I am allergic to them.

name: The River Nook✨A Tiny Refuge
description:
A bright, new, custom tiny home welcomes you for your visit to Asheville!
The River Nook is a magical refuge and starting point for all your Asheville area adventures! The careful thought and attention to detail that has been put into every aspect of this space, paired with the prime North Asheville location (within walking distance to a French Broad river park and lovely coffee shop) is sure to make this your future go-to vacation spot in the mountains.
All are welcome here:)

The space
The River Nook is a custom tiny house, built from the ground up with the needs of of guests always in mind! Wake up in the cozy sleeping loft on the cloud of a bed to the view of the surrounding forest. Make breakfast in the full kitchen stocked with local coffee, local tea, creamer, sugar, honey, and organic oatmeal for your use. Soak in the view at the bar seating and set out on your daily adventures!
The River Nook is a completely self sufficient tiny house with
neighborhood_overview:
This home is located in North Asheville, a calm and cozy area that feels tucked away but is incredibly close to anything you need. In fact, the vast majority of our favorite places in Asheville are within a ten minute drive!
The French Broad River is directly across the street. Guests can follow a very short river trail to the nearby river park with a walking trail and perfect spots for a picnic or to relax and enjoy the view. If you are bringing a canoe or kayaks, there is a put in here as well. A favorite coffee shop in Asheville is also located within walking distance, so come grab a drink and enjoy the river!
host_about:
Hi! I'm Michelle. I moved to Asheville seven years ago and immediately fell in love with these mountains. There are an endless amount of new things to explore here! I love to grab a cup of tea at the local tea house and go to dance classes downtown!
We hope to host you at one of our cozy Airbnbs soon!

name: Eco-Friendly Clean Spacious Suite near Town/Trails
description:
Private, modern green built suite in North Asheville near Beaver Lake, bird watching, UNCA, Grove Park Inn, Blue Ridge Parkway and 2 miles from downtown. Queen bed, queen sofa bed, private bathroom, kitchen, yoga space, and outdoor patio. High ceilings and tons of windows let in the natural light that give a sense of calm and serenity. Peaceful property and walkable neighborhood. Driveway parking. We look forward to welcoming you to our home!

The space
This Green Craftsman was built in 2019 and is just a short drive from all that Asheville has to offer. Within 10 minutes driving distance from some of the most visited places in the city, this home will plant you in the middle of an outdoor adventure paradise. We are a very close drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway, Beaver Lake, Arboretum, and the Biltmore.

Our home has the character of a Modern Retreat in a quiet neighborhood, but with zen, relaxing comfort. There is a lovely outdoor space to hang out in
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is 1/4 mile from Beaver Lake walking trails and 15 min. from the Mountain to Sea Trail on the Blue Ridge Parkway. We are also within walking distance of many delicious restaurants like Avenue M, Rye Knot,
Cecilia's, Fresh Market grocery store, Penny Cup Coffee Co., Geraldine's Bakery and Asheville Pizza and Brewing Company.
host_about:
I am a Naturopathic Physician and my husband Dave is an ESL teacher. 
We have lived in Asheville for the past 4 years. 
We moved here for the mountains and hiking, biking, good food, great beer, family and friends. 
We have 2 adorable kittens - Fredy & Luna -  meow! 
Our passion is traveling around the world, adventuring, tasting unique cuisine and experiencing culture through the eyes of a local.

name: Matt's Place, quiet street charming West Asheville
description:
This is a comfy and clean space with a private entrance on a quiet street with off street parking for one car. Room for 4, one queen bed and one queen sleeper sofa in separate rooms, has a full bathroom and linens provided. There is covered private back porch looking out over the rustic field behind while only 7 - 12 minutes to downtown Asheville depending on traffic. Lyft/Uber to downtown for ~$11, or head to unique West Asheville Haywood Rd for bars and restaurants off the beaten path!

The space
separate entrance, two rooms plus private bathroom, outside seating, fenced yard, off street parking, mini fridge, hot and cold filtered water dispenser, coffee provided, towels provided, bright and comfortable and safe with tasteful furnishings in a two level house. Airbnb rooms are downstairs with their own entrance has a separate apartment feel, coded doors lock automatically.
neighborhood_overview: This street is quiet and neighborhood oriented with a sidewalk and lots of daytime walkers and kids around.  there is little traffic or noise but the street is narrow and care should be taken to drive slow when entering and exiting.
host_about: Artist and traveler from Asheville NC
