name: Modern Mountain Bungalow - 10 minutes to downtown
description:
In this colorful bungalow you’ll find new and vintage furniture and decor collected over the years, and local hand-blown glass. The open concept floor plan, screened-in front porch, and large fenced-in backyard make it easy to gather with friends and family.

The space
It was built in 1903 and was the neighborhood dance hall. My husband and I love the history and when we renovated in 2017 to open up the space and vault the ceilings, we had to showcase the original wood beam we found. You'll also notice the extra-large door frames which cover the log frame construction.

The three bedrooms are cozy but well appointed, each unique and full of color, with thoughtful touches and 60s vibes.

The galley style kitchen is stocked with everything you need for cooking and baking. It boasts a gas range, deep stainless steel sink, dishwasher, full size fridge with an ice maker and filtered water. You’ll also find a blender, an automatic drip coffee maker
neighborhood_overview: The bungalow is located in beautiful North Asheville in a quiet residential area. It’s 5 minutes to the Grove Park Inn; 10-15 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway, Downtown Asheville and the River Arts District; and 20-25 minutes to the Biltmore Estate.
host_about: I live in beautiful North Asheville with my husband Billy, our 2 year old daughter Quinn, dogs Charlotte and Rusty and seven chickens. We're not Asheville natives but after seven great years here, we're happy to call this place our home. Billy is co-owner of Lexington Glassworks and I'm a stay at home mama managing our first home-turned-rental, Modern Mountain Bungalow. When we're not enjoying the small mountains of NC, we're dreaming of our annual summer trips to Maine.

name: The Studio at 217
description:
The Studio at 217 is tucked away on a quiet cul-de-sac in as-yet-to-be-discovered East Asheville. This cozy, light filled space is attached to a corner of our handmade log home, with it's own private entrance and lots of off street parking. Our property abuts Blue Ridge Parkway land, so it's a short hike on a clear trail through the woods to the Mountains-to-Sea Trail or the Parkway. The Studio is 15 mins from the Biltmore, just 12 mins from downtown, and one mile from a local grocery store.

The space
The Studio is fully private and well appointed, with everything you need for a comfortable stay in our beautiful area. If you want to eat in one night, our fully equipped kitchen has everything you need to make a meal. We provide coffee, tea, sweetners, 1/2 and 1/2, breakfast bars, fruit, and instant oatmeal for a light breakfast. Also basic cooking condiments: pepper, salt, and oil.

Guest access
The Studio is fully self-contained with it
neighborhood_overview: The Studio is at the bottom of a gravel road, tucked into a small holler with woods on one side. It feels out- of-the-way here, but it's also just a mile from our local grocery store and Filo, our favorite local cafe and Bistro.  The Copper Crown, another favorite restaurant, is also in the neighborhood.  And then there is Ultimate Ice Cream, which really is the ultimate!  The Nature Center is a mile away too.
host_about: We've lived in the area for over 30 years, and love the natural wonders that abound here!  We had a great time renovating the Cottage on Parkway Loop together, and hope that spirit is passed on to everyone who shares the space.  We've added 'The Studio at 217'!  We had a lot of fun making this space cozy and welcoming.

name: The Woodfin - Chateau de Bro & Chalet de Bae
description:
THE SPACE IS ALL YOURS!

The Woodfin is a chateau de bro, chalet de bae, camp for champs, and home for the roaming adventurer. Nestled in a quiet neighborhood just a 5 to 7-minute drive from downtown, this private dream pad is the perfect hub for couples, friends, and family to explore everything Asheville has to offer. Recharge in the high-end Tempurpedic TEMPUR-Cloud® bed (with vibration settings) for an unbeatable nights sleep! Fully equipped kitchen. Professionally cleaned!

The space
DESIGN
Enjoy a minimalist aesthetic inspired by Scandinavian design with undertones of low-key surfer vibes. Crisp, white walls and large casement windows maximize light and warmth. Natural elements of wood, wool, and iron add intrigue and texture to the space. This homey abode invites you to relax and enjoy your company.

PARKING AND ENTRY
Complimentary off-street parking for two vehicles is located in front of the house. Guests enter using convenie
neighborhood_overview: The small town of Woodfin, NC rests along the banks of the French Broad River and its convenient location next to I-26 makes for a quick 5-minute drive to downtown Asheville. Filled with grit and charm, this historic suburban neighborhood is currently undergoing a fast-paced revival with the expansion of the River Arts District (RAD) and French Broad River Greenway Project. Breweries, restaurants, and coffee shops are overflowing from the nearby RAD.  Our neighbors are lively and friendly, and you’re likely to get a small-town wave. These are good people. Please respect our neighbors by driving slow.
host_about:
I grew up on the Texas border near South Padre Island. I moved to Asheville in (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) from Austin, TX soon after graduating with a degree in mechanical engineering. The mountains called my name, and my would-be manager also called my name (to offer me a job),  so I set out on the 17hr drive and only looked back once...because I thought I saw a bear.

 I began my career servicing CTs, MRIs, and X-ray systems throughout Western North Carolina. If I'm not working on the house or hanging with the fam, my free time is spent playing outdoors - kayak fishing, mountain biking, and rock climbing. 

If there's an opportunity to go fishing, I usually take the bait. I own a small fleet of fishing kayaks and like to take day trips out on the local waters to pursue bass, trout and gorgeous scenery. If you're in the neighborhood to catch some fish, let me know and Ill try to give you some tips on where to go. 

Asheville is a mountain biker's paradise. There's an expansive network of trail systems all throughout the surrounding forests lands and hitting the trails with the gang is a surefire way to put a smile on my face. IMO its the best way to submerse yourself in these mountains and take in all their beauty. If you're itching for a thrilling downhill adventure or a casual bike ride through the mountains, reach out and I can point you in the right direction. 

My relationship with rock climbing is fickle; I'm either climbing or I'm not. I love it because by nature it puts you by nature. But if the fish are biting, its hard to pull me from a kayak to climb a 300 ft bluff. 

I also love music, food, and beer. If Asheville's beer and culinary scene is what brought you here, I am happy to offer advice. Let me know!

name: Basement Apartment Convenient to Asheville
description:
We have a downstairs guest apartment with one bedroom and bath. There is also a living area with a futon, and a kitchenette/dining space, about 600 square feet total. We are located in Candler, minutes away from downtown Asheville, Ski Resorts, or the Blue Ridge Parkway. Highlights of our area include: Wicked Weed West, Bent Creek - an ideal spot for hiking or mountain biking, Pisgah View Ranch - soon to be a state park, and the North Carolina Arboretum. We would love to have you stay with us!

The space
Quiet and cozy, we welcome you to your private basement apartment. Located minutes from West Asheville and 10-15 minutes from the heart of downtown. Our house is convenient to the interstate, the Blue Ridge Parkway, hiking or dining. As travelers ourselves with two small kids, we try to make our space accommodating to families (a pack and play is available on request). We offer games for kids to play, motion activated nightlights, and two TV's equipped with ROKU.
neighborhood_overview: We live on a short private road in a small planned community. Our neighbors are mostly retirees who are friendly and quiet. There are plenty of mature trees and some good views of the mountains!
host_location: Buncombe County, North Carolina, United States
host_about: My wife Betsey and I settled in Asheville in 2015, and we have spent a lot of time exploring fun things to do in this area and trying out new places to eat.  We are parents to two young children, and of course we enjoy traveling ourselves. We are happy to welcome visitors to our home and to the Asheville area!

description:
Head for the hills of North Carolina and stay at this 2-bedroom, 1-bath cabin while exploring the Asheville area. Located just 5 miles from the city, this vacation rental puts you in the middle of national forests, breweries, the Blueridge Parkway, and the distinct culture that Asheville is known for. Spend your day out of the house at the Biltmore Estate or touring Sierra Nevada Brewery, then return home to your cozy cabin to make a meal and enjoy a beverage as the sun sets.

The space
Washer/Dryer | Newly Remodeled | Family Friendly

Perfect for couples looking for a quick getaway or families visiting UNC Asheville, this cabin has all of the amenities that you would find in your own home while being close to Asheville’s best attractions.

Master Bedroom: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed

INDOOR LIVING: Hardwood floors, flat-screen TV w/ Roku, Bose speaker, ceiling fans, dining table, laptop-friendly workspace

The kitchenette is stocked with spices and cooking oils, a convection oven, electric kettle, slow cooker, drip coffee, and full size fridge. While there's NO range/stove, we hope the options we provide can assist in creating easy, no fuss meals.

The dining area overlooks a spacious living room with a pull out queen bed. Additional bedding can be
neighborhood_overview: We are 15 minutes max from Downtown Asheville, the Biltmore Estate and Grounds, and the Blue Ridge parkway. We're located on a quiet street and you can come and go as you please, and never have to worry about parking—you'll have your own spot.

name: Jupiter's Garden Studio
description:
Quirky is the name of the game in popular West Asheville. Everyone has their own unique angle on everything. Our space is a private studio suite, with its own entrance and outdoor seating area, decorated with some mid century flair, accessed through our beloved gardens, which have been featured on the West Asheville Garden Stroll twice. Memory foam topped double bed, perfect for 1 or 2 people. Homestay permit.

The space
We have created in our studio what we look for when we are traveling. A clean, comfy, and private space at an affordable price. Lock box entry so you can check in if we are at work. Our house is a bungalow built in 1927, with all the charm and quirkiness of a house soon to celebrate its centennial birthday. Part of our living space is above the guest suite. There are 3 humans, 2 dogs and a cat living here. We are relatively quiet people, but you will probably hear us. We have earplugs for your convenience, and will do our best to keep the noise t
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of West Asheville-walking distance to all restaurants, bars, yoga studio, social clubs, coffeeshops and the grocery store. We live on the best street (in our opinion) in our neighborhood and love our neighbors. It is a quiet respite away from the bustle of Haywood Rd, which is a short 6 minute walk. Enjoy breakfast at Biscuithead or one of the many coffee shops like Odd's Cafe, dinner at The Admiral (make a reservation way in advance), Gan Shan West, or Sunny Point Cafe or catch some music at Isis. Or go do some shopping. You could check out Whist, our favorite kitschy impulse buying store. Ample street is parking available.
There is so much to do in and around Asheville. You are less than an hour from some of the most amazing hiking, waterfalls and views of the Blue Ridge. You can climb walls, zipline through trees, hike to the tops of mountains, pick wild blueberries and so much more. Bike Rentals (we have a couple of locks you can borrow) are plentiful. Art

name: 6 MIN TO DOWNTOWN ASHEVILLE % SPARKLING CLEAN
description:
7 Min Drive to Asheville Art Museum
6 Min Drive to Downtown Asheville
11 Min Drive to Biltmore

Located in the quaint Woodfin community, this beautiful, 1500 sq ft home is the perfect base for an extended staycation. It’s clean and tidy with plenty of room to unwind and every modern amenity for your comfort. Stroll along the French Broad River, hike the Appalachian Trail, or head downtown for some shopping, dining, or the Asheville arts scene.

Experience Asheville With Us & Learn More Below!

The space
Here Are A Few Kind Words From Our Past Guests:

“Very clean and comfortable! Heidi was super responsive when I sent a message that the fire alarm was chirping. They were there within about half an hour to replace the battery. Home had everything we needed to cook meals. The area was quiet, and close enough to Uber into town with no issues. Out of the hustle and bustle of downtown, but close enough to experience it each day!
neighborhood_overview:
Located just 6 min from downtown Ashesville, our place is a perfect launchpad for outdoor adventures! We are less than 3 miles to downtown and 8 minutes from just about everywhere in Asheville, including the Biltmore, hiking and the Blue Ridge Parkway.

Don't waste your vacation in traffic. As Asheville's popularity has increased, so has it's traffic. From our location you can access Downtown, the River Arts District and popular West Asheville via the River Road and avoid the traffic. Get to just about anywhere you need to go in less than 10 minutes!

Head to nearby Riverside Park for strolling and views of the French Broad. Bike the Blue Ridge Parkway, hike the Appalachian Trail, or explore Chimney Rock and Lake Lure. For winter sports, Wolf Ridge Ski Resort is just 35 minutes to the north. The area is dotted with Western North Carolina’s best breweries and cideries, where you can enjoy a crisp drink in a lively setting.
host_about: I love to travel, I am a big foodie...That pretty much sums it up!  My partner and I travel extensively and enjoy creating spaces for other fellow travelers to enjoy. If we are not in Asheville you might find us in central America or South East Asia soaking up some sun and surf.  Life is constantly flying by so why not get out there and enjoy it!  Right? Thats my motto.

host_about:

We put a lot of thought and love in designing our homes, and we hope it shows. 
We would love to host you in our home and see all we have to offer along with Asheville's beautiful scenery.  Thank you for viewing our homes.

is a relaxing private space on the ground level of my home. Visitors have their own parking and entrance to a 3-room hide-away, with windows in each room.
The kitchen has a sofa, table, chairs offering a place to sit, read, prepare small meals, sip a variety of beverages, and plan your time on the town. The bedroom is quiet and the king size bed is deeply comfortable, close by is another private sitting area.
The bathroom en suite is the perfect place to bubble bath.

The space
The 'Hide-Away' is tranquil and relaxing with a spa-turquoise color scheme, comfy king size bed, queen sofa bed, ensuite bathroom with soaker tub and kitchen appliances-refrigerator, toaster oven, Keurig coffee maker and microwave, with dishes, utensils and pans, all that is needed to prepare small meals and snacks. neighborhood_overview: Morningside Hide-Away is in a quiet neighborhood, but walking (8 blocks) distance from downtown West Asheville, with all the restaurants, live music venues and micro-breweries along Haywood Rd, that you might want to experience. There are numerous brochures  in the sitting room that list places to visit, and eat as well as brochures and maps you can take with you.
host_about:
Greetings;

I am a professional book artist and teacher since 1989, specializing in book restoration, conservation and new construction.    I love to cook and meet new people and look forward to making Asheville accessible to visitors through affordable accommodations and  enjoyable experiences.  Amount of contact with guests is set by visitor preference.  Asheville is a fabulous place, no matter how long the stay, and most people return often, until they move here permanently, as I did in 2003.  I look forward to our meeting and helping you create your own adventure.

name: Cozy, modern, private W AVL studio, dogs stay free
description:
Very clean dog friendly ground floor studio in my home with a private entry. Due to the coronavirus, I’m taking extra care to disinfect thoroughly between reservations. Studio is walking distance to French Broad River Park/dog park and Carrier Park. A short drive (5 min) to Biltmore Village, Biltmore estate, River arts District, or Haywood Avenue. Ten min drive to downtown Asheville. Well behaved dogs welcome with no extra fee or deposit, request they be groomed and pest free.

The space
Newly remodeled, clean & stylish studio space suitable for 1-2 people. Dogs welcome, sorry, no cats. I provide a dog bed and sheets to cover couch to minimize shedding on furniture.
For your safety, the space has a dedicated Gree ductless AC/heat that supplies individual temperature comfort and safe supply of clean air separate from the rest of the house.
My dog and I live upstairs, some household noise may be heard. I work early hours and am very conscientious of
neighborhood_overview: “East” West Asheville is an up and coming area of Asheville. Your Airbnb is located on a residential street with a mixture of remodeled and older homes. There are not sidewalks, but there is not much traffic on my street.  The house is walking distance to two riverfront parks, one of which also has a fenced dog park.  Dogs can access the river from both parks if your pup enjoys swimming!  There is a wonderful breakfast/lunch/coffee shop walking distance from my house-Homeground.  It is only a short drive (5 min) to the River Arts District, Biltmore Village, Biltmore Estate, and several breweries & restaurants .  Ten minutes to downtown Asheville.
host_about: I moved to Asheville North Carolina from Florida in July 2019.  I wanted to be closer to family but also to achieve a better life work balance.  I work in a Rehab hospital 4 days per week which allows me time to travel, hike, relax, and pursue other interests.  I consider myself extremely lucky to have found a home with an Airbnb apartment I can share with others.

name: West Asheville Farmhouse on 4 Acres Close to Town
description:
Relax in a fully updated 2BR/1BA home w/ 4-acre back yard and wooded glade. 12 minutes to Biltmore Estate and downtown, 6 minutes to W AVL restaurant scene, BR Parkway and NC Arboretum. Freshly painted with new furniture as of 2020. Modern kitchen, half-covered backyard deck overlooking forest and fields. Includes a grill and a gorgeous fire pit area. Sleeps up to 6 in 3 beds plus 1 foldout couch. House has many books, maps, board games and stereo/ turntable with LP collection. Dogs allowed.

The space
Private house in West Asheville, completely updated as of January 2020, includes brand new beds and sofa. Flat screen TVs in living room and main bedroom are set up for Roku and access to guest's subscription services. Fully appointed kitchen includes fridge, stove and oven, microwave, and cookware to prepare a feast. AC and heat controls are readily available with temperature settings to your preference.

The covered deck includes comfortable wicker fur
neighborhood_overview:
We are on the western edge of Asheville City limits-- a nice bucolic neighborhood with lots of trees and open pasture. We are very close to the Buncombe County Sports Park, and close to the NC Arboretum, Blue Ridge Parkway, French Broad River, and West Asheville.

Stand-alone short term rentals are not allowed in Asheville city limits. We are just outside of the city (by a few feet!), so our rental is 100% legit.
host_about: We are the Mills Family from Asheville, North Carolina. Smithson works as an economic development consultant and Kathy is a media specialist in the local school system. After years of using Air BnB around the country, we decided to build a cottage on our property for guests who travel like we do. The cottage is designed for comfortable short-term stays, inspired by great experiences we had in homes from Portland, OR to NYC and many points in-between. We are looking forward to making your stay as enjoyable as possible!

name: Perfect location. Quiet and 5 minutes to downtown.
description:
We follow Airbnb's Covid disinfecting protocol

This charming, cozy mid-century modern home is located just 1.4 miles from downtown and minutes to the Biltmore Estate. Close to everything, centrally located and yet on a quiet mountain road with mature trees, privacy, and wildlife!

It is the perfect home base to explore Asheville. This is a unique property in the city. Enjoy a mountain escape within the heart of Asheville. We are just 10 minutes to the River Arts District and West Asheville.

The space
This 5 time Super Host awarded property has an open floor plan with a sunny kitchen and dinette. There's a comfortable living room area with large windows looking out into the trees. A door off the dinette opens right onto the deck. Sunlight comes over the mountain and into the kitchen and deck for morning coffee. There is a quiet shaded spot outside under the trees to sit on a bench with a book or meditate.

The deck overlooks the ya
neighborhood_overview:
Located on a low mountain between downtown and Tunnel Rd. breakfast opportunities abound, as well as a major supermarket, all less than 3 minutes from the house.

Downtown Asheville is just a 5-minute drive. You can walk over and down the mountain to town in about 25 minutes on a narrow, quiet road and then Uber home for around $7. West Asheville and the River Arts District are a 10-minute drive.

The Biltmore Estate and Biltmore village both neighbor the Kenilworth neighborhood and are just 2 miles away and about a 5-minute drive.

Windswept Drive is just up the hill offering some of the best views of the city found anywhere. There's also an access point to Beaucatcher Mtn Park, a mature forested oasis just above the city. It's accessible from the house for walkers or runners who don't mind climbing, otherwise, there's parking at the trailhead.
host_about:
Entrepreneur, business owner, Caribbean charter boat captain and sailor. I've spent my life making people happy on vacation, from the Mountains of Colorado to the US Virgin Islands. I've always loved welcoming visitors to awesome travel destinations that happen to be my home. 

Asheville is a wonderful small city. I like coffee, bookstores, farmers markets and bicycles. I also love great restaurants and outdoor activities. No wonder I moved to Asheville. 

As a host I like to completely disappear unless I'm needed or wanted, then I'm here to help, offer local tips, make reservations, arrange transportation or whatever you need.

name: Magnolia Suite - North Lodge on Oakland Bed & Breakfast
description:
Historic 1904 home, restored to Bed and Breakfast since 1995. Careful attention to original ambiance, while newer touches have been added for warmth and blended renewal.

The space
This is a spacious room, with a King size bed and all the comforts you might require. The room has it's own private bath, a lockable door from the rest of the home. you will be provided a key to the room and the main entry has a coded door lock for ease of access. Come and go as you will. Please make use of the common areas of the home. We hope you will make new friends from anywhere in the world.

Guest access
See our pictures to view common area of the Inn. Included in the areas are the dining room where we include a 2 to 3 course plated breakfast

Other things to note
We really love hosting great guests and would love to have you stay!
neighborhood_overview: We are central to everything you want to see and do, from the Biltmore Estate, Downtown, River arts district all about a 5 minute drive and many many more attractions.
host_about: Come share with us the community and family that is Airbnb.  We now live in the heart of beautiful Asheville, North Carolina, at the base of the Blue Ridge Mountains.  Our Inn sits on 1 acre of well manicured lawn and old country English gardens, not even 5 minutes from Biltmore Estate and 1.6 miles from downtown.    We love what this area of the country has to offer.  It's a friendly diverse area, with lots of outdoor activities.   Our unique area offers something for everyone from the "foodie scene" to artists and musicians, to beer and wine and certainly anything your imagination desires for being outside in nature.  My partner Kevin and I have hosted for Airbnb for 8 years now.  That's how we got our start in hospitality and where it all began on our 13 acre horse farm, which we sold to become full time innkeepers.  We're pretty social and love meeting people of all walks of life,  from all around the world.  We'd love for you to come stay with us at North Lodge Bed & Breakfast.

name: Fairytale Stone Cottage
description:
Storybook stone cottage is an absolute GEM! Only a 7 minute drive to downtown. The home is loaded with charm and features like Arts & Crafts wainscoting and an 1850's antique mantle. Large yard is extremely private and features fruit trees and many unique types of flora. Three bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. Enjoy sunsets from your westward facing sunroom, a cup of morning coffee on the stone patio out front, or walk the stone path in your own private fairytale garden!

The space
The home was built in 1910 by the same mason who built the Biltmore House. It was the original estate in the area with over 9 acres of land surrounding it and it has stood the test of time. Over the last 100 years, the land around the home has been sold and neighboring homes have been built into a beautiful mountain living community.

Guest access
You will have absolute privacy and access to the entire home. There are 3 queen beds and a pull out couch with a thick que
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is located right off of Riverside Drive - a scenic drive along the French Broad River.
host_about: Mom with 2 little girls and looking to stay in quiet place and explore areas around.

name: Ralph’s Retreat
description:
Welcome to Ralph’s Retreat! Conveniently located 2.5 miles from Downtown Asheville//3 miles from the River Arts District//1.5 miles to UNCA, this freshly renovated 2 bedroom 1 bath apartment comes fully equipped with all essentials guests may need for a cozy getaway in the mountains.

**Check out our other listing: Rufus’ Retreat (the upper apartment)!

The space
The space is open and airy, located a short drive//walk//bike ride to downtown Asheville, the River Arts District, UNCA and West Asheville.
Asheville Community Yoga, DanceClub Asheville, Acupuncture Center of Asheville, Zillicoah Brewery, Gingers Revenge Brewery, the French Broad River and Beaver Lake are all within walking distance of Ralph’s Retreat.

Guest access
The entire lower apartment is available for guests. There is a small backyard shared with the upper apartment. Please pick up after your pets.

Please be mindful that there may be guests staying i
neighborhood_overview: This location can’t be beat! Yoga & dance studios, acupuncturists & massage therapists, breweries & hiking trails are all a stones throw from Ralph’s Retreat. Stay with us and experience the magic of Asheville! *A brand new restaurant just opened 3 doors up from Ralph’s Retreat!*
host_about:
Superhost in Asheville, NC (Rufus’ Retreat + Ralph’s Retreat). 
Love to travel with my husband and 3 fluffers to new places and experience new things!

description: How about the feel of mountain forested seclusion while being less than 20 minutes from downtown Asheville? Or stay in your own luxurious hideaway, yet being less than 5 minutes to the nightlife, restaurants and more in Biltmore Park Town Square? Welcome to the unique and luxurious Deerhaven Hideaway!! Deerhaven Hideaway is a true "one-of-a-kind" vacation destination, tucked in the pristine & private property surrounded by Biltmore Park, The Ramble and right outside downtown Asheville. This spacious 4 bedroom home affords mountain privacy, a wrap-a-round covered & open deck, and a truly luxurious experience while being close to a plethora of outdoor activities and everything Asheville is renowned for in every Top-10 rating. Deerhaven Hideaway has become one of the most popular homes in our Yonder luxury portfolio, and is quickly becoming one of the most requested! It is not surprising when you put a terrific home together with all the amenities it has to offer, with a one-of-a-kind loc
neighborhood_overview: WNC
host_about:
Yonder Luxury Vacation Rentals has designed the vacation experience around each Yonder Home to invigorate and inspire. Every Yonder Home is individually decorated and beautifully furnished for your comfort to give you an effortless and relaxing vacation with family and friends.

The Yonder Homes, with a wide array of amenities, can accommodate between 2 and 30 guests. Larger parties can easily be arranged.

name: Urban Forest Suite (Open During Crisis)
description:
Modern master bedroom in a newly build home, this cozy private space with a private entrance is pure Asheville vibe and charm! It has a south-facing window overlooking the fenced garden, so you'll have light to enjoy all day. With high ceilings, it has a private bathroom with a luxury stone floor shower, a TV with access to streaming, and a kitchenette. Enjoy the covered porch with a local Asheville beer, before walking for a meal on Haywood Rd. 12 minute Uber ride to downtown.

The space
With a private entrance and a door code, you enter into your 330 sqft (31 m2) suite with one queen bed, a table for two, and a loveseat. The suite has its own thermostat, so you can set the temperature to your preference. The kitchenette is stocked with a coffee machine, refrigerator, and microwave, so reheating food or making a snack is easy. We provide local coffee and a few local beers. The bathroom has a double sink and a custom shower designed for a king. Just outside the en
neighborhood_overview: We are near the end of our street, inside the suite you can't hear a thing. Located the heart of West Asheville, we are a 10-minute walk from Haywood Rd. There you can find bars, breweries, restaurants, a supermarket, some local shops, and a music venue. To downtown Asheville, it is about a 12-minute ride, and it's easy to get an Uber from the house. The Biltmore Estate is about 10 minutes by car, and the closest hiking trails about 15 minutes by car.
host_about: We Love to travel and have lived in several countries. Now my wife and I live in Asheville, NC with our dog and cat. We have hosted Airbnb on and off for years and love to meet new people and see new places. Both of us have worked in the hospitality industry for years and we like to give 5 star service!

description:
Enjoy a private entrance to a 600 sq. ft. private suite with a large private outdoor space. Access to a grill, unwind in a hammock, memory foam bed with free WiFi. Walking distance to the center of hip West Asheville with it’s local shops, restaurants, grocery stores & farmer’s market on Tuesdays. Downtown and other popular outdoor destinations only a short drive. Outdoor/Indoor spots to work remotely. Discounted for longer stays. House thoroughly & non-toxically cleaned after each tenant!

*Please note that the homeowner lives on site, in a completely separate unit, and may be present during your stay.

Patio/Hammock/A/C/Memory Foam Master Bed/Free WiFi

You will have full access to the suite that you have rented as well as the backyard & hammock. The grill is also available should you want to do some outdoor cooking.

Other things to note

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is centrally located to most everything that draws people to Asheville. Should you prefer to tour or eat out on foot this unit is a short distance to Haywood Road, the heart of West Asheville.  There are unique and locally owned restaurants & shops that are so fun to explore!
host_about: I have lived in Asheville for over 15 years and still really love it.  For most of that time I've lived in this neighborhood, West Asheville.  I mostly spend my free time with my children, doing yoga and hiking with my dog & friends.  The local economy, small town feel, and natural beauty are what have kept me in Asheville.  I hope you come for a visit!

name: Hip, Atomic Getaway in Downtown Asheville
description: The Atomic getaway is a newly furnished, open concept midcentury studio.  The apt is located on the ground floor featuring a private entrance, a sitting patio and off street parking.  The spacious living area has a smart tv,  a kitchenette with a mini fridge, microwave, a Keurig,  and a water cooler.  The sleeping area includes a king bed and another tv.  Conveniently  located in downtown Asheville,  the Atomic getaway is the ideal home base for exploring all destinations Asheville has to offer.
neighborhood_overview: Hi!  You are in for a real treat if you love a beautiful walk in the woods while being in the city.  This neighborhood is at the base of Town Mountain which offers peaceful walks for miles with massive trees and woodland wildflowers as  far as you can walk.  You may also see white squirrels,  wood peckers, and hawks!  If you choose to walk toward the city, you can be at coffee shops, pubs, and restaurants in minutes!
host_about:
Hi!  

I'm Amanda  and have lived here in Asheville for 22 years.  I love this town and the little neighborhood I wake up to every day.

I'm passionate about gardening and morning runs in the mountains.

I have a love of mid century design and have decorated the space for guests according to that passion and for all to enjoy!  

Please don't hesitate to contact me for anything you may need to make your stay with me super fun!

name: THE HIVE pingpong * foosball * arcade table * deck
description:
Welcome to ‘The Hive,’ a spacious 3,300-square-foot home with plush furnishings and a fenced-in yard! This upscale 6-bedroom, 3.5-bathroom vacation rental in is the perfect spot for large groups looking to visit Asheville. Prepare meals in the full kitchen and stream shows on the Smart TV while kids have a ping pong tournament or zip down the zipline. This peaceful 4-house neighborhood sits on a private road, less than 9 miles from major sites like The Biltmore Estate and Downtown Asheville!

The space
Family Friendly | 3,300 Sq Ft | Newly Renovated | Sparkling Clean

This group-friendly getaway is great for remote work and school, extended family gatherings, bachelor/ bachelorette celebrations, church and business retreats, and college group reunions! If you're traveling for sightseeing in downtown Asheville or adventure in the famous Great Smoky Mountains, this is the place to be! The WiFi speed is a whopping 200 Mbps!

There are four bedro
neighborhood_overview: Search online for "The Hive, Asheville Airbnb video" to view a video tour of the house, outdoor space, and neighborhood.
host_about: Hi, I’m Andrea!  My husband, Brian, and I have lived in Asheville for over 20 years!   We were high school sweethearts, growing up in Raleigh and getting married just two weeks after graduating from NC State.  We are parents to eight children (ages 6-18), three of whom we adopted from Haiti in March of 2018.  As a family, we enjoy hiking, bicycling, traveling, watching movies, reading books, and playing board games.  When we were first married, Brian and I lived in Canada and spent our time rock climbing, ice climbing, white water kayaking, mountain biking, and leading high ropes adventures at a camp and retreat center.  After 20 years in sales, banking, engineering, and customer service management, Brian is now happily self-employed in the real estate industry.  I enjoy the many tasks (except cooking) that keep me busy between running a large household and our Airbnb rentals.  Together, Brian and I enjoy experiencing new destinations, watching live performances, and eating out.  We are passionate about creating a special vacation for our guests!  We look forward to hosting you!

name: Private Entrance to Upstairs of River Arts Home
description:
A private entrance to two bedrooms, each with a private bathroom, and a third common room with TV and kitchenette are all yours to enjoy in this beautiful, historic house. Located in the River Arts District and about 1 mile from downtown, the location is ideal to explore Asheville.

The space
You will be staying in the upstairs floor of a beautifully restored 1907 house. There is a simple kitchinette with minfridge, microwave, coffee maker and tea kettle.

Guest access
Front porch
neighborhood_overview: A booklet will be provided with a curated list of restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, activities, sights, hikes, etc. We've visited them all and picked the best, but if you find something we've missed please let us know so we can add it to the book!
host_about: I have lived in Asheville for seven years and it gets better each year.  I love hosting people in this town and making sure they have a great experience. I'm a foodie and nature lover. My schedule is full and erratic, so I will do my best to greet you but we will most likely communicate through text. Please let me know if there is anything you would like to know about the area, and thanks for visiting!

name: Driftwood by the River 3.0
description:
Secluded lower level 3 bedroom duplex situated on 3 acres of gorgeous riverfront in East Asheville! Convenient to I-40 and Tunnel Rd. (Hwy 70) at Exit 55. Warren Wilson College, V.A. Hospital, & The Blue Ridge Parkway are nearby. Downtown Asheville & Biltmore Estate are 6 miles away. Guests enjoy sunning on the big rock in the river and watching the abundant wildlife from the large decks. We respect the privacy of our guests but are available should you need guidance.

The space
Driftwood by The River 3.0 is recently renovated. This lower level duplex boasts 9 foot ceilings and ample windows giving it an open and spacious feel. Freshly tiled common areas and carpeted bedrooms give the apartment a clean and cozy ambiance. Large covered decks overlook the river and feature a gas grill, patio furniture and indirect lighting. One master suite on the river side with queen bed and private bathroom with shower. Second bedroom with queen bed. Third bedroom with full bed a
neighborhood_overview: There are many great places to eat in East Asheville. Our favorites are listed in your welcome letter. Warren Wilson College and Azealia Park offer great resources for outdoor enjoyment and upstream/downstream river access. Access to The Blue Ridge Parkway is less than a mile from our driveway with great hiking and amazing overlooks. Ingles Grocery is 1.5 miles away. Western North Carolina Nature Center is 2 miles away. The V.A. Hospital is very close by.
host_about: My wife Pamela and I enjoy living in such a beautiful area. We like to hike and spend time in nature.  Our work is in music and entertainment. Libre manages a boogie-woogie piano trio named Screaming Js and operates an outdoor music festival and wedding venue in Spartanburg SC called The Music Camp. Events are our passion and we are happy to provide event services to those we host at Driftwood by The River or at our much larger location in Spartanburg, SC. It is our hope that you will enjoy our property and send your best friends to this fantastic location. We assume you didn't look for such a secluded place to meet new people but if you need us for anything we are available to help.

description:

A quiet, comfortable home in the downtown area will have you relaxed after your explorations of Asheville and the surrounding areas. The front door opens to the South Slope and you can walk to restaurants, breweries, music venues, theaters, and much more. The two (2) car garage has a keyless entry lock. Use the stairs or ride the private in house elevator to living areas.

The space
The second floor has the living room, dining room and kitchen. Games and books are provided or view your favorite show on the TV Roku system. A modern kitchen has the essentials for preparing your favorite meals. The third floor has a master bedroom with a king bed, walk-in closet, and a bath with two sink areas and a walk-in shower. The second bedroom has a queen bed, closet and a separate bath with a tub/shower combination. The laundry is also located on the third fl
neighborhood_overview: The South Slope is home to Buxton BBQ, the Orange Peel, Burial Beer, Wicked Weed Brewing, Chemist Gin, Vortex Doughnuts, Biscuit Head, and much more.  Sauna House is directly across the street for a Nordic style bathhouse.  The entire downtown area is within easy walking distance.
host_about: All of the hosts (my wife Meliah, brother-in-law Marlon, and me) all grew up in Asheville and are glad to offer this place on the South Slope.  I personally enjoy taking advantage of the areas bounty of mountain biking, hiking and farm to table food.

name: Charming House Overlooking River near Asheville
description:
A quiet and quaint 1300-square-foot house with a spacious wrap-around deck nestled among the trees overlooking the river. A serene nature-lovers setting on the outside with cozy, colorful, clean decor and lots of light on the inside.

Two bedrooms, plus a dedicated office/writing room (with high-speed wifi - and a few free weights and yoga mat!) ...just 7 miles from downtown Asheville. Mountains-to-Sea trailhead is just minutes away, as well as dog-walks and local restaurants.

The space
• The house is filled with light...skylights in both living room and kitchen.

• Kitchen is newly remodeled and stocked with coffee, teas, filtered water, a VitaMix blender, plus all needed cooking utensils and supplies for eating at home.

• The house is cleaned and supplied with earth-friendly cleaning and paper products.

• We follow AirBnb covid guidelines for cleaning and sanitization of the entire property. The house is aired out b
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is perched among the trees above a tiny tree-lined street that has just 12 houses on it. The street runs parallel to the river so you hear mostly birdsong and the gentle sounds of the water, and catch the occasional black bear wandering by. You get to experience the serenity of the mountains while having quick access to downtown Asheville.
host_about:
Hey - I'm Christine!

I moved to Asheville in the early 90's to escape Northern Virginia and my post-college cubicle job. I wanted to be a songwriter...which thrilled my parents to no end.  

Turns out, Asheville was the perfect place to be creative, get quiet, wake the heck up - and spend the next 15 years as a touring performing songwriter on my own record label. (Shared stages with everyone from The Beach Boys to John Mayer to Nanci Griffith - and made 7 CD's along the way.)

In 2010, as a result of requests from so many creative entrepreneurial types (and being burnt out from 250 days a year on the road), I started a business coaching company here in Asheville. That became an online training resource, and we've hosted clients from all over the world at our retreats and events here. These days, like so many of us, I spend more time on Zoom than anything else. :)

Hosting guests has been an unexpected joy and new passion for me.  I love being able to provide all the amenities and experiences for travelers and vacationers and work-from-homers... mostly based on 15 years of staying in every hotel (ahem, and motel) chain and city across the U.S.  I'm still learning constantly!

I love all things nature. Trees, birds, bears, mountains, dirt. I strive to contribute the creative and natural spirit of this precious spot, even as it grows at a crazy pace.

name: A Stones throw from Asheville & Weaverville
description:
Hansel & Gretel rock mixed-use duplex located 3 miles from Weaverville & Asheville; convenient to I-26 & I-240. Newly decorated 2 bedroom ground level apartment with a separate entrance. Home has a galley kitchen, walk-in shower, living room area, and off-street parking. It is close to the Blue Ridge Parkway, Biltmore, Grove Park, breweries, tubing, Rivers Arts District and everything Asheville has to offer. Note: The owner's accounting firm is on the 2nd floor of the home open M-F 9 to 5.

The space
This home is 1375 sq ft space all ground level. It features a fully furnished galley kitchen including snacks, coffee, and tea. The bathroom has a walk-in shower. The shower only has one small lip making it easy for guests with mobility concerns. Both bedrooms have queen size beds. The living room has a 4K 42-inch screen TV. The washer and dryer are available for guest use. Off-street parking is available for up to 2 vehicles.

Due to the layout of the
neighborhood_overview:
We are nestled between downtown Asheville and Weaverville with fast access to I 26. Multiple grocery stores, restaurants, and an ABC store are all a short distance from our home. Location serviced by Lift/Uber and many local restaurants and grocery delivery services. There is an abundance of activities for all to enjoy from dining, shopping, local art, hiking, mountain biking, skiing, white water rafting,zip-lining, horseback riding, theater, live music, historical tours, ghost tours, outlet shops, wildlife viewing, nature parks, petting zoos and so much more. All of these activities are within a 30-minute or less drive. We have compiled some suggested activities and restaurants into a welcome manual. We can provide local 5 star or local family-friendly suggestions. For those seeking a gym, the YMCA of WNC is located in the Reynold's Mountain shopping center less than a mile away.

Our home was built in the 1950's and our door widths do vary from room to room. The most n
host_about: Alicia and her husband John are both Asheville natives who love where they live . Having grown up in Asheville, we feel we can help guests enjoy both the tourist and the locals view of all that Western North Carolina offers.  Alicia's favorite hobby is photography (you will see her prints on the walls of the home).  John is an avid outdoorsman having spent his life backpacking, hiking, camping, rafting and fishing throughout WNC.   We have loved traveling and staying in AirBNB properties and are excited to now offer up space of our own.

name: Relaxing 1 Bed 1 Bath Private Apt in Bent Creek
description:
Welcome to our modern 1 bed, 1 bath, apartment complete with kitchenette. The completely private apartment is attached to the back of our home, in the Bent Creek neighborhood.

Bent Creek Forest has access to over 50 miles of trails, is minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway, the NC Aboretum, boat launches to the French Broad River, and is an easy 15 minute drive to downtown Asheville. A short walk or bike ride from the apartment will lead you to endless trails.

The space
This new construction apartment offers a large one bedroom, complete with queen sized bed, a large closet, couch for lounging, a TV with Amazon Fire to conveniently stream your favorite shows or movies, full bathroom, and a kitchenette. We provide coffee, tea, honey and sugar. The kitchenette comes stocked with dishes, cups, mugs, an electric kettle, coffee pot and french press, a toaster oven large enough to bake a 10" pizza, a microwave, and an instant pot. You will have full access to
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is in Bent Creek Experimental Forest, which is made up of over 50 miles of hiking and mountain biking trails, which can be accessed by foot or bike from the apartment. It is a quiet, family friendly neighborhood. There is a park in the neighborhood within walking distance from the apartment, which has kids play equipment, as well as a pump track for biking. It is a 5 minute drive away from the beautiful Blue Ridge Parkway, the NC Arboretum, Zen Tubing, and the Asheville Outlets. It is about a 15 minute drive from the Asheville Airport, and very convenient to I-26 and I-40.
host_about: We are a family living and working in Asheville, NC. We enjoy being outside in the amazing surroundings of WNC!

description:
Relax in your comfortable and perfectly clean one bedroom suite after a fun day of sight-seeing and exploring the town. You will enjoy unwinding in this newly built suite or being outside on your private patio with beautiful views of the mountains and Blue Ridge Parkway. Conveniently located only 10 minutes from downtown Asheville. Private parking and sidewalk lead you to a separate entrance, which has keyless entry for self check-in. First booking is 6/18/21.

You can unwind on either the king size bed or in the sitting area (with pull-out sofa) while watching the 42 inch on 4K TV with streaming access. You have control of thermostat for control of heating and A/C.
neighborhood_overview: The property is located within a quiet neighborhood inside the Asheville city limits. The back of the property backs up to the mountains so there is wildlife in the surrounding area. You can occasionally see turkeys, birds, rabbits, deer, and even bears that enter our property.

name: Stay awhile in our FarmTique Forest Retreat
description:
Nestled within Asheville's magical forest! Stay awhile in a forest mountain retreat! Private yet peaceful and sprawling with wildlife, listen to the neighboring waterfall while relaxing on the back porch. The house is 12 mins to Downtown AVL, Biltmore Village and 7 mins to Blue Ridge Parkway hiking & waterfalls! Ideally located to everything to get the full Asheville experience! Newly renovated farm-tique home with all of the desired amenities to have an incredible stay!

The space
Escape to our Farmtique Forest Retreat and relax in our Magical Forest!

name: West Asheville Cottage Near Everything Asheville
description:
Good vibes abound in cozy West Asheville cottage near New Belgium Brewery, Haywood Rd and downtown. Fully equipped home with high speed internet, large screened TVs, big kitchen, blue tooth speakers, all new furniture only 5 minutes or less to all of the downtown sites! House is very private in a small, quiet neighborhood. Two levels easily accommodates 4-5 people. Enjoy coffee on the screened porch , deck or back yard.
Extra amenities include a 2nd mini kitchen / lounge in lower bedroom.

The space
Our groovy little in-town cottage occupies 2 levels. All furniture and renovations are sparkling new. One bedroom is on each level. The lower bedroom has a lounge area, complete with refrigerator and coffee bar. High definition TVs occupy each room. Super-fast internet allows you to stream your favorite apps and shows.
Screened front porch, deck and sizable rear yard let you breathe in that mountain air.

Guest access
Guests
neighborhood_overview:
Our cozy cottage sits on a small neighborhood circle. We know and like our neighbors and hope you will be mindful that they live here full time. West Asheville is an eclectic and emerging area that is very popular with guests. Our “base camp” is near all of the great new spots- but is not pedestrian friendly - everything is just minutes away by car or Uber.
Zip Lining and the Kolo Bike and Adventure Park is in our neighborhood at The Holiday Inn Crown Plaza Resort , directly adjacent to the house. The resort is very popular with guests as it also offers golf (under 1 mile ).
host_about:
I enjoy adventure travel and active getaways.  This led me to Asheville and Western Carolina back in the 90’s.  Since then I’ve hosted people who enjoy similar  experiences both here at our Asheville homes and in other parts of Eastern Tennessee and Western North Carolina. 
I enjoy pedaling, picking (guitar) and burying myself in the mountains - wherever they are. Pisgah is obviously my favorite but I could just as well be found in the Cascades or in Southwestern Colorado and Utah. 

Our cottages are a reflection of what we love and what makes us comfortable.  We hope you’ll find them super accommodating !  

Don’t forget to bring your bike and boots !

name: East Asheville 2 AirBNBs in 1, MtnViews, Sleeps 12
description:
Entire House includes two separate AirBNBs in one. Separate upstairs apartment with private deck, hot tub, fire pit, views, separate entrance(sleeps 2-4). Large 2000 Sq ft downstairs home (sleeps 8) with separate entrance, large deck, firepit, fenced dog area (no cats) and screened porch. Enjoy 360 degree views, large yard. Upstairs ideal for wedding couple, house for family/wedding party. Enjoy Asheville and relax around a fire! Minutes to Parkway,Biltmore House, Grove Park, downtown.

The space
There is a full kitchen to cook meals and washer/dryer upstairs and downstairs. There is 1 bedroom/1 bathroom upstairs. There are 4 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms downstairs. Both have Private entrance and porches. The house has a huge yard . It is a great place to enjoy family times or reconnecting with friends. Our cleaning specialist has cleaned all the details of the home thoroughly. We use air purifiers with uv lights, ozone cleaners and deep cleaning pro
neighborhood_overview: The views are amazing!  When the colors change you will enjoy them even more, especially while sitting by the fire.   It is close to everything you want to do in Asheville.
host_about: Hi!  We are Michael & Kerrie, and we have lived in Asheville almost 20 years.  He is a firefighter and I'm a computer geek.  We enjoy camping, concerts, and fun food like burgers and pizza.  His hobbies are riding his vintage dirt bike or his Harley.  Mine is gardening.  We love traveling and staying in airbnbs, having the place to ourselves.   We are looking forward to your visit and hope you enjoy the beautiful views while relaxing by the fire.

description:
Stealing Home!
True to its name, Stealing Home is the vacation equivalent to one of the coolest, most exciting plays in baseball, and is actually located just outside of the Asheville Tourists ballpark. As such, it is right in the heart of it all in downtown Asheville, making it possible to literally walk to everything and anything downtown!
Come create special Asheville memories in the heart of it all!

The space
Location:
Private, luxury townhome located in the new, upscale Bauhaus residences in downtown Asheville. You are about 15 minutes to Asheville Regional airport, and only 5 minutes to the gates of Biltmore Estate. You are also app. 15 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway, and easy access to everything in the WNC area. (2-car garage.)

Accommodations:
3 bedroom, 3 full ensuite baths, Powder Room Bath

name: The Haven.  Have it all...luxury/comfort/location
description:
Enjoy Asheville while staying in a charming historic 95 year old home in close in Montford, walking distance to downtown. Light and airy suite with private entrance, luxury modern furnishings, off street parking, large living room area and adjoining dining nook*, access to deck and lovely large yard (also shared with two energetic but friendly dogs), and a host who is always ready to help out when needed.

The space
Must love dogs! I have two sweet rescue pups that you will probably hear pitter-pattering on the floor above. You're also likely to encounter them in the yard too, so don't be surprised to find a nose pressed to the door hoping for an invitation to join you inside (the answer is NO! the apartment is a dog-free zone). If you want a bit more low key stay we can work out a schedule so you won't have to bump into them. I've also got a few birds that sometimes may give a yell, but as birds go they're pretty quiet most of the time. The outdoor bir
neighborhood_overview: Montford is quirky and eclectic with a diverse and friendly group of residents.  It has a tucked away feel with lots of trees and winding streets, you'll forget that you're just a few blocks from downtown.  The "locals" include resident bears and wild turkeys.  Must try 9Mile on Montford Ave (reservations help) for some great food.  The grits are amazing (trust me on this), if they don't run out before you get there.  I love the sound of the train whistle and the rumbling along the tracks at night--distant but still audible.
host_about: Recently relocated from the west coast and happy to be back in the South again.  All of my pets are well-loved rescues, and all of my friends say they want to come back in their next life as one of my pets.

Located just 5.5 miles away from downtown and 2.6 miles from the beautiful Blue Ridge Parkway, this 2-bedroom, 1-bath vacation rental gives you easy access to the charming history and natural beauty of North Carolina. Take a quick Uber downtown for some premier brewery hopping, or stay at home to birdwatch through the wall-to-wall windows while dinner cooks in the full kitchen.

The space
Central Location | Pet Friendly | Wireless Internet

Nestled in the Appalachian Mountains, this apartment provides seclusion while still accessible to downtown Asheville and is perfect for couples and families seeking a secluded weekend retreat.

name: *Comfy Smart Condo|10 mins to DT & Biltmore*
description:
All the amenities and luxuries of home while being ideally located to the best of Asheville! Make yourself at home with convenient features including 50" TVs in the living room and bedrooms, a fully-stocked kitchen, charger stations, blackout curtains, sound machines, smart locks, Amazon Echo, and books and games for your whole group!

The space
Make yourself at home in this 2 bedroom upstairs condo that sleeps 6. There are two bedrooms and two full bathrooms. The master bedroom includes a king bed, an en suite bathroom, a 50" smart TV, and blackout curtains. The 2nd bedroom has a King bed, a 50" smart TV, and plenty of extra amenities to make it a great stay. A full-sized sofa bed is available with linens for use as well.

This condo is the perfect place for your Asheville adventure! It is conveniently located 10 minutes to Downtown Asheville and The Biltmore House! Getting around town with Uber or Lyft is very reasonable, starting around $8.
neighborhood_overview: The Neighborhood is in a quiet, residential area only a few minutes away from the Blue Ridge Parkway, I-40, and I-240. There is an Ingles grocery store less than 1 mile away as well as multiple restaurants like Piazza, Nachos & Beer, Great Wall, and Subway.
host_about: Jon is a Realtor and Emily works in the mental health field.  We welcomed our first child into the world in October 2016. We've lived in North Carolina since 2011 and adore Asheville.

description:
Cozy single level home 1 mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway & only 7 mins to downtown Asheville! Set back from the main road on 10 acres, you'll have privacy & plenty of room to play outside. Three total bedrooms with a King, Queen & single/bunk bed combo (rated for adults up to 200lbs) share one full bath, fully equipped kitchen & living/dining area. Tons of parking, self-check in at your convenience, pets allowed with notice. Near VA Hospital, Folk Art Center, Warren Wilson College & Exit 55.

The space
Updated ranch style home on privately owned 10 acre property in quiet East Asheville neighborhood. You'll have access to the entire living space - Master bedroom with king sized bed, guest room with queen sized bed and third bedroom with 2 single beds and a lofted bunk (ok for adults up to 200 lbs). Pets allowed!

All contact surfaces throughly cleaned between guests with anti-bacterial and anti-viral products. This includes door handles, light switches,
neighborhood_overview: This house is located in the Riceville Rd neighborhood between the Blue Ridge Parkway and Warren Wilson College. It is about 1 mile from the VA Hospital and halfway between the popular tourist hotspots of downtown Asheville and Black Mountain. Tons of hiking, biking, fishing and drinking only 5-10 minutes drive away. Friendly, quiet neighbors so no large/loud parties please.
host_about: Hello! I was born and raised in Asheville, NC and love this town. An avid runner and hiker, you’ll often find me out exploring with my two German Shepherd dogs, Clyde and Khaleesi. Dave is an outdoorsman as well preferring to bring his mountain bike out to the trails or spend his days fly fishing in local rivers. He is a current guide with Asheville Fly Fishing Company should you want to book a casting trip while you’re in the area. We both enjoy local craft brew and the occasional night out at an area restaurant. Feel free to ask for recommendations!

name: Bent Creek Livin’
description:
Newly constructed guesthouse on the doorstep of Bent Creek Experimental Forest. Enjoy hikes and biking from the house! The Blue Ridge Parkway, NC Arboretum, shopping at the outlets, and floats on the French Broad River are a moments drive away. Enjoy the full kitchen, smart t.v. with Roku, and in-house stacked laundry unit. Plus, a high efficiency mini-split heat pump will keep the temperature just right. Finally, the place is yours...no shared walls or footsteps knocking overhead. Enjoy!

The space
Entire upstairs of detached garage building. The garage area is not accessible, however we, the homeowners next door, do not park in the garage so you will not hear the garage door going up and down. We do access the garage via a side entry door on occasion to grab tools, bikes, etc.

Guest access
Upstairs apartment, the garage below is homeowner’s storage.

name: "Suite" Record Room in walkable West Asheville
description:
New house construction with dedicated guest suite on 1st level, keyless door access with off street parking in great West Asheville location

The space
Located in the heart of West Asheville, come stay in this new cozy space providing everything you need for your get away. Queen bed, Record Player with Vinyl Collection for your listening pleasure. Smart TV with Netflix, WIFI, Work space/table and 2 chairs, coffee maker, filtered water, fridge and microwave. Outdoor table and chairs. Sidewalk to Haywood road.

Guest access
Private entrance with keyless digital keypad. Follow stepping stones to right side of house to access your suite.

Other things to note
Pisgah forest offers breathtaking views. You can cruise along the Blue Ridge parkway and venture closer via hike or mountain bike ride.
neighborhood_overview:
Check out the robust food scene in West Asheville. You are a short walk to many restaurants celebrating regional cuisine such as Sunny Pointe Cafe, Oyster House Brewing, The Admiral, BimBeriBon and Biscuit Head. West AVL is home to local coffee roasters, breweries and music venues. Some of our favorites are Bean Werks, One World West Brewing and Fleetwoods for live music.

name: Cabin of the Pines with Hot Tub
description:
Nature lovers dream house. Welcome to this custom uber-clean and private eco-home. If you want to see animals, dark skies and listen to sounds of nature, this is the place. Asheville is an incredible area to live. We are 3 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway, which has tremendous views and hiking access, not to mention the Folk Art Center right here in the valley. There are too many restaurants and breweries to even recommend them anymore.

The space
650 square foot eco cabin.
Private ozonated hot tub.
2 bedroom, 1 bathroom with shower.
Full kitchen with island and big windows.
Master with King bed, teak dresser, in-wall speakers and private deck access.
2nd bedroom with Queen bed and walk-in closet.
Washer/Dryer room.
In-wall sound w/ Bluetooth Amp. No TV.
Medium (+/- 30 lbs) Friendly, well-behaved dogs will be welcome for additional fee ($10/day). Dog door and dog fence area.

Guest access
neighborhood_overview:
We are half-way between Black Mountain and Asheville, 1000’ beneath the Blue Ridge Parkway. Our little unincorporated area is called Riceville. We have 5 churches, no stores or stoplights, and has a reasonably interesting history found by Googling "Riceville, NC history". This is the country, where people generally keep to themselves. It is normally very quiet with fantastic starry nights. There are children in the neighborhood, and you may occasionally hear them playing, 'ahh... the sounds of youth'.
To mention a few of the prominent neighbors, we have bear, coyote, bunnies, turkey, fox, skink, lightning bugs and frogs. There are many dogs in this holler. Generally, they keep the bears away. All of them are friendly with people, even if a bit vocal.
host_about:
My arrival in this valley was not coincidental. This quiet and sunny cove continues to inspire work in the renewable energy field.  I'm an active outdoorsman and lover of healthful and intentional living. Don't be surprised if you glance a yoga practice on the deck of our home nearby. 
My family and friends will always respect your privacy, and lend a hand in emergencies, that are beyond rare. The reviews say it all, and the feelings are mutual! Thanks for your confidence!

name: West Asheville Town Home for simple living
description:
A 2 bedroom, two story duplex condo in the heart of W Asheville. It is fully outfitted for extended stays. Grocery store, breweries and cafes all are within an easy walk. Downtown and River Arts District are about 2-3 miles, an easy drive, uber, or take the bus from a stop less than a block away. Avoid the bustle of downtown and enjoy the local feel of W Asheville. Great access to all the river and mountain adventures Western North Carolina has to offer. 30 day minimum required by local law.

The space
970 sqft of living space with fully outfitted kitchen, open dining/living area and 2 bedrooms upstairs with a Jack and Jill bathroom to share. The half bath is downstairs. You can also enjoy sitting outside on the porch. There are 2 parking spots assigned to the unit for your use.

Guest access
You will be able to access the entire place.
neighborhood_overview: Breweries, the French Broad River, Isis Music Hall, iconic Asheville restaurants such as Sunny Point Cafe, Nine Mile, Biscuit Head are all a nearby walk. host_about: I'm an avid traveler and airbnb user all around the world.  I love Asheville and the mountains.  It is a great place to visit or live!

description:
Bright, spacious and impeccably clean. Private one bedroom suite conveniently located in the desirable Haw Creek Neighborhood. Quick, easy access to downtown Asheville (4 miles), the Blue Ridge Parkway (2 miles), and Biltmore Estate (7 miles). In addition to location, nature and accessibility, you're minutes from a local neighborhood restaurant and coffee shop.

The space
Ideal for couples and business travelers, the guest suite has a private entrance with off street parking. Newly-renovated and well appointed, the one bedroom suite offers a queen sized high end Puffy mattress, quality linens and pillows, walk in closet and black out curtains. Easily regulate your preferred temperature with newly installed mini split heating and cooling system.

We follow CDC cleaning/sanitizing guidelines. All bedding, including blankets and quilts, are washed in hot water after each guest. Please inform us if you have any sensitivities to detergents or cleaners
neighborhood_overview: Nestled in a family oriented neighborhood in East Asheville, the suite is a 5-minute drive from Whole Foods and 10 minutes from the heart of downtown. Hike to the ocean from the mountains :)

Mother, creator, biker, yogi, NJ born, fortunate Asheville transplant.
My partner, Aims, who is co-hosting, is a WNC native who loves all things nature.  Previous airbnb host with over 300 5 star reviews.

name: 2 Adjacent Cottages on 4 Acres Close to Town
description:
Two cottages on adjacent properties near West Asheville, suitable for larger groups of up to 13 people. Each house is 2BR/1BA with a fold out couch in the living room. Cottage One features a pet friendly fully fenced yard on a quarter acre, able to sleep up to 7. Cottage Two features a delightful covered deck overlooking fields and forest with space for 6. Outdoors there are fire pits, 2 large grills, and paths through the forest. Fully appointed kitchens in each house. Parking for 6 or 7 cars.

The space
The two cottages are on adjacent properties and guests can easily walk between the two. Total of 8 beds in four bedrooms and 2 living areas. 12 minutes to Biltmore Estate and downtown Asheville, less than 10 minutes to West Asheville, NC Arboretum, Outlet Malls, Blue Ridge Pkwy. Lots of space for grilling, camp fires, and being outdoors. Pets only in Cottage One (green cottage), please.

Guest access
You will have access to all living areas
neighborhood_overview: We are one of very few listings in Asheville of 2 adjacent houses with full amenities and also dog friendly (green cottage only). Stand-alone short term rentals are not permitted in the City of Asheville. We are located a few feet outside of the City so we are 100% legit. We are located on the western edge of Asheville. Please note that parties and events are not allowed as per Air BnB policies.
host_about: We are the Mills Family from Asheville, North Carolina. Smithson works as an economic development consultant and Kathy is a media specialist in the local school system. After years of using Air BnB around the country, we decided to build a cottage on our property for guests who travel like we do. The cottage is designed for comfortable short-term stays, inspired by great experiences we had in homes from Portland, OR to NYC and many points in-between. We are looking forward to making your stay as enjoyable as possible!

description:
This private apartment with a walk out deck is located on the lower level of our new construction, Green Built home. Conveniently located in the Kenilworth neighborhood of Asheville, we are 1.5 miles from the Biltmore Estate entrance and 1.5 miles from downtown. We are near many local breweries, restaurants, and shops and have many great outdoor adventures nearby. Guests must be able to walk an exterior staircase to access apartment.

The space
The apartment is bright and spacious, and boasts your own deck space. Enter the apartment through your own private entrance, equipped with a keypad lock. The apartment has a kitchenette with a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, dishes, and utensils. The living room has a smart TV equipped with Hulu, Disney+, Prime Video, and an antenna (you may also sign into your favorite streaming services). The apartment also has a separate bedroom with a queen size memory foam mattress and a full bath with a large shower/tub.

name: Romantic Mountain Getaway with Private Hot Tub
description:
Beautiful, secluded chalet nestled in the Blue Ridge Mountains - this place is for those who want to escape into their own little world of passion. It's perfect for a honeymoon, anniversary or just reconnecting with a partner.

Rest in the luxurious king-size canopy bed, enjoy mountain forest views from your private hot tub, create a feast in our fully stocked gourmet kitchen. All this plus endless hiking trails off the Blue Ridge Parkway, minutes from downtown Ashville, the Biltmore Estate...

The space
Set on 1/2 an acre and less than 5 miles away from some of the best restaurants downtown Asheville has to offer, you’ll find everything you need in this first-class intimate retreat that features sensual art created by local artists, all of which is sure to stir something inside of you amidst surroundings that are as beautiful as they are quiet.

The chalet was designed for lovers and when not in use for our private couples Passionate Intimacy
neighborhood_overview:
The Beaverdam Lake area is one of the most highly sought out neighborhoods in Asheville. Although the chalet is a mere 2.5 miles from shops, restaurants, and groceries, and only 5 miles from downtown Asheville, you will feel like you are living way out in the country, surrounded by mountains and trees.

You are also literally minutes away from the Blue Ridge Parkway and miles of hiking trails.
host_about:
Hello!  My name is Xanet and I love living  in Asheville. I recently moved here from the west coast (though I have NY roots) and am thrilled to be back in the East.  Asheville is a gem of place and I am so grateful to have found a beautiful secluded property where I get to kick back and enjoy nature all the time.  I am very low key and will stay out of your way (you are here for a romantic get away after all!).

Professionally  I'm a relationship and intimacy coach and best selling author of Living an Orgasmic Life: Heal Yourself and Awaken Your Pleasure.  My Airbnb is also the home of my private couples weekend and weeklong Passionate Intimacy Retreats (you can look that up on line).  I  also offer mini-retreats to my Airbnb guests.  If that interests you, please connect via my website.

I look forward to hosting you!

description:
Our Asheville cottage is located near everything that makes your mountain experience matter. The cozy mountain retreat sits at the edge of Pisgah Forrest and is only a 10-minute ride to the downtown micro-brews and restaurants.
Enjoy the back porch and expansive yard. Need more space? We are only 1.5 miles away from Bent Creek Park and the NC Arboretum. Not enough ? You're only 5 minutes from The Blue Ridge Parkway, outlet shopping and great restaurants! The mountains are calling!

The space
Your Blue Ridge Mountain getaway is located on an oversized lot with large trees, garden flowers and a back porch sitting area. While the cottage is in a neighborhood near some of Asheville’s best restaurants, shopping and sights, the outdoor space invites you to pull up a chair and enjoy our cool evenings under Southern stars. FULLY EQUIPPED KITCHEN!
Our indoor space is newly renovated top-to-bottom and has hardwood flooring throughout as well as tastef
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is located in a quiet neighborhood on the edge of Pisgah Forrest but near great restaurants, the interstate and downtown.  While the house sits on a large private lot , we do have neighbors.  The road up to the house is low traffic.
host_about:
I enjoy adventure travel and active getaways.  This led me to Asheville and Western Carolina back in the 90’s.  Since then I’ve hosted people who enjoy similar  experiences both here at our Asheville homes and in other parts of Eastern Tennessee and Western North Carolina. 
I enjoy pedaling, picking (guitar) and burying myself in the mountains - wherever they are. Pisgah is obviously my favorite but I could just as well be found in the Cascades or in Southwestern Colorado and Utah. 

Our cottages are a reflection of what we love and what makes us comfortable.  We hope you’ll find them super accommodating !  

Don’t forget to bring your bike and boots !

name: West Asheville Artist's Sanctuary
description:
Charming artist retreat in the heart of West Asheville. A light-filled, uplifting atmosphere with colorful, whimsical decor and an expansive back deck for sunsets and libations. This is the perfect place to relax, recharge and reset. 25 min. walk to Haywood Rd. and West Asheville's restaurants, breweries, stores, and more! 5 minute drive to Downtown Asheville, Biltmore Estate, River Arts District, The Arboretum, farmer's markets, and the French Broad. EZ access to frwys & anywhere in WNC!

The space
French provincial brick, built in 1925, restored in 2015. Lush and beautiful front garden, filled with colorful flowers and indigenous plants. There is a large back deck with patio furniture and string lights for a peaceful evening under the stars.
The guests have access to the entire main house ~ living room, dining room, sunroom and large outdoor deck.
The basement apartment is Not included.
Because the City of Asheville requires that AirBnB hosts

host_about:
Elizabeth ~ I am a yoga/meditation teacher and wellness coach.  I have 12 years experience working in spa hospitality at a high end, luxury resort in Laguna Beach, CA.  I have also traveled to Thailand where I learned Thai massage.  I am happy to offer any and all of those services to my guests upon request.  You may go home feeling relaxed, refreshed, restored and better than Ever!
Nikolas ~ I am a Swedish artist/elf and creator of unique, whimsical art and home accessories; mostly made of wood and painted in bright, happy colors.  My work is available for purchase from my home and onsite workshop.  Perhaps you'd like to take home an original piece of handmade artwork to brighten Your world and to remind you of your trip to beautiful Asheville!

Our home is a pleasant indoor space with a number of outdoor seating areas. There is a comfortable king-sized bed and a kitchen area with a small refridgerator, microwave, and coffee maker.

I love Asheville and can't wait for you to experience our great town! I live in the downstairs of 415 Red Gate and my co-managers Ben and Celeste and I look forward to offering you a hospitable stay. 

I love Asheville's food, music, and social scene. Whether you're looking for haute cuisine or the best-kept secret local spots, I can point you in the right direction.

Ben and Celeste are knowledgeable about the outdoor scene and can offer suggestions for biking, hiking, paddle sports, and climbing.

name: Modern Cabin Retreat
description:
This space was designed with love and care and the hope that all who stay here feel relaxed and connected to nature. Since this is for longer term stays, we expect we'll get to know one another a bit but are by no means pushy or nosy. We live "next door" on the same property with our 4-yr-old and 2-yr-old sons who are often in the back yard but are not allowed to go onto the porch or in the general vicinity of the cabin when there are guests. Common fire pit between the cabin and our house.

The space
The bedroom has no door and is an open air space lofted above the kitchen. There is a reading nook with a twin mattress and a very comfortable sleeper sofa downstairs. Space is available for 30 minimum, 90 day maximum.
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is a 3 minute drive to Haywood Rd in West Asheville which has no shortage of nightlife, restaurants, coffee shops, book stores and the world's greatest record shop. Downtown is 10 minutes away but if you fancy walking our neighborhood has ample sidewalks and an amazing greenway that leads to some pretty crucial zones.
host_about: My husband and I moved to Asheville from Chicago in December of 2010.  Can't live without live music, records, gettaways and our tent.  We love Airbnb and all the unique spaces we have found to stay using this site, including a barn in West Virginia and a treehouse in Santa Cruz!  Hope we see you soon!
