name: Mountain View & Hot tub at “Blue Bird” Cottage
description:
Blue Bird Cottage is our newest Airbnb. Nestled in Reeves Cove just outside Asheville city limits. Less than 20 minutes to downtown Asheville or Biltmore Estate this is a uber friendly location. Hiking trails about 1 mile away.

Relax and take in the mountain views from our relaxing hot tub or covered porch as well as living room & Master.

Need more space? Rent together with one of our other on site Airbnb's.

The space
The house has two bedrooms and two full bathrooms. Fully stocked kitchen for those who like to stay in a cook their meals. Gas grill and hot tub.

Open main living area with electric fireplace and smart tv. Take in the lovely mountain views from either our covered porch or large open deck.

All this less than 20 minutes to the heart of downtown Asheville and the Biltmore Estate.

We are pet friendly with a $25 pet fee added after booking.

Guest access
Guests w
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in Reeves Cove our property overlooks the mountains of Pisgah National Forest. We have 4 acres with three Airbnb properties on it. There is a forest trail head just 1 mile away for hiking, biking, running. Grocery stores are 5 minutes away, Asheville Outlet mall is less than 10 minutes. Downtown and Biltmore house are 20 minutes.
While best to have your own car our location is Uber friendly.
host_about: I am the mother to three super active kiddos ages 17, 14 & 12. We are super active people who enjoy running, bike riding, hiking and any other outdoor play we can find.  We live just "over the mountain" (3 miles by roads) from the houses so I am available to assist when necessary.  I have been hosting for Airbnb since Nov. 2015 and love it! I am also a Realtor in Asheville at Preferred Properties.

description:
Pristine, brand new and completely private, this over-sized loft studio was just completed in May, 2020. Be among the first to experience your own designer sanctuary nestled among the mature trees and rolling hills of AVL's premier neighborhood. Secluded, quiet and serene, but just minutes to downtown, it is the perfect Asheville escape. World class hiking, walk to Beaver Lake, minutes from the Biltmore, Grove Park Inn and famous breweries. Luxury truly meets nature and it's ALL BRAND NEW!

The space
The rental is a ground level, loft like, luxuriously appointed space. The bedroom area is separated, but intentionally not wholly enclosed. The dwelling has two units, the upper one owner occupied and the lower is the guest space.

Guest access
The entire guest space is completely private with no shared spaces.

Other things to note
The oven is a large toaster oven. In addition, there is a 12 inch Presto skillet that roast
neighborhood_overview: The space is located in a wonderful, quiet neighborhood close to Beaver Lake and the University of North Carolina Asheville. It's approximately 1 mile from the freeway,  and a 7 minute drive to downtown Asheville.
host_about: I love living in Asheville and hope to get the opportunity to host you as you explore and enjoy this beautiful spot on the Blue Ridge Parkway.  My  studio is permitted by the city and I am committed to our "Asheville Pledge" to take all the extra precautions to offer you a safe space by following the recommended public health guidelines and being respectful to my guests and everyone I meet.   See you soon!

name: Cane Creek Valley Swim-Soak-Stay w/pool, hot tub
description:
Swim in the private pool May-October; soak in the hot tub year round! Relax in tastefully decorated private, lower-level guest quarters in a serene mountain setting 9 miles from Asheville. Minutes to the airport, it's the perfect base camp from which to explore the Biltmore, Blue Ridge Parkway, hiking, waterfalls, NC Arboretum, and local restaurants. Enjoy complimentary coffee bar and s'mores by the fire pit; play games in the 1-acre yard; watch free premium TV channels on 3 TVs; free internet.

The space
Our 850 sq. ft. guest quarters has a spacious living/dining area and kitchenette outfitted with dishwasher, counter-height fridge, microwave, large electric griddle, InstaPot Duo Novo, CrockPot, electric skillet, and a complimentary Keurig coffee/tea bar with K-cups, tea bags, creamer, sweetner, and cocoa for the kids.

Sleep comfortably in a king-size Sleep Number bed in the larger bedroom, or on twin beds with pillow-top mattresses in the smaller bed
neighborhood_overview: The Cane Creek Valley is arguably one of the most beautiful areas in western NC. It is super convenient as a "base camp" from which to explore the many amenities the region has to offer, from the restaurants and shops of Asheville and Hendersonville, to the waterfalls of Brevard and trails off the Blue Ridge Parkway.  The 1.5 acre property where the apartment is located is level, open, and commands a view of Burney Mountain that changes with the seasons, the time of day,  and the weather. Rise early enough in the morning and you'll see the whisps of "smoke" and fog that give the Smoky Mountains their name. In the evening, experience the golden glow as the sun goes down, and enjoy a crackling fire from the comfort of Adirondack chairs.  It's easy, relaxed mountain living at its finest! The neighborhood where we are located is also fairly level and perfect for a walk or jog. Fletcher Park is just minutes away, for longer walks, runs, and safe bicycling.
host_about:
My husband Larry is a former TV news anchor and I was a Communications Director for our local school system before we became Realtors in western NC. We've lived here since 2005 and love life in the Smoky Mountains. We also love introducing the lifestyle, sights, and amenities here to our clients and to the guests who stay in our "Cane Creek Valley Swim-Soak-Stay" guest quarters.

We love to travel around the country and overseas every chance we get, so we know what travelers need and appreciate during a stay away from home.  

We have four adult children and four grandchildren spread out across the U.S., but our current "children" are our two beloved pups, Toby the Cairn Terrier and Greta the rescue pup, who form the "doggie welcoming committee."

We love meeting new people and exploring new places. We treat others the way we would like to be treated, and welcome strangers as friends.  We're non-smokers, and expect our guests to be, too. Most of all, we want our guests to have fun,  create great memories, and come back soon!

Use The Lodge at Asheville West as your base station to explore everything that makes Asheville a destination.

The space
Welcome to the Lodge at Asheville West. You are greeted by a wide wood porch, supported by century old log columns. A porch big enough to enjoy your rocking chair Mountain View. Enter into the grand living room, conveniently separated into 2 different areas, 1 for Media and one for conversation around the rock-faced fireplace (with remote control gas logs). From there enter the generous dining room with seating for 10. Our kitchen has a gas 6 burner chef's stove. On the opposite side of the ho
neighborhood_overview: The Lodge at Asheville West is the original structure on the land that now is home to the private community of Asheville West. There is some current construction going on in the development, but they are respectful about the times they are working.

name: Celia's Retreat I Convenient to Asheville I Pet Friendly w/ fenced yard - 4 Bedroom, 3 Bathroom
description:
Perfect house for a mountain getaway with convenient location to downtown Asheville. Less than 10 minutes to Downtown Asheville, Celia's Retreat is ideally located near I-40, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and the Biltmore Estate.

The space
Perfect house for a mountain getaway with convenient location to downtown Asheville. The central portion of the house was built in 1922 as a small log cabin and has evolved and been remodeled over the years. Now Celia's Retreat features four bedrooms and three, beautiful full baths with granite and tile. This home as all of the comforts of home, while still retaining that rustic mountain charm.

The grounds are simply spectacular with a large backyard with beautiful plants and landscaping. There's a fenced in yard with over an acre for your pet to roam and explore. Kids will love the large playhouse with electricity, and a swing in the old oak tree. The rear of the property backs up to the National Forest with The Mountai
neighborhood_overview:
Greybeard Rentals manages vacation rentals and vacation cabins in Asheville, Black Mountain, Montreat, Old Fort and surrounding areas. Located 10-15 minutes from downtown Asheville, Black Mountain is a quaint town with many great shopping options, delicious restaurants, breweries and access to hiking trails and wilderness areas. TripAdvisor named Black Mountain one of America’s Prettiest Towns in 2017.

Asheville is home to award-winning restaurants, stunning mountain views with access to areas like the Blue Ridge Parkway, The Biltmore Estate, and a variety of local art and culture. Oh, and did we mention Asheville has had the record for having more breweries per capita than any other U.S. city? We held the title for Beer City USA in 2009. Hiking trails are also located throughout western North Carolina.
host_about:
Joined Airbnb in 2018.

Established in 1999, Greybeard Rentals is proud to share with you the finest Asheville Cabins and vacation rentals in Black Mountain, Montreat and the surrounding Asheville area. Each of our North Carolina Vacation Rentals is fully equipped and lovingly furnished by the owner. We're proud of each vacation home we manage, selecting only those we would be excited to vacation in ourselves.

With more than 200 North Carolina vacation rentals available, Greybeard offers a variety of options. From in-town bungalows to remote Asheville NC cabins on top of the world, we can assist you with the perfect vacation home. We rent homes for the weekend, week, month or year.

name: Cozy Cottage Mini Suite - Heart of West Asheville
description:
Our cozy cottage mini suite is in the heart of West Asheville, walkable to some of the best restaurants, coffee shops and stores in the neighborhood.

1 minute walk to Oyster House Brewing, and Sunny Point Cafe, 8 minutes from downtown by car, 10 minutes from Biltmore Estate by car.

For being so close to everything, it's also tucked away off the main road for a peaceful rest at the end of a day of exploration.

It's perfect if you want to be near everything but have a private comfortable stay.

The space
The cozy cottage suite is a private room with its own bathroom attached to our home with its own private entrance, easily accessible from our driveway. It's equipped with all of the essentials for you to have a convenient stay.

The entrance is secured with a keyless keypad. The room is perfect for couples or solo travelers, and you can come and go as you please.

The comfy premium hotel-like bed helps provide a
neighborhood_overview:
Itto Ramen, right by us has the best ramen in town, and Sunny Point, next door has some of the best brunch! I also love Dobra Tea, and Early Girl Eatery, right down the street.

My favorite coffee shop in this neighborhood is Izzys Coffee, located towards the end of Haywood Road.

There's an Ingles grocery store 3 minutes walk from here for any of your snack needs.
host_about: Hello! I'm a writer and world traveler. 5 of my favorite things are: reading, coffee, driving around exploring new cities, meeting great people and day hikes. Some of my favorite travel destinations include: the Philippines, France and Brazil. As far as books and movies go, I absolutely love anything by Murakami (and have a ton of other favorite authors too!) and I love foreign films, dramas, a good comedy now and then, and something really thought provoking. I love eating healthy vegetarian cuisine (with some unhealthy stuff for a treat now and then) and I love yoga. As a guest, I'm very respectful of the people I stay with, and their home. I'm a fairly quiet person, but I also really enjoy good conversation and being social. My life motto would be: Be kind. I love a good adventure!

name: Rendezvous By Riverside Park - Entire House!
description:
Stylish House right at the edge of the River Arts District in North Asheville. Very conveniently located within 10 minutes away from Downtown, West Asheville, River Arts District, and The Asheville Mall. Only a few minute walk away from the planned Silverline Park that is along the French Broad River.

Guest access
You will have access to the entire house during your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
This house is at the edge of the very popular River Arts District. The River Arts District (RAD) is Asheville's latest and largest project to expand and promote tourism. This is a very old historic and industrial area that is being gentrified where old industrial buildings are being repurposed into chic-industrial themed upscale restaurants, art galleries, breweries, and other small local businesses.

While many different patches scattered around this area have been renovated there are many places that haven't yet or are still going through the process. This River Arts District still looks very old, and industrial. Some guests have been put off by the area and have expressed concerns that it may seem or feel unsafe due to it being an old historic area with industrial buildings. However, that can't be further from the truth. This is a very safe area and is quickly becoming another one of Asheville's most popular destinations for upscale foods, drinks, salons, and other local
host_about: I have been staying in Asheville since 1997 when I moved here during my primary school years. The food and the craft beer here are among the best and it's the perfect size without being too packed with heavy traffic.  I also love to travel, especially overseas. I mainly travel for food, with sightseeing and other events being secondary. I've been to Canada, Mexico, England, Italy, France, Netherlands, Japan, Hong Kong, and China. I am also fluent in English, Mandarin, and Cantonese.

name: Private guest suite, walk to Biltmore village!
description:
Revel in the Ashevillian lifestyle at this tranquil, private, COZY guest suite. Walk (~1 mile) to Historic Biltmore Village to discover an array of breweries, restaurants, and shops. The suite is a part of a renovated and cherished century-old family home. Enter your small eclectic suite via your private porch with mountain views. Relax inside the bright and comfy bedroom complete with a kitchenette. Adjoining the bedroom is your private, newly remodeled bathroom. This has everything you need!

The space
You can expect a cozy but spotless Airbnb with all the amenities of home. Extra pillows, blankets, sheets, toiletries will all be available. Enjoy coffee each morning from your private deck.

A quick drive to everything Asheville:
~3 minutes to Biltmore Village
~5 minutes to Mission Hospital
~7 minutes to Downtown
~8 minutes to the River Arts District
~12 minutes to the "local's downtown" West Asheville

Guest acce
neighborhood_overview: Biltmore Village is walking distance at less than a mile away.  Walk to breweries and restaurants galore. Our neighborhood is very safe and quiet but minutes from anything you could want. Many families, walkers, and  runners use the neighborhood streets for an evening stroll.
host_about: I am a frequent traveler who exclusively stays at local Airbnbs. I am so excited to host you for your stay in Asheville. My wife, baby boy, and I love to adventure outdoors, especially to lakes and rivers. Please ask for recommendations if you want ideas for restaurants, shopping, adventuring, or any other local tips.

name: Beautiful home mountain views 10 minutes from DT
description:
Come experience our warm and welcoming hospitality in the beautiful mountains of Asheville, just 10 minutes from downtown yet, a world away. We are 17 time super-hosts and our beautiful home is clean, comfortable and well appointed. The bedrooms are very large with private bath, great beds, walk in closets and lots of room to relax and enjoy. Come share a glass of wine on our deck with mountain views or make friends with one of our 3 lovable boxers!

The space
We live in a small private neighborhood with only 22 beautiful houses and are surrounded by trees. The neighborhood is extremely safe and walkable, as we know all of our neighbors. The house has tons of space but is comfortable and welcoming. Sit by the fireplace and join us for wine or check out the mountain views from our deck.
Only one vehicle per stay is allowed.
neighborhood_overview: Small private wooded neighborhood area with few houses and safe streets to walk
host_about: We have been together for over 13 years now… Legally married for 5… We have 3 boxers and love to travel,  cook, share good wine and have people stay in our home! Come stay with us!

name: Victoria's Cottage in the Paris of the South
description:
Located on the side of peaceful Pisgah mountains away from city conglomeration, Victoria's Cottage makes the perfect place for a small getaway. It is also only minutes away from the city giving you the freedom to explore some of Asheville's most popular locations.
A full modern kitchen, a full bathroom with freestanding bathtub, shaver, washer and dryer, well designed bedroom with a touch of Paris, and a TV with Wi-Fi, NETFLIX. A parking space, reserved for one vehicle.
See you soon!

The space
Cozy, roomy and well furnished, this large apartment is perfect for a single person or for a couple looking to explore Hendersonville, Asheville or the surrounding WNC Mountains. You can cook your own meals in the new full kitchen or eat at one of the local West Asheville restaurants.
A parking space is reserved for one vehicle.

Guest access
Fire pit outside+woods
Gas Grill
A Parking spot for a car in the Garage
neighborhood_overview: Start your morning with the invigorating aroma of fresh coffee, or a tea with a fresh clean water from the mountain well then pursue through the quiet neighborhood. If you're lucky, you' ll catch a family of deer crossing through our backyard. You can also say hi to the horses at the farm down the street.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Moldova. My family and I moved to the United States in 2010, and became naturalized citizens in 2016. For many reasons, Asheville charmed us. Its beautiful, peaceful, and naturally home-y atmosphere, so we decided to settle here. I graduated from AB-Tech Community College as a Dental Assistant in 2014. From my first day of assisting , one of the first things I noticed was that I love to take diligent care of patients.

I also love spending quality time with my family and strive to be the best wife for my husband and loving mom to my precious children. I enjoy reading books, hiking, decorating the house to be cozy. I also love cooking tasty recipes for my family :) Making creative things with my hands is one of my dearest hobbies -- which helped me to warm up Victoria's Cottage.

description:
Cozy up in our new construction cottage! Enjoy unparalleled access to the city's offerings while falling asleep in a quiet, wooded neighborhood. Relax on the covered porch and back patio morning and evening, or stretch your legs in the open-concept main level. You're only minutes away from downtown, Biltmore Estate, and all of Asheville's most popular attractions.

The space
This house was built with the guest experience in mind. Comfort and style abound to calm the weary traveller. We're obsessive about cleanliness and making sure you have everything you need! Guest access
The place is all yours! Just please be respectful to the neighbors.

host_about: I enjoy meeting new people and showing them all the reasons why Asheville is the place to be!  Hospitality is what I know, and is the field I love and work in.

name: Mountain Bike and Family Fun Zone in Bent Creek!
description:
Great house in the best family/mountain biking neighborhood in Asheville. Head to the park 300 yards down the hill to play the pumptrack, let the kids rage on the swings and climbing features, and have a beer with the locals. Continue into the Bent Creek trail network and around 90 miles of high quality beginner/intermediate riding and a few excellent advanced trails. 5 Minutes to Blue Ridge Parkway, NC Arboretum and French broad river. 15 minutes to Biltmore or to the heart of Asheville.

The space
This lovely, lived-in house with a large fenced yard (good dogs welcome to stay) is located in one of the best areas of Asheville for family fun.

**Please be aware that the cell service is terrible here**
We have high speed wifi through cable internet that you can connect to (and use wifi calling, which is what we do), but calling over the cell network on most carriers is not reliable at the house.

Please also note that the horses in the ne
neighborhood_overview:
Bent Creek is the best family/mountain biking neighborhood in Asheville, if not on the planet. Head to the park 300 yards down the hill to play the pumptrack, let the kids rage on the swings and climbing features, and have a beer with the locals. Continue from there into the Bent Creek trail network, Lake Powhatan and around 90 miles of high quality beginner/intermediate riding and a few excellent advanced trails.
5 Minute drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway, NC Arboretum and French broad river for tubing, fishing, canoeing and kayaking.
15 minutes to Biltmore or to the heart of Asheville for tasty brews, delectable foods and our thriving music and art scene.
host_about: I'm a full time Airbnb host and general contractor who has lived in the Asheville area for almost 30 years. When I'm not answering messages on Airbnb or pounding on things with a hammer, I'm out enjoying the local whitewater rivers and hiking trails.

name: Foxglove Cottage - a Charming West Asheville Oasis
description:
This adorably decorated shabby chic cottage is nestled in a quiet neighborhood within walking distance to New Belgium Brewing and Green way, Taco Billy and The French Broad River. Bike or walk across the bridge to charming River Arts District. Perfect for travelers looking to enjoy a serene garden cottage while having easy access to all the city has to offer. Foxglove Cottage boasts a large fenced in yard, outdoor fire pit, gas grill, hand built pizza oven and brand new front porch.

The space
Foxglove Cottage is fully stocked with everything you need to feel at home including high speed internet, cable, linens and towels, and plentiful cooking supplies. Please note that as this is a 30 day rental, the cottage will be stocked with enough breakfast goodies and household products for the first few days of your stay, but guests are responsible for procuring these items for the remainder of the month. The cottage has two bedrooms with queen sized beds, plus a queen si
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is incredibly walkable with New Belgium, Archetype Brewing and Urban Orchard Cider Co. just 5 minutes away. Also within the five-minute range is The Admiral (one of Asheville's best dinner restaurants) Early Girl Eatery, The Hop ice cream shop, Hole Donuts, Pizza Mind, Ghan Shan and Owl Bakery. Taco Billy is a 2-minute walk away. Ashtanga Yoga, Point Acupuncture and Apothecary, Flora Plant and Coffee shop and Harvest Records are all minutes away. You can also walk across the bridge in 10-minutes to get to the River Arts district which is full of Artist studios, bars and restaurants. For nature lovers, the French Broad River has nearby access points for kayaking, stand up paddle boarding and floating the river. The Greenway begins at New Belgium and is lovely for taking a walk or riding a bike. For bike rentals visit Mustasheville in the River Arts District. The Crown Plaza Resort golf course is a 7-minute drive away.
host_about:
Hello! I adore the charming, eccentric, creative, outdoorsy city of Asheville so much that sharing it with other people is a true passion for me. I have been an Airbnb host since October 2019 and have hosted people from all over the world. I love connecting with travelers and providing insight on the nuances of this vibrant city, while doing everything I can to make your stay in Asheville a phenomenal one. I'm always available via phone or the app and am happy to answer any and all questions you have!  

I love to cook and eat, so many of my recommendations revolve around food. I'm guessing if you are visiting Asheville for the first time you were probably drawn in by the food and/or beer scene, so we already have something in common! I also have lots of ideas on fun things to do in Asheville, there is always something interesting going on! Thanks so much for reading about me, I look forward to meeting you!
Best wishes, Christy

host_about:
Hello,

We are Mike and Cate and we have been AirBnb Superhosts since 2016. We fell in love with the mountains and lakes of Western North Carolina and love being able to share this area with others! We maintain an extremely high standard for cleanliness and guest experience and value the years of reviews and input from our guests. We are incredibly grateful to have many repeat guests who trust us to provide the best accommodations for their mountain vacations, time and time again.

Please read details before booking! Our shared homestay is a 2.5 block walk to the popular South Slope + 5 blocks to downtown. Everything under 'Neighborhood' below is walking distance. You've found a beautiful gem here with handcrafted gardens + courtyard. This spacious bedroom is 1 of 4 & has a mountain view, queen bed, desk, plenty of floor space & closet. name: Bohemian Paradise Nestled in the Trees
description:
Welcome to your bohemian paradise nestled in the treetops of desirable Kenilworth neighborhood! *Please note this is a 30 day rental. * This 3 bedroom 2 bathroom home is full of warmth and light. It boasts a large fenced-in backyard, 2 porches, a spacious living and dining room, fully equipped kitchen, brick fireplace, comfortable beds and lots of good energy. The trees surrounding this home give it a remote, treehouse feel yet you are minutes away from downtown Asheville and Biltmore village.

The space
This home is entirely yours, you have access to the front and back yards, porches and the entire interior of the home. Enjoy lounging in the cozy living room next to the brick fireplace or soak up golden hour on the back porch. There is a gas grill and 4 seat table on the porch for al fresco dining. The front yard is home to blueberry bushes and a fig tree. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need for home cooking. The back bathroom hosts a new washe
neighborhood_overview:
Kenilworth is a lovely, quiet neighborhood located in between Biltmore Avenue and Tunnel Road. You can walk down to Biltmore village in 10 minutes, south slope in 15 and downtown Asheville in 30. Drive anywhere in central Asheville in 5-10 minutes. Quickly get on 240 via Tunnel Road. This forested neighborhood is known to have bears, foxes, and wild turkeys roaming through backyards and across roads. Wake up to birdsong and rustling leaves. This peaceful neighborhood is the perfect place for visitors looking for a peaceful escape while being close to everything.

Easily walk to tons of Asheville’s favorite places. There are 3 parking spots at the house for your use. If you drive to the downtown area, plan to pay for parking before 6pm on weekdays. There is the ART bus line that stops on biltmore Avenue and within Kenilworth neighborhood. You can walk to a stop in about 5 minutes.
host_about:
Hello! I adore the charming, eccentric, creative, outdoorsy city of Asheville so much that sharing it with other people is a true passion for me. I have been an Airbnb host since October 2019 and have hosted people from all over the world. I love connecting with travelers and providing insight on the nuances of this vibrant city, while doing everything I can to make your stay in Asheville a phenomenal one. I'm always available via phone or the app and am happy to answer any and all questions you have!  

I love to cook and eat, so many of my recommendations revolve around food. I'm guessing if you are visiting Asheville for the first time you were probably drawn in by the food and/or beer scene, so we already have something in common! I also have lots of ideas on fun things to do in Asheville, there is always something interesting going on! Thanks so much for reading about me, I look forward to meeting you!
Best wishes, Christy

name: The Cozy Cove. Private Guest Suite
description:
Quiet, private, clean, comfortable, bedroom suite in a chill but slightly quirky neighborhood in West Asheville, with convenient off street parking. Private entry, private bath, walk in closet, queen bed, breakfast nook, sleeper sofa, and a generously appointed kitchen cart. Covid conscious enhanced cleaning protocols are implemented between each guest stay. Social distancing is expected in all common areas.

The space
Convenient digital entry lock with deadbolt for added security, free and fast WiFi, home roasted organic coffee with a variety of coffee paraphernalia, microwave, refrigerator, and toaster oven. Also, there's a walk in closet with ample hanging space. Whether you're here to stacay, vacay, connect with family or friends, or strictly for business, this space is thoughtfully designed to fit your needs.

Conveniently located less than two miles from downtown Asheville, the River Arts District, The French Broad River Greenway, and the popular
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is populated with the people that make this town such a great place to live and visit, with it's eclectic and diverse array of talents, occupations, and personalities. The guest suite is within walking distance of multiple award winning restaurants and breweries, and nestled comfortably between the River Arts District and the popular Haywood West End. The whole area is pedestrian and pedal friendly, as well.
host_about: Hey, I'm Patrick. I'm a parent, a public school teacher, and a nature lover. I've lived in Asheville for nearly 10 years, and in western North Carolina for almost 20 years. I love this area and this town, even with it's flaws and growing pains. I enjoy exploring and witnessing natural beauty,  cooking and experiencing good food, quality conversation, and meeting new people.

name: Heavens View-of the Beautiful Asheville Mountains
description:
Peaceful bonus room apartment available for a restful getaway. Great views of the North Carolina Blue Ridge mountains and downtown Asheville. The entertainment options are endless. Downtown Asheville with all its local restaurants, iconic attractions, and musical venues are only 5 minutes away. The famous Biltmore House is a 15 minute drive or you could hike one of the many trials near the Blue Ridge Parkway. The comfortable accommodations include a Japanese style bathroom.

The space
Your space includes a window seat and table with beautiful views of Mount Pisgah and a seating area to enjoy your morning coffee. You'll have your own microwave and mini fridge for snacks and a cold drink.

Guest access
Guests will have their own entrance into a breezeway that leads to a sweet get away featuring some of the best views in Western North Carolina. The private room has a sitting area with a view downtown Asheville and window seat complete with
neighborhood_overview: Heavenly Mountain Retreat is located in a small private community with lots of nature all around.  Bear and deer sightings are a regular occurrence but there are restaurants within 2 miles of the home.
host_about:
My name is Donna.  I have helped my parents over the years to rent out 2 of their mountain homes and we enjoyed it so much that my husband and I decided to build a room to rent out in our new home in Asheville.  The space ended up to be a perfect weekend getaway with great views of the mountains and downtown  Asheville.  

We're a family that enjoys traveling both  throughout North America and internationally.  We have family in Japan and Canada and have enjoyed using Airbnb around the world.  It's a great way to visit different areas and get a more personal feel of the real life there.

name: 2 BEDROOM   about a mile from middle of downtown!
description:
Our apt is only a mile from the middle of downtown. Many people just drive and park for the day or evening in a parking garage for $5 to $10 and walk all around. Also, some take a taxi or Uber for a few bucks and do the same. You can walk to downtown from the in the daytime.
Spacious 1000 square feet Eclectic two bedroom including King Bed in the one bedroom and a Queen Bed in the 2nd bedroom. There is a custom tile shower.

The space
Enjoying downtown Asheville. . Lots of pillows for a comfortable, laid-back experience! The entire apt. is decorated with area art, books, and unique furnishings candles, , natural soap available for you to wind down after a great day sightseeing, hiking or
There is a 45”inch TV with DVD in the living room with a fold out memory foam mattress and a table with seating for 4. Some movies are provided and we have full cable in the home and very high speed wireless WIFI. An electric fireplace keeps you toasty while yo
neighborhood_overview: It is a quite a small neighborhood with a mile  long circle that is very wooded and only about 15 houses in the area. But it is only about 1 mile from downtown.
host_about:
I am a 4th generation native of Asheville, NC. I am a nurse and a vegan chef. I have 5 vacation rentals that I have been hosting for the past 6 years. I also own Advantage Care Services. Advantage is a home care company that provides in-home aid to those in need. I love yoga and I am an artist who works with watercolor. I enjoy being a host. I have met a wonderful variety of people from all over the world and many walks of life who have stayed at my homes over the years. 

"Be the change you want to see in the World" Gandhi

name: Walk to Downtown! 3 Bedroom, 2.5 Bathroom Home.
description:
House in the Montford neighborhood, just a 15-minute walk to downtown Asheville. Open floor plan, high ceilings, 1,500+ sq ft with lots of light. Modern mountain feel with a beautiful wood burning fireplace and tasteful original art works. The kitchen is fully equipped (all large and small appliances), washer/dryer, and three TVs throughout. This home is perfect for families or anyone wanting a spacious, private, and comfortable getaway in Asheville, NC. Walk to restaurants!

The space
This craftsman home was built in 2010. High ceilings and large windows - it is bright, airy, and open. Includes a large front porch, a back deck overlooking a lush green canopy, and a Juliette balcony off of the master suite.

Note, the basement apartment is used occasionally by the owners. The owners use a separate entrance at the back of the house. There are no common areas or shared surfaces.

COVID: We have implemented the cleaning protocol set by our county
neighborhood_overview:
Location Location Location! We are located in the Montford neighborhood a short walk to downtown Asheville. The neighborhood represents homes of many architectural styles, many of which were constructed in the late 1800s and early 1900s. A portion of Montford is a Nationally Registered Historic District.

There are three neighborhood eateries, which include Nine Mile (Caribbean cuisine), Chiesa (rustic Italian), and All Day Darling (casual breakfast/lunch/dinner).

The Asheville Visitor's Center is in Montford and only a 5-minute walk from our house.

New Belgium Brewery and River Arts District (RAD) are less than 2 miles away, West Asheville is 3 miles, and Biltmore Estate is about 5 miles down the road.
host_about:
We. Love. Asheville.

We have lived in Asheville for over 11 years - we have experienced it as single professionals, as a dating couple, and now raising our kids here. 

Before having kids we traveled near and far...Japan, Australia, Europe, Hawaii, all over the States....and now we are settled in Asheville. We are thrilled to be hosting other travelers coming to our city.

As hosts we are happy to be available to provide tips or travel guidance on the area. We also respect your privacy and hope you will make yourself comfortable in your private Montford suite.

New construction, furnished with modern sensibilities and full of art. This private guest suite is attached to our main home, but for your convenience is accessible through a private exterior entrance. Enjoy this beautiful, tree-lined street while being a 2 minute walk away from thriving Haywood Road, filled with restaurants, cafes, music venues, breweries, shopping and more. Adjacent suite available to travel "together but separate", found on Airbnb as "Stone's Throw."

The space
We hope you find our studio equal parts spotless and cozy. The studio is equipped with a brand new, comfy Tuft and Needle queen size bed, a SmartTV, and a kitchenette complete with fridge, microwave, coffee maker, & electric kettle. We provide local coffee and a variety of tea. You are welcome to use the backyard space - we have a firepit, grill, and covered porch.

While we hope you love the space, we hope you'll also love being a 2 minute walk from West Asheville's thrivi
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood and our tree-lined street full of 1920s bungalows! Within a five minute walk from our house are many local shops - a market, coffee and tea shops, incredible restaurants, local pubs, a bookstore, comic book shop.  It's also a great neighborhood for walks, runs, and bike rides - there's a park right down the street too.
host_about: I live in the beautiful mountains of Asheville, NC and love to travel!  I own a small public health research consulting company, and work with organizations to help them measure the impact of their work.

Guests access the home using an electronic keypad with the code sent to you beforehand. There's no need to worry about keys!

neighborhood_overview: The Neighborhood is in a quiet, residential area only a few minutes away from the Blue Ridge Parkway, I-40, and I-240. There is an Ingles grocery store less than 1 mile away as well as multiple restaurants like Piazza, Nachos & Beer, Great Wall, and Subway.
host_about: Jon is a Realtor and Emily works in the mental health field.  We welcomed our first child into the world in October 2016. We've lived in North Carolina since 2011 and adore Asheville.

name: Amazing Townhouse Min to Downtown Asheville
description:
Welcome to our little townhouse! We've recently updated the space with traveling in mind! We are about 10 minutes to downtown Asheville, 15 minutes to the Biltmore Estate, 5 minutes to French Broad River Parks.

With 1 King bed, 1 queen bed, 1 full size sleeper sofa, we can comfortably sleep 6 people. Living room is inviting with plenty of seating. Full kitchen for cooking meals, dining room table, stacked washer & dryer.

0411

Guest access
Entire downstairs townhouse with the exception of the owner’s closet. This door will be locked.

Other things to note
Your stay will be in the downstairs portion. We also rent out the upstairs portion as a short term rental. Each unit has a separate entrance and parking spaces.

Please keep noise to a minimum between 10pm and 8 am (inside and outside).

Limit of 2 vehicles per reservation. There are clearly marked parking spaces for this rental.

Dogs are
neighborhood_overview: Well established neighborhood in North Asheville. You'll likely see people walking their dogs on the street. House is close to local coffee shops and breweries.
host_about:
I'm an Asheville native. I love the mountains and the four seasons we get to experience here.

We are constantly doing renovation projects, restoring old furniture, buying and selling real estate and managing vacation rentals.

name: Royal Cottage Mtn Views, Decks & Close to DT AVL
description:
Royal Cottage offers you long-range mountain views, an abundance of privacy, solitude, and room to relax and rejuvenate. The home has three bedrooms, an open living room/kitchen/dining room floor plan, and an eat-in kitchen. It has a lovely wrap around deck that is partially covered so you can enjoy the warm days and cool mountain nights as well as an upper deck, all within minutes of world-class hiking, mountain biking, the Biltmore Estate, many breweries, and very close to downtown Asheville.

The space
This is perfect mountain getaway. It provides a private and rejuvenating retreat while also being close to Biltmore Village and Downtown Asheville.

Prepare a whole meal in modern kitchen with mountain views or take advantage of the take out services provided by some the best local restaurants in the area.

Relax with the whole group on the back porch and soak in the healing energy of Blue Ridge Mountains. Then wind down with the whole gro
neighborhood_overview: Royal Pines is a well-established mountain neighborhood that offers views and privacy.
host_about:
Ron is a Asheville/WNC native.  He loves hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic and ancient mountains.   

Darlene relocated from Michigan to Asheville a few years ago. She loves visiting  quaint  towns in and around Asheville and local attractions like the Biltmore Estate as well as discovering new hiking trails.  Her outdoor passion is kayaking and rock climbing.

Most of our vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, dog friendly and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back. Please see individual properties for their unique features. 

We both are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

We look forward to sharing the WNC area with you!

Darlene - Director of Operations and Concierge
Ron - Property Manager

name: Malvern Hills Hideaway
description:
A sanctuary tucked away in a great location. Private lower level duplex with lots of amenities. The home opens up to a large, beautiful wooded yard perfect for games, grilling, a fire pit, nature watching, or enjoying a cup of coffee on the deck atop a small pond. 2 minute drive to West Asheville, 10 minutes to downtown and just a short walk to Malvern Park for tennis or swimming. The perfect location to experience all Asheville has to offer while still enjoying a quiet getaway.

The space
Newly updated cozy space. Plenty of space to relax including a bistro set over a pond, swinging chairs, rockers, and chairs around a fire pit.

Open up the curtains in the bedrooms and enjoy nature without getting out of bed. Mobile TV cart with a flat screen so you can watch TV while you're cooking or enjoy a movie night under the stars.

This is a great spot for a couple, small family, or group of friends.

You will hear running water and so
neighborhood_overview: Situated toward the end of the street in a friendly neighborhood (Please drive slow). Just a street over from Malvern Hills Park where you can enjoy swimming, tennis, a playground, and walking paths. Tennis rackets and balls available in your suite. Great local spots nearby
host_about: I would be thrilled to have you as our guest! I've worked in the rental/concierge industry for years in Aspen & Snowmass Village Colorado. It makes me so happy to help folks have a memorable and fun trip. I have plenty of recommendations and a few hidden gems to share so please don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything.

name: New Mountain Home! Yard for Dogs, 10 m to Downtown
description:
Looking for a place with the calm and quiet of a mountain cabin, yet 3.5 miles from downtown? Our house rests in a quiet mountain neighborhood on 1.3 acres of forest with views of the French Broad River and plenty of space to play and explore! Take a walk out the door down to the old barrel road next to the Om Sanctuary, from where you might spot the noon train. Upon your return, cool off with a drink on the balcony as deer, turkey vultures, and the occasional bear meander through the yard.

The space
NOTE: The Mountain Home also has a basement flat that is rented separately to other guests, that may or may not be rented at the same time. You will not share any part of the home, nor will you share an air filtration system. Both levels are completely separate; the only shared area is the yard and fire pit.

The front yard and back yards are connected and mostly fenced (75%) with only the back portion open to the the mountain and wildlife preserve.
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quiet residential neighborhood situated on the French Broad River.  At the bottom of our road is the French Broad Outfitters and river access for a variety of activities.  Richmond Hill Park is a few minutes drive from our house, which boasts trails and a disc golf course.
host_about: General contractor and teacher, we love the water and water sports! We love having our Cocoa Beach escape close to us and Asheville reprieve from Florida's heat! Airbnb has made it so easy for us to travel with our kids and dogs, and we want the same for other families!

name: Perfect for four in east Asheville.
description:
Located in east Asheville, only 12 minutes to downtown. The neighborhood is adjacent to the Blue Ridge Parkway and the Mountain to Sea Trail. Great setup for spending your days exploring Asheville and western NC, then resting up for the next day's adventure. Private bedrooms and baths in a traditional ranch home. Bathroom 1 remodeled 2017. Bedroom 1 bed and mattress new 2019. Bathroom 2 updated 2020. Bedroom 2 mattress new 2020. You are welcome to use the kitchen and laundry room--just ask.

The space
You'll be staying in the original master bedroom (with en suite bath) and a second bedroom and bath of our traditional 1960s ranch home. Although the listing says four guests, there's also room for a child in a sleeping bag or baby in a portable crib in the larger room (bedroom 1).
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a nice place for walking. A short trail connects you to the Mountain To Sea Trail along the Blue Ridge Parkway for longer walks and runs. Views of mountains all around. Restaurants, Ingles grocery store (with a Starbucks, deli, and pharmacy), Urgent Care, VA Hospital, The Cove Training Center, gas stations, and fast food restaurants are within a 1-2 minute drive.
host_about: Anne and Paul have lived in Asheville for over 20 years. For ten years they hosted exchange students from around the world. They love to travel and they love to welcome guests to the mountains.

name: Modern Asheville Sanctuary on Elk Mountain!
description:
Eager for a peaceful getaway in a serene setting conveniently located to town? This Asheville vacation home, located on Elk Mountain, surely will not disappoint. It’s a mere 10 minutes from downtown, moments from the famed Grove Park Inn & Spa, and a short drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway. Not only does the property feature a master bedroom and en-suite bathroom on the main level, but it also boasts 3 other bedrooms, 3.5 bathrooms, a gym, pool table, and more!

The space
Step-Free Access | 4,612 Sq Ft | Ideal Location

For travelers seeking a luxurious getaway, this Asheville home spares nothing when it comes to amenities or comfort with breathtaking surroundings to match!

Master Bedroom: King Bed | Bedroom 2: King Bed | Bedroom 3: Queen Bed | Bedroom 4: 2 Twin Beds | Game Room: Sleeper Sofa

INDOOR LIVING: Air conditioning, jetted bathtub, central heating, 3 Smart TVs w/ cable, Netflix, Amazon Prime, en-suite bathrooms, fireplace,

host_about:
Hi! We’re Evolve Vacation Rental, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

name: "ARTISH" ... VERY Modern, Zen, Five Star Apartment
description:
You will be staying in a peaceful, quiet and light filled one bedroom 475 sf apartment with loads of amenities in West Asheville. A super convenient location with only 4.4 miles to the center of Downtown Asheville and the River Arts!
APARTMENT FEATURES: kitchen, LR w/Mod Fireplace, glass enclosed walk-in shower, W/D, large bedroom w/vaulted ceiling, Queen bed, dresser, large closet, inspiring office space, WiFi, pvt fenced courtyard w/seating, pvt parking & a sweet walking neighborhood.

The space
Artistic and well furnished, this apartment was newly built in fall of '20 with a keen eye towards Mid-Century Modern. Whether on vacation or working remotely, we have designed this apartment to embrace your needs. You control the heat/AC with the touch of a button on the remote. The office, featuring working desk, chair, bookshelves, music, artwork and lounging chair is light filled and inspiring!
Relax after a long day or have your morning coffee in t
neighborhood_overview:
Haywood Road Restaurants
Today, West Asheville offers a big variety of restaurants, from upscale four-star dining and gourmet burgers to casual barbecue and pubs. You'll find many of the best spots along Haywood Road. Also, see our West Asheville Dining Guide.

Asheville Sandwich Company (794 Haywood Road) is a small joint with huge french fry sandwiches!
Westville Pub (777 Haywood Road) opened in 2002 as West Asheville's original watering hole and entertainment venue.
West End Bakery (757 Haywood) is a long-time staple and serves breakfast anytime, with an assortment of made-from-scratch baked goods.
Nine Mile West (751 Haywood) features vegetarian-friendly, Caribbean-inspired pasta dishes, rice dishes and an array of locally-made desserts.
Isis Restaurant (743 Haywood) offers a creative fare of seasonal vegetables and proteins in their dining room and bar. After, enjoy a performance in their Music Hall.
Biscuit Head (733 Haywood) is a hot spot
host_about:
Hello, my name is Pat Johnson and my partner's name is Betty Pomeroy and we moved from Friendsville, PA in November of 2011 to West Asheville, NC.  We came to visit and look around, but by the 6th day we fell in love with the diversity, the artist community, and of course the (Website hidden by Airbnb) we purchased land that 6th day and set in motion to build us a new home in this new town.  And so we did, and we haven't looked back since. 
 
Surrounded by beautiful, charming Arts and Craft Bungalows, West Asheville offers diversity of people, food ,music, arts, schools, and service business, all in a stones throw! We encourage you to come to Asheville and stay a while and find yourself.  You won't regret it! 

We love it here and know that you will too. We look forward to meeting you.

name: Chickadees Cottage
description:
Centrally located in western North Carolina. Close to many major attractions in the Asheville area. Including the Asheville airport, SierraNevada, wnc arboretum, access to the blue ridge parkway, Pisgah forest, bent creek, Biltmore, Hendersonville and downtown Asheville. Yet you will feel far from it all.
The cottage is set back in the landscape with fields, forest and a small creek on the property. You can watch the birds and if you’re lucky you will spot wildlife visiting the property.

The space
The cottage is decorated to feel cozy and romantic. It is kid and pet friendly.

Throughout the space you will find art and pottery made by artists nearby. In fact, your closest neighbor is a pottery/art studio. Guests are welcome to stop in anytime to watch a master potter create on his wheel.

We strive to create a home away from home for our guests.

Other things to note
We do ask that you disclose your fury friend(s) a
neighborhood_overview:
Grocery store 5 minutes away.
Parkway, airport, downtown all 10-15 minutes away.
Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Brevard and DuPont all with in 30 minutes.
host_about:
Our family made our final move to the Asheville area at the end of 2016. The summer before we put our home in Colorado on the market, loaded up the truck and camper and travelled up and down the East coast alternating between camping and staying in vacation rentals while we searched for the right fit to be closer to family and where to raise our young children. We have not regretted the decision.
Western North Carolina offers wonderful outdoor activities and more family friendly restaurants and festivals than we could ask for. 
I am so excited to be apart of helping visitors have great experience in this nook of the country. 

As an artist, the purchase of this property has afforded me the ability to set up a pottery and artist studio where guests are invited and welcome to stop by and watch a master potter and other artists in our trades.

name: Awesome Asheville Short Stay House Guest Rooms
description:
Beautiful Home! COVID-safe, licensed, short-term rental in Southeast Asheville. ASHEVILLE HOMESTAY/SHORT STAY PERMIT # 20-04424). Ideal for leaf watchers, mountain bikers (can use garage), hikers, etc.

1 or 2 Bedrooms/1 bath. Gorgeous hillside house in quiet wooded sloping neightborhood. Off Sweeten Creek Road, in lovely Ballantree subdivision. Furnished. Pets negotiable with deposit.

The space
Until Sept 24 would work well for 2 individuals, 1 couple or 2 couples (2 King sized guest rooms). After that it will be just one guest room/King bed. Travelling health professionals, or folks awaiting new home might enjoy a longer stay! Just 2.5 miles to Blue Ridge Parkway and about 5 miles to downtown Asheville.

Quickfold table available to set up workstation for tele-workers.

Guests will have their own entrance and space. For COVID and privacy purposes, virtually no interaction with host unless mutually planned.

Guest
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, safe, private, on a cul-de-sac. Essentially the base of a small mountain range.
host_about:
Hello! I'm an outgoing, conscientious male physician, athlete, and cultural enthusiast. I have a military background. I was a good boy scout...and learned to "always leave the area better than I found it"!  I love to travel to clear my head of the rigors of medical practice, to meet interesting people and to explore various geographies. I own several properties myself and respect the nuances and sensitivities of having a new person in one's dwelling. I enjoy a wide range of activities, but 'active activities' are at the top of the list.  I currently practice a self created philosophy I call 'militant voluntary simplicity' which allows me to live and travel lightly and easily. Cheers!
PS: For extra validation and security, I hold unrestricted medical licenses in NC, SC and Texas...you are welcome to look me up (once we meet I can show ID and last name) at the medical board for any or all. Just websearch the (SC or NC or TX) Medical Board and there will be a link to look up licensees. This profile wont let me put the direct link for you. You will see that I am in good standing (which means my medical and legal records are pristine).Thx in advance!

name: Home away from home with nearby adventures
description:
Downstairs apartment at end of dead in road, with private parking, paved walkway to french doors of apartment, french glass doors have blinds inside glass. Apartment includes electricity, wifi, cable, water and trash pick up. This private road is off of Averys' Creek road, which is near Long Shoals Rd, Airport Road and 15 minutes to downtown Asheville,near the Biltmore House or 15 minutes to Hendersonville, NC and 5 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway.

The space
Backyard directly outside apartment

Guest access
Parking & paved walkway directly to downstairs apartment entrance

Other things to note
Smoking not allowed inside apartment, outside apartment smoking is permitted
neighborhood_overview: Family oriented, generally quiet
host_about: Registered Nurse

name: Colorful, Roomy Retro Caravan Home w/fenced yard
description:
Fully rehabbed retro-hip, colorful and comfortable caravan home, 15 mins to downtown Asheville and River Arts District, 3 mins drive to Bent Creek Forest. Quiet wooded setting w/private parking, small front deck and good-sized fenced-in yard for visiting dogs. 2 bedrooms/1 bath, large open-plan living room and kitchen. Strong WIFI and TV with Roku. Full kitchen, lots of space to lounge around in large living room. (We can't bring ourselves to call it a mobile home, it hasn't moved in 50 yrs!)

The space
This is a sweet spot in the woods and it's been a pleasure to 'save' this old Caravan mobile home and turn it into a comfortable getaway for people and their dogs. It's in a quiet setting with only 5 other units spread out over 4 acres! If you have any questions, feel free to ask ahead of time before making a booking. We've owned the property for close to 5 yrs now and we love it there.

Guest access
Easy, self-entry combination lock on fro
neighborhood_overview: Very quiet residential setting with ample parking and super close to Bent Creek, Zen Tubing and Rt. 26.  15 minutes to heart of downtown Asheville and River Arts District.
host_about:
Together with my husband Michael, we are hosts who LOVE our "hometown" of 7 yrs - Asheville NC!  We both have excellent suggestions on things to see and do here --especially restaurants!  Asheville is a foodie and beer lovers paradise.  Through a fateful twist of the pandemic, we also recently discovered Edisto Beach SC and we're enchanted beyond our expectations and look forward to sharing that property with other travelers.  We live with two almost-human roommates, Lucie and Mambo - 7 yr old Standard Poodles who pretty much rule our lives.  

By now it's probably clear we're big fans of "the good life" and we'll do our best to share it all with you!

name: ☆☆☆☆☆ MOUNTAIN CHALET/1.2 MILES TO DOWNTOWN$6 UBER
description:
5☆ 1960's dressed up mtn cottage just 1.2 miles from downtown on Beaucatcher Mtn. Located above the mountain tunnel heading into downtown, our home is a stand alone 2 br+ office and is a part of AVL travel history as one of the original Swiss Chalets from the 60s. So close but don't be surprised if you see a bear or two "up on the hill".

* 3rd bedroom is set up as an office
* Snug parking for two vehicles
* $7 Uber to downtown

Brought to you by Suites on Front - NC's Own!

The space
Well laid out home on the mountain above AVL. Comfortable furnishings, deck, grill, 1960s builtins, outdoor space, and so close to everything but a world away on Beaucatcher Mountain!

*** Notes - House is above a 2nd apartment - we do not rent it and is used as1 storage (gate is locked to the stairs)

**** 1.2 miles to downtown/$7 Uber but is a mountain road so would not walk it

Guest access
100 percent of
neighborhood_overview: This one of a cluster of 12 Swiss styled homes built in the 1960s as tourist homes on the mountain above Asheville's downtown.  Our moderately steep road and traditional switchback access showcases these little gems of Asheville history from the 1960s.  While you may feel a world away you are only a touch over a mile from downtown and a $6 dollar Uber from incredible restaurants and culture.
host_about:
We travel and try to support travel.  This started out as a hobby and to have a place for us to go have dinner and a drink and we thought maybe someone else wants to do the same.  Nearly 20 years later, we have owned over 30 vacation homes in the heart of the historic district in WIlmington, NC and thruout NC.  It has also lead to us helping others find their perfect home or vacation property in Wilmington NC and the Beaches.

Looking forward to hosting you!

Answer to Airbnb questions!

5 things you can't live without:  Family, Surf, Pizza, Wanderlust and Art

Favorite Recent Travel Destination: Budapest but be careful of the Palinka

Favorite Read: A Clean Well Lighted Place - 2 page monster from Hemingway

3 top Movies: Beautiful Girls, Pulp Fiction, Shawshank

Food: Pizza

As a host, we are trying to make sure you have all the info you need but not hovering.  We have an onsite property manager that greets many of the guests and help with any one off issues.   

As a traveler, I would say I personally like to travel with little or no destination in mind. I like to wander and my wife likes to wander with a homebase.  Ah, compromise.

Thank you for considering our listings.

name: Minutes to Downtown & Parkway with Arcade Room!
description:
Location, Location, Location! This home sits perfectly between city and nature being 5 minutes to downtown and the parkways entrance. It is in a quiet friendly neighborhood. With great WiFi it is also great for working travelers. We have visits from black bears, hawks, foxes, & turkeys often. The owner has taken great care to make the place feel like home. With the charms of the vintage Jukebox and video arcade games for fun.

The space
The screened porch has a celling fan and outdoor table and chairs to relax. You may even catch a Hawk or Bear sighting! We are so close to the parkway they can be seen wandering around the neighborhood sometimes, along with turkey, foxes and sometimes deer. Kitchen has stainless steel appliances. Refrigerator with freezer and ice/water dispenser, dishwasher and coffee cart with coffee and tea selections. The dining area has a beautiful blue ridge mountain mural that can also be seen from the living area. The living area has an L s
neighborhood_overview: We are a short distance from some biking/hiking/walking trails. There are also some churches near by walking distance with playgrounds for kids.
host_about: I am an Asheville native. I am a photographer, teacher& aspiring writer. I love to travel and see new places and try new foods. My dog ruger and I love having guest visit from allover!

name: Daybreak Escape- Quiet Beautiful, New, Great host!
description:
Modern, new, and clean private 1 bdrm, 1 bath suite with your own entrance, back porch, kitchen (full size fridge, range, sink, coffee setup), walk in-closet, sleeper sofa, HDTV, washer/dryer, lots of light.

15 minutes to downtown AVL. 5 mins to the Blue Ridge Pkwy/Folk Art Center, JBL soccer complex and Warren Wilson College. 5 minute walk to a secluded beach on Swannanoa River. Breweries, hiking and biking trails close too!

We'd love to welcome you to AVL and share some of what we love.

The space
Brand new everything. Full kitchen, HDTV with Fire Stick, Laundry, a huge closet that can easily fit a pack and play ;) Quiet neighborhood with trails close by, easy access to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Folk Art Center, JBL Soccer complex, Warren Wilson College all 5 minutes away in quiet subdivison. Able to provide recommendations and guidance for biking, hiking and rafting if needed.

Guest access
Guests are welcome to en
neighborhood_overview: On the banks of the underappreciated Swannanoa River, our little neighborhood- Southridge, is awesome. It's on a southern ridge. Hence the name. The radiant morning sun will greet you each morning over the distant ridges. But we have darkening blinds when you need them, if you know what I mean. It is Asheville.
host_about: I'm such the AVL stereotype. Vegan, Realtor, mountain biker, DJ, dad.

name: A Suite Stay!
description:
Tranquil and private 1 bedroom suite in an updated private family residence. Upper and lower apartments both have their own entrances and are completely separated and do not share a common HVAC system. This home is on a cul de sac in a typical southern eclectic dog friendly neighborhood.

We are SUPER pet friendly with no pet fees for up to 2 pets! The suite offers a king bed, full kitchen, deck, big screen TV, gas grill, and much more! Close to hiking, breweries, shopping, restaurants.

The space
This comfortable space is very pet friendly! Enjoy a full kitchen, comfortable living room, bedroom with King Size bed and bathroom.
For entertainment the Living Room has a 55" flat screen 4K TV and the bedroom has 32" wall mounted television. Both televisions offer YouTube TV with over 60 channels including HGTV, ESPN, TCM, Networks and so much more. We also offer Netflix, Amazon Prime and Chrome Cast.

The safety and cleanliness of t
neighborhood_overview: Safe residential pet-friendly neighborhood and reflects a typical southern eclectic neighborhood. Our home is located on a cul de sac with easy access to Asheville and surrounding towns.
host_about:
We are Corey and Cheryl Brookhouzen and we host 2 private suites in our 2 story residential home on a cul de sac in Arden, NC, a suburb of Asheville NC.  The suites are " Houz Zen," a pet friendly ground floor suite with a big fenced in backyard and "A Suite Stay" which is our upstairs area with a full kitchen,  wood fireplace and a deck overlooking the big backyard.

Cheryl and I are passionate about hosting!  Both of us have a long history of hospitality experience - I have over 15 years in Hotel Management experience in the Tampa Bay & Chicago areas and Cheryl has been a Pastry Chef in fast-paced well-known hotels and restaurants in New York City and Chicago.  In fact, we moved from Chicago to the Asheville Area approximately 6 years ago when Cheryl was offered a position at the Inn on Biltmore Estate.  I currently work at a large car dealership in town and Cheryl blogs and helps run our home based Airbnb business.

As hosts for Airbnb, we have enjoyed opening our private suites to guests (and their furry family members) from all over the world.  We try to offer our guests what we like when we travel - a comfortable and stylish place to relax.  What's more, we enjoy traveling with our 2 small dogs (Lola and Archie) and look for pet-friendly accommodations with no extra pet fees!

We love Asheville and we see ourselves continuing our life's journey in this beautiful eclectic Mountain community.  Cheryl and I first met and dated in high school.  In fact, she was my high school sweetheart in 1986!  Although we lost track of each other over the next twenty years, we met again at our high school reunion and (needless to say) the rest is history.  

Come stay with us!  We would love to share our private suites and everything that Asheville has to offer.

name: The Retreat in West Asheville
description:
Welcome to our wonderful house in the heart of West Asheville. We offer a private, spacious basement apartment walkable to all the best spots West Asheville has to offer, such as Biscuit Head, Sunny Point Cafe, Westville Pub, Up country brewery, and much more. Our house is located just two blocks from the epicenter of Haywood Road where all the action is. We offer a newly renovated basement creating a cute and cozy space for you to enjoy your stay and take in all that Asheville has to offer.

The space
The space is completely private including it's own entrance with a covered porch and outside seating. The space has all the comforts of home and plenty of room to stretch out. Its the perfect size for two people or a small family. The main bedroom has a cozy queen size mattress, and the living room has a full size pull out couch with a memory foam mattress. When the pull out bed is not in use, you will have a small living room with a TV for you to relax and a dining
neighborhood_overview: We love this area and hope you will too! If you are looking for great food, friendly people, and an abundance of outside activities you have come to the right spot. We usually spend our free time going out to dinner with friends or drinking some beer at one of the many breweries or picking up a concert at Isis, just up the street. On the weekends, you will find us mountain biking at Bent Creek, walking our dog down at Carrier park along the French broad, hiking/camping in Pisgah, or sailing down at the lake Julian.
host_about: We love Asheville and all it has to offer. We are avid outdoor enthusiasts!

name: Peaceful, convenient, cozy space near everything
description:
Enjoy the convenience of Asheville without the noise.

You will have plenty of space to recharge between adventures in the entire upper level and peaceful backyard of this home.

Set back from the road, you’ll have maximum privacy in this space. Cozy up with a book in the bay window or gather with friends around the kitchen island and open concept dining room.

Every window features a natural view. After a day of fun in town or on trails, crack one open by the fire pit with friends and family.

The space
Your space includes the entire main level of the house and the backyard.

The basement level and garage are private areas as the owner lives on the property with her two indoor cats.

But I’m friendly if you need anything! 🙂

Guest access
Guests have access to everything on the main level and front and backyards. I have a washer and dryer and will do your laundry by request, but there is no w
neighborhood_overview:
Arden is the more relaxed sister of Asheville. Located on a quiet country road, this home is convenient to:

-Downtown Asheville (20 mins)
-Downtown Hendersonville (26 mins)
-Interstate 26 (4 mins)
-Asheville Airport (9 mins)
-Biltmore Park Shopping Center (7 mins)
-Bent Creek Hiking Area (8 mins)
-The NC Arboretum (7 mins)
-Blue Ridge Parkway (8 mins)
-Asheville Outlets (10 mins)
-Zen Tubing & the French Broad River (6 mins)
-Lake Julian (8 mins)
-Biscuit Head South (10 mins)

Even the Biltmore Estate is only 25 minutes away! Arden has everything you could want or need, from nature to high end shopping and dining.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Tee. I like to hike, travel, and meet new folks.

I have two kitties whom I love very dearly.

I’m quiet, clean, and I love being a traveler AND a host! It’s truly the best of both worlds.

Thanks!

name: Remember When Cottage
description:
Remember when the Platters recorded "Remember When" in 1956? What a perfect name for this cottage! Built in 1947, Remember When Cottage has been completely renovated and decorated in 40's and 50's style. Go to youtube and type in "Remember When Cottage Asheville" for a 10-minute walk-through. It's a comfy, cozy hideaway. One of our guests said it brought back a flood of memories of visiting his Grandma's house when he was a boy. Why not take a walk down memory lane?

The space
Note: In light of the current COVID19 crisis, you should know that we do our own cleaning and are very concerned about the risk of COVID. We take care of all the cleaning and maintenance ourselves. You won't be able to find any viruses hanging around this house!

Remember When Cottage may look like a house from the 40's or 50's , and it was in fact built in 1947, but don't be fooled! It's been completely renovated, with new floors throughout, a new heat pump with electric
neighborhood_overview: This cottage is about as close to Asheville as you can get without being in the city limits.  It's on the south side, less than a mile from the Asheville city limit and about 11 miles from downtown.  There are lots of fun restaurants and breweries on the south side of town which are quite close to the cottage (see our guestbook on airbnb).  It is about 4.5  miles from the entrance to the Biltmore Estate.
host_about:
My wife, Sheryl, and I built a new home in 2006, a move of about 3 miles.  When we moved out of our former home, we decided to keep it and rent it as a vacation rental - Willow Haven.  We kept it pretty much the way it was when we lived in it, so it really feels like home.  We have been blessed since the beginning with super renters who have consistently taken good care of our home.  In 2016 we switched from another vacation rental website to Airbnb which proved to be a very pleasant and profitable experience. 

In November of 2018 we purchased another home to rent as a vacation rental - Stone's Throw Cottage, which is also listed on Airbnb.  Our first guests arrived on Dec. 21, a wonderful couple.  We are looking forward to another fantastic vacation rental experience!

Well, we've done it again! We just bought a third vacation rental house in October of 2020! Remember When Cottage was built in 1947. We have completely remodeled it and decorated it in retro 40s and 50 style. You'll love it!

Thanks to Airbnb and to all our wonderful guests!  Enjoy your visit!

name: NEW! Asheville Family House w/ Wraparound Deck!
description:
Sitting less than 10 miles from downtown Asheville, this family home is an ideal getaway for exploring the natural beauty and charm of North Carolina's Blue Ridge Mountains. Explore the grand Biltmore estate which sits only 9 miles away from your front door. Or take a hike on a nearby trail before heading into town to grab a pint at the Asheville Brewing Company. Back at home, relax and enjoy the 3-bedroom, 3.5-bathroom vacation rental's bright living space, kitchen, and wraparound deck!

The space
Wraparound Deck | 2,050 Sq Ft | Free WiFi

Boasting a bright living space and an ideal location near Asheville’s attractions and hiking areas, this vacation rental invites guests to experience life in the Blue Ridge Mountains.

Master Bedroom: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: Twin/Full Bunk Bed | Living Room: Queen Sleeper Sofa

INDOOR LIVING: Leather sofa, foosball table, dining room, hardwood floor
KITCHEN: Fully equippe
neighborhood_overview:
HIKING AREAS: Mountains to Sea Trail (3.5 miles), Urban Trail (7.3 miles), Craven Gap Trailhead (9.9 miles), Rice Pinnacle Trailhead (13.6 miles), Hard Times Trailhead (14.3 miles)
THINGS TO DO: Blue Ridge Parkway (5.5 miles) Asheville Museum of Science (7.3 miles), Asheville Pinball Museum (7.6 miles), Biltmore (9.0 miles), The North Carolina Arboretum (12.7 miles)
BREWERIES: One world Brewing (7.3 miles), Asheville Brewing Company (7.6 miles), Hi-Wire Brewing - South Slope (7.6 miles), Green Man Brewery (7.6 miles), Wicked Weed Brewing Pub (7.7 miles), Burial Brew Co. (7.7 miles)
AIRPORTS: Asheville Regional Airport (19.5 miles), Greenville-Spartanburg International Airport (82.2 miles)
host_about:
Hi! We’re Evolve Vacation Rental, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

name: «Demi Sous-Sol Ensoleillé», 3 Rm/2.5 Bath for four
description:
One Block from the River Arts District and Central to all of Asheville's Best Attractions.

Spacious new construction Apartment Suite, with Private Entrance, in a centrally located, convenient and friendly Residential Neighborhood. There are Two Bedrooms, each with en suite Bathroom and queen-size beds. Plus huge Parlour with Kitchenette, Dining Area and Gas Fireplace. Comfortable, Quiet and follows COVID-19 sanitation protocols. Great for Escape "Staycations" or "Work from Anywhere".

The space
• “Vacation Escape to the Mountains” or “Work from Anywhere” visits with maximum privacy, convenience, and comfort.
• Top-Quality accommodations created during new construction (2019)
• Wheelchair Accessible
• Two Oversized Bedrooms with large South-facing windows
• Queen Sized Beds
• En Suite Bathroom, with heated floors, and Oversized Shower for each Bedroom
• Ample comfortable seating in each Bedroom
• Office Desks with Se
neighborhood_overview: Eclectic, historic, centrally-located, friendly, inclusive, the Southside is truly one of Asheville's best places to reside.
host_about:
I work as a database analyst/applications developer, typically on contract to one company or another.  
--
After 32 terrific years in Northern California, I now live in the small mountain town of Asheville, NC where I've just completed building my dream home.  The house is located almost midpoint between vibrant Downtown Asheville and the Biltmore Estate entrance and has a large common room and two bedrooms.  
--
At Bob's House, "Y'all means All".  My life has been enriched immeasurably by a diverse group of friends and acquaintances, and so it will be until the end.
--
In between contracts, I love to travel around the planet.  Invariably, an international trip will include Australia and New Zealand to see treasured friends.  --
Life motto:  "If you can dream it, you can do it!"

name: The Farmhouse at Wolfehaven
description:
Newly renovated 1925 farmhouse. Very private with easy access to all of Asheville’s best attractions and owners readily available for advice. We are 5 minutes to NC Arboretum, 5 minutes to Blue Ridge Parkway, 5 minutes to Bent Creek and miles of bike trails, 5 minutes to Asheville Outlets, 10 minutes to downtown Asheville, 15 minutes to Biltmore Estate, and 15 minutes from the Asheville airport. Hiking and Bike trails on property and a short drive to WNC’s best ski resorts. Come to the Mtn’s

The space
You’re tucked away in the middle of a 255 acre farm with Mtn’s and miles of trails for hiking and biking right out the back door.

Guest access
Private parking

Other things to note
If you will be arriving late, we offer a grocery buying service for breakfast items. Both a Keurig and a standard drip coffee maker are provided, as well as a tea kettle with a full selection of teas.
neighborhood_overview: This was the main Farmhouse of this 255 acre working farm. The farm is managed for both crops and timber. A additional small house was added in the mid 90’s next door to the farmhouse. We are in a small valley with trails that lead to the top of our mountain, 1.5 miles away, biking and hiking are allowed on the property. From the top you can see a vast part of the Biltmore Estate including the house ,motels and winery. We are 5 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and only minutes from miles of hiking and biking trails. We are only minutes from the many of Asheville's best breweries. But, you can reach all of Asheville’s best in minutes. Come to our little haven and visit Western North Carolina
host_about: Your hosts, Mike and Carole, live in Asheville because we know it’s the most beautiful place to be! We invite you to enjoy spending time in our hometown, and we’ll be happy to help with recommendations for restaurants, activities, and the best drives to see our beautiful Smoky Mountains.

name: Peace & Tranquility  in the Mountains of Asheville
description:
Nestled in the Appalachia and Blue Ridge Mountains this cabin is a perfect get away. Peaceful, tranquil, plenty of hiking. Like you’re a 100 miles from nowhere but only 8 miles from downtown.This cabin is unique, it is offered to Military members free upon returning home as they need time to destress and reconnect.
When not enjoyed by Veterans, Air B&B fees are 100% invested in this 501(c)(3) Non-profit.
A wonderful opportunity to enjoy everything Asheville has to offer and help our Veterans.

The space
Newly built Cabin, sits among five acres at a dead end road. Property is surrounded by 300 acres of pristine forest.
Massive hiking and open space. Two fire pits, picnic table, flowing streams, wildlife and fruit trees.
We have intentionally left out internet and television.
Cell service is usually available.
Three miles from grocery shopping. Fifteen minutes from Downtown Asheville and Downtown Black Mountain.
What we love
neighborhood_overview: Wildlife  present. Deer, turkey, skunk and an occasional black bear
host_about:
Married, father of two.
Veteran of two wars.
