description:
Well-loved quaint family home! Spacious front and back yard with comfortable back porch to relax and enjoy yourself. Family-friendly neighborhood conveniently located close to numerous Asheville tourist destinations. Wifi and live-stream tv are available in the home.

The space
This is an older styled home with a cozy cottage feel. It is clean and organized.
The kitchen and bath have been recently renovated. The house is one level and has a basement access from the kitchen. The washer and dryer are located in the unfinished basement area. You will need to be able to walk up and down stairs if laundry access is a need during your stay. If you are searching for value, this is your house of choice! The home is not a fancy establishment but hosts provide excellent communication and offer all the basics you'll need and have extra special guest touches, too!

Guest access
Guests have private use of home. There will be no one else occupyi
neighborhood_overview: Located in Candler, NC just minutes from the city of Asheville! The home is located in a family-friendly neighborhood. The front yard faces the main road and the back yard faces a side road leading into the neighborhood. There is an ample amount of traffic on the main road. Parking on the side road is recommended for ease of travel and entry to the house from the porch area.
host_about: Hi! We are Shannon and Leslie, two sisters,who enjoy hosting and meeting new people. We love shopping and spending time with our families. We enjoy eating at unique restaurants. Asheville has many great places to eat! We especially love older homes and discovering their histories. We love being able to share our childhood home with you!

description:
Hike, bike, and golf, or simply enjoy a leisurely vacation filled with dining, shopping, and scenic drives when you stay at this cozy Arden vacation rental. Centrally located near Asheville, this 1-bed, 1-bath cabin invites you to enjoy the sights and sounds of downtown Asheville, take a scenic drive along the Blue Ridge Parkway, or kick back at the local breweries, all within a short drive. When you're not out and about, enjoy beautiful afternoons on the lounge chairs by the fire pit.

The space
Prime Location | Free WiFi | Outdoor Seating

With splendid views of the surrounding forest, and a fantastic location near the area's finest attractions, this cabin is the perfect place for your next romantic getaway!

name: Asheville Cabin Hideaway - Minutes to Downtown
description:
Come for a mountain getaway in our newly constructed two bedroom cabin less than 10 minutes from downtown Asheville and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Enjoy a rustic mountain experience with the comforts of all new appliances, a fully-equipped kitchen, and a large flatscreen TV with Roku.

The location is tucked away in a peaceful, wooded cove where you will likely spot a wide variety of wildlife. After a day of exploring all Asheville has to offer, Homestead Hideaway is the perfect place to unwind!
neighborhood_overview: The cabin is located in a serene and wooded area up a mountain, down a short gravel road, within a beautiful cove. You will feel like you are miles away from the city, with starry skies, beautiful local wildlife, and tranquility, however, you will just be a short drive from downtown Asheville!
host_about: Alicia and Dan are both career teachers in Asheville, NC. When we're not thrilling our students with math and humanities, we enjoy teaching, gardening, cooking, eating, fermenting, hiking, camping, and exploring in our hometown of Asheville, NC. This area offers such a rich diversity and balance of experiences with the arts, cuisine, natural and cultural heritage, history, and wildlife. We love traveling the country and the world, but we always are grateful to return home to Asheville. We hope you enjoy your time here as much as we do!

Guest access
You’ll have the full home, deck and porch. The unit over the garage is

name: Topsy's Trailer, Fast WiFi Close DT AVL, Sm Dog Ok
description:
Topsy's Trailer is located in Arden, which is only 15-20 minutes to downtown Asheville. Great location to take advantage of the breweries, hiking trails, the Blue Ridge Parkway, Biltmore Estate, and close for take-out services offered by local restaurants.

It has been fully renovated with hardwood floors, comfy beds, fast/reliable WiFi, streaming TVs, Weber gas grill, two covered decks, easy flat roads access (no 4WD needed), plenty of parking. A small dog is ok (fee will apply).

The space
Stay here and truly soak in the southern mountain charm of Western North Carolina. Relax in the large sectional American-made sofa and enjoy the fabulous eclectic furniture.

Prepare a whole meal in the kitchen or take advantage of the many take-out services from local restaurants that have made Asheville a nationwide hotspot. Soak in the food culture inside or on one of the two covered decks. Then relax in the new queen-sized beds that have a vibrating
neighborhood_overview: Topsy's Trailer is located in a residential neighborhood.  It sits on a mostly wooded half acre lot surrounded by homes.
host_about:
Ron is a Asheville/WNC native.  He loves hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic and ancient mountains.   

Darlene relocated from Michigan to Asheville a few years ago. She loves visiting  quaint  towns in and around Asheville and local attractions like the Biltmore Estate as well as discovering new hiking trails.  Her outdoor passion is kayaking and rock climbing.

Most of our vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, dog friendly and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back. Please see individual properties for their unique features. 

We both are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

We look forward to sharing the WNC area with you!

Darlene - Director of Operations and Concierge
Ron - Property Manager

Close to everything Asheville - restaurants in walking distance, near the parkway for biking, hiking, minutes to Biltmore House, Grove Park, downtown. The home has 360 degree beautiful views & relaxing porch w/ firepit. This home is spacious with screened porch with views in the front & large back porch & yard with room to relax. The space

description:
Welcome to the Stone Carriage House located in Asheville's desirable historical Grove Park neighborhood. Stone Carriage House features one bedroom and one bath with wood flooring throughout and a calm color palette. Less than a 10 minute drive to the heart of Asheville and all it has to offer. Less than 5 minute drive to the Grove Park Inn where you can enjoy the stunning sunsets that Asheville is known for. Walkable neighborhood with beautiful homes and gardens.

This freshly-remodeled peaceful mountaintop cabin has stunning views from the large, wrap-around deck and is only 15 minutes from the heart of downtown Asheville and the Biltmore House. Relax in the hot tub on the spacious deck, chill in the cozy living room with wall-to-wall windows looking out at the mountains, hang out in the heated game shed out back or in the fenced yard with your furry friend. There's plenty of room for everyone to enjoy this incredible setting just minutes from Asheville.

The space
This cabin is in a well-spaced wooded mountaintop neighborhood, providing a feeling of seclusion and tranquility. **PLEASE NOTE: the road to this mountaintop is very steep and winding, and parking/turning around is tricky. Once inside the house, there are two cozy bedrooms upstairs, each with its own heat pump for climate control. There is a

name: Bent Creek Retreat Mountain Biking & dog friendly
description:
Located in Bent Creek, Asheville's best kept secret. Ride/hike right from the house to miles of single track in Bent Creek Experimental forest. Paddle or float the French Broad river past the Biltmore Estate with river access 1 mile away. Enjoy the Blueridge Parkway and the Arboretum, for your ultimate hiking, biking or sightseeing adventures, only minutes away. Head downtown after a long day of adventure, it's a 15 minute drive or Lyft ride and only 10 minutes away from the Airport.

The space
Enjoy the private lower level suite of our ranch home. We are a family of 4 with 3 dogs so there will be some normal day to day noise upstairs. You will have 1 off street parking spot in our safe cul-de-sac neighborhood. Unwind on the covered deck and you may see a bear or deer passing through our lower yard. The covered deck has plenty of room to store bikes and air out gear. Enjoy hiking/biking Bent Creek trail access without having to get in your car. Snuggle up next
neighborhood_overview: Forest Edge neighborhood borders the Bent Creek area of Pisgah national forest. You can be on a trail in under 5 minutes walking or biking from our front door.
host_about: My husband Chris and I moved to Asheville in 2004 but truly found our home when we moved to the Bent Creek community. We live here with our two active teenage boys and 3 dogs.

Sharp Quarters is the perfect space for your Asheville getaway! The Tempur-pedic mattress on our king-size bed offers maximum comfort. We can also add a Pack-N-Play or toddler bed for the little one(s). The neighborhood is perfectly peaceful and safe, yet accessible to all things Asheville!

The space
This studio apartment space has everything you need for a quick weekend away or a long stay in Asheville!

We are located in a friendly, safe West Asheville neighborhood. The space is cozy, private and comfortable. It features a king-size bed, love seat, kitchenette, full bathroom, and 50-inch Sony Smart TV.

If you can bring yourself to get out of the king-size, memory foam bed in the morning, you will have so much to explore. Walk to New Belgium in 10 m

host_about: I love chocolate, summertime in Colorado, the beaches in North Carolina, my family, my husband and my sweet daughter!

description:
Private and close to downtown!
Enjoy quick access to downtown Asheville (8 minutes) while being nestled in the trees at Woodfin Cottage. This tastefully decorated cottage accommodates up to 4 guests comfortably with two bedrooms and two full bathrooms. Enjoy morning coffee or evening sunsets with a gentle breeze by the gas firepit on the deck. Adding to your stay is a well equipped kitchen, gas grill, record player, Wi-Fi and 2 smart TVs.

Minimum age of booking guest is 25

Guest access
Guest are welcome to access all parts of the property.

Other things to note
Property is only available to immediate guest.

host_about: I love the mountains and everything they have to offer. The crisp air, outdoor activities, and so much more. My goal is to offer an experience where I exceed your expectations. I hope you enjoy Woodfin Cottage as much as I do.

Family-friendly West Asheville 2 bedroom/1 bath home located steps away from Malvern Hills park, playground, & pool. Enjoy movie nights on the large screened-in back porch. Off-street parking makes this a rare find in West Asheville. This hip neighborhood is safe & bright. 2min from Haywood and all the great food, music, breweries, & art. Fully stocked kitchen and bathroom. Bike to the greenway via Hominy Creek. River access is 5min away. Walk to the neighborhood restaurant/bar. Min 30-day stay

The space
We feature high-speed Internet, smart TV, all the essentials for your stay such as soap, shampoo, hairdryer, a full kitchen, and many other amenities.

Clean, minimalist modern feel in an updated & re-modeled 1953 home.

Guest access
Access the entire top level of h
neighborhood_overview:
One of the few Asheville neighborhoods with sidewalks. Great for walking and running. Safe and bright. Great area for families with younger kids as well as adults.
In the heart of West Asheville, close to downtown and only 14 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway

Walk to the park & explore the creek along a beautiful walking trail. 2 Blocks from Bowling, Ice cream & restaurants. Take a 2-min Uber ride to the famous Haywood Street for coffee shops, restaurants, live music, shopping, and more. It's a 9-min drive to Downtown. Welcome to the mountains! This private rental is a central location between Asheville, Blue Ridge Parkway, Asheville airport, and Hendersonville. It is an end unit townhouse in a quiet neighborhood, with 2 bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, and a pull-out sofa bed. The unit is recently renovated and goes through extensive cleaning and sanitizing between every quest who occupies it. The unit is located 2.2 miles from the airport (7 min) and 11 miles from downtown Asheville (20 min).

The space
Entire newly renovated spacious townhouse with privacy and comfort. It has 2 bedrooms with 2 baths located upstairs and a new pullout sofa downstairs in the living room. There is a gas fireplace in the living room for cold evenings, and space on the back porch for warmer nights. The kitchen has enough equipment to prepare a home-cooked meal and a dining table that seats up to six. Full-size washer and dryer are available to use as well.

Guest access
The entrance

Brand new, sparkling clean guest suite. comfortable, private, quiet, and perfectly located to access all that Asheville has to offer. I even provide home roasted coffee beans to enjoy during your stay, and some to take home, as well.

Private, stylish suite with vaulted ceilings, custom artisan furniture, lots of books, and a variety of coffee options with home roasted beans and Bustello for the espresso machine.

name: Historic Montford 10-minute walk from the AVL Buzz
description:
Savor the buzz of downtown Asheville in just a 10 minute walk from this ground level, newly constructed apartment suite with private entrance in this quiet National Historic neighborhood. Flooded with natural light, all new furnishings include, a dinning/living area, large separate bedroom with king-size Casper mattress, and outside sitting area off the living room. Everything you need for take-out dinning is provided. Enjoy the large smart-TV and high speed internet access.

The space
We have created a relaxing and uncluttered hygge [ˈh(y)o͞oɡə, ˈho͝oɡə] atmosphere for your enjoyment. The blend of colors, textures, art work, decorative accents, and accessories, were thoughtfully curated by an Asheville artist. Green views steam through large windows throughout. We hope that you find everything that you need for your stay including mini fridge, microwave, cutlery, dinnerware, coffeemaker, tea kettle, coffee, and tea. Your host is always available living in the at
neighborhood_overview: Nestled in the National Historic neighborhood of Montford, the variety of late 19th and early 20th century architecture will fascinate you on your strolls through climax forests. Within the neighborhood is the Chamber of Commerce, a greenway along Reed Creek, and 3 excellent restaurants including All Day Darling, Chiesa and Nine Mile. Within less than a mile you will find Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, and Harris Teeter grocery store.  In the other direction is downtown Asheville, internationally known as a culinary destination. Eclectic restaurants and fine dining are within easy walking distance to downtown.  Enjoy the Art Deco architecture, fanciful gargoyles, craft breweries, new art museum, galleries and boutiques.  Close by is the River Arts district housing 200 artists in 22 buildings creating high quality fine art and craft of every variety. Other close attractions include the Biltmore House, Blue Ridge Parkway, and National Forests.
host_about: Married. Love movies, theater, conversation, and the outdoors.

description:
Dolly is a 1968 retro camper trailer that has been restored to meet the needs of our visiting guests. Located close to Asheville, Hendersonville, Brevard (home to waterfalls and mountain bike trails), the Asheville airport, Biltmore Estate and all the best breweries, restaurants and shops that WNC has to offer!

The space
Dolly may be tiny, but she has a lot to offer! One double bed comfortably sleeps two adults. The pull-out bunk bed can fit one person (weight limit of 100lbs) and the dinette also transforms into a small double bed.

The kitchenette offers coffee and tea essentials, breakfast items, a large mini-fridge (with freezer) and a toaster oven. The original oven has been kept intact for the beauty it adds but it is not for guest use. There is a sink for rinsing dishes or brushing teeth (drinking water is provided).

The outside patio is perfect for sharing a glass of wine or drinking your morning coffee.

The camper
neighborhood_overview: Our Air BnB is located in a quiet, and very safe, neighborhood in Arden, just south of Asheville.  There are wonderful hiking trails within the neighborhood.
host_about: We are a fun, friendly family of 5 - living, working and playing in the beautiful mountains of North Carolina!  The  Asheville area has been our home for over 20 years so we are very knowledgeable about all the food/drink/nature/cultural destinations and experiences available to visitors.  We have created a mini-homestead on our suburban property, including chickens, gardening, mushrooming, canning, fermenting, and of course, updating our sweet little vintage camper!  We love sharing our homemade goodies with our guests and strive to support local as best we can!

name: Quiet idyllic riverside bungalow near Asheville
description:
Perched on the river's edge, surrounded by trees and rhododendron, this quaint 2000 sq ft bungalow is a nature lover's sanctuary only 7 miles from downtown Asheville. A minimalist urban-boho vibe with OMG river views plus a well-equipped kitchen for stay-at-home meals, high-speed wifi, a work-from-home office/writing space (and bubbling falls just beneath the window), a TV room, and a "let's-never-leave-here" riverfront screened in porch.

The space
This is a brand new listing, and I just opened up the summer months now that my first guests are raving via text during their stay.

It's a special house for a special guest. From the commitment to provide and use only earth-friendly products to the little extras for work-from-home'rs..like circle lights (because Zoom), a laptop riser and the Eero trio for no-fail wifi signal... this house is part mindful retreat space, part work-when-you-have-to, and part nature-paradise. All within 7 miles of downtown an
neighborhood_overview: Because the street is nestled alongside a river, the way out is all uphill. (Cyclists need to know these things!) There is no official public river access here, so privacy is ensured.  If you bring a kayak, you would enter the river from the backyard, and find a way to drive yourself back to the house.
host_about:
Hey - I'm Christine!

I moved to Asheville in the early 90's to escape Northern Virginia and my post-college cubicle job. I wanted to be a songwriter...which thrilled my parents to no end.  

Turns out, Asheville was the perfect place to be creative, get quiet, wake the heck up - and spend the next 15 years as a touring performing songwriter on my own record label. (Shared stages with everyone from The Beach Boys to John Mayer to Nanci Griffith - and made 7 CD's along the way.)

In 2010, as a result of requests from so many creative entrepreneurial types (and being burnt out from 250 days a year on the road), I started a business coaching company here in Asheville. That became an online training resource, and we've hosted clients from all over the world at our retreats and events here. These days, like so many of us, I spend more time on Zoom than anything else. :)

Hosting guests has been an unexpected joy and new passion for me.  I love being able to provide all the amenities and experiences for travelers and vacationers and work-from-homers... mostly based on 15 years of staying in every hotel (ahem, and motel) chain and city across the U.S.  I'm still learning constantly!

I love all things nature. Trees, birds, bears, mountains, dirt. I strive to contribute the creative and natural spirit of this precious spot, even as it grows at a crazy pace.

name: Weekender Cabin 3 Miles from Downtown Asheville
description:
Brand new cabin located 3 miles from downtown Asheville, the Weekender is a perfect home base to enjoy all the area has to offer. Cozy cabin in a beautiful wooded setting, fabulous king size adjustable bed, spacious covered porch to relax and enjoy the outdoors, firepit with complimentary fire wood, gas grill with side burner, microwave, fridge, and complimentary coffee, tea and snacks. We are a short distance from the Blue Ridge Parkway (9 miles away), and Biltmore (6 miles).

The space
New cabin, super clean with beautiful wooded landscape. Watch wild turkeys and sheep graze and enjoy the sunset on the spacious covered porch. After a day of hiking or sight seeing, relax by the firepit or watch your favorite shows on Netflix and Amazon.

If you like to bike there is an excellent greenway that starts a couple of miles away. You can park near New Belgium brewery and bike along the French Broad River to Carrier Park and Hominy Creek greenway for a fl
neighborhood_overview: Wide open neighborhood, beautiful setting only 3 miles from downtown.
host_about: We love to travel, taking motorcycle trips to the many beautiful locations in this part of the country.  We also love hosting, helping others have a great trip and to share our beautiful spot here in Asheville.  Our interests include the outdoors, hiking, cooking, gardening and the farm to table process.

name: Historic DT pet-friendly suite w/hot tub & views!
description:
Enjoy all that Asheville has to offer in a private apartment in our 1880 Victorian home. Period details & all the amenities in a part of Asheville's history. Beautiful mountain & city views, private deck. Quick stroll to Charlotte Street, a leisurely walk to downtown. Close to groceries & Blue Ridge Parkway. Relax in the hot tub or feel nostalgic with some original Nintendo! Kitchenette has microwave, minifridge, toaster oven, & coffee maker. Let us help you stay like a local.

The space
Our space is cozy, historic Asheville with all the comforts of today. Brand new sofa with queen memory foam sleeper! Three original fireplaces, even one in the bathroom. Beautiful glass enclosed shower and exposed brick. Warm, original hardwood floors and high ceilings. Large yard with mature trees and landscaping makes the property feel like a private mountain oasis in the city. Pack & Play available on request!

Guest access
Private entrance and deck, livi
neighborhood_overview: Charlotte Street is a tight knit and friendly neighborhood with beautiful historic homes and great restaurants. Walk to Charlotte Street Pub, Ultimate Ice Cream, Jettie Rae's Oyster House, Bone & Broth, City Bakery, and more! Some of our most popular residents are the black bears who call these mountains home!
host_about: Hi y'all! We are Lindsey and Shaun. We moved to Asheville, NC from Charleston, SC a few years back and would love to welcome you to our beautiful home, built circa 1880. We are world travelers, scotch whisky enthusiasts, and rabid football fans. We have a beautiful daughter, a lovable golden retriever mix, and four crazy kitties. We are inspired by the unique and cozy places we have stayed overseas and strive to recreate the same vibe in our airbnb. We hope to see you soon!

description:

This cozy spot has all new kitchen, appliances, bathrooms, bedrooms, landscaping, fenced in yard with a fire pit and ping pong table in the basement.

The space
This private, convenient getaway has it all - close to trails and nature, downtown restaurants, shops, and breweries, and minutes from interstates and Blue Ridge Parkway.

Guest access

Other things to note
Coffee and Tea selections provided.

name: A bit of seclusion in the city
description:
Welcome to our bit of seclusion in the city. Our spacious and lovely West Asheville home is located just 7 minutes from the heart of downtown Asheville and its bustling restaurants, breweries and coffee shops, and 15 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway. Tucked away on a little known drive surrounded by trees and foliage, and with 70 feet of wrap-around deck overlooking the beautiful Crown Plaza Golf Course, you will forget you are in the city.

The space
Our spacious home offers 2,000 square feet of updated living space perfect for your gathering of friends or family. Quick access to downtown Asheville, the River Arts District and West Asheville.
- Base rate includes occupancy for up to 6 guests. Guests beyond the included 6, incur an additional fee of $50/guest per night., with a total allowed occupancy of 8 guests. No more than 8 guests are permitted.
-Equipped with two living rooms with ample and comfortable seating and two new 60/55” smart TVs
-
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located down a drive with only a few other houses, and is surrounded by lots of trees and the greens of the Crowne Plaza Golf Course. This gives the home a private and secluded feel, but the location is less than 10 minutes away from the heart of downtown Asheville, trendy West Asheville and the River Arts District, and within 15 minutes of the Blue Ridge Parkway.
Some of our favorite breweries, Burial, Hi-Wire, Bhramari and many others are just 10 minutes away. Asheville also has a great culinary scene within minutes from our house. We love Early Girl for breakfast and Laughing Seed, Bouchon and Zambra for dinner among many others.
host_about: Hello from Jesse and Catherine. We are both native North Carolinians but have spent a good deal of time away from our home state. We recently purchased a home in Asheville North Carolina to be closer to our family and to beautiful Western North Carolina where Jesse grew up.

name: Walk to the Asheville River Arts District!
description:
Spectacular new home with a unique combination of location, amenities, and a cliff-top view of the French Broad, River Arts District, Downtown Asheville, and mountains beyond! (view partially blocked by trees in warmer months)

Very spacious 4 bedroom home on 3 levels, but all of the "basics" are available on the walk-in main level with no stair climbing required to access master suite, kitchen, dining area, main living room, and huge back deck.

🤯Due to local regulations, min stay 30 days.

The space
The home is very up-to-date, having been built only 5 years ago, and features wonderful Craftsman-style architectural details. The master suite, great room, main deck, stunning covered porch and kitchen are all on the walk-in level, with no stairs (just one small step up) from the driveway into the home and out to the porch.

Bedrooms #2 and #3 along with an alcove with a desk for remote work are on the upper level, accessed via a beaut
neighborhood_overview:
The Riverview Drive neighborhood is an eclectic mix of newer homes and modest older homes with many architectural styles, ranging from brand new to 70+ years old. It is a very friendly neighborhood with residents as varied as the houses.

It's a 10 minute walk down the hill to the galleries, food, and drink opportunities of the River Arts district and New Belgium Brewery. The heart of downtown Asheville is a 1 mile walk from the River Arts District, with countless shops, galleries, entertainment venues, restaurants, and watering holes between the two. Walk the opposite direction and within a few blocks you will find yourself in the very fun Haywood Rd district with foodie favorites like Taco Billy, Hole Doughnuts, Battle Cats Coffee Bar, Pizza Mind ... the list goes on and on.
host_location: Chapel Hill, North Carolina, United States

We have decided to share our little piece of paradise with others through AirBNB!

description:
Location, Location, Location! Bent Creek House is just minutes from everything Asheville has to offer. Pisgah National Forest trail access & Bent Creek mountain bike trails are less than 1/10 of a mile from the front door! French Broad River access, the AVL Arboretum and the Blue Ridge Parkway are less than 2 miles away! The house is ideally situated less than 9 miles to downtown Asheville, AVL Airport, or the Biltmore Estate. This cozy house offers everything you need for the perfect vacation!

The space
Bent Creek House is located in the quiet, family friendly, Bent Creek neighborhood. Throughout the house you will find new beds and premium bedding. Two renovated bathrooms and new living room furniture add to the overall comfort and enjoyment during your stay. Plenty of comfortable living space on the main level, and additionally, a spacious den with ample seating, card table and board games, and an office space are provided on the lower level. A full sized
neighborhood_overview: If you have kids, or if you want to try out the excellent neighborhood dirt pump track, the Bent Creek Community Park is just a short trail walk through the woods across the street from the house.
host_about: My wife Janna and I have both lived in Asheville for 15 years and we love it here.  I'm sure that you will too!  We've owned our home since 2009 and have put lots of love and sweat into making it what it is.   We want to share this sweet home with others so that it can be enjoyed by all!

The home has hardwood flooring throughout with Carpet in the BR. Stainless steel, modern and well decorated and kept. Other things to note
This unit isn't ADA compliant, BUT it is one level with no steps to the front door.

name: 3 BR home w/hot tub and screened-in porch
description:
Just 10 minutes from the Biltmore Estate and the airport and 20 minutes to downtown Asheville, Weston House is an oasis to come home to after enjoying the wonders of Western North Carolina. Soak in our hot tub after a full day exploring.

Fully stocked kitchen, comfy living room (Netflix, Hulu, HBO and Amazon Prime), 3 bedrooms (King and two full), 2 bathrooms (bidet toilet seats), and Internet (up to 1 gig speed).

Close to Blue Ridge Parkway & NC Arboretum.

The space
Guests have access to the outdoor deck, fire pit, and salt-water hot tub as well as a screened-in porch.

If you are coming into town for business or you just enjoy high-speed Internet access, we have you covered. Up to 1-gig download speed.

Other things to note
-No house parties.
-Please do not wear or use heavily scented products.
-We are a smoke-free/vaping-free property.
-No loud noise after 9:30 pm on the outside of the pr
neighborhood_overview:
This quiet neighborhood is ideal for walkers and runners (if you don't mind a couple hills). There are two Little Free Library's in the neighborhood--one right on our front lawn!

Note that our property backs up to privately owned woods with trails, so at the far end of the backyard, you may see someone walking a dog or riding a bike.
host_about: We met in 2013 and got married five years later. Michael works from home as a project manager for a software company. Rebecca is an online math tutor. We both enjoy traveling as well as meeting new people. We look forward to meeting you --whether you come see us in the mountains of Western North Carolina or we meet you somewhere else around the world.

name: Peaceful Sanctuary Above Artisan Bakery
description:
Our cozy little sanctuary is tucked away in a rural setting, only 15 minutes to downtown Asheville. Surrounded by trees, songbirds will awaken you. We are all-inclusive and love to welcome people of all walks of life. Our house is next to the apartment, so we are available when needed and we are also great at respecting your space. Below the apartment, Nathan bakes his yummy sourdough bread that he sells locally several days per week. If you're tortured by the smell, buy a loaf!

The space
The apartment is furnished with 2 comfy queen beds and a cozy living room couch. The bathroom is spacious with a bathtub and shower. The kitchenette is well-stocked with everything you need for cooking simple meals. Specifically, there is a large-sized mini fridge, toaster oven, 2 burner electric cooktop, microwave, coffee pot with filters, tea pot, and plenty of cookware, dish ware, and utensils. The kitchen is quite small, so I wouldn't recommend planning anything extensive. I
neighborhood_overview: Quiet country neighborhood. About 10-15 minute drive to downtown and 10 minute drive from the heart of West Asheville.
host_about:
Nathan and Michele are excited to host you!
We have been stewards of this property for 4 years now; putting in a duck pond, a flower garden and a bakery, introducing goats and animals to our sweet little spot here in Asheville. We delight in being here on the land and it shows. Our next project is fixing up the upper garage to be a flower studio where Michele will be making her arrangements to bring to the farmer's markets here in town. Nathan sells his bread at these markets too, and if there is some available when you are here be sure to ask for a loaf, it's delicious!
We are so happy to share our land with others, and this really is a place to come relax, be around some sweet pets and barnyard animals, and enjoy asheville while you're at it!
 We look forward to meeting you, 
Nathan & Michele.

description:
Unwind in your private guest suite after a day of touring beautiful Asheville and the mountains. This new home (finished Dec '20) is picture perfect. Enjoy lots of natural light, a private patio and entrance, beautiful bathroom, large yet cozy bedroom, and stylish living space with a modest kitchenette (not for cooking) and dining area. Located in a peaceful cul-de-sac just a short walk from the heart of West Asheville and all of its wonderful restaurants, coffee shops, and boutiques.

The space
Private guest suite with separate entrance

Private patio with outdoor seating

Spacious yet cozy bedroom with queen bed and luxury mattress

Adorable living area with Roku tv, Bose speaker, mini fridge, and coffee station

Community garden, trails and fire pit

Pet friendly (woof only please!) for one time $50 extra cleaning fee

Other things to note
** Please note that there is construction next
neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of funky & hip West Asheville and just a short drive from downtown, our cozy guest suite will be your perfect base for exploring all of Asheville! Local shops, restaurants, breweries, and more on Haywood Road are just a half mile away. Hop on the Blue Ridge Parkway in 15 minutes to see sweeping views of the Appalachian Mountains and access many hiking trails. Although conveniently located to everything, our space is also on a quiet, peaceful, and safe street. Private trails and fire pit are available for the community (and you!) to use!
host_about: Originally from Chicago, I have lived all over the world! What makes my ability to host unique is that I have stayed in dozens of airbnbs, from city apartment stays to farm houses in Italy! I know exactly what I love (and don't) about a home stay and I pride myself on providing you with the best experience possible.

name: "Albergue" Home base for exploring Asheville & WNC
description:
Our home is in charming Montford just north of downtown Asheville. Our lower level private guest suite has its own entry to come and go as you please, while we live above. It has a queen bed, lounge space (w/ fold out double sofa), Wifi & TV, table w/ chairs, and counter area with fridge, microwave, coffee and toaster. We expect you'll spend most your time exploring, and as locals, we offer tips for the outdoors, food, activities, and other unique local favorites. We are covid vaccinated.

The space
Apart from the privacy of the full bathroom, the entire suite is an open floor plan, where different sections serve the purposes of sleeping, lounging, eating and TV watching (with local channels, Netflix, Prime and Hulu streaming). It is ideal for a couple on the Queen bed, but the foldout sofa sleeps an additional two on a Double sized mattress. An infant pack-n-play is available upon request. The windows look out on our wooded backyard, where songbirds greet t
neighborhood_overview: We are located 1.3 miles from downtown, and even if you don't consider that as "walkable" as we do, we encourage everyone to try it if the weather permits, as it passes through Montford, on the same streets that the tourist trolleys drive down to see the historic homes.  We love our immediate neighborhood for its walkability, unique homes from different time periods, tree-filled tranquility and friendly neighbors.  Even the black bears are regular visitors (we've seen them more in our neighborhood than we have in years of hiking in the mountains).  They are always docile, just sniffing around for food, and will go on their way peacefully if they are not antagonized.  As for or human food, there are several neighborhood restaurants that are walkable, the closest being Nine Mile (Jamaican themed) which is one of Asheville's most popular.
host_about: I've traveled a good bit for both personal and work reasons, and the travel I've most enjoyed has been culturally immersive travels and living short stints in other countries.  I work as an educational travel planner and history tour guide.  Living in a really cool city amid natural scenery has allowed me to also play host.  I enjoy giving tips on the things I enjoy in my area - mountain trails, music venues, microbreweries, eclectic restaurants, dancing, festivals, urban walking/biking/running, water activities.  The same things I'll enjoy doing/exploring in your area.

name: 35 Carolina Lane Loft :Elegant + Edgy  Loft downtown on Historic Alley
description:
Secreted into the heart of the city – an industrial 2-bedroom loft, cloaked within the confines of a one-way alley, long known only to the real Asheville. A block once devoted to agriculture, today ensconced within the multicultural vibe of downtown. A modern-yet-historic, industrial-while-inviting, convenient-but-secluded (as cities go) kind of place.

The space
This is 35 Carolina Lane. This is a historic and quintessential Asheville loft: Two bedrooms. One bathroom. And heaps of history: A aged brick façade. Wizened wood floors. An antique clawfoot tub. Stone underfoot. Heavy old doors. All those oh-the-stories-we-could-tell details you crave.

This is 35 Carolina Lane. This is a thoroughly updated industrial loft, modernized for today’s traveler: Professional design. Combed concrete walls. Custom artwork. Bold colors. Partitioned walls. Modern appliances. A fully equipped kitchen. Both heat and air-conditioning. A dedicated washer/dryer. All those
neighborhood_overview:
☀☀☀ LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! ☀☀☀
If you’ve ever wandered through downtown Asheville, then you’ve felt the wanderlust (and “wonder-lust)” of this historic warren.

Here, connecting two of the city’s most sought-after streets – W. Walnut and Woodfin/Hiawassee – Carolina Lane is a quiet (for the city) alley, long known to the real Asheville. This is where Oscar winning actress Frances McDormond conspicuously smoked her cigarettes after a day of filming in the area and industry once reigned. And this neighborhood? Well, it’s still a place where restaurants go unadvertised and the best bars have no signs, just a door. A place where high-end art galleries about record shops, upscale shoe stores, and more.

And, while Real Life may be about compromise – sacrifice This to get That – we believe that vacation should be a special time. A time you get both This and That, no compromise required.

35 Caroline Lane is your no-compromise-required destinat
host_about:
Growing up Santa Fe, NM I saw a unique blend of artistic community, endless outdoor opportunities, interesting history, beautiful landscapes, and a diverse mix of cultures.

Though far from Santa Fe and a different climate, I arrived in Asheville in the early 90’s to practice Chinese Medicine and felt some of the same elements at play.  Asheville was not well known, but you could feel the energy building and the mixture of art, landscape, environment, history and community all coming together.  It reminded me of my ‘early days’ in Santa Fe.  

One of my closest friends was Andy Brokmeyer, who I told for several years that he needed to come to Asheville, as it was a dynamic and exciting place.  We were also avid kayakers, and Asheville has been a Mecca for kayaking since the early days of the sport so I knew I could lure him out with the promise of all the great rivers in the area. 

He came out ‘for a visit’ and hasn’t left.  That was 16 years ago.  

Asheville has grown into the most happening place in the region, far beyond my expectations, and has sustained an authentic, community oriented and dynamic quality.  Like my dad used to say about few places, it has ‘cultural energy’. 

Though both Andy and I had done some residential real estate investment and development, 80 N Lexington was our first move into the commercial side.  It was an old building, greatly in need of repair, and was a bit removed from the core downtown commercial traffic.  We scraped together what we could and fixed it up, with an eye towards something special in the future. 
 
Now, many years later, North Lexington Ave is hopping, with restaurants, breweries, bars, tea houses, coffee shops, galleries and wonderful, diverse retail shops right out the door.  

And 80 N Lexington has been transformed into a blend of funky, hip, and industrial intertwined with lush, upscale design.  A mix of style and comfort that is unique and authentically Asheville.  

Just like Asheville, there’s nothing quite like it.

name: Beautiful Guest Suite by Parkway and Bent Creek!
description:
You'll be right at the edge of the Blue Ridge Parkway, Bent Creek Forest, the Asheville Arboretum, and the Asheville Outlets in this beautiful guest suite! Relax in the spacious, well-lit living and dining area with a convenient kitchenette. Or take in the fresh air in the outdoor seating area. Enjoy the beautiful tiled bathroom with deluxe shower and soaking tub. This suite sleeps 1-4 people with a queen size bed and futon/double bed. Plus, it's solar powered!

The space
This comfortable guest suite is newly built with lots of beautiful details. You can come and go with your own separate entrance. The kitchenette includes a mini fridge, microwave, dishes, coffee maker, electric tea kettle, coffee, tea, and Brita filter with purified water. There's a bedroom with a queen bed and a futon in the living area that can fold out into a double bed. The beautiful tiled bathroom has a deep soaking tub and deluxe shower head with adjustable massage jets.

If you'
neighborhood_overview: We're located in the Bent Creek neighborhood, a pleasant and quiet area full of people who love the easy access to the great outdoors.
host_about: I love the southern Appalachian Mountains. They offer some of the most remote and pristine areas in the world and my wife, Rose, and I love to explore them all. When I'm not working, I try to climb the cliffs, bike the trails or hike to mountain peaks . If I'm hanging out and relaxing in the town of Asheville, I'm out eating tasty food, seeing vibrant music or enjoying a nice craft beer.

description:
Beautifully renovated 1917 home in Historic Monford District near downtown Asheville.
Welcoming front porch with plenty of wicker furniture to sit and relax on~
Wonderful neighborhood to walk about, two children’s parks, the greenway and several great restaurants to walk to within the neighborhood. Chiesa, Nine Mile and All Day Darling just blocks away. Whole Foods, Trader Joe’s and Harris Teeter are all within walking distance.

The space
Home is within blocks of great eateries, outdoor theater, bars, children’s parks and greenway!
Whole Foods, Trader Joe’s and Harris Teeter are also within walking distance.
Downtown is just a 7 min walk!

Guest access
Guests will have the home to themselves. There is a lovely front porch to spend time enjoying being outside.

Home is located in Historic Monford district of downtown Asheville NC. It is beautiful neighborhood to walk in. There are several great restaurants within a couple of blocks!

name: Blue Pines Getaway! Cozy & modern w/deck 15 to AVL
description:
Welcome to Blue Pines Getaway! This adorable home is nestled in a quiet, friendly neighborhood with beautiful mature trees, just south of Asheville. With easy access to a main road, you can get into Asheville or to any of the local restaurants, shops, hiking trails, or breweries very quickly. Many favorite local eateries are within minutes of the home, and the AVL airport is a 13 minute drive. We also provide custom-curated Google maps so our guests can take our local recommendations on the go!

The space
This 3 bed, 2.5 bath home has a cozy contemporary feel you won’t want to leave. The home comes fully furnished with an inviting sectional sofa, a dining table and bar top, as well as a separate workspace (with Wifi!) for when you need to answer some emails. Enjoy the open-concept living area with your friends and family, catch up on your favorite show, whip up some dinner inside or out on the grill, or soak in the quiet sounds of nature on the huge back deck. name: Little Hickory Top - Mountain Side Modern Cabin
description:
Welcome to Little Hickory Top Cabin. Named after the mountain it overlooks, this beautiful new modern cabin is perched on a ridge facing Bent Creek Experimental Forest. Convenient location offers easy access to all that Asheville has to offer. Find rest and recharge with beautiful views from every room, and a great deck to grill from.

The space
This modern cabin is warm and welcoming with beautiful features throughout, including large timber framed ceilings and stairs. The home is three stories with a common area on the main floor and bedrooms on the upper and lower. It is EcoStar certified and was featured in the 2020 Asheville Parade of Homes!

Guest access
The whole home is yours to enjoy, except the owners/cleaning closet.

Other things to note
For those interested in working remote or needing connectivity the home has 400Mbps cable internet service and a Orbi Mesh router to ensure good WiFi throughout the hou
neighborhood_overview: The home is nestled in a quite cove behind Bent Creek Experimental Forest and Enka Lake. There is access into the forest less then a mile away while still convenient to the city.  20 minutes to downtown Asheville,  Biltmore Estate,  and the main entrance to Bent Creek.  30 Minutes from the Airport and Sierra Nevada.   If you enjoy mountain biking and want to explore some classic Pisgah loops you are 40 minutes from the entrance to the Ranger District.
host_about: Hi  from the mountains of North Carolina near Asheville  where we live and play with our three kids; Hayley, Graham, and Colin. Becca is a CPA turned stay at home mom and Austin is a mechanical engineer. We enjoy hiking, mountain biking, camping, craft beer and good food!  As tourists we love to explore new areas and experience the outdoors, as hosts we welcome you to our city and share what we love about Asheville and why we call it home.

name: Stone's Throw Studio★2 Min Walk to Hip West AVL!
description:
Located on a tree-lined street, steps away from restaurants, cafes, breweries, music venues & shopping on the vibrant Haywood Rd. corridor in West Asheville. Stone’s Throw is a newly constructed guest suite attached to our 1920’s bungalow, accessible through a private exterior entrance. Just a short drive to the arts district, downtown, Biltmore, mountains and lakes. We’ve lived in here for 20 years and strive to provide a welcome retreat for visitors. We love to give recommendations too!

The space
The suite is newly constructed, with vaulted ceilings. There is great sunlight during daytime and blackout shades for peaceful sleep. Your sleeping area has a king-size Tuft and Needle mattress, a closet and small set of drawers for clothes storage, in addition to two luggage racks. The bathroom is brand new and we provide shampoo, conditioner, and soap.

The kitchenette has a small fridge/freezer, microwave, coffee and tea station. We provide plates,
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood and our tree-lined street full of 1920s bungalows! Within steps from our house are many local shops - a market, coffee and tea shops, incredible restaurants, local pubs, a bookstore, comic book shop.  It's also a great neighborhood for walks, runs, and bike rides - there's a park right down the street too.
host_about: I live in the beautiful mountains of Asheville, NC and love to travel!  I own a small public health research consulting company, and work with organizations to help them measure the impact of their work.

name: Large Studio Near Everything w/ King Bed
description:
Newly renovated home, steps away from the Blue Ridge Parkway and Mountains to Sea Trail. The room is 400 sq ft, complete with: a new kitchenette, private living area, full closet and wall mounted flat screen TV with Roku. Stairs lead to studio.

Perfect for a quiet vacation, or a convenient base for taking advantage of all Asheville has to offer. I am a craft brewing industry professional and outdoor enthusiast, so you'll have expert advice at your fingertips. I have had both COVID vaccines.

The space
An amazing location!

A 7 minute drive will place you in all of the most visited places in Asheville, including: Downtown Asheville, the Biltmore House/Biltmore Village, Hiking/Outdoor Activities, Breweries, Shopping and the WNC Nature Center. Situated in a walkable and wooded community with views of the Blue Ridge Parkway from the front porch (a favorite morning coffee ritual). There is something in bloom nearly year round on the property an
neighborhood_overview: Oakley is a little community just outside of Bilmore Village and full of walkers and runners. Springtime is booming with blooms and color with well maintained yards and neighbors that take pride in the natural location.  During the Fall, the road my home is on is easily one of the most beautiful for color.  Finish your leaf peeping with a beverage on the front porch and a very close vista of the Parkway you just visited.  Full of mature trees, a small nearby ranch and somehow convenient to EVERYTHING!
host_about: I am a Marketing and Creative Director for the craft beverage industry in Asheville, NC. Most of my 20s & 30s were spent traveling and living abroad in some of the most interesting places. I have had careers as a SCUBA instructor in Thailand and Indonesia, Outdoor Adventure Instruction/Guide in Western North Carolina, Business and Creative Consultant and Boxing Instructor. My latest passion is a Non-profit I co-founded called "Asheville Strong". This project serves our community with food insecurities and supports the Food and Beverage community effected by the shut-down in March 2020.

name: Long Cove Cottage minutes to West Asheville
description:
This cozy cottage guesthouse has been completely renovated and redesigned to be a serene getaway in the mountains just minutes from downtown, west Asheville and the Biltmore.

Tucked away in a rural country setting the cottage features 2 queen bedrooms and 1 bathroom. An open kitchen layout flows into the living room. The kitchen is equipped with new appliances and all cooking essentials.

Need to work? We have fast and secure WIFI. Need to relax? Enjoy Netflix, HBO, and Prime video channels.

The space
Location:

Located just 15 minutes from the Biltmore Estate (largest mansion in America) and West Asheville - known for local shops, yummy eateries, breweries, music venues and coffee shops.

Just 20 minutes to downtown Asheville - lots of shopping, restaurants, and a true Asheville-style drum circle every Friday night.

The cottage is located 2 miles south of beautiful Biltmore Lake, tucked away on a private road
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is located 2 miles south of beautiful Biltmore Lake, tucked away on a private road shared by several nearby neighbors. There’s a country feel here in the cove that is unique to rural mountain living. Greet the morning with sounds of roosters in the distance, and birdsongs throughout the day. It’s a serene getaway from the hustle and bustle yet a short drive to all of Asheville’s popular destinations.
host_about:
Hi, my name is Charmie. Me and my husband Aaron along with our daughter Oriana and Yorkie, Gonzo want to welcome you!

We have a passion for travel, design, and Asian food.

We both work remotely, currently living part of the year in Southern California and the other part in Western North Carolina. On my spare time, I like to explore my passion for textiles through my online shop New Crop Shop, and Aaron loves diving into wood projects.

We look forward to hosting you in our home!

WiFi

The space
Picture your vacation drive just minutes off the interstate to a quiet neighborhood as you arrive at Mountain Escape. As you pull in, you’ll notice a simple garden with blooming flowers and small walkway to the home. There’s a good chance you’ll see Peter and his hunny bunny Lola in the front yard eating clover in the late afternoon.

As you enter this clutter free clean space you’ll notice a little welcome gift on the living room coffee table. Decide on which of the three rooms you’ll stay in. Blue and calm King Kong with an ensuite. Bright and airy Misfit room with a queen bed and sunrise facing. neighborhood_overview: This location has everything. 5 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Bent Creek for hiking, swimming and beautiful waterfalls. Relax and float down the river tubing. 5 minutes to Biltmore Park for movies, dining and shopping. This home has options for meal delivery if you want to stay in for the night. Centrally located means only 15 minutes drive to  west, or downtown Asheville and downtown Hendersonville!
host_about:
Excited to share my town with families, outdoor enthusiasts, those teleworking looking for a change in scenery and the romantics. I’m dedicated to ensuring your stay at Mountain Escape is enjoyable. 

I have a large family including my husband four kiddos. We welcome everyone to Asheville and our property to enjoy.

description:
*NEW* Surrounded by a bamboo forest just outside of Asheville, our private, luxe loft-style home has high ceilings and ample natural light that fills the space all hours of the day. Professionally designed for comfort and style you might not want to leave! If you do, you're just 10 minutes from the heart of Asheville's River Arts District or UNCA. This location is also close to a ton of outdoor activities such as rafting and floating the French Broad River. Whoever you are, you are welcome here!

The space
This private home is tucked away just outside of Asheville in the Woodfin area making for a quiet and relaxing respite but just 10 minutes to the heart of the River Arts District - home to award-winning restaurants, breweries, an urban winery, the greenway along the French Broad River, and tons of artist studios.

The two bedrooms boast cozy amenities. The downstairs bedroom has a queen size Avocado mattress. The upstairs loft bedroom, with an open vie
neighborhood_overview: We are just outside Asheville (about  12mins drive to downtown) in a developed rural/suburban area with some farmland. It’s quiet and country-like!
host_about:
I live in the beautiful smoky mountains of western NC and am happy to wander around these old hills when I'm not traveling. I'm an environmental educator and live for spending time outdoors with my husband and son. I travel a lot for work & pleasure so Air BnB has been great for me. 

As a host, I have taken care to provide the kind of space that makes me feel comfortable. Cleanliness, coziness, convenience, and affordability are my top priorities. My guests’ experience is very important to me. I hope you’ll stay and enjoy everything these majestic mountains have to offer!

Leave the city behind for the mountains of Asheville when you retreat to this 5-bedroom, 3-bath vacation rental! This 2-story getaway boasts multiple outdoor seating areas overlooking the Blue Ridge Mountains, a hot tub, and a game room; there’s something for everyone! The house is under 10 miles from the Biltmore Estate and downtown Asheville so you can easily fill your days with city and historical sights. With Blue Ridge Parkway nearby, you’ll also find outdoor fun within easy reach.

name: The Happy Bluebird - AVL’s BEST Nest!
description:
Welcome to Asheville's Happy Bluebird Home!!! A Completely Updated, Artsy, Executive Monthly 4BR/2BA North Asheville Rental! Close to Beaver Lake Trail, the Bird Sanctuary & only 10 minutes UBER to downtown Asheville! If you want to be a part of what's happening in AVL, yet have privacy...this is the place!!! HOP on over...to AVL's SAVORY Cecilia’s Restaurant just 5 minutes away or ENJOY a breakfast pastry from Geraldine’s Bakery! Live Music at AVL’s Salvage Station, breweries & MORE!

The space
Book today and be the the EARLY BIRD! You could be the FIRST to enjoy the BRAND NEW stainless kitchen appliances, granite countertops, NEW hardwood floors and large covered front porch with close Mountain Views! Excellent high speed Wifi provided.. Off street parking for 2-3 cars (first driveway on the right). In the wintertime you will need 4-wheel drive due to possible snow on the small hill. Onsite spacious laundry. Quiet, nestled in the tree’s neighborhoo
neighborhood_overview: Beaverdam in N AVL is 10 minutes to downtown,  close to Grove Park Inn and has wonderful restaurants:  Cecilia’s, Geraldine’s, Stony Knob, Green Sage and more!  Beaver Lake Trails and the N Asheville Bird Sanctary are 6 minutes away!   You are also 8 minutes from UNCA’s Botanical Gardens and Farmer’s Market (on Saturdays)!   You are Less than 15 -minutes to the River Arts District, the Biltmore House, Biltmore Village and easy access to the interstate, the Blue Ridge Parkway, tubing the French Broad River and local breweries as the Bluebird flies!
host_about: I am originally from Cambodia. I am an artist, painter, and forager of wild mushrooms and medicinal plants. I love hiking and Frame drumming in the Layne Redmond and River Guerguerian styles. I work by taking old broken homes and transforming them into beautiful places for a soul to live .I love to cook great food,Contra Dance and more..., keep honeybees ,chickens,bunnys,and garden.

Welcome to Asheville! Our home is located a short 5 minute drive from downtown, breweries, the French Broad river, and many local music and outdoor venues and events. I am also fully vaccinated.

We are quirky and colorful. We love meeting new people from around the world. Our house is a shared space with you. You have a private kitchenette, bedroom and living room. The bathroom downstairs is private for you to use, it is located in the hallway next to your suite.

The space
You will open the wooden gate to find a fun, colorful, eclectic surprise. Listen to the birds sing. Bring a guitar, drum, or flute and sit around the fire pit. Guest access
Please park in the front of the house. Enter through the wooden gate down the driveway.

host_about:
Hello - We are a family from Austin, Texas that love providing great experiences to travelers from around the world - Over 4,000 Groups Hosted so far!

We are "Digital Nomads" that love to work remotely while traveling with our little guy Jackson (26 Countries by age 2 - zero since Covid)! We’ve taken what we've learned from staying in over 100 Airbnbs (in 35 Countries) to create the best possible experience for our guests! 

Sean will handle everything related to your stay. He is the CEO of our business, Stay Work And Play (SWAP CoHosting) and will make sure you have a great time! Lindsey founded SWAP in 2015 but spends her time focusing on her business of 19 years, American Dance Training Camps.   

We are passionate about creating a great experience for our guests and we can’t wait to help  you have an unforgettable trip! Please reach out with any questions....otherwise book and we will make sure you have a blast staying with us!

name: Firefly Farmhouse -A cozy retreat/romantic getaway
description:
You'll enjoy relaxing in the porch swing as the evening shadows deepen, sipping a glass of wine and watching the horses graze. Private retreat close to all the area attractions. The Blue Ridge Parkway, the Biltmore House, hiking trails, brewery tours and shopping are close at hand. A getaway complete with washer/dryer, full kitchen with a fully equipped coffee/tea bar. Parking is free and close at hand. No cable but a smart TV with internet to enjoy your favorite subscription channels.

The space
This guest house is a stand alone cottage located on our property. This cottage consists of a open plan downstairs with a living area and small island with 2 bar stools, small kitchen area and a well equipped tea/coffee bar. Upstairs is a bedroom and bath, with a queen bed; a bath with tub and shower.

Beside the cottage is our own home occupied by myself and my husband. We have a small West Highland terrier named Westie who stays within his own fenced yard un
neighborhood_overview: We are in a rural area close to Asheville and Hendersonville. We are close (3 miles) to a small town, Fletcher, which has an urgent care, CVS, Ingles grocery and several unique eating establishments.
host_about:
Retired Social Worker with Appalchian State University. My husband, Gary and I love to travel. We have a vintage 1962 Shasta Trailer which we pull with a 1965 GMC pickup, bought new by Gary's dad. We have 4 adult children, 6 grandchildren and 3 great grandchildren. I am an Okie and my husband is a Texan who now call North Carolina home. We have a very sweet Westie, named Shiloh, who usually travels with us...though sometimes he has a kennel getaway of his own. 
I guess if we have a motto it would be that we are more interested in doing, being and going than on having.
My husband plays the hammered dulcimer and bass guitar. He loves to fish and is a skilled woodworker. 
I seek out beautiful sunsets and photographing local people and places when we travel.

name: New Stylish Upscale Condo in Downtown Asheville
description:
Enjoy your stay at our stylish and new downtown condo which includes 1 bedroom/1 bath. Elegant and modern touches throughout include a velvet chesterfield sofa, local Asheville Art, and Pac-man Icade featuring favorite games from the '80s including Centipede, Galaga, Frogger, and many more! The bedroom includes a comfy king-size bed and a large walk-in shower. This beautiful space is within walking distance to everything Asheville has to offer and a short drive to Biltmore Estates and Village.

The space
Our condo is new, and we personalized the space switching out many of the standard features such as the doorknobs, kitchen hardware, and chandelier. There's a pullout queen sofa, and our total space is about 570 sqft. It can accommodate 4 guests, however, it's best suited for 2-3 people.

Guest access
Keypad access. One parking spot is included with the Condo. If you have more than one vehicle there are several nearby parking garages.
neighborhood_overview: Fantastic location in downtown Asheville and within walking distance to all of downtown. Close to Wicked Weed, South Slope, Asheville's top restaurant's Curate, and Limones. Next door to Foundry Hotel.
host_location: Black Mountain, North Carolina, United States
host_about: My husband and I live in Black Mountain, NC. We manage our condo in downtown Asheville to give our guests a personalized experience. We are residential builders and create customized beautiful houses. We love to travel and stay at other Airbnb's!

Relax and enjoy the sights and sounds of nature in our newly renovated home located only 7 miles from downtown Asheville. Located in a quiet country setting this house comes with plenty of amenities. This house features a relaxing dining area or laptop friendly workspace with a bay window, a screened in sunroom, a large front and backyard for games or just watching the deer that frequently pass through. Cornhole game on site for your enjoyment.

name: Whole Renovated Home Minutes to Downtown Asheville
description:
Spacious and freshly renovated entire home, only 10 minutes to Downtown Asheville! Huge kitchen, open living spaces, and a large back yard with deck make this home the perfect getaway for large and small groups. Just two miles from Biltmore village, this location gives convenient access to everything in the city in the setting of a peaceful neighborhood.

The space
An entire home just minutes from everything Asheville has to offer. One king bedroom has an en-suite large soaking tub and separate shower. The second full bathroom is located near the center of the home. The second bedroom also has a king sized bed, while a third bedroom has two queen sized beds. There are two queen sized pull-out sofas, which are surprisingly comfortable. All furnishings are brand new!

Guest access
Guests should feel free to use the entire property. The front and back yard are both sizable, with the backyard being fully fenced.
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is serene but less than a mile from many things Asheville has to offer. Azalia Park and the Nature Center are very close, as are several Asheville breweries.
host_about: Hello fellow travelers! I'm Jenna and I am so happy to have found my love for hosting. I travel frequently with my husband, Ryan, and our young son. We have always preferred the locals' experience provided by a great homestay. I strive to give my guests the same quality vacation that I would expect for my family.

name: Luxury Chalet w/King Bds + Hot Tub + 15 min to AVL
description:
This chalet features a hot tub, garden dining, fenced in yard and king size beds. Look out through the windows over the trees and as far as the Blue Ridge Parkway. The morning views from the deck are breathtaking, and you may spot a fox or bear. Nestled on top of Buffalo Mountain, this hideaway is charming, romantic and relaxing. A scenic 15-minute drive from both downtown Asheville and Black Mountain, this nook is the perfect peaceful getaway.

The space
You won't be disappointed by gorgeous decor and comfort of this home. It is fully stocked, has two living rooms, and 3 porches on different levels for taking in the views! It features 2 bedrooms with king size beds and private baths. The property is surrounded by trees which creates a treehouse feel and complete privacy. The mountain that the house sits on has a direct view across the valley to a famous lookout spot on the blue ridge parkway, (you get the opposite view right from your porch)! *Please see note abo
neighborhood_overview: Overlooking a valley filled with green pastures, winding brooks, cows, sheep and the occasional wild turkey, this neighborhood offers ample options for exploration. Enjoy a stroll up the hill, or venture further on one of the many accessible hikes surrounding the valley. For urban-based fun, explore Asheville's breweries and renowned restaurants. Enjoy one of Asheville's many downtown festivals and free concerts, or visit the eclectic art galleries scattered across town.
host_about:
Hello! I adore the charming, eccentric, creative, outdoorsy city of Asheville so much that sharing it with other people is a true passion for me. I have been an Airbnb host since October 2019 and have hosted people from all over the world. I love connecting with travelers and providing insight on the nuances of this vibrant city, while doing everything I can to make your stay in Asheville a phenomenal one. I'm always available via phone or the app and am happy to answer any and all questions you have!  

I love to cook and eat, so many of my recommendations revolve around food. I'm guessing if you are visiting Asheville for the first time you were probably drawn in by the food and/or beer scene, so we already have something in common! I also have lots of ideas on fun things to do in Asheville, there is always something interesting going on! Thanks so much for reading about me, I look forward to meeting you!
Best wishes, Christy

name: Easy Breezy in walkable West Asheville
description:
Welcome to West Asheville! Walkable to West Asheville’s best restaurants, bars and shops and a quick drive to amazing hikes and scenic drives that make the Blue Ridge Mountains so popular. Quiet street, cozy home, lots of space and an outdoor patio all your own!

The space
You'll be staying in my downstairs apartment which has lots of windows for natural light, 2 bedrooms (queen beds), a full bath (shower only) with washer and dryer, kitchenette and living room with comfy seating (+ full size sofa bed). The entire space is for your enjoyment. The apartment includes a TV with a firestick. Sign in to any of the apps to watch all the things. Just out the back door is a covered patio with a bistro table and 2 Adirondack chairs for your use.

Guest access
You have access to the entire apartment, with a separate entrance and an outdoor patio for your use. Parking is limited to 2 cars. I reserve the driveway for your cars, so please reserve the gra
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville boasts fun restaurants, watering holes and easy access to all the fun urban and scenic parts of Asheville. Walkable to Sunny Point, One World Brewing, Zia Taqueria, Haywood Commons and the new Cellarist Beer Project.
host_about: Biker, hiker, yogi living in the mountains and traveling as much as I can.

name: The Westside Rancher: *Cozy *Countryside Retreat*
description:
The Westside Rancher is a single story ranch style home beautifully designed for you to experience Asheville like a local. This home is tucked away in the secluded countryside of West Asheville. You will be surrounded by lush landscape, blooming cherry tress, and bustling wildlife. This 3 bed 2 bath home has been remodeled with love and is a perfect home base to explore all that Asheville has to offer.

The space
Whether you are visiting to relax, unwind, explore, or adventure experiencing comfort is key. You can enjoy our newly built outdoor deck while barbequing with a view of the large grass area perfect for a game of corn hole, eating around the table under the shade of an umbrella, and sitting around the fire feature under café lights in the evening with friends, family, and loved ones. Inside you will find well-appointed bedrooms as you sink into our comfortable beds after a long day of exploring Asheville’s beautiful nature, storage space for personal item
neighborhood_overview:
This secluded neighborhood is on a No Outlet Street which means only the locals usually drive by. This is a Safe and Friendly neighborhood as you may see residents walking in the morning and afternoon waving high as they past by. Also look out for deer and wild turkeys on and near the property.

*A suggestion : Start your trip with a visit to the WNC Farmers Market just 2 miles away where you will find a year-round daily market with indoor & covered stalls showcasing local produce, crafts & plants.

The Westside rancher is centrally located to all that Asheville has to offer. Asheville Outlets 9 min, Westside Ashville Haywood Rd. 9 min, Biltmore Estate 12 min, River Arts District 12 min, Downtown Asheville 13 min, Blue Ridge Parkway 14 min, Asheville Arboretum 16 min, Asheville Airport 21 min to name a few.
host_about: Maria & I are excited to Host guests in our Airbnb -The Westside Rancher in beautiful Asheville NC. Hosting a beautifully designed home for you all is a dream come true. We look forward to your stay and giving you a 5 star experience. Thank you Airbnb for this opportunity.

name: Quiet Bent Creek Bungalow - 1 mile from Parkway
description:
Relax & restore in this private Bent Creek bungalow on over an acre of land & gorgeous wooded views. Perfect central location! Within 1 mile of: the NC Arboretum, Blue Ridge Parkway, Bent Creek hiking & mountain biking trails, Asheville Outlets, French Broad River put-in, and 1-26. A short 9 miles to The Biltmore Estate & Biltmore Village for boutique shopping & local eats. 6 miles to trendy West Asheville for some of the best local hotspots. Enjoy our two large porches for a night of grilling!

The space
Charming boho bungalow with enough greenery throughout the home for all the fellow plant lovers! Beautiful open concept living and dining space. Washer and dryer and large fully-stocked kitchen including complementary tea and coffee. Both mattresses are hybrid memory foams for your comfort! Two large porches for grilling and enjoying the crisp mountain air. Over an acre of green space for outdoor games & plenty of play space for the kiddos. Have fun playing corn
neighborhood_overview: QUIET, beautiful, wooded neighborhood with spaced out lots and homes.
host_about:
Husband & wife native to the blue ridge mountains of Asheville, NC currently living the island life. We live for travel and truly believe adventures make not only the greatest memories but teach us the greatest lessons! We try to spend as much time as possible outdoors soaking up everything this world has to offer. 

We fell in love with Airbnb and decided to become hosts ourselves with two wonderful friends and local Asheville co-hosts.

name: Woodsy Hideaway near Downtown, Parkway, Biltmore
description:
Brand new airy & private guest suite in a woodsy location with private gravel driveway/parking tucked away at our Kenilworth home near downtown Asheville. Private entrance with attached patio and outdoor seating as well as a new private bathroom.

The space
Bright and airy suite has a private key code entrance, queen bed, double bed in loft via ladder, new private bathroom, small desk, open air closet with iron and board, sitting area with sofa, and coffee table for lounging or eating leftovers; complete kitchenette with coffee, electric kettle, mini-fridge/freezer, toaster and microwave; outdoor patio with cafe lights and seating

The new bathroom is a small efficient use of space. Please note the photos for size & space in the bathroom.

Driveway and parking are gravel and only 2 cars allowed max.

The loft bed and ladder are at your own risk. Please note that during the summer the loft is prett

The neighborhood is great for walking, running and cycling with lake and mountain/city views nearby.  The Blue Ridge Parkway and Mountains to Sea hiking trail are less than a 10 minute drive and Downtown is even closer.  Driving or Ubering is best when headed into town.
host_about: Love travelling with my family and friends and staying in unique homes and areas all over so excited to share a part of our home with folks.

name: Hilltop getaway in the heart of West Asheville
description:
Welcome to Holly Street Hill-top, the coolest handcrafted home in the heart of West Asheville. Located mere minutes from all the popular locations of the surrounding Asheville area, get ready to relax with all the cozy comforts of home, or go out and explore what the town has to offer. Featuring 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, entertainment room, and 2 scenic porches.

The space
Each room in the home is unique and offers a personalized touch with exceptional comforts. The funky living room has a large Smart TV for all your entertainment needs. An intimate dining area adjoins the kitchen where you can enjoy your coffee with the best morning light! Each bedroom has its own full bathroom. The second story is expansive, complete with a king bed, Smart TV, walk-in closet, huge shower with dual shower heads, office desk and a reading nook.
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a serene and walkable neighborhood, encompassed by the French Broad River. This quaint area of town offers a wide variety of activities to do, things to see, and local businesses to support. It's a laid back neighborhood community, where you will find people outside gardening, walking dogs, and having picnics. There is sure to be live music and an active nightlife at one of the many bars along Haywood Street. Ask me about my favorite bars and restaurants!
host_about: Hello, I’m David, originally from Pennsylvania but have lived in Asheville for 8 years and call this beautiful city my home. I moved here to build energy efficient houses and never left. The city offers everything I need and more; Scenery, great people, social groups, sporting events, unbelievable music, a variety of cuisine, pristine water features, and an optimal gardening seasons. I’m happy to live here and share my home with you.

name: Charming Asheville Studio Escape
description:
Our studio is a newly furnished, modern rustic open concept suite with its own private entry in North Asheville. Located in the ground floor of our 1 acre property, the private 700 sq ft studio is provided with ample parking on the property. The space has a living area with a couch and coffee table, a sleeping area with queen size bed and TV, a dining area with coffee bar, mini fridge and microwave for simple meals and breakfast, and your own private full bathroom. Free Wi-Fi is also provided.

The space
You will enjoy your stay in this spacious 700 sq ft private studio apartment with its own entrance, private bathroom and outdoor space. It has a 9 ft ceiling, ceiling fan and decorated in a modern rustic style. You will find everything you need in terms of hotel amenities such as a fridge, coffee bar, utensils, linens and toiletries. Perfect for either vacation or business trips, and your base for exploring surrounding area, activities and attractions.
neighborhood_overview: It's a quite and safe neighborhood in North Asheville. An easy reach to the French Broad River for kayaking, 10 minute to downtown Asheville, RiverArt district, BlueRidge Parkway, New Belgium Brewery and West Asheville for all the dining and activity options. 15 minutes to Biltmore village and Biltmore Estate
host_about:
I am a pastry chef and a former banker. My husband is a marketing strategist and an Artist, we love to travel, to learn about different cultures and languages. Currently, we are learning about gardening and sustainable living. 

Originally from Hong Kong, now reside in Asheville NC with my husband, our French bulldog Arnold and our Yorkie Maisy. We are happy to have found a beautiful place in Asheville NC to call home and would like to show you this artistic, friendly, green, and energetic city!

My motto: Live in the moment

description: Welcome to the Advantageous Asheville Home!  We are on half an acre of quiet peaceful land. Our four bedrooms are spacious and comfortable. neighborhood_overview: We are on a flag lot in a small neighborhood. The house it tucked behind another home and provides a private and quiet setting!
host_about: I have lived in Asheville since 2005. I have a beautiful daughter. Our greatest passion is to love God and to love people exceptionally well! We really enjoy having our family and friends over a lot, going hiking on the weekends, eating great food at different restaurants in the area, and serving our city as a part of our faith community.
