name: NEW! ‘Oakley Cottage’ - 4 Mi to Blue Ridge Parkway
description:
Escape to the Blue Ridge Mountains and book a stay at the charming 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom vacation rental in Asheville! Take advantage of nearby outdoor attractions and spend your days hiking through the Chimney Rock State Park, shredding the slopes at the Wolf Ridge Ski Resort, or exploring the Blue Ridge Parkway. After, head downtown and enjoy a locally-brewed craft beer. Finish the night back at this cozy cottage relaxing on the private deck with your furry friend by your side!

The space
Free WiFi (50 Mbps) | Dog Friendly w/ Fee | Keyless Entry

Boasting all the essential comforts, this conveniently located cottage is the perfect home base for small families or a group of friends looking to get outdoors and explore the beauty of Asheville!

Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed

KITCHEN: Fully equipped, cooking basics, drip coffee maker, toaster, knife set, dishware & flatware
MAIN FEATURES: Smart TV w/ cable, 4-perso
neighborhood_overview:
ASHEVILLE ATTRACTIONS: Biltmore Estate (3.3 miles), Biltmore Park Town Square (7.2 miles), Grovewood Village (7.4 miles), Asheville Treetops Adventure Park (7.8 miles), River Arts District (8.0 miles)
BREWERIES: Asheville Brewing Company (5.4 miles), Wicked Weed Brewing Pub (6.2 miles), Thirsty Monk (7.8 miles), New Belgium Brewing Company (8.0 miles)
OUTDOOR RECREATION: Blue Ridge Parkway (4.1 miles), Chimney Rock State Park (22.2 miles), Lake Lure Beach & Water Park (23.6 miles), Pisgah National Forest (32.5 miles), Black Balsam Knob (36.1 miles), Wolf Ridge Ski Resort (36.8 miles), Cataloochee Ski Area (41.6 miles), Nantahala National Forest (79.0 miles)
AIRPORT: Asheville Regional Airport (16.9 miles)
host_about:
Hi! We’re Evolve Vacation Rental, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

name: Treehouse-like Hideaway, Walkable West Asheville
description:
Welcome to our upper-level, private entrance guest room. This cozy, clean furnished bedroom and full bath also has a beautiful large, private deck opening up to a tree-house like backdrop of summertime woods. With off-road parking for guests, we are walking distance to Haywood Rd's local restaurants, breweries and shops, while also a greenway bike ride from River Arts District many studio art spaces. It's our goal to be wonderful hosts and share a place we've called home for over 2 decades.

The space
This space offers a comfy queen size bed with a Smart TV, along with a kitchen island complete with fridge, microwave, toaster/griddle and coffee (locally roasted) and tea kettle. There is a walk-in closet with ample room for staycay, vacay or to connect with family. Also Covid19 conscious cleaning protocols are implemented between each guest. The vaulted ceiling and spacious deck invite you to either curl up to enjoy natural light or just have a sweet spot to come h
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood vibe is sweet and relaxed with most everyone knowing each other by name on our street and very likely to be sharing kitchen spices or gardening tools. West Asheville has a more relaxed personality in general, with its eclectic crew of folks that call it home, you might hear a local band having practice in their backyard or pass the neighborhood kiddo's lemonade/art stand at the church parking lot. With cool, unique houses going up everyday, it is special to still walk around the block and get that small-town feel with local residents and communities showing the best about individuality and diversity.
host_about: My family has lived in Western NC for over two decades, and we love the mountains and the people that make up our home place. We also love travel and oceans and great adventures so plenty of tales and treasures from all our experiences can be found around a house. I am a special education teacher and appreciate all that goes into being the village that raises our children (along with my 10 year old kiddo)! Look forward to sharing a cup of tea and a story when our paths cross.

name: East Asheville, Close To Parkway And Near Downtown
description:
A completely remodeled 5 bedroom home in East Asheville (6 miles from Downtown). The space offers, 3 bedrooms, two baths, a full kitchen and living room with a TV on the main level. The master suite is beautifully decorated with a king sized bed, a his and hers closet, TV, and private bathroom. As you head downstairs you will find a second full kitchen and family room with Smart TV perfect for family movies or the big game! The lower level has 2 bedrooms, a full bath and laundry room.

The space
Guests have full access to the entire home and yard. (At this time the garage is not available for guests to use until updates are completed). There is ample off street parking in the driveway and a cozy shaded deck off the front of the home. The neighborhood is very quiet and peaceful with very friendly neighbors.

Guest access
Guests have access to the full home and yard.
neighborhood_overview: The property is very close to an access point for the Blue Ridge Parkway and the Southern Highland Craft Guild, Folk Art Center (located in the Blue Ridge Parkway). We are also close to downtown (6 miles - about 10-12 minutes depending on traffic). Black Mountain (a wonderful mountain town with lots of art galleries and great views) is 12 miles east of the property. Our property is central to most anything you may want to explore!
host_about:
I am a local resident originally from Central Illinois. I absolutely love living in the Asheville area.  I am thankful everyday for where we live and the beauty just outside our doorstep! 

Airbnb has been a wonderful way to share our lovely property at Fields of Grace with travelers from around the world and is allowing my wife and I to develop sustainable resources for our Non Profit work in Nicaragua. 

Each Stay at Fields of Grace provides resources that benefit ongoing projects such as sustainable agriculture, community development, rehabilitation services, medical clinics, and countless other projects throughout Nicaragua. We are grateful for the partnership with our guests as they have an opportunity to enjoy "A vacation with a purpose!". 

It is a pleasure to host your stay!

Nestled in the heart of downtown Asheville, this condo offers the best location for exploring the city. Restaurants, shopping, breweries are all within an easy walk.

The building has just undergone a complete renovation. The main floor of the building is now home to Highland Brewing, Bun Intended Street Thai food, Peace Love Taco, Farm Dogs, Buxton Hall Chicken Shack, The Hop ice cream, and the Times Coffee Bar. YOu will not need to travel far to eat amazing food. Bun Intended is my favorite.

Relax in style. Enjoy our big screen TV with cable or our king-sized bed.

name: Cozy Bear Hideaway - South Asheville Retreat
description:
Located in the South Asheville area, the Cozy Bear Hideaway is a 700 sq. ft. bright and airy retreat with 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. Every inch of this newly renovated basement space was designed with your comfort in mind. Equipped with a small kitchenette, desk area, coffee bar, cozy beds, and ample storage. We also have a dog upstairs who occasionally barks when he hears something outside (Amazon delivery trucks are his least favorite), but we will actively seek to keep it to a minimum :).

name: Long Cove Home minutes to West Asheville
description:
Our home has been completely renovated to be a serene getaway in the mountains just minutes from downtown, west Asheville and the Biltmore.

Tucked away in an intimate country setting our home features 3 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms. The open layout is perfect for gathering with friends and family. The kitchen is fully equipped and the living area includes lounge spaces.

We have fast and secure WIFI along with comfortable desk spaces. Need to relax? Enjoy Netflix, HBO, and Prime video channels.

The space
Location:

Located just 15 minutes from the Biltmore Estate (largest mansion in America) and West Asheville - known for local shops, yummy eateries, breweries, music venues and coffee shops.

Just 20 minutes to downtown Asheville - lots of shopping, restaurants, and a true Asheville-style drum circle every Friday night.

Greet the morning with sounds of roosters in the distance, and birdsongs throughout the day.
neighborhood_overview: The home is located 2 miles south of beautiful Biltmore Lake, tucked away on a private road shared by several nearby neighbors. There’s a country feel here in the cove that is unique to rural mountain living. Greet the morning with sounds of roosters in the distance, and birdsongs throughout the day. It’s a serene getaway from the hustle and bustle yet a short drive to all of Asheville’s popular destinations.
host_about:
Hi, my name is Charmie. Me and my husband Aaron along with our daughter Oriana and Yorkie, Gonzo want to welcome you!

We have a passion for travel, design, and Asian food.

We both work remotely, currently living part of the year in Southern California and the other part in Western North Carolina. On my spare time, I like to explore my passion for textiles through my online shop New Crop Shop, and Aaron loves diving into wood projects.

We look forward to hosting you in our home!

name: Clean & cozy basement apartment in West Asheville
description:
Located near the heart of West Asheville, we would absolutely love to host you and your guest in our clean and cozy basement apartment! We’re an enjoyable ten minute walk (or one minute drive) to Haywood Road, which is famous for its many eateries, cafes and boutiques.

The space
Though smack in the middle of Asheville, our house backs right up to a wonderfully-natural setting; an undeveloped gulley of sorts that feels like its own forest. Need a bit of nature in your life? Check out the view from your kitchen window and enjoy the sights and sounds of swaying trees, or step outside on the deck and get an even better view.

The kitchenette features a microwave, coffee maker, mini fridge and toaster oven. There is *no* stove or oven due to some rather silly restrictions they place on AirBNBS in Asheville-proper, but with this being the foodie haven that it is, you won’t have any issue staying full in this city.

Important note: We are a family
neighborhood_overview: We love the feel, friendliness and families of our neighborhood. It feels safe, inviting and doesn't have a bit of suburbia vibe to it. Every house is different, there are tons of trees, and many people in the neighborhood go on daily walks to enjoy the scenery. Our street is not a through street, either, so there's limited traffic compared to other streets around.
host_about: When our lease was up a few years ago we decided to buck convention and hit the road. Along with my loving wife and amazing daughter, we lived exclusively through AirBNBs for just over two years, with over thirty AirBNB locations logged across the country (and Canada, eh!) in the first 12 months alone of our journey. We are laid back, friendly and general lovers of life. With nothing but 5-star reviews to our name, we're always proud to take care of the listings we call "home" while we're stopping through a new city.

description:
Just south of Asheville, on the cusp of Pisgah National Forest, this cozy and rustic vacation rental is the ideal home base for your outdoor adventures! 1,148 Sq Ft | Surrounding Forest Views | 14 Miles to Downtown Asheville

Bedroom 1: King Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: Queen Bed, Twin Trundle Bed

name: Stunning Gem in the Heart of Asheville
description: In the heart of the historic Montford neighborhood, this picturesque detached carriage house is tucked away behind our 1897 Queen Anne Victorian home, previously operating as the Bed of Roses Bed & Breakfast. Make yourself at home with your own private entrance, private parking, fast WiFi, a 50" TV w/ Netflix and Disney+, and full use of our serene outdoor garden, complete with hammock and comfy patio furniture. Perfect for couples or solo travelers. A mere 10 min walk to downtown Asheville.
neighborhood_overview:
The Montford Area Historic District is one of the prettiest neighborhoods in the country--though we're admittedly a little biased. Most of the neighborhood's residences were constructed between 1890 and 1920 in the Victorian or Queen Anne Victorian styles, though you'll also find architecture in the Arts and Crafts, Neoclassical, and Colonial Revival styles. Residents pride themselves on their gardening and landscaping expertise, benefited in no small part by the region's capacity for growing an incredible diversity of flora, from the signature magnolia trees, to flowering shrubs like the rhododendron & azalea, to bamboo, succulents, and so much more.

The gorgeous local cemetery is worth a visit, marking the final resting place of authors Thomas Wolfe and O. Henry. North Montford was once home to the Highland Hospital, in which Zelda Fitzgerald tragically died in a fire in 1948.

The neighborhood is home to several tasty eateries just blocks from our AirBnB. Don't
host_about: I am originally from Texas I moved to Asheville last year and *adore*it. I'm a huge slam poetry fan, love Mexican food, and exploring new places!

name: Green Garden Getaway
description:
5-Star Sanitary Deep Clean. Contemporay and stylish garden level apartment against mountain backdrop, and clear night skies 9 miles east of downtown Asheville. My green-built home is well appointed, with great attention to detail. It's perfect for a couple or individual seeking a bucolic getaway.
This sweet little unit is the ground floor, with convenient dedicated parking at the entrance in the front of the unit. There is another home above, where I live with my 2 amazing dogs. I love to host!

The space
Custom green built apartment with all the details you can expect from this 4 year Super Host. You won't want to leave.

Guest access
The front yard and pond area are open for use, as well as the Cantina with grill just 100 feet away. Host lives upstairs and I will be as scarce as possible while guests are in this garden level unit.
Backyard is private.
neighborhood_overview:
We are half-way between Black Mountain and Asheville, 1000’ beneath the Blue Ridge Parkway. Our little unincorporated area is called Riceville. We have 5 churches, no stores or stoplights, and has a reasonably interesting history found by Googling "Riceville, NC history". This is the country, where people generally keep to themselves. It is normally very quiet with fantastic starry nights. There are children in the neighborhood, and you may occasionally hear them playing, 'ahh... the sounds of youth'.
To mention a few of the prominent neighbors, we have bear, coyote, bunnies, turkey, fox, skink, lightning bugs and frogs. There are many dogs in this holler. Generally, they keep the bears away. All of them are friendly with people, even if a bit vocal, but are not necessarily gregarious with interloping dogs.
host_about:
My arrival in this valley was not coincidental. This quiet and sunny cove continues to inspire work in the renewable energy field.  I'm an active outdoorsman and lover of healthful and intentional living. Don't be surprised if you glance a yoga practice on the deck of our home nearby. 
My family and friends will always respect your privacy, and lend a hand in emergencies, that are beyond rare. The reviews say it all, and the feelings are mutual! Thanks for your confidence!

Enjoy all that Asheville has to offer in a private, one bedroom lower level apartment in Historic Montford. With a leisurely stroll to Downtown Asheville, you'll have a comfortable home-away-from-home all to yourselves, while in a prime location to sample some of Asheville's favorite pastimes.

The space
The private ground level one bedroom apartment is stylish, sunny and meticulously cleaned, with a minimalist design to make you feel right at home. Walk-able to all of Downtown Asheville, and just a short drive to the RIver Arts District, West Asheville and the BIltmore Estate.

The apartment is an ideal space for single travelers, couples and families. The bedroom boasts a luxury Stearns and Foster Latex queen mattress, with a high end sofa bed in the living space.

You'll have a full bath with shower and tub, stocked with everything you'll need during your stay. Quality shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotions, and towels/washcloths provided
neighborhood_overview:
Situated on a dead end street, and just a stone’s throw outside of downtown Asheville.

Homes in architectural styles such as Victorian, Queen Anne, Arts and Crafts and Neoclassical sit majestically overlooking the tree-lined streets
host_about: WNC Native. “Ma” to an adorable tiny human. Explorer. Music lover.

name: NEW LISTING Spacious West AVL Cottage Dog Friendly
description:
Welcome to Ashevilleshire Cottage. Fantastic West AVL convenient location - Easy access to the best that Asheville has to offer. Five mins to Haywood Rd, 10 mins to DT AVL, 15 to Blue Ridge Parkway, 15 mins to Biltmore, 15 mins to hiking/biking trails, dozens of breweries/wineries within mins. Covered front porch, private back deck w/grill, open floor plan, 2020 construction, dog accepted, 3BR/2BA, fast WiFi, smart TVs, private and in Asheville! House is on a main road so some traffic noise.

The space
This is a brand new house as well as a brand new vacation rental. The owners were unfortunately transferred but want to keep their beautiful Asheville home. We are listing it now but will have professional photographs up very soon. We wanted to make it available to everyone asap.

The home is located in eclectic West Asheville only minutes from Haywood Road, the River Arts District, New Belgium Brewery, One World Brewing West, Archetype Brewing, Wedge
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is spread out so you'll have room to run around the yard if you want to.  Again, the house is located on a main road so some traffic noise can be heard especially when you're outside.
host_about:
Ron is a Asheville/WNC native.  He loves hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic and ancient mountains.   

Darlene relocated from Michigan to Asheville a few years ago. She loves visiting  quaint  towns in and around Asheville and local attractions like the Biltmore Estate as well as discovering new hiking trails.  Her outdoor passion is kayaking and rock climbing.

Most of our vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, dog friendly and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back. Please see individual properties for their unique features. 

We both are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

We look forward to sharing the WNC area with you!

Darlene - Director of Operations and Concierge
Ron - Property Manager

name: *Suite Caroline - only 15 mins to dntwn Asheville
description:
Suite Caroline is perfect for families and friends who want to enjoy a spacious place to return to after your Asheville adventures! With a large deck, gas grill, fishing pond, and close range mountain views, you may want to schedule days to just stay in and enjoy!

** This property is multi-unit. There is a basement apartment that is also a vacation rental for a max of 2 people. So the pond/pavilion and cornhole/yard areas are shared with other guests.

The space
It is 3.5 miles from I40 and about 15-20 minutes to downtown Asheville, Biltmore Estate, River Arts, shopping, and all that the Asheville area has to offer!

The garage and basement was once a bait and tackle store for the pond. In the 1950’s they held carp fishing tournaments here! There are still very large carp in the pond! You can often see them at the top of the water on a sunny day! There’s also plenty of bass! You are more than welcome to fish with your own gear, as long
neighborhood_overview: At the end of a dead end street, you'll be in a semi-secluded neighborhood.
host_about: I am a 40-something, fun-loving, travel loving lady!  My husband and I own a roofing business.  As business owners, we love to take a vacation anytime we can!  And we love to stay at private homes as often as we can rather than hotels!  Since we know what we like to see in a vacation rental, we try to make ours as comfortable as we would like it to be ourselves!
